inobedience put paradyse howe standinge naked bochas desyred hym put theyr wofull fall fyrste remembraunce howe theyr ofsprynge liued sorowe wretchednesse lenuoye fyrste chapter howe nembroth buylded bochas reherseth howe fortune hathe made many hygh estate vnwarelye discend fol xxxviii wordes translatoure wherewith endeth hys boke ❧thus endeth table chapter ninth last boke foloweth prologue translatour prologue john lydgate monke burye translatoure worke sumtime diligēce boke bochas frēch trā slate latin called laurēce tyme remembred truely date whē kyng john mortal fate prisoner brought vnto region began first translation prologue affirmyng reason artifirers hauyng exercise may chaunge turne good discresion shape formes newly deuise make vnmake many sundry wise potter whiche craft entende breake renue vessel amende thus men craft may due right ben inuentife haue experience fantasien inwarde syght deuices newe excellence expert master haue therto licence fro good better chaunge thinge semblably clarkes writyng thing made auctors thē beforn may newe finde fantasy olde chaffe trye full fayre corne make freshe iusty eye subtile witte labour apply colour agreable hue make olde thinges seme newe afore prouided presumption chaunging haue none aucthoritie mekenes haue domination ouer false enuy present grounde wt perfite charitie conueyed aduauntage truely roted amidde courage thus laurence enuy excluded thoughe forne translated boke within self▪ fully hath cōcluded vpon labour cast loke woulde amend first forsoke presumption toke mekenes prologue dothe expresse whiche processe lyke learned tyme cunnyng excel language requyred estate whiche gan compell among holde rethorike well vnderfong labour prey request lowly obey full well felt labour notable fall noble euery circumstance lordship dreadful vnstable howe fyll put remembraunce therin shewe fortune variaunce might myrrour se worldly worship may surety example rose sprigyng gardē sum thorne nether fayrer blossom thē nature list dispose thē mai beuty mē hath sene toforn bitter wind frō braūches born ne none high estate contune fle frō wayting daunger fortune wherfore bochas memoriall consideryng great dignity worldly prince power royall great emperours estate degree fortune hath cast frō see namely coulde self know full sodainly make lye full lowe sayd aucthour wise ryght sadde hath gadered wyth rethorykes swete diuers bokes whiche hath radde philosopher olde poete busied bothe colde heate compile write fonde fall noble many diuers londe vpon whose boke translation saied laurence rehearceth certaine holdeth opinion suche language open playne accepted often sene thē straunge termes vnderstād namely folkes y• dwel vpō lād sayeth also entencion amende correct declare condemne presumption report playnely spare thinges touched shortly story bare vnder style briefe compendious prolonge ben vertuous story whiche playnely tolde construed vnder wordes fewe lacke truth new old men report matter shew okes great downe yhewe fyrste stroke long processe ne long storyes worde may expresse whiche playnly thys noble translatour cast purpose storyes wryte diligent laboure fyll order endite men myght selfe delyte aduentures fyll dede sundry prynces beholde reade haue maner contemplacion thing al fortune may attaine transitorye condicion kynde hasty sodayne contrarious course restrayne wilfulnesse variable whē men trust thē chaūgeable chaunge doublenes bochas biddeth y• men enclyne set harte voyde vnstablenes vpon thynges whyche ben diuyne ioye perpetually dothe shyne wythout eclipsyng heauenly see voyde cloudes mutabilitye among bochas writeth swetenes matter lusty ben glade sometyme wryteth wretchednes fortune floure fade ioye vnder cloude prosperitie shade enterchangyng euery maner thyng y• men fele world •• uyng hys processe lyst beholde estate hygh lowe degre prynces bothe yong olde fro beginning world haue lykyng ioye aduersitye fro fyrst descended adowne theyr fortune playne description noble ne spareth none setteth order cereously begynneth idā endeth kyng john theyr auentures rehearsyng kyng john concludyng finally y• great puissaunce price edward take prysoner fraūce thys sayd bochas aucthour thys boke whiche story great intelligence left also toke suche left negligence supposyng demyng credence storyes whythe commune knowe also well lest folke would haue disdain thynges cōmune put memory therfore bochas thought vain name encrease glory remember cronicle ne historye tho merite notable aucthorised famous commendable labour hauyng delite matter greatly myght auayle pleasaunce commen profite noble storyes make rehearsail shewig myrror al ye world shal fail fortune hye renowne hath vpon prynces iurisdiction whiche thyng full sober wyse considered inwarde intent reason began aduertyse seyng prynces blynde entent worldly worshyp y• blent shoulde euer estate kepe fortune ylayed slepe fortune maistry enchaunted wyth pocions newe craft sorcery power incantacions make stable domination wyth yron chaynes last longe locked rockes wyth adamantes strong supposyng surquedy estate durable fortune frowardly deny plainly preue changeable fro prynces stable fortune full fast great estate vnwarely chaūgeth saith thē che 〈…〉 lordes magnificence royal power set god tyght nought conceyue long pacience neither peyse power thought harte well sought meke pacient abide would reason pompe lay aside tariyng negligence returne agayne yet mercy beneuolence without vengeaunce rigour disdayne meke father workes playne assayeth yarde castigation bryng correction full fatherly chastice loueth punishynge sickenes mercy many anotherwise aduersitie worldely distres asketh kindenes high ne lowe aduert none treasure man hart mine aucthour list comprehende john bochas great aucthoritie almesse correct amende vycious folke euery comminaltie example whiche notable prynces olde sumtime fall lower people erroure call small whelpes sume clarkes write chastised mighty fierce lyon whan y• swerd vengeaunce doth bite vpon prynces transgression common people opinion dread tremble adowne quake suche meanes vyces forsake suche also haue ben defouled vyces longe continuaunce synnes lye ymouled good exāples may cum good repentaūce repenteth lord auaūce accept lowe high estate meke preserue punyshe obstinate sayd matter touchyng thinges mine aucthor bochas herafter shal declare exāple prynces mighty kyngs fine truth spare though style naked • e bare rethorike myne aucthour ensue yet fro truth shall •• substaunce good leiser abyde mine aucthor lyke may attaine part set eloquence aside boke bewepen complayne assault fortune froward sodayn ou prince hath kyd vēgeaūce malice deadly mortal chaūce ala shalbe muse vnto shall helpe call calliope callyng wyll refuse pernaso worthy susters suger temper gall swetenes lusty freshe singyng ful farre discordeth frō matter cōplayning master chaucer wt fresh cōmedies deade ala chiefe poete brytayne sumtime made ful piteous tragedy fall prynces also complayne makyng souerayne whō al lande ryght ought prefarre sith langage y• lode starre senec rome hye prudence wrote tragedy great moralitie tullius chiefe well eloquence made tyme many fresh ditty fraunces petra • eke florence city • made boke aduert two fortune wilfull peruert agaynst bothe wrote remedy bokes twayne made diuision among rehearsyng many freshe story first boke thus conueyed doun dialoge betwene gladnes reason second well witnes made betwene reason worldly heauines matter wondets delectable though wo ioye haue entresse john bochas wrot mater lamētable fall prince dothe expresse ioye fyl great distresse writer hye renown great worshyp vnto nacion semblably haue tolde toforne •• et chaucer busines day hath well borne tonge auoyde al rudenes reforine wt colour swetenes wherfore let v geue laude glory put name wt poetes memory whose labour make mencion right shoulde commended youthe made translation boke whiche called trophe lumbard tonge men may read se vulgare long dyed gaue name troylus creseyde whiche reade louers delite haue therin great deuocion poete also selfe quite boecius boke consolation made tyme olde translation sonne called lowys made treatise ful noble great prise vpon labour full notable forme set order diuisions men wittes accomply conforme vnderstande full expert reason domifiyng sundry mancions rote sought ascendent forne gaue iudgement wrote also full many day agone dant english selfe doth expresse piteous story ceix alcion death also blaunche duches notably businesse great auise wittes dispose translate romaynt rose thus vertue set entent idlenes vyces fle fowles also wrote parliament therin remembring royall eagle thre howe choyse felt aduersitye fore nature profered battayle eche partye woulde auayle also diligence payne vulgare translate endite • gene vpon maudelayn lyona boke write annelida false arcite made complaynt dolefull piteous broche vulcanus thebe wrought full diuers nature ouide writeth therof syght high desire shoulde endure neuer glad ne light myght like master sayth writeth dede conserue shoulde euer liue dred poet wrote request quene legende perfite holines good woman fynde nyntene excell bountie fayrenesse labour businesse importable wyttes encomber world finde great nūber made boke caunterbury tale pylgryms rode pilgrymage kent hylles vale story tolde passage endityng full well language knyghthode gentlenes loue perfitenes also great mortalitie disport cōcludyng great sentence prose wrote tale mellebe wife called prudence grisildes perfite pacience howe monke story new olde pyteous tragedy way tolde sayd poete master dayes made compiled many freshe dittie complaynts ballade roūdels vyrelayes full delectable heare se whiche men ryght equitie syth englysh making best pray vnto god geue soule good rest poetes make mencion olde tyme great deyntye kynges prince euery regyon greatly preferred degre lordes pleasaunce se study among cast lokes good leasure vpon wyse bokes tyme cesar julius triumphe wan rome towne enter woulde schole tullius heare lecture great affection notwithstāding cōquest renowne vnto bokes gaue great attendaunce story great ioye pleasaunce also lande dare affyrme thinge prynce full mighty puissaunre kynges sonne vncle kynge henry syxt whiche nowe fraunce lieutenaunt hath gouernaunce brytayne whose discrecion hath conserued v region duryng time full high prudence peace quiet han susteined ryght notwithstādyng noble prouidēce dede proued good knyght eyed argus reason forsight high lecture dare tell truely deme dothe excell vnderstandyng age hath ioye clarkes commune man expert langage stable study alway dothe contune settyng aside chaunces fortune loueth shall tary withouten cause full lothe vary duke glocester men prynce call withstādyng estate dignitie courage neuer dothe appall study bokes antiquitie therin hath great felicitie vertuously selfe occupye vycious slouthe hath maistry prudence manhede truthe susteyne fauour setteth aside holy churche mainteynyng dede lande herityke dare abide support vpholde also gyde spareth none maketh selfe stronge punish tho church wrong thus manly also wise chosen god owne knyght one thinge hath singuler prise heritike dare none come sight christes faith stādeth hole vpright holy churche defence champion chastice tho therto treason pleasaunce lorde jesu studieth euer haue intelligence readyng bokes bringeth vertue vyces excludyng wt slouth negligence maketh prince haue experience knowe selfe many soundry wise trespaceth erroure chastice among bokes playnely case sayed prynce considered reason noble boke john bochas accordyng hys opinion great noblesse reputation vnto prince greatly necessary geue exāple worlde doth vary cause entent shew vntrust worldly thinge gaue commaundement semed ryght well sittyng shoulde small cunnyng boke translate pleasaunce shew chaung worldly variaunce support magnificence vnder wynges correction though lacke eloquence shall procede translation fro auoydyng presumption lowly submittyng euery houre space rude language lordes grace haue one thing well minde bade shoulde especiall folow myne aucthour written fynde fauoure partiall thus meane speake generall none estate singulerly depraue sentence mine aucthour saue conceiued gan style dresse thought would matter procede matter obreyed heauinesse freshe colour toke maner hede processe playnely lede semed mete set apart rethorykes swete ditty mournyng complaynyng pertayne vnto caliope neither mus pernaso syng whiche remēbred number thrise thre vnto matter aduersitie sugred aureat lycoure willyng fauoure disdayne settyng farre backe hinder woulde endite hauyng colour whyte blake tragedy whiche shall write selfe better aquyte vnder support shall reade vpon bochas ryght thus procede finis ¶ howe adam eue inobedience put paradise liued sorowe wo ofspringe howe standynge naked bochas desired hym put wofull fall fyrste remembraunce ¶ fyrste chapiter whan john bocas considered sought woful fal mighty conquerours remembrance entred thought rekenyng numbre predecessours fyrste mynde came progenitours man kynde farre yrun age toward hym holdyng passage hym thought warde syght theyr cōming full pitiously tremblynge quaking age lacke myght feblenesse signes shewing one first commyng father adam sodenly abrayde myne auctour euen thus saide cosyn bochas wol well thou lere art busy serche ouer ofinfortune maner enquere sodayne chaunge turning ball •• thly prince estate rial syttyng sondre twyn v twayne processe begyn consider first lorde auyse whan v made vnto likenesse put v paradise haue lyued parfite stablenesse till serpent dyd businesse false enuy make v lese grace perpetually exyle v fro place whā jhon bochas naked thē behelde without hand fourmed nature slime erth damascene felde god made aboue eche creature perpetually endure discrecion prerogatife endued wyth soule lyfe parfite age men xxx yere put possession paradise place entere delites chosen mansion adam made imposion fysh foule beastes al reason men call rybbe whyle adam dyd slepe eue drawe ful fayre visage al sodenly toke kepe hym ioyned mariage disport auantage lorde first wyues dyd ordeyne eyther helpe encrease peyne god vnto gaue soueraintie paradyse dominacion place fulfilled felicitye frutes subiection saue one made excepcion whyche god forbad byble deuyse touche wyse delices heuenly place god gaue put kepyng vse euery houre space theyr ease lyking blomes blossomes theyr fayrnes ay keping frutes alwaye one freshnesse witer stormes myght thē duresse soyle enbrouded full sa • er floures wedes wycke none interesse god kynde wyth freshnesse colour wt tapites motles gladnesse made yt place habūdant wt swetnes fresh flora whych floures quene lyuerey made perpetūal grene tree raught almost heuen whyche cast ful pleasaunt shade storme ne rayne thūdre wynde ne leuine power leues fade euer ylyke freshe glade whan lyst might se middes ye garden life y• holesume tre whyche vertue ayenst malady folke preserue youth freshnes eate thereof neuer dye lyue euer ioy gladnes neyther fele trouble sickenesse place haue alwaye hertes ease suffisaunce y• myght please euer endure neuer fal age whyche called tre lyfe whan adam fallen dotage ayenst god began holde stryfe throuh excitynge wyfe wylfully yaue assent breke precepte cōmaundement god lord wylful negligence approche tre bare name tre connyng also science frute dyd attame sothly byble sayth good euyll haue cōnyng thought wher toforne euyl knew right noght thus first euyll experience toforne knew wickednes presumpcion inobedience brought thē ioye wretchednesse afore time mine author bereth witnes helth goodnes called lyfe euyl named sicknes first rote strife paradyse myne auctour sayth certeyne tyuers orient fyne lyke quicsiluer boylyng vp pleyen ronnyng chrystallyne whych wel heauenly deuyne vpspryngyng aueylyng downe al pleasaunce gaue swete sowne woulde rauysh man corage whose baumy colour endewed al place wt freshnes cours hys passage holesome ayre hertes dyd embrace plēty plesaūce grace euery spice herbe grayne rote foāden growyng gardein sote delectable soun songe brydes ermony aire clene corrupcion therin ingendred malady mirth al melody ioy blysse souerayne suffisaunce al may hertes pleasaunce clerkes lyke tolde bokes determine thoe sphere sunne manifolde vertue clere dyd shyne doth nowe mighty lyne mone whyter beames clere euery sterre bryghter dyd appere euery thynge vertuous nowe behold se yt place nothing noyous perfit gladnes knit vnto surete perpetuell peace ioy prosperite blisse make strong comfort god spake among goodnesse bare companye shewed vnto hys gracious presence angel also state magnifye amonge serue dyd dilygence diuers office humble reuerence nature wrought none ryall purpill ryche stone tissue gold ornamentes enuiron bodily beaute shaping suche maner garnimētes angel vse felicite naked fayrest se whyle stode state innocence clothynge none experience blysse make mencion ioyes celestiall may made comparison ioy temporal haue lasting immortal euer haue lyued mirth gladnesse saue ageyn reason wilfulnesse banished thē self blisful life whan adam gaue credence snake wretchedly gan trust wife whiche gan apple serpent take plesantly present make vnto adam fyrst began deth deuyse poyson vnto man ioy incomparable greatest lordship erthly thinge fall importable surmountyng paradise reignynge kinge dedelye mortall payne fro thilke place haue fall sodayne▪ thilke sorow surmounteth al sorowe next foloweth felicite wo greuous euen ne morow dede sodeyne aduersite commeth vnwarely prosperite ne nothinge may hertes disauaunce old ioy newe remembraunce taketh ensample adam eue maketh myrroure mynd whether reason dyd thē greatly greue put ala ferre behynde blysse kynde chaungyng state immortalite became subget deth pouerte sodeyn change vnware mischefe vnhappy transmutacion full vncouth vnlefe depart fro thilke manlion ful delectacion fro delites sodenly go worlde whych ful wo delite sorowe care ioy heuinesse plenty euyll fare helth great sickenes troble ay mēged vnsure gladnes ay blysse eternall glory mirth false transitory ala howe blinded sight vaynglory false ambicion went wronge loked ryght false couetyse theyr confucion wherthrough lost dominacion paradise poore thrall fredome lost became mortal vnto god wold haue semblable lyke vnto hym good yuell know trust stable frō estate brought ful low thus sede fyrst ysowe rote planted disobeysaūce brought linage sorowe mischaūce thus came fyrst inobedience gate pouertye nede backe foloweth indigence sorowe sicknes malady drede exile banyshynge seruitude dede whych caused man longe contune vnder lordshyp daūger fortune thus came also malady deth dispoyle mankynde hys beautye long syckenesse pestilence slethe soden stroke whych ye man may flye vnto adam hys posteritie deth annexed successyon hys offence conueyed doun man man euery maner age list know sin brought shame man feble faynt hys passage processe wexe halte lame vnto adam thys vncouth game constrayned sych apparayle bareyne erth seke hys vitayle hungre thurst hys lyfe wyth swete labour tribulacions endured also many mortal styfe hote colde ryght stronge passyons elementes sodayne mutacions wynde hayle rayne fearful fallyng vnware stroke thūder lyghtning thei stode also domage drede cruel beastes tygres lyon wylde beres taketh hede great feare fel dragon assaut dragon scorpion thilke beastes toforne milde sinnyng ful ragy wylde thei stode first sikernes ioye blisse euer one lastinge rest thei fil vnsurenesse sorowe sighing dolour cōplaining fro iyen continually weping bitter teares day day distil desert wanting wil wheder thei sorowful faine long tyme desolacion whan foūd abell son slayne cruel cayne confusion▪ cayne made mencyon time wilde vagabound til blind lameth yafe hī dethes woūd adam eue afore ylke time neuer sene feest funeral chaunge new prime behold thyng disnatural brethern one wombe hatered eternal one hate far hym selfe deuide false malice homicyde routh whan stode behold son al deed layd grond bathed blod al soile lay rede whan adam eue toke hede ful great aduersite newe slaughter behold se euer among sighes harde sore bitter weping sorowes auaūce ware heeres woxe hore age began theyr beautie disauaunce youth also ful great displesaunce began appal could aspye cruel constreynt force malady youth fallen flour processe many hundred yeres duresse great labour wexe vnlusty vgly cheres age deth ben daungers say checkmate nature couth vnto beautie grene lusty youth whan yeres fully passed flouring age lastynge season processe eye men may se beaute declineth blossom fal adoune littel littel succession cōmeth croked elde vnwarely crepynge potent ful porely manassing thus father called adam creature fayrest al feire great trauaile processe came began vnwarely ascend vpō steyre potent cast repeyre atropose afore shal gone attwin liues threde anone ebron made sepulture ther bilded mighty great cyte whose story recorde nature may conclude list se neuer man liberte sithen adam lord gan disobey ayenst deth must obey cōplaining mine autor jhon bochas ful pitiously hys aduertence bewepeth wayleth oft sayeth ala apple great offence taste inobedience adam ala haue great fal sodainely die mortal example ought inough suffise al world though mo exemplify folkes ben wise world throwfare ful wo lyke false fortune y• turneth fro make folkes whā clerely shine estate vnwarely decline though thei hedes lift lofte highe phebus shineth sphere thinke selfe falleth oft renown recheth aboue ye starres clere howe surmount euery sphere trust corrupt hath sodayne fal declare ben mortal worldly folke aduert yene entent vengeaūce punicion god shal take iugement trespas transgression breke preceptes ayen al reason ye haue forgotten wt precious blod saue died vpon roode adam disobeisaunce lorde list ordaine made first formed euery circūstāce creature soueraine enbraced chaine seruitude child ouersene shal folkes sein • liue deserte sorowe▪ exise plesance desolate▪ worlde euin morowe hertely ioye stonte disconsolate▪ destitute also infortunate forpossed wo worldly troble euer variable ful chaunges double ye entende false couetise fraude berret extorcion agayne god many dyuers wise againe neighbour false collusion hym wronge oppression worst al ye retche syn slee soule worldly good wyn fal power smal accomplyshe auarice dede sinful wyl assenteth ouer al thing desire ye maye spede thus false lust doth bridel lede trust hauing sore doth assayle falsly afered world fayle god benigne debonayre yarde castigacion chastiseth easely faire ye grudge correction nothing auerting discrecion howe god bad v take hede striue ne wrastel dede neither strength ne might appli vpon beast monstruous sauage called chimere licy specially whan hys rage monstre auantage heed lion bokes determine wombe gote taile serpentyne outrayed bellyferon olde poetes make mencion neither god bad men gon colchos conquere jason flees gold region firie bulles mettal made bra dragon ful straitly kept god bad v contreys lete vnderfonge thing ben impossible mynotaur slee crete halfe man halfe bul credible monster hateful odible sūtime brought forth bokes ye may se mynos wife called pasyphae whose storie techeth thou list vgly beast monstruous ariadne king doughter dere sumtime slayne duke theseus within caue made dedalus god biddeth v plainely sake great emprise vndertake byddeth v recheles perilous dedes bene marciall v ieoparde dyd hercules bidding especiall euristeus mighty kyng royall lordes athēs make honor shine learned armes famous discipline preceptes haue sight remembred highe bounte v cōmaundeth thinges lyght accomplishe humilite corage auoyde vanite hertes exclude ydelnesse false chāge al worldly gladnes vnto man perfite stable good reasō mine auctor doth wel preue nothing faire ne agreable finally vicious lyfe leue verye god rightfully beleue loue worship aboue al erthly thyngs passeth victory emperours kinges lord biddeth also discerne entere loue labour life life shal gouerne father mother due honor nede socour vertue frendes comfort power grace supporte world nothing perfite neither taccōplish thinge plesance man haue delyte lytell good haue suffisaunce content gouernance auoyde auarice thinke euer among neighbour wronge couet goodes wise selfe gouerne like estate excede flye also dispise maner loue whych disordinate selfe preserue contecke debate specially esche good slaughter murdre sheding bloude flye syn hate lye folde offence among haue repentaunce esche scorne malory ayenst vyces almesse penance haue souerainly pleasaunce sewe pathes oure lorde jesu true examplayre grace vertue sake redempcion loue nayled tre suffered payne cruell passion nothing asketh high lowe degre recompensed ayenwarde set holy entente fulfil commaundementes grace mortal lyfe precell wysdome reason gift haue prerogatife tofore beastes discrecion therefore let v hole intencion reason beastes ferre excede let v thē word exāple dede grounde selfe first vpon humilite pompous eyen mekely vnclose enclyne harte conceiue se worldly welth shall fade rose meke hert let v selfe dispose tragedy haue knowledgynge mischefe howe rote beginninge vice inobedience surquidy false disobeisaunce myne anctour hath shewed sentence emprinteth well remembraunce ware serpent wyth disceiuance flesh world enemy thre traynes ye nat disceiued best shilde make resistence ayenst power sothly mekenes haburion mighty defence fendes power venquish oppresse remembre deuoutly lownes howe mekely christe pay taunsum suffred crosse deth passion therby men may prudent ben wyse ioyes clayme whych bene eternal entre ayen paradise fro whens adam pryde fall whych place aboue celestiall christ jesu brynge v glory whyche thy deth haddest victory lenuoye sodeine departinge felicitie miserie mortal heuinesse vnware depriuynge prosperitye chaunge gladnes wretchednes longe languishynge wo bitternes continuell sorow dred dole pestilence fyrst brought inobedience adam eue lost libertye fraunchise blessednes put exyle captiuitye lyue wo labour pensifnes false desire pompous wilfulnes serpent whan gaue credence lord mistrustyng inobedience ala wher free ioy eternall stode sekernes blynde ala pitie leue rest liue wetines ofsprynge brynge dystresse drawynge fro god hys due reuerence false consentynge inobedience wherefore ye prynces auysely doth se thys tragedye maner bereth wytnesse wanteth comonalte subiection lackynge mekenes wyth poore pryde hath enteresse foloweth froward insolence among people false inobediēce noble prince whych haue souereinte gouerne people ryght wysenesse lyke ye cherishe peace vnite frowardly distroy oppresse ayenwarde corages well dresse lowly obeye magnificence disobey inobedience che ii chapiter ¶ howe nembroth bylt tower babylon saue fro noyes stode whyche pryde put fro magnificence hys tower sodayne leuyn smytten downe myne auctour bochas lightly oueryode vengeaunces myscheues huge y• god toke noyes flode whan sent vniuersal deluge ayenst whych refuge saue viii person mortal wo whiche shyp saued mo wherefore myn auctour lightly ouergoth maketh age special mencion passeth ouer adam nembroth consideryng howe deedly chaunce lorde syn toke greate vengeaunce wryttynge storyes victorye highe ne lowe left memorye laft cronicle none ne boke made mencion none auctour lyst loke brought destruction deluge wythout excepcion whych myne auctour trāsported stile tyme lyst nothynge compyle founde mater wheron myght found set fote none auctoritie neyther truth purpose grounde olde wrytynge coude se whych thought necessitie surplusage tyme lete adam nembroth mete certes lyke bochas hys boke remembreth first adam story next order story toke speke nembroth surquedye whych first bokes specifye flode waues gan aswage made lorde gouerne age whan flode began decrece god vengeaunce gan molifye withdrawe hand water tho gan cese • vpon mounteynes high ermonye shyp gan rest byble lye age called seconde lynage man gan first habounde encrease ayen multiplye dyscent bokes ye maye se specified genelogye howe one chus cosyn noe man tyme greate auctorritie vnto nembroth storye dothe assure father ingendrure nembroth mighty large long excelling stature surquedous hardy right stronge time great labour might endure force much dyd assure yet none water ne lande durst power presume withstand noblesse magnify worldly worship reporte glorye called chefe prince venery desirous euer haue victorye beastes wilde put memory haue price amonge champion tigres daunt eke boores lion beast wodes sauage durst ayenst make resistence furious yre mortall rage erth quoke feare presence tyll last aduertence prince deuoyed grace ayenst god began compace made maner coniuracion frowarde gyaunt conspiracy toke counseyl false collusion might power multiply estate glorifye thought woulde entent fayle god heuen proudly assaile namely god whiche gouerneth al thought woulde proudely take hād ayenst deluge come shall prouidence plainely withstande selfe assure make place lande kepe defence ayenst god water violence might accomplishe intent lyke desire labour toke counseil al one assent chose nembroth duke gouernoure conuey socour gyde forne ware towarde countre called sinear compasse wise rounde yclosed great stode named eufrates strong foly whych haue purposed fulfil rechelesse saye put selfe prese high toure edifye whiche shoulde surmoūt aboue sterry skie shoulde greued nomore deluge brought distruction neither water may thē greue sore fine intencion tower mightie stronge dongion ayenst god flodes themselfe assure hight largenesse measure thus nembroth encrese began name people reputacion golde richesse great fame called god opinion eurous mighty renowne worlde also hole vnder obeisaunce god lord toke gouernance vnder whose might people gan procede lord hauinge inspection percinge bowelles earth dede make mighty foundacion false glorye vaine false ambicion proude nembroth appetite se worche hath ful great delite ioy inwarde gladnesse beholde great company persen erth great depenesse make ground stronge masonry worke vpwarde fortifye many stone huge large weight haue reysed vp y• ayre height finally mediacion great werke nēbroth famous takinge hert great consolacion report glorious great might port pompous myghty ryche stronge rease towre high large longe daye touchynge great myghte towre whych babell men cal men fro ferre may haue thereof sight surmounteth toures whych werke thus befal serpentes many great dragon nowe called chefe habitacion man dare se wycked eyre corrupcion great space great countre approche nere ye meruaylous dongion venemous mansion horible man dare approche lyke mountayne builded roche men say thereto repaire tower attaineth vnto sterres clere transcendeth region eire stone siment made mater ioyninge stedfast entier though fyre water dyd assaile litle nought power shoulde auayle made mighty endure well assured disposicion worlde liuynge creature sawe neuer none like comparison whose reryng vp chefe occasion ryches masonrye nēbroth pride surquedy demed proudely auise transcended noblesse thought selfe myghty wyse felowe god lykenes god worldly pryde oppresse make prince eclypsen glory suche trust thinges transitory lorde eternall myghte thys tower whyche nembroth list edifye made wyth thunder leuyn lighte thereof fall full greate partie boystous wyndes ragy skye goddes power syde began thus abate percell pryde discent fallynge stone werkemen ful many man deed oppressed backe broken bone masonry wyth bloude reed yet proude nēbroth hed al signes lorde list knowe whiche pomp broughte fullowe hys errour procedeth furth newe thought would get selfe name melancoly chaunge loke hewe began also attempte atame encrease magnify hys fame newe tower edify ayen lyke god ben blynde nothing seen would haue raught vp sterres seuen thassēt first coūsail robbed god raught heuen presumeth lorde aboue tassayle reason shoulde auayle prynces may well ayenst hym cry loude power may clipse wyth cloude myddes great emprises proude nembroth makynge masōs compas cast deuises geometry diuisions god hath aspections seynge thententes euery erthly man mighty best ayenst malice make resistence worldly power dominacion vengeable magnificence chastice ouer whelme downe pride prince euery region ensample nembroth ye shal whose pompe raught aboue sterres clere whan workemen stode auantage busy hys intencion time spake al langage sodenly transmutacion tounges made diuision workynge obrayde▪ man wyst sayde lyke accordynge wyth reason chaunge made langages hertes made diuision wyll corrages ascendynge workynge stage ther chan̄ge broder vnto broder like straungers none knew thentēt myne auctour troweth aduersitie gilt caused vègaunce el god tyght equitie disposed hath ordinaunce amonge great variaunce ye world shuld thēselfe deuide fro nembroth disceuer abide gan anone among thēselfe disdeyne accept nembroth kynge amonge forsoth twayne one another clere knowynge ne speche knewe plaine meanyng whyche y• coūtre senaar forsoke eche sondry countrey toke departed made lenger space folowyng fortune diuision begā chese thē newe dwellinge place party many region thus nembroth priued put doun babel mighty famous toure called lenger possessour ayenst pryde nembroth froward fortune gan cours vary god also maner worth surquedie contrary place wilde solitarye thys senaar furious sauage nembroth gan feble fal great age yet bokes specifye waxte froward hys condicion fyrst grounde ydolatrie fynder vp false religion causynge people haue opinion goddes worshyp panimes wyse founder rightes false sacrifyce towarde perce chese hys dwellynge place whych countre orient hys lordshyp shuld stretch great space bounded hym occident perce lande hath hys extent toward party reed see thys lande perce lyst se bokes olde remembre put mynde perce costeth inuiron septemtrion great inde many another myghtye region nembroth first dominacion whyche extendeth bokes specifye mede germanye lordeshippes myne auctour sayeth without vertue true guyde suraūce none ne fayeth thynge passeth may whyle abyde wherefore bochas spyte pryde rebukynge al folkes proude makyng cōplaynt cryeth thē ful loude iii chapiter ¶ exclamaciō bochas ayenst al proude men shewynge howe god maye pryde abate whan hym best lyste manye dyuers meanes wayes punyshe chaslyce al proud ryal floures whych trust reygne long dresseth vp youre roches youre towres ayenst god make youre selfe stronge let power proudly vnderfonge selfe wyth pryde magnifye ayenst heuin holde champartye buyld vp castle reyse vp tyghte adamantes wyth yron stronge ybounde square stone large huge hyght reyse vp walles mighty profoūd shit dūgeōs wt mighty chenes roūd lette men armes euer wake slepe nyght daye watche straitly kepe god ne man opinion fortress myghte assayle castels ne stronge dungeon stuffed wyth men plenty vytayle lyke stande euer neuer fayle god might ayenst false puissaūce whā euer hym lyst right vengeaunce set afore youre eyen ben blynd monstruous werke greate babilone pride nēbroth put behinde maugre mighte towre smyt doun al craft werkemen mason distroied sodayne leuin auenge hys pryde sent downe fro heuin though strengthes assured none engyne may thereto attayne gunne ne bumberdes subtilte shot arowblast ne touche dundayne yet god lord souerayne lyche desertes spyl saue may confounde erth quaue myne auctour asketh castel towre may strōge made wyse meane false traytoure way deuyse may lost solde couetise deliuered al stronge bondes power enemy handes sodayne aduenture castels city many riche towne haue lost might assure resist ayenst false trayson sume haue lost also rebellion meanes truth begyn punishynge whyche god sent syn god hath thousande handes chastyse thousande dartes punicion thousande bowes made diuers wyse thousande arowblastes bent hys dōgeō ordeyned echeon castigacion findeth mekenes repentaūce mercy maistresse ordinaunce ye bene wyse considereth howe rote vice al pride ye may well se pulleth downe putteth vnderfote taketh counceyl humilitie ye list stande surete byldeth hert sekernesse towre vertues grounded mekenesse whose masonry costage vertues grounde soueraine blastes wyndes weders rage neyther tempest hasty ne sodayne pompe ne blast though payne vertue mekenesse vndermyne feble make enclyne mekenesse grounded verily though somtime fele aduersite passeth ouer suffreth paciently venquisheth maner enmytie assaute also contrariosite infortune worldly trouble victory conquereth palme double tho mekenes amiddes flodes flowe worldly mischefe persecucion whyle pacience bote doth rowe tho froward waues tosse vp downe calme shall folowe consolacion whan sterne windes blastes haue laid lowe name mekenesse shal shewe well knowe may troubled ouercome neuer tyme may suffre werre ende vanquisheth euer land see whether nere ferre hau •• life lode sterre take recorde humilite mary blessed mote rote mekenes floureth vp faire whose beaute dredeth tribulacions somer ne wynter floures apayre frute lasteth maner season pryde may assayle bostful sownes finally encrease glory humblenes wynneth victorye ¶ lenuoye ofolkes al tragedy rede haueth kenes amonge youre aduertence proude nembroth also taketh hede fel magnificence onely sturdy violence list malice mighty lorde assayle case myght pride auayli noble prince worlde possede ye famous wysdome science haue many subiectes drede gouernaunce vnder excellence let power mekenes dispence false pride oppresse poreyle noble muche may auayle pride nembroth dyd brydel lede conuayed great insolence pride apertayneth nothynge manhede saue armes shewe presence wherfore honour laude reuerence mekenes hath gouernaile al vertues man may auayle iiii chapter many yeres betwixt adam nembroth bitwixte nembroth cadmus kinges olde poetes wt sawes swete ful couertly verse fayne old saturne sūtimne king crete custome dyd hys busy payne goodnes list ordayne shoulde nature echon deuoure ingendrue mater shortly soiorne vnderstande poetes processe meane plainly word saturne doth selfe nothinge time expresse philosopher bere also wytnes tune forth euery thing broght time ayenward bryngeth al nought clerkes also recorde wrytinge vnder support dare reherse fyre wasteth euery thynge yron herd doth neshe thynges perce ought abideth y• may transuerce yet cōmeth time continuaunce al consumeth sharpe launce sharpe toth consumpcion stil wise doth busy cure aneantise conclusion al thynge brought forth nature long abydyng ye may thē assure olde thynges deuoured men may se ferre mynde neuer maye remembre wise glorious prowesse prince olde▪ noblesse philosopher wyse▪ poetes feyning vnfolde▪ processe yeres ala tolde deuoured hath name noblesse derked renoune foryetfulnesse thus name left memory tyme wt rasour hath done greate vengeaunce shauen away honor glory many noble ful mighty puissaunce left nowe remembraunce prince poetes ne philosopher whan y• deth nailed cofers cam time vpon processe yeres memory hath dusked minde reuolucion heuenly sphere oft turnyng glory hath left behind thus euery thinge whiche subget kind life without auauntage wasted time processe long age first time adam noe prudent lister list bokes rede founde fortune mutabilite neither chaūge toke hede adam rekened ben dede vnto nembroth turnynge heuen thousand yeres vii hundred eleuen space considereth wel ben thinges writen especial digne memory ne spoken neuer del ben notable ne historial fro time nembroth fal vnto cadmus yeres conteine iiii hundred fourtene touchinge cadmus bochas list endite rehersed b • rethoriens howe one vexores bokes write made first kinge egipciens whan philosopher nigromanciens began first taboūde renoune tauaūce nachor y• time hauyng y• gouernaūce ebrues made mencion nembroth true rehersayle thre hundred yere computacion foure score xii time fayle vexores begā warres great bataile volunt ayenst straunge nacions conquere cityes borowes townes force without title ryght wan al egipt encrease name al lyst haue sight nowe left reporte fame saue bochas wryteth howe first dyd attame hys mighty conquest intencion glory high renoune ascriued vnto worthynes residue surplusage golde treasure good richesse turne common auauntage al hys people euery maner age report mighte nerre aboue singularite cōmon prefer also tanais cithie fyrst kynge whan sarneke duke souerayne ouer iewes recorde writynge two hundred yere xl also twaine nēbroth tanais gan ordayne mighty power stronge battaile cithye proudly assayle conqueryng then vnto yle called ponte ful cruel wyse though lordship lasted whyle wan couetise bochas doth thys folke deuise proces yeres al great puissaunce hath put name remembraunce zoroastes also great myght bactrians kyng possessoure lorde trace full myghty knyght dedes great laboure conquest ne great honoure nothing left writyng v beforne saue yt lough houre yt borne began full sone mery sodaine laughter natiuitie worthy ninus kyng assiry expowned laughter great felicitie ninus wan many fayre coūtry day day power gan encrease would cōquest cease maner conquerours whan haue armes victory might paine labour newe emprises put memory courage surprised wt vayne glorye styll content estate till parady say checkmate fortune armes bokes ye may read false laughter folkes dothe smyle frowarde euer ere take hede nature falsely begyle conquest warre lasteth death dothe sturdy vyolence god death vengeaunce recōpence worthy ninus gan mightely preuayle ayenst zoroastes spake tofore hym fought last battayle whiche ninus hath well ybore zoroastes hath felde ylore aucthour bokes specify false magyke nygromancy fonde nature euery element kindely workyng mutacions course starres firmamente influence disposition aspectes coniunctions wrote pillers deuised metall seuen science called liberall also pillers brycke full harde ybake vp set longe large huge began also write vndertake make sure refuge shoulde floude ne deluge defaced ben scripture grauyng perpetuall endure though zoroastes craftes fond full little ornought myght auayle though good knight hōd ninus slayne batrayle lost realme royal apparayl ninus dyed within litle throw wise story knowe also moydes kyng sodome fynde memory writyng saue story men may reade se people freell liuynge assiriens kyng false fortune oft vary babylon made tributary haue sene redde also vengeaunce pestilence done egypt kyng pharao made maner resistence ayenst god wilfull insolence therfore people vpon day drent echone middes see people god ledde moyses without trouble maner wawe went echone quiet pea pharao gan drawe pursue full mortall lawe pursuite forward atteynt among waues host dreynt exodi ben mencions ceriouslye put remembraunce xii plage persecution egypt done full great vengeaunce treasour great substaūce dispoyled ebrues tolde vessel siluer golde egypt full great treasure ladde thē thought might thē auaile pharao fynde hadde two hundred chares enarmed battayle pursue proudly assayle fifty thousande lacke men armes folowyng horsebacke two c thousande fotemen aboute egypt chyualrye pharao great route began israel pursue enuye pryde false surquedy people drowned euerychone number left one froward hart ayenst god indurate fulfilled malyce obstinacy purpose proude obstinate foule vyces coulde espye glory regally doun though tofore crouned amidde sea among people drowned ogiges kyng thebe another prynce called ogygus kyng thebe bokes determine foūder thus bochas telleth v citye called eleusyne stout grece whose power decline fyll floude regyoun whiche ouerflowed many royall towne cithia dammage tyme iacob patriarke notable deluge waues rage slewe lordes many prynces honourable dame fortune deceiuable sumtime list disdayne folke assayle floude sodaine floude also assayle wasted cornes bothe croppe rote caused also scarcitie vytayle many man felt full vnsote pore wyst finde bote prynces supprised drede lacke vitayle great nede great floude tessaly another floude tessaly time kyng amphyon helde ceptre regaly vpon thebe mighty stronge towne beside kyngdome babilon time floude fell doubtles god people ledde moses floude land ben deuoured tessaly region pernaso people succored roches stode enuyron founde refuge saluation great succour til floudes rage began decrease withdrawe asswage olde story also ye may se whan cecrops first possession athens myghty stronge citye heate fell region influence descendeth downe body aboue celestiall whiche likely deuoure heate engendred sonne diuers countreys length breade hath course mightely begone many folke fell great dreade ryuers welles list take hede consumed dryed vp echone heat called enbracyng pheton v chapter ☞ goodly isi wife apys kyng argyue slayne brother dyffeus haue read story toforne isi egypt toke flyght crete true daughter borne promotheus full manly knyght isi euery man syght freshe goodly wedded lyue worthy apys king argyue whiche isi excellent beauty tyme father ygraue put suretye vncle shoulde kepe saue sayd • de y• man haue vncle ouide ye may se like wrote▪ called epymethe flourynge vp tender age sayd isi pleasaunt mete semelines loke vysage iupiter mighty kynge crete enuyronned mete excited feminitie enclined hart vnto deitie entent clene obeiyng hun lowly wise argiuois made quene smit couetise ayenst argus warre gan deuise vnweldy age wt stand found none aduauntage yet fortune gan vpon frowne kyng argus subtiltye counsaile prudently gan rowne take full great crueltie souldiours also made flye argus gayned raunsome fettred put strong pryson sonne god mercurius right freshe ryght lusty full hardines earthly ioye glorious ayenst argus gan power dresse intirely busines argus slaine conclusion isi deliuered fro pryson sleyghtes afterwarde feynt toke shyp egypt went shyp cowe depeynt theores iupiter also sent gone bothe one entent ioyne mariage anone ryght betwene apys prynce full myght ryght wise aboue creature secrete cunnyng well expert science taught first letter fygures egyptian playne experience gaue cunnyng intelligence tyll lande taught labourer sowe graine multiply peres egypt fame renowne began day day wext worthines holde cunnyng reputation signe shewed onely princesse holde among goddesse worshyps whiche diuyne sacrifice enclyne declare playnly worde middes great prosperitie mighty apis husband lorde prince egypt lorde country sonne iupiter niobe whiche niobe long discendyng daughter phoroneus y• kyng phoroneus first lawe founde whiche crete stande vnder obeysaūce statute myghty londe ystablished ordinaunce write vnhappy chaunce kynge apys remembred slayne pyteously dismembred brother called tyffeus sumwhat hatred couetise tyffeus onely desitous reioyce full mortall wise mighty kingdom ye haue herd deuise argiuois haue possession preferred murder false succession isi foūde lorde deade entent magnified first wisdome gan take hede ordeyned meane deified high among goddes stellified egypt temple made stalled god serapis called vi chapter ¶ grysiton membres eate honger shall write case horrible grisiton wt hōger cōstrayned life self odible thessaly wt indigence payned pyteously fame disteyned solde daughter seruage liriope whiche yong age exchaunge god puruey thē vytayle nede wo begon nothing y• might thirst auayle ne staūch hōger gnawyng bone wherfore ate membres one one prynce ala great pitie se dye suche aduersitie▪ also read full many day tofore great banishment persecution argiuois kyng gelanor • cruelly put region liege indignacion place set one danau sonne also heyre god belus people malyce encomber encrease sorow aduersitie fyfty daughter also number edippus brother also pardy fiftye sonnes story ye may se wene whiche surety ho • de mariage made bonde vnder compassed treason couertly though hide ye list haue cleare inspection story vpon euery side reade legende cupide chaucer order stode compyled woman called good touchyng story kinge pandion goodly fayre daughter twayne thereus false condicion deceiue busy payne bothe named beauty souerayne goodly progne yonge philomene bothe innoc • ute intent full cleane piteous fall open expresse presumption syth chaucer busines legende made mencion martyrdome passion rehearse busy payne chiefe poete called brytayne good woman boke write number vncomplete fully ninetene story plainely endite thereus progne philomene ye may se legende thus mene worshyp forth life shew clere myrror fewe passe ouer speake thē vnto cadmus forthe style dresse wrytynge yet greueth sore touchynge woman fayeth stablenes blessed god fynde none excesse fewe thinketh good shoulde deyntie ☞ lenuoye tragedy beareth wytnesse saturnus disposition maliciously frowardnes causeth iuno full great infection nature conueyeth nature doun ayre infect whiche man may succour cōmeth death anone al thing doth deuour time frō adam mine auctour dothe expresse downe nemrothe computation stile conueyed great auisenes zoroastes kyng pharaon two deluge maketh mencion tessaly vengeaunce gan laboure achaia thebe deuoure ye haue heates hearde excesse prince pryncesses full great destruction egistus great wretchednes fury thereus wo pandion two sister confusion fate gan vpon loure felicitie vnwarely deuoure prynces princess eyen vp dresse meane eyen discresion se worlde y• chaunge doublenes great vnsurenes variacion aduert great renowne fortuns dewes whā swetely shour falsest glory deuoure vii chapter ¶ iupiter rauished europa cad mu sent seke diuers region rehersal many olde poete discent line conueyed downe next saturnus mighty kyng crete ioue crowned succession next heyre procreacion father lande enherite raygning crete poetes list wryte one linage tolde beforne god souerayne entere though bloude high yborne chose europe fere downe discended frō heauenly spere deitie surprysed hart great beauty daughter mighty kyng called agenor line discent whose mighty kigdom ryal faire dwellyng phenice toward orient araby lande adiacent farre south ye may read se toward party redde sea iupiter whan aduert europa great semelinesse thought wounded hart vnto death beholdyng fayrenes cōstraynt mortall distresse seyng fayre syght rauished force might agenor owne father dere began case full piteously complayne ala goodly entere biraft whiche doubled al paine recure none though pleyne tyll remembryng regaly thought woulde sende aspy sonne cadmus recure ayene searche many region labour wer fructuous vaine father set fell condicion returne none occasion therupon made bounde tyll y• kinges daughter founde toke shyps great auisenes began sayle many straunge see labour busines many worthy wt preue reason se meane sent accōplishe fine entent glad hart deuoyde grutchyng seyng case frowarde contrary humble cheare toke exilinge manhode list selfe dispayre meyne knightly gan repayre towarde grece piteously lande appollo vnderstande party might drawe prayed god wyshe rede token shewe maner sawe ile myght spede woulde graciously leade myght builde citye accordyng meynie appollo sacrifice made oblation god requiryng goodly deuise lande region dwellyng habitacion drawe withouten obstacle make habitacle cadmus thus appollo stode knelyng among full great reuerence temple delphos styll abode hūble entendaunce deuout diligence mekely besechyng word sum sentēce appollo woulde vnclose party selfe dispose aunswere conclusion statue expresse go serche countreys enuyron tyll found businesse bulle excellent fayrenes whiche precept appollos lawe neuer aforne yoke ydrawe euer sekyng fonde bull stande styll pasture appollo bade vpon lo • de seeth syght auenture shoulde busy cure builde citye folkes boecia bulle call whā cadmus y• precept vnderstode searchyng busines founde place bulle stode feadyng hym selfe whiche likenes place full pleasaunt largesse stynt gan citye rayse poetes greatly cōmend praise y• buildyng myght auayle foreyns dwell full like knyght force battayle countrey expell raysynge citie whiche excell ouide also recordeth vnto thys day thebe beareth name onely glorified rearyng vp great citye also magnified manhode magnanimitie commended ye list se surmountyng famous excellence whiche wysdome science myne aucthour list indite noble prudent puruey aunce taught fygures letter write made lawes full great ordinaunce among grekes set gouernaunce thei • vycious life vertue restrayne outraied punished wt pain entent encrease hys lynage citye also multiply toke wife yong age called bokes specify hermyone touching alye though borne royall bloud also bothe ioly fayre good done writeth mine auctour death worthy iosue sothonyell beyng successour hauyng leadyng soueraintie israell whan thebe citye founded first dayes olde kyng cadmus tofore tolde foure daughter lyue full fayre echone goodly se name reherse blyue semele eldest next acthonie thirde order called inoe agane yongest whiche daughter thus befall echone port manere full well fauoured euery man syght right womanly heauenly chere beauty father anone right sittyng wyth full myght like estate birthe also age made thē wedded ioyned mariage worthy prince linage auaunce encreased procreation wherof kynge full great pleasaunce great reioysyng opinion saue lyne generation neuewes cosyns alye fro day day waxe multiply encreased felicitie whan considered verely dede riche buildynge royall citye fortune brydle leade great rich bokes reade great noble hauyng great residence citye moste magnificence daughter semele record mine auctor though discended bloud ryal iupiter paramoure power supercelestiall conceiued especiall poetes list endite god grape redde white called bachus whiche hath gouernaūce wynes regaly wherof take full great vengeaūce iuno first espye iupiter great auoutrye great hatred enuyous desire made semele brent wt sodayn fire discendyng sodayne leuine semele vengeaunce downe wēt fro iuno ielous cleped quene heauen wreke wrath purposely ysent fore flame consumed spent left remembraunce ende wofull mortall chaunce also actheon sonne acthonie great mischefes infortunes borne whose father called criste come kinred tolde toforne cruell houndes ala torne sawe bokes tell dyana naked bath well poetes remember lest whan ladyes thebe citye helde bachus solemnely feaste yonger sister called agane daughter cadmus ala pitie ayenst owne sonne deare wode mortall cheare murderyng hym full cruell wise rage furious lough sacrifyce thebe done woman bachus whiche sonne called pantheus slewe wt sharpe dart wodenes founde apart great mischeues fell lyue king cadmus vnhappy chāce fortune noblesse gan vndermyne thought would glory disauaunce worldly gladnes medled wt greuaunce experience cadmus ye may se importable aduersitie sate highest glory part clipsed prosperitie bryght renowne royall memory realmes spredde many farre con̄trey moste wealfull high see set wt linage high noblesse came fortune false enchaunteresse wilfulnesse founde occasion ayenst cadmus made renowne dul kynred false collusion gan away bryghtest fethers pull whan shining waxt vp y• full chaunge fortune lawe glory gan discrece withdrawe greuous dignitie sodayne fall high noblesse neuer set state great worthines furious mortall heauines kinred without would haue greued pore man full sore amonge sorowes euerychone rehearse playnly dare affirme one horrible dreadfull caas cadmus sonne called athamas sonne lawe false melancoly fell sodaynely frenesy wife called inoe cadmus daughter ye haue heard expresse cōstraynt infirmitie rage furious wodenes thought wyfe lyonesse wylde ymaginations two child also two lyon vpon full loude gan crye towarde wife haste came anone armes remedy childe rent craggy stone gan brast breake euery bone whiche childe bochas writeth thus full tender yong called learchus wofull sodaine aduenture rage whan toke hede sorowfull creature childe hent anone drede succour knewe better spede might gan haste sight welaway toke flyght husbande came pursuyng like woode lyon crueltie downe hill whiche dependyng childe fell see ruthe pitye king daughter lord thebe crouned woode feare drowned▪ lo fine cadmus euery deale child slayne ally selfe fortune whele whan wened leste full sodaynly fall little suger tempred moche gall among mortall peynes liege men thebe citezynes made ayenst conspiration put exile wife also son daughter brought destruction encrease mortall wo wife compelled bothe two pouerte indigence last age purchace dispence thus cadmus sorowes discriue mischiefe put remembraunce banished twise lyue first father cruell ordinaunce sister make enquiraunce alder last vnweldy age compelled holde passage thebe wife alone sorow wepyng accomplishe day illery togither gone pacience put fell assayes whose bitternes felt none alaies also ende vnhappy fate ne death finde none date saue ouide maketh mencion iohn bochas poete excellent say two brother zethus amphion thebe one assent haue cadmus exile sent wyfe also high noblesse ende life sorow wretchednes god mercy pitye whā thē saw fortune thus cast doun estate great pouertie hauyng full great compassion made transformacion bothe twayne yeuyng likenesse serpentes liue wyldernes ¶ lenuoye owhat estate may selfe assure conserue life sikernes worldly ioy may long endure shall men finde stablenes sithe kinges prince frō high noble record cadmus ben sodēly brought low whele fortune ouerthrow may susteyne pyteous aduenture tragedy writyng expresse like chaunte plure beginnyng ioy endyng wretchednes worldly blisse meinte bitternes sodayn chaūg therof may man know sytteth highest sonest ouerthrow world yet neuer creature reken vp prince hygh noblesse fortune coulde enclyne lure enperishe frowardnes wherfore ye lordes wt great rich beware afore ye daunce rowe fortune hath frō whele throw viii chapter ☞ processe oetes kyng colchos iason medea theseus scilla nisus mo whan iohn bochas diligent consider succession lynages withall entent writyng discriptions compyle generation many noble famous estate meane suche infortunate serchyng founde fewe vnhappy founde liuynge presēce anone gan hym shewe multitude full piteously wepynge among whiche full dolefully playnyng came forthe oetes hath cōplaynt begūne kyng colchos sonne vnto sunne phebus bryght clere poetes write sonne heyre myghty power freshe lusty manly ryght fayre fortune fell great dispayre cursyng fate destayne iason first entred countrey againe pelleus sent tessaly accomplishe diligent labour great emprises chiualry god fortune list fauoure might winne excellent treasour meane bolde ram assail bare y• flece gold iason counsaile medee sorcery incantacion bulle slough horrible se vainquished venimous dragon kyng dispoyled possession accomplished carectis figure colchos dreadful aduentures afterwarde purpose left oetes full great dispayre medea forth lad brother kyngs heyre finde howe repayre colchos whan gan remue kinge oetes gan sue vpon iason auenged without tariyng folowed proudly whiche thing iason se medea gan shape remedy toke brother slewe cruelly dismēbred bokes make minde piecemele felde behinde gan cast bespreint bloude wherof father syght full pale chere still felde stode iason toke vnto flyght trowe tyme wofull wyght liue whan know childe dismembred abrode ysowe whiche cause ala welaway stout man disconsolate iason fro colches went away medea infortunate rote ground mortall debate saw euer redde suche another saue straunger list slea brother forsoke father countrey kinred lande emperished robbery worshyp toke none hede loue hath brought suche fantasy abode tessaly iason soiourne made eson youth returne yarde toke drie olde herbes commi • tions made boyle ouide tolde charectes incantacious craft coniurations yarde began bud blossome newe beare frute leaues freshe hew semblably confection olde humour hath deputed cleane lusty freshe pocions empty skynne tremblyng right leane pale wanne bloude sene deadly creature hath transformed nature made lusty fresh courage glad hart liuely cheare syght right well chered clere vysage wonder deliuer force myght member weldy lyght euer estate craft medee lo alterate ayenst kyng pelleus began maligne vncle vnto iason enuy proceadeth thus king daughter draweth anō counsaylyng gone vnto father playnly vnto sayne desired yong agayne full restored force recure therwithall lusty age floure behight busy cure lyke desire helpe socoure matter crafty laboure fynally stande case made yonge brother touchyng whiche thing euidence medea hath daughter tolde entent yeue credence bade thē take ramme y• right old wyth knyfe bolde slea beast stode vessell drawe olde bloude fullye affirmyng like true lambe agayne craft would bloude remue wise euidens playne elde token shoulde seyne membres lusty entere lambe eyned one yere vpon suche sleyghty wise began processe full false treason sister made vpon lambe practise drewe bloude like enteneton craft false illusion blent eyen apparaunce vayne olde ram seme lambe agayne thus medea sleyght compassyng enuy venemous hatred excited hath sister workynge ayenst father mortally procede wt sharpe kniues thei made father blede amiddes hart throughout euery vayne supposyng sely sister twayne pelleus renued shoulde youth ayen force substaunce finally treason medee lost life suche wofull chaūce wrought onely vengeaunce rote grounde cruell dede ayenst nature womanhede supposyng opinion death greatly shoulde please pellius vnto lorde iason great encrease set hart ease rebounded vnto disease finally iason forsoke offence way toke corynth kynge creon whose daughter creusa great beauty afterwarde wedded iason whā wedding knowē mede cast woulde theron auenged began conspyre malice enuy magyke forcery full great haste gan ordayne little coffer onely entent yonge fayre sonnes twayne iewels hath sent vnto creusa makyng present whiche malyce list dispose whan creusa coffer vnclose fyre brast full large space brent creusa full great vyolence set fyre playnely place enchauntment resistence went fire presence vengeaunce full great domage whan iason fire sawe rage considered malice medee thought woulde execution punishe great iniquitie ayenst compassed treason vengeaunce ayenst reason creusa consumed brent owne sounes whylom sent without ruth womanly pitye falsly murdred child bare like stepmother auenged cut throtes ware ayenst nature none spare hatred vnto iason murder fled away anone escapyng indignation craft magike went libertie athens region wedded vnto kyng ege longe sonne child mine auctour telleth thus medea called medus whose name famous region ynamed called mede folowyng euer olde condicion medea voyde shame dread compassed hath wilfull false hatred theseus sonne kyng ege newe poyson shall deuoured theseus full like manly knyght repayryng home countrey high prudence aspied anone ryght mortall vengeaunce great crueltie stepmother whiche enmitie concluded hath entencion destroy vnwarely poyson hart malice cruell horrible treason euer alied whan sawe purpose moste odible king egeus fully aspied hath hart wittes newe applied bokes poetes haue compiled ayen iason reconciled fled away feare theseus lest would done vengeaunce finally writeth ouidius morall seneke concludeth sentaunce tragedy makyng remembraunce howe medea like poetes sayne vnto iason restored agayne touchyng ende furious discorde poetes make therof mencion neither tell meane fyll accord incantation whiche well coulde turne vp sondry thinges loue hatred bochas read saue whan fulfilled purpose mine aucthour telleth iason mede restored haue ayen vnto colchos father oetes pouertie brought ayen royall see crowne force restore touching ende find thus fortune hath turned fro first like kyng hauyng ful great rich liuyng pouertie wo sythen restored worthines thus euer sorow meint gladnes aduert worldly thing record mynos noble worthy kyng must style dresse folowyng trace bochasius wiche mynos ouid doth expresse touchyng byrth writeth playnly thus manly wise vertuous sonne discent iupiter great europa borne heyre crete person wonder delitable full renowined wisdome science diuers title laude commendable byrth bloud knighthode prudence study entyre diligence founde first lawes grounded reason wherby crete famous region gouerned set stablenes iniuries wronges reforme made statute extorcions represse right wisenes toke first forme eche man shoulde conforme like degree subiect souerayne man matter complayne made liege liue quiete cleare shinyng royall noblesse sword sceptre sittyng sete floured worthines toke wife excellent fayrenes doughter phebus bochas ye may se called faire pasiphae father record writyng time holden full famous yle rhodes lorde kyng dayes port full glorious right proude armes victorious takyng witnes methamorphoseos daughter thre child mynos first sonne called androge afterward full faire daughter twayne ryght goodly womanly se like fortune ordayne felt selues trouble payn one called ariadne phedra folowyng fate might none androgeus kyng mynos sent profite cleargy athens vertuous entent study philosophy began encrease multiply passe study learnyng excell felowes cunnyng enuy false malice ala made ayenst conspiration pinacle sacred pallas ful great heigth thei made tūble doun iniury bochas maketh mencion father mynos auenged layed great power citie cast fully y• man shoulde let woulde cruelly vengeaunce rounde sore beset men armes ordinaunce finallye brought vttraunce constrayned within little space life death submitten grace made ayenst resistence supposyng power withstande nisus kyng megarence ayenst mynos party toke hande oft time ye shall vnderstande whan kyng mynos citye assayle nisus within myghty apparayle vpon walles stode defence whan mynos full like manly knyght fought without sturdy vyolence like mar selfe stele armed bryght wherof whan scilla syght daughter nysus aduertyng prowes anone loue fell great distresse supprised high noblesse manly force expert many folde set scilla great heauines loue mynos poetes tolde made hart presume bolde first life put ieopardy father life citye cleargy hart loue hath set aside ayenst nature bloude kynred frendshyp gan deuide worshyp toke maner hede loue made cruell ayenst womanhede first hart sore set fire father death falsely conspyre kyng mynos beyng straungere emprynted opinion creature stode none nere sake full false treason compassed destruction first father citye straunge thing ala myght woman yeres yong tender coulde ymagen marueylous thing falleth creature slender vnder face angelike lokynge ben wolues outwarde workynge also vnder coloure port feminine ben found serpentyne lambes wyng shadowed wt mekenes cruel tygres doth offence humble chere pretendyng likenesse wo ala harme doth apparence damage doth counterfaite innocence vnder mantell shroude womanhede whan fayned falsenes doth brydle lede scilla kynges daughter dere set whole affection harte ioy pleasaunce entere worldly blisse consolation turned confusion like daughter like sorceresse death cōpassed story beareth witnes father fatall heer shone bryghter golde assure manly fight ayenst mortall fone head endure vainquishe recure knighthode encrese glory euery quarel wyn victory whā kyng nysus father lay slepe vpon night parcell afore day full secretely toke kepe heere golde scilla cut away vnto mynos armed lay presented ordinaunce false entent pleasaunce matter like writeth ouyde methamorphoseos taketh hede father sleping knelyng side toke sharpe knife without feare dreade lay naked carft two head stale away full false entent kyng mynos ye head doth present commyng presence father head afore layed nothing ashamed great offence vnto mynos thus obrayed bolde chere euen thus saied lorde quod wt support grace yeueth tale leasure time space certes lorde loue hath excyted constrayned cruell dede slee father destroye citie forget worshyp forsake womanhead made hardy make father blede thinges horrible thus haue vndertake accomplyshe onely sake selfe disherited loue persone called countrey false traytoresse disconsolate stale away alone new diffamed named maistresse false murder bryng great witnes father head deadly vysage ayenst nature voyage wherfore pray ye list aduertise consider like gentle knyght loue towarde great empryse great furtheryng also right haue first father depriued myght raft life dispoyled rich pleasaunce high noble nothing aske vnto guerden neither rewarde may auayle might haue full possession person worthy battayle treasure y• might counteruayle desire woulde dede goodly accept womanhede ye may saue spyll worde make glad dolorous require souerayne lorde ye would gracious bloud kinne father house left behinde ye list aduert vndeparted yeue hert highnes ought ynough suffise thing considered royall estate conceiued also vncouth wise loue stande desolate saue mercy full disconsolate loue bye sore ye grace say whan tale tolde knelyng maner pretence womanhede treason poynt cōcelyng king astonied horrible dede great aduise peysed toke hede sittyng prynce kyng fauour frowarde thing troubled hart face pale loke vp cast sayed god forbede euer cronicle story tale man mynos reade supported venemous dede fauour woman ala well away whiche slough father whan bed lay▪ hatefull vnkynde rage praye god echone saturne take vengeaunce false outrage euery whither ye returne euery place ye soiourne lande sea shortly expresse ben enfect cursednesse owne mouth outrage doth accuse actes ben abhominable giftes fully refuse ben frowarde reprouable persone disnaturell vnstable within courte thinge faire ye shoulde abyde haue repaire ye hateful euery side contrarious condicion praye cellus oferth gide neptunus make orison ferre stretcheth dominacion vnder bound regaly dwellinge place deny whan minos answere thus deuised reason grounded equite scilla sawe howe dispised knewe partie passage ne countre finde socour whether might flye dispeired lyke traitouresse towarde see anone gan dresse entre water plainly mighte shame selfe shroude whan goddes thereof sight turned y• might coude quaile sing loude father nisus dyd also transmewe sparhauke quaile pursue ende nisus scille afterwarde athene toune yelded vp stande kinge minos condicion euery yere reuolucion citie delay nyne theyr chyldren tribute paye minos imposicion vpon athene drede obeyed made mencion child yere yere lede crete minotaur fede vnto monstre ordeyned repast cōming deuoured hast forther procede mater wyl cure declare ye lyst take hede monstre tell engendrure vncouth heare ayenst nature writynge ouidius thys vgly beaste engendred thus methamorphoseos maner ye may se minos bulle greate fayrenes white milke quene pasiphae loued hote story bereth wytnes dedalus dyd busines subtell craft made gynne ayenst kinde conceyued beast monstruous departed halfe bull halfe man poete writinge techeth v al minotaures thus name began dedalus longe whan mōstre quene forth brought subtle workmā hath house ywroght called laberinthus diuers vncouth full wrynkels straungenes vgly knowe north south parte man hym dresse folkes blent wt furious derknes entred retourne veyn wythout clewe resort ageyn minotaurus thys habitacle lyke prison made turmentry dampned folke paynefull tabernacle lay ieoperdy monstre must deuoure defy specially ordayned thys turment doun athene sent mater folke vary afferme quene pasiphae kyng minos loued secretarye called taurus bochas ye may se thus kinge ryalte disceiued may whyle selfe preserue woman lyst begile • taurus bochas bereth witnes quene pasiphae childe full faire minos knowing likenes childe borne heire trust good fell dispaire husbandes poetes haue cōpiled whych assure rathest ben begiled innocentes deme amys namely wiues ben founde true clerkes may write doutles thus nature loue nothynges newe stedfast hert chaunge hew haukes best preued sūtime chek make yet faute foule forsake mater wryte wyll nomore aye tribute seruage toun procedeth forth cōstreyned sore lyke lot turned vp doun made none excepcion high ne lowe neyther soure ne swete fell sent crete statute inly rigorous toke sort came aboute tyll last fell theseus mought go forth amonge route kyng egeus son beynge great dout touchig life might socored must wyth deuoured theseus hys worthynesse knighthode hys great encrese manly force prowes somtyme called seconde hercules among amasones put hym selfe prese wedded ipolita bokes specifye hardy quene called feminye afterwarde thebe gone holpe ladyes especiall cōpleined vpon king creon thē distroubled lyke estate rial holde halowe festes funerall lordes quenes princess wifely truth kyndnesses whan thys duke maner sene creon great iniquite ladyes made deliuer ayene lordes bone ruth pyte yet youth cite deliuered statute ful odible deuoured beast horrible gothe prison semelynesse statute felly dyd ordeyne ruth tender gentylnes hym preserue deedly payne king minos ye goodly doughters twaine ariadne shope remedie feire phedra shoulde dye helpe hath y• mōstre slaine dredful vgly se scaped whereof ful faine led wyth hym towarde countre waye deuoyde pyte ariadne ful falsely hath forsake ayenst suraunce phedra hath take myddes sea left yle towardes partye knewe declyne wepeth crieth ala hard fate thys mortall fyne pite bachus god wyne toke wife whose croune stone fine doth nowe heauen ix sterres shyne thus theseus ye may beholde se ariadne great vnstedfastnes great vntruth mutabilite broke assuraunce newe fanglenes sely woman kepe stedfastnes euer vnfouled saue sumtyme theyr kinde must thē puruey whan men vnkind theseus nowe sayne matter make hym memory kynge minos wyll resort againe tell howe fortune euer false transitory poyntes defaced hath glory fyrst eche one bochas doth specifye pasiphae foule aduoutry wyfe stode well grace pleasaunce soueraine cloude small trespare made lorde disdayne wysdome bare preuily paine suche case sentence let prudent husbandes take paciēce thynges mynos gan also cōplaine hauynge hert thereof full great greuaūce lost fayre doughters twayne minotaurus slayne wyth mischaunce also hym great greuaunce theseus gone liberte tribute deliuered hys cite greued also countinaunce theseus ariadne forsoke liked also manere vnto wyfe phedra toke yet thys phedra lyke sayth boke two sonnes theseus first demophoon next antiochus also theseus gan hym drawe towarde cecile stele armed clene peritheus armes felawe rauyshe proserpina quene entent phedra ful vnclene loued stepsonn called ipolitus daungerous lust froward contrary apport goodly ne benigne false entent anon gan vary ayenst hym full felly maligne prince many token signe womanhede gan hym accuse auoutry falsly excuse sayth woman ymagyne deffence tale vntrue desire men list enclyne neither feyned false wo tue▪ anon compasse thynges new fyshe finde entencion couert cloude shadowe traison hath accused yonge ipolitus false auoutrye hys tendre age tolde affirmed duke theseus ful bolde chere ful playne visage howe purposed outrage force beaute oppresse lorde beseching reforme dresse great iniquitie done wife whyle absēt thing y• bare charge wyues tale somtyme ben inuentife suffre tonges falsly flyen large folkes ye list domage thē discharge accusyng ne take none hede tyll truth tried dede meane nothynge wyues ben good neyther woman ye flouren innocence god forbede holy roode men due reuerence noblesse excellence declare bounte vertue shewe thē cherishe fewe touching accusing ayenst ipolitus though fals dede yet shame fere theseus story ye may behold rede hert caught maner drede ala thys sely yonge knight fled withdrewe hi hys father sight hys indignacion playnly eschewe though desert lacke hasty drede gan remewe chare horse backe horse afrayde fel sodeine wracke doun frō roch pendaunt ye shall lere chare drowned fere thus vngilty lusty youth conueied distruction sclander conspired wele couth false phedra conclusion sclander turned confusion whan wyst ipolitus dede defaut anon shame drede toke swerde full sharpe ygrounde raft hert tweine lo howe yt vēgeaūce woll euer ayen reboūde falsely busy peine sclaunder folke like ordeine diffames folkes wyte god last malice aquite bokes phedra recorde ashamed confuse dede hing selfe vp full high corde lo false sclaunder quite folkes mede wherefore counsayle euery man take hede mater stande vncertaine hasty langage tonge refraine amonge story woful rede besprent teares face full sodenly jhon bochas gan take hede middes prease zisara came place howe fortune gan also manace proud duke full myghty notable kyng jabyn called great constable host leder gouernour israell mortall fo people rode lyke conquerour euer meyny dyd go earth quoke people dredde fled fro hys face came ferre nyne hundred wayne wet strōgly inarmed wt hokes made like sithes▪ ye approched mayme wounde tirant custome oftsithes great delite jewes confound tho swerde hath found kynge jabyn bad prince canaan israel spare childe ne man zisara sent scourge goddes suffraunce sinnes chastise olde offence punishe purge flagell many sondry wyse whan reason gan better deuise trespaces fall repentaūce god gan wt drawe hand vengeaūce mischefe gan lorde knowe felynge pricke punicion mercy hath vnbent bowe hys fell yre castigacion god made inuocacion herde mortal drede judicum storye ye may rede howe whyle zisara shope hym newe jewes oppresse defence god sent delbora prophetesse story bereth witnes yeue thē counseil armeis dresse spirite prophesie wythstande great tyrannye zisara whych discended doun great host felde repeired delbora high discrecion whan sawe jewes dispeired fight corrages sore apeired made first deuoutly drede crye god helpe nede iudge gouernes chefe counsaill custome cause dependinge great auysenes stode dout dome equitie tried vnder palme tre▪ hasty mater determyne tyll party aforedyd examyne whan herd cōminge zisara wyth full great puissaunce constable mighty king called jabyn wyth al ordinaunce vpon jewes vengeaunce delbora gan prudently entende jewes party wysdome defende bad barach husbande anon ryght nemptalym x take ayenst zisara fyght ryghte shoulde great enarme take drede thys iourney gan forsake durst ayenst tho werrey present lyst hym conuey wel wel quod syth standeth wantrust ye haue maner drede wyl selfe gladly wyth go support great nede trusteth fully ye shall fynde dede woman laude honour glorye shal fro wyn price victory folowed sothly sayd auisely made ordinaunce chefe charge selfe layde princesse jewes gouernaunce prudently gan selfe auaunce god conueyed support grace zisara mete face specially touchyng viage god toke away spirite myght fro zisara force corage feareful entre fyght kepte chare toke hym flyght knowyng place suertie abyde tyll jaell woman dyd hym hide within tente al dede drede vnder mantell desirous drynke gaue mylke slepe fyl heed whyle heuines gan wynke sadly slept gan bethynke thought woulde zisara shape lyfe escape toke nayle sharpe long couertly gan selfe auaunce myghty hamer round stronge droue y• naile lo bēgeaūce heed se soden chaunce tirantes trust fortune wil suffer long contune false vsurped tiranny holde people long subieccion blandyshe wyth flatery vnder colour false colluspon wyth sodaine transmutacion fortune poore folke trouble reuerse pride wyth face double lengre thys mater tary▪ though lordshyp myghty famous let zisara examplary endureth vertuous conquest victory though glorious vnto world vertue behinde men reioyse haue theyr name mide fortune frowardnes hath kynges put region hath also throughe doublenes▪ dystroyed lynages wyth successions▪ made sometyme translacions kyngdome called argiuois transported lacidemonois▪ tyme whan zisara proude gan goddes people put vnder fote fame trumpe blewe name vp loude wyth sacred sownes semynge wondre sote al pride rent vp rote whan hys glory outward shyning may trust worldly thynge▪ folke haue afore sene valuacion remembraunce antiquitie myghty troy lion distroyed grekes cyte v declarynge mutabilite offalse fortune whose
