fauor lasteth shewyng euer truest whan wol begile variable delites whele vntrusty frowardly meuyng recorde take madianites vnware fal ful dolefully pleynynge shewed selfe pitiously wepynge jhon bochas writynge sought y• fortune ayenst prince wrought gouerned lande madian▪ trustinge pride greate puissaunce ayenst jewes warre began purposinge bringe vtterance god holdeth warre balaunce prince oppresse vein glory yeueth list conquest victory great nōbre great multitude party seeth right hys dredful hand shortly conclude holdeth vp grace yeueth lyght higher hand cast sight lyst power fauour shewe many orbe vnto fewe wronge party gladly hath fall though ther million many •• theran take witnesse jerobaall whych also called gedian wyth thre c fought ayenst fan israel byble deuyse whan god done hys sacrifice shewyng hym thynge meruaylous whan fleece wyth siluer dewe ful shene spreint wet storye telleth thus rounde soyle grene founde drye drop sene token onely duke knightly man shulde haue victory madian gedeon toke hym fewe thre hundred chase whych lapped riuer god vnto hym token dyd shewe euidences afore full clere shoulde right good party hys aduersaries drede nother prowes neyther manhede god aboue holdeth champerty may ayenst hym made defence▪ force strength wysdome cheualry ayenst hys might feble resistence thys well preued experience whan thre c wyth gedeon nombre many thousandes grace dyd encōbre thys sayd people deuided thre trumpettes vpon ye derke nyght gedeon soueraynte wyth voyde pottes laumpes therin lyght thus arayed entred fyght vnto thys token first knowe whan gedeon trumpe dyd blowe blewe echon loud gan crye brake pottes shewted anon ryght story doth playnly specifye laumpes shewed wt full soden lyght wherof enemy astoinied sight troubled vpon euery side felde durst abyde crie euerychon thanke ye lorde noble glorious pryse swerde myghty gedeon v hath caused victorious made enemyes malicious influence onely grace feare flye afore face thus lorde hys magnificence meke exalte proude oppresse lyke fyndeth hertes difference power dome dresse mercy aye meint wyth rightwysenes hys iudgementes wyth long delay differred punish pytie aye preferred lenuoye myghty prince remembre power transitory abiding thys tragedy hath rehersed euidences notable ensuynge example substaunce wytnessyng ty • ante playnly termpue mo • e • eir state sodenly declyne phebus freshe hys mydday sphere beames bryghtest hotest spredyng cloudy skyes oft approch nere eclipse lyght wt vnware coming none erthly ioye longe abidynge record tytā whych stondmele doth shine yet toward nyght stremes doun decline whan fortune fairest chere apparence blandishyng fallest ech season yere soden cha • ge vp turnīg nightīgale may doth freshly sing backe wynter somer vndermyne freshnes sodenly declyne erthly blisse dependeth balaunce vneuynly hanging prīces prīcesses souerayne entere tragedy conceyueth redynge howe estate vnware chaunginge somtime full worthy liues dyd fine whā frō noblesse made declyne ¶ mighty iabyn kinge canaan quene iocasta thebe distroyed ix chapter nowe muste wryte greate sobeyn fall mighty iabyn iniquite▪ whyche vnto iewes enmye full mortal scepter crowne reigning canane vpon affrike souerainte rebell god lyst hym obey euer redy hys people werrey lord aboue seynge tiranny forbare hand wyth full longe suffraūce hasty obstinacy lyke desert vengeaunce euer thys iabyn continuance endured forth cursidnesse tyll swerde goddes righwisenes whet ayenst tira • chastise represse rebellion kyngdome story doth deuise myddes pride pulled doun exemplify dominacion found wilful truth ouer cast god wyll suffer power long last iabyn found alway frowarde high disdaine list lorde knowe therfore power drewe alway bacward empire ybrought full low riall fame fortune hath ouerthrow name eclipsed yt sumtime shone ful clere great cison besyde ruiere quene iocasta bochas doth also endite princesse thebe mighty great citie vnhappes dolefully doth write imagining howe se appere great aduersite lyke woman would teares reine fortune gan disdeine though defaced figure shewed maner maieste quenely honour plainly discure infortuns infelictte declare plainly princess stode estate selfe infortunate gaue bochas full great occasion whan sawe pitous apparayle make lamentacion vncouth sorowes whych dyd assaile tragedy wepe wayle importable straunge dedely strife duryng lyfe wryte story large playne byrth fyrst doth diffyne affyrmeth hys boke certayne discended noble lyne flouryng age also dyd shyne wedded great beauty vnto kyng thebe citye tyme called layus whan wombe processe dyd aryse kyng glad also desirous childes fate know wise thought would go sacrifice vnto appollo haue knowlegynge toforne touching child whan borne folow conclusion desirous hasty se fyrst heauenly disposicion fauour woulde appollos myghty deite haue aunswere among wyttes al child fate befall answere though contrary desire yet thus dede appollo tolde hym lyst lenger tary childe verily dede slee father make side blede wt hand none wey swerde must nedes deye kyng heuy trist sentence sorouful hert god wote nothyng faine cast afore prouidence son al hast slayne would houre delayne byrth bad men gone forest slee chylde anone lyke byddyng minister dyd dede takyng chylde tendre yong age forest wyth gan lede deuoured beastes sauage mother ala almost fell rage seyng child inly fayre face shal thus deed dyd trespace lytel wondre though felt smert al woman report vnto mother ben tendre hert mater fuges ruth pite princesse quene ala shuld know child deuoured caas▪ thys byrth layus toke good kepe without mercy respite delay vnto one whych kept shepe yong chyld vpou certayne day shal deliuered al hast may thys entent myght socoured beastes dettoured sayd sheperde goth forth anon ryght chyld beholdyng benigne loke face thought hert inwarde light shoulde god great trespace slee child wherfore hym grace toke fyrst knife dyd busy payne throughout fete make hole twayne toke smal rodde yonge osier perced fete ala pite bonde hym fast good leiser yong childe henge vpon tree entent ne wylde beastes cruel sauage sodenly deuoured rage vpon tre whyle henge thus bound auenture occasion straunge sheperd hath child yfound whych ruth pyte toke hym doun bare wyth hym home hys toun made hys wyfe payne foster chylde wyth brestes twaine whan brought forth recured full made hole hys woundes sore thys yong chyld whych al hath endured whan age began nature began hym restore saide sheperde loued hym best hurtes edippus dyd hym cal edippus saine conceyueth exposicion fete yperced throughout twayne langage made mencion meropa wife king polibion shepeherde ful humble entent began child ful lowly present barreyne nature kyng one affection toke edippus cure sonne heire adopcion reigne corinth succession kyng quene corinth coūtre chylde great cheerte let men considre discrecion sodayne chaunge euery maner thyng childe sent distruction prouided kynge fortune aye double working refuse beastes sauage receyued knyghtly heritage destitute kynrede forsake abiect bloud alie tēdre youth fete made blede henge tre began helpe crie god mischefe magnifye reconfort folke disconsolate hath made thys childe nowe thus fortunate hath prouided kynges heire stode deth auenture fortune shew herselfe foule fayre folkes brought lowe ful wel ayen recure paciently endure lyst grudge ayenst chastisyng god myschefe sodenly bryng whan edippus growe vp age lyke yong prince encresynge noblesse lusty strong freshe corage auenture fel sothnesse outher strife frowardnes sume conteke knowledgynge howe sonne vnto kynge discēt ferre fortaine whereupon full sore began muse knowe put certaine thought would som maner practike vse kyng gan hym selfe excuse tyme wythdrawe presence tyil myght knewe experience sume signe howe matter stode thought would diligence knowe father also bloude discended haue euidence touching troth howe stode sentence vpon certified towarde appollo fast hath hym hyed whiche cirta worshypped time gaue answere beite tolke came euen prime euery doute ambiguyte edippus fallyng vpon kne hys offring answere anoue towarde grece gone vnto mountaine phocis bare ye name shoulde kynred also lyke fate answere shoulde slee hys owne father dere thebe drawe hym nere wedde mother ignoraunce called iocasta throgh hys vnhappy chan̄ce list lenger tary ne abyde thys sayd edippus forth goeth hys way began anone ryde tyi mount phocis se vnder stode great countre called cetoyens whiche time certayne werreyed moūtaine father layus chiualry citoyens entred battaile edippus came wyth partie hyll armed plate mayle began eche assaile among prese encountrynge auenture edippus flewe kyng vnknowen hym father hauyng thereof suspection passed way platly thys case also vnknowen came toun mighty thebe wher hie renoun receyued wyth ful great reuerence bycause slough defence sphinx serpent horible se sometyme ordained incantacions distroy towne countre compassed sleightly question sloughe man chylde region coude wysdome reason make probleme playne exposicion passed coude hym excuse serpent woulde hym felly assaile problem make hym muse called men vncouth deuinayle whych expowne assaile ther none helpe neither remedy statute must dye folke haue knowledgyng demaunde dede wyll reherce wrytyng compendiously men may rede first serpent list take hede monstruous spake ayenst nature fyll creature man woman forth passe highe lowe region sayde erst none grace made exposicion serpentes frowarde question must dye make defence whych demaunde thus sentence serpent asked thyng may beast foule whan forth brought hath power stand go flee afterwarde well ysought goth fyrst foure el gothe nought precesse thre twayne eft agayne nature doth ordayne goth thre efte four agayne also kyndly right nature disposeth whyle foloweth certaine matter came fro must kynde resort ayen therto meanynge clerely se serpent shall deuoured edippus ful sobre entent rekell hasty langage hert wyth great auy sement full demure loke vysage considred fyrst thys perilous fel passage sawe wel tofore iape ful prouided y• worde escape good leysar wyth hole mynde memorye seyng ernest mortal emprise hys life depending bitwixe deth victory thys quod plainly deuyse fyrst child whych may suffyce whan borne truth al day sene wythout helpe selfe sustene four naturally doth crepe impotence grene tendernesse norices tell kepe afterwarde vp doth hym dresse two fete thirde expresse hand benche support wal holde hym vp lest catche fall afterward encresyng myght great age whan doth attayne nature goth vpryght mightily vpon legges twayne cometh age power restrayne croked lame lyke men may se staffe potent make vp legges thre whan feblenesse syckenes assayle handes fete must bow lout croche potentes may auayle whan lusty youth banished shet eft agayne hereof maye dout four fete erth doth retourne fro whe • came styl soiourne came fro erth erth shal agaynst nature may protection worldly estate echone mortal may treasour make redempcion clymeth hiest fal lowest doun meane estate best coude knowe betwene hye presumynge bowing lowe sit hyest stand ieopardye vnder daunger fortune lyke fall mischefe pouerte party ben lowest brought among people al folke tast sugre sum tast call salomon therfore myrrour sapience bytwene great rich great indigence asked meane called suffysance hold hym content cōpetent dispence reioyce great haboundaunce euer pouerte send pacience sobre wt plenty scarsnesse non offence grutching bitwene ioye smart thanke god euer glad hert erth ende euery maner man rich wyth great possession dyeth soone reherce doth poore tribulacion deth ne maketh diuision syngler fauour bitwene ylich poorest hym rich said problem concluded case whych y• serpent began sleighly propose whan childe fyrst borne ala • ynde dethwarde anon doth 〈◊〉 dispose eche day iourney none glose experience tech euery age howe thys worlde pilgrimage thys sayde edippus fyrste thebe borne sent forest deuou • ed founde brought forth ye haue herde toforne drawynge home countre slough hys father infortunate frowarde happes followynge al hys lyue tragedy hys fortune shal discriue hye prudence vnto serpent declared euery dele slough hym knightly vyolence wysdome armure stele stace thebe tell thys ful wele whych one cause ye list sene wh •• edippus wedded hath y• quene called iocasta princesse countre hys owne mother vnknowen bothe though ryghte fayre vpon se mariage y• goddes wereful wroth aliaunce nature gan loth mother ye shal vnderstande shoulde son take husbande therin conuenience supported kynde ne reason heuenly influence disposed inclinacion false froward constellacion caused saturne mar frowarde star engendre debate mortal war thys matter playnly thus deme connyng opinion though crowned wt sceptre diademe reigne thebe strōg myghty toun aspect came fro heuen adoun infortunate frowarde full rage agayne kynde ioyned mariage crowned assent towne flouryng season soueraynte peece whyle helde possession sonnes doughters doubtles fyrst sonne called ethiocles polynices called sayth bochas seconde brother also goodly doughters twayne eldest called • ntigone seconde named imeyne ryght fayre vnto se quene iocasta might gladder remembre whan wexe age goddes encresed linage ioye felicitie se child inly fayre ioye ther cometh aduersite hope assured wanhope doth oft appayre▪ cōtrarious trust wyll gladly repaire wher false wenyng hert cōceyued ignorāce hath many disceiued thynge earth disceyuable whan man supposeth verily prosperite stand stable ioye remeued sodaynly▪ fortune found hasty trise folke greuous endure sodayne chaunges hatefull nature vnware wo cometh gladnes vnto hertes ryght passinge encombreous hath felt parte wealfulnesse sorowe suynge hym odious worst al contrarious whan estate highest renoun ben frō noblesse sodenly brought doun glory whych shyneth false fortune magnifie whan laude brightest clere eclips wyth cloudy •• e vnware sorowe onely enuy seeth edippus open euidence life experience highe noblesse therwyth also parte importable great aduersite hys ioye euer meynt wyth ful mortal wo reigned thebe citie▪ iocasta ful great • • alte within countre fyl pestilence people infectyng violence land al region euery age greuously echone towne infection spred specially vengeaūce swerd rigorously day day began byte • • ue ech estate causyng folke sterue thus began encrease mortalite euery man stode ieopardy lyues throughout countre importable malady ye might heare people clepe cry dispeyred theyr line voyde socour preseruatiues sought herbes spice cofers began seke helpe socours cause enquiringe prudent philosofers experte diuinours goddes wyth sharpe shours pestilence cruel wyse lyst ala mortally chastyse among soth case founde one ful prudent wyse prophet called tiresias prophecy hauyng souerayne prise affirmed sayd thys wyse vnto shewed myracle phebus selfe declarynge oracle cause syckenes malady goddes plainly haue disposed senecke writeth also hys tragedy though cause secrete yclosed vnto tyme kyng deposed slew father raft life hath also take mother wyfe tyll thys done execute dede ther may made redempcion pestilence shall multiply sprede euer region tyl vnto tyme put doun fro crowne whych long agone father slough among mortall fone hath mother wedded also agaynst lawe agaynst al ryght tyll vengeaunce vpon crime shalbe war pestylence fighte sorowe strife euery maner wight veugeaunce hys neighbour shal hate brother wt brother bloud wt bloud debate al may socour whych brought people great heauynes tiresias great diuinour propher • told thus expresse last token witnes men vnderstode signes shewyng pestilence brought kyng though people gaue credence tiresias ne prophecy quene iocasta caught au euidence hert full great fantasy specially whan dyde espie edippus fete wounded tumour trouth ygrounded also diuinour tolde tofore edippus shoulde layus thebe successour wherby kyng quene ryte fyl great trouble great aduersite well writyng report nothing yt myght thē recōfort ful oft day iocasta gan swoune kyng edippus sobbe crye wepe salte teares would drown deth crāpishing hert gan crepe day cōplainyng night may slepe cursynge houre natiuyte lyue day se mortall chaunce dedly auenture fortune also whych gan thē froun inpacient doleful endure froward fate wyth lokes broun kynge foryre caste away crowne began • ace cōstraint payne heed wofull eyen twayne day night cried deth hatefull come mannes sight desirous yelde vp breth woful hert come light coorbed sorow feble stande vpright specially hys deedly distres drede shame dared derkenes cruel constr • int grenance sonnes hym dispyte gan sorowe greatly auance scorne set delite neuer none stode worse plyte thus lyeng destitute chere vnto goddes made prayere beseching thē ful doleful herte vpon wo haue sum compassion would auenge • inert bitwene sonnes make diuision eche brynge distruction thys prayer substaunce eche may take vengeaunce yeres fewe vnkyndnesse herd prayer ye haue herd deuise bretherne two cursidnes eche gan mortally dispise lacke grace false couetyse eche partie desirous dede tofore reigne succede thus bretherne infortunate bitwene selfe fill discencion finally vnkindly debate brought al thebe distruccion yet made fyrst conuencion enterchangīg y• eche reigne yere tother absent play come nere concluded assent accorde region polynices rode forth absent ethiocles toke fyrst possession whan ye reuolucion come false entent vnto accorde denied assent thys cause theyr striues polynices thus put ryght tyll adrastus kyng argyues thorow al grece gretest might sent vnto thebe tideus knyght hys sonne lawe treat thys matter cause finally lere wher kyng called ethiocles would condiscende truth reason stynt warre cherishe pece accorde composicion vp deliuer thebe mighty towne vnto brother whych absēt without yere fully come false frowardly gan vary ethiocles hys conuenci • n whych adrastus lenger would tary whan tideus made relacion called anone throughout region worthy nere farre ayenst thebe begyn warre thys cause lyke ye shal lere polynices force hys partie ywedded kynges doughter dere meane adrastus floure chyualry whan tideus dyd certifye touchinge answere ethiocles truth recheles false hys promyse cursedly forsworne hys truth none aduertence neyther accord yt made beforne touchyng y• deliueraūce thebe citie lyst storye clerely se two bretherne discencion howe adrastus lay fore toun howe tideus high prowes fought way going message grece worthines wyth kyng adrastus went viage mischefe fyll passage lacke water tyll siphile norishe ligurgus fayre vpon se taught tideus fynde riuer dyd fayrnesse excell ne howe serpent vgly chere • ig ligurgus y• childe slough well neyther howe amphiorax fyll doun hel declare semed nede siege thebe ye may rede storye hole made mencion either parte puissaūce might adrastus lay tofore toun inette euery daye fyght howe tideus famous knyght • omed actes marcial slayne ala fought wal howe bretherne met among prese lyke two tigres lion wode sharpe speres doutlesse eueryche shed others hert bloud fyne thus thē itstode saue feestes called funerall fell marueyle tel shal whan brent ash dede enuy fyll ful great wonder amonge brondes cole rede hyghe ayre smoke went sunder one one party yonder declare storye list fayne gret hatered y• bitwixt hem twayn thus yre false discention lordes chiualrye slayne grece also towne rote myne aucthour list lye false alyaunce fraternall enuy chefe grounde surplusage serche aright vnkyndly maryage quene iocasta felt part payne se chylder eche slea son lorde blynde eyen twayne son father also brother fortune would shoulde none also parchas sister nūber thre spanne threde natiuitie also whan iocasta stode thus disconsolate sawe thebe subuersion countrey destroyed made desolate gentle bloude shedde region without comfort consolacion thought myght appeyred hope fully loe dispayred trist heauy pensyfe spake word sorowes olde newe gan aduert toke sworde hym lorde wt edippus smot layus hart • inyshe paynes smarte fro body soule deuide ro • e selfe throughout euery syde wery wofull life seyng fortune great frowardnes diffame slaunder rife edippus great wretchednes also sonnes great vnkindnes thinges weyed sore distresse list liue bochas writeth concernyng fayrenes constraynt sorow caused fade famous light also noblesse clearenes dayes glade vnware harmes ouer lade anguyshe selfe hate inly contrary disposed fate thus death deuoureth bitter gall ioye sorow auoyde mercy dart maketh downe fall riche pore markyng sodaynly vnware stroke smiteth indifferently refusyng fauour mede estate taketh little hede better dye liue wretchednes better dye euer lyue payne better ende deadly heauines better dye euer wo remayne y• mischefe doth folke cōplaine wofull cōstraynt long cōtinuaunce better dye thā liue suche greuaūce taketh ensample hereof priefe kyng edyppus long ago quene iocasta felt great mischiefe child remember also whiche euer liued enuy sorow wo fortune ala duryng dayes frowarde assayes touching edippus processe finde none ende made conclusion saue bochas writ howe kyng creon cosen heyre succession exiled chayned farre towne endured mischefe sorow drede tyll attropos vntwyned liues threde ☞ lenuoy tragedy thre thinges ye may se pryde iabin false presumption quene iocasta great aduersitie kyng edippus inclinacion vyces diuision two brother playnly v assure kyngdomes deuided may endure ☞omne regnum se diuisum desolabitur sawe euer kyngdome countrey stande quiete possession ryght peace equitie iust accorde without discention voyde vntruth false collusion▪ plainly declaryng ensample scripture kingdomes deuided may endure seeth example thebe citye noble myghty region frowarde false duplicitie warre brought destruction promise broken couert treason shewed harmes ipossible recure kingdomes deuided may endure prince princess haue soueraintie ouer people domination ifye lyst longe lyue felicitie cherishe subiectes none extorcion aduertise wysdome reason tragedy dothe discure kyngdomes deuided may endure x chapter ☞ atreus kynge messene wrought ayenst brother thiestes slew thre child dismembred piece made thiestes eat flesh drinke bloud bochas poete auctour boke purposyng gather compile diuers story anone penne toke remembryng within little chapitle began direct style write story hye compendious forne duke theseus lorde athens famous great citye right strong myghty euery side backe bochas one se cryed loude bade shold abide bochas quod fro list hide wofull case ne wise spare piteous complaynt declare thiestes besprent wepyng drowned teares thou maiest well se sometyme sonne mighty kyng pelops borne also parde quene hippodamea excellent beautye thou art desirous endite people vnhappy wo write anone thou procede turne thy style take thy penne bliue leaue theseus take hym none hede first tragedy thou discryue suppose thy lyue thou saw neuer thing dolorous vnhappy frowarde ne piteous ala mortall aduenture incomperable sorow surmounting quene iocasta wofull creature edippus fate euer complaynyng complaynt hath none endyng lasteth euer beareth witnes wo resembleth vnto heauines y• worde john bochas styll stode▪ full soberly geue audience place demurely abode hear substaunce mortal offence whiche thus began shewe sentence john quod pray take good hede wo write men may reade ala brother rote vnkyndenes atreus called reason sour well finder treason falsenes fraude doth precell whose couert hate tell supposyng innocence malice disceite none offence brother brother trust trusted hart thought apparence none cause wyst person supposed nought euer culd false thig haue wroght may soner another man deceyue malice men conceyue▪ demed true brother wenyng faythfull ben sawe signe ne knew none suposynge duplicitie wo ala might euer euer story finde bloude vnto bloude vnkynde passe ouer tell worthines touching estate progenitours kynred great noblesse tell nothing nether predecessours ne youth howe passed ben floures leaue vnto mynde call wretchednes fall brother founde false occasion ayenst began cause feyne banish region began hatred disdayne vpon affirmyng certayne kingdome whiche called missene haue lien wyfe quene compassed full falsely malice selfe well knowyng euer founde vnkynde misauise like brother like deadly • encrease great percell wo long processe entencion •••• gined destruction chefe cause false couetise touchyng thing fame yet kyngdome truely deuise haue bē departed betwene v twaine ayenst truth ordayne exyle region selfe alone haue possession yet hart cast wile vndoyng desolation place whence exile vnder shadowe false collusion make mane • reuocation brotherhead shewyng pretence restore ayen presence accepted brother shoulde full accorde styll hym abide miuries whyche afore tolde either party forget set asyde nothing loue deuide one one entencion leade lyfe without deuision wherof people full glad lyght throughout missene mighty region resortyng founde euery wyght ready hart whole affection receyue noble towne none ready sygnes shewyng make chere sothe kyng domage comparison may lykened resemblaunce fayned truth simulation whan fraude hyd wt fayre countenaunce pretendyng truth outward deceyuaunce vndernethe false entent doublenesse dareth serpent vnder flower shrowded dragon betray sodayne vyolence suche folke haue suspection truely meane pure innocence till caught dispurueyed defence fishe bayte false pleasaunce hoke sene brought mischaunce thus semblably home commyng receyued euery circumstaunce lyke halfe heyre brother kynge pretendyng countenaunce inly great pleasaunce repayre truth tolde reioysyng sayed woulde go vnto god obseruaunce accorde humble sacrifice made minister wt faythful attendaunce wayte best wise nedeth tell ne deuise neither wrytyng bokes sor set halfe ioye made whan mette first frendly embrace harty gladnes within armes twaine▪ ioye teares face full entirely gan distyll rayne party could restraine must frendshyp fraternall wepe estate royall wily wolfe cast deuou • sely lambe whiche defence ne none helpe selfe succour feble make resistence whiche demeth truth false apparence wonder fraude conceiued though lambes vnwarely disceiued though rose midsomer full sote yet vnderneth hyd full sharpe spyne freshe floures haue full bitter rote lothsom galle suger vndermine dredful stormes y• sunne amōg doth shyne vnder shadow fayned frendlyheade frendshyp perillous dreade thus remēbryng faythful wordes stable brother shewed vnto metyng kissyng amiable assured couenauntes fraternitie oft time men may beholde se lily growen amōg nettle thicke •• oure delice mids wedes wicke thus rested kynges house nothing aduertyng deadly cruelty old hatred venemous odible destroy selfe auenge toke child thre sikerly wonder cut throtes knife asunder thought good dismember peces small dessell gather bloude say still loked pale dede desert vale within caue man espy treason conspired false tyranny substaunce sacrifice slee childer make hart blede trowe god therof agrise false offrynge whan toke hede membres rost sede vyande abhominable made serued table couert crus also thus stode staūch mi thirst cruel vēgeāce made vnknowe drynke bloud thing goddes displeasaunce yes dare saye demonstraunce vpon dede without obstacle sunne heauen shewed myracle whiche sore agrysed might beholde beames theron cast syght displeasaūce clearenes gan wtholde vengeaunce withdraw lyght day turnyng horrour nyght whan shone bryghtest midday spere shrowded face woulde appere ala vpon case horrible coulde ymagyn ne thynke matter odible eat fleshe bloude also drynke whiche sore dothe mine hart synke may touchyng aduenture circumstaunce constraint discure nedeth make rehearsayle touchynge mine exyle maner thinges diuers sorowes assayle wofull sighes ne greuous wepings ne vpon nightes dolorous wakinges pouert nether stode drede lese life wherof bochas take hede remembre circumstaunces euer thou sawest high low degre contrary vnhappy chauntes thou hast heard remembred wey balaunce sorowes let se sorowe mischefe vnrecured may counterpayse haue endured mine infortunes founde aye fell without fauour succoure dispurueyed brother euer cruell full oft desiered haue died day spirite hath ben conueyed sorow wo deuoyde refuge wherfore pray bochas iuge thy writyng leaue behynde nether thy boke thou disdayne among tho folke thou haue mynd yt sorow wepe wayle playne thus thiestes rehearsyng paine like would selfe piece rende made vnto bochas tale ende xi chapter ¶ atreus excuseth selfe murder brother aduoutry done europa quene atreus came full pale chere enuy full dead vysage vnto bochas gan approche nere like fallen rage furiously abrayde langage may like man wode thiestes hath venym sow abrode like rybaude falsly accused notwithstandyng full clearely se mine infortunes may refused sore ala worke agaynst though thiestes false vntrue vnto bochas face pale agaynst hath forged tale whiche effect shalbe found vntrue haue time complaynt declare purpose tell tale newe fro poynt poynt man spare ground rote care ouer like befall reherce beginnyng sorowes sometime whan raigned missene age lusty flouryng freshenes wife europa quene reuomed time fayrenes thiestes grounde falsenes traytour tyme espye false fraude flattery compassed meane within citye sleighty wyles incomparable corrupt wiues chastitie bedde defoulyng thing intollerable god abhominable vsyng quene fleshely pleasaunce tyll vnto tyme continuaunce sonnes two thre echone brought forth false aduoutry demyng none mine owne child till espye swyne false lechery thiestes europa lay daughter called pelopeia processe forthe chylde brought called egistus whiche whan came age saith bochas much treason wrought malice great outrage destroyed whole lynage tantalus whiche liuyng frygia raygned lorde kyng egistus spake toforne falsely begotten mine auctour sayth ye pelopeia anone borne hyde slaunder also fame thiestes also saue name whan day age cast beastes sauage deuoured story well couthe melche gote god lyst prouide foster tender youthe nyght day liynge syde within forest thus abyde vnto tyme gan growe age court holdeth passage wherfore bochas hart pray whiche story terrible edippus iocasta me▪ tel anone possible whiche sorowes penible thebane brother ful wo tene v twayne brother missene aknowe party vengeaunce cruell dede slough child malyce enuy tosted whan deade onely bicause thou list take hede begate thē rote stryfe vpon europa wife hatefull thinges ech man lothe apparteyneth murder treson thus may saye vnhappy first trespace fornication done quene wythin region slaundred syde hasty vengeaunce homicyde bedde defouled aduoutry god man thing detestable malice false melancholy slough childer serued thē table thus enterchaunging commendable eche desyrous throughe vnhappye chaunce vpon vengeaunce great hatred odious found crueil dedes wrought eyther syde senecke reherceth especiall tragedy dothe deuide complayntes malice pryde fatall ende sorow mischefe fyned whan attropos liues threde vntwyned whan john bochas fully espied two brother accusation maliciously replyed eche agaynst discentions began duly heare mocions put vp pen wrote word fury ne false discorde ¶ lenuoy tragedy sheweth fygure maner ymage also likenes contrary vnto nature bloude vnto bloud shew vnkyndnes wofull story well beare witnes debate ben ye shall fynde hatefull god contrary vnto kynde dreadfull aduenture kynred fynde frowardnes neither domage perilous tendure frēdshyp whan straūgenes maner party example dare expresse se tree debate agaynst rynde god right hateful contrary kynd euery beast euery creature loueth sēblable kynde right gesse whā one truth doth tway hart assure vndeparted perfitenes vycious frowarde cursednes▪ loue vnknytte lose vnbinde hatefull god contrary vnto kynde prince pryncesses busy cure frō auoyd strife fraude doublenes remember vpon vnhappy cure two brethrē wretchednes bothe malicious wilfulnes strife haue well mynde god right hatefull contrary kind ¶ xii chapter ☞ duke thesius ariadne saued life caue like forsworne man forsoke wedded fayre phedra slewe selfe thenes whan floures called nourish philosopher wise princesse poetes expert oratours sūme science clarkes deuise whence cunnyng clearely aryse named grece lanterne light al erth shed bemes bright noble title ben number euery coast renome shyne fame therof clipsed wt none vmber scholes enlumine citye plamely determine vii artes frō one head spring riuers streames cunuyng science called liberall onely fredome fraunchise libertie stocke proued thrall braunch study citye ilke bloude founde free bothe discent liniall high noblesse scholey haue entresse citye sacred mynerue wisdome sapience mercury feastes obserue rethorike eloquence mighty mar gaue influence glad aspectes party amende noble knighthode cleargy defēd toune nobled bi title thinges glorious rekened age succession duke kynges among duke thesius lynage sonne egistus full freshe courage excellyng prudence manhede euer crowne possede citye noblesse defence trust affiaunce gaue expert prowes triumphes great aboundaunce specially renome auaunce made free truage lete ayenst mynos mighty kyng crete force story well couthe franchise region mynotaur slough tender youth afterwarde deuocion acquite selfe like champion therof made solemne sacrifice jupiter humble wise theatre called maraton duke theseus victorye went colchos jason chiefe counsayle made memory processe augment glory hercules brother conucy agaynst amasones went warrey conquered manhode wel sene force noblesse mortall stryfe ipolita quene theseus toke vnto wife brother ieoparded lyfe duke perithous whan vndertake centaures outray sake centaures poetes specifye seruius maketh mencion sumtyme engendred sky whan first father called ixion enamored full many day agone vpon juno fayre gouernesse goddesse ayre ixion secretary fayrenes excellent beauty loued hote albeit contrary desire bochas read ye may se delude writeth selfe transformed y• might could likenes heauenly cloude ixion playnly supposyng selfe euen thus wrought cloude embracyng wtout tatiynge foly goddesse sought wt medlyng forth brought centaures beastes matuelous whiche nature ben founde monstruous halfe mā halfe horse departed thus twain wonderfull discription false malyce selfe ordayne pirithous make enuasion put possession wife called ipodamen rauishe maugry men thē hundred number swift winde course runnyng whiche malyce cast encumber duke pirithous day weddyng rauysh wyfe commyng party defence agaynst power make resistence theseus lyst delay pirithous brother defende first centaures knyghtly outray mortally durst offende conquest hell descende duke pirithoe worthy theseus maugry daunger cruell cerberus rauished mortall tene knyghthode ye list lere despite pluto proserpina quene whiche jupiter daughter dere pirithous founde first manere wilfull force high renoun realmes conquere hold possession writyng sothly duyde playnly telleth duke theseus arested hell must abyde force cruell cerberus pluto hym contrarious tyll pirithous fynde relees case declared vnto hercules whiche knighthode remedy founde helpe frende busy paine first prowes cerberus bounde hell gate wyth treble chayne manhode ordayne duke theseus daunger discharge maugry pluto go large armes brother bothe twayne loued brother bothe warre pee neither coulde vnto frayne life ieopard put thē self prees brother called hercules signify poetes well tell name conquest doth excell olde tyme pereles noble diuers region manhode named hercules noysed famous champion tygres daunt eke boares lyon renoumed among euerychone bechas affirmeth theseus one first sayd knyghtly trauayle whan athens stode deuision among selues warre battayle wisdome discrecion set accord within noble towne exiled stode certeyne knyghthode made thē resort ayen gaue thē lawes wherby thei shold thē gye noble statute founded reason set amonge prudent policy liuyng discention shoulde aryse none occasion among selues hye lowe estate prouidyng euer debate thus began city encrease multiplye waxe famous wisdome richesse sprong well fyrst philosophy first knyghthode rose hye noble theseus bochas beareth wytnes thus thinges two like founde cleargy lawe first abounde set citye quiete made peace region knyghthode manly mete cruell tyrant called creon maugre made restitucion lordes bone thebe slayn ladyes wherof full fayne thus grece renome spradde knyghtly fame began multiply long ioye thus life ladde fortune list magnify aye ioye meynt enuy froward list soiourne theseus began face tourne away fro wexe peruerce froward glory vngoodly gan doubul downe frō whele made go backward good name gan fethers pull whan noblesse highest full meane full felicitye folowed ebbe great aduersitie moreouer frowardly aquite vnhaps rehearsyng one one one first bochas list endite lay crete among fone pryson grece gone repayryng homeward selfe wtdrawe mynotaur whan yslawe first empryse vndertoke whan escaped importable payne mynotaurs like sayth boke wt king daughter twayne malice falsely list disdayne ayenst • ryadne saue death whan lay caue haue ben slaine socour repayre toke therof hede left alone great aduersitye within yle mischefe sorowe drede fayre phedra lede wedded like forsworne man thus wt vntruth mischefe first began phedra quither y• story well know absence bochas writeth thus whan within little throwe loued agaynst kynde sonne ipolitus contrarious woulde assent foule dede shame fled percel also drede father accuse ye toforne haue story sene company refuse went away came neuer agayne ye haue heard slayne within chare vnhappy chaūce phedra vengeaunce slough selfe agaynst womanhede boke tofore tolde thing whan thesius toke hede thought vēgeaunce offēce old quit like beholde ariadne whiche haue wyfe whose succour scaped lyfe infortune vnhappy chaunce noble full contrarious death also vengeaunce sonne called ipolitus sorow duke theseus salt teares sore began playne helde exequies ilke twayne trowe also sore greue duke pirotheus whan sawe deade slayne beast myght releue kig orchus hoūd treble head whose teeth hortible bloud redde whiche infortune gan beholde vnto death felt hart colde reken great wretchednes vnhappy chaunces y• fell lyfe among great distress none mortall full strife whan gaue credence wyfe phedra called whiche intencion compassed vntruely accusation vpon ipolytus hatred enuy woulde great offence assent lechery therfore death felt vyolence father sone gaue credence bochas forbade husbandes lyues without prefe leue sone wyues neither hasty tale leue flaterers chamber ne table forger lesyngs auctor doth wel preue abide wt lordes able maketh chapitle notable wrytyng cause prynces examyne eche party wisdome also discrecion without prefe parciall prynce confusion betwene party found egall caused many one haue fall▪ god suffreth longe contune withdraw grace hindreth fortūe thus theseus hastines happe grace discreased day day fame appalled worthines frowarde fortune also wayte lay defautes hinder may cast woulde noble disauaunce kyngdome disobeysaunce wtdrawe honour reuerence full frowardlye region athens cruell vyolence fyll agaynst rebellion fayne flye towne thus hath fortune darked bryghtnes noble cast hym distresse thus ende great contrarioustie theseus hys dayes glade whan freshe floure olde felicitie fortune aduerse made fade eche thyng must bowe whan ouerlade worshyp honour whan brightest shine wt vnware chaunges rathest declyne ☞ lenuoy vnsure gladnes ioye transitory vnstable surenes transmutatiōs clowdy brightnes false eclipsed glory earthly prynces whiche haue possession monarchy dominacions sodayne chaunge declareth v swete suger meynt bitter gall blynde goddesse consistory pleasaunce medleth discentions triumphes conquest victory reueth kynges scepter crown troubleth people false rebellion se duke whele fall al worldly suger meynt bytter gall tragedy maketh memory duke twayne hye renounes loue write great history conquered diuers region gouerned city countreyes also townes tyll fortune prowes appall shew suger meint wt bitter gal prynces pryncesses se deceptory ben worldly reuolutions fortune reclinatory treacle tempreth false poysons marueilous ben confection frowardnes wyll befall euer suger custome temper gall ¶ xiii chapter ¶ bochas writeth agaynste geueth hastye credence lyers flatterer chapter bochas sentence repreueth blameth onely prince lyghtly geueth credēce euery tale fable whiche reported vnto sothfastnesse list nothing due proue truth false true though euery maner age folkes ben diuers condicions turne plye chaunge courage outher party sodayne mocions bowe transmutation euery wynde vnstable leaues hang tree forestes greues al chaūges y• chaunge drede fearfull variaunce whā prince whych may people lede ben founde vnstable gouernaunce noble hye puissaunce assureth maner forme euer thē list accomplyshe performe cōmen profite may aueyle whan ben ruled wisdome reason people may disaueyle whan lacke wytte discrecion thus betwene twayne euery region people draweth discerne good badde prynces gouerne may hasty ne sodayne thyng good aduisement kepe thē fro tonges yt parted twayne hasty geue iudgement folkes whan ben absent lieue tales▪ neither geue credence tyll party may come euidence sumtime hath happed slowe credence hath founde full noyons hasty credence dare say sentence thousande folde perillous vnaduised haste odious haste full oft lacke reason muche people hath ben destruction domage men purpose dradde lamentable prynce eares vnclose euery tale euery fable token harte stable whan flatterer eares apply namely suche well forge lye folke ben diuers false true diuers study done busines study finde tale newe lucre maintayne falsenes holde vp quarels ayenst ryght wisenes pretendyng truth vnder false entent hinder folkes whiche ben innocent men suppose great folye folkes shoulde opinion speake pronounce one party holde one way intencion semblably diuision courage hye lowe degre truly great diuersitie rehearsall report thing party eche man fauourable man say well al rehearsyng man double disceauable men say true variable wherfore prynce ryght doth seme well examen deme none dreadfull pestilence tonge flatter fage wyth cursed crabbed vyrulence enfecteth folke euery age wo tonges froward langage wo tonges false furious wode person neuer say good bochas rehearseth right well sittyng euery man commende say best alway reportyng well saiyng man may offende men say well god grace send men mē must praise vpraise like merites alowe disprayse thing vtterly vnknowe let man hasty sentence ryghtfull iudges sittyng rowe wisdome hye prudence trouth haue first euidence meane gouerned grace dome forthe lippes pace prynce assemble thinges twayne within selfe full prudently shut vp dome betwene locke twayne one soule reason party prudence chosen right body betwene bothe geue sentence counsayle call truth good conscience first consider wyth euery circumstaunce diligently theron laboure discrecion take balaunce first wey accusour whether falsenes fauoure processe list procede hereof prynce must ryght take hede must also consider accused whether accusour frend enemy whether shalbe accept refused actes must afore mused whether report name man well noysed slaundred diffame thesius thus ben auysed considered reason manere hastely deuised sonnes death like ye shall leare assembled fere person prudence reason shoulde haue sene descrecion knowlegyng long experience wyfe great vnstedfastnes false compassed eloquence ready euer bryng folke distresse writyng bochas beareth witnes nature woman flatter fage sumtyme copious langage also wisdome duke thesius haue considred afore entent sonne called jpolytus vnclennes founde euer innocent custome made went forestes durynge yonge age hunt beastes sauage rennyng fote ye shall vnderstande hilles valeys eschue idlenes mother vice bow hand diana serue huntyng chefe goddesse sumtime hauke busines also vnto fishyng greatly applyed youth neuer vnoccupied thus liued woodes solitary venus dispised seruice among woman would neuer tary felowshyp alway despise demed sentence wise toucheth pytche saye men may se fayleth shall defouled jpolitus sawe wel thing kept large contagiositie grene youth would haue lore defouled lacke chastitie liued euer virginitie neuer bochas vary nothing vnto god contrary thus entent kept body clene duryng life thought dede whose mother jpolita quene amasones ouide ye may rede wo ala theseus toke hede tale phedra full gyle without gilte sonne exyle whose death poetes sayne howe dyana chastitie restored vnto life agayne esculapius gaue lybertye forestes hunt go fre whiche restoryng write ouidius twyse man men call hym virbius bochas doth mene maketh boke exclamation agaynst woman pity sene sayth life generation ben nature double condicion calleth also diuers vnstable beastes resemblyng ben insaciable meaneth woman borne crete nothyng y• dwell coūtrey woman doublenes lete haue tatche mutabilitie loue chaunges ne duplicitie husbandes cause small great whatsoeuer say coūterplete blessed god hath made meke humble fearfull condicions though men would cause matter seke pacience finde occasion haue refused contradiction thē submitted gouernaūce onely mekenes womanly suffraunce speake one speke euerychone ben professed vnto lowlines thei mai haue mouthes lāgage haue thei none true husbandes beare hereof witnesse wedded men dare full well expresse haue assayed experience best recorde wifely pacience longeth men sturdy sumwhat frowarde nature right woman suffer paciently wronges womanly endure men shoulde attempt maner creature namely woman mekenes preue may wel suffer man greue euery thing resorteth kynde bochas writeth sumtyme yere sercheth processe shall fynde truth vertue may neuer fade rightwisenes alway shyne clere truth falsnes haue done may assemble one persone feare flattery ben contrary may together hold long soiour neither simplesse whiche vary may neuer accorde baratour neyther innorence lesyngour neither chastite selfe apply conforme vnto rybaudry eche thing hath proper disposition ordinaunce set courage ech man foloweth condicion stocke frute hath tarrage pilgrymes may go full farre passage dare say farre euer go beare tarrage y• came fro bochas maketh introduction chapiter hygh noblesse prynces haue possession maner laughyng doth expresse toset great sykernesse haue seruauntes vpon abidynge men armes day nyght awaytyng man may enter haue lycence froward porter standyng gate put men abacke sturdy vyolence full harde agaynst debate watch kept early also late assure nyghtes whan slepe chāberlains dores straightly kepe men assigned meates assay taste wynes lest treason mortall drede lordes affray surenes meynt suspection feadeth glaoly feareth poyson▪ pore folke franchised dreade god doth sende wt myrthe fede poetes write tragedy complàynyng hye estate rehearsyng euer piteous ieopardyes sodayne chaūges wofull fate deuisyons mortall debate euer cōclude dities canrede high estate stande aye drede ground rote mortall trouble bochas writeth beareth witnes ben lyers tonges double selfe aye forsyng truth oppresse flattery chiefe maistresse worst dreadfull sentence whan prynces hasty credence hasty credence roote erroure froward stepmother good counsayle ground great hindring dredefull disceyuour fayre face perillous tayle gladly concluding wt ful great disauayle next neighbour vnto repentaunce trust haue pleasaunce ¶ lenuoy prynces price cōsider euery age folkes ben diuers condicion ply turne chaunge courage yet none mine opinion dreadfull chaunge ne transmutation chaunge prynces geue iugement hasty credence without auisement well founde passyng great domage knowen expert euery region though tale haue fayre vysage may enclude full great deception hide vnder suger ga • e fell poyson freshe face double entendem cut yet geue credence without auisement let folkes beware laugage kepe tonges oblocution hynder hurte maner outrage preserue lyppes detraction champarty contradiction lest fraude found entent ne geue credence without auisement prynces princess noble high parage whiche haue lordshyp nination voyde asyde flatter fage fro tonges haue terrage • reason stoppe eares bitter soun circumspect hastye prudent geue credence without auisement ¶ xiiii chapter ¶ quene althea hercules woman brought confusion whā bochas shewed sētence declared opinion thē y• wer hasty credēce begā anone make digression fro matter entencion serche mo purpose contune downe cast hyndred fortune thought sawe company many worthy whiche appeare among first espye quene althea gan nygh nere wept face also chere salt teares pitye sene whiche time cale • dony quene daughter kynge thestius wedded oene calsidony kynge cheare face appearing full piteous heere torne frowardly liyng token also complaynynge writeth bochas wherof toke hede blacke habite torne wede sonne melliager hyght earth none fayrer se ryght wel fauoured euery man syght fynde natiuite present fatal susters thre rockes began spyn fast toke brond fyre cast hour langage touchynge thys chylde full accorded haue disposed also terme age space concluded destyne long tyme lyst se tyll thys brond among cole reed ful consumed ash dead whan althea espied entent conceyued fyne sentence rose vp brond hent fyre wyth ful great diligence quenched anone fyres violence dome parche gan thus disobey brond reseruinge vnder locke key touchyng father melliager oeneus hym thus rede howe sought nighe ferre goddes goddess whose lyst take hede hope onely haue great mede al poetes thus deuyse saue diana dyd sacrifyce wherof caught indignacion cast woulde hym auenged sent boore region full sauage full cruelte deuoured frute many tree distroyed cornes vynes scarsnesse vitayles wynes land vpon euery syde people necessite compelled among prouyde meane way saue countre last condiscended melliager lusty corage shoulde chose wt folkes fresh yonge age dredeful boore mightely enchace forth went echon deuoyde drede round speres gan manace melliager made fyrst sydes blede wyth swerde smote hede wherof countre glad fayne wyse tuskye bore slaine bokes tell huntyng lady whych borne irge called athalanta doughter kyng slee boore toke charge wyth arowe made woūdes large also ouide lyke founde gaue fyrst wounde melliager anone memorye owne chosen knight gaue heed token victory two vncles ayenst al skyl tyghte raft head force myght hauyng dispite auyse victory shoulde beare away price iniury melliager wroth agaynst proudly gan disdayne pulled swerde vpon thē goeth throughe hys manhode slewe vncles twaine yt dyd busy payne take heed wyth humble entent athalanta agayne present one vncles called flexippus manly knyght yonge age brother named theseus whan suster herde outrage howe slayne gan visage wexe deed pale ala bloud whan espyed cause howe stode matter god wote fayne quene althea stand beholde bretherne twayne son slayne huntyng whych tofore tolde fyrst thynges twayne gan peise vnfold bretherne loue nigh kynted sonne hasty cruel dede remembring casteth balaunce hertely wo dyd endure thought dyd vpō deth vengeaūce slee son ayenst nature thus warre longe tyme dyd endure deedly sorowe peysyng euery dell wheder shalbe tender eruel thus tender meane son spare punishe dethe brether twayne thus confortlesse al destitute bare languishing endured forthe payne temedy none ordayne saue faine would auenge may came forth nature sayd nay sonne agaynst kyndly ryghte cast auenged woman al vgly straunge syghte mother deuoyde pitie shoulde slee childe merciles parde naye nature wyl assent dyd full sore repent ala al fatal purueyance kepeth course clerkes sayne wrytyng doctours substaunce diuynes reply agayne affirme opinion vayne trust fate desteny god aboue hath soueraintie fortune power may restrayne saue spyl lyke folke deserue ayenst wyl may nothynge ordayne necessite course conserue matter al holy reserue vnto diuines determyne conclude whych nat partayneth vnto folkes rude althea calcidony quene began sore muse henge balaunce bretherne deed whan dyd sene meued anon vengean̄ce vpon son ful great displeasance poetes lyst compile nature made wtdrawe hand thus betwene yre affection helde long euery partie stable tyll caught opinion soden rancor made vengeable hasty worth cōmendable ayenst son made hande chest take fatall brande • nd sodaynly cast fyre wexed cruell agaynst womanhede execute venomous desyre fatall bronde among cole rede consumed ash dede furiously melancoly vengeaunce done thus gan cry ye parce froward susters three joue kepe library child natiuite awayte sentence whych may vary wherso wylful contrary vpon dome alwaye takyng hede ye shall dispose fatal threde thou cloto takest thy rocke hand lachesis doth begyn great auise vnderstande threde length drawe spyn whan spirite shal frō bodye twin thou atropos doest thy busy payne ful frowardly parte thred twayne may wel playne perdicion day wo ala euer ye haue vntwyned made deuision two bretherne caused thē disceuer lyue shal se neuer haste ala dyd tauenge deth haue slayn son also ye doughters cerberus fell whose vgly moder blacke nyght al kyndred linage lyue hell auēge wrong great vuryght haue accomplished syght wyl wyth perpetually complayne like desert tendure sorow payne whyle gan wt selfe thus stryue vpon sorowes endlesse made swerde hert riue selfe recheles bochas among al prese sawe hym thoughte wyth full hidious chere deed visage hercules appere whose father jupiter greate mother doughter amphitrion called alcumena sumtyme borne crete poetes reherce one one excellent neuer none speke conquest victory fame thys world great name dredful loke ryght terible berde also blacke hing lowe doun al heer bristle horible hys robe also ful maruaylous facion skynne fierce lyon whych backe force rent within forest lone whan went hand bare mase stele whych beholde wonder long huge apparence bochas felte wele demed reason ryghtful iuge hercules refuge wysedome wt force encrease fame beastes wylde make tame vnto bochas gan loude crye take right good hede fable merites speake chiualry noble triumphes cōmendable preferred worthy able haue accomplished al may excel hyghe prowes yt tong tel also byrth heuyn ful yore ago fully conceyued constellacion myghty jupiter sayd vnto juno day region one shalbe borne myghty renoun noblest noble warre pee name shalbe hercules whych dome whan juno vnderstode jupiter conceyuing entent knewe fate good lucina messanger sent saythe howe selfe downe went thys goddesse goddesse childing besought graunt askynge would hercules translate influence natiuyte helpe rescue name hys fate graunt holy yonge euristee lucina present would hour jupiter prouyded possede hole vndeuided thus mother euristee juno goddes graunted fauour therby disposyng mighty puissaunce lyke emperour noble conquest labour manhode prowes pursute hercules fully execute hercules trauayle euristeus bare away name also hercules fought plate mayle highe emprises proudly dyde attame report hys noble fame euristeus fully ascriued thus thanke hercules depriued full oft armes man doth wele oft causeth felde another dyd neuer dele price spredeth lyke shineth y• son oft happeneth hath best ron doth spere like desert possede false fauor giueth euery mā mede fame palice hath trūpes mo one golde geueth freshe soun man hath laude deserueth none haue ful worthy renoun nothinge preferred commendacion report state hye lowe frowardly fame trumpe hath blowe touchyng armes pore ne riche hertes echone corragious neither al men may yliche neyther theyr name egal ne gracious though pore haue bene victorious auenture full wel daye haue pinched take thāke away sleeth dere wyth hoked arowe whose part none yet venison one beteth y• bush another hath y• sparow byrdes possession one draweth nettes riuers vp doun sondry baytes cast lyne hoke hath parte al euer toke euidence hereof ye may se ful notable put memorye hercules euriste hercules gate aye victory euristeus receiued hath glorye thus palme departed twayne one reioysed bare ye payne euristeus prince athene sonne heire dyscent lyne vnto kyng called stellene vnder whose myght bochas dothe determine hercules knightly disciplyne proued manly wyse al bare away prise wo ala euer fall manly knyght worthy notable spotte price appall cause hys corage vnstable thinge doleful lamentable knighthode thinge straunge euer woman hert chaunge wyll excuse nature chaunge hertes corrages agaynst nature force maye endure flatery sugred fayre langages lyke siren full freshe visage chaunge prince noblesse mo hercules bere hereof witnesse thus hercules astonied ashamed vnto bochas shewed presence said ala knighthode diffamed full false amorous pestilence sore constrayned mortal vtolence whereby ala manhode applied sleye woman oppressed maistried take habit cloth wede shere berde farce vysage oyntmentes al manhede make souple chaunge langage complayne myne outrage vpon fyngers fyue twyse tolde ringes richely wrought golde thus corage chaunged femynine loue one called iolee condicions though serpentyne thought fayrest vnto se ioye wyth none aperceiue trespace chaunged habite loke face woman outwarde apparence entent haue liberte vse lustes haue experience appetite vnlefull wherof sclaundre reboundeth vpon dare say outragious trespace doth al knyghthode prowes difface wherof bochas pray take good hede discriue termes playne clere mine infortune lyke dede whan conceyue manere myne vnhappes contagious may example paine vicious life hertes restraine folles al wysdome dispise contrary bertuous discipline may gyue example folkes ben wise ben lanterne doctrine vyces eschewe prudently declyne fro fleshely lustes taught scholes wysemē al day ben ytaught foles whan bochas conceyued pleynt hercules appering noble woman ataint disordinate liuing thought anone hym remembringe ruthe put mynde hys vires vertues left behinde considered also impartinent eyther lāgage write ayenst al ryght thing sentment fame amenuse noble knyght discrese man syght hys glorious prowes sith poetes hys werres reise renome highe aboue sterres knyght philosopher strength called giant commen profit gan promptly profer manly corage gyue thereto full graunt entre egipt slee giaunt called busyris ful false entēt slewe al straūgers kingdū wēt vnder colour liberalite vnto palys gladly would cal straūgers echone y• came cūtre solemly receyue thē one al lyke kynge chambre hal make chere maner thynge apperteyned worthy kyng whyle gestes lay nyght slepe false tirant ful cruel wyse murdred ethone toke kepe thys also gise bloud make sacrifice jupiter god countre hole entent please deite kyngdome frutes grayne land encresed great habundaunce doun heuin would send thē rayne meane made cheuisaunce murdre slee great plesaūce al thing thought good murdre gestes shede blod whā murdre busiris couth strāgers myght passe lād pee manly knyght yet flowryng youthe thys noble famous thys worthy hercules among put hym selfe prees lyke gest outwarde shewyng came palys busiris kyng rebuked hym great outrage done hys gestes cruel violence make pesible passage auenge y• importable offence murdre make recompence thys hercules slewe busiris dede toke bloud whych dyd blede offred vp jupiter please thys victory hym magnifye al egipt thus set ease landes frutes gan also multiply theyr grayne encresed eche partye habounde influence rayne whych afore time vitayle barayne another giaunt called antheus kyng libye gouerned al land hercules strong coragious sūtime outraid slewe hym hand wrastled experience fand touching erth giant trewe force myght dyd alway renewe whan hercules maner dyd espye howe strength renewed agayne ofte theragaynst shope remedy hye ayre peysed hym vp lofte stroke harde nothynge softe backe bone sore embrace fyll deed tofore hym place bokes thys giant tell within kyngdome dyd assaile would newe chiualry compel efte agayne mete hym battayle wyse full selde dyd fayle aforce newe ye shal vnderstand strength myght enemis wt stād hercules hye discrecion felde manly recure hym sleyght hys region met auenture sayd anthens might endure disconfited hercules anone maugre myght men echone conquest hercules gone exercise prowes vse agaynst myghty stronge gereon kyng spayne melleager ebuse whych tiraunt myght hym excuse labour poetes lyst compyle realmes people exile hys tiranny myght long endure hercules noble worthy knyght made vpon hym great disconfiture slough tyraunt met fyghte great myght highe prowes magnanimyte sloughe cerberus heades thre famous bull lande crete whych distroyed region sloughe also whan dyd mete nemea slough feirse lyon recorde hys high renoun manly force skyn away toke body cote thereof shope enemis shewe hym dredeful therfore ware hidious garment armes neuer founde dul ylike freshe euer entent mountaine anone made hys went called erimanthus passage slewe boar wylde sauage besyde ryuer called styphalus furious byrdes slewe great nombre within kyngdome kyng pheneus countre dyd encombre wyth shadowe cōtagious vmbre sede frutes euer alight al deuoured euery mannes sight vpon mountayne called auentyne far rome citye wode cronicles determyne right freshe light goodly se hercules passyng countre fro spaynward passyng itayle cachus giant dyd hym assaile hercules among leues grene layde slepe sodayne auenture beastes sonne shyne slepte went pasture came cachus forth ful hidious stature thought would beastes wt haue stale echone hyd thē caue lyke thefe made go backward man y• trace know neyther passage haue regarde tailes ledde rowe caue stode full lowe excellent fayrnes kepe close businesse slepe whan hercules awoke parceyued ox away rose vp cast loke began aspye hast may partie trace lay stode thus musyng shade herd lowyng ox made lowing gan anone aproche toward parte wher kept close fonde caue vnder myghty roche proud cachus thē depose agaynst hercules sturdely arose al myghte hym selfe saue hym sloughe thentring caue thus beastes hath ayen recured sempte afore inrecuperable mountaine byforce hath assured brigātes afore full doutable knyghthod made habitable men myght drede foe whan euer would frely come go touchyng conquest vpon feminye agaynst amasones theseus went quene ipolyta chiualry praye anone hym hent ipolita ful true entent gaue vnto hym token victory girdel golde haue memorie affrike went full great pace onely purpose gardin se apperteyned kynge athlas brother kynge promothee astrology full wel expert gardyn whych haue tolde riche braūches apple gold magike made great auisement ful streyte kepte closed enuyron watched fell serpent man entred ryche mancion hercules mighty renoun serpēt slough māly pursute fro gradeyn bare away frute said athlas bokes specifie poetes also endite connynge astronomy therin ful greatly delite many boke made dyd write great labour great diligence hys time vpon science precious golde rich opinion hercules soth tolde gate bokes hys hie renoun bare force region grece lyke conquerour brought thē great treasour trace slough giant outragious sumtime called diomede murdred al came house fleshe horse dyd fede witte labour manhede achelous whych great wondre made stremes departe sondre wisdome dyd thē deuide two party disceueringe passage afore man myght abyde course furious fel outrage countreis dyd great domage turning vpward non bote euer flowed tree crop rote great emprise also vndertake whan messe hidious horible ariued vp archadies lake called lerne beastes ful odible teeth mouthes terrible frute grayne corne dyd mortally deuour hercules countre sucour came lyke knyght malice let prudence destroyed thē euerichon lake wormes vp shet saue among behind left one hercules anone knighthod raught great auauntage coūtre dyd domage thus euer may rehersed • e touching knighthode prowes prudence glorious fame long felicitie knyghtly man excellence armes longest experience triumphes actes marciall set vp pillers memoriall whiche remembred cōquest notable dedes grauyng expresse beyonde whiche lande habitable farre abrode spred noblesse sunne leaueth bryghtnes sumtime whan fresshest hys sphere vnware cloudes sodaynly appere semblably noble glory hercules vnstable lyfe eclipsed shadowed memory dianyra sumtyme wyfe fraude came mortall stryfe ye shal heare maner caas wherby lost lyfe ala yet sake manly man fought fynde singuler battayle acheloes sonne occian lyke poetes make rehearsayle eche proudly assayle hercules knyghthode souerayne sent head one horne twain kyng oene daughter dere hercules ioyned mariage came great riuere sturdy waues passage nessus gyaunt vgly vysage hercules profered seruyce full falsely gan deuyse made promise hercules dede put life great aduenture ouer streme dianyra l • de large stature ryght fayre creature whan passed came londe nessus falsely woulde vpon str • nd haue know fleshly like write ouide hercules hauyng therof syght abode vpon otherside auenge great vnright • ake howe • ent • one ryght▪ wyth arrowe fyled sharpe groūd gaue nessus deadly fatall •• unde like condyte gusshed bloude whan sawe must dye dianyra stode hart gan pray one thing lust would obey take shert retcheles bloud distayned sende hercules reconsiled anone shert hath sent whose venim ala begiled touching enchauntment fleshe bone brent among deadly paynes rage sodaynly fall beast furiously ranne valeys hylles among craggy stone semblably doth woodeman pulled vp tree rote one brake beast horne al gnew bone pitie knyght good shold amōg bestes runne sauage woode thus ouerwhelmed worthines de • iyne went prosperitie cause roote al wretchednes set felicitie trust much mutabilitie woman whyche early soone nature brayed vpon moone ala ala noble prudence prowes nature force chyualry forsyght wisdome discrecion science vertuous study profityng cleargy clere shynyng philosophy hath false lustes manaced sleyght woman darked defaced hercules fele penne quake mine ynke full filled bitter teares salt piteons tragedy write thy sake poetes glorifye exalt fraude woman made thy renome halt froward mus thy triūphes • end discryue ala thy fatal ende ¶ lenuoy sole 〈…〉 sauory p • yso • dredful • ioy • dolorous pleasaūce 〈…〉 furious 〈◊〉 fayth dispay •• 〈…〉 ▪ vertue exilyng lust hath gouernaūce false luxury diffasen noble tragedy beare full well witnes froward venus hath domination blinde cupide subiects doth auaunce wilfull lust indiscrecion chosen iudge holde balaunce choyse vnlefull hath yll chaūce derked prynces famous noble tragedy beareth full well witnes thou hercules thy high renoun thy conquest knyghtly suffisaunce thou woman brought confusion fraude thy renoumed puissaūce disclaundred brought mischaunce ashamed write expresse except tragedy beare well witnesse prynces princess high discretion thing imprinte remembraunce others fallyng make protection preserue prudent purueiaūce afore prouided perseueraunce perturbed false sorceresse tragedy bereth witnesse ¶ xv chapter ☞ processe narcissus byblis myrra infortunes bochas complaynyng narcissus byblis myrra thre tofore bochas pyteously appeare infortunes infelicitie complaynyng deadly cheare commyng tell manere narcissus sorow dole attaynt began first declare complaynt sonne cephisus flode mother called lyriope discent borne gentle blode creature fayrest se finde natiuitie tyresias spirite prophecy touchyng fate thus gan specify goddes haue prouided space lyue earth long endure tyll knowe se owne face sake full many seruitu • e ordinaunce god nature whan se shall fele full great payne loue grace may attayne shalbe contrary daungerous port full straungenesse hart right inly surquidous occasion natife fayrenes presumyng semelinesse woman freshe ne fayre face able stand grace excellence great beantye purposed tender age neuer lyfe wedded thought selfe fayre vysage whych cast great outrage agaynst lustes loue disdayne hunt beastes alone slayne whyle kept hym forest wyldernes water goddesse called ecco loued full hote fairenes sikerly busines folow steppe ryght lyne desyres make enclyne heard wele sawe nought wherof astonied anone gan enquere amarueyled thought sayd euen thus wyght aunswered manere euer sayd longeth ecco without abode sayd hym come nere quod began call come nere quod ioy pleasaūce loked among rockes sawe nothyng beside ne distaunce abrayed declared greuaunce sayd mine owne hart dere ne straunge let v dwell fere nay nay quod nothing obey desire short conclusion well leuer playnly dey ye haue possession nothing one opinion well though fygure se go forth way ye speake wt ashamed fled way anone myght socour haue dispayred ecco forthe gone hidde selfe vgly caue among rockes buried graue though yt men voyce may heare time neuer durst appeare thus narcissus daunger disdeine vpon lady cruell vengeaunce whan goddes cruelty sei • e towardes fyll great greuaunce vnmercy displeasaunce right merciles founde wt vnmercy caught deadly wound daunger displeaseth venus disdayne lothsome cupide loue contrarious god loue quite syde dreadfull arrowes mortally deuyde hurt mayme retchlesse seruyce founde mercilesse narcissus merciable towarde ecco great beautye port founde vntretable cupyde thought woulde auenged prayer hearde pitie causyng narcissus fele haue part venus brande fiery darte day whan wildernes beastes runne huntyng longe labour fall werines desirous haue refreshyng wonder thurstlewe traueylyng myght endure lenger dwell last founde cristall well right freshe springyng wonder agreable water lusty delectable sight thirst importable vpon brynkes fell downe ryght reflection middes ye water bright thought sawe passyng faire ymage hym appeare angelyke vysage enamoured semelinesse desierous therof stand grace yet lykelinesse shadowe reflectyng face whiche feruence amorously tembrace narcissus piteous complaynt start well selfe dreynt thus beauty ala layed lowe semelines put full farre abacke thus whan gan fyrst selfe knowe sene vysage whiche lacke presumptuous pryde caused wracke much doth selfe presume owne vsurpyng wyll sonest cōsume finally olde poetes tell narcissus without succour drowned well heuenly goddes fauour turned full freshe floure water lilly whiche dothe remedy hote access bokes specify narcissus well dreynt john bochas declared wo biblis appeared teares spreint toward great pase gan go brother camnus came also one wombe gemelles twayne tofore fate gan complayne loue vertuous ayenst god kyndes ordinaunce loued brother named camnus whan sawe froward gouernaūce vnto gaue none attendaunce though sleyght accōplysh entēt secrete wise pistle sent sayd impossible thing without grace selfe saue assentyng el playnly may health haue onely death afterwarde graue thus writyng attame couert ne wrote name whan pistle came presence vertuously therat gan disdayne gaue therto maner aduertence neither toke hede furious payne suffred eternally playne tyll ouid wel tell oft wepyng transformed well next came myrra wyth face full piteous whiche sumtime loued ayenst nature owne father called cynarus whose sake great payne endure • e durst sorowe discure tyll noryshe sygnes dyd espy hartily constraynt malady nourice whiche haue tolde conceiued hath open euidence knoweth newe olde suche matter hole experience long labour great diligēce diuers wayes meanes sought father bed myrra brought lust pleasaunce vnknow lay nyght deceaued dronklewe ignoraunce morow longe lyght stale away went sight noryce whiche kept long close till vnto tyme wombe arose father cypre king tolde called cynarus whan truthe espyed thing daughter deceiued thus waxt loth odious fledde sight sore aferde pursued swerde araby hote mighty lande kyng cynarus hath daughter founde cruelly began enhaunce hande sworde geue wounde goddes mercy habound hath fro death made go fre power trāformed tree beareth yet name called myrra life whiche aucthours say distilleth gome great preseruatife nature full good defensife kepe body putrifaction franchise corruption influence sunne beames myrre engendred distyllyng kind round dropes ayenst phebus streames doun discendeth hard rinde riftes also finde sayd myrra hath childe forth brought worlde sought none faire formed nature beauty pereles poetes recorde scripture called fayre adonydes worshyp great encrees fairenes bare away floure venus chase paramour whiche goddesse gaue charge tender age forestes went large hunt beastes whiche sauage contrary disauauntage wilfulnesse say slayne vnwarely tuskye boare whiche felly enchace folly vayne laboure lay slayne full pale chere face venus turned full freshe stoure whiche bloude purple coloure budde golde wt goodlye leaues glade set y• middes whose beauty may fade whan myrra frō bochas wtdraw declared great aduersitie fate tolde mortall lawe came orpheus full vgly vnto se sonne appollo calyope appeared full dolefull face sumtime brought forthe yborne trace full renoumed armes science famous musike melody full notable also eloquence soote sugred armony beastes foules poetes specify wodes floudes course strong stynte course harken sote song harpe mercurius whiche erudice wanne bachus write ouidius sacrifice solemnely began vnto hell wife ran recure sote touch sharpe whiche made vpon heauenly harpe whan labour toke lawe made boūd • backeward cast loke shold lese se neuermore sayd sythen gone full yore may lawe louers well constrayne importable deadly payne husband stand caas haue lost wiues loke sodayne • hey would haue suffred sayd ala • ut paciently endured payne • nd thanked god y• broken chayne • hich hath long pryson bounde • hat grace way founde • olye pryson ful great charge • nd stocked vnder key locke • meryer man go large • han yrons nailed blocke▪ bonde called wedlocke • ettryng husbandes sore wonder • hich file may broke asunder orpheus father hermony thought erudice y• wife fayre sake felt must dye whan made repayre trouth nothing embraced ayre thus lost sayne cōstraynt greuous payne hart partyng sate sore grene memory tender remembraūce would neuer wine fayre escaped penaunce wedlocke life muche pleasaunce hath one infarnall paynes sene neuer come snare wene orpheus gaue counsaile full notable husbandes haue endured payne ben prudent tretable one hel dredful dredful twain one bounde chayne may escape daunger blyue eft resort god let neuer thriue vpon sentence woman vengeable writyng full contrarious sayd counsaile commendable feast halowed bachus fill echone vpon orpheus rethoryke swete slough ala laureate poete harpe ye lyst heare god appollo made translation among ymages starres cleare wherof men may haue cleare inspection fortune confusion denyed frowarde nature whan slayne fredome sepulture next orpheus appeare also amasons worthy quenes twayne merpesia sister lampedo whiche conquest busy payne great worshyp armes attayne namyng selues writing nere farre doughters mar god warre merpesia rode region conquered full many great citye couetise great possession encrease lordshyp would sister kept surely countrye enemy doubt merpesia rode host conquest famous▪ enemy proudly assayle fortune anone wart contrarious caused slaine battayle lo conquest victory may auayle whan fortune doth disdayn se ensample quenes twayne ☞ lenuoy tragedy remembreth thynges fyue narcissus excellent beauty biblis dothe also discriue great luxury dishonestye myrra diffamed turned tree exemplify lechery pride ben vertue set full farre aside orpheus endured liue joye entermedled wyth aduersitye youth whan wyue felt wedlocke full great felicitie worldly blisse meynt duplicitie fortune chaunges deuyde whiche vertue set full farre aside merpesia list stryue wyth wylfull warres encrease coūtre pompe ouerturned blyue whan battayle vnwarely slayne shet warre death fyne pardee furious mar folke prouide whiche vertue ben set farre aside ye mighty prince let witte reason dryue high noble consider se fortune estate depryue plonge thē downe prosperitie pride luxury counsayle flye falce auarice ne let gyde whiche vertue clene set asyde ¶ xvi chapter ¶ priamus kyng troye monke bury translatoure boke wrote boke siege troy called troy boke complayntes lamētacions bochas boke cōpile medled among transmutation set ouide full souerayne style whan mused long sene maner forowe ioye began remēber priamus troy first byrthe kynrede among kinges famous poetes recorde dede descended worthye dardanus whiche line declareth vnto u jupiter lynially come downe vnto father called laomedoun olde troy laomedon kyng destroyed grekes countrye priamus raynyng made ayen myghty strong citye full longe full great royaltie wife childer worthy renoun scepter crowne held possessioun gouerned citye peace rightwisnes fortune fauourable asie treasour rich assemble kyng honourable armes commendable worlde far mē gone high noble ronoume shone priamus child many one worthy prince full great myght hector among euerychone called prowes lanterne lyght neuer borne better knyght troylus knyghthode manly foūd named hector seconde rehearse manhede kyng pryam sonnes citye besieged dede story remembraunce call betwene grekes befall circumstaunces rehearsyng vp doun set order first occasion siege first layed hercules also iason maner whole troye boke sayde rudely endited translation folowyng vpon destruction called second whych accomptes cler • fully endured space ten yere semeth labour vayne truely also entent write newe agayne commaundement noble excellent kynges vndertake translate write sake ye list wete meane henry fifte myghty puyssaunce gaue charge entent full cleane thinge olde time put remembraunce▪ henry knyghtly suffisaunce worthy manhode teken kynges nyne worthy haue stall holy churche chefe defensoure suche cause christes chosen knyght destroy heritykes set laboure loued vertues sustayne right noble manhode might diligent busy payne haue set peace betwene realmes twayne meane sothe england fraunce purpose haue peace finall sought meanes wt many circumstan̄ce well treaty actes marciall theron ieoparded lyfe goodes wo ala agaynst death boone land may say dyed soone among kinges one best dedes conueyed grace pray god geue soule good rest wyth sayntes heauen dwellyng place v little space abode remembraunce shall neuer dye england ne fraunce worthy kyng gaue charge englysh tonge make translation latyn within volume large howe longe grekes lay tofore toun paris fyrst cytheron venus temple sleighly dyd payne rauysh fayre quene heleyne boke processe ye may se hym wedded toune siege layde vnto cyte menelay kyng agamennon many another full worthy renoun eyther partie battaile fro day day ech dyd assayle wherto shuld tell shuld write deth hector achylles wherto newe endite worthy troilus slaine y• prese ende paris pallamides slaughter manly deyphebus howe brother called hellenus tolde afore howe great folly paris wed quene heleyne cassandra prophecy wedding fore began compleyne constreint hertely paine wexe madde ran toune tyl caught shet vp prison al matter ye may behold dede set wythin troye boke creseide loued dyomede whan worthy troylus wilfully forsoke nature quarel thus toke assay nede also feyne take thirde leue thē tweyne passe ouer tel ne meanes grekes wan y• toun eneas neyther anthenore ayenst kyng priam cōspired false traison neyther howe vlixes gate paladion deth priam ne eccuba quene ne howe pyrrus flewe pong pollicene neyther write mine entent repeyre grekes home countre cyte iiyon brent neither mischefe see neyther howe vlixes founde penolope true wyfe though long fro al grece rede mo matter thus make eude fil grekes viage troy boke tho folke send haue desire se surplusage howe grekes made fyrst passage towardes troy besiegynge cite bede storye ye get xvii chapter ☞ speketh bochas authour thys boke agaynste surquedous pryde truste rychesse sayeng wordes vnto proude folkes set affiaūce strength beaute hye noble ye consider fortune variaunce coude myrrour eyen dresse kyng pryam great richesse se child noblesse sodainly
