ben fall hector knighthode called sour wel sad demure famous prudence paris also beaute dyd excell helenus perfyt prouidence troylus armes great experience also deyphebus preued manly fone yet y• warre slaine euerychone kyng also deuise noble heccuba whiche y• quene▪ doughter called cassandra wyse yong suster fayre pollicene ala ala may pride mene albeit renome spronge ful far yet woman deuoured war mighty strong thynges also aliaunce ryght worthy prince many rych kynges nighe al asie vnder obeisaunce holde tyme famous puissance renomed richesse tresours tyl fortune wyth sharpe shoures whan satte highest whele blind goddes began assaile frowarde malice felte ful wele golde treasure fyrst gan fayle darken gan roial apparayle whych example proud men mayse vntrue trust mutabilite world sene founde alday myddes state magnificence ebbe floude maketh delaye hait course resistence tyde abydeth violence eche man y• standeth chaūges dout must take tourne cōmeth let priam clere myrrour ye proude folkes set affiaunce glorye whych fadeth flour hath beautie none attendaunce worlde cast ful bitter chaunce whan ye wene syt highest full wil sonest bright feders pul ye haue warnynges take hede ensample clere ryght visible worldly blysse medled al wyth drede wittes reason sencible thynge sene eye incredible al doctrine veyne tyme ye haue chaunges sene wherefore bochas vnto auayle full prudently put issue fyrst al giueth counsaile leaue byces take vertue sette trust al wholy jesut may best mischiefe helpe nede worldly chaunges ye thē drede xviii chapiter ¶ also jhon bochas putteth greate praysynge commendacion suerty standeth pouertie vnder wordes sentence great lordshyppes greate dignity chefe thinge annexed vnto y• regaly whan sytte highest see rounde stante chiualry drede entreth paryl enuy vnware chaūge whych none may know whan fortune wyl make lout low may wel kepe stately housholde vain trust power shuld euer last clad mātell purpul golde whele fortune clyme vp fast lyke myght neuer downe cast aye clymbinge highest ala sorer vnhappy fal fal priam agamemnon ought right complayned whan fortune pulled doun malice hath disdayned neuer worship attained theyr fallyng greuous tofore glorious thou pouert meke humble debonayre kepest lawes nature sodayne chaunges thou wilt dispaite art thou franchised fortune lure assautes thou lowly doest endure may haue iurisdiction enterupt thy possession thou settest lytel al worldly richesse▪ treasours bene transitory thou scornest thē sheltrōs dresse towarde batayls conquest victory thou dispysest al shininge veyne glory laude triumphes whych conquerers haue sought wt al pillage yu setst thē noght thou dispreisest al superfluitee none infortune may chaunge thy corage shippes saile see marchandise amonge flodes rage auentures perillous passage lyfe body goodes al put auenture onely lucre great richesse recure al thyng thou takest litle hede people maners purchase pleders whych lucre mede meyntayne quarels questes enbrace thou thē beholdest ful styl face subtill working sought ye none sodainly depart al atones thou canst litell also haue suffisaunce art content wyth ful small dispence thy richesse thyne haboundaunce without grutchyng humble pacience man offence thou forgettest canst forgyue suffyseth thou mayst liue starred heuin thy couerture somer season vnder leaues grene thou makest thy dwellinge doest thy selfe assure ayen great heates son shene content wt frutes water christal clene staunche thy hūger thy thurstes sore season carest pouert eke lyeth colde wynters nyght wrapped strawe without cōpleyning without drede goeth glad light tofore theues ful merely doth syng gothe also without patisyng fro lande lande amonge poore riche frende foe hym ylich moral senecke recordeth writing richest thynges glad pouerte euer one chere voyde al grutching ioye aduersite al world last liberte franchise stant greate ease fredom man wyll displese norice study doctrine vertuous labour doth diligence science whych ben diuine called mother clerkes sentence philosopher reuerence fortune farre sonder vary eche custome contrary erthly ioye liue pea hateth tumulte noyse disturbaunce disciple called zenocrates wylful pouert set holy plesaunce sober porte whose attemperaūce ful many man teching brought vertue fro vicious lyuinge diete mesurable deuoyde superfluite corage kepte fyrme stable fro fleshely lustes attempre reason maistred sensualite desyres vnleful set asyde duryng lyfe pouert gide abidyng conuersacion place solitary among tree welles bylte dōgiō multitude hated tary pouert secretary sober chere stable entent athene fyrst schole went mighty authorite rightwysnesse iustyce obserue rightful iuges sentēce toke gre coude mouth tonge preserue temple one mi • erue without oth vnto sentence saide iuges gaue credence asked among great audience soleine daliaunce answere neuer scylence litel speking felte greuance speche vnauysed causeth repentaunce recheles tonges lacke refreyninge many man hath great hinderinge diogenes true heire next alied wylful pouert iust enheritaunce richesse plainly hath defied great encomberaunce worldly treasour haue aliaunce hys dwellyng made within litell tunne turned wt concourse sun selfe refreshig wt hete phebus bemes content god wote ful lite kyng alexander cōquered al realmes came ridyng downe gan selfe delyte philosopher se visyte selfe soquestred sole al prees came alone see diogenes profered vnto hym great rich treasoure badde aske thyng woulde might please hym succour nothinge ne tolde prayed ful lowly shoulde drawe frō thynge ayen al right giue lay myght thyng quod alexander agayne haue cōquest al erthly tresour wun philosopher said spake vayne thou hast quod lordship sun thy shadow letteth bemes fro tun sith thou hast power hys lyght pray hertely forbarre sighte though alexāder myghty puissance world demeyne yet hys reason vnder obeysaunce fleshly lustes fettred cheine hys person wyl souereyne reason bridled sensualite troublyng fredome ryght equite wyll hath dominacion prince sustayne ryght parcial fauour oppresseth reason trouthes titel bornedoun myght equal doome hath lost clere light though season sit hie cheyres fame shal fade within fewe yeres make comparison bytwene alexander diogenes one endured short season loued warre pee recheles helde hym content wyth giftes nature vnto great age pouert dyd endure alexander slayne wyth poysone triumphes whan dyd excell tunne lay ful low downe diogenes dranke water well end difference tel alexander wyth couetous blent philosopher wyth litel content blessed pouert may endure longe maugre fraude daunger fortune kynges emperours strong estate whyle may contune al vertues rekened cōmune twene indigence great habundaunce good meane content suffisaunce great plentye men assured lust alway lyue ease though y• mē great tresure haue recured rich fele many disease lord haue al thyng may thē please hertely ioy philosopher expresse grettest tresour twene pouert rich chapiter sheweth fygure maner lykenesse demonstracion howe diogenes lenger dyd endure mighty priam kyng laomedon exemplifye conclusion trust vertuous symplesse presumynge vicious false rich auoutry paris heleine brought al troye distruccion pryde luxury also meanes tweine grekes layd siege towne finally cause confusion eyther partie losse many man groūd conceiued fyrst war gā lenuoye tragedy piteous lamentable ful dolorous write expresse worthy priam kinges notable fal pouert al great richesse fro kyngly honour wretchednes sceptre croune regaly mischiefe brought false auoutry▪ fortune froward disceuable suffer doublenesse course whych euer variable worthy hector flour al prowesse vnwarly famous noblesse slayne ala chefe stocke chiualry quarel false auoutry agamemnon accompted incomparable among grekes trouth rightwysnesse gouerne glorious able within paleis storye bereth wine wife clitimnistra cursednes assented murdre hym enuy occasion false auoutry ye noble prince cōceiue howe chaungeable worldly honour vnstedfastnes sith king priam glory vnstable fixe minde thys mater doth impresse corages knightly doth vpdresse agayne al tytles holdeth champarty whych appertayneth false auoutry ¶ xix chapter mighty sampson whiche tolde hys counsayle dalyda whereby disceiued stronger thā sampson none deliuer y• byble bereth wytnesse without weapen slough fierse lyon enemyes hym dyd expresse vncouth problem anon gan dresse agayne philistine slough thē thirty paye hys promyse spoyled problem text thus rehersyng letter sothfastnesse came mete thynge etynge fro strong went swetnes hys wyfe frowarde doublenes euer wrought disauayle worthy sampson tolde counsayle stronge lyon swete hony tastyng woman haue thys condicion secrete thynges whan haue knowleging bolne inwarde hertes aye freting outher must dye discure britel custome nature case lyon deed agayne sonne gapynge lay vp right aswarme entred heed came hony anone ryght whan sampson therof syght fautasied hys opinion full secretly proposicion ye haue herde gan forth purpose philistine hym expowne vnder payne trouth hym vnclose wyth hys wife priuely gan rown sāpson gan cōpleyn frowne faymngly long vpon hym wepe coud coūsayle fro kepe whan knewe made taryeng plaine hole gan declare double trust wepynge kepe tonges woman spare wepyng wyues yuell mote fare al husband pray god gyue thē sorow tel counsaile euyn morowe told thē hole told thē halfe sampson gan vpon thē smyle ye herde calfe ye haue found great whyle may sure woman lyst begyle though bokes sāpson strēgth cōmēde yet durst ayenst hys wyfe offende mighty sampson also payne thre hundred fox one founde toke tailes knit thē twayn twain amyd euerich set fyre bronde ran phylistines lond furiously vp downe went frutes vynes brent eke trayson whan one bound wyth stronge cordes lay slepe iii whych sampson founde haue murdred hym toke kepe brake bondes vp anone lepe asse caught chaule bone thousande slough anone gan faynt sodaine lust drinke faded face chere god sent hym staūche hys thurst ass water christal clere sprāge large lyke ryuere refreshed spirite whych afore gan dul tyl water dronke ful went gasam citye amōg hys enemy great might plesaunce dyd se full fayre woman lay wyth al nyghte morowe long lyght maugre watch sholders square gate strong vp hyl bare valey whych called soret ful hote loued dalyda fayre hert full sure set coude fayne meke debonayre make chere whan hi list repeyre dare call dalida double chefe rote cāuse al mortal trouble neuer dranke wynes whyte ne reed nazarees gouernaunce rasour ne shere touched neuer heed long growyng stādeth plesaunce sampson myghty substāce al force influence heuyn heeres weryng y• nombre seuyn ful secre euery mannes syght among people told vncouth thinge wherof sampson great myght outwarde shewyng force hys working dalida wyth false flatterynge woulde neuer stynt enquiring euer amonge tyl y• • knewe wherby strong lyke serpent daryng vnder flour lyke worme wroteth tre lyke addre many folde colour righte true apperinge fayre vpon se shrowded mutabilite lowliheed fayre pretence true menynge vnder false apparence ment troth variable faithful vntre sted fast v • stable trust aye one loued thinges newe weared colour many diuers hewe stede blewe sted fast clene loued cha • nges many diuers grene purpose condiscende whan sampson knewe al priuite falsheed shortly comprehende made hym slepe ful soft kne sharpe rasour toke shofe heeres large great length whereby ala lost strength domage erth none greuous enemy secree pestilence none perilous falsnesse wher priuee specially feminitee theyr wyues founde variable shall husbandes fynde stable thus sāpson dalida disceiued coude well flatter forge fayne philistine whan thei haue cōceyued vnwarely boūd hym myghty cheyne cast prison put eyen twayne dispite fynde quernes made hym grynde thei made feast stately solempne whan al traison wrought rebuke scorne condempne blinde sampson afore brought▪ greued hym ful fore thought cast dyd priuely minde cauenge hys blyndnesse maner way finde whan thus thought hym long made childe hym priuely lede two postes large square stronge enbraced man toke hedet gan shake without feare drede • sturdely among hys fone al temple vpon fal thus auenged fone falsely dyd agaynt hym stryue slough hys dyeng god wote many one dyd euer afore hys lyue also date discriue israel byble myn auctour twenty yere theyr iudge gouernour ¶ lenuoye • hys tragedy gyueth euidence mē shal theyr coūseil 〈…〉 dyscure recheles tonges lacke prudence haue great harme many creature whan harme done ful harde recu 〈…〉 beware sāpsō coūsaile wel ke 〈…〉 let dalida complaine crye wepe whilom sampson manhode pruden 〈…〉 israel gouernance cure daunted lyon magnifyeence▪ made thousande disconfiture hys perilous auenture whan lay dalida slepe whych falsly coude complayne crye cr •• though dalida cōplayne crye wepe ☞ xx chapiter chapter bochas discriuyng malice woman myne aucthour bocas reioysed bylyue dare saye whether commendable woman malice dyscryue generally writ fable theys nature • en variable howe malice best euidente knōw haue experience aforce al day men mayse sp • guler fredom dominacion ou • r • en haue soueraynte kept lowe vnder subiection sor • labour • opinion • subtyl • ra •• thinge return denied nature bochas affirmeth holde tale want freshnes colour haue face jawne swerte pale anone diligent laboure anede helpe socour riueled skyn abrode drawe strain forward froūces make thē smoth plain rednesse chekes lilyes dilectable white take tencrease beaute oyntements may delite wher kynde fayleth surplusage aquite craft selfe dispose shewe rednes though rose shewe face faire bryghte hote spice oyntementes sote craft counterfete ryght take case many holsome rote kinde faileth connynge bote theyr brestes vp hye dresse cā ful wel thē bossynge downe represse soft tendre haue connyng make harde round corsnes eke make slendre poynant sauce y• ben phisike fon̄de subtel wittes sleightes habound thynge y• croked wrong mās syght make seme went vp ryght haue strictories make theyr skyn shine wrought subtilly gōmes glaire crafty lye dye heer cytryne distilled water make seme fayre fumigacions rectify ayre stomagers freshe confection represse false exhalacions al thing bochas hath dispite whan veckes farre yron age within selfe haue vaine glory delite fayre paynt visage lyke paintour olde ymage layeth collours riche freshe hewe worme frete storkes make seme newe slak skyn crafte abrode streined lyke orenge galey brought riche relikes necke cheined golde vpō golde perle stone wrought ye colour outward apeire nought wt winde sun shuld thē stein fade vnkinde heates vsen citrinade write vncouth desiers sumtyme frowarde sūtyme debonayre imageninge sondry freshe attiers contriued newe many thousand payre diuers deuiles make seme fayre apport counterfayte lykenes resemble venus goddesse one deuise holde apayde must eche day haue straunge wede better arayed frowarde grutchynge fele herte blede eueryche thynketh verely dede morow prieng myrrour bryght fairest owne sight eyen lokes dresse drawe folkes sleightes lure whyle frowardnes fayned daunger men recure euer lyst auenture agaynst whose sleightes force prudence may auayle make resistence constraint wepyng forged flatery subtyll speche ferced plesaunce many false dissimuled malady though ī hertes fele greuaūce couert sobre daliaunce though vnderneth double serpent dare ful many one haue broght ī snare swetnes ful mortalitie serpentyne wyth plesant visage vnstable ioy ful aduersite chaungeable hert corage thy desire hauyng thys auauntage euer thou lyst daunt oppresse thy fraūches bocas bereth witnes nature many wyse mighty gyantes power wel aslake▪ wyt man compas deuise sleighty wyles dare well vndertake lyst theron ende make fro conceite discord • thousande story reders accorde remembring first hercules stronge▪ brought woman destruction quene clitimnistra dyd also great wrōg murder lorde kynge agamemnon dalyda also betrayed sampson amphiorax sanke depe downe hell bicause wife counsaile tell nedeth make mencion though phillis died impacience longe abidinge demophoon howe nisus kyng magarence doughters cursed violence vnwarely murdred ouide told whā frō head stale y• heare golde bochas reherseth wyues many one werkinge ful cōtrarius among writeth one quene assirye wyfe kyng ninus discent doughter neptunus semitamis called dayes men woulde make assa •• nouther spared straunger ne kynred owne son set asyde wyth knowledgyng dede whych sclaūder went ful wyde wyth one man could abyde false lust vpon fall corage haue wythal truely doth wyt appal thys matter make rehersaile reason atwyte woman al though one two whylom dyd fayle sitteth may auaile rebuke perfit ben gode ferre ioynt though stode rich rubye saphire inde appayred freshe beautie though among stone mē coūterfetes fynd semblably though woman wel gouerned degre diffa • eth doth violence neuer dyd life offence whyte lillye holsome rose violettes sprede bankes thicke swetnes whych outwarde vnclose appeyred weedes wycke though y• breres many croked sticke growe garden among floures fayre may vertue herbes apayre dare say woman vertuous ben vertue price cōmendable rekened vicious liuinge founde also stable good woman ought partable trespasse wycked dede cōmended womanhed appayred hester mekenes though y• scilla sturdy vengeable alceste perfite stedfastnes eclipsed acceptable though clitimnistra founde variable lyke whā cloud blaknes decline phebus wt beames doth clere shine ful many one haue clene ben al lyue vndefouled kept virginitie coude al vice striue conserue perfit chastitie deuoyde chaung mutabilitie thogh sūe haue ther againe trespased▪ laude therwith diffased euer malice lyst accuse sely woman touchynge variaunce let remembre wyttes muse men ay stable constaunce worlde perseueraunce chaunge ay founde men woman outher party neuer wroth man vertuous wite stede trespace thefe trewe man iudite gylty innocent manace good wycked abyde euery place price lacke let reserued outher party haue deserued though jhon bochas opinion agaynst woman lyst processe make ben good condicion shoulde ayenst maner quarel take lightly passe sleues shake againe good nothinge made conceyue theffect balade ¶ xxi chapter excuse bochas writing ayenst misgouerned woman sted lenuoy ye woman shall beholde see chapiter proces rede ye ben good founde youre degree vertuous thought dede bochas sayeth take ye hede writinge discerned agayne well gouerned though fall one two thre haue done amisse therof god forbed womē whych stable faithful atwited vngoodlyhede cōmended womanhed scripture concerned agayne well gouerned galled horse soth ye list se toucheth hi boweth backe drede knowe vntrue countre shrinketh horne whā mē speke falshede good woman haue ful litel nede grutch frowne whan ye truth lerned thoughe sōe yt wel gouerned dalida quene pasiphae though doublenes dyd bridell lede yet lucrece penolope noble fame abrode doth shyne sprede good corne mē may darnel wede woman rebuke defautes querned touch wel gouerned xxii chapter ¶ myghty pyrrus sloughe pollicene whyche hys pryde auoutry dyed pouerte slayne last horestes bochas musynge hys remembraunce considerynge fantasy vnsure truste worldely variaunce men woman chaunge foly tyme sawe company myghty prince ful pitously wepynge hym appere fortune complaining among put selfe pr • ase mighty pirrus fyrst tight son worthy achilles among grekes famous knight commended manhode might son next heire bokes specifye pelleus kynge thessalie achilles ful manly herte hurt hector wounde grene slough hector dyd aduert whiche achilles loue pollicene compassing heccuba quene vnder treaty grekes champion slayne paris within troy toun whose deth auenge pyrrus tene furiously face deed pale slough afterward sayde pollicene dismembred peices smale whiche heare piteous tale knight vengeable dede slee mayde quakynge drede coude ire mercy haue swerde furious wode merciles vpon father graue lyke tiraunt shed chaste bloud dede horrible diffaced knighthode day sclaunder diffame newe report reboundeth name poetes say specially ouide writes whan grekes fro troy shuld saile howe shyppes anker dyd ryde purpose long dyd thē faile whyle maketh hersayle erth manacynge chere achilles ymage dyd appere grekes sayde wyth deedly face fele well mine honour glory noble ful lyghtly forth doth pace vnkynde people memory whych conquest vyctory deuoyre doth pollicene take graue sacrifice make wyth blode loke ye spare nought spring sepulture thus blode blode wyth vengeance shalbe bought death death must endure hole maner thys auenture howe dyed maydenhead methamorphoseos y• processe ye may rede hasty vengeaunce set al hys ioye wt thurst vnstaūched troyan blode shede slough priam worthy kyng troy grece wyth hym dyd lede andromada story ye may rede weded certaine worthy sonnes twayne repayryng home coūtre eolus dyd hys shyppes dryue fynde pirat se grece whan dyd aryue fortune vnwarely gan agayne stryue forsoke hys wyfe let lyue alone toke another called hermione tyme mariage horestes son agamemnon ala loues wylful rage toke force hys possession auoutry foloweth guerdō sodayne deth pouerte shame open disclaūder great mischefe diffame eke hys tyme thys pirrus rede fyll mischefe great pouerte wyth meyny dyd lede rouer robbed see poetes reherse ye may se robbyng sclaūder diffame worde pirate pirrus toke y• name storye doth deuise sayde horestes gan sykerly espye wher pyrrus dyd sacrifyce tofore appollo god magnify full vnwarely horestes enuy toke sharpe sherde pyrrus coud aduert wher stode rofe hym hert fyne pyrrus substance al pryde great presumcion false auoutry foloweth thys vengeaūce losse membre pouerte prison hateful sclaundre occasion sodayne deth shortly sentence complete pyrrus ful clere euydence xxiii chapiter ¶ machayre hys suster canace thys pyrrus came canace faire teares dystyllynge fro eyen twayne brother called machaire pitiously gan playne fortune gan disdayne hyndryng fate woful aduenture touchig loue ayen nature brother loue also storie plainely doth declare bedde laye eke bothe two reason none would spare loue causeth wo eke welfare gan agayne kynde straungely deuyse wombe made sodenly ryse finally myne authour beareth wytnes childe owne brother excelled fauour fayrenes lyke hym beaute none loue gyded rother caribdis twene windes ful contrayre hath canace distroied machayre whan father maner dyd espie workyng whych horible yre almost fel frensy whych appese impossible mater frowarde odible whiche plainely deuoyde al pite vpon trespas would auenged cause knowen father anone right cast deth rigour prouide whych machaire fledde sight face presence gan hide wo ala suster must abide mercilesse hateful trespase suffre deth none grace first father sharpe swerde sent token deth remembraunce whan wist plainely ment conceiued rigorous ordinaunce whyth whole purpose obey plesaunce grutched lowly entent lyke meke doughter desire assent dyed cast write lytell letter brother dere deedly complaynt shewe endite pale fate mortal salt teares eyen clere pitous sobbing fet fro herts brinke distillyng downe tēpre ynke ☞ xxv chapiter ¶ letter complaynt canace brother machayre ovt sowne whan abreyde knowyng meane deth distres brother full pytouslye sayde cause sorowe rote heuynesse whilō chefe sour gladnes whā ioyes wyl disposed vnder one key herts vnclosed whilom thou supporte sykernes chefe reioysyng worldly plesaunce thou art ground sicknes wel wanhope deedly penaunce haue sorow grettest habūdaūce euer yet creature must loue deth ala endure thou whylō blysse al trust souerayne confort sorowes appese spring wel hertes lust nowe ala chefe rote disease deth myght ease brother myne remembraūce twaine deth shall pleasure payne cruel father vnmerciable ordayned hath nedes must rigour vntretable al mercilesse wyll algate shall dye two glad sith may none thou art escaped best beloued brother myne ende may astert brother myne say lowly besechinge al hole hert remembre specially prey befall litel sonne dey y• maist mynde v haue suffre v buried one graue holde hi streitly atwene armes twaine thou nature layde charge gyltlesse wyth mast suffre payne sith thou art fredom large let kyndnes loue discharge haue mynde euer thou one day vpon chylde dependeth trespare touchyng gylt great offence welawaye angelyke face chylde yong pure innocence shal agaynst right suffre dethes violence tender lymmes god wote full giltlesse goodly fayre y• lieth spechlesse mouth hath wordes hath none cōplaine ala none outrage grutcheth lyeth alone styll lambe meke visage hert stele coude hym domage suffre hym dye beholdyng mauere loke benigne two eyne clere thou father cruell thy wreche harder hert tigre lyon slee chylde lyeth wythout speche voyde mercy remission mother haste compassion youth cōsidered wt lyppes soft silke whych brest lyeth souketh mylke sorow remēbred wryting vnto sorouful sighes comparable euer creature lyuyng felt dole thinge lamentable confortlesse vnrecurable thilke heaped sorowes full rage haue wo oppressed corrage reken mischeues especial mischefe remembre haue mynd lord father enemy mortal experience yn • ugh thereof finde pursute hath left behinde distruccion chyld al ruth al mercy fatherly pite brother auoyded sight whiche wyse grace mayst attayne ala rigour vēgeaunce cruel right shoulde aboue mercy lady souerayne crueltie doth disdayne thou brother childe also shall dye exyled ala mercy father whylom many sondry signe socour supportacion gracious benigne worldly gladnes oure consolacion loue fortune hath tourned vpsodoun grace ala welfare fame hard recure sclaundred name spot diffaming harde washe away whan noyse abrode folke manace hynder man theyr may delay hateful fame flyeth far short space v twayne none grace saue onely deth deth ala eternal sclaunder v thus stant caas whō shal blame whō shal atwite greate offence sith maye hyde excuse reportes respyte meane none except god cupide though woulde v prouyde thys mater chefe refuge poetes say blynde iudge depaynt lyke blynde archere marke aryght fayling discrecion holdynge measure nouther fer nere lyke fortune disposicion al vpon hap voyde al reason blynd archer wt arrowes sharp ygroūd auenture yeueth many mortal wounde wrongly dyd marke felly hynder fatal auentures farre phebus shyneth hys arke make v refuse al creature called v twayne vnto wofull lure diffame whych wyll depart neuer newe reporte noyse encresyng euer odious fame swift wynges flyeth al good fame enuy doth restrayne eche man defautes seeth yet owne man wyl complayne al worlde cryeth v twayne whose hateful ire v may quemed must dye father hath demed farwel brother doth suffice dye alone sake faithful humbly wyse vnto dethward thogh trimble quake euer leaue take one yere forget take hede fatal day letter rede shalt yu haue remēbraunce name emprinted thy kalendere rehersayle deedly greuance weare black day make doleful chere whan thou comest shalt aproch nere sepulture pray disdaine vpon graue teares rayne writyng letter wrapped drede ryght hande pen gan quake sharpe swerde make hert blede lift hand father hath take sorow childes sake vpon whose face barme slepyng ful many teare wepte complayning al thys stode quoke chylde beholdig amyd paynes smert without abode sharpe swerde toke roue selfe euyn hert chyld fil downe myght astert hauyng helpe soccour hym saue bloud selfe began bathe father cruel entent badde childe shoulde anone take cruel houndes haste rent deuoured hys mother sake thys tragedy thus ende make processe whych men may rede se concludeth mischefe furious crueltie remembrynge fyrst made mencion howe pyrrus delited hym dede whan troye brought distruction cruel swerde troyan blode shede slaughter se cruel mede ryght requyreth vnware violence blode shedde blode finall recōpence ¶ lenuoye whan surquedy oppressed hath pitie mekenes wt tyranny bore doun agayne ryght hasty crueltie vengeable maketh delation foloweth therof good aspection se example pyrrus tene hatefull yre slough yonge pollicene kynge eolus outragious parde vengeable entencion agaynst child machaire canace importable punicion haste proceadyng destruction worse yre well sene cruell pyrrus whiche slewe policene noble prince prudent attempre deferre vengeaunce high discrecion tyll yre sum waged neuer doome none execusion hate rancour perturben reason hasty iudges entent vnclene cruell pyrrus whych slewe policene ¶ thus endeth firste booke folke parcase would seme touchig y• chaūges mutability rehearsed yt thei might deme fortune straunge aduersities prince shewed doun pulled frō see tragedy ought inough suffise complaynyng ye haue heard deuise story piteous processe lamentable voyde ioye gladnes pleasaunce thing greuous importable mirth medled greuaūce vpon complaynt standeth alyaunce whan fortune y• course knewe chaungeth olde ioyes sorowes newe vnto neuer wist wo remembraunce olde gladnesse whan welfare pleasaunce go neuer afore knewe heauines vnware chaūg vncouth wretchednes causeth price new dedly trouble falling sorowes double olde example prynces haue fall remebraunce new brought minde may myrror estate vertue shall remedy finde eschue vyces made blind sodayn fallyng selues preserue long cōtune thanke god deserue fal one cleare lanterne teach another shall eschue peryll one discerne schole doctrine peryll remue men deserue suche guerdon must sue vice vertue man may god deceyue like desertes mede receyue foloweth vertue lengest doth perseuer rich pouertye light trouth clerenes kepeth euer agayne assautes aduersitie vertue cause long prosperitie whan prince frō vertue downe decline fame shrouded vnder y• cliptike line false fortune whiche turneth ball vnware chaūges though men atwite yaue prynces fall vycious liuyng playnly endyte though god aboue full oft respyte longe abideth dothe grace sende entent shoulde life amende welfare abidyng longe aduertiseth dependeth chaunce good life vertue maketh thē stronge assureth long perseueraunce vertue fortune maketh defiaunce fortune hath domination wher noble prince gouerned reason suche list corrected example vycious gouernaūce fro vyces list flye troubled hygh puissaunce arette fortune variaunce touchyng gyltes vse demerites full falsly excuse vertue conserueth prynces glory confirmeth domination vyces put prynce memory trespaces transgression suche sodayne mutacions refute better succoure agayne fortune make clamour make crye doublenesse gylt owne dede thus vntruly call goddesse litle nought may helpe nede god loue drede trusted lordshyp hart thought fortune playnly set nought euidence full expert palpable tofore rehearsed tolde diuers age worldly glory vayne full vnstable disceytes double vysages shewyng prynces firme corages ensamples howe wyse others fallyng shal thē selfe chastise sygnes shewed token heauen diuers cometys constellation dreadfull thunder fearfull firy leauen rumour earth great discencions disobey saunce sundry regyons shewen example full wel affirme date mighty prince thē biddyng beware life amend lorde smite negligence late y• swerd vengeaunce kerue byte anto vertues vycious life translate cherishyng right agaynst wrong debate dreade god make selfe stronge doubt shall endure longe ware others chastisyng shal chastised harde hart whithe writyng doctrine none aucthoritie none example vyces flye indurat frowarde entent whiche suffer hardnes relent rounde droppes smothe rayne whiche discende fall aloft stone harde eye seyne perceth hardnes fallyng oft touchyng water soft persyng caused force puissaunce failyng long continuaunce semblably ryght dare rehearse oft readyng bokes fructuous harte prudent prince perce soke mind make vertuous eschue thyng vycious auaileth example y• rede readyng contrary dede▪ cunnyng dede ran comprehende clere conceites ben thinges twayne cunnyng dede amende wene thē made mighty chayne noble thing right souerayne cunnyng labour well spent whan dede foloweth bothe ben assent thus john bochas procedyng boke whiche number called seconde gan write purpose toke set story founde entent vyces confounde example whiche expresse begynnyng busines myghty saule appeare kyng israell piteously wepyng deadly face hydous cheare voyce ybroke manifolde sobbyng mine aucthout sorow cōplaynyng requiryng hym together whan met first boke wofull fate set anone entencion penne hande fast gan spede coulde translation labour procede lorde came forth gan take hede mighty prince right manly right wi • e gaue charge prudent auyse euery tragedy processe made mencion ende set remedy lenuoy conueyed reason humble affection noble prynces lowly dyrect others fallyng selues correct obeyed biddyng pleasaunce vnder support magnificence coulde gan penne aduaunce barrayne eloquence folowing mine auctor substaūce sētence suffiseth playnly vnto lord makyng take gre finis ¶ hovve saule kyng israel borne lowe degree longe dradde god obediente ruled good counsaile made many disconfitures last pryde presumption great disobedience lost crowne stayne philistine ¶ firste chapter sayde saule spake toforne full well compacte large stature lyne beniamyn eke borne father ci called scripture whose ass whilom left pasture space thre dayes saule thē sought lost labour founde nought gone farre stray disceuered ne coude mete tyll childe suyng way yaue counsaile labour lete go prophete whiche full famous holde israell name called samuel whiche made saule house dyne receiued great affection precept ordinaunce deuyne samuell made prolongation shed holy sacred vnction vpon head saule downe knelyng full deuoutly israell made kyng god people haue gouernaunce sceptre crowne whole regaly noblesse myghty aduaunce mekenes rule monarchy god gaue spirite prophety whiche great glory magnificence future thinges haue prescience yt meke humble dede voyde pryde false presumption prudent counsayle lede hym gouerne good discretion founde quiete region forayne enmy durst werrey lorde mekely obey enemy myght ayen recure none ēprises sore drede made many great disconfiture force knyghthode māhead philistynes daunted eke dede two mighty kynges one ammonite another gouerned moabites founde stronge eke victorious palestine bringyng mischaunce agaynst ydumeans mighty famous myghty prudent gouernaunce pride brought mischaunce outrayed wisdome manheade primo regum ye may playnly reade sonne called one yere israell whan raygne began stable hart benygne chere frowarde sturdy maner man whyle loue people wan tyme mene iust stable workes founde variable whā pride gan hart enhaūce wilfulnes false melancoly outrayed reason haue gouernaunce olde famous policy forgotten fantasy know lorde mekely sue lawe god crowne grace gan wdrawe vnkynde worme foryetfulnes hart myned wall whan god kyndenes gaue laude thanke whiche raysed vnto estate royall poredegre among kynne alone singuler fauour set trone thig hart may froward thought sodayne false presumption wretche came vp nought yeue lordshyp domination▪ make playne comparison men reason dreade lyon lasse rudenes crowned asse thing god abhominable pryde vpraysed pouertee nothing gladly foūd vengeable wretch set high degre stocke kynd may flye eche thing resorteth howe farre euer go nature whiche came fro frute apple take tarrage first grewe tre semblably eche kynred lynage one yere none token signe eye men may se draweth communely euery creature sume tetche folow nature write rebuke pouert suche onely deserue god might men well expert may vertue encrease conserue mischefe pore man preserue rayse hem heygh dominacions high noblesse condicions influence god may grace shede findeth cause onely mekenes pore man raise vp dede vnto estate vertuous noble vertue cometh gentlenes pore ryche make none exception cōmende like condicion pore man whiche vertuous dreadeth god pouertie eche thing eschuyng vycious power doth trouth equitie dare right well say euer puttyng rebuke vnto kinrede call gentle verily dede kyng saule contrarious disobeysaunte founde workyng whan god made vyctorious amalech agag kyng commaunded spare maner thing man woman beast childe succoure y• sworde thing deuoure saule wrought wise eche thing reseruyng y• fayre syght entent make sacrifice vyctory shope anone ryght fattest beastes chase hath dight toward fyre make offryng fro death spared agag kyng reproued afterward samuell god biddyng contrayre abiect raygne israell good hope hym gan dispayre grace myght gan pale appayre prophecy hath hym fayled wyth fiende also traueiled thus frō whele fortune cast downe aualed royall se god also toke away crowne posteritie set vp dauid humilitie lo lorde dome deuide enhaunce mekenes abate pride saule endured frensy wicked sprite sore assayle vnto dauid euer enuy hardy enter battayle staffe slynge voyde plate mayle slough golyas without feare dreade pulled swerde smot heade repayryng home felde whan dauid slayne goly yonge maydens whan behelde great vyctory armony laude dauid thus gan synge cry saule hath slayne thousād might dauid ten thousand lusty yong knyght saule disdayned sayd frowardly graunted haue thousand name sonne isai yaue ten thousand encrease fame whiche rebuke shame▪ wherupon saule frete yre yonge dauid gan death conspyre hys hert fantasy syngyng whan toke hede dempt maner prophesy dauid preferred dede crowne succede thought childer gan diuyne depriued royall lyne thus day day saule wayes sought slea dauid playnly myght malyce thought euer kept lowly syght therfore good euer grace alyght aye lorde magnificence agayne tyrantes preserueth innocentes bible playnely dothe v lere dauid tender age noble kynges daughter dere called mychol ioyned mariage whan saule fyli rage dauid anone aswage wodenes touched harp brought gladnes saule full oft gan dauid enchase warrey throughout londes desertes pursue manace entent haue shet hym vp bondes slea come hondes finally god ordinaunce preserued knyght frō al maner mischāce saule full oft brought mischefe yet aye death dauid saue hereof speciall prefe whan dauid cut garment caue mo token ye list haue another time dauid also kept life saule whan lay slept case hosteyng farre sunder saule lay slepe people sleapyng vnpurueyed lyke stocke shepe whiche thyng dauid toke good kepe downe descended made delay came tent kyng saule lay spete saule standynge heed dauid toke went anone cōmyng man toke hede saule slept men echone whan vp hyll gone toward saule agayne cast loke made noyse knyghtes woke fyrst abner prynce chyualry dauid sayd wordes sentence▪ abner quod thou hast done great foly day shewed great negligence suffer saule magnificence peryll stande none hede take person make knight wa •• thou art blame thy retchelesue •• e leaue king stande great drede slepe haue sauour swetenesse lyfe take hede negligence requireth mede death turment rightfull iudgement prynce whan folke negligent thou lyst se euidence hys lyfe stode ieopardy se spere yeue thereto credence vnprouided ye party saule thou ye may denye life deth power puissāce day god put whole gouernaunce acquite pure innocence euery man vnto kyng declare none offence agaynst noble workyng god wot knoweth euery thyng neuer conspiracy wrought compassed agayne regaly lo example perfite pacience agayne malyce shewe kyndenes sauie shewed mortall vyolence dauid acquite hym wt suffraunce goodnes tyrāt vainquished bi prudēt mekenes men agayne trouth may well warregyn thende palme doth aye wynne story ye take hede saule fall hys frowardnes mischefe sodayne drede philistynes byble beareth witnes great power gan thiderwards dresse vpon kyng saule auenged tentes pight besyde gelboe wherof kyng saule astonied hert lost spryte knyghtly hardines specially whan dyd aduert prophete none harmes redresse future thinges trouth expresse israell whiche cast hym great drede tyme samuel deed saule cast diuynes israell eche diuineresse notwithstandyng palestynes risse agayne power oppresse ne knewe maner sorceresse might counsayle take god time forsake wise stode disconsolate coūsayle god prophete knewe none man infortunate vngraciously sped forth anone secretelye saule forth gone woman rede wisse israell called phytonesse whiche name clarkes writen office taketh hede soules men agayne clepe call mene suche tofore deade whiche thing straunge reade woman list lere make soules dead men appere vnkouth straunge opinion witte maner impossible accordyng semeth reason like thing whiche credible soule nature inuisible myght appeare shewe visibly vnto eyen ben bodely flyt lest holde presumptuous diuines matter commit wise clarkes ben vertuous wittes subtyll curious conclude dothe seme matter trouth deme whether soule samuell spirite call whiche tolde kyng israell battayle shoulde fall aduenture mischefes death tolde also dede dauid succede onely disobeysaunce written retchlesnes amalech toke vengeaunce thus spirite bare wytnes wherof saule fyll great heauines knowing mene escape dout take fortune cometh tolde also enemy wrothe philistine beside gelboe battayle child bothe shoulde dye daye necessitie chyualry shall discomfited raygne lenger date god kingdom wil translate thus saule returned agayne meyny brought disconfiture whan sawe hys people slayne▪ meane recure deadly wofull aduenture bad squier take swerde blyue hart shold ryue enemy vncircumcised haue power story founde haue vpon haue deuised yeue hym hys last fatall wounde high noblesse mischefe confounde squyre feare god drede woulde assent foule dede slea lorde greatly aferde thing hatefull euery mannes syght saule toke pomell swerde grounde full depe anone pyght haste possible myght made poynt furious payne perce hart part euen twayne philistynes anone dead spoyled hym royall armure dismembred smote heade token disconfiture toke spoyles wyth busy cure therof made best entent astaroth pryde great present thus saule slayne sentence philistynes vpon gelboe forsake god inobedience abiect also royall see thus lackynge humilitye god foreuer set asyde lo ende surquedy pryde ¶ lenuoy haue mind saule estate ryal frō low degre called mekenes presūption made hym haue fall god abiect frowardnes lost • rowne bible beareth wytnes cause disobeysaunce god biddyng yaue none attendaunce god asketh man whole hart without doublenes gyftes whiche especiall yaue man goodnes chastiseth vnkindnes suche ben rebell pleasaunce biddyng yeue none attendaunce noble prynces vertue pryncipall conserue high noblesse imprynt memoriall fayth equitie wronges redresse sustayne trouth ryghtwysnesse tofore god holde euenly balaunce biddyng yeue al attendaūce ¶ acommendation obedience vertue vertues excellence y• haue souerain suffisaūce vertue true obedience whiche set thyng ryghtfull gouernaūce ne prudent ordinaunce obey aboue gye destroyed worldly policy vertue hygh discrecion auoyded haue wylfulnes title onely dominacion truely lenyng vpon rightwisnes wrong errours iustly redresse trouth may right well affirme say people mekely biddyng shold obey noble vertue faythfull obeysaunce established vpon humilitie whiche includeth double variaunce ail region eche countrey causeth welfare ioye prosperitie vertue chefe souerayne vycious ryote playnly doth restrayne obedience eke men may se falsenes exileth rebellion temperaunce ryght equitye stant welfare euery region mekenes lowe subiection comonties holde vp regalies lordshyppes monarchyes doubt whan lorshyps entent busy ben souerayne lorde queme subiectes right iudgement conscience ryght reason deme shall crowne dyademe vpon heade perseuer freshly shyne make subiectes biddyng encline thus obeysaunce playnly worde haue lordshyp souerayntie done entent souerayne lorde shall cause raygne long prosperitie subiectes humilitie noble famous gouernaunce aye ready vnder obeysaunce y• serueth lorde lordes hath people subiection god wyll kepe shall fall longe preserue domination agaynwarde whan wisdome reason ben ouermastred sensualitie farewell floures felicitye obedience blunteth sharpenes cruell swordes tyrantes handes mekenes appeaseth felnes hasty vēgeaunce breketh two y• bōds eke pacience set quiete londes thre contune comonties longe peace perseuereth • kyngdoms city obedience dothe also restrayne conspyrations false collusion whan stant vnparted wayne dreade discencions combineth true opinion hart people ful wel afore prouided vnder prynces stand whole vndeuided prince meke hūble debonayre toward god whole affection theyr subiectes gladly contrayre seruice rebellion founde deuision head membres eche partye gouerned prudent policy contrariously saule put downe abiect god obstinacy put scepter crowne region israell lost monarchy lyst make alye frowardnes wylfull negligence noble vertue called obedience longeth kingdomes cityes vnder keye true beneuolence prince kynges gouerne see apperteyneth due reuerence subiectes obedience obey lordes degre title right euery comontee obeysaunce discerned argus eyen taketh hede ryght requyreth well gouerned whan membres presume agayn head gouernaunce perfite spede vnitie go froward wey whan subiectes prince disobey ii chapter ☞ kyng roboam geuyng fayeth yonge counsayle lost beneuolence people died foole vnto bochas order next came full great dole lamentacion yonge kyng called roboam sonne next heyre salomon entryng title iust succession besought mine aucthour make foly fallyng piteous tragedy first whan entred region twelue tribe gouernyng dede ruled selfe reason kept subiectes plainly rede vnder loue vnder froward drede olde wise great disauaile despised doctrine counsayle demeaned well couth scepter crowne regaly folke floured youth could custome wittes well apply blynde falsely flattery whiche stepmother called substaunce vertue good gouernaunce ala great dole great pitie flattery haue great fauour whych blindeth prince may se misteth eyen euery gouernour knowe owne errour false hony shed aye sentence fole yeueth credence may called deuyls tabourers frowarde sownes eares fulfyll sireues perillous bo • elers whiche gall hony downe distyll whose drinkes ben bothe amerous yll clarkes well deuise cunne worse drynkes sirenes tuune eares prynces full well enoynt soft oyle adulation termes subtylly appoynt eche thing concludyng false deception aye blandishyng amerous poyson finally poete sayth faith custome conciudeth wt vnfayth flouryng word though scute double hart pleasaunt langage true meanyng voyde destitute mustring outward preted fayre vysage trusteth findeth smal aduaūtage apparaunce glorious freshe shewyng prince deceauing many worthy kyng roboam beare full well witnes auoydyng folkes true hindred flattery falsenes coulde forge tale newe whose counsaile sore rue fayned false suggestion greatly abridged domination dempt selfe aucthoritye folly youth presumption father great royaltie pompous false opinion came concept adulation flatterer bare witnes excelled father hygh noble great rigour oppression vpon people wel preued finde mitigation matter yt haue greued tribute releued besought would relese thē nede nought toke therof hede olde counsayle set aside refused doctrine lore false counsayle folkes full pryde▪ pore liege oppressed sore ten kynredes anone without tyranny misgouernaunce withdrough trouth lygeaūce thus kyng conceiued rygour people anone indignacion stoned adoram whiche collectour tribute region departyng rebellion wherof astonied auenge vnryght jerusalem toke anone flyght whan parted roboam ten kynredes diuision chase kyng called jeroboam roboam within royall toun auenged rebellion cruell iustice hundred thousande made anone rise jeroboam cast mete one set ieopardy sameas prophete bade lete fro warre withdrawe party quarell iustifye people frowarde departyng god wyll done punishyng touchyng surplus gouernaunce royall buyldyng many fayre city great ryche famous suffisaunce wyne oyle hauyng great plenty empyre encreased yeres thre eke time ryghtfull dede josephus story ye may rede child borne ryght lyne eyghtene wyues made mencion fynde many concubyne sonnes daughter procreation rich great possession tyme encreased well knowe god aboue bare lowe mine auctour maketh rehearsaile encrease augmentacion mekenes hert gan waste faile pryde entred false presumption vertue despisyng religion whose vyces sayth boke wicked example people toke maners good yll vsed prynces diuers region people ready vse fulfill fully trace condicions lordes may subiections list take hede vyce vertue subiectes lede thus roboam transgression josephus deuised frowarde false opinion onely vertue hath despised god rightfully chastised jerusalem chiefe royall towne enemyes besieged enuyroun kyng egypt siege layed great people yt socour ther none roboam abrayed prayed god deliuer hun frō sone auoyde mercy enemyes euerichoue god list graunt prayere chastised like ye shall fyrst citye royall towne deliuered knewe better succour vnder fayned false composicioun entryng voyde fauoure kepyng couenaunt toke treasoure within temple hauyng pitye ladde home egypt countrey rehearse great dole roboam josephus dothe declare inly proude therwithal foule wysdome destitute bare vnmerciable hys people spare hatyng good counsayle regaly raygnyng foole let hym dye ¶ lenuoy philosopher conclude deuise theyr bokes good experience counsaylours sadde expert wyse true worde stable sentence hasty retchles vyolence kepe preserue trouth dare attame noblesse prince fro mischefe dyffame hasty youth rancour contrarywyse whyche haue wyll theyr aduertence except selues men despyse vnbrydeled furious insolence nothyng aquainted wt wisdome prudēce bryng ayenward wherof blame puttyng noble mischefe diffame kyng roboam agaynst ryght iustice yonge foles yaue fayth credence cruelly subiectes chastyce whiche put people beneuolence threw ten kynredes obedience record full great shame puttyng noble mischefe diffame noble prince wisely aduertise perseueryng magnificence olde expert blent couetise take counsayle reuerence eyed argus high prouidence whiche conserue report good name noblesse prynces mischefe diffame ¶ iii chapter ☞ office retinue kynge erthly thing deceiuable thē prīces pōpe vainglory▪ wene stand estate stable thei world conquered vyctory sodaynly put memory fame clouded ala noble darke shadowe foryetfulnes wherof cometh famous clere shinyng emperous consistory wherof cometh laude reportynge saue clark haue writē history conquestes transitories triūphes men thē find nad writer prowes put mynd reken vp al first worthy nyne high noble whiche neuer peer marciall actes clearly shyne fame vp borne aboue al nine sters loude soundes famous clarioners glorious palmes thei well paysed lowe labour cōmons first raised make likenes great ymages curiously corue entayle head armes body freshe vysages without fete legges may auayle stand vpryght nedes must fayle semblably subiectes commontees rayse vp noble prince see head membres ymages stone stocke compasse vndeuided proporcion fetures euerychone set true order nature hath prouided y• errours craft circūcided head highest custome men knowe body amidde fete beneth lowe myghty prince high renoun worthy shall occupy heade wytte memory eyen reason kepe membres frō mischefe dread like degree take good hede clere foresyght prudent thought fete preserue erre nought must hand armes defence whiche shall ymage manly kepe gye assautes forayne vyolence whiche shalbe named noblest chiualry true office iustly magnify sustaine church make thē selfe stronge se y• widowes maydēs haue wronge prudent iudges skyll ryght punishe wronge surfets redresse ymage shall occupy syght loue hate dome rightwisenes frende fo iudgementes dresse egally lawes susteyne workes none errour seyne amidde ymage body set aggregate people degree perfite peace vnity yknet estate gouerne commonties mayres prouostes burgeis city marchauntes also whiche seke sundry lādes craftes liue hādes body whiche stant health feleth grefe froward humour euery cōmonte continueth great welth whiche demeaned wt prudent gouernours appese debate errours people kepe controuersy causyng welfare encrease multiply body must haue soule lyfe quicke mēbres gostlye mocions whiche shalbe made folke cōtemplatyfe church cōmitted possession holy conuersacions good example sterres shyne grace vertue people tenlumyne vpon lyght condicions body dependeth welfare teaching predicacions trouth hygh low declare office drede ne spare vice correcte lyke holde syth ben heerdes christes folde folowyng vpon entent full clene labourer ye haue herde deuysed shal body beare vp sustene fete legges whych may dispised true labour iustly auctorised ne plough vpholdē trauaile king prince farewel gouernayle thus fyrst prince gouerned ryght knight suffre ye people haue wrōg trouth iudges shew lighte forth city wt loue drawe long holy church vertue made stronge labour ye plough ne fayle nought proporciō ymage wrought matter hole exemplyfy kyng roboam false oppression wilful frowarde tiranny lost great party hys region wherfore let prince considre reason god set people lordes auantage oppressed wyth seruage vpon prince bochas doth complaine haue custome manere agayne subiectes vngoodly disdaine pride shewe frowarde chere counsayleth remembre lere chapitre doth finally deuise fyrst labour al lorshyp dyd aryse iiii chapiter howe mucius sceuola sloughe innocent stede kynge porcenna layde siege rome whan kynge porcenna wyth hys chiualrye agayne romains werre fyrst began towne besiegynge eche party great puyssaunce brought tus • citie knightly mā mucius sceuola cast distres breke y• sege thorough high prowes let arme hym selfe clene plate mayle comune profite auaunce corrage kynge porcenna proudly assaile tyme prouyded auauntage siege make hys passage finally comynge jeoparte person slee kynge lyke telleth v tytus liuius wher porcenna satte royal see senatoure manly mucius sawe prince great auctoritee kyng resemblynge clad one liueree atwene dece • nyng maner variaunce slough prince ignoraunce whan knewe dyd faile slee procenna enemy toun sawe lost al hys trauayle made pitouse lamentacion bycause dyd execucion ignoraunce agayne owne entent spare tirant slee innocent selfe full worth founde negligent dede hand vnto fyre goth made brenne bryght glede nerfe bone fleshe shede hand cōsuming piece yondre arme made parte sondre storye declareth vnto v manly man noble senatour afore tyme called mucius y• comon profite great labour vncouth hasty fell rigour done hym selfe romaine al sceuola dyd hym call moch say langage lande take ryght exposicion man without hande hym succession ofsprynge borne toun remembraunce encrese fame sceuola bare hym name example many mo men list corrages awake shoulde se perill wo comon profit men haue vndertake whylom brutus lucrecis sake tarquin chaced transgression kynges rome toun touching lucrece example wifely trouth yong tarquin falsly oppresse y• whych great routh howe selfe slough heuynesse nedeth reherse processe sith y• chaucer chefe poete bretaine wrote lyfe legende soueraine rehersynge amonge thynges eche circumstaunce eche occasion romains exiled fyrst kynges neuer reigne toun olde cronicles make mencion remēbring also vnkinde great outrage eneas done dido cartage eke story whiche wrote lyue ful notably wt euery cyrcūstaunce fate pitiously dyd discriue lyke fyll put remembraūce wherfore shulde penne auance making put memory men would deme presūpcion veine glory sterre presence sunne lesyth freshnes hys clere lyght rudenesse vnder skyes dunne dareth ful lowe hath lost sight compared agayne y• beames bryght poete wherefore vayne thinge sayd hym wryte new againe ☞ v chapiter ¶ howe lucrece oppressed tarquin slough selfe bvt lucrece stynte wyll whyle pytie storye hide slouthe penne rude style sake al matter set side also lorde bad abyde good auice layser translate doleful processe pitouse fate folowynge trace collucius wrote declamacion lamētable doleful pitous wher discriueth dolorouse treason constrained false oppression wrought compassed vnware vyolence lyght vntroubled clere conscience father whilom called spurius worthy husbande named collatyn luxurie treason odious viciouse outrage sextus proude tarquin oppressed brought fyne whose deedly sorowe englishe make pitouse ruth penne fele quake said tarquin yuel auised knyght slaūdred man hateful dede came lyke thefe ala vpon nyght naked sworde whan man toke hede vpon lucrece quakyng drede lyeng bed ferre folkes al knewe refuge helpe call manasyng froward entent beholdyng furiouse chere sworde would assente boy would preint yfere one vgly manere vnlykely persone fame thus thrat slaunder name entent whan dyd fele sawe meane woful chaunce morowe list nothynge concele told husbande holy gouernaunce hym requirynge vengeaunce vpon cryme sayde lyke true wyfe would hert perce wyth knyfe matter fantasy better dye lyue shame lasse yl put ieopardy mortal body good fame whan honor dieth farewel mānes name better thys life disceiuer slandrous fame sley man euer purpose husband sayd nay father also thereto contrary makynge promise without delay vengeaunce howe wyl tary declaring reason debonary vnder wordes trouth right cōserued slee selfe hath nothynge deserued sodainly also vnauised foole trapped snare vnware fraude vpon practised thou disceiued plainly declare hauyng thys conceyte harde repayre name thē falsly diffamed whan wrōg report y• renome hath shamed touchyng thy person dare affirme seyn maner impossible lyke thynge neuer yet seen thy worshyp found corruptyble stedfast aye indiuysible vnparted vertuous made strong nowe desirous auenge thy wronge thy iniury shal auenged considred first deedly heuines thou suffredest great aduersite whan y• auoutrour thy beauty dyd oppres reioysyng false gladnes maugre thy wyll thefe nyght encombred force myght thou woldest leue thy mourning restraine thy unportable wo soone shuldest yu se egall punyshyng vpon thy frowarde mortal foe warne shal nomore chastisynge false auoutry thy renome ryght magnify diffasyng thy trewe entent though youth vnbridled went large aforce sely innocent whose wyckednes oughte bere charge ryght thy conscience dyscharge ioye vnlefull false plesaunce double palme thine honor doth auance conceiue se thou myne lucrece reason good discrecion shoulde thy trouble thy mournynge cece ryght restrayne thy opinion rechelesly punicion knife hande slee thy selfe ala others gylt dyddest trespas let lucrece let thy dole cease thy complaynt thy wo restrayne fro lyue alone al sole thy deth perpetually complayne▪ put thy father importable payne welfare rechelesse dye leaue childre motherlesse prudence eke thou oughtest se aduertyse onely reason though force thy body corrupt thy soule inwarde thyne entencion fraunchysed ben al corrupcion offence none consider thyne entent wyll hert yeue therto ful consent thou naked thy bed lyenge alone vnware slepynge voide myght suspeciouslesse al comynge tyme namely y• nyght fearefull woman manly knyght al vnknightly dede wyth naked swerde assayle thy womanhead myght thy body force wel oppresse sleyghty way sought wele wote al sturdinesse myght neuer haue mastry thy thought body yelded hert yelded nought ye twaine yu feble ryght stronge thy trouth afforced werker wrong mightest yu haue greater price laude ryght considred trouth equite fyrst coūterpeysed force sleighty fraud parseuer feminite thought enhaunced infragilitie womanheade haue hert stable thige myght cōmedable wel knowe yu herte aye one false lustes contrary gouernaunce lyke ymage kerued stone lyke woman fleshely plesaunce tirant foūde thee chere countenaūce whych euer womanly victory shalbe ascriued thine encrease glory thy father brutus hath well excused selfe also thy blood thy kynrede matter let mused sley thy selfe thy side blede certes lucrece thou hast ful litell nede great wronge iudgement spare tirant slee innocent thy lyfe murdre woulde seme thou gylty thou art clene diuers wittes diuersly wyl deme report thyng thou none dyddest mene thou shalt paciently sustene tyll thy chaste wyfely innocence may se hym punished violence folke wyl deme person innocent wilfully whan cuipable yeldeth selfe deth iudgement neuer fore gyit partable doome vpon selfe vengeable causeth people tho reporte noughte deme thinge y• neuer ywrought auenged vpon thine owne life excusynge thy deedly fame shewe thou art true wedded wyfe wenyng deth get name deuise thou art greatly blame wher yu yet knowest thy honor clerely shyne yeue people matter deuyne worde lucrece dyd abrayde full deedly loke chere againe euyn thus sayde let husbande let father dere speke matere lest men dempt hindryng name idred death false dyffame counsayle shal lyfe conserue sorowe sclaunder gladnes lesse yl houre sterue euer languish sorowe heuines deth maketh ende al worldly distres sayde syth ful yore ago better die euer liue wo whan worship creature staine deed slaūdrous report better death dredful payne endure false noyse aye liue discōfort newe newe diffame hath resort neuer dyeth quickeneth y• outrage hateful tonges venimous langage deuer halowe make stable chast chambres wyfely gouernaunce case ye variable false auoutry vengeaunce shal folow euerlastynge remembraūce true spousaile ye haue herde deuised citie broke chastifed ye founde case negligent punish auoutry right charge slouth ye assent luxurie vubridled shall ren abrode large shal conscience discharge woman stande sickernes lucrece afforced clennes dere husbande ioy shulde thine estate maner place lyke thy wyfe cherishe thine armes goodly enbrace gilt horrible considred trespace tarquyn ala welaway persō may neuer wast away father mine shuldest thou cal day thyne owne doughter dere ala refuse woman al thy plesaunce whilom entere within thy house whan lere clere example manifolde doctrine al pertained vertuous discipline haue lost dayes olde dispaired recure agayne myne owne childre dare beholde bycause wombe haue layne diffouled pollute certaine tofore chastitie conserued chastise auoutrer hath deserued part speke wordes fewe lenger liue haue fantasie face shewe dare appere company sith derke spot false auoutry shal euermore whether false true myne hindring y• sclaundre renewe lust afforced hath false appetite offrelte included nature maugre wyll foloweth delite folkes say euery creature good fame lost ful hard recure sith may harmes redresse open gilt wil confesse al againe wil oppressed maner constrained lust dede power might redressed feblenesse stand great drede offence deth shalbe mede sith leuer haue edge tole slee selfe lyue slaūder dole father myne spare haue pitie dere husbande rue myne offence goddes goddess called chastitie trespace graunt indulgence gylt make recompence venus gate vaūtage deth shal redresse chastise myne outrage make delay perse brest wt sharpnes knyfe men would deme say fro day day make sclaūder open rife howe tendre life thā worship gret shame loue life good name matter witnes good put awaye false suspection knife shed hert bloud myght make better purgacion al folke haue discrecion finally deth excuse gylt horible whych men accuse go forth soule pure immortal chefe wytnes myne innocence tofore tho iudges ben infernal fyrst mynos kyng deme conscience radamanthus yeue sentence lyke desertes might sene wyfely trouth clene thou erthly body thy fairnes auoutry ful great occasion thy bloud shede rednes thy side let raile doun stere exite people toun deuer within litle whyle loue tarquyn al kynges exile fyrst pray husbande entere vengeaunce make delay helpe socour father dere punyshe y• auoutrer al haste ye may let take wage pay lyke ye se plainly nowe conceyue offence death receiue sodaynly myght aduerte toke knyfe great violence brest euyn hert made glyde resistence ful pale deed fyl presence occasion piteous dede tarquyn exyled holy kynrede cause recorde writyng neuer rome cite day man crowned kyng cronicles ye may beholde se thus luxurie cruelte tiranny false extorcion exiled rome toun vi chapter ¶ howe rome gouerned virginea father slayne gouerned officer remembred titus liuius called decemuiri diuers croniclers amonge whyche one appius judge vntrue proud luxurious y• citie story bereth witnes behated great falsenes one fyll cast loke vpon maide inly fayre sight false desire within hert toke dysuse agayne al skyl ryght doughter worthy knyght ful manly founde dedes al vyrginius y• romains cal whose goodly doughter ye story doth v lere hym noble fame virginia called goodly entere cause bare name appius greatly blame hath conspired great falsnes y• might beauty oppresse iuge vntrue thought dede law vnrightful sought occasion made sergiaunt procede agayne mayde take accion claimed seruant false collusion done appius entent might yeue iudgement meane false delite thought myght beautie best disuse accomplishe fleshly appetite beyng feble accion refuse wherupon father gan muse fully conceiued appius maner defence wrought ye shal whan appius yeuen iudgement againe mayde afore stode manly father knighty entent toke apart thought good wyth knyfe shed hert bloud dempt better slee clennes tirant beauty oppresse thus hole conserued virginite vndefouled maydenhede vyrgynius kepe honeste spared nothyng make side blede appius horrible dede decemuiri vnhappye chaūce citye neuer gouernaūce story also maketh mencion appius ashamed dede slough selfe fetred prison false iuge lo final mede tho tribuni rome gan succede twene right wronge truely discerne romayne lawes iustly gouerne men may se myrour clere estate chaunged great offence poore person singulere prince put doun magnificence cōsidred great excellēces god ordeineth yerde sōdry wise poore sūwhile pompous chastise shewe example anone ryght marked story notable thynge pausanias grece manly knight macedony slough philip kyng table sitting atwene alexandre olimpiades wrong auenge amyddes al prees eke salmator knyght low degree wronges done especial manly force grounded equite slough cartage prince hasdrubal brother vnto duke haniball besyde riuer met batayle called metaure renneth itaile wherefore ye prince ye lyst longe endure right wel ware ye neuer stronge lordshyppes much assure surquedy porayle wronge discrecion conceyuing euer amonge greatest drede may state assay • whan subiection doth people fayle ¶ lenuoye tragedy declareth partye myschefe foloweth extorcion eke spousbrech auoutry tarquyn doue false extorcion vnto lucrece wythin rome toun kynges exyled misgouernayle false outrage done porayle eke appius wylful tiranny agayne virginia toke accion false lust frowarde lechery blent fer derked memory reason chefe cause occasion estate dizhom dyd fayle false outrage done porayle kyng philyp lost sceptre regally macedone famous regyon vnwarely slayne amyd chiualry sittyng table wt chefe dongeon greatest cause fallyng doun whan fortune pride dyd assaile false outrage done porayle duke hasdrubal whome bokes magnify vp heuyn hys hygh renoun whose triumphes raught vp sky al cartage subiection yet slayne vnwarely treason seruant lo doth auayle treason purposed afore porayle noble prince reason applye whych ouer people haue dominacion prudently gouerne gye loue drede true affectyon preserue harte false rebellion • syth nothynge may preuayle true subiection expert porayle vii chapiter ❧ jeroboham kyng israel idolatry disobedience came myscheuous ende nexte storyes bochas fynde dyd appere vnto presēce kynges syxe hym praying haue mynd vpon fal vnware violence theyr estate royal excellence fore al fynde came al israel kyng jeroboam vnto myne aucthour gan declare deedly complaynt pale face great mischeues yuel fare howe fyl downe frō kyngly place vnhappes dyd enbrace story plainly hath deuysed offence howe chastised idolater tolde reysed vp auters force myght set therupon two calfes pure golde dyd worshyp agayne al skyl ryght gaue euel example people syght whan dyd wyth fume ensence false ydols vndue reuerence fro temple made people gone priestes ordained owne gise forsoke trybe leuy aaron vpon bethel offryng gan deuyse whyle dyd vnleful sacrifice god well knewe hym false entent jerusalem prophet hym sent whych rebuked misgouernaūce gan parels hym specifye told afore vengeaunce dauid kyng come one josye priestes falsly coud lye manly distroy slee al one asshes bren fleshe bone token distruction prophet tolde among al auters shoulde bowe doun ydols stage fal foles goddes falsly cal haue power helpe maner may neyther se fele thys prophet jadan tolde sayde signes playnly kyng auter fyl peces many folde ouerturned backewarde offring whych kyng furiously loking put forth hand story maketh mynde bad men prophet take bynde arme raught length power wythdrawe ageyne wext vnweldy contract lost strength whan kyng token hath seyne▪ ye prophet spake word veyne greatly astoyned coude say praied jadan arme restore prayer mediacion arme vengeaunce anone made restitucion payne feleth aleyaunce kyng wt ful great instaūt required hym graciouse day abyde dyne house prophet would assent nouther wyth hym eate drynke toke asse forth anone went whose departyng y• kyng gan sore thynke fantasy gan hert synke specially whan toke hede token howe true dede god • ad jadan great emprise jeroboham fyrste whan sent eate drinke maner wyse citie whyle present nother prophet entent ful olde slygh syde compelled hath jadan abyde hym aforsyng false collusion resorte agayne vnto citye make contradiction hym dyne fraternitye hym affyrmynge may none god sent frende brother abyde plainly none frendlyhede true affection within house shewe presence repast refection goddes wyl fully sentence whose wordes y• prophet yaue credence sate dyner fere god vnto jadan sayd thys maner brekyng comaundement thy great offence thy transgression thou hast wylfull negligent thou shalt endure punicion al torne rent lyon thy countrey thou shalt recure prophetes haue thy sepulture thing jadan nothynge fayne gan departe ful heuy thought lion amyd way slayne asse harmed right nought full great maruaile wel sought lyon syttyng diffence kept al violence al token myght conuert jeroboam fro iniquitie goddes warnyng hym lyst aduerte hys prophete corrected wherefore god would se vengeaunce folowe dyd dede vpon hym kynred sonne fyl great sickenes called abia boke doth specify whych king bad quene dresse go disgised without company vnto prophet called achy hym require truely sey whether chyld lyue dey inward syght cōtemplatife god shewed hym clere inspection jeroboam wyfe al sleyghty transformacion nouther falla false decepcion may god parceyued • e prophet may deceyued came straunge wede entryng called name come forth quod nede hide thy selfe shame trouth truely attame god hath yeuen fully knowledging thou shalt answere say kyng say plainly marke thy thought thy repayre wordes rehersyng syth god hath made thee raysed vp nought seruant reigne kynge fro dauids kyn worthy reigning parted kyngdome yeuen vnto thou vnkynde therof canst nothyng se great goodnesse remēbraunce fully forgeten thy frowarde pride false goddes put thyne affiaunce god aboue falsly set asyde wherefore anon shall deuyde kyngdome hole wythout delay fro thy lyne crowne take away thou hast thy confusion thy fayth vnfaithful false goddes take wrongly refused thy religion god aboue playnly hym forsake ende whych y• thou shalt make thee thy kyn man may socour fleshe skyn bone houndes shal deuour thy entrynge home cite thy sonne thou shalt fynde deed al hys kin though none founde good take therof good hede whych answere y• quene fil great drede entryng citie especial childe dede lay colde wal thys warning king toke none hede made redy wt ful great aparayle forty thousande wyth dyd lede manly men armed plate maile king abias haue batayle whiche abias juda kinge vnto people said metynge noble knightes haue one thing memory man venquisheth platly cōclude great people getteth victory nombres heaped greate multitude false ydolaters god wyl delude suffre seruaunts ben true sad miscreauntes ouerlad triumphe none found newe olde idol stone siluer shene calues mettall made golde yeue partie vntruly meane sithe y• god knoweth quarel clene ther hope force none myght y• groūde cause right hope victory standeth vpō right wisnes yt cast sinful life amende lyst forsake wrong al falsnes hole hert vnto lorde entende shal day grace sende true cause truely termyne thus abias gan tale fyne preestes gan trūpes blowe kyng abias high renoun gaue people high low ful manly comfort consolacion fyfty thousand computacion slayne y• day ful proudly came vpon party kyng jeroboam al partye jeroboam al lyne borne thys batayle vnto mischefe came whan slayne wt hoūdes al torne prophet thē told beforne kyng toke therof hede soden vengeaunce god quit mede ¶ viii chapter howe zaras king ethyope slayne batayle hym bochas dyd appere next ordre playnly fynde one zaras wyth soroufull chere kyng ethyope jude whose eyen almost wt wepyng blynde prayeng myne auctour vnhappy chaūce woful put remembraunce would recorde scripture sodayne fall dolorous distresse diffamous hateful discomfiture dispoylynge great richesse king asaph thrugh high noble people dyd thē assaile hath venquished slayne batayle ix chapiter howe adab kyng jerusalem lost sceptre crowne israell came wooful • kynge called adab ful pytously wepyng vnto bocas cōplaint rehersing kyng basa subtyll false werkyng slaughter caused fallyng whan fortune gan falsely frowne toke vniustly frō sceptre crowne x chapiter ¶ howe vengeable prynce zambrias set toure fyre brente hym selfe next came zābrias prince vēgeable whiche slough kinge helam false treason founde also ful vnstable zambrias entencion hath murdred within chefe dongeon castel wyth ful great route vnwarely layde siege aboute amarin prince ful great might came tharse famous great citye cast playnly lyke worthy knight zambrias auenged hym distroy without mercy pitie toure zambrias went set fyre hym selfe brent ☞ xi chapiter king achab jezabel wife sighes sore wepig importable came kyng achab vnto bochas whose hertelie sorowe incōparable complayning ful oft sayd ala besechyng write woful case compile falling fate yfere athalia owne doughter dere god aboue contrarious thys achab al gouernaunce wyfe cruel lecherous called jesabel whiche set al plesaunce goddes prophetes vengeaunce bible malice men may se idolater god trespaces well seyne afore shewed true prophecy sent thre yere neither dewe ne reyne vpon erth graine multiplye tyl eft agayne prayer helye holsome water heuin gan discend gaue thē cause life amend wyfe cursed jesabel eche thing hateful diuine hundred prophetes slough israel vnto baal would inclyne also slough naboth vyne whose outrage false oppression achab brought confusion enemyes outrayed bataile sharpe arow caught fatal woūde tyi al blode bledyng dyd faile hys chare wt many droppes rounde wordes ful true founde helias told stode hungry houndes lycke blod citye called israel downe toure ioyned wall sayd quene called jesabel ouer cast deadlye fal touching mischeues cause beware ye prince remēbring lyues eschue false coūsayle yeuē wiues ☞ xii chapiter ¶ quene athalia tiranny slayne next achab ordre dyd sue athalia wt doleful countenaunce bocas besechyng hym thought due sodayne fal put remembraunce sour chefe rote sorow mischance vsurpaciō false couetise lyke story herafter shal deuyse vpreised fauour thre thinges father broder also husbande tyme echone crowned kinges scepter sworde ye shal vnderstād many emprises day toke hande howe fortune highnes dyd assaile cast shortly make rehersayle fyl fortune vnhappye boundes fyrst whan father wt arow dede blod vplicked wt cruel hūgry houndes chare rennyng downe ful rede body pale lay toke hede lyke carreyne naked dispoyled foule black erth amyd felde ysoyled cause another vnhappy heuynesse deedly desolacion people felly dyd dresse arabye rebellion agayne husband entencion robbe treasour auauntage take richesse outragious pillage meyny put prison agaynst thē made defence spared nother citie borough ne toun slough man chyld sturdy violēce lorde enfect wyth sodaine pestilence conceyued fully malady gayne must nede dye deth wretched odible body corrupt bowelles fyl doun carayne stench horible ayre enfect hym enuyron great horrour putrifaction man myght abyde endure bryng body vnto sepulture third vnhap whereof ful fayne fortune lyst efte assayle made vncle kyng joram slayne arow fled batayle supposyng greatly auayle lyke woman furious wode king dauid slough al ye rial blode purpose gouerne al realme alone selfe haue dominacion reigne juda jerusalem athalia vsurpacion cause entencion mortal sworde made tho fyne discēded frō dauid doun lyne except one joas left one lyue chyld yere sonne kyng och • sy josaketh story disctiue pitie caught fantasy childe saue shal dye malice athalia wyfe byshop joiada byshop hole hert entere kept chylde ful secret wyse within temple space seuen yere seuenth storye doth deuise joiada toke emprise yonge joas vpon certayne day iust title crowne may messangers sendeth anone prince tribune gan counsaile cal preestes eke leuites euerychone whan discured al hole entent thus befal sworne assented sytting yonge joas shalbe crowned kyng promise y• diuine quod joiada ye take hede god hath behested dauid lyne assured vnto kynred jerusalem shal succede though joas yong tēdre might crowne hath neuer lasse ryghte matter wyl ye slepe shewe true diligence four party temple kepe man entre violence myddes royal excellence quod byshop man shal v let joas heade crowne set whan ech thing brought poynt hys hygh estate encrease magnify people anone whan anoynt viuat rex began cry whan athalia gan thyng espye ire sodayne wonder melancoly clothes cut asonder ran temple gan make fray meyny crye aloude bad go sle make delay yong kyng al hast coude venym hid vnder couerte cloude al one purpose recure sodaine malice gan ye day dyscure temple kept entre none people ordayned awaytyng none might gone clenly armed centuriones cruel quene assayled al one malice wryte short tale slough cedron vale lo ende murdre tiranny lo ende vsurpacion lo ende false conspiracy lo y• ende false presumcion borne rightfull heyres wrongly put doun noble prince though god make strōg ryghtful heyres beware ye wrong ¶ lenuoye tragedy estate degree fully declareth decepcions fortune false mutabilitees shewed prouinces city eke touns prince vnwarely lost possession synnes diuerse wyse god warnyng lyst ryse mighty prince cast downe see lost liues region vnwarely throw felicitees jeroboam oppression frowarde false oblacions done idol story doth deuyse god warning lyst ryse achab also great aduersities false coūsaile exhortacions iezabel rote iniquity dyd false collusion vnwarely slayne great couetise god warnyng lyst ryse prince remembre prosperitees se afore discrecions wrong clyming vp state degree outher murdre false treason asketh fal final guerdon namely lord dispise warnyng lyst rise xiii chapter ¶ howe dydo quene cartage slough selfe conseruacion chastitie nowe muste put rude stile prees queene dido makynge passage lorde siche priest hercules father belus fal great age kyng tire quene carthage red bokes ben true fyrst tire found purple hewe chadmus founde fyrst letter write gaue grekes made mencion whose brother fenix clerkes eke endite founde first colour vermilion cartage famous mighty toun sayd dido story doth expres quene founderesse husband chefe lorde fyre called sicheus full famous renoun noble citie called tyre great treasour great possession enuy kyng pigmalion broder dido siche slough dede false entent richesse possede dido slaughter toke greuously hert sore complayning vnhappy chaunce cast would might asterte flye tire lyfe auaunce al treasour haboundaunce behynde left whan lorde dede shyppes entryng went awaye drede knewe drede gredy auarice brother kyng pigmalion hateful vnstauncheable vice grounde rote chefe occasion y• lord slayne toun whome cried ful oft wel away whose deth cause fled away also opinion caused hertly heuinesse sith brother pigmalion slayne lorde great ryches abode woulde hym dresse
