parcel malice parcel couetyse haue treasour treason practise eschewe malice treason nauy maketh ordinaunce auise reason ryght set affiaunce ful redy plesaunce one assent nothynge would fayle fayre dydo lande sayle cypre fyrst aryuaile • e founde riuer syde yong maydens wt ful rych apparayle sixty ten tyde whiche temple venus dyd abyde custome reporte cypriens straungers disporte faythful humble wyse ryghtes cypre countre vnto venus eche day sacrifice conserue virginite duryng life lyue chastitye neuer ioyned mariage wt quene dydo went cartage passage fyll great myrracle seruius maketh mencion dydo toke juno oracle outher apparyng aduision cartage bylde myghty toun reuerence great goddesse party fast gan dresse sayd citye stately founde werkemen erth sought ox head auenture founde quene dido anone head brought meninge wherof serche thought clerkes deumayle tolde token seruage trauayle list buylde place remeued ought ryght fro thence litel space soyle founde ful dylectable sight werkmen wyth full myght grounde gan serch toke hede story telleth found horse head expownyng deuinours founde beast myght greatly auaile vnto prince mighty conquerours necessary werre batayle wight noblesse shoulde assaile cartage buylded great excellence againe al enemyes stand diffence bokes declare specify dydo dyd much land purchace skyn rounde might occupy oxe theron buyld place grounde cōpassed toke large space whych strongly buylded thus befal skyn men byrsa dyd cal whan citie mightily walled skyn wrought good curray name toke carta called lether birsa plainly nay toke eke name durynge many day carta birsa knit langage much say word carthage affryke stant teritory builded citye dilectable founded laude memory mighty juno goddesse honorable citye walled wt tower strong stable time kyng dauid amidde fourth age sayd erst called cartage great worshyp raygned y• towne euer purpose liue chastitie rounde floured renowne prudence honestye tyll report famous beautye came eares gladly wil hide kyng dwelled beside musytans lorde syre poetes playnly lyst decryue whiche hart greatly gan desire quene dido assent wiue vnto grace might aryue auowed chastitie neuer cast maried kyng supprised wt loue courage wisdome great bountee sent prince carthage matter haue treatee condiscende might like desire best entent deuoyre make consent request gan eke manace fayled entencion like desire stande grace sayd would enemy towne ordayne force destruction fully sober fully rage playnely langage knewe great stedfastnes hart immutable aferde word expresse lest aunswere acceptable highnes treatable eke conceyt gan also recorde desyre quene would accorde good aduice answere puruey purpose party fauourable aferde would noble towne werrey disdayne vpon vengeable quene dydo entent aye stable cast would whatsoeuer tolde chast auowe faythfully holde set aside cruell kyng fell manaces word great prynces consentyng stode feare y• threate vnto yaue maner heate bolde attempt attame treate matter rebounding shame nay rather dye quod assent desire whiche thing god forbede fro tenter chaste entent remeue thought dede whiche disclaunder womanhead condiscende manacyng breake vowe pleasaunce kynge touchyng manaces made citie destroy great myght without cause title equitie ground quarell agayne right onely blynded syght froward lust chaste auowe assaile ryght well sure therof shall fayle ye bolde manly courage comon profite citye defende wtstande vycious outrage treate wt ye would condiscende mine entent platly comprehend whether ioye displeasaunce promise shalbe variaunce lorde sicheus whiche ala deade vnto worlde lyst aduert trust verely manacyng dreade shall neuer dye myne hert shall neuer myne auowe peruert thus auysed stande fre quene cartage gouerne citye mine hasty answere pray disdaine ye list yeue libertye support may attayne haue space graunted vnto mene space monethes thre lordes accomplyshe entent whiche whilome made testament vnder couloure aduauntage toke space bokes specify might citye cartage meane time strongly fortify agayne enemy sluggardy would high estate confound vnpurueyed city founde whan thre monethes passed gone would hartly pleasaunce sundry ryghtes many mo one goddes obseruaunce speciall singuler remembraunce ye shall vnderstande whilom lorde best beloued husband exalt glory honour held exequtes due reuerence cartage highest tower brenning fire fume incence prince beyng presence whyche gan declare complaynyng deadly sorow frō tower loking farewel frendes farewell euermore vnto lord husband must gone meane y• lorde yore husbandes god wot haue one praiyng report euerichone death dydo cartage joyned one maryage say kyng whiche manaced chaste beauty woulde assaile go tell passed purpose shall faile manacyng shall auayle say dydo dyed none would wedded thē one leuer haue life lose rather soyle wydowes chastitie let go chose case shall spede treasure mine honesty haue truely obserued lyue depart worlde blyue fire brent clere bryght ran haste sayne saue knyfe euery man sight full sodaynly rofe hart twayne whose piteous death city gan complayne sore wepyng wonder ruthe woman finde great truth death busines holde halowe feast funerall worshipped like chaste goddesse commended inespeciall heauenly goddes goddes infernall wydowes clothes blake feast wept sake touching dydo let stryfe though accused ouide bochas wrote chaste life contrary haue set aside thought better abide goodnes thing rehearse dede might resowne womanhede eneas though fauourable itayle makyng passage commendable receyue commyng cartage tho folke large langage amisse expoune report expresse thing done hym onely gentlenes shall made rehearsayle finde wrytten bochas say well may much auayle froward speach many diuers case cartage oft sayd ala death cōplaynyng throughout citye whiche slew selfe obserue chastitye ¶ lenuoy ayre dydo stable thy constan̄ce quene cartage myrror hie noble raignyng glory vertuous habundaūce called thy time chefe sour gentilnes neuer founde doublenes aye one hart thou diddest fyne light trouth al wydowes enlumin chast vnchaunged thy perseueraunce immutable founde goodnes whiche neuer thoughtest vpon variaunce force prudence wardeins thy fayrenes haue langage thy vertues expresse new report clerely shyne light trouth al widowes enlumine lode starre good gouernaunce vycious lustes wisdome represse thy grene youth flouryng pleasaūce thou didst brydle wt vertuous sobernes dyane demeaned chastly thy clennesse whyle thou sole playnely termyne light truth al wydowes enlumyne thy famous bounty put remembraūce thou slewe thy selfe innocent purenes lest thy surenes hanged balaunce cast thi chastitie oppres death inoughe beare therof witnes causyng thy beauty clennes enclyne light vertue al widowes enlumine ¶ lenuoy dyrect wydowes translatoure noble matron whiche haue suffisaūce womanhead wittes vpdresse fortune list turne chaunce retchlesse sodayne hastines ay prouide stablenes foly enter courage folow dydo quene cartage maners haue none acquayntaunce put minde sottyshe wilfulnes slea selfe great penaunce god grace defende blesse preserue variant brotlenes trouth fall none outrage folow dido y• quene cartage couert colour sober countenaunce faythfull meanyng pretendeth likenes counterfayteth speache dalyaunce thinge sowneth stedfastnes prudence great auisenes selfe restrayneth yonge olde age folow dydo quene cartage let port voyde displeasaunce get frendes busines neuer without purueyaunce shall ye best encrease ryches one alone may sykernes hart dyuers langage contrary dydo yt quene cartage holde seruauntes vnder obeysaunce let neuer haue fredome largenes vnder daunger obseruaunce daunt pryde brydle wt lownes whan serpent newefanglenes assayleth aduauntage contrary dydo y• quene cartage ¶ xiiii chapter ☞how vycious sardanapalus kyng assirie brent selfe treasure assirie reken kynges whiche lande vnder subiection last sardanapall feminyne condicion wherfore fortune hath cast downe complaynyng vgly manere next dydo bochas appere vycious lust life enclyne among assyriens whan raigne gan false vsage feminine among woman vpon rocke span habite disgysed man froward fleshly insolence men fledde presence first kyng chase gyde mother vyces called ydlenes whiche custome eche vertue set asyde eche courte maistresse sorow mischefe first foundresse caused onely sardanapall goodnes wittes appall founde vp first ryote dronkennes called father lust lechery hatefull harte sobernes cherishyng surfetes watche glotony called time prynce baudry founde reresuppers fetherbeddes soft drynke late chaunge wine oft ayre meates baudy coke custome day rost sede sauoure spittes ladels fleshe hokes loued well toke great hede folke dranke nede smellynge wine great excesse abide holly gladnes thought also good haue without skyll right boystous bochers bespreint bloude watry fisher abode aye syght coates poudred wt scale siluer bryght dempt odour duryng lyfe courage best preseruatyfe herbe spice grasse ne rote lusty bordelhouse gardeyn none holesome sote pleasaunce delicious presence folke lecherous euer glad speake rybaudry folke cheryshe coulde flatter lye tyll last god right displeased condicions euery mannes sight feminyne affection wholy yaue inclination duryng life euery vycious thing terrible heare namely kyng bochas list put minde whan arbactus prince great renowne sawe kyng fleshely lust blynde made people region agaynst coniuration sent misgouernaunce high disdayne full playne defyaunce bade beware proudly tolde cast vicious life assaile haste also woulde within fielde mete battayle wherof astonied hart gan fayle among womē sate makyng gaudes wight flatterer baudes vp rose gan selfe auaunce company wt seruauntes ryotous toke felde without gouernaunce men armes folkes vycious whose aduersary called arbactus made proudly felde forsake like cowarde castell take hart frowardly gan fayle like knyght like loseniour riche pierrey royal apparayle golde iewels vessell treasure brought afore downe fro toure palace yaue men charge cole fagot make fyre large whiche cast treasoure iewels like beast manly man amyd rich stone vessel fire furiously ranne triumphe sardanapalus wanne whiche fyre consumed finall mede brent ash among cole rede tofore death bade men write vpon graue boke dothe specify letter large reason endite cursed life froward glotony mine ydlenes myne hatefull lechery hath caused many false desire last dayes consumpt fyre epitaphe graue set shew liue busyed euer hinder let maner vertue theragayne striue foloweth trace like thriue whiche ye prynces se auayle vengeaunce aye foloweth vyces tayle xv chapter ¶ commendation bochas rehersing vertuous name foūders diuers science cunnynges reprefe ydlenes list prouide false fleshly lustes dissolution ryote outrage froward disdaine pride vyces enhaunce affection many vnlefull croked condicions reason auoyding rehearse shall selues delityng bestiall two maner folkes put remembraunce vyce vertue put difference good alway hath set pleasaunce vertuous labour diligence vycious people slouth negligence report bothe reserued laude lacke haue deserued men must ryght vertuous preferre truely prayse laboure busines agayn warde disprayse folke erre whiche haue ioye ydlenes compate maner witnes▪ vertuous folke mynde call rebukyng kyng sardanapall olde wise called pitagoras soūd hāmers auctours certifye example toke chefe master founde musyke melody yet tuball bokes specify bi stroke smyths thei stode founde first musyke tofore no floude josephus remembreth scripture tuball could forge wele first ymagined makyng armure instrumentes yron stele temprures found euery dele lucius tarquyn story finde founde chaynes fyrst folke fetter binde child seth story ye may se flouryng vertue longe succession profite posteritie first craft heauenly mocions founde sundry starres reuolucions bequeth cunnyng great aduauntage came linage vertue god gaue great cūnyng touching nature earth heauen remembred sothly writyng lasten aye water leuen generation seuen whiche vertue wtout warre strife traueyled cūnyng durynge life adam prophecy twise world destroyed water one stande ieopardy next fire whiche man might flee seth child see made two pyllers men might graue fire water charects saue one made tyles harde ybake fro touche fire saue scripture harde marble another make water strongly endure saue letter prynt figure cunnyng afore gan prouide agayne fire water perpetually abyde dempt cunnyng ben veyne folke ben partable laboure seyne remembred wrytyng full notable tofore god thing full commendable folow scripture writyng men dye depart cunnyng olde time folke diuers craftes founde sundry wise occupacion vertue cherishe vyces confounde witte set entencien put laboure execution outrage trouth fro mannes life negligence slouth olde enoke full famous vertue duryng age founde first euerich one prudence letter hebrue piller kept stone till floude noe gone cam seconde mo hebrue letter founde cathacrismus first fande letter also langage letter written god owne hande moses first toke moste bright vysage vpon syna helde passage whiche carectes name sentence writyng difference eke afterward bokes tell saint hierome rehearseth style vnder empyre zorobabell esdras hebrue gan letter first compyle abraham long erst great first bokes men may se found letter ciria calde isys egypt founde diuersitie sundry letter parted twaine first priestes comontie vulgar letter also ordayne fenices busy payne letter greke finde entent whiche cadmus first grece sent whiche number fully seuentene whan troy ended battayle pallamides langage sustene put thre therto whiche greatly auayle pitagoras prudent gouernaile founde first figure discerne life short life eterne first latin letter b c carmentes founde full high prudence great omerus isidor ye may see founde amonge grekes craft eloquence first rome souerayne excellence rethoryke tullius founde stoures plea defence subtill oratours callicrates grauer notable white yuore busines hande eye iust stable ampt graue likenes vpon ground nature doth dresse craft founde sardanapall founde ydlenes mother vyces scriueyn bochas maketh mencion scrowe little quantitye wrote croy destruction folowyng omerus great subtiltye whiche among grekes great daintie founde writyng compendious story rehearsyng archimides made chare also small shyp apparayle bee might close two vnder wing great maruaile nothing sene whole entayle craft founde vertuous busines eschue vyce froward ydlenes pan god kynde pypes seuen recorder founde first melodyes mercury sit hye heauen first harpe founde sugred armonies holsom wine fined lye bacchus founde first vine heauy lade licour lycours courage glade perdry compas founde tryangle lyne euclyd first founde geometrye phebus founde craft medicine al • umasar founde astronomy mynerua gan chares first gye iason first sayled story tolde toward colchos winne flece gold cere goddesse founde first tylth londe • onysius triumphes transitory bellona force first fonde conquest knighthode field victory marti sonne put memory called etholus founde speres sharpe kene runne warre plate bryght shene eke aristeus founde vsage mylke cruddes hony sote piroydes great aduauntage fro flyntes smote fyre daryng rote pallas whiche yt may colde bote founde weauyng sothe yet prudence maner clothe fido founde first science measure proporcions marchauntes diligence finde balaunces iust diuisions auoyde fraude city townes nouther party playnly compyle true weyght gyle compare order clerely thinges founde olde tyme diligent trauayle pleasaunce prynces kynges shewe much cunnyng may auayle wey warde ye froward aquitayle contrariously sardanapall founde ydlenes mother vyces let prince hereof take hede auayleth vertuous busines damage reuerse dothe dede▪ vycious life slouthe ydlenes example let eke empresse amyd harte howe sardanapall founde ydlenes mother vyces ¶ lenuoy noble prynces ye may well se myrrour full clere euidence many example two thre harme foloweth slouth negligence depe imprintyng aduertence great hindring doth wilful frowardnes estate vycyous ydlenes whan reason fayleth sensualitye holdeth brydle lecherous insolence sobernes hath lost libertie false lust done reuerence vyce vertue hath apparence misleadeth prynces wilfull retchlesnes great errour froward ydlenes ¶ xvi chapter ¶ amazias iuda king pride presumption vainquished battaile slayne study bochas sate musyng many vncouth solemne fantasy appeared many mighty kyng tofore came worthy amazie sonne also called ozie dauids bloud discended rede eche juda succede first amazias complayned fortune causing grcuous great aduersities traytoresse called commune kinges twayne castyng frō see whose ouerturnyng dignity vnware fallyng dreadfull terrible ben ceriously remembred bible ende men may reade se fortune fate entrete wherfore eschue flye prolixitie tedious thing processe lete substaunce glea • e grete fallyng purpose spare compendiously cause declare amazias hauyng gouernaunce • ust tytle succession▪ scepter iuda wt y• whole puissaūce full peasably helde possession tyll pryde false presumption frowardly hart embrace whiche one made lose grace hart maner vayne glory god made preuayle conquest haue victory amale • hites vaynquyshe battayle eke gabanites assayle purposyng might israelite pryde fight vnto kyng joas israell sent cōmaundyng obey byddynge like subiecte entent predecessours maner thing whilom dauid noble worthy kyng sonde joas plat playne whiche problē thus wrote agayn vgly thistle vale lowe proudly presumyng aboue degre make hys pryde openly knowe sent hys message cedre tre sonne might wedded daughter althoughe substaunce atwene two great dis • ordauu • e forest beastes sauagyne courage therof disdeyne assent fyersely dyd enclyne thystle leaues abrode vpon pleyne nether lease pricke seyne problē joas writing sent pistle amazie king bvt josephus origynall sayd epistle doth expresse sayth vale pouder small pryde sent hygh cypresse daughter excellent fayrenes vnto sonne playnely discryue myght deliuered haue wyue fel beast beside stode cruell yre indignacion fete disdaynyng ye pouder cast abrode hygh apre enuyron whyche ensample conceyued reason attempteth clymbe hygh aloft unware chaunge fall full vnsoft atwene cedre tree royal sharpe thystle conuenience twene cypresse estately founde lothsome pouder great difference royall bloud haue assistence ioyned •• yt mariage bē brought forth low parage cedre stronge mighty substaūce vpgrowynge ryght lyne tho thystle haue spottes pleasaūce hath eke pryckes small spyne bothe nature playnly termine cedre kynde loketh well thystle braunches loute • olesome odoure faire cypresse bokes tell vertuous kynde dust pouder playnly expresse troubleth ayre maketh folkes blynd whiche spousayle cōuenient fynde let estate byrthe honourable voyde al rascaly wedde semblable amazias woulde beware warnyng prophecy styll hart great hatred bare agayne kyng joas malyce enuy felde brought chyualry gadred bothe nere farre ayenst god gyn warre king joas full like worthy knyght felde fast gan spede knyghtes juda anone ryght stroke vengeaunce wt sodain drede bid flye god wot nede amazias great pryde stode destitute man syde none left meynie god joas agaynst wrought jerusalem entred citye amazie force brought temple treasure sought golde siluer wholy rich samaria home gan dresse amazias let pryson suffred go fre mischefe confusion deliuered captiuitie slayne lachis citye among frendes dissimulation death conspyred vnder full false treason xvii chapter ☞ vpon ozias succeadyng kyng nexte iuda god toke vengeaunce smote leprie juda mighty region next amazias ozias gan succede wonder manlye famous renoun workes full prouident dede knighthode vaiquished rede palestine great puissaūce ambie brought vnto vttraunce builded townes many strong citye vnto egypt bondes set made castels besydes redde see conquest euer met manly pryde woulde let meane tho aduersaries lordshyp make tributary labour also repare jerusalem ruyne walles reared y• soyle lay bare made newe tower ryght lyne fanes golde turretes enlumine force let workman vndertake square bastiles bulwarkes make delited make freshe gardeynes diuers grayne herbes knowe reioysed plante sundrye vynes graffe tree sedes sowe straunge fruit maketh thē grow arow wt enemyes encumber thre hundred thousand manly men nūber noble fame gan sprede wyde greatly dreade prowes wherthrough hart corrupted pride onely great rich frowardly busines maligne estate royall agaynst lorde whiche immortall god aboue gan waxe obstynate processe full small winne sauour caught royall estate folow father vnthrifty synne grace vertue twynne shinyng magnificence fortune proudly assayled excellence cast would within little surquedy frowarde pride assayle full vnwarely deceyue begyle make power appall fayle whan kyng toke apparayle bishop frowardnes temple proudly gan dresse beyng purpose solemne day take waye vp hye alter falsly vsurpyng whosoeuer sayde nay sacrifyce holdyng censere tofore alter shone golde clere whiche offence bible sayth azarias bishop blame gan withstand face anone fourscore priestes beyng presence kynred discended aaron whiche forbade made resistence hande put incence vpon aulter god lawe chargyng boldly presence wtdraw despite made hold pee payne death began manace sodaynly among prees earthquaue fill place therwithall kinges face sunne smote beame bryght face scorched wt light wared leper foule right horible offence god list ordayne euery man loke terrible fewe mischiefe gan complaine great hill ye hour carft twayne farre aside towne without city destroying stode rounde kyng ozie god toke vengeaunce lordship magnificence punishe pride frowarde puissaūce brought lowe great offence person put presence perpetually holy writ tell farre people wt leper dwell fleshe troubled diuers passiōs sickenes auoyded citye crye sorowe lamentacions lise lad great aduersitie dyed sorowe pouertie simply buried great myght within ylande stode farre sight ¶ xviii chapter ¶ exhortation prynces aduised agaynst goddes preceptes let prynces prouidence right wel ware thing attame whiche vnto god offence lest fyne conclude shame let thinke noble fame repent god iustice froward pryde vnwarely chastice let beware malyce presume againe churche •• encion god right tyrantes consume full short tyme presumption whiche suffer theyr dominacion enterrupt great myght breke fraūches holy churche ryght prudent prynces whiche discerne let kyng ozias considryng offence mynde myrrour lanterne holy churche due reuerence conce • ue magnificence god ryght neuer ••• ng chastyce theyr malyce though • yde long ¶ xix chapter kyng oseas taken kyng salmanazer dyed pryson another called osce whilom raygned affirme dare israell fortune enuy made take ware besyeged kyng salmanas assirie vnder daunger bible telleth prysoner cityes townes brought destruction people vnder longe seruage take kept stronge babilon suffred great payne domage pryson furious outrage sayd oseas chaynes bounde sore sorowe dyed hym write xx chapter ¶ howe senacheryb kynge assirie slewe selfe forsayde wofull kynges three senacheryb assirye kyng came bochas vglye se full piteously fate complaynyng specially hys vnware chaungyng gan bewayle oppressed thought hye noble came nought renowne sprade many reme people gan hym magnifye siege layed vnto jerusalem tyme kyng sedechye hys frowarde surquedy god aungell tofore citye hundred slough meyny make hym aferde amyd hys people selfe nyght god aungell shoue away berde sharpe sworde shone full bryght left hys siege toke hym vnto flyght temple hys god worshyppynge slough selfe sate knelyng ¶ xxi chapter ¶ king sedechy false swearyng slayne made blinde pryson touching y• cōplaynt kyng sedechy sorowes shew y• manere holy write doth clerely specify wherfore vayne tell men processe may playnly lere joachim kyng jerusalem owne brother led reame wherof hart felt full great sore sedechias founde kyng nabugodonosor brother helde strong pryson bounde fully purpose jewes confounde tyrant mortall strife bother child pryson wyfe yet tyrant tyranny fauour fell rage vnto wofull sedechy suffer rayne great age yere yere pay truage fayth othe▪ composition raysed people brought babilon yet sedechias especiall maner false felicitie hym selfe reioysed see royall occupy noble dignitie forgate great aduersitie brother frendes touching mischefe fall pryde fell presumption whan remēbred brother lynage considered fro kyng salomon discended title heritage gan disdayne pay truage maligne hart wrothe falsly brake assuraunce othe maner indignacion whiche caught olde remembraunce tyme passed kyng salomon hys manly prudent gouernaunce kinges recognisaunce payed trybute durst wythsay fro yere yere noble obay whiche thing remembred kyng sedechi • wext great stronge puissaunce hye disdayne tribute gan denye set aside fayth assuraunce othe stode substaunce agaynst kyng babilon presumptuously fyll rebellion kyngdome strength fortify thought woulde aduauntage kyng egypt haue party pryde fell great outrage woulde pay truage fynally suche wayes hath sought othe little ne rought wo ala dolefull thing remembred hye lowe degre prynce worthy kyng false othe vntrue men suche variaunce se courage whiche ben hye borne cause falsly forsworne reporte dothe fame trouble infortuneth clipseth noble whan prince heste double chargeth wilfull rechlesnes al promisse conclude doublenes though god awhile suffer respite vnset houre falsenes quyte warnyng oft sent afore lackt prudent policy recorde take nabugodonosor whiche came vnware kyng sedechye tribute gan falsely denye power abrayed jerusalem mighty siege layed within constrayned nede kyng self better defēce man fleshe people fede caldeys mighty vyolence force without resistence false forswearyng take wreke mighty tower walles breke slea kyll list none spare soeuer met came • ight sedechias left towne bare take toke flyght chaynes bounde fettred anone ryght whose presēce tencrease paine anone yonge child slayne euerichone wyues wofull cheres whiche tyme goodly fayre deliuered handes straungeres ala put dispayre kyngdome neuer haue repayre sharpe tonges great payne head rent eyen twayne jerusalem citye brent playne grounde ash dede great rich treasour wholy sent babilon stone blewe rede vessel golde whiche richest dede without mercy remission caldeis toke possession thus sorowe wretchednes dyed ala fettred pryson lo ende periury falsenes lo fortune turne vp doun mortall men condicion richest shynyng hye prosperitie vnware chaūge hatefull pouertie men lift vp royall dignity hye aloft fulsum aboundaunce auayleth syt royall see folke haue therin none assuraunce▪ namely whan fortune holdeth balaunce whiche aye custome vnto hye estate hath false ioy shewe checkmate recorde take prynces one wofull fate hangyng ieopardy remembred late amonge eche one wofull fall kyng amazie sonne eke lepre whiche called ozie last babylon kyng sedechias dyed pryson ¶ lenuoy noble prynces consider falla fortune frowarde flattery sith disceits many diuers caas first mocked manly amazy whiche slayne surquedy yeue warning exāple ye may rede whā ye sit hyghest fall drede remembred bochas eke bible king ozie time famous bothe ryches chyualry punished lepre bokes specify presuming remēbryng dede whan ye syt highest fall drede worldly glory flyeth • ence pa take wytnes kyng sedechye false forsweryng slayne ala made blynde pryson story lye thus sheweth fortune frowarde enuy prynces ye list take hede whā ye sit hyest fal drede ¶ xxii chapter ☞ kyng astiages laboured disherite cyrus god suffred malice preuayle kinges one folowed y• prees bochas cōplat • discure called great astiages whiche tolde order vncouth auenture lorde asye bokes v assure treasure duryng life aboue kynges prerogatyfe fortunate gouernayle felt fortune none aduersitie saue heyre male nothing fayle gloriously sate se worldly wealth lacked plente except onely clarkes wryte sonne kyngdome enherite whiche wealthe great distres least succession fayled lyne daughter called mundanes whose wombe bokes determyne dreampt nyght howe sawe vyne auysyon stode ouer asye braunches spred abrode also reuelation slepyng nyght soupere though knewe exposicion thought sawe cristallyn ryuere lustye water beryll clere wombe stremes fresh soyle asye make tender neshe touchyng riuer lusty vyne hym shewed auysion within selfe coulde termyne therof finde clere cōclusion without maner exposicion declared folkes sentence whiche suche dreames experience called astronomer phylosophers deuynours knew meanyng nine sphere image star house tower expert expositours assembled euerychone touching dreme corded one tell trouth retchles said daughter frō whō came vine name called mundanes haue discendyng lyne whose noble fame asia shine whiche put renoun force armes region fate might refuse heauenly cours fayle wherupon sore gan muse suche fantasy hart assayle fill great doubt diuy • ayle thought woulde make purueyaunce withstande god ordinaunce full harde make resistence thīg ordeined whē god namely influence heauen aboue hath shape destiny men record man may fle dome holde flyt astronomer wholy commit sayde kynge spake late cast woulde aduauntage ordinaunce reuerse fate heauen surplusage yeue daughter mariage sum vnworthy pore infortunate neuer likely rise hie estate wise kyng astyages maried daughter entent one vnworthy called cambyses demyng therby short auisement within selfe ryght prudent wening y• noble came discent bloude grace heauen stode reason comprehended socrates master platon full low bed birthe discended enherite kingdome regyon haue fully possession morall vertue philosophy duryng life witte apply sought countreys wisdome science secrete cūnyng serche payne founde diligence philosopher bokes assertayne ioye reserued outher payne grace god whiche eternal men soules founde aye immortall great appollo bokes founde gaue iudgement equitie ryght socrates vertue habounde preferred euery man sight called wisdome lanterne light wisest named euen prime philosopher tyme poete also called euripedes honourable named age mother lyfe retchles contagious vycious outrage yet poete vyle lynage vertuous founde assayes poetes dayes called tyme great tragician bicause wrote many tragedyes woulde trouth spare maner man rebuke poetry touching vice fleshly fantasy cōplayn prince theyr dedes horrible • eche thyng punyshe odible another called clarke domosthenes subtyll rethorician inuentyfe among prees euer sythe worlde began al byrth pore man yet souerayne excellence among philosopher speach eloquence whiche example semeth doubtles royall bloude hye lynage men byrthe yeueth small encres vnto vertue little auauntage hye noble taketh courage riche pore state souerayne grace god list ordayne wherefore foly kynge astiages contrariously agayne al gentry bad doughter called mundanes fyrst whan folke wyth chylde dyd espy accomplyshe froward fantasy whan borne charging aboue althing ar •• anie beare ky •• e whych tyme called harpagus fynd dyd vertue floure spyte story telleth thus beastes shoulde litel childe deuou • god may mischefe best socoure kepe chyld recheles agaynst malice kynge astyages commaūded malice hatred howe chylde grene tendre age harpagus shoulde cast dede deuoured beastes sauage drede great outrage shepeherde himselfe stand large chylde slee fully yaue charge heerdman al loth execute woful auenture forest forth wyth chylde goeth gaue beastes litle creature foster grace agaynst nature wylde bytche whelpes forsoke pappes litel childe toke wt mylke made hym sup dine busy hym enchace wyld foules beastes sauagyne none ne durst nyghe place lo god dispose grace innocentes fro mischefe preserue agayne false enuy whych would make sterue blode vnkynde founde kynred couetise blode disnatural false malyce blode ful hatred murdre chyld borne stocke royal mannes reason turned beastiall falsy transfourmed vnto cruelte slee chylde beastes haue pyte sely herde hath tolde wyfe case anone pitye dyd aryse husbande went ful great pase forest beholdyng al gyse fore ye haue herde deuyse seyng chylde lippes tendre softe bytches pappes sokte ful ofte sayd heerde called sparagos wyfe also tofore tolde yong childe toke depose armes • softly gan folde ful goodly face gan beholde maner whyle chyldly wyse gan smyte childes laughter whan dyd aduert al hole faythful diligence gan cherishe wyth al herte yaue soke ful great reuerence bytche made resistence complayninge stode fully bay lytel chylde whan sawe led away ful pitiously gan houle crye departynge dolefully complayne ful fast gan hye childe let felt great payne lo howe god mercy ordayne cruel beast sorowe make mourne chyldes sake euery thyng y• god wyll haue preserued may fayle stand si • ernesse secrete dome ben hym selfe reserued man expowne thē gesse shope fyrst sheperdesse sparagos true pore wyfe meane saue childes lyfe home house childe led anone fostre dyd busines salary god wote knewe none saue hert thereto dyd dresse entierly ye story beareth wytnesse tendred h • wyth busy cure y• chylde borne nature story plainly doth expresse yonge chylde wext age fro day day encreased noblesse lyke ryght manly corage cyrus called langage say latyn playnly substa •• c • man yborne great enheritaunce whan renowne excellence longe processe hys great encres came reporte vnto audience ayel great • stiages kyng found rechles called harpagus vengeaunce yong cirus fyll displesaunce meane astiages wroth harpagus founde merciable cyrus saue lothe agaynst ryght vengeable slee chylde thyng commendable demyng trouth conscience god payed murdre innocence astiages cast hym wreke harpagus false collusion bidding breke contrary entencion cyrus slee agayne reason cause astiages rede harpagus let sley chylde dede say false compassyng couert murder wrought astiages sonne slayne harpagus king rosted ala ful causeles syth presented amonge prees tofore father thynge lamētable astiages sate table whan kyng called harpagus conceyued hath murdre terrible howe sonne heire slaine thus ire furious odible al hast possible repayred home housholde al case cyrus hath tolde sonne slayne sake hateful odious cruelte exciting vndertake false murdre auenged declaringe trouth equite howe borne discent dede ryght heire reigne perce mede declaryng story first dreme astiages howe fraude ful falsly made doughter called mundanes porely wedded vnto cambises mother tedre age cast beastes ful fauage▪ shepherde sheperdesse fostred great pouerte brought beastes wyldernes bycause god woulde saued thilke lorde euery thynge may se whan hath thyng afore disposed nedes must fal may deposed said cirus natiuite ordeyned reuolucion heuenly sphere numbre thrise thre stode tyme constellacion shoulde haue dominacion ouer al asye influence deuyne afore fygured spredyng vyne may y• fraude sleyghty folke auayle innocentes put ryght though trouth hyd amonges poraile harde brought forth dare shewe lyghte yet god wyl ordayne beames bryght shal one day shewe clerenes maugre al tho wold title oppresse cirus clerkes write tytle mother syde borne kyng al asye enherite al ayel woulde deuide god trouth best prouide hath cirus processe ordayned asye lordship hath attained cirus y• time growen vp wel length wel proporcioned membres stature wonder deliuer passynge great strength straunge emprises proudly endure ieoparte put auenture owne person fame hym none lykely men ado counsayle kyng harpagus whan cirus wel woxe age perciens proude surquedous archanites cruel corage recure ryghtful heritage began wt cyrus armed wyth plate mayle wyth astiages holde batayle agaynewarde gan take hede toke many worthy knyght al puissaunce land mede hath take felde day forth righte disherite cyrus ryght god trouth atwene thē twayne egal iuge quarel darayne felde ordayned splaied baneres eyther party ful proudly set thassemblyng lyke lyon cheres face freshly met round speares sharpe groūde whet tyl y• cirus grace nombre ayel party dyd encombre mighty cirus yonge champion throughout y• felde gan slaughter make knightes went vp downe deth fomen hym forsake astiages vnder baner take felde vēquished al veynglorye shewe right hath alway victory man malice may thyng purpose maner frowarde prouidence god aboue graciously dispose agayne malice make resistence men may suffer violence wronges great yt wende trouth alway venquisheth ende astiages foūde ful soth dreame though agayne made purueyaunce haue depriued cirus reame disceyued ordinaunce god puisaunce lyst heires iustly prouyde sleyght man case set aside maugre myght astiages cyrus hym made discomfiture al asye reioysed eke pee right aduenture iust title dyd also recure land mede lyke fate perce dyd hole translate agayne ayel vengeable wrought distruction benygne merciable graunted hym hole affection fourth part region archany whych afore tolde hym sustayne dayes olde kyng cyrus would lyue suffre ayel gentylnes men finally depriue kingly honour none vnkindnes yeue ensample prince sothnes though god erth haue yeuen thē myght shoulde aye mercy medle wt righte ¶ lenuoye noble prince eares encline considre discrecions howe dreames shewed influence deuyne lyke sweuenes lyke auysions resemble reuelacions though mē wold disturbe make faile god wyl suffer malice preuayle astiages dempt sawe vyne shewed trouth none illusion doughters wombe ryght lyne spred asye ouer region dish exite false collusyons yong cirus kynge dyd trauaile god suffred malice preuayle prince remembre honour shine vpon story entencions well willed god lyst forther line outher rich dominacions fauer promocions contrary acquitaile syth god wyll suffre malice preuaile xxiii chapter ¶ howe candalus kynge lyde made cokolde slayne jhon bochas cast hys loke aside hys study sate writinge hys presence came kynge lyde called candalus ful pitiously playninge slate teares ful lowly besechinge woulde swage greuaunce deedly sorowe put remembraunce hys complaint vnkyndnes false deceite al skil right trust gētilnes mocked al great might house certaine knight gyges called thinge shameful tolde speke plaine englishe made cokolde ala auised wel beforne vnkonnyngly speake langage haue sayde y• • horne sought terme wyth fayre vysage excuse rudenesse thys gret outrage land cornodo men thē cal affirme y• folke haue gal thus y• case whan phebus shone shene somer season hys assencion whan sote braūches clad new grene heate importable dominacion whan quene recreacion vnprouided man dyd kepe vpon bed lay naked slepe clerkes beauty wryte lyue fayrer creature excellyng lyke endite semelynes story doth assure called beauty cosyn nature worthy eke shal fayne compared grisilde elayne kynde forge lyst nothyng erre whan wrought greate auysenesse make beauty lode sterre yeue beauty fauour semelinesse nature great businesse fourme woman yt fresh hue forget make true eyen celestial heer vntressed like phebus hys sphere thyng resemblynge immortal augelyke loke chere examplary porte maner lacke saue nature slouth left behynde yeue fayth trouth daye lay sleping naked bed goodly syght ful vnwarely came candalus kyng cambre wher titan shone bryght shewed beauty hys owne knyght entent beare wytnes howe excelled al fayrenes whan giges gan ordre se quene great excellence enamoured vpon beaute al whyle stode presence gan ymagyn treason sylence slee lorde wythout longe tariyng wyn quene reigne kyng thys ende doleful pytous remembred hateful terrible noble worthy candalus trust much credible vnto gyges traitour odible yet folysh wherby lost lyfe outwarde shewe beauty hys wyfe though faire goodly se trust syckernes good parte gyges coude beare therof wytnes ala quene great princesse assent fame trouble nature excuse double xxiii chapiter thyng kynge mydas touched golde yet died mysery wretchednesse bvt whosoeuer therwith loth fayne giges crouned kīg lide whan hys lorde treason slayne surplus bochas set syde hys study dyd abyde came frigie mydas rich kyng tolde myne auctour complaynt weping neuer cōquest laboure kyng afore rychesse plenty golde treasour whose byrth poetes thus expresse cradel amptes gan hem dresse slept gan hym layne ful great numbre pured whete grayne wherupon expert diuinours toke hede attendaunce best expositours sayd token haboundaunce haue ryches al maner suffisaunce concludyng playnly gan tell howe al treasour excel poetes wrote full olde bachus gaue hym mighty god wyne touched shal tourne golde good came myne al assayes pure fyne request writeth ouidius vnto midas graunted bachus thought golde might auaile handled golde wyth touchyng whan hunger stomake gan assayle bread mete golde shewyng whan gan fayle fedynge founde golde recure escape besought bachus remedy shape bachus bad go bathe riuere wash away colour aureate wher yet shewed goldy grauel clere whych example declareth eche estate golde alone maketh men fortunate may golde treasour ther auayle men hungre finde vytaile worth golde perle stone red bred grene emeraudes sapir inde whan men enfamyned haue greyne mischefe vitayle may none finde foster nature kinde barly lofe distresse myght auayle al worldly rich knewe mydas experte dede though gold great plentie metal might self fede caused necessitie considre clerely se bread vaileth fostrīg nature al rich men may recure king gan hate al richesse golde treasour eke disdayne left crowne royal noblesse chase kepe shepe vpon playne worldly worship vayne melancoly froward pouertie ended life great aduersitye ire impacience fynally thus hym stode furiously great indigence writeth bochas howe dranke blode bul sauagine wode loue enchaufed made delay stially ended thus dayes ¶ xxv chapter ¶ balthasar kynge babylone howe daniell expowned mane techell phares next bocas ware sate wrytyng wyth full great laboure babilon cam great balthasar declare sorowe langour whych misused ful falsly tresour vessel brought jerusalem babilone chefe citye reme souper lordes al whan vessel dranke mighty wine solemply sate roial stal rounde aboute al concubine phylosophers magiciens diuynes came hand byble doth assure wall gan wryte scripture mane techel phares wrytten hys sight though mening cōceiued neuer dele wal shewed fayre bryght whose sentence auailed none appele prophet holy daniel fully expowned balthasar kynge mistery derke writyng worde mane playnly tary latyn tonge betokeneth sustance dayes counted rekened numbrarye thy reigning thy great substance techell sowneth wayenge balaūce token thy power kyngdome • ure god hath paysed shal whyle endure phares also betokeneth breakyng romaine tong peces smale thy power frowarde rebellynge shal hie brought vale holy writ fained tale whan prince wil life redresse god wyl vnwarely surquedy represse thou wert token warned longe afore many example story ye maye rede fallyng nabugodonosore thou thereof toke ful litel hede lord thank haue name drede whych thou shalt within litel throwe lose scepter crowne brought ful lowe let prince al thys story haue mynde selfe notably prouyde namely tho ben god vnkynde concubynes set syde make vertue theyr gyde voyde lechery false presumpcion hath brought many distruction nabugodonosor repentaunce restored possession god ryght toke sodaynly vengeaunce balthasar trausgressions wherefore ye prince dispose reason merites haue god merciable demerites fynde hym vēgeable agaynst holy churche take quarels aduertise inward syght balthasar dranke tho vessel stale fro temple force myght lost lorshyp lyfe vpon night kyngdome assirieus translated medes perciēs xxvi chapter ¶ home cresus balthasar vanquyshed cyrus sonne cresus slayne huntynge bore next ihon bocas within throw wrytyng prince many pitous fate sawe king cresus row lowly besechyng fallyng translate howe fortune agayne hym gan debate mischefe doleful rede discriue anone gan procede remembred writyng god kynde lyst hym ordayne lide gouernour kynge lordshyp storye fayne many kingdom one twain fame tyme dyd hym magnify called floure al chiualry also hys tyme founde expert werre batayle richesse habounde excellynge conquest preuayle plenty people wyth royal apparayle al great auauntage numbre childre tenblysse hys lynage highest royal see well nothyng stode amis yet amenuse felicite dreme truely thys sonne called athis take hym mortal outrage slayne sodenlye tendre age woful dreme dyd great distres put hert great dispayre standyng feare great heauines bycause hys chylde rendre yonge fayre borne hys heyre shoulde causelesse suche myschefe die dreame afore dyd specifye processe declare cresus dreme fulfylled dede olimpus came wylde bore furious sauagine drede wyth fomy tuskes fast gan spede downe discendyng lyst abyde tyl came laude lyde gan distroy frutes vine euer came maner place brake nettes stronge lynes hunter dyd hym enchace vnder supporte kynges grace hys sonne spake tofore gate licence hunt bore hys father cresus demynge ease cause drede maner though hys sonne present chase hunter suche game lere aye fortune wyth double redy euer fatall trayne disportes mischefe ordayne one whych gouernance vpon chylde wayte se chasyng y• bore saue hym fro myschaūce al domage aduersite many lusty folke countre horne hoūdes sharpe speres groūde sekyng bore tyl hym founde gan fiersly bore enchace charged chyldes gyde speare gan bore manace head entred forth gan glyde chylde whych stode besyde stroke lyght dyd auerte speres heade rofe hym hert chylde whan y• deth couth tolde reported holy manere slayne hys tendre youth borne heire vnto father dere cresus sorow chaunged loke chere constraint dole vysage resembled deade ymage euery sorowe long continuaunce last sumwhat must aswage ther none furious greuance mortal importable rage long processe yeueth auantage meane thus none great sorow mought cese outher eue morowe philosopher concluden discerne reason recorden scripture thyng vyolent may eterne one poynt abydeth none auenture sorowe may alwaye endure stoūdemele fortune variaunce foloweth ioy great greuaunce sorow cresus tho intollerable hert greuaunce sate sore syth dole irrecuperable meane none harmes restore bochas writeth wo nomore fal howe fyll dede tel maner forth doth procede whyle set style asyde processe party forbare speke cresus kyng lyde gan resort write balthasar agayne rehersynge ware howe myghty cirus woful auenture made hym proudly discomfiture put remembraunce balthasar holde vp party cresus wyth hym made aliaunce al puissaunce al chyualry lyfe treasoure put ieoparty sworne armes brother vnto brother cirus vēquyshed one mischefe lenger delayed al cresus faught long hys defence finally cyrus outrayed depriued knyghtly vyolence take felde resistence rigorouslye confusion myghty fetter cast darke prison encrease gret aduersite sonne tendre yong age dumbe natiuite neuer spake word maner lāgage cyrus commaunding furious outrage cresus shoulde vengeable cruelte knyght perce prison headed sworde gan manace cresus haue slayne wythout al reuerence dombe chylde present place neuer spoken thus said audiēce withdrawe thy stroke violence vnto lorde thy fame confounde slee kyng lyeth prison bound knight astonied hath stroke forborne gretly abashed darke habitacle whych herde chyld neuer spake toforne agaynst swerde make au obstacle ran tolde marueylous myracle myghty cirus euery circūstaūce hopyng therby atempre greuaūce tyrauntes set cruelte croked malice ful harde appese indurate iniquite al vengeaunce set hertes ese selfe reioysinge se folke disease lyke frowarde daūger clerely fraunchised fro god power thys cruel cirus vengeable desire execute fel entent dede let make haste fagottes gret fyre gan thē kyndle wyth many cole rede made cresus quakyng drede take lay ful lowe bad men fyre throw iupiter whych hath vengeaūce seyn howe cruel cirus malice attaynt heauen sent tempest reine sodainely y• horrible fire quaynt woful cresus wt dredful fyre made faynt escaped furious mortall payne god fortune hym lyst ordayne aduenture maner marueylous hert cirus gan somwhat tenbrace caused hym pitous agayne cresus granted hys grate occupye whyle hath lyfe space land lyde except thys thynge shoulde called kyng thus lyde kynge dyd fyne toke beginyng one ardisius endured space kynges nyne loke wyl bokes tel thus hereof forth vnto cirus wyl procede wyth al busy cure translate hys woful auenture xxvii chapter ¶ cruell tyraunt cirus delited euer slaughter shedynge blode ended heyre discent great astiages poorely brought forthe made mēcion al asie great encres holdyng reigne iust succession longe quyete wythout rebellion tyl tyme thought ful frowarde wyse world smal staunch couetise etyke contagious fretyng vpon hym desyre good dropsy hateful furious froward rage made hert woode woluyshe thurst shede mānes bloud ouerth warted false melancoly hys royal corage tiranny whan presumptuously dyd entende robbe reue folke pyllage god fortune made hym discende ful sodaynly hys royal stage demyng pryde great auauntage wyn landes force myght tho cōquest tytle ryght wyll yaue holy soueraynte aduertised nothyng reason preferred sensualite haue lordshyp dominacion aboue sad trouth discrecion whych causeth prince frō estate roial ware haue sodayne fall lordshyp al asia might suffise cirus gredinesse thought would conquere cithia werre encrease hys ryches though tytle ryght wysnesse saue false lust wherof mē shoulde haue ruth wyl prince shoulde oppresse truth fyrst cirus al prince dyd excel conquest victory batayle golde treasure bokes hym tell kyngdoms wyn dyd preuayle yet two vyces dyd hert assayle fyrst couetise euer encrease good desire shede men bloude wyth two vyces brenned euer one neuer might hert twyn made great army towarde septētrion cast proudly set begyn cithia mighty land wyn quene thomiris reigninge fynde whose kyngdom ioyneth ethiope inde towarde party whych orientall see surry floweth full plentuous downe see called occidentall southwarde renneth caucasus folke cithie ben laborious tyl land hath liuing onely frutes therth spring lande cithie ryche none greyne fruite land ful couenable ryche golde perle precious stone ryght comodious wonder dilectable great party habitable people dredful bylde mancions feare deth bycause gryffons noble fame high renoun ferre knowe ysprad aboute thomiris quene region noblesse within wythout tyl king cirus ful great route cithia gan hym proudly dresse hardy quene spoyle richesse fame magnifie gan great haste ful rich apparayle ful prudently assemble chyualry toke felde woulde assayle redy haue batayle meyny lyke sayth boke vnto sonne thyrde parte toke yaue hym charge place hym selfe daye aquite lyke knyght mete cirus face nothyng drede hym fyght whan kyng cirus syght cast hym day yong prince oppresse rather wyles manhod prowesse fyrst let stuffe large pauilions great plenty drinkes dilectable diuers meates confection rounde aboute vpon euery table meanyng passyng disceyuable lyke maner dredful toke al host gan anone fle yonge prince meanyng innocent nothyng demyng supposayle y• cirus meyny went sled feare durst hym assayle whan founde plente vytayle knightes misgouernaūce eate drinke set al plesaunce knyghthode lost disciplyne forsoke mar put hym syght bachus heades gan enclyne gorge vpon gorge tyl drough nyght proude cirus came thē anonryght hys hoost armure beastial folke made discomfiture cruel cirus left none alyue hygh lowe made none excepcion feble might striue chefe cause distruction drōkennesse whych voydeth al reason wyse men rehercen sentence folke dronken resistence whan thys slaughter relacion reported brought presence thomiris quene region vnto hert dyd ful great offence ire great impacience seyng sonne slayne tendre age sorow almost fyll rage al woful deedly payne shewed token feminite prudence weping gan restrayne cast playnly auenged vpon kyng cirus cruelte sente meyny espyen passage hym fynde myght auauntage meyny gā feyne maner flight vp mountayns dredful terrible cirus gan haste hym anon ryghte hope take possible among whiche hilles credible ben craggy roches hideous entayle perilous passage voyde al vitayle cirus ther fyl greate daunger al vnpurueyed drogemen gyde fostre people vitaile none ther erryng beastes vpon euery syde cithie gan hym prouyde wherof quene god wote ful fayne great mischefe yt al men slaine none al taken raunson hym selfe escaped boundes wayte layde theyr distruction perced mortal woundes peces rent beares ben hoūdes quene cōmaūding whā lay thus torne presence body borne fyrst hath charged smyte heade whan hath thus victory hym bath blode red gan throwe within litel tonne dispite ryght thus hath begonne tirauntly woful rage dead cirus haue langage thou cirus whylom wode thrustlewe thy tiranny agayne nature shede mannes bloud woluyshe thyne hateful dropsy mercy none myght modefye thine etyke ioyned gredy vnstable thrust slaughter aye vengeable horrour maner thynke great prince rebuked woman mannes blode drinke disclaundre roial maieste gladly euer vengeable cruelte ryght requireth wyth vnware violence blod shede blode iustly recompence myghty cirus imperiall noblesse woman vēquyshed borne doune god made chastise furious wodnes toppresse famous high renoun vengeaunce hath dominacion worldly prince playnly deuyse vnware stroke god thē chastise thende cirus bere ful wel recorde god wt standeth folke y• ben vengeable lordshyp mercy whan ben discorde right wyll suffer state stable cirus vnmerciable vnmercy punished dede deth quyt deth lo final mede slaughter blode dyd greately delyte tho twayne repast dede founde mercy vēgeaunce respyte founde matter blode shede ioy deth se folke blede▪ syght much good fatal ende swym blode lo thexequies mighty king lo ende estate royal flame brondes shinynge bren body fire funeral obseruaunces offringes marciall tombe golde stone rych fyne none ordained make shrine epitaphie ther none red songe poete wyth poetry triūphes bell ronge wepers sobbynge tragedy none attendaunce hys enemy hatred cruell rage cast carayne beastes sauage lo cirus finall auenture al asie whylom emperour lieth abiect without sepulture high low founde better fauoure lo fyne al worldly labour namely tiraunts lyst god drede set lust slaughter blodeshede lenuoye ryghte noble prynces considre youre syghte fine cirus pitous lamētable god punisheth equitie ryght tirauntes echone cruel vengeable syght abhominable prince philosopher write slaughter men shoulde hym selfe delyte saide cirus full manly knight begynning ryght famous notable nature yaue semelinesse myght conquest none sene able tyl tiranny serpent disceyuable merciles corage dyd atwite slaughter men whan gan delite wherefore ye prince remēbre day nyght tafforce noble make pardurable get fauour loue euery wyght shal state cōserue kepe stable conquest none honourable governaunce vengeaunce respite mercy preferring slaughter delite xv chapiter ¶ howe amilius couetyse slough brother remus rumulus nourished wolfe king cirus bochas espy two worthy brethern wyth face pitous borne discent reigne albanye one father story telleth v one called amulius remembre name numitor ycalled brother fader whyche named prochas kyng y• land story doth deuise whose deth playnely thys case amulius false couetise brother slough ful cruel wyse vniustly false tiranny might haue kingdom alone albany albany discripcion like bochas affirmeth certeine citye ferre fro rome toun set hyl beside large pleine building stately rych well beseine stronge walles many high toure ascanius fyrste thereof foundour called foundacion albania great whytnes kynges succession named albanois prince great noble discent story beareth wytnes kyng prochas recorde bokes olde came ii brother rea suster told numitor slayne made mencion kyngdom occupied amulius rea entred religion wympled holy house sacred vesta wyth virgyns glorious abyde contemplatife maydens duryng al lyfe thys done whyle yonge age brother false entencion shoulde haue maner heritage clayme title region kynred none occasion stande professed virginitye fore vesta liue chastitie yet withstanding virginal clennesse hath conceyued natural myracle gan encrease holynes whose wombe arose kīde obstacle agayne bolnyng auayleth triacle goddes dyd ordayne one sonnes twayne temple vesta stode wildernesse rea holy gouernaunce priestly honour done goddesse wyth many straunge vncouth obseruaūce brother mortall ordinaunce yong sonnes might socoured cast beastes deuoured wolfe whych whelped late yeue thē soke dyd businesse god ordained heauenly fate thē conserue fro deth distres holy write plainly beareth wytnes god defende well couth child frō mischefe tendre youth whyle sayd amulius vncle made mencion agayne suster frowarde furious made shyt ful derke prison complaynyng distruction two child borne reprefe sorow dyed great myschefe sayde chyldren deuoyde al refuse besyde riuer lay pitiously cry al socoure naked destitute except wolues vpon waityng whose wombe ful style lay soukyng vnto nature thyng contrarious child souke beastes rauenous lorde euery creature ryght hym lyst saue spyl beastes ben rage nature aduert make lye ful styl tigres lion obedient wil lorde hath made fel w • l • esse vnto twey child bigges dresse whyle thys wolues thē depose ther came herde called faustulus behelde soukyng saw thē lye ful close whych sheperde kyng amulius caught vp chyldrē story telleth thus brought thē forth great diligence vnto wyfe called laurence loue dyd busy payne fostre tyl came age gaue souke brestes swayne fro day daye hert hole corage called langage storye one remus seconde named romulus whych brethern brefely termyne towne rome toke original false disclaundre fyrst began lyne rote sought ful vicious foūde clerely remēbred memorial begynning grewe incōtinence clerkes call incestus sentence incestus thyng fayre good bokes wel deuise conne trespassyng wyth kyn wyth blode frowarde medlyng wt nonne thus line rome begon slaughter murder false robbry chefe begynnynge al auncetry couetyse toke auauntage lyggers way robber openly murdrers also owne linage stronge theues gate company spoiled al tho past forby vnder shadowe kepinge beastayle al maner people proudly dyd assaile • lee marchaūtes conscience murdre folke euery age woman oppresse force vyolence al countre vsage abode ther sure passage two brethern lyke founde fonde first y• maner speares sharpe groude aspeare greke called quiris cause sayd romulus bokes say sothely afterwarde called quirinus wt brother y• called remus al thyng confederate partable tofore god vicious dampnable accordynge life lacke vertue fyll great diffame atwene thē ther vncouth stryte yeue name vnto citie atwene ernest game theyr name rome called thus fyll case afore walled therupon ful longe lasted striues haue dominacion shewing title prerogatyues yeue name toun reigne kyng region reason shuld go beforne bycause borne fynishe fraternal dyscorde haue prouyded atwene thē anon ryght thus condiscendyng put thē accorde nouther force oppressyon myght whych sawe greatest flyght byrdes flyeng high vpon hyl name citye owne wyl accorde wytnesse wt lad ful great multitude therof yeue dome rightwisnesse wyse people rude al one thys mater conclude hyl called auentyne ben • ended matter fine byrdes syxe remus dyd appere augury gan procede called vulture ful fierce manere numbre double dyd excede romulus sawe whan toke hede wherof ther fyll great contrauersy thē shoulde preuayle party thus first al remus syght sixe birdes called vulture auaunce prefer hys right ful proudely put selfe prees romulus recheles brother clayme playnly entrouble afforced hys title numbre double yet purpose one thē must fayle though euer striue romulus gan finally preuaile citye forth went blyue auctours lyst echone discryue bokes reherce al name rome dyd cal al foreins exclude agayne thē make stronge defence fyrst began wal rounde aboute made lawe ful dredful sentence clymeth wal violence outward inwarde sey statute made must nedes dey enacte ful plaine ordinaūce paine deth man breke shal befyll remus ignoraunce statute knewe nothynge atal auenture went ouer wal whiche knyght ordained certayne saide remus hath pykeis slayn brother lyst maner wyse againe lawe fauourable assented parcel couetyse vpon remus vengeable thys entent make reigne stable alone myght gouerne non clayme brought brother people shuld thē delite abyde haue possession olde auctours romulus write within boundes toun deuised great prouision compas rounde croniclers compyle teritory called asyle asylum romulus deuised place refuge socours like theatre liberty fraunchised receiue forayne trespasours theues murdrers wayliggers robbours great resort within walles wide foster brybers y• durst abide fled people fro diuers region citye gan encrease multiplye banished folke straunge nacions finde refuge thither gan hye thus processe gan chiualry first tyrantes retcheles workyng till world obeyed biddyng wilfull force without title right brought people vnder subiection claime made violence might toke hede trouth reason first auctour foundation romulus gathered route within citye walled many day made mencion citye gouernaunce first kyng crowned toun raigned continuaunce full many yeres till variaunce fortune false enuye campania made dye vpon day whan gan thunder loude name foreuer magnified bokes saye rapt cloude high vp heauen stellified god stately deified stalled jupiter syde like knightes mar list prouide lo panyms false opinion christes lawe contrary odious tyrantes false oppression called goddes named glorious whiche liue founde vycious playne trouth dare well tell rather ben fiendes ful depe hell earth dominacion conueyed vertuous noble power hygh renoun set trouth rightwisenes like estate prince princesse dare affirme bothe twayne vycious liuinge must endure payne whan ben faythfull entent right trouth iustly maintayne royall power blent wronges redressyng pore folke sustene contune conscience clene life rath pompe warres shal make thē raigne heuē aboue y• star whiche let prince vnderstand atones worldly princess wt rich high horne fret wt riche stoues heauen passage dothe dresse vertuous life chatitye mekenes whan list pride hart arace causeth thē heauen winne place straunge abusion ne tofore god greater ydolatry whan prince list catche affection creature falsly deifye collusion brought sorcery god defende prince well disposed suche false craft neuer enoysed eyen none illusion avieugled neither hoke line boytes false inspection wrought cyrenes drinke medicine whiche nature resemble shrine rich outward beauty soueraine loke inwarde like caraine god grace amende suche outrage noble prince saue thē werre enlumine disposyng courage suche false worshyp ne erre like argus sene ferre false fagyng cause thē blynde god goddess worship againe kynd though yt romains worship honor romulus constraynt drede let man take example errour lorde whose side made rede saue mankinde crosse deed let men hym chefe loue obserue thē quite better deferue ¶ xxix chapter ☞ howe mecius kyng albanoys beynge false othe assuraunce drawen piece next romulus wt teares al bespraint vnto john bochas appered mecius chere loke port faynte fall declaryng frowarde dispitous called eke sufficius lowe byrthe simple vpgrowyng albanoys tyll fortune made kyng whose pride romains gan warrey full mightely oppressyng countree kyng mecius list obey cast fully auenged byrthe lowe degre risen vp vnto estate royall thē purpose yeue sodayne fall hasty clymbyng pouert set hight whan wronge title maketh ascende vnware peyse owne might sodaine fall maketh discende whan list surquedy entende fro whence came selfe knowe till god fortune pōpe hath ouerthrow mecius presumption thought romayns pride might auaile gan warre againe thē rebellion fearfull noble assayle till day signed battaile bothe hostes within felde mete take part soure swete tyme rome raigned hostilius manly man ful worthy knyght twene concluded kyng mecius twayne mete stele armed bryght bothe battayles trye ryght iust accorde therin vary party vaynquished tributary wholy put subiection without entreatyng delay finally short conclusion kyng hostilius triumphe wan day albanoys coulde say nay romayns put memory singuler battayle wonne victory thus romayns first possession albanoys obey drede mecius yelded sworne toun neuer rebell fauoure ne mede double founde dede assuraunce false citie chastised anone ye shall se agaynst fidinates countrey itaile king hostilius rebellion cast woulde mete battayle common profite diffension bothe citye royall toun afforce party workynge albanoys sent vnto kynge come haste whole chyualry tary maner wise make stronge sustaine party like behest ye haue hearde deuise kyng mecius full falsly gan practice sleighty treason couert wyle agaynst promise romayns begyle yet outwarde pretendyng true came felde ae full great meyny liuyng hope se chaunges newe rome might auenged specially myght se kyng hostilius frowarde enuy day outrayed chyualry first saw romayns enbattailed fydinates side wardes ready haue assayled couertly hyll abyde fro lyst go ryde person put ieopardy strongest holde y• partye wherof romayns fyll suspection kyng mecius whan toke hede tyll hostilius hygh discrecion knighthode put thē drede▪ gan dissunule mecius falsehede comfort knyghtes entent sayd done assent full lothe chyualry know effect mecius treason whiche cause myght party full great hindryng occasion deme falsenes treason yet trouth story beareth witnes ment vntrouth falsenes thus manhode high prudence knyghtes yaue hart hardines made set great vyolence felde gate high prowes fidinates brought great distresse outrayed force euery side tofore romayns ne durst abide whan mecius saw thus outrayed maner fayned false gladnes like hart well apayed hostilius anone gan dresse selfe reioysyng counterfayte likenes meanyng playnly conceiued came ryght receyued thus whan mecius stode presence pretence faithfull stablenes apport trouth apparence shadowed hath expert doublenes vnder sote hony couert bitternes frendly vysage wt wordes smothe playne tho mouth hart departed twaine hostilius hath fraude espied compassed falsenes treason therupon hath iustly fantasied paine accordyng ypeysed reason punishe double passion mean like deuided double torment hath prouided dome fatall payne hostilius contriued iustice fete armes atwene charets twayne naked bare story dothe deuise bounde knit trauers wise contrariously horse drawe hale tyll body rent piece small right cause great trouble founde aye dede full variaunce therfore payne maner double right self double gouernaūce false othe hest assuraunce double menyng hath perseuered ende mēbres disceuered fete drawe head asunder ioynt abide legge arme lay yonder thus eche member frō gan deuide coulde holde outher syde false pretence outher party true chastice founde payne newe xxx chapter ☞ chapiter howe prynces shoulde othes promise true auoydyng doublenes deception ende double false meanyng whā worde hart contrarious othe behest false founde kyng albanoys mecius noble prynces prudent vertuous let neuer story recorde worde dede shoulde discorde kyng mecius variaunt courage whose inward menig euer treasō set traynes contriuyng fayre vysage thought harte wt double cordes fret bochas called disceyte false baret whiche vyce discriuyng concludeth reason fraude fraudes false deception face flatteryng peacible pretendyng trouth vnder false pleasaunce panteris perillous terrible trappeth innocentes wt gryns mischaūce meane disceite wt countenaunce folkes englueth simple retcheles warreth vnder face pee puissaūce prynces famous honourable hath ben disceaued traytouresse folke prudēt estate notable hath distroubled suche doublenes many knyght victorious prowes hath ben entryked hygh renoun traynes founde disceyte treason disceyte deceyueth shalbe deceyued disceyte disceyuable though disceyte perceyued disceyuoure disceyte retournable fraude quit wt fraude guerdon couenable fraude fraudulent found defrauder fraude wyll aye rebounde ¶ xxxi chapter ☞ kyng hostilius first weared purple hewe consumpt fiery leuin shoulde disceite endite touching fraude kyng mecius cast finally write fatall ende kyng hostilius whiche first sayth valerius rome citye auctours knew among kynges weared purple hewe tryumphall noblesse many vncouth knightly high emprise fortune appall pryse prowesse made full frowarde wise retcheles slowe sacrifice jupiter whiche sent heuin consumpt sodaine firy leuin men may se reuolutions fortune double purueyaunce ye mighty romayne champion haue sodainly brought vnto mischaunce outrage put remembraunce great conquest turned wo frō ioye rebuke sende lenuoye ¶ lenuoy rome remember thy foundacion people thou toke thy beginnynge thy buildyng gan false dissencion slaughter murdre outragious robbing yeuyng v maner knowlegyng false beginnyng auctours determine shall processe come vnto ruyne thy ēperors souerain renoun kinges exiled outragious liuyng thy senatours worthy scipton poetes olde thy tryumphes rehearsyng thy laureat knightes stately ridyng high honour▪ al noble line longprocesse brought ruyne cesar toke possession first empyre tryumphe vsurpynge lucan maketh mencion conquest serious writyng octauian solemnely raignyng become lordshypor lyne processe yeres hath brought ruyne tullius chefe lanterne thy toun rethorike surmountyng morall senec prudent sadde caton thy common profite alwaye preferryng rightful traian iustly deining whiche party list declyne long processe hath brought ruyne temple thy protection made virgill curious buyldyng ymages erect euery region whan lande founde rebellyng toward part smal bell heard ringing prouynce ymage enclyne long processe brought ruyne also great extorcion consules prefectes oppressyng dictatours false collusion decemuir frowarde disceyuyng great outrage liuyng echeone odious rauine hath processe brought vnto ruyne become thy dominacion thy great tribute thy treasure shynyng worlde whole thy subiection thy sword vēgeaunce al people manacing euer gready encrese thy gettyng nothing grace whiche diuine hath brought processe ruyne thy hyghest exaltation thy proude tyrantes prouinces conquering god contrary long rebellion goddes goddess falsely obeiyng aboue starres surquedous climbyng till vengeaunce thy noble vntwyne new complaintes shewe thy ruyne lay downe thy pride thy presumption thy pompous bost thy lordship encreasing confesse thine outrage lay thy boast adoun false god playnly defiyng lift vp thine hart vnto heauenly kyng whiche wt bloude thy sorowes fyne hath made thy raunsum saue fro ruyne olde saturne drawe thine affection golden worlde fully despisyng jupiter make digression silueren tyme hartely dispraysyng resort agayne wt whole meanyng lorde order nyne whiche mekely dyed saue fro ruyne though mar myghty assencion influence victory disposyng bright phebus yeueth consolation worldly prince noble auaunsing forsake rightes thy false offryng lorde bowe downe thy chyne whiche shed bloude saue fro ruyne winged mercury chiefe lorde patrone eloquence fayre speakyng forsake seruice thine opinion serue lorde gouerneth thyng sterred heauen sphere eke meuyng whiche thy sake crowned wt spine hart eke pearced saue fro tuyne cast vp venus false derision fiery brande flattery renuyng diana transmutacions nowe bryght nowe pale▪ nowe clere nowe drepyng blynde cupide fraudulent mockyng jun • bachus proserpina lucine none christ may saue fro ruyne voyde cirses beastiall poyson cyrenes furious chauntynge let medusa treason fro gorgones turne thy lokyng let sinderesis haue kepyng christ jesu may thy medicyne agayne suche raskayle saue fro ruyne false ydols make abiuracion similachres worshyppyng make thy resort christes passion whiche may mercy redresse thyne erryng grace repare thy fallyng thou obey vertuous disciplyne trust shall restore thy ruyne mercy surmountyng foyson euer encreaseth without amenusyng aye full cche time eche ceason neuer waneth none eclypsyng whan men list make deuoutly rekening leaue sinne come doctrine ready kepe ruyne rome rome olde abusion ceremony falsly disusyng lay aside conclusion crye god mercy thy trespace repentyng trust refuse thy askyng receyue laboure vine eternally saue ruyne noble prynces high discrecion sithe worlde none abidyng peyse conscience wil reason ye haue leasure hart ymaginyng ye beare hence deseruyng let conceite aye thought mine example rome goth ruyne ¶ thus endeth seconde boke like pilgryme y• goeth fote hath horse releue trauail hote drye wery may find bote well colde whan thyrst doth assayle wine lycoure may auayle right fare whiche busines succour finde rudenes redresse meane thus haue freshe lycou • conduites calliope clyo rethoryke floure labour refreshe sister number thrise thre whiche citherea pernaso dwel neuer gaue drinke well sprynges clere cristallyn sprange touchyng pegase fauour lacketh making enlumin fynde balme great scarcite tame tunnes wt drop plente poliphemus blyndnes hath darked argus brightnes life short wyt great dulnes heuy soule troubled trauayle memory blasyng brotilnes drede vncunnyng haue made strong battayle werines spirite assayle wt subtill crepyng quaynt hath made spirite making faint ouermore fearfull frowardnes stepmother called obliuion hath bastyle foryetfulnes stoppe passage shadow reason myght haue clere dyrection translatyng newe quycke story write olde antiquitie thus set stode double werre metyng fearfull wayes twayne one euer list lere good gan constrayne bochas accomplyshe payne came ignoraunce manace drede penne rest durst procede thus selfe remembryng boke traunslate vndertake full pale chere astonied loke hand gan tremble pen felt quake dispayred almost forsake great labour dredefull importable • erforme founde vnable twe ne residue great iourney little therof begonne stode checkmate feare whan gan se way little • onne like man fayled day sonne light accomplishe vyage farre stode abacke passage night came darked ignoraunce wit dull clerenes discerne rethoryke lacke suffisaunce torch quenched lantern case style gouerne founde none muse hard stone pierides meduse support none dulnes gye pouertie approched stale croked age mercury absent philologie purse aye lyght voyde coynage bachus farre glad courage ebbe plente scarcete full olde man maketh spirite dull hope trust put away dispayre mynde new gan dresse chefe make wether fayre lordes fredom bounteous largesse mine hart brought gladnesse releuyng benigne grace false indigence lyst manace hartly reioysing serue prynce list aduertise seruaūtes ye faythful iust meanyng▪ list cōsider guerdon seruice nede list despyse fro al daūger yt noy greue beth euer redy helpe releue thus releued goodly hede noble knightly man mistes clered dispayre drede trust hope fayth hartran laboure anone forthwyth gan cleare support lordes grace foraynes lettyng fro enchace folke vse make great vyages whiche vnderfonge long trauell labour whē thei haue gret part passage werines asswage rygoure faintyse fynde fau ••• loke oft agayne parcell releue • se muche iourney acheued cause oft loke ageyne backeward turne loke eke vysage may seyne much done vyage eke wery folke gone pylgrimage rest full large space laborious sweate wipe fro face heauy fardell among cast adoun certaine boūdes backes ease welles colde eke entencion drinke freshe water greuous thurst apease holesum wynes appetite please rekenyng myles computacions whiche haue past castels townes doth ease number know syth began many great iourneys hye mountayns valeyes lowe straunge sightes passyng countreys vncouth buildyng borowes city counting ye distaunce frō townes space talking restyng place residue surplusage reken also labour commyng thinke maner auauntage haue se cleare knowlegyng thinges passed thinges eke folowynge harte doth full great plesaūce whan suche thing put remēbraunce semblably iohn bochas fynde gan turne backe loke countenaunce remember appoyntyng minde story rehearsed substaunce two bokes sorowes displeasaūce selfe astonied marueilyng great dele fall prynces fortune whele vnhap dothe rehearce towarde thē selfe cause dothe rebounde climbyng vp heauens perce worldly rich encrease abounde gredy etike doth selfe confounde thirst hauyng vnstauncheable cause • noble variable hygh climbyng vp reason se dulleth braines memoriall blunteth sight hygh low degre whiche aloft maketh haue fal men saye olde couet vnset houre suche one shall chese gadryng shall lese worldly folke whiche hye aryse wyth great peyse worldlye abundaūce weight frowarde couetise namely fortune holdeth balaūce vnware turne vnhappy chaūce stormy quene double goddesse plungeth thē downe rich wherfore bochas hereof make prefe sheweth purpose sentence full notable clere example suche vnware mischefe writeth auctour maner fable albe menyng full commendable well accordyng conclusion clere purpose entencion finis ¶ hovve andalus doctour astronomy concludeth prynces shoulde atwite constellacions fortune vnhappy fallyng demerites vycious liuyng ¶ first chapter naples whylom dothe specify youth whan schole went doctour astronomye famous cunnyng right excellent hym rehearsyng shortly sentment ioy study wake called andalus blake redde scholes mening heauen kinde starres constellacions course also planet seuen influence mocions helde also opinion fall prince cause well sought came selfe fortune nought starres nothing wite meuyng influence yt men right heauen wite froward worldly vyolence clarke concluded sentence men vertue longe may contune hurt starres fortune owne desert chefe occasion vnhappe taketh hede demerites vnwarely put thē doun whan vycious life doth brydle lede course fortune starres rede hindreth nothing agayne felicitie syth free choyse haue full libertye god punished sinne many maner wyse chastiseth theyr owne auaile men may reason suche case deuise sinne aye requireth vengeaūce tayle god fortune taketh counsayle meuyng man fre clarkes write glad pouertee vnto purpose auctour full notable scholers beyng presence full demurely gan reherse fable many coloure sugred eloquence theron concludyng sūme sentence touching strife whiche expresse atwene glad pouert blinde goddesse ☞ disputation betwene fortune glad pouerte hvod andalus whilom fortune straite place sate glad pouert whiche resembled loke figure retcheles woman vgly vnto se narow metyng hye wayes thre torne ragged rent thousand patch vpon garment hydous bothe chere face semyng voyde sorow drede way fortune pace glad pouert sodaynly toke hede gan smile laught dede maner scornyng certayne aray great disdaine whose froward laughter whā pouert espy indignacion rose vp hygh melancholy playnly shewe entencion without good day salutacion doyng fortune maner reuerence vnder wordes declaryng sentence thou fortune moste fole foles cause hast thou laugh disdayne thyne hart fall spare deale tell let se full little haue ado olde new haue none aquayntaunce neither wyth thy gouernaunce whan fortune beholdeth manere glad pouert torne wede knew also countenaunce chere toke little hede like maner nede whiche thinges conceyued seyne pouerty answered thus ageine scornefull laughter plainly whan sawe megre pale lene naked colde great aduersitie scabbed scoruy scalled vnclene backe body well sene many beast walke pasture whiche day day new thou doest recure hauyng nothing wrap thy head saue brode hatte rent nattes olde full honger defaute bread slepyng strawe frostes colde thou comest men may behold fear child withdrawe many dogge hath thy staffe ygnaw estate thou art odious men haue daliaunce thy felowship contracious thou abidest may pleasaunce folke hate deedly thi froward acquaitaūce finally dare conclude euer thou comest thy felowshyp mē fle whan glad pouert gan plainly vnderstand rebuke rehearced fortune rude reason toke hande whiche frowardly entune pouert refuse commuue repreues fortune layde whiche pouerte replyed agayne saide fortune quod touching debate whiche malice thou doest againe take well certaine touching
