pore estate frewyll thy fauour haue forsake though folke saye thou maiest men ryche make yet leuer pore wt gladnes trouble posse de great rich though thou seme benigne debonayre maner counterfaite apparence fatte well fedde wt rounde chekes fayre many colour trouth pretence therof fayth existence vnder thy floures freshenes serpent glydeth chaunge doublenes though thy clothing purple hewe great awaytyng many chamberers golde perle eche day chaunged newe clothe golde sundry fresh attire thine housholde full many officer yet dare well put ieoparty pleate holde champarty thus glad pouert gan waxe importune contrary loke langage agayne ladye whiche called fortune disdayne fill rage beholde quod pouerte courage wretchednes standyng disconsolate agayne obstinate se stant outrayed farre fauour felicitie yet pride dismayed list bowe obey though cast mendicite farthest abacke well assure mischefe set creature truely pouerte thi truaundise maugry thy pride thine outrage shall punishe full cruell wise make loute vnder seruage whiche resemblest deadly ymage newe risen graue yet pryde darest ayenst raue whan fortune wordes sayde glad pouerte gan fall great gladnes agayne fortune sodayne brayde gan conceit shewe expresse fortune quod though thou goddesse called foles yet learne thy seruage stande libertie shall algates haue ado armes moste cruell vengeable touching quarell yt atwene v two one thinge right comfortable thy courage flikeryng vnstable harte selfe deuided victory armes prouided list nether flatter fage anoynt adulacion though flattery fayned false langage appropred thy condicion dispite thy presumption haue forsake fre voluntie treasure worldly vanitie whylom thou hast deuised seruaunt vnto thy treasours frō thy daunger yt fraūchised seking nether helpe succour manace kynges mighty emperours glad pouerte late neither sone thy rich hath nothing done though thou haue embraced thy cheine worldly prince goodes transitorye ryche marchauntes vnder thy demeyne yeuest knighthode conquest victory fadyng palme laude vaynglory whan echone thy fauour haue recured thā glad pouerte fre fro thy lure assured thy seruauntes stande vnder drede quakyng feare thy doublenes neither wisdome force manhede fredome bountie loue gentilnes may thy fauour haue sykernesse possed wt windes thy barge glad pouert goth fre large thy manacyng dothe duresse whiche worldly prince dreden euerychone may well quake losse rich glad pouerte therof desire none flow ebbe worldly thing must gone floudes fortune tide ebbe foloweth man abide flowe ebbe aliche drede nothing thy mutabilitee make whō thou list either pore ryche nothing require nether lordship great prosperitie thy gyftes hath done chaunges braydeth ofter mone pouerte came first emperours rome crowned laurere fredom large made first victours causyng fame shine bright clere till couetise brought daungere whan foly excellence thy doublenes reuerence whan fredome prynce dothe forsake couetise put awaye largesse straytnes honsholde take nygardshyp exileth gentilues withdrawe hye noblesse people hart playnely deuise seruantes farewel al good seruice suche sodayne chaunges commune worlde vsed fro day daye echone come fraude false fortune experience hath put assay loue trouth fayth gone farre away trust prynces tary little maruayle though people vary thy chaūges fraudulēt fairenes vsed euery region glad chere outshewed wt couert doublenes vnder curtayne simulation secrete adulation worlde may surete rest glad pouerte yet thy perillous frowarde variaunce set store truely thy frendshyp cōcludeth wt mischaūce sodayne mischefe mutabilitie yeueth hart haue ado suffisaunce pore estate shal thy chaūges say sodainly chekmate fortune anger almost dispayred wordes toke full great greuaunce pouert quod maist apayred shew agayne puissaunce men would little accompt substaunce mighty pouerte stronge hercules puttest thy selfe prees supposest thou auayle force hardines haue ado wyth battayle whiche conquest hygh prowes armes called lady prynces none myghty conqueroure may preuayle without fauour wordes pouerte nothyng aferde answerde agayne thus playnly sentence though ne haue spere shelde swerde chosen armure stande defence pollar dagger make resistence bare naked anone shalbe seyne thou wt darest wrastle pleyne whiche shal done vnder condicion none v shall selfe withdrawe styll abide entencion till vaiquisheth ordeined hath law liketh felawe whiche lawe shall delayed accomplished outrayed whose wordes fortune gan smile pouert profered proudly assayle vpon stynt little whyle pouert put opposayle shall quod iudge battaile yeue doine iustly atwene v twayne quarell shall darayne aske also another question touchyng thy profer furious outrage thou puttest condicion lawe full proude langage shalt thou fynde pledge hostage kepe promise thou doest ordain therof abide guerdon payne meane thus set lawe atwene v two condicion surety whiche may withdrawe vnder bonde obligation neither lawe reason may bynde begger well sought whan proued yt hath right nought secte pouerte hath protection statute go libertie lawe playne exception foloweth thou bynde lawe may contriued fraude playnely endite hast right nought thy party acquite thou art feble came therto thou brought vnto vtteraunce power whan thou shoulde fayle make thy finaunce bothe destitute good substaunce sithe lawe thy person may coart foly suche one ieoparte woulde compulse wracke aske treasure kyng dary party thou standest farre abacke payment longe shoulde tarye indigence would vary woulde thy person eke compare alysaunder thy sydes ben full bare finally thou standest suche caas misery wretchednes nede thou mightest reason synge ala bothe forsake frendshyp kynrede none dare pledge drede yet like fole supprised vaynglory hopest wynne vyctory quod glad pouerte doubt neuer adele vyctory shall passe side pledge hostage let go farewele aske thy great pryde thende thou wylt abyde pledge thy fayth albe men sayth trust fortune full little fayth part hye emprise sith haue pledge nether one twayne sure hostage deuise victory thou attayne yelde body bound chayne perpetually like condicion abyde fettred pryson fortune laught thē afore whan saw pouerte presumptuous aray ragged tore neither rent lande ne house quod thing contraryous vnto nature aduert begger haue sturdy hart vainquished battayle worshyp aduauntage thy body vnto auayle enpryson straytly cage charge costage thine empty wombe eche day fyll thou mightest haue vytayle thy wyll would selfe magnify token tryumphe chare lede men would deme maner mockery say scorne take fole good hede begger hath ouercome dede fought encrease name cōquest turneth disclaūder shame yet whan haue brought vttraunce power shadowed great might thine outrage oppressed vengeaunce skyll ryght shalbe couthe euery man syght declared great difference atwene thy feblenes great excellence represse thy surquedy one cruel orchus tydogye infernall shall rende thy skinne asunder frō bone shew power whiche imperiall declare especiall pouerte reclaymed vnto prydes lure plete may whyle endure sodenly glad pouerte toke hede fortune proudly first began tassayle vnwarely hent hede demyng pride yt may nat fayle thrugh power vēquish bataile may fall dwerye right outray gyaunt gret might god taketh none hede power strēgth highe estate high noblesse square lime forged brede length quarels groūded right wisnesse wronge may growd prowesse trouth holdeth champarty god wyll cause grace magnify wherfore pouerte stronge entent light delyuer voyde fatnesse right well brethed nothing corpulent small dyette surfettes represse agayne fortune proudly gan dresse vgly sterne cruell face gan armes proudly enbrace pouert slender might well endure fortune roūde short wynde breth wombes great oppressed armure lacke wynde great stuffe thē sleth many man bringeth dethe ouermoche maner thing hath many one brought vndoyng meane best good gouernaūce moche nought ouer great plente gretter rychesse founde suffysaunce flodes superfluyte content pouerte grutcheth nat bytter sote euer hath fortune vnder fote couetyse put hym dispayre wherfore pouerte herte glad lyght lyft fortune full hygh vp eyre constrayned force myght glad pouerte custome right whan trouble agayne dothe begyn aye fortune laurer dothe wyn maugre fortune eyre lofte constrayned wylfull pouerte earthe fall full vnsofte pouert bony sharpe kne slendre longe leane vpon se hyt fortune great myght agayne ye hert myght nat stand vpryght signify pouerte gladnesse content small possession geuyth force treasour richesse hath ouer fortune dominacion kepeth euer vnder subiection worldly folke wt rych aparaile lyue euer dred lest fortune wolde fayle poore man afore thefe dothe synge vnder ye wodes fresh note shryll ryche man full fearfull robbyng quakyng drede rydeth forthe full styll poore large goth wher list wyll strongly fraūchysed frō debate stryfe ryche aferde alway lose lyfe thus glad pouerte hath palme ywonne fortune outrayed doublenesse vpon whome pouerte haste ronne strayned wyth great duresse tyll confessed playnly dyd expresse faythe hande great payne abyde lawe pouerte lyst ordayne haste discomfyture fortune began complayne sore glad pouert al thing might indure charged fortune scorne sayd sythe go full yore reioyseth scorne folke vayne whan lothest shall scorned agayne yet quoth pouert though thou dispitous wordes rehersyng whyche nat fayre straunge rebuke full contrarious repreues many thousande payre thou shalt fynde againe warde debonaire though tong slaundrous vēgeable slaunder againe nothing cōmendable thou must considre touchyng oure batayle ordinaunce imposycion whiche v conquest preuayle bringe felowe subiection shall obey statute reason accomplyshe due det lawe victoure lyst vpon hym set whiche thou shalt sayd lawe obey wyth circumstaunces condicion ordayned nothynge agayne say make grutchynge replycation consydred first false opinion sayne worldly auenture good bad abyde vnder thy cure poetes phylosophers also wold case make goddesse disceiued dare say two errour foly redresse shall withdrawe sykernesse vnhappy auenture away fro thy power stand thy daunger lawe newe vpon make first thou shalt al open pleyne juell auenture bynde stake pyller may seyne shewe example folke certeine man shal lose ne discharge lyst go large herof make declaracion touching thy might yuell auenture thou shalt forgo dominacion hyndre harme creature foles thy might assure foly may fele great domage nat thy power outrage thylke foles list vnbinde wretch called vnhappy auenture wyt reason make thē self blinde like world stode fortune cure though might assure vnsure dispose welthe wretchednesse errour calling goddesse wilful wretch self betake put fredom subiection god aboue power forsake submitte agayne reason vnder fortune transmutacion lyberte full falsly thrall namely whan goddesse lyst cal derke myst variacion fortune hath clouded natural lyght ouershadowed discretion blent inward syght consydre behold ryght howe god aboue put vnder mannes cure fre choyce good reason assure lord enlumined boūtuous large minde wyt memoryall toward vertue steppe dresse endued reason naturall frowardenesse tyll waxe bestyall bynde selfe contrariously dede serue fortune atwene hope drede thus bestyall folke made goddesse falsly wening might auayle wyth plentyes habundaunt rychesse deme supposayle wt vnware chaūge dare great assayle whose trust alwaye medled trouble plesaunce includeth mening double affyrme may auaunce conquestes great discomfytures howe lyeth also puissaunce forther hynder maner creature call princesse al aduentures rich enhaunce royal apparayle disdayne hinder porayle maketh fulsome profers blandisshing farced falshede whan rich ben stuffed vp cofers ben aye shet vnder locke drede wherfore ye rich one thyng take hede gathering came wyth plesaunce right losse departeth wt mischaunce gredy thurst treasour multiply causeth etyke suffisaunce engendring false dropsye sharp hunger worldly abundaunce making maner resemblaunce tantalus whan ye depest synke thā nature thrustlew drink clymbeth highest fortune whele sodainly rychesse dothe ascende vnware turne afore sene neuer dele whan leest weneth maketh descende fro suche chaunges may hym defende wyth pouerte nat dismaide lytell holde selfe apayde firste chapiter ¶ howe kyng hostilius worshyppyng false goddes consumpt firy leuyn whyle bochas gan muse thys matter consydred fyrst worldly thynge muste fayle wyth wepyng eyen dyd apere prynces ye whylom famous itayle whiche gan fall full pitously bewayle contrarye falling lowe tofore mischefe knowe vncouth thylke aduersyte namely prince whan sodayne euer haue liued prosperite hauyng fortune mater complaine wretche lyuith aye payne custome causeth conceyued sentence ioy sorowe full great difference ioy passed newe remembraunce whan folke ben fall theyr felicite treble wise dothe great greuaūce vnware turne theyr tranquilyte vnsure trust mutabilyte worldly power whiche haue founde vnto hertes yeueth greuous wounde wretche whiche wretchydnesse hath euer liued neuer partable welfare wyelfulnesse neuer found fortune fauorable sorowe myschefe ben costomable hys paynes longe continuaunce dothe greues maner allegeaunce prince whiche sate high alofte sodayne fall moste contraryous disendynge wel vnlofte tryumphes y• glorious reccorde take kynge hostylius rome royall stall whan sate crowned moste sodenly fall remembred old nat newe rome lorde syre firste kynges y• weared purple hewe citye gouerned empyre fortune hym lyste desyre tyll fyll regaly frowarde deedly malady paynes fynde alleyeaunce temple went pylgrymage offeryng made deuoute obeysaunce wherby somdele paynes dyd aswage restored corage felt hym selfe dyd amend comon profyte agayne gan entende vpon albaynes reignyng hys glory great anayle rome cytie throughe hys knighthode gret victory whiche full great cruelte beraf • e fraunchyse lyberte made thē thrugh high renoune rome vnder subiectyon hys conquest story doeth deuise hys noblesse full stately royall gan make ryche sacrifyse queme please memoriall rightes ceremoniall jupiter full great reuerence afore auters wyth fyres encence hys inward intent cyrcumstaunces oblacyon rechelesse founde also neglygent frowarde false affection goddes caught indignacion sodaynly discendyng heauin consumpt firy leuin hys false goddes might hym nat auayle jupiter saturnus mar venus let chrysten defye suche raskayle faythe contrarious among godds thyng outragious whan prynces bleut foly lyst erthly thynges falsly deify vnto god hatefull odyble withdrawyng reuerence magnify thynges corruptible vndue honour false concupiscēce wherfore ye price beware high prudēce lest god vnwarely punyshe noblesse make erth false god goddes ¶ second chapiter ¶ howe anchus kynge rome murdred lucinyo assent wyfe thynke anchus kynge rome toune whyche noble shynynge glorye weared crown ful famous renoun next hostilius put memory wan palme many great victory al ful sharpe knyfe murdred assentyng wife loued best aboue eche creature considred statery falsnesse double meaning vnder couerture falsly blent prince worthynesse robbe reue great richesse labour counterfete pleasaunce entent bring hym mischaunce anchus great affection vnto goddes make sacrifyses augment religion paganysme made sondry wy manhode circūspect deuyses vpon latines rebel citye comon profyt made great armye one city called polotory knightly wan maugre al myght whan ful victory abode lenger anone forth ryght made al people euery mannes syght prisoner thys romayne champion brought afore hym boūde toun eke fynde anchus nolde cease cōmon profyte affection teritories augment encrece al countreis enuyron towarde y• riuer tiber renneth doun place let edifye ful stronge citie called ostye withstanding al worthynesse depriued story telleth kyngdome great richesse foraine called lucinio wife tarquild assented therto whose outrage gredy couetyse anchus murdred full cruel wyse iii chapiter ¶ howe lucinio murdred anchus murdred thus fro whele fortune fall lucinio rome crowned kyng romayns dyd hym cal tarquin olde recorde writyng hath atayned fraudulent workyng subtyll forged eloquence vnto state royall excellence fyrst ordayned estate roiall turneys iustes castels city playes called marcial many famous great solempnitees session state degree tarquin eke fyrst y• payne open stretes tauernes ordayne eke preserue citye doute enemyes lyst assaile fyrst walled rome mighty toures vnlykely fayle also many strong batayle sabynes rebellion made subiect vnto rome toun assented depriue worthy anchus estate royal toke tanquylde vnto wyue slough lorde treason mortal god would right haue fal lord wyl euery thinge may se suffre murdre long secre lucinio great offence touchynge murdre kyng anchus yslayne sodayne vyolence two sheperdes story telleth thus entent contrarious atwene selfe fayned strife fynde way reue hym hys life kyng sate iugement vpon quarel iustise full sodaynly assent fill vpon full cruell wise axe story doth deuise one man toke hede two party rofe kynges heed thing done procuryng two chyldre sonnes anchus whyche exyled false compassyng lucinio agayne moste yrous hym presence odyous shope tho syght theyr father deth auenge might nature blode wyll auenged recompence wrong kyntede thys chapter lyke ye may se blodshed blode thus bothe dyd blede whyche example let prynces take hede howe murdre done supplantacion requireth vengeaunce guerdon lenuoye thys tragedie clere inspection openly declareth substaunce howe slaughter price causeth subuercyon realmes cyties put ordynaunce mortall longe contynuaunce blode supplāting shed kinges twayne exāple shewed false murdre restrayne fyne declaringe murdre false treson dede horryble cryeth aye vengeaunce god aboue caste hys eyen doune punishe thys sinne throgh puissaunce • mother myschefe mischaunce wherfore ye prynces lawe ordayne within boundes thre vyces restraine vyce sclaundre murdre poyson euer thre haue acquayntaunce bryng sorowe desolacyon put prefe newe remembranuce falshede vsed vnder fayre countenaunce wherfore ye prynces busy payne within boūdes vyces restrayne god defende thys noble regyon thre vyces haue alyaunce slaundre firste deuoureth hygh renoun sleeth good fame thrughe false daliaunce harme done late foloweth repentaunce wherfore ye prince lawe ordayne punish malice fals tōges restrayne god hath murdre abhominacyon false poyson dothe hym displesaunce payne comparyson condygne murdre paysed balaunce wherfore ye prince make ordynaunce within boundes preuy payne dae punishing false murdre restrayne noble prynces prouyde reason agayne vyces make purueyaunce rygour shewe due execucion labour hertely instaunce let deth guerdon fynall penaūce warne cōstraint payne frō iii vice corages restrayne iiii chapiter ¶ howe offence done lucrece tarquyn neuer crowned kyng rome touching tarquin whō told myne auctour maketh mencion called tarquinius olde whyche longe rome dominacyon tyll hys kynrede generacyon offence done vnto lucrece caused kynges name cece sonne dyd succede outrage extorcions many cruell dede hys hatefull vsurpacions hys frowarde lyfe false condycions among people bothe styll loude called tarquinius proude full obstinat entent ambicious taccroche great rychesse tyll fortune wexed impacient agaynst hym great noblesse gan snare crokes dresse thought woulde kept hym wele sodaynlie cast whele sonne full vycious fynde vertue moste contrarious froward came hym kynde nature proude dispitous agayne people fell malycious nat loued dred tyrany ryght thyng hated people syght thys proude tarquin y• story well couth agayne lucrece dyd great outrage oppressed beuty vnbridled youth trouth assaylyng furious rage hys father hys lynage exyled hatefull thynge ther neuer rome crowned kig body corrupt clene hert thought force assayled innocence oppressed beaute spirite nought chaste wyll dyd none offence entred conscience greate remorse wyfely trouth sle selfe whych great routh bochas remembreth pyteouslye deedly sorowe lamentacion write complaynt ordre ceryouslye whyche made oppression folowe muste make mencion myne auctor percell rehersyng touchyng wordes sayd dyinge albe byddyng lorde reherced haue translacion pierms worde full dolefull declamacion hym remembred entencion sake men myght se rede wyfely trouth womanhed john bochas lyst nat set syde would reherse sentence wofull complaynt therupon abyde wronges done innocence though nat folowe eloquēce shall sue trouth rehersyng substaunce theffect writyng morowe next thys foule dede lucrece vp rose wt full deadly chere face gone rede darked heauenly eyen clere clad blake maner thylke folke whyche especiall wonte go feastes funerall frendes beyng presence husbande father eke also rehersynge sentence cyrcumstaunces hartely wo go vnder hope lorde wyll supporte sayd wyll reporte v chapiter ¶ greuous complaynt lucrece vpon oppression moche quod lucrece lawe ioyned maryage mi lord whose loue shal • e encrease towardes wt surplusage wyfely trouth endure myne age humble subiect wt faythfull obeysaunce vnder thy lordshyp thy gouernaunce collatyn lorde true husbande best beloued hole affeccyon wyll quarell take hande wyse take none accion without thou lyste enclyne doune goodly thyne eares ye • e audyence shall reherce thy presence iniury done maner wronge agayne worshyp myne honeste lawe sentence made stronge toucheth also wele holy yolden vnto thou art heed clerly discerne lorde husbande body gouerne parciall cause sothe may none atwene v twayne disseueraunce sote bytter ioy aduersyte must way one balaunce counterpayse sorowes plesaunce entermedle thynge stant doubte receyue fortune commeth aboute may atwen v meaning double one herte one wyll one corage woman y• standeth trouble wythout polysshyng fayre langage must disclose greate outrage done vnto playnly discure whyche redresse lyeth holy cure mater speake wordes playne aright serched trouth found iuste cause indifferent twayne towarde v quarell doth rebounde strongly mater groūde reherse wyll ye saufe vouche mortall wronge ye doth touch castell whiche called collace lorde hath y• gouernaunce tarquyn yonge came place full disware make purueyaunce agayne hys commynge ordinaunce tofore nat warned offycers sate vnpuruayed amonge chamberers entent eschewe ydelnesse sate span wolles softe vyces chefe maystresse cherysshed yset alofte custome haue done full ofte woman duly ought auoyde slouthe full busily wrought entryng meke debonayre benygne porte loke vysage pretence many wordes fayre whose meanyng full great outrage chere contrary vnto corage thys wyse receyued wherby ala falsly disceyued prime face thought due hym receiued commyng rose vp mekely gan hym salue apertayned maner thyng vnto sonne worthy kyng truly tarquine whiche say ala traysh stode caas kynges sonne shulde duety woman wall protection preserue kepe surety man shulde presumpcion wronge oppression rather dye se suffer vnryght aduertysinge offyce knight contrary knighthod hath wrought false outrage done agaynst wronge wayes croked meanes sought lawes twayne breake liberte deface auctorite lawe ciuile naturall also person offendyng bothe twoe first subtyll compassyng gan espy thestrys place whan bed alone lay slepyng lyke lyon full sterne loke face left hande throte dyd enbrace helde agayne lawe oppresse naked sworde ydrawe thus afforsyng wifely chastyte agayne knighthod dyd great offence lyfe worshyp put perplexite hauing might make resystence manasyng deadly violence one twayne dye entent auoutry falsly consent thus stode sole atwene dethe diffame body corrupte spyrite abode clene spousayle broken good name euer disclaundred y• whilom shone shene yuell fame custom wyll alway wax grene neuer dye people disporte worste thynges gladly reporte ala ala amonge sorowes one moste y• dothe hert agryse nat worthy men shoulde call haue name maner wise offence whiche ye haue herde deuyse called wretched lyfe collatyn henseforthe wyfe myne eyne also blynded derknesse shame lyfte vp syght outher stremes beame vp dresse clere heuen loke vpon lyght may neuer nombre ryght true matron amonge ferre ornere rekened kalendere let myne iniury mortall cryme punysshed ryght equyte without delay lenger tyme euer may example worlde eke cyte suche payne therupon deuysed auoutrors may therby chastysed seme opinyon case shulde vnpure wyll receyue iuste punycion payne paciently endure stande perauenture ye deme reason iust stable mater culpable tale tolde whan longe mused complaint inward sight trouth echone helde full excused made behest full myght auēge wrong lucrece anonright toke sharpe knyfe might aduert roue selfe euyn hert ☞ complaynt bochas vpon luxury prince example many dyuers myschaunces bochas hert brennyng hote fyre ire indignacion agayne tho prince desire haue fully set delectacion felycite affection folowe lustes false lechery froward spousebreche auoutry writeth seketh occasiōs place lustes haue libertees fulfyl delectacions taccōplysh great dishonestees deuyse tauernes borowes citees sitting among company dede boste foly man pyntche outrage rebuke transgression wyl answer wt froward false langage party alledge great reason first longeth condicions right nature well couth frely vse lechery youthe affyrme also howe lawe kinde fre afforce sustain party exāple dauid y• toke bersabe sake slough vrie dyd manslaughter false auoutry allegyng agayne right re • dalida luxurye sampson story also frowardly apply woman prudent salomon lord offendyng ydolatry diffence opinion reherse story excusacion errour therby price wynne tofore god lechery sinne consydre entencion story euery cyrcumstaunce first kyng dauid great contricion vpon samson god toke vēgeaūce first lost force puissaūce offence haue minde eyen made blynde reason lyst enclyne conceyue discrecion spyrite wysdome heuenly diuine take away fro prudent salamon chastising transgression doctours affyrme ouermore salomon repented hym ful sore play youth folke calleth lechery say game nature sustayne beare vp party howe sit well recorde scripture vnto euery lyuely creature stant helth coragious kynde lecherous vicious report haue remembraunce vertuous thynge ferre mynde fleshly lustes lecherous plesaunce desire lefte behynde auauntyng lying new fynd nowe dayes hold curtesy othes horrible flateryng ribaudy auice take lytel hede vnto doctryne noble scipion commaunded story rede massinissa full famous renoun touche condicion sophonisba fayrest vysage way maryage though borne blod royal youth set honeste doughter heire noble hasdruball duke cartage story ye may se vertues feminyte wedded byrth lyke king siphax reigned affrike preue great lyberte vertue conueyed reson false thraldom dyshoneste bothe make playne comparison doctryne censorin caton shewed folkes commune vertue neuer subiect fortune vertue conserueth measure reson consydereth thinges afore befal taketh none emprises discrecion prudence foundeth werkes al aye counsayle attēperaūce doth cal warely prouiding selfe within end thynges fore begyn doctrine taught forth catō lecherous lustes put vnder fote grauntyng vertue domynacyon plucke vp vyces braunche crop rote frute goodnes groweth vp sote whan planted youth corage neuer appalleth eld tarage caton vertue chefe offyter preferryng euer common commoditees tofore profites wer synguler enhaūce comon kingdōs citees wyttes peysed habylytees person promoting whō supposed vertue naturalli disposed manlye hert aye sustene indifferent trouth iustyce fleshly delytes folke vncleane aye redy rygour chastyce set lawes full prudent wyse punysh flaterours lechours open auoutrours woman none opinion deale luste beaute procreacion stable found degre boke redyng immortalyte plato made trouth well sought therin concludyng soules dye noughte lyueth euer ioy payne thus wrote plato originall men may body bi deth ful wel constrain soule aye abydeth immortal caton stedfast wal comon profyte dye aferd whan self slew naked swerde fortune afore dethe saide thou prince worldly goodes vayne thy flateries neuer abrayde thy fauour false vncertayn neuer faught fraunchise atain selfe perciall syngulerte profyte touching comonte agayne cesar made resystence conquere fredome toun frely eschewe mortal vyolence world dispising mine opinion fraunchise thralled vnder subiection iustly forsakyng varyaunce life soule conueyed contemplatyse philosopher prudent old caton tendring hert common comodytees tofore dethe wrote compassyon sate royall dignitees vertue lost libertees prince sechyng luxurous take ensample folow kyng drusus drusus succession heir augustus next emperour set vertue affection cherysshe holy labour lust vnlefull neuer gaue fauoure touching loue duryng al lyfe neuer lust onely wife palayes amyd royall se noble prince dwellyng rome toun asked dignyte maner corage temptacyon feruence delectacion within hym selfe loues play sole hys wyfe whan bed lay lyke prynce fulfylled hye noble answered agayn wyth sobre countenaunce touchyng lust foloweth fleshlynes lyke nature put gouernaunce one alone set al plesaunce none concupiscence saue wyfe neuer dyd offence prince echone folowe nat trace noble drusus ye shal vnderstand haue stande another case hold two thre hand botes come land consydring degree disauayle whan newfangylnes bloweth sayle eke bochas writeth sōe price haue foūd viciously haue done busy payne vertuous woman flatery confound tendre maydens bring trayne suche manaces tormentes ordayne thē transforme perseueraūce interrupt virginal constaunce folke yeue force shame drede god traynes deuyse husbandman forsoth blame foraine woman trespace wise trow wiues thē may inough suffise many feble dettes quite though cha • ige thē self falsly delite affyrine self allegyng outrage haue licence frely nature vse thing case wight offence froward errour sentēce fro bond wedlock whan vnstable tofore god hatefull dāpnable hye noblesse named clerkes clerly cōcerne doughter god lady princesse reason called gyde folke gouerne atwene good yuell iustly discerne hath departed playnlye conclude lyfe man lyfe beastes rude lady reason sith ago full yore gaue vnto man wyt discrecion taught also souerain lore twene vyce vertue great diuision eleccion vnto vertue naturally obey contrary al vicious lyfe werrey enprinte memoriall luxurie great dishoneste dissourme man make bestyal disfigure estate whan reason high lowe degre fled away folke may affyrme lyke beast rather man wherfore let prince haue ben defectife folowe lustes sensualite shape bi reson amend life conserue kepe chastyte virgin wifely honeste punyshe al tho lyst labour honest fame woman deuour lechour force maistrye defouled hath virgynes clennesse widowes oppressed auoutry assayled wiues stande stablenesse may thā sclaūdrous harm redres whā good name hurt report fame lost one neuer haue resort thefe may robbe man ryches meane make restitucion men may disherite oppresse poore man frō possession make satisfaccion man may restore degre mayden robbed virginite man may also beate castell doun build freshly syght exyle man regyon reuoke wher wrong right man hath power might restore palayes virginal chastyte whan broken wal men may also put seruise offycers remeue place day whan fortune lyst deuyse may agayne restored grace nouther tyme set space neuer story nouther read seyne maydenhed lost recured ageyne men shuld haue conscience rewe hert repent sore haue remorse great offence rauish thing thei mai restore sayd hath ben sayd ful yore emeraud grene perfyte chastyte stolne one away may recured hard rauysshe treasour nature recuperable lordshyp may kyng emperour refourme thing reformable rust dyffame seperable maydenhed lost newe yore man alyue may agayne restore romayns old pacience suffred tyrauntes theyr tyranny cyties great vyolence people oppres robberyes punyshe set strayte espyes false auoutrours wel couth widowes rauish maydēs youth vpon mater story bereth witnesse touchyng exyle king tarquinius afore rehersed writing ful expresse hateful death apius claudius trespase done virginius iudgementes rehersed payne fro offyce depriued bothe twayne nat cytie whylom desolate sychemites ribaudry one sichem whiche gan great debate haue accomplyshed foule lechery whan yonge dyna bokes specifye went rechelesly walkyng vp downe se maydens royall towne whan sychem dyna dyd espye sole selfe walke cytie begane anone assayle maystry aforce virgynyte bycause leyser fle whose great offence transgressyon cytie broght vnto destruccyon father jacob holy kynrede agayn sichem gan inwardly disdayne whan fury mar drede venged dyd theyr busy payne specially worthy brethern twayne fyll cyte symeon leuy auenge suster stroy fynally mortally gan stryue swordes ground sharp kene male child left none alyue vēgeable furyous tene sychemytes might sustene day agaynst stand defence importable violence wher god list punish man right mortall swerde farwel al resistence whā grace faileth force goth away myght febleth prince magnifycence chaungeth power impotence reuerseth kynges stately regaly example sichem false auoutry hard dredfull punycion one prince trespas lecherye caused afore god regyon distroyed without remedy story told exemplify whan noble prince woman submit grace al fauour anon doth thē flyt mater shuld wryte genesis resydue ye may rede dethe sichem kyng hemore howe kingdome distroyed dede sychemites lo y• finall mede lechery false plesaunce many realme hath broughte myschaunce shuld eft reherce agayne write false auoutry paris helayne woful fate gu • dyd endyte poetes echone eke dyd busy payne declare howe twayne worthy blode short conclusyon troy grece came distruccion▪ oft falleth muche abundaunce worldli good great ease rich folke set holy plesaunce folow lust froward wylfulnes hath caused landes gret mischef distres whan vicious life corages encōbre distroied kingdom people nombre whan people fals obstinacy indurate amend correct wil turne lechery aye redy soules enfecte vnto purpose style wyl dyrect examplify howe gabaa town sinnes brought confusion whylom people called gabanytes beniamin discended line aye disposed folowe delytes custome wyttes dyd enclyne worldly plentie flour shyne dempt alway due wylfulnes lustes sue lechery set al plesaunce vice lad moste lyfe wherby brought vnto mischaūce many slayne full mortal strife whan leuyte came forby wife full excellent fetures beaute toke lodging within greate cyte ful old inly fayre impotent tendre age gabaa making repayre cytesyns importune rage shewyng fury great outrage long nyght beauty dyd assayl tyll lyfe brethe atones dyd fayle contagious sclaundre diffame judicum story ye may rede reherce maner shame abusyon foule dede ye leuite morow gan take hede piteous chere saw yong wyfe tofore gate depriued lyfe hent vp layde asse noyse cryme vpon euery side thought case myght lasse toke sharp sword lyst lenger abyde twelue partes gan deuide eche tribe jacob hath sent certayne parte se iudgement thing hateful terrible • ight full abomynable haste lykely possible one wyll one corage stable gabaonytes vengable gathered haue shortly conclude tassayle towne ful great multitude whan first met atwen thē thus stode twelue tribe twise put flyghte either party great quantity bloud shed among mortall fyght sixty thousand co • pt right slayne story wyll lye auenge sclaundre false auoutry lo guerdon froward fyres lecherons folke yt wyl staunched brent hote bestiall desyres gabaa mighty stronge cyte distroyed iniquite almoste brought beniamin line offence eternall ruyne eke feruent dronken lechery holophernes judith lost hede al hoste al chiualry left felde fled away drede lay bathed bloud al rede thus vyce wel sought ful many price hath brought nought sayd story ought ynough suffyse men wold consydre take hede great vengaunces many sondry wise god hath take sinne dede bokes mai behold rede warnynges afore full oft put prefe self shal saue fro mischefe lenuoye tragedy yeueth v gret warnig biclere example manifold resō howe many prince 〈…〉 uing many rych royal mighty toune many citie many region haue bene euer sith full notable infamous synne prince lecherous chosen god dauid worthyking prophet prophet souerain reno • bersabe sodayne lokyng slee vrye caught occasyon suffred great punicion chastysed god house cause lecherous great repentaunce great sorowing made psalmes great contricion woful teares manyfolde wepyng make sheth transgression yeuing prince full clere dyrection eschewe flattery odious false fraude woman lecherous ther euer science conning renomed king salomon yet woman made thrugh false flatering foraine goddes done oblacion clipsed honor brought fame doun whilom moste vertuous tyll thrugh woman fyl lecherous eke remembred writing israel howe chefe champion goddes people leadyng mean famous mighty strong sāpson thrugh force torent lion dilada teares plentuous grace bereft made lecherous sichem slayne eke rauyshyng yonge dyna made mencion father hemor brought endyng lost rychesse discencion kingdom brought distruccion lo end prince vicious dispose lecherous earth one perylous thinge prince condicion e •• emynate wyttes enclynyng false desyres fleshly mocion put self vnder subieccion thral resō tresour precious vnleful lustes hatefull lecherous sentence full playnly menyng woman haue dominacion holde raine hokes castyng sensualitie hath iurisdiction enter reason false intrusion warre agaynst vertue contagious vaynquished lustes lecherous taketh fro men clerenes seyng causeth great sickenes corruption vertue greatest hyndryng maketh men seme olde inspection appalleth minde disposition shorteth life thing dredfull piteous whan dispose lecherous noble prynces ymaginyng conceyue woman false deception namely loue winnyng labour aye possession whose sugred flattery false collusion like syrens voyce melodious enoynt eares make lecherous ¶ vi chapter ☞how cambyses assentyng murder brother mergus last slough selfe death mighty king cirus next came sonne called cambises heyre succession full victorious whiche tofore bochas put selfe prees gan complaynt doubtles egypt many vncouth wyse sundry goddes sacrifice first vnto apis dyd sacrifice called serapis greatest god raygnyng egypt excellence god goddes foles call noble thus befall slayne brother whiche wonder seuered peces ful farre east asunder egypt made ordinaunce vpon payne death statute olde god call obseruance within temple like holde wherof cambises tofore tolde temple region cast force throw doun temple jupiter robbe rauyne called hammon without exception knightes sent bryng ruyne echoue presumption sodaine leuin smit beat wherof cambises jsye tho raygnyng dreame lay slepyng drempt brother yt called mergus kingdome succede wherof hart waxt enuious purposed rancour hatrede meane make side blede purpose take auayle magicien toke counsayle holde full great phylosopher called comares full sleyghty cunnyng whō cambises made full large profer golde treasure make assentyng execute horrible thing would cruell wise murder mergus cōpas deuise cambises ordeyned treason slea mergus owne brother dere god aboue cast eyen downe hym punishe full cruell manere waxed wode list lere caught swerde roue thigh twaine sodaynly dyed paine two cause god toke vengeaunce mine auctour bochas doth expresse presumptuous false disobeysaunce spoyling god great rich froward great vnkyndnes yeue assent contagious caas whan y• mergus brother murdred death chefe occasion full great warre striues debate eke fynall cause region mighty perce stode disconsolate heyre none high low estate title right vnhappy chaūce kyng haue gouernaunce magycien called comares • lue mergus ye haue herd expres toke brother called dropastes made kyng story bereth witnes resembled likenes vnto mergus face stature crowne kyng therfore cure deth mergus outward know playnly published region body buried cast earth lowe murder fraudulent treason piteous slaughter wrought collusion maner processe espyed openly myght denyed wyse noyse gan sprede touchyng murder odyous whan oropastes occupted dede crowne perce story doth v lere prynce full notable entere called hostanes gan wytte apply high prudence murder espy oropastes vnder false pretence perciens receiued kyng sayd prynce diligence inquisition haue knowlegyng ingyne sleyghty thing sayd oropastes caught occasion stede mergus occupy croun matter coniecture title neither whole ne clere trouth trye busy cure serche wholy manere sought farre came ryght nere case letted slouth tyll founde trouth case thus playnly termine daughter full fayre vysage whiche kyng chiefest concubine thought catche aduauntage vnto hath sent message secretely enquire stode yt kyng come cyrus bloud bade shoulde secretly take hede slept busy payne handes fele hede grope eares twayne fyll sayne vpon head none eares founde tel father trouth boūd mighty prynce hostanes knewe wele ryght recorded scripture touching case stode euery dele kyng cambyses sodaine aduenture liue forfeyture made oropastes story sayth nay two eares cut away hereupon certified desierous haue full knowlegyng whiche daughter whan espyed vpon nyght liyng kyng gropyng head lay slapyng full subtilly felt toke good hede none eares vpon heed father anone hath declared secrenes auenture feare ne drede hath spared stode playnly discure first busy cure prynces perce lande yfere counsayle call entreat mattere whan assembled euerychone oropastes tolde chaunce yt mergus murdred yore agōe tofore put remembraunce wherupon set ordinaunce redresse wronges done toforne perce lande seuen prynces sworne one assent intencion bonde othe thei made assuraunce full secrete communicacion put oropastes frō royall puissaunce whiche perce vnder gouernaūce full false pretence herytage like mergus vysage seuen prynces tofore tolde one hart othe ybounde prudent manly yeres olde haue sought tyme oropastes confound wt swerdes sharpe whet ground vnder couert apparayle came entent oropastes assayle palays euer met agayne made resistence accorde fiercely set magicien y• presēce came agaynst sturdye vyolence encountregan thē constrayne prynces haue slaine twayne finally prynces fyue whan sawe two feres blede al palays left none alyue kynge oropastes quaking drede full vnwarely toke hede slayn ther guerdoned al might pretence kinges yt reigne haue right vii chapiter ¶ howe dary obteynyng kingdom perce sleyght ended shame deth magicyens left king haue y• gouernaūce rule lande perciens saue fyue prince full famous puissaunce whyche made statute ordinaunce one accorde recorde writyng theron concluding shuld chose king sort hap auenture yeue fortune thys eleccion thus prince crowne shall recure among fyue theyr conuencion gouern mighty regyon lande reigne contune lyke fauour lyst ordeyn fortune thys statute vpon mornyng atones erly ryde atwene aurora phebus vprisyng vp hyll houe abyde rancour dyscorde set asyde whose horse among first herde neying without grutching shulde crowned kyng vpon mater shoulde leger tary hereon made othe sykernesse among prīces one called da aprince perce excellyng noblesse whych seruaunt y• story bereth witnessery kept hys horse thought dede hys lorde wolde preferre suche nede sayd seruant full sleyghtly werkyng dilygence lyst nothyng spare day fore set metynge place smothe playne bare hys lordes horse made leape mare morowe prince met horsbacke hys lorde set whan horse thyder came agayne nature anone afforced corage neye loude vpon playne mare vsed passage kynde suche case great auauntage whiche sleyght playnly reherse sayd dary crowned kig perce prynces lyke theyr conuencion phebus shewed firy beames bryght without stryfe contradiccion horse sodaynly alyght vnto dary lowly myght sayd greke vp rose policromtudo basileos latyn spake wordes playne englyshe expowning scripture greke moche sayne longe tyme myght kyng endure lyue helth good auenture grace fauour fortune vpon perce reigne contune wyll consydre euery cyrcumstaunce meruayle nat grounded prudence sleyght king haue gouernaunce tytle clayme iust euidence raysed kyngly excellence whan fortune fauoureth suche assay tyll y• chaunge ther man say nay thus kyng dary borne lowe linage set vp sleyght estate honorable thought y• wolde auauntage make kyngdom reigne stable wed wyfe hym able demyng trouth hys clayme well amēded cirus lyne discēded wede suche one couetyse stable reigne vpon perciens fynde full cruell wyse counsayle false magicyens werre gan vpon egipciens eke folily gan werrey athene whiche lyst hym nat obey myne auctor maketh rehersayle pride false presumpcion discomfyted twyes batayle neuer made mencyon nat reputacyon among perciens gan honoure fade wyth sleyght gan shame ende made ¶ viii chapter ¶ corolian romaynes exiled gan warre agaynst sent mother withother peace eft exiled slayne dary rehearce mine auctour liketh conclude iohn bochas came corolian wofull multitude gan complaine vpon ingratitude romayns whilom dede exiled person rancour hatrede whiche time would neuer ceace noblesse hys hygh renoun common profite augment encrece bringe subiection many citye many noble toun yet agaynward chyualry exiled malyce enuy whan marcus called corolian saw romayns great vnkindnes toward countrey called tuskan high disdayne anone dresse entreated manly fell prowes gyn warre sythe manly cōueiyng againe rome y• citye put assuraunce haue victory high renoun tolde playnly great distaunce false strife discencion newe fall rome towne wherfore prouided cōquere thē lightly thei wer deuided assent made great armye stuffe war richely apparayled pyght tentes tofore great citye fielde stode proudly battayled harte romayns haue thē fayled durst passe gate toun among thē great deuision citye stode time destitute feare supprised lacke gouernaūce defende founde refute farre enfeblished old puissaūce euer gladly stryfe variaunce kingdome haue enteresse touchyng defence adue hardinesse within selfe stode debate afore enemy ready assayle comfort none hygh lowe estate discord auayleth coūsail fone wtout within selfe battayle brought ala confusion false serpent dissencion last afforced constrayned coact peace seke case stode nede payned maugre might hart meke mischefe encrese eke augmentyng cruell fate saw enmies armed gate sent first priestes toun enemy entrete pee humble profers lowe subiection corolian doubtles againe romayns merciles grace none myght hart myne request eares enclyne romayns story tell venturia made prayere whiche mother corolian volumnia faithfull wife entere go fere vnto prynce besechyng lest benignly heare request mother first full prudently abrayde vnto sonne makyng question metyng hym thus sayde shall quod short conclusion faythfull harte true affection thy presence declare finally receyued mother enemy thine aunswere must selfe dispose wittes specially apply cause cōmyng clerely vnclose tell effect mine ambassatry speache gouerne gye receyued thy grace selfe declaryng haue time space like thy mother thou receiue accept vnto thy presence must therafter gouerned tell tale playnly sentence thou geue frendly audience receiued suche wise strongly tale must deuise noble prynce corolian heard mother thus cōplaine full like lorde knyghtly man gan embrace armes twayne lowly wise sayne saue like sonne due ryght sayd full lyke manly knyght madame quod pleasaunce hear conceyt matere faythfull hart humble attendaunce receyue mother dere ye lyke benyngly ingratitude done cruel wise romayns purpose chastise ah sonne quod touching offence done thy noble great outrage shal menes trespace recōpence thinke thou art borne linage suffer yt mercy thy rigoure may asswage think nature thou maist wel wtsay thing thy mother doth pray thou shalt close thyne entrayles pitie requestes thy wife gynne warre agayne thy countrey stroy thy lyne newe mortall strife thy child make v lose life wey balaunce romayns thy hatred loue thy kynred sende home agayn thy straunge souldiours ben redy y• romains bloud shede let stand peace walles tower suffer thy grace thy rancour excede thy pity may put away drede condiscende receyue hostage pledge great outrage behold wōbe whiche thou borne se also naked sydes twayne whiche thou fostred toforne lack thou woldest cry plaine remember theron disdayne vnto mercy receyue citee request thy wife whilom milke thy chrishing fode stynt thy cry whan thou diddest wepe sote drop full holsome good thy tender youth preserue kepe like mother bryng slepe woke full oft kynde wherfore dere sōne request haue mind thou lyst city torment demerites rygour recompence punyshe wyll assent beare gylt great offence dere sonne let thy magnificence suffer knighthode yt mercy may dede attemper thy rygour thou dome procede suffer romayns liue quiete graunt thē peace agayne great outrage drope pity let thyne hart flete thinke thou art borne linage loke vpon mercifull vysage whiche offer selfes shal fulfill lyfe death wholy thy remember nature lyon set aside rage wodenes mekely afore fall doun royall kinde duresse exemplify knyghtly noblesse wt rigorous swerd thou shalt manace lowly yelden vnto thy grace whan prynce corolian heard mother list sayne goeth haste besprent wt teares y• chekes rayne embraced armes twayne sayde mother may lettyng hole hart graunt askyng siege made auoyde away repayre home countrye wyth mother wife yt day great gladnes solemnitie anon receiued citye like fortune neuer wold haue fayled fone newe hath assayled gery romayns stormy vnstable whiche neuer one styll coulde abide prynce knyghtly notable conspyre new gan prouide banished tuskan beside slayne within little space romayns afore toke grace ☞ ix chapiter ¶ howe melciades duke athens small nombre vanquished vi c perciēs comonte aye custome desyreth chaung prince new chayned pryson dyed amonge putte theym selfe prees bewayle greuous heauynesse came athens duke melciades thrugh manhod hygh prowesse thrugh knightly renomed noblesse like auctours triumphes lyst cōmēd faught many batayle city defend victory compyled comon profyt noble toune faught wyth tyraunt yt tofore exiled called hippias false treason kyng dary made suggestion vpon athens al hast might rayse al perce agayn town fyght sixe hundred accounted nōbre perciens armed plate maile athene force encombre echone assembled proudly assayle duke nothyng wold fayle melciades knightly toke place ten thousande met face manly ryght wyse handes proued ful good knight set vpon prudent auyse perce great might four tymes put vnto flyght thylke duke shall fayne noblesse knyghts twain themystocles ycalled tone hand auctours list discryue felde proued hys fone manlyest knight time alyue whych thylke day proudly dyd stryue agayn thē perce slaughter make fynally field haue forsake cynegirus knyght eke towne day chyualry blody swerde went vp doun without nombre melancoly slough perciens bokes specify tyme refute saue shyppes drede dethe ran wrought straunge marueyle writeth bochas affyrmyng certayne greatest shyp bare largest sayle righthand gan restrayne lyke fastned wyth chayne maugre perciens whiche thē sore greue craft could meue whan none refute wyst frely escape daungere tyl right hand cut wrist wt left hand gan approche neare helde styll vncouth thing heare force great ship let ala left hand smet yet maugre thē whan malice seeth lost eche hande ship styll helde teeth ne myght departe lande lyke vessell fal vpon sand caused day mine auctour doth reherce two hundred slain thē perce whan singuler mighty champion cinegirus vncouth corage done maruaile made mēcion anguish fill rage lyke beest furious sauage ran ala lacke mynde bochas boke finde proces beheld aye howe fortune frends fayle melciades leder fielde gouernour al great batayle causing victory made rehersayl yet people malice yre noble falsly gan conspire athene set prison chaynes mightily bounde vnkindly yaue guerdon al knighthod found yet suffred many mortal wound diffence libertees saue liues toun countrees ende duke melciades y• constreynt stronge bondes eke exyled knyght themystocles towne lyue straunge lōdes worthy proued hondes shewe chaunge mutabylite founde fortune euery comonte ¶ lenuoye stormy trust euery comonte gery corages trobled cōstaunce tragedy men may behold se vp doun fortune cast chaū ce custome haue ioy plesaūce desyres vnstedfast vntrewe se ech day chaunge prince newe corolyan rome chefe cytye protectour thrugh mighty pusaūce venquisshed enemy set thē suerte brought rebelles obeysaunce agaynwarde wylfull variaunce banysshed hym twyse cause knewe saue se chaunge prince newe knyghtly noblesse magnanymyte polyce prudent gouernance melciades duke countre yt athens chefe towne substaūce whan comon gan auaunce vnkyndly honor yt grewe wer busy chaūge new themystocles hauyng soueraynte knyghtes bare speare launce duryng tyme take cōparisons oft tyme great greuaunce sixe hundred thousande put vttraunce vnto athens neuer founde vntrewe yet conspyred exyle newe thyng may flour felycite stande stable longe contynuaunce hyghe estate outher lowe degre nowe flowe ebbe nowe ioy nowe mischaūce fortune holdeth balance specially false feyning vntrewe comons desyre chaunge prince newe noble prince prosperite sodayne chaunges set remēbraunce fresshnesse floures braunches y• beaute haue aye chaūge trēblyng attendaunce trust comons perseueraunce wynter somer dyuers hewe dyuers chaūge prince n • w x chapiter ☞ howe xerxses kyng perce rauyne couetyse dismembred small piece tofore bochas pitously wepynge declare deedly heuynesse came xerxses nexte perce kynge gan cōplayne dole distresse thre thinges y• story bereth witnes cronycle clerly v tell prince erthe dyd excell high estate none greate neyther ryches worldly habundaūce none tyme great dygnite put remembraunce perce vnder obeysaunce neuer prince auctours conclude hosteyed attones suche multitude space fyue yere ordynaunce seuē hundred thousāde people dyd rayse dempt pride agayn gret puissaunce none erthly power myght counterpayse auctors alowe nat prayse bycause people encombre set trust cōquere wt gret nombre manly prince haue opynion multytude standeth nat victory knightly prowesse euery champion manly cast thē armes haue victory enprynted hath fixe memory marciall tryumphes god ne doth nat shewe nombre great rather fewe sayd xerxses recorde auctours also cronycles rede thre hūdred thousande straunge soudeours without perce mede whiche gan erthe cure sprede dried ryuers dyd attayne karfe downe hylles made valeys playne chefe conceyte fantasy haue erthe vnder subieccion thought power raught aboue skyes surquedy false presumpcion demeth opynion howe power playnly lay fro god heuin heuyn take away thylke lorde yt meke enhaunce see proude put doune namely yt haue remembraunce aduertyse wysdome reason knowe lorde mighty renoune lorde lord plainly compyle wyll suffre tyrauntes reigne whyle one maruayle euer dyd rede greatest vncouth playnly vnto howe xerxses kynge perce mecde shewe specyall syngulerte asie ouer great se sayth myn autour whō dare alledge europe made myghty bridge men perauēture ther disdayne say maruayle nat credyble yet craft case suche thing may attayne whych nature semeth impossyble thing odyble thynges inpugne autentyke olde whiche notable clerkes dayes tolde newe men haue lytell seyne nouther expert crafte nature lacke reason holde thing veyne though remembred scripture euery maruayle euery auenture straunge hym reherce lacketh ye cause wherof ye groūd began sayd xerxses eke possession tytle father darye egypt made mencyon grece hym contrary wherfore cast lenger tarye proude prince mightely werrey lacedemonoys wolde nat obey one called demaratus whych country afore kyng exyled story telleth v tyme wt xerxses housholde abyding whyche loued land exyling gaue thē warning saue thē fro mischaūce xerxses power ordynaunce wrote letter grauen table themprises xerxses doute stuffe people incomperable nombre great rout whiche table couered without full subtelly withe wexe yplaned playne sonde letter seyne thus thentent xerxses first discured vnto grekes false workyng one thinge greatly assured trust expert knowlegyng leonidas noble famous kyng whych amōg grekes prowes foresight tho dayes holde best knyght chyualry called lode sterre sonne knighthod yt shone bryghte shene bearer vp peace warre strongest pyller party mayntene grekes ryght hande noblesse sustene carboncle armes myrror policie surest capitayne felde rule gye myne auctour remēbreth boke howe case nat recheles haste four thousand men toke let wayes comyng xerxses hyll called thermophiles perciens began first voyage knyghtly cast stoppe passage secretly espyeng comyng kyng xerxses stronge apparayle lyke knyght made tarying chase vi hūdred armed plate maile whiche suche case might moste auayle defence helpe countre wolde rather dye felde fle couertly toke lodgyng kept close tyll drough nyght dyner selfe refresshyng sate steele armed bright kyng abrayde lyke manly knyght felde afore shulde gone ryght thus sayd amonge euerychon syrs quod nowe dyne merely good wyne afforce corage lyke good knyghtes porpose fynally lyfe dethe nat turning vysage assent caste passage ye dyne nowe especiall suppe night goddes infernall meane ye shal selfe ieoparte hardy knightes proudly prouide within felde asondre nat departe kepe close drede deuide desyre worshyp make gyde expert noblesse eternally auaunce quicke reporte newe remembraunce haue thys day nothyng memory nother ryches blode ne kinrede saue hope good trust victory hardi prowesse conducte lede thinke knightli shalbe mede marcial palmes renome name highest place set house fame though ye fewe nombre let hertes one thyng fantasyed diuision nat encombre victory armes may nat denied nothyng conquest applied true accord amōg self shew though nombre verey counsayle syngulerly notable knightes kingly good langage recomforted held selfe able agayne fomen hold passage fyrst al hertelye proude corage perciens mortally greue within tentes fyll eue perce ydrowned wyne say great excesse lay slept lyke dronkenswyne watche nat kept lo y• drōkēnesse causeth oft rechelesnesse ful many man wyl nat take kepe murdred nightes whan thei slepe kyng dyd knyghtes lede perciens tentes assayling sodaynlye ware toke hede affray made hidous cri defence none vpon party men may knowe olde experyence folkes dronke may resistence nombre slough fone ceased nat longe nyght tyll morowe sonne shone beholde vgly syght proude xerxses put anone flyght euer last wold fone assayle aye first fledde batayle flight fast away ran therin holy trust great trauayle anon xerxes gan coward drede haue great thurste dry salte sond dust way serching ferre nere nother founde wel ne riuere auenture amyery ground fand water troubled blody colour xerxses drāke water wt hande refresh deedly labour thought neuer dranke lycour holsom strayt stode case confecte spice pyment ypocras first mischefe drede xerxes mighti prince stode men may se lyst take hede howe gery fortune furyous wode wil spare rich goode mighty prince lyst god know estate bring ful lowe hatefull serpent hygh presumpcion aye vnstable gredy vsurpyng newe trouble false sedicion lyst pryde receiue warnyng nowe xerxses perce mede kyng purposed hath odyous apparaile temple god contagiously tassayle thought myght nat suffise great example contrarious pryde howe toforne god chastyse mannes hande set pompe asyde nowe newe gan agayne prouyde sacrylege mighty hand dresse spoyle appollo reue hym richesse delos temple thylke day moste stately builded set vp mason great ymages relyques ryche aray golde stone sondry mansyons appollo sondry questyous yaue redy answere story telleth thus called appollo delphicus four thousand men xerxses thyder sent auice chose none ful clenly armed thether went spoyle temple gold rich stone sodain leuin thei wer brēt flesh bone tempest thundre hayl hydous rein consumpt echone neuer seyne great apollo whiche shineth bryghte heuin xerxes great indignaciō made people consūpt wt leuin cruel punishing presumpcion yet purposed confusion syth land nothyng myght wyn vpon see new werre begin gan make great ordynaunce nauy couered see yet neptunus thought enhaunce within boundes haue lyberte themystocles small meyny besyde cytie called salamine shyppes brought vnto ruyne yet fynde proud kyng xerxses party themydora quene halcarnois put self prees armed plate shone ful bright shene thenarme xerxses sustene woman faught lyke fell woluesse many greke day oppresse straunge meruayle se woman sturdy vysage yet men expert day may se lere nature ful cruell corage cowardes found langage set assay shall sene wher ferfull quarell sustene mai mekenes shew fayre pretence serpent colour syluer shene floures ful fresh apparence growe thystels rough sharp kene ben angelyke sene heuenly golden tress ben prefe verye lyonesses say sothe poore man may shent dare speke matere kyng xerxses proud entent nauy people yfere put flight outraied chere shyppes drowned amonge waues rude none abode al multitude kyng xerxses hurt wounded mortally vnnethes might great payne endure quakyng hert quit cowardly see lande suche auenture yet agayne damage recure thre hundred feyghters hee gan call vpon grekes newe fall mighty duke called mardonyus captayne made people lede themistocles min auctor telleth thus knowing xerxses cowardnes drede lettre made sent dede enfourming grekes greate outrage bridge broken passage maruayle ther came tidinge king xerxses anon ryght aferde ech thynge full lyke cowarde tooke flyght fled bote lyke coward knyght al people yseyne awayte vpon saue chamberleyne people departed yonder standyng mischefe great indygence many coast wēt rode asonder pyned hunger lacked dispence punished also wyth vnware pestylence feble trauayle myght endure impotence carye armure ala eche way lay ful caraynes soyle blode stayned grene ayre terrible pathes plaines man might endure sustene sauour odyous vnclene rauenous foules ful homely sight selfe fede vpon corse alyght thre hundred perciens slayne mardonyus afore full proudly lad tiding king xerxses fayn distresse sorow gan mad one last mischefe whan thimon noble grekish knight xerxes discomfited put men flight thymon sonne melciades father whilom athene kyng last outrayed hath xerxses saue ende fyll another thyng artabanus full sleyghty werkyng xerxses suspect dede compassed dethe bochas rede artaban prouest hys house officer especyall seuen sonnes strong dispitous vpon nyght furyous fatall fyll vpon xerxses palayes royal story remembred piece small haue dismembred xerxses last fynal mede high pride funerall guerdon frō two kingdomes perce mede froward fortune hath hym plucked doun may auayle dominacion prince hold selfe euyn egall goddes hyghe heuyn men list know chaūges prefe namely prince puissaunces erthly parels worldlye mischefe prouyde set ordynaunces drede fortune varyaunces god ward take ful lytel hede great rich possede may heare erthe quaue tofore fall token se wyl go anon self saue house townes fle put life suerte lest building made great costage fyll vpon mortall rage horse ronne oute stable breke colere thicke double longe men wyl ordayne locke yron able kepe hym neuer stronge thus men redresse euery wronge touching body great auysenesse saue soule wyl nothing redres whan ryuer passeth ferre boundes boyleth vpward fyndeth resistence wynneth land ouerfloweth groundes drowneth townes vyolence yet men wyl trauayle fynde defence turne cours som way shal sought toward god mē thīke lytell nought agaynst sickenes men seke medicine letwaries dyuers pocions serche physike sondry disciplynes dyete transgression restoratyues eke confeccions vnto godward present lyfe men trauayle confortatyfe men body wyl put distresse false desyre couetous feruence cacroche wyn great ryches suffre colde labour vyolence nother spare gold dyspence vnderfonge perylles vaynglory thynges ben transitory passe mountain many hidous roch hope shuld entent auayle many mortal monstre approche many vncouth sea sayle jeopart lyfe warre batayle many daunger mani streyt ride worldly treasor wyl abide toward goodes ben perdurable full lytle nought hertes encline heuenly company notable wyl lyft vp nother heed ne eyne toward sphere phebus lucine castyng stremes v ferre considre worldly men done erre myght auayle great couetyse kyng xerxses estate royal gret people ye haue herd deuise ten hundred people nat small hydous fal whan tofore remembred piece smale piteously dismembred ☞ lenuoye tragedi put v remembraūce y• vnsiker flateryng blyndnesse fortune vatiaūce vgly froward doublenes xerxses shewed ryches v declaring plainly figure rauynous prince may whyle endure kyng xerxses vnder obeysaunce al perce mede stori bereth witnes thought erthe lytell substaunce staunche etyke gredynesse fret hauing put distresse whose fyne declared recorde scripture rauinous prince may whyle endure made also odious ordynaunce surquedy power dresse robbe god maugre puisaunce spoyle temple frowardnes take treasors agayn rightwisnes shewed sodayne auenture rauinous prince may whyle endure great appollo toke men vengeaunce vnware tempest al sturdines leuin thunder brought mischaūce guerdon able agayn falsnes prince hertes aye playnly expres rauyne rich wyl recure god wyl nat suffre longe endure noble prince stable constaunce ye desyre stand sykernes remembre oft vpon fatal chaunce proud xerxses cursednes life disposing hygh noble ye lyst state assure eschue rauyne ye shal long endure xi chapter ¶ artabanus murdred king xerxses howe hym selfe murdred next tragedy weping dolerous whyle bochas stint wold haue pee knight appered called artabanus whyche aforne murdred king xerxses gan complaynt put prees full concludyng speke wordes playne vseth murdre murdre shal slayne artabanus record writing xerxses prouost whylom rede falsly conspyred sleight workynge kynge bothe perce mede hauing seuen sonnes wer dede worthy knyghtes manly right stronge albe father set great wrong presumed vsurpacion perce mede quench y• clere lyght trouble lyne iust succession force nat ryght nothyng resemblyng trewe knight murdre xerxses falsly ordayne right cast murdre sonnes twain conclude playnly tarye sayd kyng called xerxses two sonnes yongest called dary colled artaxerxses story reherceth doutles discent borne succede father reign perce mede murdre xerxses outward vnknow artabanus y• treson wrought tyl afterwarde within lytel throwe newe forged sought fals odious train wer neuer thought told artaxerses gan rown howe dary cast occupy croun dethe xerxses ordained dary none wight wher vpon ought complayned artaxerxses prouided anon right slaughter dary agayn ryght younge brother innocence falsly slaine none offence ye wote treson compassed twene brethern twain make diuision younger slayne nothyng trespased moste redy way distruccion artaxerxses conclusyon whan bretherne murdred dede artabanus thought succede artaxerxses playne instruccion one called baccarus token knewe couert false treason aforesayd double artabanus howe traynes outragyous xerxses slayne ye haue herd toforne dary appeched wherby lorne vncouth straūge treason wrought whan artaxerxses knowlegyng great aduise wayes hath sought artabanus bryng vnto rekenynge specyally dred one thyng feble bryng thing hys seuen sonnes great doute accomplyshe fully entente ful secretly ordynaunce al worthy hah letter sent dwellyng perce vnder obeysaunce without excuse lenger attendaunce armed echone especyall come haste vnto courte royall cause cōming know kynges purpose holden secre kept close hye lowe meanyng man priue except kyng sayd woulde se number men come nede defence myght gather lede among came artabanus vnto court list fayle man cruell couragious full sleyghtes gouernayle whiche thilke tyme armed mayle none armure lad saue backe haburion artaxerses beyng strength abrayed false affection mayle wanteth length woulde chaunge myne haburion tother hauyng none euyll suspection vngyrt selfe would lenger abide bothe sworde dagger cast thē farre aside threw haburion mayle stopped sight naked short conclusion king pulleth sworde kene bryght hert roue anon right indignacion toke seuen sonnes cast pryson ende shoulde endite death make digression god may vengeaunce respite murder wyll suche treason artabanus condicion falsely murder ye tofore haue seyne wt vnware murder guerdoned ageyne thus euer murder requireth wage slaunder importable odyous heare worde diffamous foule lāgages sounde horrible report appeare clip whose darknes may cleare worde murder vgly vnfayre rehearsyng infecteth ayre ¶ xii chapter ¶ duke palantes spartenoys warred theim missene rauishyng maydens death fatall caas piteous murder artabanus next order appeared bochas mighty duke called palautus sonne knyght named arathus exiled though treasonment citye called tarent vpon exyle sore gan complayne besechyng bochas get space within boke write greuous payne albe though whilom stode grace glad aspectes fortune face raysed fauour might duke estate pore knyght cereously matter conuey made duke gouernour whan sparteyns gan mortally warrey missenes sayth mine auctour great costage diligent labour cause wt mighty hand rauished force maydens lande people named spartenois story clerely deuise called afore lacedemonois armes proued manly ryght wise solemne sacrifise vnto goddes people messeny rauished maydens espy whiche wronge vengeaunce spartenois caught indignacion assent whole puissaunce layed siege rounde toun one wyll one affection made vowe y• siege begon neuer depart tyll towne afore towne fully ten yere lay fro siege made othe departed neyther night day styll abode sunder gothe therof wiues home wrothe husbandes messengere sent vnder wordes declaryng entent sayd accordyng reason like widowes liue disconsolate without comfort consolation farre frō husbandes stande desolate mischeues cōsidred fal eche estate long absence eche man shold drede thrugh diuers sicknes y• fal womanhede tyde abydeth nat maner man stynt course creature harde reherce thynge withstand cometh nature harme done kynde froward recure founde full lytell sykernes nature afforceth brotylnesse lytell sonde ought ynough suffyse declare domage may fall longe absence folkes ben wise somtime departed agayn men may nat cal seldome sene loue doth appall nothing maketh wyues erre disceueraūce folke werre theffect plainly insubstaunce sent hasbandes y• sege lai complayning plesaunce space ten yere loues play desolate sorowe great affray lyfe lad affyrmyng sentence cause cs̄traīt lōg absēce whan letter siege rad tofore cytie mortal stryues astonied gan waxe sad wery almost lyues considre complaint wiues tyl captayne remedy sought whose counsayl euen thus wrought first old knightes siege sworne accomplish cast true counsayl hight beforn hold promise therfor nothing rue yonge knightes come new myght lyst frely wyll whether wold go byde styll herupon auayle haste captayne made remembraūce high prudence gaue counsaile hat knyghtes old ly • h assuraunce shuld siege haue gouernaunce yong knightes fresh welbeseyne shuld siege home sent ageyne made among thē straūge ordinaunce home comyng without difference enterchaūge wyues plesaunce take first came presence thaccorde among sentēce moste redy way opinion engendrute procreacion amonge thē quarel nother stryfe mater varyaunce eueryman misused others wyfe desyres pleasaunce thus child thrugh ordynaunce engendred case thus befal parthenois men cal tong speke word plain greke lyst consydre se playnly sayne thilk chyldren engendred auoutry wherfore countre parthenois custome named borne wombes diffamed false occasion thys auoutry caused great mischefe domage man coude partye succession whan came age tytle right clayme herytage lyne falsly dothe procede hard know right shal succede disturbaunce false succession tytels claimed afforced wt great myght auoutry hath domynacion supported wyl tyght claym trouth hath lost clere light though party mighti strong god wyll nat suffre shall endure longe parthenois paysing thynges howe false assuraunce lynage gentle bloud troubled first kynges man knew high lowe parage owne father lykelynesse vysage father none great erroure coude yeue tytle successour whervpon folowed great mischaunce hateful heare countre echeman troubled countenaunce shulde clayme lyberte entre lande stande fre doute echeman party importable auoutry great mischefe taketh hede longe proces made thē know se able likelihede outrage fall pouertie assent cast flie vnder captain strong mighty hand countrey wyn lande rede chase duke palantus spake gouerne passage takyng leaue storye telleth thus departyng begynnyng vyage confuse chere vysage none great route chose father y• stode dout helde selues ashamed shame lande went like people disclaundered diffamed auoutry assēt citye called tarent stant poile mighty stronge coūtry duke palantus came meyny put great myght citizyns citye gate tarent full lyke manly knyght abode long prosperitie gouernour duke countrey tyll people false collusion depriue sought occasion exiled whan fall age lo common assure stormy hart vnsure courage selde neuer frendshyp dothe endure▪ men may day fauour recure morow let set prefe rathest hinder whā men mischefe ¶ xiiii chapter ☞ ceson quincius exiled graccus taken prysoner rehearce palantes duke leader parthenois wyll tell ceson quincius came bochas wt full piteous voyce tale gan graccus prince equois bothe one gan songe entune dolefully playne fortune myghty prynce ceson quincius complayned first made mencion rome wer contrarious felly wrought destruction full vniustly banished toun withstandyng dictatour cōfounde busy laboure cause exyle compassed rede slowe sayd negligent defende touchyng appeale dede brought falce entet yet cyncinatus father assent payde amendes sayth cronyclers met lande draught thre arblasters yet enemy would content procede exiled extorcion iudgement story full playnly compyled neuer myght reconcyled whiche haue pitye put remembraūce litle offēce haue great vēgeaūce graccus rome called cloellus prince equois mine auctour saith ye time notable glorious great duke full renoumed fame ye people equois toke name vnder support man haue disdayne processe declare certaine john bochas sayth nacion whiche first called hunoys secondly also succession full long tyme named anathois alderlast men called equois like trow mine auctor saith horse swyft toke first name remembred sentence manhode famous hardines agayne alexander made strong defence horsbacke great swiftnes besyde hyll playnly expresse whiche cronicles called caucasus thys people equois vyctoryous theyr noble playnly fynde nothyng earth expedient cōquest ethiope iude horse swyft seruyng entente therby conqueryng oryent great prowes passage equois brought egypt seruage thus euer equois abyde gate great good possession graccus gouernour gide whiche strength false suggestion againe romayns fyll great rebellion wt stand sent anonryght cincinatus proued full good knyght well trusted knowe toun prudence chosen dictatour lyuelode small possession albe worthy warriour whiche hath vainquished knyghtly labour said graccus worthy power home rome brought prysoner cyncinatus chare set called quincius great victory solemnely wyth senatours met yaue encreace glory laude tryumphe put memory graccus rebellion chaynes bounde cast darke pryson dyed full great mischefe conquestes first famous notable euidence v great prefe fortune aye false vnstable euer double frowarde deceyuable fall graccus declare gan full wele whylom sate hygh vpon whele ¶ xiiii chapter ¶ bochas rehearseth tyranny apyus falsenes iudges wt standynge bochas hath tolde apius falsenes importable outrage surfetes many folde remembred hatefull repreuable yet hym thought cōuenable rebuke spottyng name new rehearse slaunder defame great offence apius oppression vpon toke made hym grow inly couetous rauyne yt people quoke ye may se seconde boke myne auctour doth clerely specify fraude dome lechery eke thys tyrant remembred ye may rede chiefe iudge officer called decemvir pryde dede agayn custome theim y• feres made borne standerdes baneres otherwyse hygh presumption vsed beforne rome toun iudges custome manere like estate theyr gouernaunce eche haue borne bannere went suche ordinaūce twelue sergeaūtes numbred substaūce apius pryde great outrage chaunged hath custome vsage fyrst ordeyned eche place decemvir haue banner borne walkyng people manace hundred men armes beforne twenty ouer statute sworne wherby citye bare great coste dede people put feare drede se sargeaūtes walke plate mayle thought maueylous working judge go wyth suche apparayle proceadyng eche ben kyng whole entent apius menyng power myght hym lyst wronge ryght ryghtfull punyshe gylty spare fauour wronge brybes mede people oppressed stode sorow care founde succoure helpe thē nede lawe none reasō lay drede wyll iudge pleasaunce equitie thus maistry gouerned citye remembred bochas apius lecherous nature caught quarel ye haue herd caas agaynst virginia mayde clene pure nothyng recute touchyng lust father stryfe sharpe sworde made lose lyfe thys tyrant false rybaudry caused death hasty vyolence beauty maistry diyng mayde chaste innocence therfore demed sentence fore made cleare mencion chayned dye pryson eke decemvir lost power neuer rome bare name sect made none officer among apius bare blame whose cryme reboūdeth eternal shame ye haue heard discerne thā tribune chose gouerne bochas like found sayd iudges mischefe fyne apius lay pryson bounde exiled nyne good treasure lyne acheted short conclusion cōmon profite encrease towne ¶ lenuoy little tragedy dothe shortly deuyse mischefe foloweth great vnright vsed iudges many sundry wise whan fauour blinded hath syght innocence borne downe wyth myght hys quarell pouerte may procede bicaue trouth oppressed mede iudge equitie despyse take gyftes maner wyght ready wronges chastice gyftes turne away syght hondes close eares stoppe aryght aye ware frendshyp hate drede trouth oppressed wyth mede noble doctryne vertuous emprise philosopher great insyght iudges y• prudent wise frende foe dome dyght ryght wisenes sunne bryght eclypsed neuer lest men falsehede report right put abacke mede noble prynces supportours iustise called lode starres yeue people lyght apius let iudges practise let trouthes lāpe clere day nyght office paysed longeth knyght hold vp balaūce dome māhede law iudges corrupt mede ¶ bochas agaynst vntruth iudges svyng vpon death • pius hys rebuke hys greate outrage bochas writyng wext som▪what yrous againe iudges false thought corage sad demure age lyfe vertue shoulde drawe kepe preceptes statute lawe ought reason selfe habyle haue science phylosophy know theyr textes canon ciuyle therupon wittes whole apply cunnyng iudges prudent policy cause ordinaunces lawe comprehended rightful doom gretly cōmēded justice lawe dothe realmes enlumine susteineth trouth supporteth innocence rauynours boweth chyne punysheth robber great offence sluggy truauntes theyr negligence fayned beggers greatly disauayle constrayneth labour trauayle founder lawe antiquitie caused landes suffred none erroute made prynces royall magestie shyne worshyp diligent labour wrested courage many conquerour tryūphes shuld attaine lawe god nature dyd ordaine wyll tyme vnder subiection ryght wisnes trouth full wel cōceiued sensualitye seruaunt reason froward lust vnder locke ykeyed sentence statute disobeyed ryche ryght euery lande pore folke lyued labour hande lordshyp y• tyme anoyded mayntenaunce holy churche lyued perfitnesse knighthode tho dayes trouth whette laūce false extorcion none entresse marchaūtes winning came al rightwisnes artificer worke day ydell busines labour helde brydell woman age farced horned theyr tayles serpentyne wise men foly clarkes wer scorned whyche scyence freshely dyd shyne lawe disherited none heyres theyr lyne lesyngmongers found y• time socours flaterers
