made thā cōfessours golden world flouryng vertue borne vp loue grounded stablenes auoutry sprange none issue price wt doctrine established noble preesthod praier knighthod worthines ech thing law stode vnder gouernaunce marchaūts mesure iust pei balaūce first phoroneus dyligent laboure fonde lawes y• kyng argyues grekes study giit wt great honoure politick prīce auoided thē striues statute kept duryng lyues found first maner bochas doth deuyse howe jupyter made sacrifyse eke mighty minos whilom kinge crete ordayned lawes agayne transgression feare rygour foles vnmete staunche surfetes occasyons made robber mightye stronge prison dedalus chefe artificere made laborinthes diligence entere mercurie borne stode nyle writeth lactance egipt kynge vnto marchauntes dyd lawe firste compyle weight mesure vse chaffaryng wisdome excellent connyng olde poetes whilom wyse called god marchaundyse solon also best lawes made valery writeth self magnify athenienses therof full glad great wysdome whan espy fonde therin muche policy euer redy debate agayne tyrauntes sore dyd hate kyng lygurgus yet whilom dyd cure make lawes comon auauntage shuld perpetually endure made people sworne euery age went pilgrimage fro point point kepe certaine vnto time came home agayne lawes wer great substaunce profitable euery comonte chase liue exile penaunce neuer resort againe cite statute eternite shuld nat broke ye haue herd toforne cōuencion sworn comon profite tendernesse forsoke kingdome kinrede liue exile story beareth witnes dyed lay bedrede bad bone shuld cast lede amid see fer strande statute might strēgth stād eschued eueryche occasyon thyng hatefull fayre forsayd royall mighty toun shuld breke oth repair touching put dispayre cast neuer resort dayes lest wold breke sētēce lawes xv chapter ¶ bochas maketh exclamacion extorcion officer rome john bochas maketh digressiō rebuking cast assayle thylke officer ye wer rome toun extorcion oppressed porayle agayne iudges also itayle namely lucre mede set trouth asyde toke none hede maketh agayne exclamacion vertue contrarious vnder colour occasyon offyce lyst lecherous like condicioned vnto apius fynally sene false dome life vnclene quod bochas trouth thou iustise whych noble whilom dyd excel effect exercyse wher wonning ala wher ye dwel practike ful men tel fer put backe nowe disciplyne kyn exyled noble lyne aduocates nowe done occupye olde see place full royall falshede wyttes apply suche couetyse reigneth ouer cause ciuile cause crymynall dome take wher fals true wyll statute chaunged newe ben eke called accessours syttyng iudges yeue counsayle may full well called rauenours nat labour theyr auayle nombre robber folow theyr tayle pylle people ye haue hard forne bare shepe newe shorne matter sayne saue onely trouth stant desolate rightwisnes dare wight cōplayne wrong oppressed weping desolate wherfore ye prynces syt high estate thing mēde ye better hede take god shal wt full harde rekenyng make office magnificence twene man man wronges redresse wher matter agayne conscience refourme onely ryghtwysenesse stāde trueth mayntayne falsenesse let wise counsayl matter examine ye haste theron determine haue suche thynges mynde amonge thynke god wyll quyte lyke ye deserue ye spot noblesse yf ye wrong sworde punishyng drede kerue let reason conscience conserue noble estate thinke like werkīg lord wyl aske rekenyng xvi chapiter ❧of alcibiades exyled brent hys bedde put selfe prees tofore bochas cōplayntes discure came athene alcibiades time alyue fayrest creature remembred scripture discrete assayes one strongest manly hys dayes first borne full high linage aboue semelynesse well proporcioned hardy corage loued fauoured great fayrenesse famouse knyghthode hys worthinesse subtyll witted coude cloquen •• boche comprehende vnder shorte sentence wyt enclined manyfolde science conyng passyng retentife loued clerkes fond theyr dispences suche practife saw inuentife rede bokes reioysed hys life kept redde memoriall wyse counsaile none hym egal vncle ycalled perycles stode daunger excessife spendyng yet hys youth thys alcibiades seyng hys vncle pensiefe lokyng cast wisdom remedy thyng aswage hys heartes heuynesse gaue hym counsail great auisenesse fyrst rehearse matter stode hys vncles wofull hygh distresse ther delynered sūme goode repayre temple goddesse called minerna great excesse hys dispences stode somwhat drede touching thacoūpt y• muste yelde dede alcibiades vpon musyng hys vncle gaue counsayle sentence vncle quod let thynkyng selfe shape thys diffence nat tacoūpt meane prudence afore prouided face chere vnfayned suche duresse ye nat constrayned whan pericles coūsaile aduertiseth fonde worshyp resonable good layser selfe ful wel auiseth prouision prudent notable saued hys estate frō eche thyng reprouable stode touching thys matter accomptes daunger alcibiades athens chefe capteyne day day waxt vp great encres suche another ther seyne gouerne bothe werre pee citye assent hym chees theyr nauy especiall vpon see theyr admyrall knighthod sent hym aferre cathenoys theyr gouernour gayne cyracusenes gin werre first receiued wt glory gret honoure end great laboure fortune aye varyaunt vnstable duke nat founde fauourable accused toun athene gouernaunce gilty party treason thē reuoked al great puissaunce capitaynship ordinaunce fortune false mutabylitie vnwarely depriued dignitie selfe thus gan prouide went exyle fer countre cytie called elyde haue fredom lyberte hys lyfe stand suerte athene wolde haue deed vnto goddes offre vp heed whan entent certayne lacedemone toke ryght way relacion herd sayne howe cathemenses put afraye batayle vpon certayne daye held aduersytee gayne cathenoys fought see cause discomfyture tolde alcibiades thre captayns misauenture leading found recheles chefe named demosthenes tother called story telleth v tone niceas tother eurilocus alcibiades hauyng herof tiding auenge wrong put selfe prees lacedemon gothe fyrst kyng trouth called agydes beseching graunte encres certayne soudyours hys countre werrey athenoys cyte thus waxte stronge noble prouydence great people vnder gouernaunce lyke duke made strong hys defence people gadred obeysaunce prince wer hye puisaūce gan haue enuy wylful frowardnesse malygne agayne hys hyghe noblesse selde neuer regyon prowesse armes noblesse chyualry encrease ryches report high renoun fame connyng craft clergy may wher dwell without enuy whose malyce folke expert may se saue wretch man hath lyberte prince put memory escaped nat hygh parage enuyed glory life man hath auauntage agayne tonges odyous false langage stop venym best obstacle mē suffraūce tempre triacle clere prowesse alcibiades stayned noble prynces al eure hym raised vp great encres highest trone fortune hall fatal grace vnto hym fal tho dayes playnlye fable knight resemblable exyle clere renome shone grece gaue gret bryghtnes doth ruby aboue eche stone yet clip shadow worthynes lacedemonois dyd busynesse nat myght noble attayne false report renome restraine awayt layd take mischefe many traynes wer serched sought entent put reprefe al y• euer agayn haue wrought end purpose came nought god prouideth magnificence agayne malice saue innocence lykely fal great daungere lacedemonois gan hym dysdayne honour noble shone clere fone deedlye payne thus lyfe stode certayne manly wyse knew nothinge purpose malyce hee almoste ywarned late lyke haue stand great perplexitie grace fortune abate thoccasion hys great beaute wyth quene woxen full priue grace well stode none whiche gaue warnyng fone counsayle onely queene fro lacedemon wysely toke flight towarde athene thought wolde sene owne countre full lyke manly knyght though thei nat gouerned thē right towardes hym beyng distresse auenge wronge dyd thē duresse thought agaynst nature vengeable shewe cruelte thoccasion auenture ginne werre vpon countre natiue bloud meued pyte naturall gentlynesse debonayre agayne vnkindnesse case short conclusion king dary great apparayle thought werrey indignation athene towne tassayle purpose proudely preuayle thessifernes prince great puissaunce daries power al gouernaunce final cause grounde werre darius gan hastelye sent puissaunce ferre destroy athene vtterly holde vp sustayne party lacedomone whiche olde hatrede euer enuyous thē oppresse dede meane alcibiades treatie founded prudence thessifernes enclined pee therby party appease violence done noble prouidence fro place exiled athene shoulde reconciled vnto citie dyd signify darius made ordinaunce letter gan specify would stande gouernaunce condiscende playnly substaunce woulde labour lenger tary make accorde atwene king dary meane ment within athene senatours shoulde citie entent haue ful lordship gouernours cleare wedder troubled wt shours right vnwarely within royal toun treaty fyll discention • ōmeners gan sodaynly disdayne thralled vnder subiection assent common dyd ordayne onely tappease false discention reuoke agayne toun aicibiades thought mete prudence set quiete first commyng myne auctour doth reporte made duke againe y• cite gan partie cōmons supporte restore theyr old liberte senate dreding y• cōmonte fled exile full ferre prees onely drede alcibiades stode time great disioynt towne deuided gouernaunce brought euen poynt yelde citie vnto obeysaunce lacedemons vnhappy chaū ce within thē selfe debate vnder duke senat bare debate common chase theyr dyffence alcibiades gouerne voyage see cost great dispence without abode holdeth hys passage mighty shyppes made auauntage well enarmed cast yf myght lacedemonois proudly fyght thre mighty captain syde fyrst zestro bochas telleth thus second lorde gyde called mydare thyrde pharbanasus oh see lande armes full pompous knighthode magnanimite alcibiades toke thre strong fight yt take theyr meyny away scaped none duke y• day gan suche slaughter make high prowesse vpon hys mortall fone cast ouer borde almost euerychone came lande new battel met hym strande wayte layde hym enuyron hys enemyes sodayne auenture athene mighty champion whiche might armes moste souerainly endure made fone new discōfyture thus short time prince estate land water twyse laureate lyst nat cease abyde space halfe day comon profite towne tencrease towarde asye toke right waye townes castle take away apperteyned athene ryght gate agayne full lyke manly knyght maugre hym contrary wrought agayne hym rebellyon throughout asye lande dary knyghtly brought subiection agayne whose sworde holpe proteccyon fynall labour entent comon profyte towne augment glory noblesse athene repayred agayne al city ioy great gladnes came mete vpon fayre playne triumphes shuld openly sain old yong full glad vysages goddes brought ymages cry noise al prees victorious prince whose triumphes marciall shal euer song wt laud new encrees fore goddes ben immortall welcome welcome protectour wal shelde welfare agayne violence phebus knighthod sword defēce thus wt goddes made hym egall vncouth praising paganismes rightes lyke immortall songe refreytes cōmend merytes enhaūce glory set al delites lyght eternal fame set vp torch enlumyne name thus certayne dayes halowed entēt thrugh cyte hyghe prowesse tyll fortune hath eyen blent new fauour worldly false swetnes suger meynt wyth bytternesse bayte hony shedde prime face mortall venym hyd vnder manace hyghest clymbyng vp alofte thascence fortune whele custome hath full ofte best wend stande wele drewe fauour hym euery dele made people vnder obeysaunce fall mischefe lacke gouernaunce thus fro duke fortune gan vary hys noblesse go backe eke fayle whan kyng cirus successour dary full unwarely fyll batayle gan knyghtes proudly assayle whan dispurueyed voyde prouydence ouerlayde make resystence fynally alcibiades mischefe take mighte nat recure whan thrugh veynglory made recheles noble estate testablysh assure lacke foresight caused dyscomfyture encrease aduersitye banyshed agayne cyte thus diffaced clypsed glory cytie put straunge gouernaunce lacedemonoys victory knewe maner cheuysaunce refourme vnhappy chaunce saue refute myne auctour dothe reherce fled vnto kyng perce athene newe exiled thirty person furious vengeable chase cyty bochas hath cōpyled toun gouerned albe able vsyng maner hatefull repreuable thrugh theyr tauyne tempouerish cite thyng moste odyous comonte worme drede bred vp hert suffred lyue pee amonge selfe whan dyd aduerte great prudence alcibiades howe manhode pereles lest wold multitude knightly acquyte ingratitude assent abridge lyue dayes agayne hym malice haue conspyred exyle make delayes accomplysh longe haue desired brennīge hate hertes falslye fyred murdre enuy causeles agayne ryghte alcibiades noble worthy knight thus time approched date terme afore set constellacion periody hys lyues fate concluded made mencyon cruell murdre distruccion ala prince golde soudyours may prouide agayn fals conspiratours fortune newe gan hym enchace traynes ne scape myght daily pursued place aye vnto place perce mede tho wer sight tyl enemy fyll night slepyng ala sone sped whā found brēt bed thus bi murdre purpose atcheued ala horrible dede good knight wel armes preued renomed famous manhode brent among cole rede first vnwarely bedde ytake consumed amonge cole blake ende alcibiades knighthod souerayne werre lyon lambe pee mar victorius fate dyd ordayne fame palaies flieth wt wyngs twain son mynerua speke hygh prudēce lyke mercury notable eloquence xvii chapter bochas maketh exclamation vpon dethe alcibiades ofatal sustren span y• lyues thred short term ye determin▪ suffre brenne among cole rede ye hasty breke vntwyne web knighthod yt clere dyd shyne cast noblesse beames cleare ala euer fyll daungere stix attropose haue malyce slayn good knyght thre kepe selfe close doughters ycalled derke night thou letū queyntest eke lyght alcibiades myrrour l • tern speke knighthod men shuld gouerne yeslee worthy wretch ye spare thercites lyueth hector slayne dede funeral smoke maketh relmes bare race vp cedris braunches may nat sprede ye pul laurer ye make y• fir sede ful lytel thanke kyngdoms ye deserue caytiues fostre worthy sterue alcibiades passed fate light knighthod lyeth clipsed shade parcas susterne soone set hys date high noblesse make laurer fade lacedemonois dethe wer glad funerall fyre body hath dyffied hygh prowesse soule stellifyed ¶ lenuoye ala tragedy doth hert blede pen quaketh ruth pyte writyng whan take hede se straunge fearfull dyuersyte worldly vusure felycite howe see shortli comprehend froward fortune doth prince discend alcibiades corage manhed rehersed bokes ye may se genltylnes goodly heed semelynes fredom bounte hygh prudence magnanymite famous auctours cōmed yet hys seate fortune made discend people perce mede whyle gouerned athene cyte stode daūger gan sworde drede al rebel countre chastised cruelte whan fame gan hyghest vp tascend whele fortune made discend murdre treson prudent frendlihede outward fayre chere couert iniquite plesaunt speche vnder falshede houyshed sharpe tayled lyke bee songe sirenes drown men see one combyned malyce extend cause prince see discend noble prince se much rede remembring storyes antiquite afore prouidyng treason procede aye moste dredfull hygh prosperyte let others fallyng myrrour turne fortune al auctors reprehend syt hyghest red • est discende xviii chapter ☞here bochas writeth agaynest desyres people proces ye list lere lyke bochas maketh mencion worldly folk moste souerainlye desier haue lordship great exaltacion vp climbe entencion worldly worshyp hyghest place erthly treasours atones enbrace feruent flame gredy desyres muche gatheryng findeth suffisaunce hungry etyke kyndleth fyres auarice longe continuaunce theyr thyrst worldly habundaūce tantalus ryuer abraydeth euer one drowned ī drīking deme part none may tresour dropsy staunch drīke ye lyst dede tagus flodes deper thei launche gretter drinesse doth • brest brede higher water ebbe moste drede false indygence hert hath cōfounded full see seme barge groūded thus euery man wold ryches attayne suffisaunce hold contēt haboūdeth rathest complaine lacke good ala howe blent wher shal gadrīg good spent one percase shall thē therof discharge hate spēd large within body full lytell stature corages growe vp magnificence vp tascend busy cure clymbing transitorye ascence hauyng hope worldly apparence like nothig puisaūce might trouble nothing aduerting fortune double set ioy cōquest werres enbrace erthe vnder puissaunce lyke might • eche aboue sterres bring heuen vnto obeisaunce power wayed balaunce counterwayd aright memory shuld fynde veynglory may auail fetherbeds softe shetes reynes longe large wyde dyuers deuyses clothes chaunged oft vicious meyny walkyng syde voyde vertue ambicious pride▪ causeth prīces report fame mi • uing haue euell name thus lacke vertuous dilygence false luxury ydelnesse vpon flaterers outragious expence support wronge oppressing right wisnes lesyngemongers haue entresse sustayn whan prīces cure god wyl nat suffre shal lōg endure office prince support right sworde knighthode fro wronge redresse pore releuing nat toppres thē wt myght old seruauntes well preued nat disdayn hasty rigour vengaunce sodayne let mercy tempere dome procede god shal quite nede xix chapiter john bochas speaketh agaynst idelnesse rehersing howe men haue ioy one scyence another min auctor bochas maketh rehersayle eschewing froward ydlenes vnto vertue may moste auayle good diligent laboure honest busynesse concluding full plainlye doth expresse euery mā reioiseth sētēce nat glosed thing disposed haue ioy heuenlye influence knowe course aboue celestial knighthod diligence preue selfe actes marciall reioyse entent fynal eloquence philosophy aboue study poetry hardy knight seruaunt faint george mening planet sercheth thastronomere martes smyth laboureth forge harneys stele maketh tharmourere deuisour diligence entere freshe contriuyng olde entayle fyndeth newe deuises plate mayle labourer setteth wholy pleasaunce tylth land time sowe grayne encrease sede yerely habundaunce plough labour vayne castyng season drouth eke rayne poetes sit library desyre nature solitary mē loue thing vndertake fyshe foule hunt houndes woul sundrye clothes make philosopher foūd ground study set fyrst bound caused poetes playnly conclude prease lyue solitude logiciens delite argumentes philosopher vertuous liuyng legisters folowyng entente greatly reioyce lucre winnyng phisiciens trauayle getting poetes subtyll forme new inuencion thynges transforme poetes eschue ydlenes walke ryuers welles crystallyne moūtaynes morow course dresse mist diffied whā phebus first doth shine study bokes morall disciplyne nothyng coueyte set entent wyth moderate fode content chefe labour vyces fage maner couert similitude none estate wyth theyr langage rebukyng termes dull rude euer write vertue ey cōclude appayre man maner wyse office poetes wise xx chapter ¶ malleus duke cartage oppression tyranny hewen piece whan bochas hadde rehearsed poetes straunge studye solayne wrytynges theyr desire solitary seates pleasaunt place make dwellinges besyde ryuers holesome well sprynges whiche accomplished gan pen auance prynces affrike put remembraunce dyd hys busy diligence theyr pyteous falles put memory first came twayne vnto hys presence olde noblesse appalled glory whiche hym sempt within territory affryke boundes longyng cartage fyrst appeare deadly vysage one named malleus duke cartage affryke lorde syre sonne also called cartalus whilom chiefe prince bishop eke tyre malleus whych helde great empyre affryke pompous outrage exiled euer cartage whyche caused hart mery aye remēbred vpon fell banishing gadered people win lande surry felde whyle lay hostyng cast fully make tariyng haste knyghtly fell corage maugre hys enemyes resort vnto cartage auenge exyle hys hart set fyre entent fortify sent haste hys letter downe tyre tartalus hym hye brynge wyth hym chyualry citye stele armed clene father party holde vp sustene whā thys byshop knew holly manere thys purpose ye haue heard deuise consydred tyme yere ordeyned sacrifyce rytes panym wyse hercules whiche citye aboue god souerayntie whose feast holde space certayn dayes whiche halow neades must entende custome make delayes must therto condiscende leauer hys father offende case negligence vnto hys god offence wherfore father indignacion case arettyng vnkyndnes therof caught great occasion agayne sonne froward wilfulnes prynces oft furious hastines wyll pyke quarell causeles sentence agayn folke absent though ther offence tonges venemous nature whan perceyue prince meued agreg hys yre busy cure false langage make greued ther poysō wel expert preued tonges hatefull vyolence namely whan prince list yeue thē audience feast accomplyshed myghty hercules innocent double false menyng sayd byshop wyll retcheles came father without tariyng chaunged neither habite clothyng ensygnes wyse tofore done sacrifice anone hys father made delay wythout excuse would bet hasty rancour selfe day made hym hanged vpon hye gybet lawe iustice aside set tyranny moste furyous wode vengeaunce trouthes place stode may tyrantes well discryue whose swordes ben whet aye vengeaunce bloudy thyrst doth theyr harte ryue eares aye opē hear mischaūce furious myrth theyr mortal pleasaūce pale smilyng laughter hatred concludeth euer vpon cruel dede minister parcas sistern thre vntwynd y• thredes folkes mortall cosyns hasty cruelte vnto wode furyes infernall chyldrē pluto vengeaunce marciall vyces bere thē wele shall turne hell ixions whele thus malleus father vnkynde lyke tyraunt shed cruelte ye haue heard fynde furious hart olde enmyty force entred cartage cite slough tho hys hatefull yre hym afore exyled tyre wrought wyll nothing ryght gan robbe spoyle noble famous town made hated people syght outrage great extorcion hauyng ioye consolation within hys hart playnly gladnes saue lyke tyrant people oppresse people cartage sore gan complayn vpon mischefe desolation bochas writeth rehersyng certayne wyll stepmother wyt reason prynces haue dominacion false pyllage ryches clyme vp fast trust right well theyr lordship may last theyr great power worldly excellence accrochyng temporall ryches whā tyrātes may stand defence froward wyll ruleth theyr highnes lordshyp playnly expresse thys worlde discerned loue people whā well gouerned tyranny false oppression causeth prynces stand great hatrede worth dominacion without loue let preue nede men tyme may suffer drede whan drede constrayned gone prynce man alone se example malleus cartage hys castels tower made stone hys oppression vengeaunce outrage people affryke rose hym atones cut asunder flesh also hys bone cast thē playnly wer wode vnto goddes offer vp bloude people dempt mortall crueltie offring plesaūt cōuenable vnto theyr god please deitie bloud tyrantes whiche yt vengeable thus cruell prince make y• people vnstable necessitie whyche ought complayned wreke wronge y• cōstrayned lo ende malleus tyraunt whyche doth prynces full well exemplify god aboue pleasaunt delyte suche robbery pyl people false tyranny tale hasty vengeaunce suche thing god displeasaunce ¶ lenuoy reade considered sayd tragedy sheweth prynces myrroure full notable rygour shall tēper modefy procede vengeable prynce right commendable rancour hart chere courage deferre tyll yre asswage hasty yre sodayne melancholy colorike fume yr fury vnrestraynable vnqueint fyres wt flame tyranny fretyng etyke hate incomparable like beastial tygres lyke lyon vntretable ne suffer infernall rage defer dome tyll yre asswage royall lyon morall gentry among beastes force incomperable preueth power regaly gayn beast prostrate defēsable mighty prynces case semblable innocentes take mercy morgage respityng rygour tyll yre asswage sparkle vēgeaūce quycked party wyndes foure fell abhominable blast detraction blast flattery blast false rowners yt forge many fable blast brybours vycious culpable wt smoky slaunders felon false vysage causeth yre prīces yt may neuer asswage whiche let prynces noble policy beware tonges double disceyuable whiche wt venym infect eche company poynaunt poyson penetrable folke absent mischeuable depe freteth serpentyne langage causig prince yre may asswage noble prynces let vertue magnify hygh estate make merciable morall seneke doth clerely specify trone prīces clemēce made stable vengeaunce delayed god agreable hasty rygour doth outragious damage whē hūble request yre may aswage ¶ xxi chapter ¶ substaunce host hymilcho duke cartage goyng conquere cecile dyed pestilence selfe slayne myghty prynces twayne next order wt pale deade vysage tofore bochas hymilcho gan cōplayne vnhappy fall fatall passage whan sent aucthoritie cartage cōquere mighty puissaunce lande cycile vnto obeysaunce cartage opinion lefull entent without title ryght reason teritories boundes augment cause hymilcho sente mighty duke noble aduaunce whiche cartage hole gouernaunce must passe see towarde cicyle noble worthy knyght full great enarmee chose cartage stele armed bryght fone cōquere force might fortune gan disdayne purpose neuer myght attaine grounde gynnyng distruction remembred shortly sentence fyll ayre great corruption whiche caused full great pestilence among meyny vnware violence sodaine mischefe vpon fall lost almost worthy knyghtes nye hys people slayne y• morayne left hys meyne infortunate turned agayne home cartage citee causeles hasty cruelte hath slayn thys duke bochas doth cōpyle lo may trust fortune xxii chapter ☞ heynon duke cartage dismembred whose death mā gan succede mighty duke y• called haynon whyche purposed chaunge dede name duke false ambicion called throughout y• mighty toun kyng cartage therupon pryde finde wayes felly gan prouide cōtent duke men shold call cartage named kyng like purpose fall fro day day meanes compassyng might fulfyll vncouth thing crowned raigne londe last meane way fonde daughter yonge tender age whiche people stode great fauour cast yeue mariage yonge knyght sonne senatour whiche citye gouernour purpose myght attayned day mariage tyme ordeyned palayce chefe principall sayd duke let make ordinaunce holde feast full solemne royall great coste made purueyaunce sundry daintyes whiche y• substaunce necessary maner thing vnto feast worthy kyng gaue charge vnto purueiours ready agayne certayne day feast came senatours dwellyng cartage durst none saye nay purpose make delay thought fraude apperceyued cast yt day deceyued conueyed inwarde entent kyng raygne cartage senatours would neuer assent breake custome olde vsage durst therof vtter langage kept secrete without noyse soun fully cast procede treason next way knew better rede desire playnely ordayne cartage senatours dede likely purpose attaine crowned lorde souerayne accomplishe lust thing cartage raygne lord kyng senate wer vtterly destroyed finde maner resistence wherby purpose annoyed none dare say nay magnificence porayle defence feast cast procede entent conclude dede officer made sworne helpe destroy falsely poyson senatours spake forne vitayles dainty foyson eke wine short conclusion venym intoxicate palaice spare none estate officer conscience accomplyshe horrible thing secretely vnder great prouidence senate therof gaue warning whan knew mortall cōpassyng duke haynon shew affray put prudence weddyng delay wherof duke gan haue suspection matter fill maner drede thought would collusion againe cartage mortally procede gan call helpe nede mauritayne kyng great renoun force fall vpon towne made promise aduauntage make fre distribucion rich treasure pyllage whiche might fynde toun vtter fyne hys entencion destroy wilfull crueltie famous cartage y• mighty strong citye thralles towne dwellyng suche borne lowe lynage strēgth party workyng made mortall fell outrage within mighty castell cartage kepe close malyce enuy agayne citye selfe fortify nought mighty senatours therof ware high prudence gaine malice false robbours made thē strong prouidence especiall ordeyn defence first party let commyng mauritayne stronge cruell king assent lyst nat delay rose tone great ordynaunce false duke venquisshe outray churles brought vttraunce fyll vpon wyth great puisaunce fynally procedyng reason dome auyse toun first duke remembred dispoyled doublet eke vnlaced ioynt fro ioynt hewen dismembred heed eyen araced ryght afore compased haue distroyed owne mighty toun ye haue herd receyued guerdon ¶ lenuoye tragedy doth pitously complayne maketh maner lamentacion mighty ryche prince twaine slayne cartage made mencion causelesse tone saue thoccasion pestilēce froward viage slewe people borne cartage fortune also gan frowardly disdayne agayne ryche mighty duke haynoun whan malyce gan mortally ordayne senatours murdre toun feest craft false poyson ye haue herde reherced outrage agaynwarde dismēbred cartage doth vengeaunce vēgeaūce shall attayn hygh estate without excepcion pyte vengeaunce doth restrayne shall mercy receyue guerdon ryght requireth trouth reason cruell prince shall haue wage deth lyke duke dismēbred cartage noble prince beste payne preserue fro rebellyon comon people stand certain euery wynde tournyng vpsodoun fortune chaunge affeccion turning hertes wt tryst glad visage lyke y• people dyd whylom cartage ❧ autour agayne couetous people nature y• content lyttell thing wise ware circūspect goddes vnder god heuī aboue reignig world gouern called thēpres mother rychesses first founderesse serched artyficeres straunge treasours hyd neres noble lady princesse famous knowyng man vncouth condicyons sawe experyence richesse noyous hym eclypse disposyons conuay inclynacions wronge way vertue set asyde howe couetouse full peryllous gyde auarice vertues contrayre gredy worme y• serpent vnstauncheable man betraisshe wt promyses debonayre prime face sote agreable taught nature craft deceyuable subtyll serching wer y• none first erth delue precious stone riche myners serche y• entrayles fynde metal worldly auaūtages contryued shyppes theyr brode sayles diuers see make passage couetyse ordayned first vyages caused prince ryde landes ferre eche agayne gyn werre auarice gan first robberyes awayte brigantes extorte pyllages murdre slaughter couert briberyes olde contryued furyous fell domages wrought atcheued maner age nowe dayes let set prefe false couetyse caused suche mischefe first rote false extorcion spoyle temple mother rauyne sterer vp oppressyon take force doctryne myne auctor doth plainly determyne concludeth full pytouse wyse rote yuell false couetyse eke norice conteke stryfe maystresse murdre wilfull vyolence made men ieoparte body good lyfe caused discencion disobedyence grutching comons wtdraught reuerēce rigorous constraynt sodayne rebellion rumour realmes vnware subuercions froward dragon full ydropisy whose fretyng etike may plēty fede staunche thyrst remedy drinketh hath nede tresure y• stant drede tantalus though swym y• flodes mydas well playneth lacke good worme eke causeth y• men rich haue drede theues night waking heare cofer bedde presse cat rat mouse worme meuyng weneth anone within selfe demyng come wt great apparayle vncouth pillor treasure assayle wofull soule standeth euer drede aye abydeth labour trauayle goodes whiche doth possede falleth dispayre lest would fail twene hope drede suche battayle enterminyng eche cōfound gredy whan abounde hope vnasured drede dispayred metyng harte make mortall warre whā hope presumeth wt drede apayred like cowarde maketh stand afarre dull chere cloudy starre dare shew light treasour euer encrease set wholy labour dare touch thing loueth cofers close shut vnder key thoughe haue muche maketh therof bost lest tresure men would hym werrey playneth nede like would dey fayneth false pouert spare dispence oppressyng plenty froward indigence though chestes heaped golde yron barres fast shut closed false scarcitie gouerneth housholde none excesse vndisposed indigent hart straytely enosed herebus heyre yet well worse dede greatest ryches cōplayne vpon nede herebus hath yrou stone auaryce buylt foule citee whele turneth ixion vnder boundes thesephone zisiphus may neuer day go free stone continually trauayleth busy labour lest auayleth thus auarice vertue contrary founde among vyces full contagious euer busy restlesse stone cary vp downe wt wery zisiphus whose endles labour braydeth theseus whiche helde brydle fruteles busines condemned hell liue ydlenes couetise cruell marinere called charon wt flegetonte many streyght many fell daūgere sayleth floudes furious acheronte vnder darked cloudy orizonte auarice chose whylom nygardshyp treasorer cofers kepe first declare labour gatheryng couetous men dede coūterpayse streight kepyng euer meynt importable drede sorow departyng mortall mede may called trouth equitie cerberus waker heades three fyrst head vnstauncheable desyre worldly goodes great rich attayne encrece hotter fyre seconde heade dredefull payne kepyng hart doth constrayne vnware departyng sodaynely doth fall third head greueth wakyr worme yt bereth head thre called worme gredy couetyse whose busy cōstraynt restles perplexite troubleth soule full furious wise whiche froward monster playnly deuyse braydeth hidra whome poetes sayne one head cut groweth thre agayne euer tayle plenty ryches custome foloweth grutchyng enuy hath treasure great michnes selde glad party thus bothe twayne stande ieopardye ryche wt plenty holde appayed neady wyth pouert afrayed yet pouert full great sykernes treasour man wyll assayle myne auctour bochas beareth witnesse amiclates amonge porayle lyued peace sure battayle helde hym content wt suche god sent whan riche wer armed werre went vertuous pouert standeth euer siker case watche house hath full lytle nede proude pompey assieged dura feare iulius stode great drede people rude herof take none hede suche reioyse shede blode straunge werres wrongly get goode story olde ful well reherce conne diuers study folke mortall first diogenes cōtent tonne made lodgyng principall saw course aboue celestiall lyued gladder amonge philosopher kyng cresus wt hys stuffed cofers yf men woulde vnto mynde call great mischeues folowyng habūdaūce thinke also sardanapall treasour came vnto mischaunce sophoclius poorest substaunce gardayne full lekes grene right nought el hym selfe sustene philosopher euer gladde lyght watche made hys tour full surely slepte al longe nyght hauyng drede theues ne robbours somer walkyng among grene flour colde wynter full merely ofte drie strawe lay slept full softe cyntinatus poore laborere feyed dichesse get hys sustenaunce without grutchyng euer glad chere bothe porte countenaunce dempt muche suffisaunce pleasaunce cresus kyng lyde content lytle nature hys gyde thys poore man hys pouert assured lytle fode clothes fewe heartes ease gladsome peace recured lyked hym nat ouer head hewe thing conceyued clerly doth v shewe ioyous pouert conueyed wt gladnesse grutching auoyded surmounteth al richesse folke consider ryght pitous sighes theyr thoughtfull busynesse theyr great labour theyr lytle slepe nyght endure worldly rychesse y• abydyng dredefull sykernesse thing peysed called memory erthly power double transitory storyes whiche ben credible topreue theyr power nat abydyng poynt slydyng fallible whylom massinissa numidy kyng mighty recorde writyng feare siphax onely hys lyfe saue flede mountaynes hid hym caue founde ful smale vitayle constrayned narowe indigence nede whā deyntes mischese gan fayle gadred rote eate drede eke proude xerses kynge perce mede drāke blod water staūche wt thrust drede trauayle gaue hym suche lust yet men would saye auenture compelled agayne theyr volūte kynges twayne suche mischefe tēdure maugre theyr wyll necessite casuall chaunce refte theyr liberte rygour thys sodayne rage came constraynt courage folke theyr pouerte great meates selfe fede ben strong whole fayre see also lusty preued nede vpright limmes theyr iourneys spede long lyfed cause expresse onely thys vse excesse poore men best medicine due labour moderate abstinence good ayre feldes wher phebus lust shine voydinge darke mistes y• causeth pestylence heuy stomake fele violence nat enriche lech potyquares selfe saue vncouth lectuares folkes ryche worken contrary causeth malady stronge fro theyr diete euery day varye diuers meates theyr syttyng longe▪ theyr apetites wronge take time thei mai nat endure custome oppresseth nature thus myne auctour shortly deuyse seeth glad pouert stādeth sekernes euyl seeth couetyse rote ground false extort rich ryot annexed engendryng long sicknes theron concludyng moderate diete setteth body soule rest quiete xxiii chapter ❧ howe euagora kynge cypre artaxerses outrayed put hys kyngdome folowingi order y• processe bochas remembreth next writyng appered rehersed thus y• caas euagora cypre kyng hys eyen derked manyfolde wriyng bycause lost riche lande tofore cōquered wt hande lande cypre made mencion diuers metal passyngly habounde hath ryches great plenty foyson citie lyke founde stādeth farre south wt many hilles rounde hath also many commodity within boundes townes city touchyng cypre say whiche lande euagora kyng tyll gan proudly warrey lacedemons partie susteynyng gayne artaxerses metyng sayd euagora brought vttraūce put fro kingdome fro al gouernaunce xxiiii chapter ¶ howe theo kynge egypt artaxerses driuen hys kyngdome fledde araby next euagora came kyng theo egipt longe tyme possessour john bochas gā declare wo fortune dyd frowarde labour fro hym drewe frendshyp fauour sodainly iniquite cast kynge downe fro royall see lyst malyce hym nat differre ne would suffer hym lyue pe • caused hym begynne werre agayne sayd myghty artaxerses wenyng therby haue great encrees gadred shyppes made great armee entent haue met hym see lacedemons fauourable sent vessel stuffed vitayle dempt pride hym selfe able artaxerses holde battayle hasty trust doth fooles often fayle theo anone ryght dryuen egipt yput flyght artaxerses pursued hym sore tofore hys face durst nat appere fledde araby myne auctour saythe banished egipt deedly face chere hys fate lyst lere depriued kyngly dignite fortune cast royall see xxv chapiter ¶ howe amynta macedone kyng erudice hys wife alysandre perdica philyppe slayne among fate cōplaining fortune dredefull violence came amynta macedone kyng john bochas shewed hys sentence declare hys magnificence alysandre graunde father lyfe hauynge four child erudice hys wyfe fyrst alysandre called perdica named seconde thirde philyppe macedone stalled kyng grece lyke founde whiche ryches greatly dyd habounde eke father thys noble warriour alysandre mighty conquerour myne auctour dothe procede maketh maner disgression matter like ye may rede gynneth order discription macedone famous region amonge grekes writeth especiall seuen prouinces principall procedyng sayth countre stretch boundes hym enuyron towarde see called egee forthe achaya towarde septentrion messene westwarde gothe doun crafte costes cast dalmacia name therof dothe last macedone dothe also v lere olympus standeth great mountayne kyngdom many great mynere golde syluer lyke bokes sayne hyll nouther wynde ne rayne thylke mountayne high dothe attayne may nouther blow ne rayne kyng amynta whō spake toforn grece many great battayle olympiens macedone borne illyriens togyder dyd assayle wisdom alway preuayle enemy whyle stode strife hys dethe shapen erudice hys wife myne auctour bochas doth diffine imagined destruction bycause another concubine set affection day set tyme hys confusion fully ordayned mariage slayne one linage suster called vryone whiche prudently espied manere erudice secretly alone goth kyng tolde hym yfere story order telleth though fayled daye empryse thought fulfyll another wyse thys meane iniquite fraude false ymaginyng cause cōtrariouste destruction myghty kyng conclusion false workyng haue slayne kyng lyne haue raygned concubyne whan saw myght nat atcheue furious purpose none auenture venomous malice vpon lord preue party dyd busy cure enmitees mischeues procure agayne kynge mortall fell assayes sorow trouble shorte dayes night day hys lyfe stode euer drede hym betraye cast hoke lyne may take hede frely escape eschewe decline malice woman whan serpentine▪ se example thys quene erudice voyde vertue full euery vice ala prince beware bridel noble reynes reson commit ala bothe shyp rother vnto sirenes row vp doun throughout caribdis theyr destruction craft cyrces ala wer made nice blynde remembre vpon thys erudice made aminta liue sorow drede rest peace suffered haue space thought trouble lyfe gan lede tyl long processe deth gan hym manace yet died fortune gaue hym grace eldest sonne wisdome ordayne called alysandre hys crowne attayne thus alisandre hys successour cathynenses gan rancour lete agaynst hym wyth great labour theyr sufferaunce came hys royall sete set hys realme quiete first athene myghty strong toun prouided peace hie discretion auoyde ambiguite olde debate olde outrage first sent strong cite sonne philippe yong tender age peace assured lye hostage citye storie beareth witnes gan grow vnto full hye noble committed vnto discipline great duke called epaminondon vertue youth made encline duke justine maketh mencion maner recommendacion tofore hys auyse neuer prynce excellent wise fyrst commendeth hys vertuous corage hys hye noblesse hys vertuous excellence discent borne hye linage two thynges concludeth sentence sayeth magnificence egall mar famous chiualry sonne phebus hye philosophy bochas doth hys style auaunce ful notably excellent langage sayth treasour atteyneth substaūce thylke richesse auoydyng outrage bonde mariage knyt vp knot atwene excellence famous knighthode dame prudence knot auaileth golde cofer glorious perpetually abyde mighty prince ought philosopher whiche prudence al vice set asyde whan manhode prouidence gyde vertuous force captayne werre let men well trust partie may erre epaminonda knighthod sustenour carbuncle vertue bokes tell con gentel maners called famous flour high noblesse worldly son whose knyghtly triumphes high vp ron martes palais blessed souns famous trumpettes golden clariouns called bright myrrour rightfull quarelles partie sustene extort wronges iust reformatour aye egall iuge entent clene whiche neuer coude nothing truth meaane wolde custome hate aliaunce nouther partie decline balaunce commende hys vertuous prowesse hys proued triumphes hys magnanimite hys marciall actes hys knyghtly busynesse gettyng many strong cyte labour commonte augment woulde neuer ceace ioy common wele tencreace thys also hys vsaunce euermore euer gate part largesse golde coyne set lytle store heart set gentlenesse manly fredome playnly expresse spared good shewed well dede hys true seruauntes helpe theyr nede kept nat cofers hys treasour nature liberall releue eche manly soudiour suche preued actes marciall holde hys feest funerall dethe storie maketh mynde fre left nothyng behynde office famous dignity great emprises hys tyme wrought encresed frāchises grece ī city liberty hys prudence sought common profit selfe nought great augmenting strāge teritories came meane victory amonge hys knyghtly excellence diuers auctours vnto mynde brought hys lyfe studied science vpon connyng set holy hys thought manly prowesse dethe fered nought shewed well founde day whā receyued dethes woūde home borne vnto hys pauillion armour bloude stayned reed couche men layed downe gan abrayde lay halfe deed sir quod one thyng take heed hath enemy thys daye felde wounded taken vp shelde hys knyghtes tolde hym nay maner knyghtly reioysyng commaunded without delaye presence bryng thervpon full pitously lokyng full lyke knyght mortall chere kyssed sayde ye shall thou felow armes brother neuer wouldest felowshyp forsake sure abyding ther nat another euery iourney dyd vndertake welcome ende must nowe make deth soule shall haue plesaunce kept yet remembraunce afore hys deth put mynde hour came hys memorie enquire left nat behynde haue quod daye victorie felde hath y• palme glorie knightes prayed y• day dey playne trueth would hym sey hym tolde playnly caas partie wonne feld might worde reioysed hys spirite yelde vp anone ryght died lyke worthy knyght whō shewed aueyleth sentence noble knighthode ioyned wt prudence meane hys wyse doctrine philyppe laye hym hostage gan encreace knyghtly discipline wext vertue ryght wext age whose father furions outrage called alysandre made mencion slayne hys mother false trayson whose dethe perdicca dede yonger brother story doth deuise crowne gan linially succede slayne anone full cruell wyse suche false murder euery man shuld agrise ye haue herde first amynta alysander kyng perdicca xxvi chapter ☞ howe proude tiraunt aman hanged innocent preserued horrible fall furious rede foloweth y• great aman ful false tyraūt foūd word dede byrth macedonian bible full well reherse chefe maister well conscerne assuerus hys people gouerne exalted hye pryde goddes people contrarious hys hatefull venym lyst nat hyde lyke tiraunt malicious wylful rancour fell dispitous fully disposed coud nat withdrawe destroy jewes theyr holy lawe hys entent gate auctoritie hys subtell false compassyng sent letter eche countrie thrugh al perce biddyng kyng hye low within land dwellyng wight except people vnto aman obey knele lout thys byddyng kyng assuere whan quene vasty voyded pride hester chosen mayde entere brought court y• kyng abyde youth gyde worthy jewe called mardoche within susis fayre large cite whose counsaile euery thyng wrought passyng fayre great mekenesse enukes y• king brought accepted great fayrenesse vnto hys grace storye beareth witnesse cherished especiall aboue maydens court royall perce crowned quene pee commaunded al tho region duryng feast men might sene kynges nobley city touns thys feast ryche royall souns came eares simple mardoche whiche came maner se tofore palays dyd abyde jewes hys company happe cast hys eare asyde two porter counsaile dyd espy cast false conspiracie slee kyng day yere like entent whan foūd best leisere whan mardocheus prudently gan fele secrete malice theyr compassyng compassion would nat concele made hester discure kyng wherof conuict led hangyng semeth competent guerdone falsely ymagine suche treasone meane sayd mardoche wel accepted kyng assuere lykely also stande liberte malyce fell daungere cursed aman made hym chere compassed full fell manere hym distroy jewes yfere thys mardocheus byble tell withdrew hym selfe reuerence vnto thys tyraunt frowarde aman lyke statute cōmaunded sentence whiche thing tauenge frowarde violence aman made hatrede set afore palais myghty stronge gybet cast hym vengeaunce innocentes oppresse myght wylfull malice tagrege theyr greuaunce god blynde syght last wyll ryght punysh proude furious violence poore supportyng theyr pacience mardocheus innocent lyuyng meane hester great mekenes accepted assuere kyng lawe jewes set surenes frowarde aman hys cursednes vengeable pride bible ye maye see hye enhanged vpon galowe tree mardocheus prudence reason furious daunger aman set asyde preserued hys people fro destruction tyraunt hanged hys frowarde pride thus lorde hys iudgementes deuide seeth tyme mighty puissaūt support simple punyshe tyraunt xxvii chapter two brother artaxerses cyrus howe artaxerses slew child concubine howe ended fall aman doubtles whē best wēd haue ī flour tofore john bochas came artaxerses renomed time conquerours gan declare sodeyn sharpe shours parcel mortal payne fortune agayne gan ordayne artaxerses put memorye prynces excelled rychesse whiche hys chare famous glorye hys trone worldlye hye noblesse sate tyme story beareth wytnesse highest exalted y• kyng shoulde fall nat vncouth thyng kynges vnder obeysaunce hundred prouinces twentie eke seuen son vnto dary prince moste puissaunce fame drede fyry leuen none mighty vnder starred heauen accompted tyme warre pee kyng called artaxerses brother named cyrus one stocke came theyr bothe lynes artaxerses story telleth thus lorde graynes oyle wine also diuers concubine hundred child lyke tolde fiftene ouer tofore wexe olde bothe brother power last farre duryng theyr tyme stode full hye estate yet atwene ful mortall warre agayne nature vnkyndly debate thylke warres infortunate whan blode wt blod let man deme lyst warrey brother agaynst brother finally cause thys warre gan atwene brother made mencion whiche debate died many man grounde first occasion onely thys succession king dary reigning perce mede whiche twayne shoulde next succede artaxerses maner prouidence put brother priuely prison ne make defence gather people hys destruction yonge cyrus made mention fast stocked eke tolde stockes fetter golde though nat remembred bochas howe cyrus escaped fro pryson yet also soone delyuered perce mede rydyng vp doun gadered people entention olde hatred hys brother tassayle felde assigned mette battayle wher cyrus proudly put hym selfe prees shewe hys manhode speciall sought brother called artaxerses gaue hym wounde ful mortall without frendshyp fauour fraternall artaxerses wounde gan ake constrayned felde forsake cyrus furious lyon hys aduersaries gan mortally wake false fortune full collusion vnder faynt smilyng mow gan make whiche caused ala y• day take afore ywounded woulde none presented vnkynde brother though cyrus afore found yonge freshe lusty manly honde constraynt mortall wounde dyed anone succour fonde two kingdomes wtin perce londe fyll handes artaxerses whiche liued longe pee thus great space like mighty kyng perce helde vnder obeysaunce famous noble full gloriously shinyng hauyng rich fulsom abundaunce put remembraunce encrease prosperitie true wedlocke sonnes thre fyrst called darius arobratus named seconde thirde named othus manly prynces like founde nature lyke kyng bound vnto dary made mencion aboue echone affection dempt able warre likelyhode yeres yong grene cast fully noble prefarre hye prudence thus dide mene impotence support sustene feble perce raygne alone set vp dary trone whiche thing straunge contrarious agayne custome perciens vsaunce supposed sonne darius shoulde suche case encrease aduaūce father party naturall attendaunce shew vnto trouth kyndnes impotence cheryshe gentlenes estate oft dothe thus fall whan prynces runne farre age childrens loue ayen thē dothe appall shewyng frendshyp saue adauntage may reioyce heritage suche case whan wexe stronge thinke father liue longe artaxerses stode caas story playnly ye shall fynde rehearsayle writyng bochas dary false eke vnkynde forgetfull nothing mynde father trouth reherce hath made hi equal wt raign perce declare first occasion father sayd dary false maner rebellion gan workyng contrary whiche discure wyll lenger tary wyth penne haste procede discriue fell dede artaxerses among hys concubynes remembred one whiche reken wyues vyrgynes fayrest holde euerychone called arthasia full yore agone tyme beauty discryue among perciens fayrest holde alyue though yrun farre age lyke bokes lyst expresse colour also vysage kept beauty natyfe freshenes whyche afore semelines sayd cyrus briefly termyne chose long afore concubyne whan thys cyrus passed fate brother might liue pee anone vpon wythout lenger date take vp kyng artaxerses beauty pearles long tyme fell age claymed title heritage kyng dary hys father lyue faynyng clayme succession though father agayn dyd stryue thus began made mencion debate fyrst occasion dary cast bare styll reioyce agayne hys father wyll accomplyshe falsely entent haue full possession afforce party made thys argument cyrus quod made mencion raygnyng perce mighty region story playnly determyne beuty made hys concubyne time whan cyrus dede artaxerses father ye may se next succeadyng perce drede lyst clayme eke great beauty quod dary longeth pleasaunt syght succession clayme ryght thus kyng dary father sayde would haue arthasia fayre therwithall artaxerses gan abrayde aunswered face debonayre sonne quod contrayre thy desire affection deliuer thy possession promise gan repent cast hym make another cheuisaunce secretely concubine sent called arthasia made remembraunce sleyghty purueyaunce vnto tēple meanes hath sought great appollo yt haste brought veyled made presteresse rite playnly gyse▪ olde panyms maner holines professed seruice▪ statute constrayne deuise life might none bounde liue chastite thing wrought compassyng artaxerses frowarde ielosy wherof dary yonge lusty kyng wext almost wode whan espy gan compasse melancholy furious rancour hasty cruelte vpon father auenged party force sustene story maketh minde brother bast hūdred fiftene father false vnkind number left none hynde frō purpose one lyst dissent hys death one al assent yet straunge false conspyracy artaxerses knowledgyng although story dothe specify ne therof wyttyng whiche haste made tariyng gader meyny make selfe stronge self auenge disnatural wrong artaxerses lyke case tho stode thought sate well high noble venged vpon vnkynde bloude lawe nature decree rightwisenes statute dampne vnkyndnes wherby kyng occasion finde ayen child vnkynd men deme great multitude many childre maketh man stronge therupon plainly conclude vertue cause dwell among corage enclyneth vnto wronge vycious life brydle lede greater number worse spede progeny borne cursed lyne may frowarde false infection outward trouth though shyne vnder appearaunce simulation infect corrupt region sayd full olde langage frute soure tree take soure tarage well shewed artaxerses suffred brother dye mischefe bledyng wounde left helpeles whyche name shall euer reprefe thus bloude vnkynde hath euer euil prefe child fro stocke discended cursed euerichone remēbred stocke fyrst contagious nature grefes frowarde great number whiche assent busy cure false treason father encomber shade couert vmber closely kept namely false gyle venym wyll shew whyle thus death contagiously conspyred artaxerses sythe ago full yore wheron auenge hart fyred furious yre ybrent sore could defarre meyny fyll anone ware slew thē euerychone slough also hys concubynes wer mother whō told toforn suffred none liue lynes y• lynage hath wede vpshorne founde among grayne good corne couy • doome whan presented death echone assented clothes sprent vnkynd bloude chyldren whiche dyd shede whose death great mischefe stode sorow lyfe lede dyed mischefe drede death quyt wt death rage rage lo fyne vnweldy age ¶ lenuoy tragedy afore declareth great outrage vnkyndnes betwene two brethrene raignyng yfere perce lande ye haue heard expresse tyll deuision mischefe maistresse gan enter fraternall hatrede whyche agayn kynd destroyed kinrede warre arose contagious lere throughe perce mortall frowardnes cyrus death rehearsyng manere helpelesse dyed distresse nūber brother thē dresse slea father story ye may rede causyng ende theyr whole kynrede kyng artaxerses froward chere iniuries wronges redresse slough hys childrē mother eke yfere spared one froward cursednes whiche occasion toke great sickenes dyed mischefe drede causyng ende whole kynrede lo sorowe particulere perce ran cursednes croked fame spred bothe farre nere vengeable hasty fell woodnes ayre enfecting wt slaunderous blacknes shew vengeaunce cōtrarious mede bloud vnkynde borne one kynrede noble prince lift vp eyen clere consider great auisenes wofull stryues odious fell daūgere sowen kinredes wilfull straungenes rancoure courage redresse peysyng mischeues folowyng dede bloude vnkinde borne one kynrede ☞ ende thirde boke fruite writynge set cronicles olde mooste delectable freshenesse tastynge moste goodlye glorious beholde colde heate lengest abidyng chaunge season may hyndryng men dyne fast men taste lenger last doth courage renue agayne glade whiche may called frute tree lyfe parmanable neuer fade fiue wittes greatest restoratyfe pleasaūce chefe confortatife nature whan quicke goode frute take naturall foode auctours hereon concluden eke assent writyng kyndly right dothe loued person likeness represent frendes absent seuered farre frō syght darkenes absence clered light thus frute writyng hath auauntages folkes farre present ymages lawe perished nad writyng fayth appalled nere vertue scripture religion order good liuyng taketh example doctrine lecture writing causeth helpe portrature thinges darked olde begon remembred celestiall son god set writyng letter sentence agayne dulnesse infirmite world enlumyne craft eloquēce canon ciuyle philosophy thre confirmed fraunchises many strong citee couenaūtes asseled trouthes olde assured nad writyng myght haue endured diligence chefe tryumphatryce slogardy negligence slouthe eke memory vpholder nouryce registrer supposayle trouthe hath olde labour el great routhe brought thinges passed notable substaūce onely writyng newe remembraunce writyng cause hereto remembred lyfe prophetes patriarkes olde apostle martyr dismēbred christes fayth banner vp holde writyng sheweth fore tolde confessours great stedfastnes vyrgyns virgynall ciennesse like tre whyche euery yere beareth frute shewyng hys beuty wt blossom flour right fode inward refute diligence olde doctours dayly frute faythfull labour haue courage fostred pastured writyng hath long endured epigrames whilom perished prudent prosper vertuous senecke tragedy sad stratagemes vegecius rebuke vyces noble percius olde writyng ben founde lacke sayd thynges farre put abacke writyng caused poetes recure name eternal laurer whan wan adamant graue perpetually endure recorde take vyrgyll mantuan wrote ye armes prowes man called eneas whan hygh corage came itayle dido cartage thre famous bokes auctor list compyle eneidos fyrst whiche dyd excell rethoryke soueraynte style dranke plenty poete men tell stremes yt ran downe well wrought tho sister nūber nyne prowes knighthode clerely termin boke cast fayle voyce melodious discriue aryght great conquest rome itayle wrought enee manly troyan knyght whose verse notable gaue clere lyght worlde rethoryke among poetes none hym lyke wrote also poete wyth hys hande humble style bokes twayne one pasture next tylthe lande verse cōueyed wt fete meter playne thre labour palme attain make hys name dities dilectable aboue poetes commendable writyng poetes hath set wt clos cōquest knyghthode triūph renoūs reade ouide metamorphoseos great wonder transmutacions morall menyng y• vncouth conclusion boke de ponto wyth great diligence full many pistle cōplaynyng absence craft loue boke hath compyled wherof cesar full great disdayne whyche cause exiled abide ponto neuer turne agayne yet labour certayne hope grace wittes apply write boke loues remedy writyng olde letter aureate labour poetes doth hyghly magnify recorde petrarke rome laureate whiche two fortune wrote remedy certayne egloges cosmography great conflyct whiche men may se quarelles within hym selfe secre wrote seuen psalmes great repentaūce affryke commended scipion wrote boke ignoraunce maner excusation set notable compylacion vpon life called solitary world froward contrary thus writyng gate selfe name perpetually remembraunce set registred house fame made epistle full high substaunce called sine titulo self auaūce famous woman wrote excellence gresylde preferryng great pacience writyng also remembred hath troy destroyed sithe gone many yere death ector chefe pyller ioye party grekes wrote omere whiche writyng particulere achilles wrought al fraude aboue ector gaue singuler laude writyng causeth chapelet grene bothe esope iuuenall dauntes labour dothe also sustene report celestiall songe among lumbardes especiall whose thre bokes great wonder tell heuyn aboue purgatory hell men writyng knowe myracles blessed sayntes holtnes medicyne salue eke obstacle geyne mortal woundes great sickenes recreacion solace distres quiet labour pouerte pacience rich ryght trouth conscience shortnes lyfe forgetfulnes wytte man dull aye slydyng negligence frowarde ydlenes echone stepmother science cunnyng dare say nad writyng onely ordeyned aduauntages dead memory mind passed age thus chefe cause afore tolde meuyng hart bochas writyng remembre many story olde estate prynces chares high sittyng vyces vnware fallyng geuyng example affyrme dare false fortune shall beware first thre bokes full clere myrrours fully accōplished bochas vndertoke cause fallyng many conquerours onely trouth vertue forsoke min auctor toward fourth boke gan sharpe pen eternall fame onely writyng get selfe name myne auctour bochas much coude beginneth make processe outrage prince yt proud wer brought low frowardnes notablye remēbreth mekenes whiche standeth whole one doth cōtune aye franchised daunger fortune maner doth recapitle agayne fall many sate hye stage vyces stode aye certayne came mischefe great outrage remembryng first pryam domages lost sceptre regaly susteynyng false auoutry fall rehearsyng astyages gaue daughter whilom mariage one called cambises pore man borne lowe lynage haue none auauntage maner nether right ne wrong rebellion agayne strong forne bysion one procede lyne whiche put region cause mischefe fyne yet fortune could vndermyne wisdome stode none auayle agayne god preuayleth counsayle nedeth story reherce maner vnhappy chaunce fallyng cyrus kyng perce king tarquin misgouernaūce though bochas put thē remēbraūce semeth thing vayne thyng one tolde tell new agayne list retcheles new agayne make rehearsayle kyng called artaxerses sithe tolde auayle▪ proceadeth strayght vnto itayle story beginneth marchus manlius romayn cōsulere ☞the ende prologue hovve marcus manlius wrought dyd rome towne last common cast tybre drowned ¶ fyrst chapter whilome rome great lynage called manloyes renomed noblesse stocke ryght fayre yonge age came marcus story doth wytnesse proces worthynesse thre tymes iust election made consuler worthy toun common greatly dyd auayle diuers tymes townes ryght faught dayes many stronge battayle aye preuayled great might felde synguler fyght outrayed hys enemye lyke tolde toke hym tyche bye golde torque latyn englyshe bye acercle golde marcus wan brought home chiualrye torque called marcus torquatus thus name gan called story telleth v amonge romayns torquatus manlius woulde ofte ieopart good lyfe citie entre felde alone conquered prerogatife sondrie crownes many ryche stone wan tunicles golde many one thylke tyme dyuers hyghe emprises crownes made many sondry wise aul gellius maketh mencion ther wer rome deuised strange crown suche foughten toun • labour receyued theyr guerdon prerogatiue called champion sondry tymes manhode might ieoparded theyr lyues townes ryght like theyr desertes y• crownes toke theyr name thēwer called triumphal youe vnto knyghtes theyr noble fame also called obsidionall romayne tonge ther mural eke twayne nauall castrence great excelence triumphall made golde offred triumphes worthy emperours set saphyrs ruby manyfolde vpon hedes myghty conquerours whan rome shynyng flour crowne called wt brāches burned fayre theyr vulgar aureate coronayre obsidionall whiche spake toforne deuised wete bokes specifye crownes notable wroughte lyke greyne corne youe vnto prīces chiualrye rescued siege saued partye closed streyte within prowes crowne win another crowne called murall geuen graunted emperour hym first wan vpon wall siege abode shour fightyng alone hope succour might suche brunt sustene shuld laurer weare crowne grene nauall crownes whilom ordayned fought manly see shyppes togeder cheyned manhode marciall surete vpon enemyes made first entre receyue shoulde people syght korue lyke rother crowne clere bryght crowne next called castrence geuen custome y• manly knyght list auaūce hī magnificēce hostes assembled ieopart woulde myght toforne entre fyght shoulde eke receyue noble queme starred crowne made lyke diademe crowne also whiche called ouall toke first name ioye gladnesse whiche kynges prince actes marciall vsed sometyme thyr ioyous noblesse sodayne scrimishes casuall hastinesse venquished proudly ī battaile suche highnes vnwarly wolde assayle power inuincible noble crownes wer seriously wrought myrte braunches whiche ben imputrible enduryng euer corrupt nought worde ouall yf well sought sayde gladnes put memorie ordayned prince victorie another crowne called cy • ica oken bowes made rounde pleyne ordayned whiche pro publica coude battayle rescue citezeyn sle hys enemy foreyn mighty oke manhede clayme weare crowne vpon hede lyke knightes marciall delytes common profite dyd hem selfe auaunce theyr noble victorious merites romayne people great pleasaūce sondrye crownes mercial substaunce guerdon knightes famous myne auctour recorde called aul gellius amonge dyd busy payne suche crownes manly recure marcus manlius manhod souerayne put oft lyfe mortal auenture hys force muche dyd assure deserued ful yore agone sayde crownes many mo one thencreace noble fame dyd thyng bothe manly deuine wherby gate hym surname called marcus capitolyne whiche aboue name dyd shyne whan alone wherby commended capitole enemy hath defended whan fraunce take cite put rome mischefe vnto flyght layde awayte great meyne capitole take nyght passage laye fatte • yght vnder roche called carmenton theyr caue entred chefe dongeon shrouded vnder darke vale ordinaunce myghty violence towarde mydnight wall scale couertly kepyng silence dempt playnly • ackyng resistence shoulde maugre tho within hour assigned capitole wyn gee within close waker foules noyse theyr cōmynge gan beate theyr wynges vp anone arose wherby marcus hys bed liyng gan tabrayde made tariyng toke harnesse furious wrothe walles hast gothe came first vpon wall force without tariyng downe tybre made hym fall hys felowes busy scalyng shelde pauis ladder vp reysyng thys manly marke shortly cōprehende flode made discende vnto dethe hym abaued knighthode hie renoun maugre capitole saued afterward rescued toun fortune conclusioun tyme dyd vnto hym fall capitolinus men dyd hym call victorious hym selfe alone thys hye victorye thys name gate hym al hys house perpetually memorye registred consistorye theyr cronicles hys name determined golden letter enlumined gee whome spake also well kept watche vpon nyght ytake offered vnto • uno solempnely great torch lyght whome also graunted ryght whan famine made theyr store fayle spared take vitayle thus marke myghtye cōquerour worshypped rome beyng assent whan folke set great honour sōtime happeth hold thē nat content couetyse hertes blent fro suffisaunce aboue theyr degree surmonte higher dignity manlius fret corage greater worshyp sodaynly assende deminge haue auauntage selfe gan frowardly pretende cite transcende beside triūphes wer reserued higher climbe hath deserued one made mencion called camillus alord great substaunce cite mighty toun aboue gouernaunce put remembraunce greatnesse man might attayne aye whose noble marcus gan disdayne hert great enuy whiche caused hym outrage erre agaynst camyllus hys chiualry towne gouerned peace werre marcus would hym selfe preferre aboue prince worshyppe honour first people gate hym great fauour maner conspyracye gadered hertes commonte drewe also vnto partye great multitude throughout citye thus arose first dredfull enmite within rome story telleth thus atwene prince camyll manlius thus fyrst venym atwene hem sow hasty hatred false occasion citie wene hye lowe caused newe diuers discencions vncouth strange opinion euery wight drew hys partye meued theyr fantasye stynt outragious errour hasty stryues furious agayne fro tuscan came dictatour tyme called cornelius cassus wisdome blamed manlius caused rancour toune gylt cōmaunded hym prisone maner hyndryng hys name appaled partie hys noblesse tyme gan eclipse hys fame afterward cloude derkenesse cōmon fauour turned ciernesse ryght none defence common rose atones fyrst whan among rumour amyd theyr fell hatefull contencion shortly rebuked worthy senatours marcus set pryson▪ bene ay helpefull toun whome delyuer many wayes sought fynd euen thus wrought fyrst clad clothes blacke pale theyr face pitously wepyng theyr berdes vnshaue theyr heades slacke lyke furyous men vp downe runnyng tofore prison nyght wakyng hys harmes playnly wreke gan manace pryson breke stynt theyr outragious clamour senatours made anone ordayne delyuer hym hys soiour lose fetter breake hys chayne delyuered payne lyst nat stynt hasty cruelte proude courage auenged furious fel presumpcion maugre senate trybunes echone sayde woulde gouerne rome toune whose outrage gan disdayne anone people hertes hym agone pride auysement assigued hym come iudgement forsake throughout cite ther came nat one hym hys kynred founde helpe hys aduersite saue fewe came dede common ful feble suche nede thus ala founde resistence veylable hym hys defence succour constrayned drede away put hys clothyng vesture naked stode verely dede shewing woūdes dyd endure many scrimyshe disconfiture rescuse speke wordes fewe capytole dyd shewe supportyng eke hys quarele meuyng people rue hys complaint fyrst goddes loude dyd appele topreserue hym attaynt people wt teres al bespraynt judge astoned dede sate agayne hym procede secretly ledde prees place called froumentyne ala mercylees dome rigour fully termyne spared nouther noble lyue fro capitole chefe dongeon low tybre cast adowne thys hys ende voyde fauour whiche man woulde redresse amende cruelte caste hye towre whiche whilome knightly gan defēd man writyng comprehende vnsure succour founde necessite labour commonte let men beholde ye trust worldly thinges namelye yt proude hauteyne open theyr eyen cast vp theyr lokynges consider se well certayne trusteth fortune trust vayne yfhe lyst clere ensample fynde among remēbre marcus mynde might auayle noble battayle bye golde▪ crownes laurere hys ryche plate vncouth mayle hys myghty sheldes shone clere triumphes songe farre nere hys victory citye wrought hys mischefe auayled ryght nought ii chapter bochas writeth parte agaynst suche nat content suffisaunce vsurpe high dignity iohn bochas calleth memory strāge salayre ye famous guerdō yt gate conquest victory honour triumphe within rome toun vsed maketh mencion seriously reherseth manere shall write yf lyst aduyse take first estate thre men armes whiche present sawe dede magnanimite hym shall haue iudgement clergy must haue eke assent senate people notable preue sought found able prince also outher capteyne triūphe receyue right within chare full rychely • eyne shalbe set golde burned bryght fret stone shall geue lyght phebus doeth hys mydoaye sphere derkenes hym shall appere thys heuenly chare shall delyte shewe thencrease hys knightly glorie led draw four stedes whyte citie token victorie shall haue singuler memorie hys ryght hand palme gold ful shene head crowne laurer grene shal eke haue aboue hys armure poudred palmes cote purple reed hys left hand hys quarell tassure standerde rounde declaryng manheed set vpon beed prince armes full ryche apparayle whose quarel accōplished battaile custome sayde standerde shall richely depeynt reed colour knight man marciall shalbe conueyed lyke conquerour yet encreace honour vpon theyr fete prisoner echone take hys manhode aboute chare shall gone worthy fast hys syde remnaunt lokyng echone poetes y• toun abide shal hym wayte home commyng ditees deuise conquest syng strange minstrelles also recorde thier instrumentes shal touche accorde entent geue hym courage capitole shalbe brought lest pryde fall none outrage surquedy within hys owne thought wretch shal town sought custome shal haue staffe hande chare behinde backe vp stande gnotos eolytos greke shoulde seyne whiche tonge playnly dothe expresse know thy selfe remembryng certayne vpon fortune frowarde doublenesse thou trust may sykernesse douteth thus let hym remembre ende manlius auayled triumphes hys bye crownes golde perled freshe tunicles hygh prowes hys chiualryes singler fyghtyng marciall particle newlye remembred fed olde cronicles peyse merites see last tybre theyr champion cast excuse auayled neuer dele fauour cōmons carectes woundes goddes lamentable appele remebraūce theyr fraūchised boudes teritories wynnyng groundes wan wt spendyng blode knitte one hym stede stode ye maye se fortune sodaynly clerenesse fame chaūge derkenesse glory reprothe worshyp vilany ioye passed mortall heuynesse swytnesse fauour bytternesse sobernesse furious rage old franchise thraldome seruage neyther request prayere auayled hys delyueraunce cheynes fettred dedlye loke abode sentence finall gouernaūce pale face trimblynge countenaunce whan ala gan mortal approche terpeya hydous roche terpeya thys roche bare name lady made mencion called terpeya whiche fell great defame assented trayson haue brought enemy rome toun wherof conuict story wel knowe vnder roche ydolue ful lowe thys roche also called carmentoun woman great aucthorite called carmentes hie reno •• capitole made cite found letter first b c connyng among workes declare afore thyng shoulde befall thys harde sturdy roche stone fro capitole marcus cast downe fauour frendshyp founde none battayles fought toune cōmons hertes turned vpsodoune whose loue lyke preued assay blase fire bryght away common people may hote crye fast theyr heartes stedfast stable nede theyr promyse wyl nat last theyr corages remouable folow reason gerysh vntreatable lyghtly declinynge ful great ruthe opinion nothyng truthe manlius hys truste disceyued whose lust vnleful departed twayne whan pride woulde haue receyued hygh estate myght nat attayne wher ye senate gan disdayne common aye false suche nede lefte hym mischefe toke hym hede ¶ lenuoye tragedy mē may beholde se perilous domages false ambiciō thē yt nat cōtēt wt degre would vp climbe lyke theyr opinion hye estate vsurpation nat consydre sentence scripture good meane men longest may endure vsurpeth higher dignite appertayneth hys condition royall chares make hys se hath tytle lyne reason frowarde pride full ofte putte doun lacke seeth nat euery creature good meane lengest may endure whan dedalus taught sonne flee bad hym first hye discretion fro phebus hete kepe wynges fre fro neptunus colde congelacion meanyng hereby short conclusion lyst ioy state assure good meane longest shall endure remembre manhode magnanimite marcus manlyus presūption wolde haue gouerned rome cite maugre senate ruled mighty toun whiche tourned hys confusion saw nat hys auenture good meane men longest maye endure theyr greatest hygh prosperite frowarde corage furious mocion theyr great weale false duplicite haue maner straunge condition nat content plentie foyson false etyke whiche theyr nature good meane nat longe endure earth greatest felicite heartes ease rychest possession suffisaunce content worldly trouble teschewe thoccasion meuyng quarelles causyng discēcion cleyme nothyng hard recure sith good meane mē longest endure prince remembre maieste enuy clymbyng causeth deuision accord trust commonte whiche poynt disception specially flee simulation ye maye marchus se playne fygure ambicion might whyle endure iii chapter ☞ nectanabus kyng egypt xerxses constrayned flye hys kyngdome fal marchus manlius bochas anone gan hys style dresse brefely tell nectanabus kyng egypt hys great rychesse seyng afore hys noblesse vncouth crafte ne myght chese hast crowne lese connyng especiall ryght expert made mencion science called liberall knew afore calculation god wolde make transmigracion hys kyngdome playnly reporte lande perce grekes ful trāsport kyng xerxses hys countre maugre hys treasour hys connyng myght nectanabus constrayned flye durst nat abyde haue hym syght grece drew hym anone ryght nat lyke kyng olde writynges lyke magicien wrought wōdre thinges vpon fortune procede hys conning greatly furthered hys sleighty workyng eke dede acquaynted quene olimpyas secre playnely thys caas openly men sayd demyng gate alysandre great myghtye kyng fled hys region hys ymages hys illusion bochas maketh maner mention wrought incantacions hys subtel operation lyke man nyght whilom apeared quenes syght saue hys deth bochas writeth nought remembring tyme date alisander togeder haue sought course starres towarde euen late hys sonne like hys fate downe brydge full mortal wrake cast hym backward necke brake iiii chapiter ❧ howe pausanias duke lacedemon exyled athene thys end bochas gan hast hys style auaunce pausanias tel pitous caas maner hys wofull chaunce whiche duke gouernaunce lacedemone foundyng cite olde tyme called bysaunce athene cite gate might conquered theyr chiualry afterwarde wronge ryght exyled pausany thus fortune false enuy caused duke without delayes payne pouerte ende dayes ☞ v chapter ❧ heliarchus tyrant extorcion oppression slaine knyght leonides fall sothly twayne iohn bochas moued courage rehearse busy payne great fury odious rage helyarchus whiche great outrage though ne famous chiualry noyed perce tyranny wherfore bochas gan disdayne cast woulde onely sake touche tyrantes mo one twaine writyng agayn thē warre make hande gan penne take tolde order perillous pestilence whiche wrought mortall vyolence first declareth fortune right againe tyrantes furious wode hath full cause shew myght appal dignity stode suche reioyce shede blode nought el labour deuise spoyle temple many sundry wyse helyarchus hys cruelte contryued false extorcions mortall enemy fayre citee called heraclye many townes extort false oppression dede concluded prefe countrey brought mischefe turnyng grace fauour hatrede mercy pitie vnto crueltie franchise people seruitude drede oppressed fredome olde lybertie statute wer fre interrupted force right whiche made odious mennes sight restrayne great extorcions fortune retchles horrible abhominacions gan auale goddesse merciles good knyght called leonides whiche felow borne countrye cast tyrant auenged dempt almesse dede set lande quiete ease tyrant furious bloude shede importable malyce appese whyche citye great disease assent swerdes kene slew tyrant mortall tene whose death many man fayne specially heraclie cite dempt medefull yt slayne set quyete commonte lo men may rightfull guerdon se tyrantes whiche vyolence oppresse people haue conscience vi chapiter ☞ vycious dyonis kyng cycyle slewe brother kynrede exiled dyed mischefe tyrant full heauy chere countenaunce piteous lamentable vnto bochas dionys dyd appere whiche tyranny importable lande hatefull reprouable gan myne auctour pray maners sumwhat write say bochas lyst rehearse lynage make processe genealogy hys great outrage full vyces pryde lechery auarice ofyre enuy cicyle helde royall see cyracusis mighty stronge citee thys dyonis cursed nature malicious thought dede remembred scripture slewe brother cosyns kynrede alone peace might possede wythout trouble interruption cicyle mighty region among vyces bochas dothe specify gan drawe vnto ydlenes folowed lustes foule iechery oft custome fell dronkennes thought souerain blessednes lyke master fortune solow lustes aye therin contune waxt ryght fatte right corcious eyen gan darke syght vnneth man vycious ne myght well beholde dayes light malyce thys tyrant agayne right helpe robber false foreyns slough citte nye cit • zeyns vycious lyfe order rehearce contagious audience extort pillage done grece perce write tell sentence would infect ayre pestilence wyll briefelye remember discriue sacrilege whyche dyd hys lyue venus temple besyde cytheron great number woman dyd call f • well • eue oppression made meyny vnwarely thē fall dispoyled one hys outrage frowarde vyolence naked stode echone presence whan sawe shape feytures suche chose pleasaunce robbed toke vesture let go without ordinaunce vncouth abhominable chaunce city lo • roys arose wt stronge hande hys outrage banished hym lande tyme also dyd soiourne wythin temple lyke tolde jupiter sonne vnto saturne beholdyng relykes manifolde sawe among mantyll large gold wherupon whan cast hys loke ryche iewel vnto vse toke thus sayde selfe excuse heauy comerous somer season mantyll vse bicause large po • derous ouermore aledged hym thus sythe garment forged golde wynter season colde whan gan away thys mantel pulle ryght anone thys tyrant deceyuable
