gaue hym another single made wulle affirmed sothely conuenable season • e agreable cōcludyng thus somer • yght warme wynter colde nyght tyme tyrant eke also whiche hart auaricious entred one temple appollo sonne esculapius whan tyrant fell contrarious beheide appollo beardles olde esculapius long bearde golde quod dionis semeth vnto straunge froward cōuenience father beardles sonne bearded standyng presence made anone sturdy vyolence take away bearde syght fyne golde shone clere bright grece perce gone temple vsaunce stately relyques wyth many ryche stone massy table full great substaunce take hys pleasaūce spared none thus liuynge lyke thefe til vēgeaūce brought mischefe ciracusanes crowned kyng assent sayne outragious vycious liuyng banished hym neuer come agayne tyrant vacant went vaine worlde lyke false fugytyfe mischefe dionys lost lyfe ¶ lenuoy tragedy geueth warnyng tho haue domination ouer people prince duke kyng eschue rauyn false extorcion let consider occasion foule pillage frowarde tyranny sayd dionys mischefe must dye first compassed falsely ymaginyng slea citizyns royall towne brother cosens kyn sparing brought bloude destruction slaughter suche dilectation reioysyng euer murder robberye whiche caused mischefe dye spoyle temple reioysyng toke treasure possession table golde wt stone freshe shinyng eke fro god relikes toke doun euer rode region whose sacrilege compassed felony caused vnwarely mischefe dye venus temple recorde wrytyng foule frowarde abusion gentilwomen came offryng dispoyled made mencion let naked without exception whiche diffame great vngentry banished mischefe dye noble prince remember thing compassed malyce false collus • must haue euyl endyng come rekenyng fraude aye wt fraude receiueth guerdon haue minde concludyng reason tyrantes playnly specify hath short lyfe dothe mischefe dye vii chapter ¶ auctoure agayne presumptuous people prynces holdyng selues goddes ye folkes bene astonyed aduyce se tyrantes incorrigible lift see thē helde wise thoughe power inuincible yet fore god nothyng impossible wherfore remember nothyng maruayle vnware falles tho fortune thē assayle whan tyrantes set hye stage dignity raygnyng lyke wode lyon full harde wrast courage tempt disposicions worldly felicitie blyndeth reason god egall power fortune vnder daunger recorde dionys oft afrayed assaut fortune lyke fate vycious liuyng thre tymes dismayde hys story remembreth olde date next ryng cometh pollicrate one viturbius tyrantes tayle raignyng like wolues oppresse y• porayle whan tyrantes diuers region surquedy catche opinion estate dominacions shoulde euer endure longe succession god fortune myght put downe estate royall thys worlde rule bothe two egall toward god haue lost shame drede touchyng guerdōs ioy payn indifferent atwene trouth falshede lust iserued noforce laugh plain god forgotten disdayne bothe recleymed lure falsely tra • scendyng boūdes measure whiche sumtyme bokes specify god lyst suffer made mencion fortune maner mockery fauoureth folke like opinion enhaunce power false deception set playnely sey serue lust durst disobey ¶ viii chapter ¶ howe kynge pollicrate extorcion tyranny hanged tyll euerye ioynte fyll recorde take proude pollycrate tyraunt samos beside sea egee whiche sore laboured early eke late agayne conscience furious crueltee abound ryches haue plentie worldly treasure demyng y• fortune aye desyres ne durst say nay fortune hym many diuers signe shewed outward great token pleasaūce eke fauourable benygne port maner attendaunce ben vnder obeysaunce stuffe coffer wt treasure locked fast false entent mocke last worldly rich hys lustes dyd obey whan founde fauourable season lyst play blinde goddes vnsure vnstable set hye vp fame table false entent estate royall whan sate highest made fall selfe pride gan deme stode prosperitie weared crowne diademe aboue felicitie thus enhaunced royall see thought egall wt goddes cōmune farre daunger fate fortune attempt goddes powere fortune variant doublenes toke ryng golde full bryght clere therin rubye excellent reednesse sekyng occasion newe heauines whiche neuer afore know suche thing sea anone cast ryng dispayred agayn recure dempt impossible right anone fyshers aduenture like maruayle incredible among wawes hydous horrible cast nettes would auayle takyng fyshe ryng entrayle whiche presented solemnitie pollicrate great reuerence whan sate crowned dignitie feast famous excellence fy •• e vndone anone hys presence amidde entrails keruer found y• ryng aduenture toke kyng whyche dempt pryde hygh presumption neptunus god salt see ryng made restitution durst offende maiestee wherupon fantasy caught nether heuēly god fortune blid sight vnhardy attēpt ayen might great outrage god vnknow presumption fortune hath wel spyed made aduersitie bowe whele spoke hath gyed wheron sate richely magnified vnwarely hye noble brought full lowe great heauines worldly ioye nothyng drede whan fortune blandishyng yt flattery fret worldly mede hygh whele make foles syng nature sorow dothe bryng wytnes prynces olde new date recorde also proude pollicrate sometyme sate hye fortune whele prosperitie beames clere shynyng whose temple made glasse stele castel ise vnwarely dissoluyng though freshe outwarde shewyng vnsure stande bryttel abyde trusteth lykely slyde geryshe quene chere face double wythdrewe fauour began vary fro pollicrates set hym great trouble wext agayne hym maliciously contrarye causyng orontes cunstable wt kyng dary maugry tyrant hys crueltie gyn warre samos citye whan glory clere lyght hys noble shone hyghest full fortune gan changeable myght prosperitie fethers pull erst courage gan dull pryde vnwarely appall whan spoyled ryches first whan orontes countrey gan assaile pollicrate sodaine auenture outrayed taken battayle full perillous mortall disconfiture thus fortune coulde brynge lure vnware vgly false disdaynes led pryson boūde stronge chaynes people dwellyng within region reioysed hart se suffer payne tyranny false extorcion caused disdayne death man lyst complayne men world haue great plesaūce se tyrant brought vnto mischaunce foure thinges tormentes augment sodayne departyng rich sawe eche man entent mischefe haue great gladnes hanged mine auctour dothe witnes honge long tēpest rayne thunder till euery ioynt went sunder beastes wilde foules rauenous naked henge suche auenture folkes odyous despite euery creature departyng denyed sepulture guerdon tyrantes vēgeable retcheles suffer people liue pee thus many tyrantes excede far boūdes false outrage well resembled cruel wolues furious houndes frette etyke gredy cruelte staunche honger aueyleth piente whiche surfets froward rede wt policrates hell shall haue mede ☞ ix chapter ☞ howe tyraunt alexander sloughe philosopher calistenes wyth saiynge trouth amonge story tell pyteous caas wofull playntyfes put theim selues prees wepyng eyen myne auctour bochas moued hart retchles write fall calystenes whiche ala remembred trouth piece dismēbred whan bochas story gan aduert dempt anone fantasy man harde stoned hart might ryght eyen kepe drye se processe hys tormentry yet gan myne auctour wofull pen prefer write wrong done philosopher calystenes youth right well thewed grene age promoted doctrine influence heauenly fate endued greatly profite morall disciplyne disposed nature grace deuyne conquere bokes specify noble surname philosophy merites famous notable philosophy busy payne geue su • ke able sote mylke breastes twayne precious licour might therto attain baume none vertue well declared worldly rich may therto compared precious pyment geue foles aboue lycours dothe farre excell whose originall sprange holy scholes athene famous bokes tell philosophy sprange first well calystenes thexperience couthe fulsum plenty fostred youth though borne good lynage vertue made high assende enhaunced noble courage bloude comprehend philosopher clarkes commende morall vertues entresured writing treasure worldly kynges gentle stockes recken issue discended downe royall lyne vycious voyde vertues haue tarage vertuous disciplyne temporall treasure though shyne tyme sittyng hye stage without vertue dead ymages though prynces haue cōquered battail world roundnes chyualry may triūphes noble auayle without vertue ryght title gye compared vnto phylosophy▪ philosopher apply entente knowe heauen cours elementes set store thinges transitory fortune expert doublenes heauenly thynges set memory vii planet course thē dresse meuing star sparking brighnes reuolutions sphere nyne mother musyke auctours determyne noble twaye famous house flouryng grece rychest euerychone called olde date fayre true spouse philosopher many mo one achademie athene shone bryght lantern reuerences world tenlumine lyberall scyences among calystenes youth put scholey two scholes prudent socrates plato whiche bare key lecre misteries diuine idey whiche two scholes great abilitee • e profited halfe muche old clarkes olde philosopher tho dayes doctrine souerayne called world ye riche precious coffer treasure kept chestes twayne amyd brestes wherin god ordayne clere possession put depose science vnder key close calistenes scholer auditour aristoteles cunning conqueryng noble gemine precious floure philosophy floures surmountyng wherthrough chosen liuyng master lyst prouide alexander awayte abide alexander kynges entere worthy speake hye prowes aristoteles humble requere prouide busines expert knowyng auisenes sende one whiche philosophy might good coūsaile cōquest magnify write also tryūphes digne glory remember actes marciall put palmes knighthode memory direct especiall royall noble vertue morall erroure sene hym worlde conquere fell knightly aduenture whan fortune high promocion armes proudly gan recure perce mede mighty region brought kyng dary vnto subiection gate hole tresure y• man might expres accompt nūber great rich whiche vnsure tresure slydyng abundasice wasting shadowes good trāsitorye surquedous pride gan hart auaūce false ambicion outragious vaynglory made lese mynde eke memory knowe nature man mortall lyke goddes celestiall aboue palme olde conquerours knightly triumphes conquestes marciall vsurped title labour heauenly goddes egall merites imperiall gan presume fyne • yed seuen goddes deified palaice royall hall lawe ne set vpon payne lyfe men custome shoulde call world monarke mortal passi • e soune jupiter prerogatyfe thearth god puissaunce conquered swerde vnto obeisaunce full auyse purposed none pompous outrage surquedous entent full great treasure gold precious stone vnto temple jupiter sent bishop priestes shoulde assent hym receyue home commyng lyke god mortall thyng thus extort drede vsurped myght fyrst brought false ydolatry causyng prynces receyue agayne ryght godly reuerence froward mawmetry whan calistenes errour espy alexander busily entende false opinion correct amende put fyue cause notable rehearce calystenes especiall though king egipt mede perce preued reason man mortall byrthe eke earthy celestiall father mother theyr nature borne dye like creature father philyp macedony kyng mother called olympyades worldly folke heauenly nothyng kynges quenes vpset hye encrees yet agayne death coulde haue relees lawes nature maugre wyll obey lyke goddes onely borne dey kynde made subiect sundry passion many vncouthe diuers infirmity glad heauy condicions folowyng forme humanity false vsurped deity say saue drede flattery wrongly earth dyd deify eke alexander folowyng euer lust lordshyp great myght suffred passion honger thurst hole sicke heauy lyght whose enterchaūgyng euery man syght clearely sheweth clarkes rehearce god like mortall man fyll one myne auctor dothe compyle great heate longe olde bathed selfe floude nyle fortune sodaynely toke colde pore opened partes manifolde lay long story beareth witnes cured great sickenes last craft medicine deliuered infirmitie nothing amended power diuine might juno jupiter postye owne vsurped deitie passion whiche endure shewed deadly creature also made mencion custome fall dronkennes vynolence lost oft reason yre furious hastines woulde smyte hurt wodenes whyche token playnly termyne person heuenly deuyne whan philosopher called calystenes gan fyrst consider condicions alexander put selfe prees voyde dissimulyng dylacions reforme suche false ambicions godly honor men thē fayne vyces courage restrayne purpose center stable cast fully true entencion correct reprouable vsed person region trouth gaue hart lyke champion tell kyng estate royall god man mortall whiche kyng indignacion caught quarell agayne calystenes put vpon hym vniustly false treason onely slea master causeles attaynt afore prees sayd hys iniquitie conspyred agayne royall maiestye fayned also selfe tyme made conspyration agayne lorde horrible cryme interrupting religion deuyne institution case better read calistenes lawe must dead prolonge death payne vpon borde layed longe hys fete smytte hys handes twayne eyen rent wer paine strōg▪ thus tyrātes whan lyst wrong slea philosopher wythout ruthe whyche spared say truthe thys cruel vengeaūce myght suffise alexander encrease wo dyd cut lyppes full cruell wise nose thyrles hys eares eke also wt body bade men go tofore hys hoste remembred shewe tronke dismēbred caue depe wonder lowe solitary darked boundes paynes made hym throwe place stuffed wt wode barking houndes false entent rende bloudy woundes tyll lisymachus great compassion short torment gaue hym poyson red euer tormentes terrible alexander thou oughtest ashamed slea thy clarke wyth paynes horrible thy vyces hath blamed thy royall name therby defamed euer tyrantes whan thē lyst woode innocentes reioyce shede bloude agaynst knyght gentle lisymachus hym compassion kyng alexander melancolious wythout cause title affection let shut hym vp wyth fierce lyon voyde helpe succoured entencion deuoured lisymachus quyt lyke knyght agaynst thys lyon place ran fiercely hys martiall myght hys head hys tonge dyd race reconciled kynges grace knyghtly hath borne better cherished euer toforne another knyght called clytus▪ famous armes chiualry one greatest kynges house commended prudent policy familier bokes specify kyng ofte preued tempre courage greued kyng walkyng hande hande within palaice beyng presence prince duke many diuers lande began notable eloquence remēber armes famous excellence conquerous knyghtes olde euery man tale tolde among whiche clytus gentle knyght gan cōmende greatly magnify philyp macedon ought right bothe wisdome chiualry tyll alexander therat enuy gan disdayne furtous cruelte cōmended caught occasion ofyre false hatrede agayne knyght y• true sharpe swerd vnwarely made hi blede hart bloude hote redde hue side raylyng downe newe therby preue story tell god reasonable man thus prynces furious cruell men may clerely euidence se lordshyp perpetuell full chaunge mutabilite frendly sodayn enmite record clytus kynges grace vnwarely slayne trespace worthy deified alysander double corage worthy stellified furious prince fell outrage slewe frendes mortall rage thus fare tyrantes whan lyst wode seke occasion shede blode calystenes slayne morall disciplyne lisymachus compassion eke tyrant false gredy rauyne slewe gentle clytus agayne reason ye haue hearde commendacion king philyp story well conceyued trusteth tyrātes shal sonest deceyued ¶ lenuoy tragedy calistenes declareth v notable remembraūce plato olde socrates youth put vnder gouernaunce dranke milke plenteous aboūdaūce two scholes euer deuoyde slouth last alexander dismēbred trouth first sent aristoteles awayte prudente purueyaunce alexander lest retcheles presumption royall puissaunce take vpon goodly attendaunce whiche wtstode ala great ruthe slayne sayd truth wt tyrantes list put selfe prees haue fauour acquayntaunce must flatter fage doubtles double hart fayned countenaunce contryued done obseruaunce faythfull meanyng slayne y• ruth calystenes bicause sayd truth noble prince subiectes kepe pee • vengeaunce tyrantes merciles god sent short life sodayne mischaunce sayeth trouth haue displeasaunce prynt hart great ruth calystenes slayne truth ☞ x chapter ❧ alexander kynge pyrothe auenturyng passe floude acherōt backe moste trustye deadly wounded complaynt calystenes slayne tyrantly trespas came alexander kyng pyrothes woundes bleadyng vnto john bochas declared drowned acheronte riuer great fame besyde towne pandosia name remembred ytolde notable mighty stronge cite grece buylte dayes olde pyrrus called pyrothe kyng helde royall se bokes also determyne alexander came lyne whose kynred made playne mencion sonne achilles kyng pyrrus next order succession father alexander neoptolomus whiche also mine auctour telleth thus full fayre daughter story ye may sene olympiades macedony quene wedded philip macedo whilom mother quene renoun alexander story telleth whiche worlde brought subiection whose father philyp great affection let crowne brother olympiades called alexander raygne pyrothes philyp great beautie fayre creature suche affection specialtie remembred scripture false foule luste nature sayth bochas excuse vnlefully beauty vse meane horrible dede whiche rehearce foule thing said philyp bochas thus rede epirothes made kyng extorcion recorde writyng causeles thence enchace kyng arabba tho raignyng yt place fell story telleth alexander serious rehearsayle vpon death philyp macedo great host came itayle supposyng greatly auayle occupy proude entent wholly boundes occident though yt fortune chaungeable double also course nature ginnyng founde fauourable made twise proudly recure gayne luke disconfiture haue felde maugre al might force put vnto flyght agaynst itaile gan warre fully purpose romayns assayle hye presumption procede gan farre many prince battayle knowe afore certaine diuinaile conquest boundes cast life longe last temple jupiter grete diuinours expert olde seruyng god wtin lande crete answere thei told affirmed token manifolde ne eschue dredefull date ouer day assigned last fate also assigned place therby haue knowlegyng clere vnder citie longe large space called pandosia go nere acheront famous great riuere tolde playnly could farder sey necessitie must nedes dey though earnest iape god ordeyned set asyde thought wisdome desteny escape otherwise selfe prouide cast grece lenger abyde wenyng riuer faire citye saue grece el haue set selfe assuraunce entent eschue destinie thre battayles departyng puissaūce came itayle tofore luke citie helpe samoys countrye great power came anone ryght slew knyghtes put hym flyght backe pursued hym nere hys enemyes almost hym fall vnto brydge broke wyth ryuere ouerturned hys plankes acheronte men dyd ryuer call tolde certayn knyght whyche rode ryuer sight rayne fyll nyght ryuer waxt dredefull floude farre then kynges syght vpon water little towne stode whiche made kyng chaunge bloud specially pryde gan attame whan wyst pandosia name gan dredfully remembre callyng mynde priestes diuinayle whiche made quake euery membre feare breathe fayle man coulde wishe counsayle euery party stode wracke floude tofore hi enemy backe take riuer stode mortall drede enemy abyde wyst well deade passage none turne asyde thus dissolate stode withouten gyde thought better ieoparde ryuere wt enemy y• folowed nere mortal dredes hart gan cōstrayne drede floude haue passage behinde enemy y• gan disoaine lest slayne mortall rage fate approchyng yong age toun pandosia token expresse • cheronte bare therof witnesse whan put auenture passe floude el deade one trusted creature toke spere square sharpe heade backe quakyng drede trayterously plate mayle perced hart bloud abrode gan rayle also remembred luca • oyes vengeable vyolence haue carayne piece dismēbred tyll olde lady beyng presence required humble pacience grace gader myght anone membres ioyne one sende vnto sister dere olympyades stately great quene affection loue entere whan befell sene nature muste nedes bene • e prouyde estate royall bury body feast funerall se example proude kyng whiche would haue scaped fatal desteny chaunge place auayle • hym nothyng periodie prynces may chaunged terme set fro whyche may fle whan heuyn death hath set date mortall man may eschue hys fate xi chapter ☞ dary king perce mede outrayed alexander kyng macedon alexander called epirothes lyst lenger tary slayn mischefe retchles double corage could chaūge vary turne pen kyng dary whiche whilom lyst take hede mightely raigned perce mede among notable warriours like deme heauenly influence onely title predecessours prudent excellence great encrease magnificence asie made mencion vnder lordship dominacion myne auctor bochas doth defyne discended imperiall bloude artaxerses borne eke lyne passed prynces treasure goode perce mede great empyre stoode hūdred prouynces tencrease puissaunce seuen thirty gouernaunce ouer asie towarde orient lordshyp last bokes make mynde eke toward occident ouer egypt power fynde redde sea left behynde demyng hym selfe earthly treasour none lorde gouernoure toward septētrion vnder y• midday spere power raught hys regaly ouer inde cronicles ye may lere boundes great armenye lorde kingdome yt called parthy worldly folke dempt hym wt god egall▪ master fortune hys thrall hyghest exaltacion worldly glory could preuayle rich vaine ambicion fortune durst wel assayle royal riche apparayle cast chaūges giue hī sharpe shoure alexander grece enheritour vnto purpose penne dresse declare make mencion proude dary noble fortune seate • ast doun anone coronacion alexander macedone kyng processe workyng delayed made long date purpose fully yre procede perce mede scepter translate rich conquere possede perpetually abide dede vnder grekes mighty obeysaunce macedone haue gouernaunce mine auctour well reherce set grece mighty stronge citye corinthe metropolitan establishe imperiall see regalibus whan list crowned man whō god liste might marke world cōquere therof monarke ginnyng conquest famous grece euery region first chose father house knightes yt souerayne renowne notable armes condicion faithfull true high prudence foresight armes marciall prouidence full notably assygne men expert knightly apparayles make stuffe many riche signe forge stele plate mayles gaue rule gouerne battayles prouidence yore hath tolde full muche auayleth knightes wise olde accomplished list lenger tary worthy kyng wt ordinaunce purposed begyn kyng dary put remembraunce proude wise gan selfe auaūce first way brenne beate downe hasty yre thebe mighty towne gate two mighty region one frigie called lyde set olde tyme founda • ion vpon two riuers runnyng beside whose goldē grauels brightnes mai hide paceolus euxyne men call richest stremes though men reken conquest farder termyne wan isauria prouince wonder stronge asia one chiefest nyne pamphile kingdome large longe gate also right wronge yt conquest haue title right cūning passeth reason might toke party lyst tary matter forth procede alexander hasted towarde dary atcheue cōqueste perce mede first came frigia rede citye name specify thylke dayes named gordy mine auctoure affirme well dare tēple frigia thus saith jupiter whiche stode chare rope bounde stone pyrre amonge whiche men might beholde se fatall knotte craft made subtile man could vndo wyle science cunnynge curious knot lose vntwyne ouer asye crowned kyng alexander bokes determyne seinge chare knitte many line semed maner impossible seuer whiche indiuisible chare wt coardes enterlaced rychely stode • oues tabernacle whiche witte coulde enbraced neither craft solemne myracle tyll alexander diuyne oracle drew sworde wherof mē wōder carfe knotte cordes asunder wherby wyst ordeyned ouer asye lorde kyng whiche reioyce story fayned rode like mar battayles cōueiyng perce mede stāderds splayig toward cōquest let dwell chare knottes tell prudent justinus olde croniclere cronicles rehearseth story nowe gordius pore laborer beside citye called gordie • ryng lande ox gye maner foules hath flyght hye ayre appeared syght vnknowe token meant diuinours cast counsayle called • ugures holy entent knowen processe diuinayle shall profite eyther disauayle gate gordy citye met mayde excelling beautie whiche aboue heauenly influence byrth maner knowledgyng suche augury great practike science whiche gordius expowned euery thyng sayd asie lorde kyng raygne duryng lyfe hope wherof became wyfe weddyng waxt fortunate cronicle beare well recorde tyll frigy sodayne great debate among common mortall discorde knowyng meane bryng thē accorde tyll goddes notable prouidence taught way appease violēce debate shoulde among last vnto time chosen kyng gan cry pray goddes fast signe myracle shewyng geue maner knowlegyng myght notable encreace chose one y• set peace aunswere waite wel ware set spyes busy attendaunce met ridyng chare joues temple obseruaunce hym receyue goddes ordinaunce vpon heade withouten tariyng set crowne frigie raygne kyng gordius chaire ridyng toward temple way met awaytyng chose kyng solemnely home hym fet vpon head ryche crowne set egall mete brought rest quiete thus crowne gordius att • yne token shewed vnto hys great auayle discordes stryues restrayne liege gaue notable counsayle royall apparayle take chayre deuyse offer vp lowly wise temple consecrate jupiter full solempne place make offryng fortunate set without lenger space tofore goddesse called grace whiche myracle harte appease set people quiete ease whan kyng alexander losed knot whiche haue tolde chaire whiche gordius ladde secretes seyne misteries manifolde worldly presūption gan make hart bolde without title ryghtwisenes citye gordy spoile rich affryke robbed eke also vp mountayne yt called taurus whiche hyll hath famous name two also named caucasus prynce vyctorious ordeyned first speare shelde agaynst kyng dary holde felde vpon mountayne together met marciall plaine named horestes proudly wardes set warre nothing pee alexander knyghthode peerles perciens battayled syght darius party put vnto flight kyng alexander shortly conclude stately royall magnificence set trust great multitude knyghts long presēce armes longe experience well preued marciall disciplyne tenha • ce cōquest prudēt doctrin whiche y• iourney haue thē well borne noble founde lacke syxty thousande fotemen thē beforne slewe perce men horsbacke ten mortall wracke xl thousande made mencion prisoner put theyr raunson grekes partie story dothe wel shew macedonoys alysanders syde comparison slayne fewe fote men men dyd ryde feldes y• large wyde day theyr mortal striues nat full thre c whiche y• loste lyues dary coude none rescue make fled mischefe full great distresse wife doughter led awaye take tentes spoyled story bereth witnesse grekes made glad full great rychesse cofers spoiled fonde better succour enpouerished hys whole treasour whan dary saw deedly auenture ful pitously heart dyd mourne anone thys disconfiture babylon hast gan retourne dyd soiourne knowyng recure hym yt might auayle alysandre holde battayle purpose set hym selfe ease taleye hys deedly fell greuaunce entent kyng alysander please cast sende letter pleasaunce yeue hym giftes full great abundaunce al y• sleight darius hath wrought kyng alysander set echone nought manly kyng kept conceyte close lyst nat shewe ment dede cast fully hys purpose vpon conquest farther procede gettyng perce eke mede wyn surry egypt libye lande demyng fortune redy hys hande hys conquest farther endyte whan glory gan freshely shyne temple jupiter cast hym visite whiche stode libye auctours determine sayde discended lyne thylke god borne hys heyre lorde heauen fire water earth ayre priestes fully shoulde assent heauenly god make hym egall great richesse treasour sent thus drede mede made hym celestiall falsely forg • mortall ambicion marciall apparayle cast dary agayne haue battayle fynde howe dyd mete two prynces people innumerable confront lande crete kyng dary folkes defensable brought felde people incomparable four hundred fotemen fet fro farre alysander holde warre hundred came also horsbacke stele armed bryght thys people whan daye full longe last fyght slayne take yput flyght alysander hys encrease glorye kyng dary day victorye perciens theyr final mischefe without mercy paying raunson kynge dary put great reprefe voyde hope consolacion f • ed fynde region called parthe tolde people take put holde though hys fetter golde ryche therof god wote pleasaunce fortune gyftes nat aye ylyche false whele suche variaunce diuers strange countenaūce made alysander lytle numbre multitude dary encombre within towne called tharsa take charet cheynes strong ybonde frendes pitously forsake ledde hurt many mortal wounde murdre contriued founde one bessus froward recheles knyght stode afore forthered sight assured fayth legiaunce kyng dary true dede false traytour god sende hym myschaunce caused woundes mortally blede yet died sent drede percien knyght sad great age alysander tell hym message thanke prince hye noblesse grace mercy habounde hym lyst shew great gentylnesse vnto wife child founde hym muche bounde myne enemy hys benignite theyr distresse lyst haue pite sith see nedes must dey blody woūdes whiche maye nat recure say alisander grace pray haue ruth myne auenture next ordayne sepulture condiscende graunte myne askyng buryed longeth kyng praying god immortall whan hath done quyte hym hys mede mercy imperyall hym lyst grace take hede bury kyng perce mede yf tauour hert founde noblesse fame shall aye rebounde requyryng hym imperyall myght foule murder see eche circumstaūce murder alway calleth god ryght neuer cessyng continuaunce vp heauen crye vengeaunce namely murder compassed thought auisement execute wrought sythe haue layd thys bonde alysander message coniured ryght hande tauege deth wrought great outrage blode shed pale deed visage boude stockes god benigne ryght hole hert sprite resygne thus lay starke ther found abode lyke another mortall creature alysander murder vnderstode ye haue herde remembred scripture dyd ordayne sepulture funerall feast holde thynges olde tyme longed vnto kynges ¶ lenuoye tragedy pitous sheweth tortune y• chaunges lameble royal trones gold stone clere worldly prince howe vnstable fatal whele diuers chaūgeable vnware turne lyst nat course tary throw thē downe recorde king dary may ful assured make fortune treatable finde way searche manere obligation fynde immutable double face worlde aye disceyuable shew eche daye howe falsely vary couert fraude recorde kyng dary example phebus bemes clere sheweth day lyght agreable long eue darkenes dothe appere cloudy mystes raynes durable v declaryng token full notable worldly dignity fresh contrary change tydes recorde king dary al asye perce mede yfere lordshyp last thing incomparable ethiope vnder mydday spere ful treasure golde innumerable boundes raught fortune eke seruisable obey hys lustes tyll gan falsely vary expert fraude preue might dary noble prince hole hert entere lyfte vp corages holde thys fable though ye syt hye conceyue good worldlye lordshyp erth perdurable sith ye nature reasonable among remembre thyng necessary stant vpon chaūge recorde king dary xii chapter ¶ bochas remembreth batayles losse realmes antiquitie fallyng diuers noble gineth bochas remēbre certaine great sorowes y• mortal disaueyls losse realines y• blod shed vaine begon warres marciall appareyls called mynde olde fell batayls gon antiquitie made mencion first atwene grekes troy • ou • pitous hert woulde make blede haue memorie great outrage ye haue heard wrought perce mede atwene dary alysandre theyr age eke wene romains cartage wofull trouble warres firste begon causeth mischefes ben vnder son outher partie remembre aryght nowe losse nowe lucre cometh diuision disencrease heauye lyght life dethe short conclusion bochas sayth suche false discention hath many kyngdomes y• stode hye estate tourned tuyne made desolate remēbre troy walles broke downe grece distroyed manyla stronge cyte perce mede great desolation rome dispurueyed marciall surete castels tour olde antiquite made ruynous affryke cartage caused warres martes cruel rage lyst consider wrought dayes olde course conquest warriours alysander clerely maye beholde remembraunce progenytours hys blode howe successours fatally dyd hence wende sodayne deth shamefull ende full many reckened wer hys lynage succede hys possession syxe thirty partyng heritage eche assigned theyr royall portion first made hys diuisions gaue frigie prefecture ryght leonatus good knyght lytle whyle last hys possession countrees lyst hym nat obey athene indignation antipater dyd warrey yet warre playnly say leostenes theyr duke theyr gouernour slayne y• day found better succour leonatus aduersary antipater partye sustene founde fortune daye hym contrary felde though rode armed clene spere wounde made grene mischefe slayne myne auctour doth cōpile thus lordshyp last nat whyle antipater another successour alysander made mencion recorde false traytour death tempered poyson hys son cassāder accōplished trayson bare cup made hym sterue y• strong poyson dyd serue antipater crime culpable greatly desyred opinion vpon tho vengeable likely espye trayson drede hym sore hauyng suspection lest accused estate crime called lese maiestatis hys soone assented horrible dede alysander beyng babylone traytourly without shame drede ye haue heard presented poysone yet kyng made mencion though hym false contrary made prefect lord y• land cary among notable warriours thre ful worthy famous set numbre enheritours polycarpus neoptolonius eche enuious within felde storye dothe v lere eueriche slewe met yfere perdicas write sayne among one best knyght▪ whan alysander laye diyng certayne gan feble hys force myght dempt afore sat ful well ryght thys perdicas wisdom manhede macedone shoulde hym succede vnto hym loke chere benigne vpon heed sickenesse complaynyng full whole hert notable signe succession gaue hym ryng day crowned kyng macedone sith might auayle al empyre haue y• gouernaile yet sayth bochas playnly sentence though knyghthode hie prowesse manly force also prudence passed storye beareth witnesse vicious pride frowarde boystousnesse hyndred outrage enemyes myght hī domage throughe pride great extorcions fro macedone people countre fledde strange region presumption story sayth howe began warre agayne kyng tholome slayne men syghtes nat enemy knightes eke anaxarchus capadoce kyng whiche prouince ioyneth vnto surry touchyng boūdes recorde writyng towarde orient lande armeny hauyng two coūtryes scilice isaury towarde cypre great ryuere rennyng amiddes stremes freshe clere anaxarchus lothe fayne dayes fewe hath hys kyngdome lorne perdicas proudly slayne haue tolde beforne thus worldly price tho sworne theyr lordshyp domination fraude fortune vnwarly put doune amonge prynces age vpon alysander duly abydyng bochas reherseth amylchar cartage duke cite recorde writyng death worthy kyng ye haue herde ymurdred poyson sayd amylchar repeyringe toun slayne cartage shortly conclude cruel malice conspiracion within cite false ingratitude whan knighthode frāchised yt towne nat withstandyng hye renoune whan stode hyest hys felicite common slayne cite xiii chapter ❧ howe eumenydes twyse outrayed antigonus last dyed pryson whā alisader roial estate conquered tofore ye haue herd like god pompous elate souerayne prince myddleerde take vpon hym nothyng aferde clayme countrees thynge y• nat fayre jupiter sonne heyre one principle taketh hede first brought false ydolatry thylke tyme yt priestes false drede hys name goddes gan magnify call hym fayned flattery mydde tēples liby stage hys lykenes set vp ymage lytle nought hym myght auayle agayne deth succour fell poyson hys hert dyd assayle whiche made fade doth flour whose empyre none enheritour saue deth thus stode woful case twene sixe thirty hys land deuyded story full playnly tolde departicion make ferme stable laide forth vpon couche golde reherse token full notable whome dempt sothe able prince playnly discerne deed kingdom gouerne first one amonge prees next alysander knightlyest man worthy knyght called eumenides whose high renoun ful well rehearse prudent justinus great historian ordayned afore gouerne realmes two capadoce pafflagony also hie noble made mention especiall magnify hym lacked nought commendacion apparteyned vnto chiualry hie prudence noble policy except thre thinges myn auctor sayth y• crowne scepter kynges name dyd excell bothe prudence famous chiualry remembred bokes tell therat enuy fortune lyst set vp hye person aloft vpon whele besyde like neuer dele holdeth euer vpon hie mountaynes fyndeth great experiece blastes shours oft troubled storme wind raines alysander proude successours whan sat freshest theyr flour winde enuy fortune helde rother eche busy destroy hylles hye impossible man abyde without winde reyne thyng expert visible hye climbyng vp medled disdeyne preace hath enuy oft seyne preferryng fortune • estate euer cause great warre debate thinge well expert preued among sayd royall enherytours alysander eche greued see hys felow raygne flour thus atwene myghty successours false enuy gan great stryfe eche made lose hys lyfe afore made mencion pollicarpus neptolonyus maner false conspiracion agayne eumenides onely enuious whose falsenesse suspicious tyll day sayne metyng battayle slew twayne slaughter proude antigonus macedone prefect gouernour wext heart fell dispitous withal noble warriour knightes dyd wholly labour agayne eumenides marciall apparayle felde assigned holde great battayle made vpon great discomfiture mette armed bryght stele thus eumenides mortall auenture fledde mischefe strong castell wherof knightes lyked neuer dole story playnly maketh mynde day fled left men behynde castell stode destitute fro thencehe cast hast flye great mischefe fynde refute time drew strāge countrye succour get auenged called argyre grekes entent latyn corrupt worde argent argiraspedes people dwell name toke region whiche lande olde bokes tell hath syluer plente foyson cause olde discription toke name nature ryght soyle like syluer shyneth bryght thys yle hath great pryse myne authour maketh rehersayle people prouident wyse prudent armes manly batayle bothe defende proudlye assayle whiche theyr wisdome good counsayle kyng alysander stode great auayle eumenides one successours ye haue herde drewe countre fynde refute succour mischefe great aduersite wordes great authorite noble langage fayre eloquence people ful great reuerence manly coragious able assemble bothe plate mayle made rise agaynst antigonus theyr prowes hym haue batayle fortune hys party gan fayle wher thilke people story telleth thus afore ben full victorious antigonus hath felde recured day knightes fought lyke wodelyons furious tene hys corage assured brake theyr tentes pauilions spoiled castels robbed • geons countre vnwarely thus affrayed neuer afore batayle ben outrayed dispite people recheles caught hert great indignation agayne prynce sayd eumenides thē brought destruction people one opinion presented nat longe antigonus bounde chaynes strong proces brefely procede great mischefehe dyed prysone found mercy playnly rede noblesse hys hye renoune yet hys manhode made mencion story lyst loke aryght alysander better knight hys conquest euery hour space cheryshed hys hye noblesse aboue stode grace helpe releue folke distresse dyed wretchednesse v declaryng great variaunces daye fall fortune chaunces ¶ lenuoye thys tragedy duke eumenides weth fortune ye great doublenes worldly prince ben recheles vnware chaunges fall distresse may greater heuynesse prosperite greater payne aduersite sodayne greatest enuy greatest preace greatest awayte rychesse greatest ease rest peace discorde heuynesse sorow sorow fullest excesse thylke sorow y• dothe man constrayne prosperite aduersite sodayne prince erthe power peerles excelled noblesse worlde cōquest encrees alysander story bereth wytnesse remēbre fyne theyr hye prowesse triūphes dyd attayne prosperite aduersite sodayne strong enheritours yt chees sixe thirty nombre expresse whiche hadde possession kyngdoms doutles eche thyng obeying worthynesse tyl fortune wunted doublenesse shewed myght vnwarely ordayne prosperite aduersite sodayne noble prynces auoyde disencrees amonge selues discordes represse nat enuyous yrous causeles worke nothyng hasty wylfulnesse let discretion gouerneresse must folow yf ye parte twayne prosperite aduersite sodayne xiiii chapiter ❧ howe queene olympiades delyted vyces murdre vengeaunce dyed mischefe next order bochas dyd appere mischefe eumenides great quene wt full pitous chere mother alysander olympiades borne lyne gaades amonge quenes story bereth wytnesse excelled beauty rychesse doughter neoptolomus mighty kyng epirothes suspecte neptanabus enchauntment put hym selfe prees wifely trouth make recheles bochas saue name writeth lytle disclaunderous fame sayd quene right fayre visage first brought forth thylke region worthy blode lynage helde theyr scepter ryche crouns grece full possession quene tyme nere farre beaute called lode starre among al great prosperitees youth flowig souerayne noblesse ioye meddled wt great aduersitees whan philip maredo great heuinesse mortally wounded distresse cythia certayne nation called triboloys made mencion countre vpon certayne day faught dyd hys best payne gette cite siege lay thassaute dyd stuffe ordayne lost vnwarely one eyen twayne whan quene behelde hys wounde sorow fell platte vnto grounde another thyng bokes specifye troubled fame great heuynesse suspecte sclaunder aduoutry wrought neptauabus enchauntyng fayrenes light eciipsyng hie noble swifte report hynder name flieth swifte wicked fame womanhede authours wryte thing cōmended theyr chast honeste thyng moste sclaundrous noble atwite whan princess hasty freeite excede boundes wifely chastyte auayleth linage royall bloode whan theyr liuyng ye reporte nat goode holy bedde defoyled maryage one soyled may nat recured voyce goth forth froward langage many realmes many great cite sclaunder hath custome pite crew outher false contagious sowne one reysed goth nat lyghtly downe hindryng olympiades philippe away dyd deciyne kyng epyrothes wyfe toke hys concubine called cleopatra playnely termine thus myschefe tencrease trouble false aduoutrie gan wexe double proces write wyll cause matter abhominable kyng philip bargayne bought sore remembred cronicles ful notable slayne day syttyng hys table full sodaynly toke hede pausanias dyd cruell dede slaughter folowed strange case ye haue herde pausanias wrought olympiades full glad mery heuy outwarde heart voyde thought yet faynyngly hath wayes sought hym holde solempne royall lyke grekes rightes feast funerall whose dethe wrought great cruelte kyng alysander made lenger let made pansonias taken hanged vpon hye gybet vpon whose head crowneset golde peerle riche stone inde olympiades story fynde stode greatly quenes grace folke dempt suspection met together many priuy place greatly tourned confusion noyse arose region thoccasion theyr mislyuyng pausanias slough philyp kyng anone malice feruent fro gybet made hym take doun made body solempnely brent kept exequies great oblat • ryghtes region nat left behinde partie appertayned feastes funerall vpon kynge philyp none lorde shame despyte solempnely made brenne bone pausanias false appetite vnto man great delite feast like thinges thexequies prynces kynges made swerde also take whiche slough philyp kyng offred vp onely hys sake tofore appollo recorde writyng sclaundre hyndryng caused folke deme entent slee kyng philyp assent cruel set pleasaunce mercylesse voyde pyte cleopatra causynge thys vengeaunce selfe henge vpon tree murdred doughter storye ye may se malyce may yf declared vnto malyce woman compared speke malycious lyst custome vengeable amonge thousande one may vertuous two thousand one merciable rancour vntretable tygre cruel doutles recorde take olympiades malice set fyre execute boldly vengeaunce occasion great empyre perce mede ful famous substa • ce stode cōquest vnder y• gouernaunce alysander wherby thought strōg ta • heue eche thyng right wrong dempte power aye contune meane hys hygh maieste god stronger quene fortune suffred son dignite babylone poysoned remembred many olde storyes triumphes victoryes passe brefely wrytyng touchyng quene made mention whan deed philyp famous kyng macedone full possession gouerned myghty region wher like wolues auctours write shede blode gan selfe delyte tyranny feruent yrous reioysed slaughter see men blede serpent none malicious quene bokes ye may rede yet receyued mede though fortune fauoured whyle yet train coude wel begile thende tyrantes eke tyrannesses murdrers neuer woode poysonmongers enchauntresses false supplantours contrary goode conspirers thryst bloode must haue goddes purueyaunce short lyfe sodayne vengeaunce macedone quene behated vengeable mortall oppression cassander hath debated gun warre vpon region alysander ministred poyson ye haue herd tofore hym deuysed antipater mortally practysed founde refute toke flyght cruell quene olympiades moūtaine stode ferre sight kyn folowed great prees supposyng haue lyued pee hyll stode great dongeon strongly walled enuyron whiche marched great cite called epidua standyng great dout cassander olde enmyte layde siege none hardy issue tyll cassander false compassed trayson made composicion hys faythe layde tyme hostage othe assured olympiades couert fraude vnder fayre langage suffer lyue pee promyse false recheles vnder treatie made mencion quene toke cast pryson wyll ye se royall hye corage howe boldly delyuered fro pryson discended imperial visage maydens enuyron enemyes present woder lyon seyng stande stately face proudest arest manace purpose arayed none sayth bochas stately wyse ryche purple golde precious stone lyke empresse grekyshe gyse herlyst nat flye storye doth deuyse crye noyse passed nat boūdes whan blodye rayled woundes nat afrayed mortall shours voyde feare lyst nat bowe chyne make prayer tourmentours token corage feminine vpryght stode lyst nat downe declyne gaue euidence comprehended lyne blode discended vnto tyme gaue vp brethe neuer seyne prince pryncesse proudly toke fatal dethe deme marciall hardynesse came frō bellona armes chefe goddesse influence corage youe goddes lynage force vertue bokes specify agayne vice make resystence frowarde rancour proude melācoly gaue spirite fayned pacience false pretence magnificence scaunce ben vertue strong trouth haue endured euery wrong contrarious force made dispitous stronge errour endure payne obstinat heart fell yrous dethes constraynt lyst nat complayne counterfayte suffraunce made fayne nothyng vertue playnely termine maners feminine entrayles malyce enclosed contagious venym serpentyne nat lyke woman fende disposed able distroy vertuous discipline thus began thus dyd also fine vicious murdre dyd aye delyte wherfore lyst tendyte ¶ lenuoye alye shall thys tragedy se ruth mercy haue compassion see prince imperiall see vnwarely fortune throwen doun whose mischese thoccasion thre thinges set pleasaunce vicious life murder vengeaunce ala euer mortall cruelte blody swerde execucion shoulde appropried feminite agayne nature theyr condition causyng finall sclaunderous confusion olympiades put remembraunce vicious lyfe murdre false vengeaunce vnder freshe floures sote fayre se serpent dareth couert poyson christ water calme sote peryllous pittes full deception men se day clere inspection faynyng face angelyke suffisaunce hyd vnderneth rancour great vengeaunce though excelled natife beaute pryncesses region yet neuer none feller sene execute lyke opinion perylous traynes contriued trayson specially pompous greuaunce hated vengeaunce noble prynces set hye dignite aduertise discretion power largest liberte merciable remission suger pite indignation let grace mercy tempre puyssaunce olympiades eschewing vengeaunce exyle rygour farre countre gyue hym iurisdiction womanheed longeth parde cancred rancour new execucion wher mercy reigneth grace ther foyson haue mynde longe continuum • ce olympiades forgettynge vengeaūce let pacience vertuous plente within heartes purchase mancion let compassion attempre equite ryght excede nat boundes reason feminine humble entencion alway bridled prouident suffraunce voyding al excesse rygour vengeaūce sayde olde aucthorite woman longeth disposition mekenesse langage porte humilite vertue humble subiection voyde manaces stryfe contencion man attendaunce espye token rancour vengeaunce speciall meane parcialite shulde mercy discription rebounde woman antiquite lambe nat vsed play lyon meke doue enuyed faucon degre naturall accordaunce syt nouther rygour hasty vengeaunce simple lenuoy receyue gre haue therof indignation lowly dyrect benignite onely mekenesse presumption knowyng kynde inclination disposed naturall purueyaunce mercye nothyng vengeaunce xv chapter ¶ agathocles lowe byrthe borne attayned vnto royall dignite ended pouerte wretchednesse haue herde sayd full yore agone whirle winde blowing nothing soft olde englishe called rodyon reyseth dust straw ful hye lofte thassendyng falleth full ofte though borne almost skye becommeth man espye forge fyre smythes make clere experience full oft yseyne infernall vgly smoke blake transcende ye top many great mountayne oft sithe full sodayne rayne al ascencions rage wind vp blow vnware turne reuersed full lowe semblably put prefe execute clere experience one contraryous mischefe founde erthe notable euidence onely fortunate violence whan wretch churlishe nature estate prynces vnwarely doth recure crowne golde nothyng accordyng set vpon knaues heed foltyshe clerke weare ryng accordeth nat take hede worlde greater drede power geue yf well sought vnto one first rose vp nought maner iuste conuenience royall carbuncle rubye garnet chast emeraude vertuous exelence inde saphyrs copper set kyndly power foule metall let state politike puy saunce euer lost wher knaues haue gouernaūce time may well vp ascende like windy smoke theyr fume sprede crowned asse playnly comprehende voyde discretion drede lyon one dede nature myghty royall voyde discretion beastiall gentle nature stronge lyon prostrate people kynde merciable vnto fall afore hym doun hys royall puisaunce nat vengeable churlish wolues rigour vntreatable foltyshe ass eke bestialyte faylyng reason brayde euer cruelte none proude good leuder head presumption cruelte vengeaunce lowe blode malapertnesse indiscretion churle gentle make diuision outher thē dare right wel reporte fro then thei came therto wyl resorte rose knowe colour swetnesse violettes freshe tarage nettle rough fell sharpnesse thistle breres prickyng great outrage▪ thus considred rote eche lynage frowarde tetches euer churles founde wher vnto gentyls aye vertue doth reboūde let men beware especiall one thyng great deception false coynage plate may bryght shewyng metall false shew fayre visage nat golde speake playne langage shineth bright concluding reason vnder fayre ofte hyd false poyson skye vgly cloude ascendeth low see blacknesse doth sunne shroude men may nat great bryghtnes see haue comforte hys clere beaute vicious tetches well assure difface full ofte gyftes nature god vnto hath geuen nature excell another fayrnesse yet vice recorde scripture thei wer disclaūdred bochas doth witnesse outwarde suger warde bytternesse ensample purpose may call agathocles fulfylled vice story commeth ryng beaute great excellence declare vicious lyuyng discriue hys outragious offence shoulde write fully sentence lyke demerites wholly maner woulde perce blot paper touchyng byrthe lowe bed descended sonne porter story ye may se vertue fynde hym nat commended except nature gaue hym great beaute fostred mischefe great pouerte eke disdayne hym nat excuse hatefull pride father craft vse meane great fayrenesse hye estate came low degre yet vice whiche wyll nat expresse disused cursedly hys beaute agayne nature yuell mote thee soyled shortly specifye spice pride lechery yet nat withstandyng false condicions god suffred hym come hie estate gouerne diuers nacions fynde whyle howe fortunate lechery aye pompous elate cite called cyracuse sayde vice frowardly gan vse beaute great myght vice hys youth dyd enclyne coude also forther hym selfe aryght eloquence expert doctrine sayde tho came low lyne yet put remembraunce hundred knightes gouernaunce centuryen purchased offyce tyme toke order knyght chosen tribune great pryce gate great fauour people syght fell anone ryght cyracuses made duke head election theyr lorde dead ciciliens helde mortall strife agathocles made hym victorious toke duchesse hys wyfe meane wherof wext full glorious glorye grewe right dispitous forgate selfe thus growyng estate wherthrough cite debate condicions whan gan espy saw worke presumption people anone knowyng hys tiranny exiled hym region exyle made mencion coude nat fynde better cheuisaunce came cite y• called murgaūce wher sleighty subtel false auyse demeaned hym people syght pretor gaue hym offyce meuyng euer myght gaine cyracuses make thē strōg fight entent auenged cause exyle cite exyle story saythe none wrought mediacion duke hamilchar yt hys sworne brother cyracusans one entention called home agayne toun restored hys place reconciled kynges grace vnto hym gaue great auice assent lordes commonte pretour newly offyce pretor custome called offycers dwell cite haue full charge dome iudgementes put gylty payne turmentes new thys agathocles bycause aucthorite cast trouble quiete pee cyracuses cite senatours greatest dignite mortal vēgeaunce titant made anon without exception slayne euerichon hasty slaughter wrought tiranny might nat asswage stāche fel corage tyll treasour toke robbery cicile spoyled pyllage cast pride vpon hye stage ascende sleyghty false workyng region crowned kyng made subiectes maugre hym dredyng cal hym kyng especiall one worthy prynce tho lyuyng sat chayre maiestye royall tyll fortune shope must haue fall cartage duke worthy knyght fought twyse put flyght wherthrough stode mischefe dispeyred al people disdayne cyracuse hast repayred cite retourned home agayne abydyng drede vncertayne whan fortune gan agayne hym take frendes olde new haue forsake mischefe bode nat long processe maketh rehearsayle gadred people made selfe strong onely purpose affryke assayle cartage great battayle th • n discomfited fortune lyst ordayne hye prowesse sonnes twayne archagatus ycalled one wonder delyuer man great myght seconde brother moste worthy echone called heraclydes whiche yt mortal fight preued selfe daye manly knyght theyr māhode lacke cartage fellye put backe though wer fortune warre agathocles day victorie false couetyse made hym erre eclipsed light hys glorie remembred hys storie lyke byrthe determined falsenes corage enclyned cruell custome hert mercyles wyll law wronge ryght contrary accorde frowarde vnto pee proude surquedous hys owne syght power stretched hys myght lyke tyraunt naturally disposed execute vengeaunce afore purposed thought power bynde fortune whele abyde stable thing contrary kynde whose propertie variable hys pryde ala abhominable mortall prince none yt may restrayne vnware tourne course sodayne influence heauenly starres vncouth course aboue celestiall fortune fauour warres agathocles byrth full rurall promoted vnto estate royall tyll pride outrage froward engendrure caused lordshyp myght nat endure fortune kynde flaskysable monstruous beast departed manyfolde slydyng serpent tournyng vnstable slipper gripe holde boke declared tolde power preued prince recheles recorde agathocles ye haue herde rehersed sentence symple bare hys natiuite brought vp fostred great indigence stocke springyng pouerte rose estate royall dignite rysyng vncouth marueylous tattayne fal greuous sodayn cyracuse exyled twyse vengeable heart myght affricans disconfited thryse euer batayle custome put flyght vsaunce robbe day nyght lyke tiraunte agayn conscience spoyle subiectes great violence hindred fortune wherof nat fayne stroke agayn sodayne violent sonnes two affrike first slayne lymmes wext feble impotent consumption entrayles brent ague continuall feruence suppressed stroke pestilence treasour hath hym take proude port worldly glory wife kyn frēdes hath forsake conquest derke put memory name yclipsed hys olde victory gan pouerte distresse made ende wretchednesse hasty rysyng thri • te sodayne surmountyng violent rauyne extort power may whyle attayne ryche chayre lordshyp shyne sodayne ascending dothe sodenly declyne vntruth whereuer encrees men wayt custome sodayne disencrees agathocles men may ensample take thende euery false tiraunt wrōge climbing vp dothe foule ende make season though tirauntes puysaunt fortune yeueth lenger graunt whan syt whele royal vnware chaunge haue sodayne fal agathocles first sympleman brought forth mischefe pouerte sonne porter story tell vicious liuyng came great dignite folke hated cruelte clambe fro pouert vp great rychesse made pore agayne died wretchednesse ¶ lenuoye tragedy sheweth figure bothe story aucthorite man beast euery creature tarageth stocke natiuitie herbe rote eche frute tre bothe vertue also outrage foloweth tetche taste lynage agathocles recorde scripture borne lowe bed brought forth pouerte yet fortune made recure vp hye estate full lowe degre reason blent sensualitie forgate selfe speake playne lāgage false tetche yt came fro lynage difference colour pycture table wall men day may se twene golde golde atwene byse asure golde shyneth bryght parde noble false yt hath great beaute let men beware counterfayte coynage tetches eschuyng churlyshe lynage man furthered sodain auenture set chayre royall dignitie wenyng empyre shoulde euer endure neuer troubled aduersitie royall eagle kyte may flye jaye may chatter golden cage yet euer tetch must folow lynage gentle bloude royall nature euer enclyned mercy pite custome vyllains cure vsurped extort false poste vengeable mortall cruelte hasty fume furious courage folowyng tetches vyle lynage mighty prynces noble assure passion rest tranquilitie se meane measure tyrant catcheth souerayntie let agathocles worldly myrrour eschue trace hys froward passage royall bloude requyreth lynage xvi chapiter ☞ howe cassander slewe wyfe alexander hercules sonne antipater slew mother murder greate mischiefe fortune myght wofull falles fr • whele dede prynces pryncesses loke aright ben lamentable doleful rede bochas dothe procede rehearsayl remēbryng thus selue appeared men woman twelue death kyng agathocles cāe tofore worthy quenes twain first called bersanes mischefe gan complayne wife alexander story lyst fayne mighty kyng greatest vnder sonne whiche conquest world hath wife alexander barsanes lyue made mencion whiche sonne named hercules wereby cassander brought destruction death thys occasion cassander dradde y• bersanes quene woulde sonne auenged bene treason whiche tofore wrought alexander hys lynage specially brought macedone auauntage wyth sonne yonge age cassander thought drede haue told wold auenge tresōs wrought old cast afore malice causeles cassander falsely workyng knyght yonge hercules son alexander recorde wrytyng maredone take crowned kyng woulde equitie ryght father death auenge lyke knyght whiche thing eschue cassāder gan prouide false fraude retchles day list longe abide slew first quene sayd bersanes sonne ycalled hercules thus cassander murder crop rote murdred wer nonother bete crueltie myght suffice vnto alexander recorde scripture lyke tyrant vengeable wise bury froward auenture man know sepulture thus ala whiche pity rede murdred foure one kynrede alexander ministred poyson slewe quene called olympiades hatred full false treason haue tolde slew quene bersanes wife alexander mother hercules whiche youthe bochas rehearsyng macedoyne like haue kyng could liue pee euer ready treason slewe eke quene called roxanes vpon day yonge sonne wyfe alexander also cassander dreadyng opinion lest would venge thē vpon treason thus euer liued murder sorow strife way fraude came encrees finde wife called thessalonices story remembreth doubtles sonne borne atwene twayne stea mother paine shortly passe mine auctor writeth nonother antipater sonnes name bicause loued brother better great defame cōpassed death story sayth notwithstandyng appese crueltee asked mercy knelyng knee breastes open white soft silke bedewed teares vysage requyred mekely reuerence milke whiche fostred yong age haue mercy appease rage accept goodly prayere saue life mother dere nought heard neuer adele surmountyng measure like father bengeable cruell trowe youe nature recorde kynde eke scripture selde neuer braunche goode spryngeth custome cruel bloude death cause none antipater slough mother dere loued alexander brother better cronicle doth v lere whiche alexander ye lyst succour finde writyng demetrius asye kyng thessalonices dead antipater infortunate bathed bloud side wer made red without compassion hye estate two sonnes liuyng debate til lisymachus yt prefect trace reconsyled eche others grace whan demetrius knew accorde god wot sothe nothing fayne fraude story beareth record alexander maliciously slayne antipater stādyng certayne tyll sleyght lisymachus murdred story telleth thus write proces maner hough lisymachus fraudulent workyng sonne lawe antipater thus slough false couetise cause thing demetrius toke kyng macedone remembred tyme date whan brother passed fate duryng murder mortal strife proces like founde antipater erudice wyfe daughter elenchus chain boūde cast pryson darke hydous profound whyle leaue soiourne demetrius wyll agayne returne made selfe crowned kyng macedone great puissaunce destroy purpose workyng thre prince notable substaūce confederate allyaunce echone assented short conclusion bryng demetrius destruction one first worthy tholome kyng egypt armes full famous twayne story ye may se called seleuchus next lisymachus cypre came kyng pyrrhus lorde prouynce eke founde made thē strong demetrius cōfoūd shortly tell apparayls macedoue fyrst depryue game vpon hym four strong battayles neuer ouerset lyue take lisymachus story doth discryue cheyned pryson life dout finde euer issued ☞ xvii chapter ¶of two prefectes perdicas amintas next order perdicas appere whilom prefect great babilon wt came amintas eke yfere prefect made mencion whiche bactry subiection great prouince youe iudgement midde alia towarde occident sayd twayne worthines manhode actes marciall assigned diligent busines wayte kepe especiall vpon maiestye estate royall alexander trust chamberlayns agayn assault drede forayns whose death singuler guerdone made prefect bothe dede ye haue heard one babilone bactry story ye may rede yet quiete might hem succede seleuchus gan warre ayen thē make wer fayn lordship forsake ¶ xviii chapter ❧ howe sandrocottus borne lowe degre cherished robber theues prefectes also fynde whiche held people ful great seruage macedone inde tyll sandrocottus man lowe lynage cast would redresse outrage entent pore people restore fraunchises yt playned sore sandrocottus auctour workyng behight people throughout coūtreys whan sleight crowned kyng restore olde liberty whan receyued dignity behestes made fayre vysage turned thraldom seruage thus whan wretche set high estate begger brought vp dignitie none proud pōpous elate none vengeable full crueltie voyde discrecion mercy pitie churlyshe bloude selde dothe recure gentle way nature may dissimule tyme fayne counterfayte fayre vysage one hode shew face twayne contrary hart double langage styll hys porte smothe passage vnder floures lyke serpent dare till may stynge spare euer like condicions sandrocottus set vp hye estate vexed people troubled region set city townes great debate whose gouernaunce infortunate sene founde preues cherished man robber theues declare caught hardines occasion people gouerne pronostike whiche shall expresse ryght marueylous vncouthe discerne whiche shall tell yerne right wonderful vncouth heare ye lyst lere man called procatales borne inde whiche liuyng wonder pore came selde prees trespaced one thing agayne venādrus y• time king cōmaundyng slea hym anonryght escaped story sayth flyght god geuen fete swyftnes meane wherof saued fro daungere long trauayle fyll werynes refreshed beside well clere lay slepyng face chere dropped swette lyon came foreby licked hys face sayth story whiche affray man anone awoke sodaynly lyft vp vysage lyon rose softly way toke towarde forest domage forgate felnesse cruell rage whiche pronostyke gan occasion wherof sandrocottus toke opinion cast thought fantasy syth lyon beast royall whiche disdayned selfe apply licke face man rurall nature shewe beastiall dempt well sittyng take hym estate kyng opinion reason right nought lyon left crueltie coutrary wext proud hert thought voyde mercy barrayne pitie whan set dignitie brought wretche domination agayne nature played lyon sum time lyon forgetteth felnesse woulfe wyll naturally deuour royall bloude hath ruthe gentlenes pore playnufes helpe thē succour tyrant dothe naturally labour whan hath power catchyng auauntage robbe subiectes spoyle thē pillage sandrocottus thus borne lowe kynrede hye estate fortune whan stode gan make stronge vengeable dede number robber furious wode cast destroy gentle bloude inde ordinaunce stea al prefectes gouernaūce wt cōmons made strōg gan maner death deuise like false tyrant although wrong agayne lordes whan gan aryse oliphant came full vncouth wise obeyed great wonder whan battayls farre asunder though wild story saith ye sandrocottus lept vpon syde hys backe beast tame toward battayle anone gan • yde captayne day gyde robber made mynde slew al prefectes gētle bloud inde xix chapiter ☞ seleuchus myghty prynce slaine great tholome kyng egypt came seleuchus bochas complaynyng myghtye prynce manlye knyght sonne antiochus famous kyng fauoured alexander syght whiche seleuchus wisdome might borne prynces cronicle ye may sene called leodice great famous quene byrth straunge marueylons mother vpon nyght cōceyued drempt thought thus semed playnely sight great appollo heuēly god bright tyme conceyuynge receyued night golde riche ryng whyche rynge set precious stone yeue vnto great guerdon graue wt anker cōmaunding anone byrthe without dylacion yeue rynge whole affection seleuchus wherby especiall excell actes marciall morow childe borne within bed founde riche ryng wyth token rehearsed toforne anker graue like euery thing whiche quene toke kepyng entent auauntage kept secrete tyll came age another maruayle fyll also withall seleuchus wōder thing enprynted eke speciall vpon hys thygh anker ryng recorde writyng suche carectes story doth determyne borne lyne seleuchus made mencion tender yeres age ronne came yeres discrecion rynge ful many land hath wonne whose knightly fame shone shene y• sonne well aduised hardy great myght time alexander hold one best knight warre armes time hath spent brought inde subiection gate kingdomes nye orient helde longe possession ala bochas maketh mencion victory honour shyne sodaine chaunge turned ruyne whan seleuchus vyctorious inde conquered substaunce atwene king lisymachus tofore made remembraunce began warre great distaunce met apparayles great felde ordeyned battayles lisymachus fyll disconfiture wherof seleuchus glad especiall dempt winnyng came nature influence celestiall gan waxe proude estate royall supposing victorious stall mischeues fall processe declareth vnto v egypt great tholome brother lawe lysimachus fyll seleuchus full great cruelte slew mischefe story ye may se loste lyfe made mencion macedoyne mighty region know antiquitee rehearsayle olde auctours foresayd great tholome alexander one enheritours kyng egypt raignyng flour whose name descedyng downe grees kinges called tholomees fynde touchyng lynage procreacion child thre first speake playne langage named ceraunius tholome next philadelphus daughter arcynoe wedded faders cōsentyng lisymachus macedon kyng xx chapter ❧ howe two sonnes quene arcynoe mother brother trayterouslye slayne exyled thus remembred bokes olde death seleuchus wrought tholome vnwarely slayne tofore haue tolde next order came arcynoe john bochas great aduersite teares bedewed vysage gan cōplayne cōstraynt rage mighty quene sayd arcynoe sonnes twaine full famous renoun tone lisymachus excelling beautye philip made mencion ioye dilectation worldly blisse sayne holy set vpon child twayne occasion great fayrenes men delited greatly se namely woman story dothe expresse mother quene arcynoe stode great hope mighty kynges iust succession macedony mighty region onely title father ryght whiche hart gaue full great gladnes dempt none wight succede haue entresse fortune blynde false goddesse disposed child twayne none thē purpose shold attayne whā father lisimachus slaine sayd quene called arcinoe saue lyfe coulde none gayne sonnes fearfully fle cassander mighty stronge citee onely drede one antigonus whiche thē pursued story telleth thus brother quene arcynoe called ceraunius rescued party agayne antygonus ye may story se yet hart great enuy albe nere one alye two sonnes kynges • e macedoyne raygne countre set onely couetise crowned macedoyne kyng false treason story doth deuise dis •• yue workyng first quene full humbly knelyng made promise vnder great surete macedoyne crowned child fayre vysage kept vnder gouernaunce vnto time came age put assuraunce ceraunius swore god geue sory chaunce purposed false workyng crowne quene make sōnes king toke god therunto witnes swore agayne plaine vysage vnto quene fraude doublenes purpose haue mariage crowne quene great aduauntage thus swore brother yet hart god wot thought another vnder colour assuraunce let enter cassandre cite came pleasaunce lordes hye lowe degre made stretes hanged clothes golde solemne wise goddes sacrifise thus receyued solemnely day halowed holde feastiual quene ioye ordeyned rychely two sonnes faire crowned crownes full royall go afore maister strete gloriously vncle mete felonous hart vnder frendly face ceraunius rote treason gan cosyns ben • igly embrace purposyng false collusion procede destruction fynally fyrst payne quene texyle slea chyldren twayne treason brought prefe whan quene apperceiued falsenes saw sonnes brought mischefe coniured 〈◊〉 mortall distresse haue pitie naturall gentilnes spare cosins afore stode royall mercy nere borne bloud crye pa • yng 〈…〉 fyl afore • wownyng 〈◊〉 ground like 〈◊〉 culpable seing sonnes bleadyng wt many woūde nought mercy foūd bloud story fayned garment dolefully distayned face fayre foyled ordure golden heere torne rent like thrall wofull creature mortall wepyng sight blent fynde sent bury child space yle called samothrace story whiche maketh mencion pryncesse hye degre founde great cause lamentacion beyng daughter great tholome child slayne vengeable crueltie beholde death dolorous husbande called lisymachus▪ banished exyle made ende wt sorowful cōplaynt life thus draw alōg tyll fate spirite wende drede paynes full stronge shoulde rehearce wronge suffred woulde greue sore therfore write ¶ lenuoy tragedy sheweth apparence lykenesse faythfull assuraunce excyte men yeue false credence vnto fortune false variaunce cast baytes angle pleasaunce hoke hid vnder vengeable crueltie chapiter put remembraunce lisymachus arcynoe greater euidence worldly trouble worldly constaunce se prynces magnificence mighty royall puissaunce vnwarely brought fortune mischaūce ouerwhelmed tranquilitie se myrror full notable substaunce lisymachus quene arcynoe ryng anker great excellence ye •• seleuchus marciall suffisaunce whan app ••• heauenly influence lyst mother make alyaunce sent hī relikes singuler acquaintāce set manhode surete al quaueryng acquayntaūce thinke lisimachus arcinoe vncouth treasour gold ne dispēce haue world gouernaūce al subiectes vp rekened sentence al region vnder obeysaunce prince princess al attendaunce may agayne fortune yeue lybertie knoweth vnsure gery chaunce thinke lisimachus arcinoe chyldren slayne violence ceramius god yeue sory chaunce false coloure dyd reuerence pretended maner obseruaunce treson close venomous purueyaunce purposed afore outray thre chyldrē slayne knew cheuisāce mother exiled called arcinoe noble prince beware hie prudence amonge selfe distaunce hyde rancoure hateful vyolence vnder curtayne double daliaunce lyke hert shewe countenaūce voide dissimulinge duplicitie wysely way chapter balaunce lysimachus quene arcinoe xxi chapiter ¶ ceramius macedoyne kyng murdred cosins slayne bataile fraunce noble poete jhon bochas boke procedyng forth cōplaineth pite quaking hande whan pen toke gan writ woful desteny ye haue herde quene arcinoe ceramius story maketh minde false traytour vnkynde whose treason made great processe howe slayne batayle punished vengeaunce falsenesse lyke story maketh rehersayle whych remembre cast fayle folowyng mine auctour procede writing howe ceramius slayne beynge kinge whyle false workyng macedoyne gouernayle thre hūdred accompted writynge went fraunce conquere itayle host departed many stronge batayle gate conquest theyr hye renoune ful many prouince many region rode many gret coūtre people gaule stele armed clene founded castels many stronge cytie towarde rome bylded myl • n sene vpon alpes armour shone ful shene vp rome went force citye brent parted vp grekyshe see custome chese dwellynge place augurie byrdes dyd fle folowynge flyght gan trace holdynge way within lytell space myghty hand boke doth specify came countrey called pannony folk gaule whych called fraūce conquere landes put selfe prees notable people puissaunce folowynge y• exāple knightly encrese theyr ridynge worthy hercules worshipped actes mercial lyke god called immortall grace fortune chiualryes conquered countreys alwaye forth rydynge selfe departynge diuers companyes withstode cōsumed brēnig came macedone ceramius king presūpciō wening shuld auayle ordinaunce met battayle ceramius outrage pride dempt able mete thē fraūce murdre homicide lacked grace power substaunce yet gaule prudent gouernaunce offred vnto hym though retcheles macedonoys treate pee presumpcion melancoly agaynst enemy felde hath take discomfited anone party men gan flie haue lord forsake hys heed smyt set vpon stake al mischefe lyte dede recōpence fraude falshede paine againe great offence may deuised boke men rede equiualent murder recompence duely punyshe outragious dede made yonge child blede ceramius whiche false couetise cosyns slough ye haue heard deuise thinke murder foule thing god man hatefull terible infernal fraude deuillyshe cōpassing eche creature nature odible whiche redresse impossible cursed ceramius leaue thy story thy name shal blot papere xxii chapiter ❧ prynce belgius disconfited brought nought tyraunte ye haue hearde eaas slayne battayle traytour odious anone order came john bochas mighty prynce called belgius deadly pale face furious whiche cōplayned amonge wofull prees disconfiture done quene softenes sodayn mischefe greued hart sore folke battayle put flyght bochas writeth knighthode apparaile saue onely maketh rehearsaile frenche host telleth certaine chosen chefe captayne came riche lande macedoyne people fraunce tyll softenes quene wt myghty hande disconfited brought mischaunce whō finde none remembraunce saue whan wende glorious outrayed force brennus ☞ xxiii chapter ¶ duke brennus delityng robbe steale mischeuouslye ended brennus full knyghtlye workynge cōquest gate many great citie reade dane kyng disployled region many great coūtrie robbed people hye lowe degre spared goddes vyolence toke treasure reuerence temple great marueylous built roche hyll stone sacred appollo called delphicus grece great god none oft sythe people woulde gone vp theatre whiche stode wythout haue answere yt stode doubt trust hope yt god applyed hauyng hym singuler affection though might haue holpe magnified done great consolation spiryte false deception gaue answere sundry question folke came diuers region kyng brennus fantasy temple panym gyse neither worship magnify grekysh goddes thē sacrifise hart gan despyse caught ioy wyth false robbours dispoyle robbe treasours behyght men sayd playne langage desyre hys entencion boty pyllage goddes possession part thē singuler guerdon labour great trauayles wyth battayles gaue people maner hardines made trust great multitude hauyng despyte innocent symplenes enemy rude meane tho folke shortly conclude whiche kepyng iewels precious great appollo called delphicus people also whiche brennus day dronke myghty wynes fyll paūches desyrous forgate marciall doctrine ascēd y• moūtayne feble chine heades totter braine gan faile temple aloft spoyle assayle assending wayes chees vpon roche beat doune priestes temple put thē selues prees one bare standard another penoune clad chesibles hye deuocion vncouth apparayles bothe roche lowe battayles people brennus incomperable spred felde story beareth witnes sayd olde fable defence dronkennes wisdome fayleth greate excesse felde playnly conclude victory alwayes standeth multitude set bochas dothe deuise knighthode false outrage spoyle robbe gredy couetise stuffe somters great pillage furious rauine hath brought thē rage farewell knighthode marciall noblesse couetise lady maistresse two mighty duke brennus whiche chefe counsayle euridanus one thessalonus thought great auaile began purpose disauayle robbe people countrey ech toun whiche turned confusion thus auarice wt stomake vnstaūcheable hath strāgled y• power many worthy knight couetise sister vntretable hath high noble full oft quaint lyght wher tātalus raigneth lion hath might meane honger couetousnes turneth noble cowardnes counsayle duke twayne brennus set opinion spoyle robbe dyd busy payne pyll city region made mencion myd battayles bochas dothe lere god appollo pallas appere appollo first shewed presence freshe yonge lusty sunne shene armed golde great vyolence entred felde well sene diana came arowes kene mynerua bright haberion cōminge made terible soun noyse herd bright armure made enemyes almost raue might afore endure fled felde drede selfe saue herde hidous erthquaue heauen mortal batayle colde constreyning great stone hayle aduersaries beate downe grounded afore durst abide brennus mortally wounded brest heed hurt eyther syde lo ende couetise pride brennus constraynt smert roue dagger selfe herte ende vēgeable merueylous duke slayne twayne called euridanus thessalonus grekish goddes gan disdayne sacrilege se greuous payne goddes lyst obseruaunce shall vnwarly punished wyth vēgeaūce holsome goddes play puissaunce presūptously attame vengeaūce lyst werray lyst assay shall fynde game presūpcion brennus founde appollo diana mynerue outrage vnwarly made hym sterue ❧ lenuoye tragedy declareth lyst duke brennus many great batayle extorte conquest holy maner howe force rode al itayle romayns dyd assaile fall grece vengeable violence goddes would reuerence toke al treasours iuels entere temple richest apparayle golde perle al yfere encrease whych myght auayle rich robbed oppressed porayle verye pompe frowarde insolence lyst goddes reuerence mighty tiraūt surquedous chere couetyse brent hys entrayle whose gredy fret ther might mesure stere tyll fortune mischefe dyd hym fayle lacked might variant whele nayle agayne whose fall resistence goddes lyst reuerence noble prynces conceyue lere fall brennus misgouernayle prudently paysyng thys matere vertue strōger outher plate maile afore considred brennus doth coūsayle chefe preseruatyfe magnificence god due reuerence xxiiii chapter ❧ howe pyrrus kynge pyrothe lyst nat lyue peace pryde presumption warre came vnto mischaunce bochas boke next folowīg y• rig came yong pirrus sonne earides borne discent reigne kyng enherite lande pyrothes yet youth tender encrees frowarde people
