dwellynge y• place without gylte gan dethe purchace preserue hym made mencion committed take kepyng certayne yeres hys sauacion one glaucus illirie king whose wife cosyn record writing sayde famous earides story called beronices nye blode thys noble queene bothe twayne borne one lynage wonder gracious sene well fauoured fetures visage whyle tender age one cassander macedone kyng compassed deth subtel false workyng purpose bryng aboute sent hym false collusion puttyng glaucus playnlye doute yf came lyke hys entencion wolde worke hys destruction gather people bothe nye farre glaucus gyn mortall warre kyng glaucus toke herof hede hauyng pyrrus great affection receyued verely dede sonne adoption purposyng whole entencion make pyrrus plainly may heyre raigne day pyrrus alway vp growyng encrees full amiable bothe face people pyrothes knowyng stode glaucus grace chaunged harte cast thē short space restore one courage sayd pyrrus heritage thus assent crowned kyng yonge freshe lusty semely ther withal wonder well thewed vp growyng like lynage courage wext royall whiche cause especiall beloued offrendes enemyes greatly doubt name gan sprede farre grece eche countrey lande tarent gan tyme warre agayne romaynes ye may se requiryng pyrrus woulde fauourable helpyng entent party tarent request condiscende purpose cast fayle fortune woulde grace sende myghty hande marciall apparayle lorde conquere itayle vncle whilom doubtles kyng alexander called epirothes first began conquest itayle toward heraclye mighty great citie brennus great battaile consull rome lorde countrye encrease felicitie remembred story vpon romayns gate victory olyphantes castels backe caused pyrrus yong manly knyght wisdome wherin lack put enemy day flyght happened forthright sicilian bochas beareth recorde amonge selues fall discorde atwene great diuision eche contrary workyng reforme false discention praied pyrrus come king whose request fully assentyng made stronge lyst deferre romayns gyn warre beside castel called esculus within poyl banner gan splay day happy eurous contrarious fortune power gan affray woūded death gan greatly dismay whiche occasion pyrrus anone right lept courser toke flyght sonne called helenus borne daughter kyng agathocles whō ordeyned mine auctor telleth thus crowned great encrees siciliens raygne pee wenyng therby haue auauntage came message tarent whiche stode auenture absence region came might endure againe power rome toun whiche assent discended downe agaynst standyng dispayre saue abydyng vpon repayre pyrrus stode full hard poynt waxt abashed dull corage atwene twayne hangyng disioynte werreyed romayns hated cartage battaile fynall domage within felde called arusius put flyght one fabricius destitute fortune appayred voyde succour barrayne rychesse like man hope dispayred towarde epyre haste gan dresse first story doth expresse ye haue heard rehearced writyng succession whilom lorde kyng whan came epyre citie gan new agaynst antigonus kyng macedoyne full stronge countrie hym werrey desierous conquest story telleth thus within great lettyng helpe fortune crowned kyng seuen monethes raignyng quiete lisymachus maugre might put downe remoued sete yet presūption though right toke gyn newe fyght gayne lacedemonois felly werrey onely would obey whose presumption whan behelde bothe prudence policy woman armed make large felde multitude oppresse party cōmon profite put ieoparty fynally suche ordynaunce pyrrus brought mischaunce sonne slayne called tholome many lost liues pride crueltie gan warre agayne argyues ende mortall striues conclusion last fall slaine wt stone came wall head smit place therof made oblacion antygonus great solace thus lyst fortune quite presumption warres many region lo ende folkes retchles folowed warre list liue pee ¶ xxv chapter ☞ tyrāt aristotimus trecherous working set aside right line crowned kyng epirothes slayne proceadyng folowyng john bochas wil reherce ful playne lāgage aristotim tyrāt y• case cast compassed full great outrage hauyng title right heritage epyrothes trecherous workyng voydyng line crowned kyng liuyng two child story telleth thus borne discent raygne citee eldest called pyrrus seconde named tholome bothe twayne cruelte aristotym falsely set aside made kyng tyrant pryde thus gan occupy lyke tyrant cruell vengeable false rancour melancoly slewe citizyns yt notable exyled story fable onely malice within hart close contrary vnto purpose vnto woman fraudulent sentence made ordayne anone fained pitie gaue lycence frendes frely gone rich euerychone biddyng false treason take way fettred pryson ware set arrest vengeable crueltie child slayne suckyng brest maydens oppressed virginitie cypre citie knyght passyng great age whiche cast purpose auenge outrage knyght mine auctour telleth thus story playnly rede greke tonge called helematus right wise manly word dede thinges twayne put drede execute purpose certayne maugre tho would againe cōmon profite drad dead cause fall age another put drede child lynage quarell rightfull gaue aduauntage vpon gathered newe suche knew y• manly true purpose helde wt circumspect auise theron made full prudent ordinaunce helematus olde hardy right wise afore prouided knyghtly purueyaunce said tyrant brought vnto mischaunce helpe assented vnwarely slain whose deth repēted ¶ xxvi chapter ☞ quene arcinoe aduoutry done demetrius husbande daughter beronices ended sorowe story bochas gan apply turne pen like ye shall write tell frowarde lechery arcynoe pleasaunt loke chere whiche port eke manere dayes like founde craft beauty called venus seconde fayrenes yeuen mariage noble aga cyrenes kyng atwene yonge age daughter recorde wrytyng called beronices kyng endyng testament bad wedded sonne kyng tholome done entencion cease warres y• endured longe atwene egipt made mencion cyrenes bothe realmes stronge mariage yt myght vnderfonge diyng set fynall peace twene ii realmes ēcrece whose death thus matter stode quene arcynoe subtyll workyng agayne matter cruell wode maryed daughter wt lettyng called beronices agaynst biddyng father called aga heretofore rehearsed caas maried one demetrius brother bochas rehearsynge vnto mighty great antygonus beyng grece macedoyne kyng infortunate weddyng story suyng ye shall se false workyng quene arcynoe conclude shortly mattere whan thys quene double arcynoe sawe demetrius vysage loke coloure langage beautie manly port liberalitie enamored fleshly pleasaunce lyke desyre haue acquayntaūce nature lecherous frowarde inclination brought demetrius assented suggestion accomplish lyke opinion desyres fleashly appetite thus accorde folowed delite lefte wyfe called beronices quenes doughter agayne ryght place secret prees lay together almost euery nyght takyng hede god wyght tyll fortune case befall hated hys knyghtes dispyte arcynoe dede horrible whan dede espy hys wyfe beronices eke whan dyd se holy maner theyr ribaudry heart caught great melancoly ordayned knightes stele armed bryght aduoutry take nyght lying bedde slept toke kepe false lustes whiche vsed fel vp whyle dyd slepe dede open myght nat excused worlde thus accused swordes draw y• knyghtes thilke night slee thē purposed anone right beronices cryeth john bochas badde spare arcynoe grounde gynnyng horrible caas sayth mercy cruelte saue suche one false pite sayth myne auctour thyng cōtrarious preserue slee demetrius beronices small thy discretion saue quene y• hath treason founde first demetrius gaue occasion shuld haue first woūde take bothe cheynes bounde thys false arcynoe example shuld haue punished whyle taken thus close sayd arcynoe made delay fro bedde anone vp rose without clothes naked lay ran swordes theyr gret affray went atwene dyd busy payne beare stroke armes twayne saue demetrius naked stode voyde drede dyd busy cure whyte body bespreynt blode gan cry euery creature ala quod let alone endure deth selfe ye dispitous saue lyfe slee demetrius erthe anone fyll adowne stande vpryght might nat sustene deed pale wan many pitous sowne dethe demetrius gan wofullye bemene embrasyng woūdes grene armes albe laye deed kyssed mouth blew nothyng reed sorow cōplaynt thus made ende write thys arcynoe beronices agayne wyl wēde bochas sayeth story ye maye se wedded worthy tholome like father first entent y• dyed made testament ☞ thus endeth fourth boke hereafter foloweth fyfte bochas vvryteth agaynste delyte beaute semelynesse callyng purpose howe man borne tuscan whiche excelled beaute fayrnesse hys beaute nat geue occasion synne disfigured hys visage body wyth manye great wounde spotte first chapter bochas scorneth hath disdayne thre maner folke dyd se worlde whiche certayne set theyr ioy felicite excell fayrenesse beaute nat withstandyng ye well tell hath vndone full many worthy man recorde taketh demetrius tyme fayrest certeyne caused hym contrarious al vertue story ye haue seyne tho folke bochas hath disdeyne busy ben conquere recure beaute craft cometh nat nature thirde yt grutcheth agayne kynde lacke stature semelynesse thre ben ignoraunt blynde agayne reason corages dresse yet aboue beaute vertue maystresse lytle worthe fayrnesse certeyne person vertue seyne vnto purpose telleth man excelled fayrenesse called spurnia borne tuscan folke ioye great gladnesse beholde hym semelynesse whose beaute brought woman dotage cast loke hys vysage wyues maydens dwellyng countre presed fast hym beholde theccasion hys great beaute nat onelye yonge olde wyth loues axcesse nowe hote nowe colde thus hys beaute many creature founde effecte perylous lure husbandes olde caught fantasy maner suspection styred serpent false jelosye towarde spurnia made mencion auoyde cruell occasion people suche malyce thought ye shall howe wysely wrought put awaye false dylectacion occasion cupides rage prudence discretion many wounde diffaced hys vysage dempt great domage thenchesen excellent beaute creature hyndred shoulde philosopher poetes wyse gaue vnto hym great commendation coude notably deuyse fynde waye within hys reason set asyde occasion suche vnlefull fleshlye fantasye might styre woman vnto lecherye knewe afore saw experience beaute shall waste away fade lyke somer flour theyr moste excellence growe hylles belowe shade rose lyllye whan glade vpon theyr stalkes theyr prefe dayly seyne beten downe stormye reyne semblably euery creature lowe degre hye estate beauty abideth nat lenger doth endure youthes ceson wt age ful checkmate thinketh hereon holde hym fortunate afore reason caste worldly beauty erth mai alway laste ¶ lenuoye ye worldlye folke reioyse beaute se eyen aduertence howe smale sodayne infirmite deth age lyst theyr presence disdayne al freshnes vnware violence agayne whose might grace processe yeres beaute doth deface though demetrius fayre vpon se ye haue herde rehearsed sentence gayne law ryght loued arcynoe thoccasion founde false insolence bycause reason made resistence nat aduertyng euery hour space processe yeres beaute doth difface full horrible iniquite tofore god hatefull offence false lust sensualite lost bridell inwarde prouidence sharpe mortal sworde made ye recompence drowned teres whan dyd hi embrace blody woundes disfigured hys face noble prynces let thys story clere myrrour magnificence therein considred false fragilite worldly fayrnes apparence transitory prudence gouerne passage vicious lust enchace processe yeres beaute dothe difface ii chapter ¶ howe two brother seleuchus autiochus eche desyrous excell fyll discorde ended mischefe man story rede mischefe debate debate atwene kinrede twene blode blod gayne kide infortunate namely person whiche ben hye estate fyll one story beareth recorde atwene two brother discorde one seleuchus antiochus story hereafter shall deuy se eche desyrous excell worldly worshyp wonderly wyse blent worldly couetyse clymbe vp hye estate whiche caused debate mighty kinges bochas maketh • ciō one wombe sothlye borne vnder cursed fell constellacion frowarde sede may grow good corne couetyse bothe lorne distroyed mortall werre atwene asie nye ferre verye contagyous rede batayles discencions false promyses antiochus disceytes conspirations bretherne byrth condicions contrarious wayes euer dyd wende frowardly began made ende mother called leodices asya seleuchus reignyng euer werre coude nat lyue pee surry antiochus kyng among robber made theyr ending euer fought wronge ryght neuer bode toke flyght though seleuchus gynnyng shynyng glory hye prowesse asya lorde kyng great diffame derked noblesse bycause great vnkyndnesse ful falsely slewe without iudgement hys yonger brother innocent byddyng leodices mother hatefull cruelte falsely murdre quene beronices wife kyng called tholome reygnyng egipt stode power fayled hys pray bycause ware fled away yet afterwarde olde hate enuy seleuchus full false treason murdred beronices conspiracy sonne also made mencion sclaundre arose many region reported vnto hys diffame wherthrough lost worship name thys murder auenged horrible great abusion kyng egypt sayde tholome gan make strong came wt people doun great discention al land story saith certayne constrained returne home agayne seleuchus made stronge armee gathered shyppes stuffed wt vytayle towarde asye taken hath see suche tempest gan hys people assayle hertes power gan fayle wt thundring lightning vēgeably distrained take land nede constrained people asye seyng thys mischefe seleuchus great compassion succour set prefe hym receyued region though stode made mencion aforetyme hys cruell dede person full great hatrede fonde fortune fauourable nat considryng mutabilite cast rancour vengeable gyn werre agayne tholome men outrayed constrayned fle knewe refute succour none great mischefe sent hys brother meane hys brother called antiochus behestyng crowne hym kyng asye hys story telleth thus toke truse thys whyle subtyll false workyng tholome ten yere enduryng brother came powere falsed promise double hert chere thus newe fyll debate eche gan myghtely werray false couetise encreace theyr estate caused nouther lyst obay met felde say fought hāde hande hostes two seleuchus fled wente thus false werre hatred fraternall agayne nature set discorde eche busy especiall story remembreth recorde neuer lyfe one accorde whā seleuchus put thus flight people surry gan deme anonryght day outher take dede gallougreis people great poste couetyse gan hast great spede entre asye spoyle countre antiochus eke enmyte fayne hys fauacion pay full great raunsom heart yeue onely pyllage takyng hym golde great quantite seyng robbyng outrage drew pyllours one al asye robbed eche coūtre seleuchus gan purchace nat durst abide place antiochus drewe tholome voyde saueconduyte assuraunce though yt atwene great enmyte season made remembraunce haue founde succour gret greuaūce nought conclusion tholome hym toke cast derke prison constrayned necessite knowyng meane make raunson woman lyued pouerte holpe derke prison lo fortune false condicion coude make kyng without pere woman stande daungere proude folke maye myrour se prynce thus sodaynly brought lowe shone ryches lyke emperour disdayne lyst man knowe cast nowe ouerthrowe hath cause plain wepe mourne knowyng frende succour turne aferde holde hys passage hye wayes come syght fyll amonge theues great outrage mercylesse slew hym anone ryght brother great myght called seleuchus wonder fil frō courser brake necke asōder iii chapter ¶ howe noble queene laodomya temple slayne vengeaunce take vpon hym slewe syxe estate prynces pryncesses shewed bochas pitouslye playnyng hym declarynge theyr mortall heuynesses first came hym wepyng noble queene sorow rehersyng called laodomya heuy chere complayned mischefe suster dere called nereis yonge tender age wedded cycile kyng daye great mariage fyll stryfe great meuyng amonge common maner rysyng quene therof syght dianes temple anone toke flyght people party rose againe y• kyng whiche rumore sodayne stryfe laodomya full fearfully quakyng ran temple saue lyfe supposyng ymaginatyfe temple chaste reuerence men woulde spare violence one strife began first grounde great motion called milo false cecylian voyde reuerence deuocion ran temple feirser lyon queene auter dyd enbrace sharpe sworde slew place sacrilege punished vēgeaunce god wrothe gret offēce diana full great displeasaunce made courte sodayne pestylence mylo vnware violence tourned bestiall made wode affray slewe hym selfe suyng twelft daye iiii chapter ☞ cleomenes king macedone slayne wife child vengeaūce taken mylo came cleomenes macedoyne king bochas gan shew deadly wo great iniuries enemy assaylyng hye emprises kyngdome defendyng alderlast citee sonne slayne tholome first countrey story doth deuise againe enemyes great battayle people defendyng fraunchyse knightly prowesse yt list fayle ryght fyght plate mayle liege echone beyng one assente lyue dye entent men woman child yonge age one hart mattere whiche made stronge gate auaūtage vndeuided stode echone yfere one corage one one chere greatly assured opinion among diuision cōmon profite prefarre treasure lyfe good fredome aye ready warre afrayed spende owne bloude fynallye together stode one thought eche gan redy make lyue dye brother sake enemy borne region name antigonus wedded boke maketh mencion olde quene kyng demetrius sonne story telleth thus called phylyp fro youth hys kepyng therby pretendyng tytle kyng lacedemonoys claymed agayne ryght raigne take possession lyke tiraunt vsurpyng great myght crowned region false presumption put yset farre though thē helde mortal warre cleomenes rightfull kyng felde armed euery day hardy lyon drede hym nothyng gayne enemyes stode • bay fro felde made flye away dredefull sworde grounde kene abyde hym myght nat sustene daye descendyng cite helde felde full stronge battayle lytle people made fone fle retournyng home ful wery trauayle thought heart auayle stynt werre hangyng certayne tyll yt people refreshed agayne set ordinaunce countre gayne enemyes make resistence egypt goth tholome wife child wtdrawing hys presēce receyued great beneuolence lyke estate care drede abode tyl thotome dede sonne kyng tholome whiche raygned succession false enuy vengeable cruelte slew cleomenes region wife child voyde compassion ala straunge cruel thyng within kyngdome murder kyng v chapter ☞ kynge nero cornely hanyball whose deathe thus wrought violence story remembreth procedyng forth came nero shewed hys presence siracuse myghty stronge kyng tofore bothas full pitously playnyng besechynge hym full pitous chere mischefe wryte manere whiche nero wylfull furious lyst presume false rebellion debate appius claudius maligne agayne rome toun anone presumptioun constrayned pride lyke cowarde flye nat abyde hym myne auctour writeth boke dothe procede came cornely rome consulere hym selfe complaynyng y• great falshede whiche vnto hym accomplished dede assuraunce broke haniball cartage chefe admirall thys cornely haniball sworne affricans maner flatery succour hym haue tolde toforne romains holde vp party whan met boke doth specify cornely take fettred prison mischefe dyed gayned raunson haniball entred entent knightes great cite cicile called agrigent julius silua olde enmyte layde siege great meyne constrayned sayde hanyball hungre leape ouer wall posterne toke hym fliyght gathered shyppes toke large see julius silua lyke manly knyght faught made hym flee vpon water anone knyghtes stoned dethe constrayned yelded vp brethe vi chapter ❧ duke zantipas cast see hanyball stayne thus putte flyght made mencion tofore bochas came worthy zantipus famous duke full notable renoun lorde stronge region lacedemoyne come ferre cartage helpe werre whose prowesse encreace glory proude romayns put flyght cartaginences victory take wyse manly knyght marcus regulus brought anonryght cartage led prysonere zantipus bochas writeth thys noble duke hye prowesse done cartage shewed toun hys notable kyndnesse vnkyndly quit hym guerdon saylyng home towarde region shyp stuffed countre false enuy cast see noblesse famous chiualry whan knighthod sate hiest flour cartage hatred enuy maligned agayne hym chefe sun socours taclipsed lyght theragayn auctours haue writyng perpetually set name regestred house fame vii chapter ☞ marcus regulus hys freewyll dyed common wele tell reherse grounde werres fyrst cause suche mortall outrage whether began influence sterres twene man man wylfull rage atwene romayns folkes cartage great hyndryng consydred manere party bochas doth v lere italiens therwith greued oft namely whan fortune theyr aduersary affricans felt full vnsoft whan lyst contrary whose course custome stoūdmeale doth vary experience hath proued wele ye ouerwhelmynge vntrusty whele worthy famous afore remembred vpon eche party fortune day made victorious morow dyd theyr myght defye vp nowe downe stode ieoperdy lyke lyst fauour nye ferre losse wining called fortune werre well wylled happy eurous also full straunge acquayntaūce reken amonge marcus regulus romayne partye prynce great substaunce preferred put remembraunce one worthy true founde dede knyghtly policy rede common profit aye aduertence twene loue hate standyng vpryght nouther syde declyned balaunce dome fauour wyght tyll eye hys inwarde syght conceyued trouth stode gaue sentence theron abode world ther better knight better named borne good linage semely person delyuer great might hardy lyon right manly visage wal romains sharpe yarde cartage demure nat hasty seynge thyng toforne papinia fynde borne great discretion worthye knyght thys marcus regulus chosen consul toun felow called manlius armes manly wyse vertuous whiche theyr notable hye constaunce romayne werres gouernaunce theyr shyppes stuffed made great armye full prudently knightly apparayle prince twayne taken haue see first ciciliens great batayle discomfited arriuayle outrayed amylchar story fable affrike capitayne constable wan countre castels many one toke prisoner stuffe great rychesse party rome sent anone manlius story beareth witnesse romayns worthynesse assent wyse prolonged haue terme hys offy • e knyghtly noblesse none hym lyke nouther armes politike ordinaunce conquest cartage affrike hym gaue whole gouernaunce brought city townes obeysaunce romayns thys noble worthy knyght wher euer rode maugre foe myght faythfull laborous dilygence gate countreys cartage toun tyll tidynges came vnto hys presence besyde ryuer great dragon horrible made mencion al y• countre stode doute man durst neygh hym ferre aboute hundred fote twayne hys length lyke writeth tytus liuius none hardy man suche strength durste approche venomous manhode marcus regulus slayne monstrous serpent maruayle skinne rome sent thus conquest whyle dyd payne get castels myghty stronge town agayne hym sent asdruballes twayne called affrike hardy champion al power region story maketh rehersayle discomfited battayle amylchar came speare shelde defence affrike cartage also distroyed felde host maugre visage thus marcus hadde alwaye vauntage making y• romains knyght vertuous prowesse victorious hys tender age lyst labour tyll owne lande exercise vertuous auauntage hold plough lede hande auoyding slouth ye shall vnderstande affrike wt many noble knight stele mayle rydeth armed bryght thus noble marke euer ado armes souerayne singulere temple rome appollo kept crowne fresh laurere forged golde fret ful stone clere temple ioue reserued robe victory hath deserued goddes consider well olde custome ryghtes mayntene thyng beyng perpetuell fadeth neuer nature thus mene ysacred freshe laurere grene cause twayne graūted conquerours marcial actes cōquest made victours noblesse tre diuine sheweth odour wisdome excellence grenesse whiche neuer dothe declyne longe abydyng vertuous prudence rounde crowne betokeneth prouidence signe onely knyghtly gouernaunce taketh guerdon longe continuaunce strength graūted nat crowne proude ginninge stablysheth nat theyr perseuerāce list muse roun graunteth putteth memory glory triumphe palme theyr victory crowne laurer story tolde jupiter ryche crowne golde discerne gyftes thre appertayneth vnto chyualry manly prowesse wisdome anone let se strength hardynesse conquest policy roman caught fantasy merites notable glorious magnifie marcus regulus marcus durynge lusty yeres prince y• werres gayn affrike cartage toke yonge knightes prisoneres sent rome common auaūtage ala whan fall age gery goddesse among chaunges agayne thys prince fauoure dyd appall withstand prowesse knyght helpe affrike made mencion came zantipus spake right mighty duke whiche sent doun fro lacedemone renoun whan power marchus gan fayle meyny slayne toke hym battayle cartage sent hym prysonere lay stronge chaynes bounde lo fortune chaunge gan chere falsest truste whan iocounde first fauourable frowarde founde maner double face folke yt syt hyest chaūge thē fro place whylom subiection almost affrike cartage cite lyeth bounde fettred pryson whylom glory aduersite cast misery hye prosperite fortune made loketh wele brotyll glasse rather stele thys manly knight albe y• laye chayned whiche brought rome hye encrees affrike cartage wer cōstrained vnto romains pursue pee accomplishe matter doutles vnder assuraunce made cartage toun toke marcus anone prison bound othe sayne chaunged affrike prisoneres abyde come agayne yong knightes fresh lusty cheres marcus feble olde yeres affricans rome sent bothe assured accomplishe entent romains suche deynte noble marke manhode prudence furtheryng theyr commonte person wisdom reuerence called y• toun wall theyr defence cheerte knighthode yt age thā prisoner affrike cartage romayns greatly reioysed commyng specially delyueraunce one hert true meanyng said welcome home ioye suffisaūce welcome myrrour knightly gouernaūce voyce langage repayre fro affrike cartage thus receyued lyke estate conueyed cite nobly presented vnto senate began tale anone ye shall se cheerte common profite deliueraunce said vnto wordes substaunce syrs auyce echone present first estate next commonte prince consul affrike sent ye know seuen yere haue chastyse rebelles countre fauour helpe god myght citie haue quit lyke knyght matter nedeth nat tary ye knowe selfe wexen olde fortune right contrary whereby youre enemy affrike made bolde desire solde erchaunge short conclusion prisoner haue toun fauour goddes hye heauen felowes wyse mediacion countreys prouynces syxe seuen haue affrike made subiect toun maugre myght rebellion constrayned lyke ye desyre obay vnto empyre make empyre glorious encrease boundes cite whylom grace victorious vēquished enemy wher dyd thēse nowe fortune mutabilite made vnhappy desolate chere somtime prynce nowe prysonere afore power fortune fraūchised thrall fettred pryson myne olde triūphes newly disgysed victory oppressed borne doun considred transmutacion youth passed myne vnweldy age lytle wonder though dull corage yet ther thing yt draweth lēgth life whiche hert hath set great gladnesse encreace howe mortall stryfe labour knightly busynesse marciall prynces famous worthynesse wt knightes souerayn renoun sought affrike pryson whose absence febled cartage coūtre pouerished brought disencreace seynge yt dull fall age gayne affricans put selfe preace causyng enemy pursue peace exchaunge y• may small auayle affrike knightes expert batayle stande hope theyr delyueraunce exchaunge sent pryson entent encrease theyr puysaunce new gynne werre vpon toun take good hede discretion payse prudence thing yt haue tolde theyr youth considred howe olde consumed weared werres fortune contrary febled beare armour lusty freshe name spred farre felde able endure vnweldy lyke creature semely draw home graue armed cite saue effecte haue cheerte faythe without variaunce vnto profyte commonte matter delyueraunce two thinges paysed wayed balaūce affrike knyghtes expert worthynesse constraynt age feblenesse conclude vpon thys matere myght neuer semeth vnto knyghthode deserue laurere triumphe famous cite better dye encreace commonte thus auysed heart hole corage yelde vp spirite vnweldy age purpose stedfast wall one wyll one perseueraunce selfe commendyng goddes immortal chase dye polytike constaunce preferre notable purueyaunce common profite motyfe set asyde good treasour lyfe right wel chered stable visage perfite loue vnto toun repayred agayne vnto cartage article kept condicion departyng affrike region say texplete lust certayne prisoner resorte agayne departyng romayne senatours gan wexe pale compassion se pauis theyr olde soccours prisoner departe toun princess ladyes fyll sowne doun child wept cryed pite farwel upholder chefe wall cite euer founde trewer knyght whiche owne faythful mocion free power might haue stande large hys election kepe promyse repayred prison▪ shall write noblesse shewe fynde one lyke hym rede fewe came agayn message knowyng thentent worthy knyght furiously people cartage presence euery maner wyght ordayned haue tourment anonryght first lyddes eyen twayne cut encreace payne nat slepe pryson euer watche payne intollerable constraynt hys passion crye complayne sighes lamētable toke playne table fret full nayles sharpe whet grounde thervpon naked hym bounde another table layde hym aloft nayled also atwene twayne couched hym bed ful vnsoft moste importable hidous ye payne blod ran euery senow vayne turment ala cruell dethe worthy marcus tyl yelde vp y• brethe redde bokes euer dyd se prince stedfast stable whylom rome cite theyr conquest longe perdurable vertue founde corage vnstauncheable reken vp euer toun marcus make comparison reken camillus papyrius scipions notable worthy many great victory reken vp worthy champion cursius fabricius famous memory regulus eclipseth theyr glory surmounteth reporte renoun sayde comparison reken vp y• four whylom rych • first called lucius twayne condicion lyche scaurus gayus delius forget nat great emilius theyr great possession make marcus comparison remembre crassus whome tolde assiriens staunche couetyse powred throte strāgled wt golde dyed story dothe deuyse though foure wende haue wyse greatlye commended false opinion marcus make comparison touchyng marke let men beholde se left treasour fredome rychesse profite commonte forsoke hys frēdes bochas bereth witnesse towne dyed distresse kepe hys fayth resorted pryson make none hym comparison myne auctour putteth remembraūce golde stone pierre rychesse habundaunce stode dignite worldly prosperite set asyde conclude reason twene marcus comparison prynces may lyue theyr entente theyr power frowardly vice gold purpure wear riche garmentes theyr lustes theyr delyces graunt theyr minister great offyces twene pompe vayne ambicion atwene marke make comparison thynges remembred certeyne wel considred yput mynde rome fewe suche seyne common profit found kynde tyll may suche another fynde thys boke turnynge vp doun wyll hym make comparison ¶ lenuoye thys tragedye take hede entermedled wyth wo gladnesse joye worshyp singuler manhede marke excellent noblesse rede fall great heuynesse whiche chase dye stode fre onely profite commonte kepe hys othe playnely rede made cartage beyng distresse thys noble prynce constrayned nede frewyll myne auctour doth expresse fro rome agayne thyther gan hym dresse suffer tourment hys fre volunte onely profyt commonte thys story shoulde crowned dede golden letter beare wytnesse howe sayde marke hauynge death drede set rome fro werre sykernesse whose hie renome soue rayn prowesse may neuer eclypse none antiquite chase dye forther commonte deserued haue mede triumphe marciall worthynesse jupiter weare purple wede fret full stone heuēly brightnesse laureat crowne cōseruyng hys grenesse graunted victours lyst consider se chase dye commonte noble prince whiche gouerne lede wordly people take hede hynesse story trew crede takyng example busynesse aye support mayntayn ryght wysnesse let marcus myrrour whiche chase dye forther commonte viii chapter ¶ howe tholome kynge egypte called philopater slewe father mother hys wyfe lecherye spent hys lyfe mischeuouslye ended next order bochas complaynyng vicious lyfe came tholome called philopater egypt kyng tender age horrible cruelte slewe father mother suster ye maye se crowned made mencion reygne alone region disposed vnto euery vyce frowarde vertue doctryne slewe hys wyfe called erudice left hys spouse toke concubyne wasted hys lyfe gan hym selfe enclyne ryote surfet outrage wyse spent hys yonge age thus disclaundred hys royall maieste lecherous lustes watched nyght bed tyll noone agayne honeste false excesse shope hym anonryght arose drynke agayne myght gorge vpon gorge afforce hys lechery longe daye spent glotony wexe wery processe write tyraunt vicious wode contagious processe endite example doth harme goode vengeaunce thus stoode sodayne mischefe rede dyd fyne enbraced armes hys concubyne agathoclia playnly name sonne called agathocles vicious bothe sclaundred diffame noysed report recheles bothe one take sodayne prees alies one fet iust dome led gybet ix chapter ¶ brythomarus viridomarus duke fraunce great batayls romayns slayne nexte philopater called tholome ther came order worthy duke frau • ce brythomarus coūtre rode grece great puysaunce first gan make hys ordinaunce agayne romayns albe ferre proudly gynne werre rome theyr confusion theyr bys • oppes priestes gan deuise vse cursed false supersticion vnto goddes full cruell wyse offer vp men newe sacrifice burye thē quike bochas thus rede false hope better spede fraūce grece toke ten nombre halfe men womē togider twayn twaine false murder dyd thē encombre buried thē quike dethe sodayne sacrifice goddes gan disdayne romayns wexte contrarious theyr false ryghtes supersticious recorde olde croniculers yere fyue hundred fro foundacion one twenty tho beyng consulers thre numbre made mencion whiche gouerned ruled toun first called lucius emilius seconde catullus gaius actilius regulus thyrde consulere al senate ordayned thre haue tolde selfe yere gouerne rule cyte preserue aduersite agayne two people gaule lumber • werred malyce enuy whiche werre ye romayns stode doute senatours citisayns agaynste came great route lumbardes halfe moūtay • joyned together many fell forayns stode departed made remēbraūce fro rome theyr obeysaunce people rude bestiall vnstable together assembled wode furious multitude innumerable vengeable heart corage dispitous voyde reason sodaynly furious saythe bochas gone soudiers bare gisarmes euerychone gisarmes gisarmes called towarde rome hastyng day day great labour fotemen sore appalled aye theyr trust muintude laye whose commyng rome stode afray specially consulers thre sent fight cite four score thousand write croniclere myghty stronge stande defence felowshyp eche consulere gisarmes numbre sentence thre hundred thousande sturdy violence goyng fote fynde eyght thousande ouer yt felde sprad reken nat rode horsbacke sixe thirty thousand wer numbre sixe hundred ouer purposed wracke finally romayns encombre shadow gaue great vmbre soyle whiche tofore grene vnneth sunne shene captaine brythomarus manly man ful worthy knyght went viridomarus another captayne stele armed bright twene romaynes long last fight party rome citye slayne consull one thre whose deth fortune anonright partie rome toun eight hundred thousand toke flight thus began fame renoun brithomarus made mencion whiche victory hert made fayne partie thre thousand slayne romayns resorted ageyne stronge battayle felde manly seyne proudly enemyes dyd assayle myne auctour maketh rehersayle gisarmes longe night fourty thousande slayne fight thyrde tyme wt helpe fraunce joyned lumbardes folk gaule also fought agayne ordinaunce besyde ryuer called po bothe battayles together ado fynd consulers twaine two romaine sheltrōs knightly dyd ordain manlius torquat called one flaminius flaccus wyth yfere romains forth togider thei gon toward ryuer full manly chere whyche battayle story doeth v lere nyne fourty thousande slayne daye enemy none ne went awaye brithomarus taken prisonere token triumphe brought rome toun capitoyle wyth full pale chere bounde chaynes gayned raūson thus hath fortune appalled hie renoun token discomfiture offred goddes cote armure thus lachesis lyues threde gan draw tyll attropos brake ful great paine viridomarus felawe slayne felde romains certaine worthy prince twayne ende mortal fall feest accomplished called funerall tyme mortall wertes atwene duke rome toun many token shewed sterres meruaylous lyghtnīges fro heauē doun many vncouth constellacion sondry cometes dyd welken appere seeth storyes may trouth lere water pytene renneth itayle whiche countre famous flode houre tyme battayle sayeth storye turned bloud fyres eyre moost furious woode mighty • owrs wt flame brēt thre mones apperynge orient people feare fled lowe caues drede wext pale deedly chere thre dayes thre erthe quaues durynge werres yere greate appollo fyll downe pyllere marbyl whyte large great strength syxty cubytes accoūte length tyme story sayeth nay rome consul wyth great puissaunce called claudius slewe vpon day thyrty thousande broughte mischaunce soudiers came fraunce ther slayne wt many captain lorn • viridomarus whome spake forne greate shame confusion remembred scripture romains made great oblacion vp jupiter cote armure token discomfiture within temple golde beaten clere dispite hynge vp banere ¶ x chapter ¶ howe siphax kynge numedy take dyed prison bothas breuelye remembraunce writeth werres debate battayls tyme itayle fraūce spayne chāpayne marcial apparails among rehersayles telleth affrike great discencion atwene hanyball worthy scipion toucheth name abydeth long vpon story byde rehersyng werres stronge striues doth compile downe discēdyng directeth forth hys stile reherce tell wrytynge fal siphax numedy kyng sayd siphax battailes twayne one king galba might eke whych dyd payne mete massinissa anonright kinges put flyght messulie fynde wrytynge howe massinissa gouernour kynge sayd siphax chiualry made massinissa flye region constrayned hym lyue robbry walke forestes beestes vp doun diffaute made mencion saue life found better refute fedde selfe rote frute realme massinissa enchased constrained •• e fro countre fro minde folke name raced man wist shulde liegeman folke cytie al affrike knewe better reed persone dempt deed thus kyng siphax encrece gan glory force two kinges hath outraied vpon wonne victory put flight people affrayed rome cartage dismaied eche dyd busye laboure werres make hym gouernour vnto siphax rome town written memoryal numedy sent scipion matter especial cartage sente hastrubal castell siphax lay twayne arriued one day playne writinge haue conceiued story remembreth sentence cōmyng receyued kinge siphax greate reuerence notable manly diligence wrytten good recorde made capitaines hertly acorde togither lay nyght siphax great surete promyse made true knyght nouther disceyued founde great duplicite followyng take hede lyke story shall deuyse dede fraude falsenes mortall compassed beforne thus befall sleight hastruball affricans nye double vnder suger hyde well gall hastrubal false decepcion vnder fayre chere deceyued scipion brought siphax false subtilte sleight painted fayre langage shoulde alied full assent haue mariage sophonisba maiden cartage doughter yong fayre withal sayeth bochas hastruball whiche thynge crafte brought accōpished verily dede thys meane plainly doute first began rancour hatrede simulacion fayned falshede atwene siphax hastruball ala scipion desceiued caas done mariage siphax ful enemye scipion hastruball rode cartage gan werray againe rome toun made mencion kynge massmissa wildernes toward scipion al hast gan dresse people gan make stronge helpe scipion belgius went againe siphax abode longe herte againe enuious day story telleth thus wyth affricans folke cartage siphax romains met vysage massinissa people woode vpon siphax auenged battayls came stode maugre cruelte manhode space none fle brought home throughe theyr hye renoune y• hāds worthy scipion siphax take thus aware vnder baner maugre al myght rome ledde afore chare scipion noble worthy knight wan triūphe graūted hym right sophonisba afore syphax wyfe wed massinyssa thēde thys stryfe lo howe fortune chaunge tydes one daye fauourable marke capitayns great gydes wende haue founde whele stable aye frowarde chaūgeable frendly daye morowe discorde trewe siphax beare recorde siphax sente toune chaynes bounde without taryinge tyburny lay fettred prison dyed mischefe made endynge bycause kyng romayns made marcial pyte buried within citye ☞ xi chapter ❧ howe nabyn hauynge tytle ticannye toke hym kyng macedoyne slayne nexte came nabyn ful pytously wepynge tofore jhon bochas whyche tirannye macedoyne toke hym kynge hauynge tytle saue tytle robbery onely force hym selfe magnify stronge hande toke ful possession crowned thylke region macedoyne olde writynges whylome ful great reuerence bycause onely floured two thynges knighthode souerayne sapience mar manhode pallas prudēce whyle two gouerna • ce al welfare suffisaunce whyle noblesse thynges twayne say floure hye clergy hye renome mooste famous souerayne marciall prowesse chiualry gouerned land new policy stode kingdome auctours reherce kōne amonge grekes lyke heauenly sonne last eclypsed lyght b • th knighthode philosophy whan couetise gan enter agayne righte vsurpe vpon regaly intrusion false tyranny extorte force made entrynges hauyng title reygne kynges chefe cause short conclusion noblesse grece brought baa macedoyne brought confusion couetyse set caas thereby theyr knighthod translated polycy cronicles ye may se grece rome citye among clere remembraunce suche tyrauntes ordre rehersyng nabyn one gouernaunce macedoyne crowned kyng without title falsly reignynge frowarde contagious cruelte behated rome citye romayns sent mighty consulere tytus flāminius werres gyde macedoyne gan aproch nere towarde argo nabyn dyd abyde entent abate hys pryde nabyn stode hiest estate grece hys liege debate duke yealled philopomenes people dwelled grece lande stryue wt nabyn put hym selfe prees discomfyted fightynge hande hande▪ great mischefe ye shall vnderstande alexamenes knyght countre slewe thys nabyn cronycleye may se xii chapiter ¶ bochas reherseth mortal werres bytwene romayns affricans nabyn bochas dothe procede tel werres mortall striues twene romains affricans dede wherby ful many lost liues caused widowes maiden eke wiues wepe waile dis • oynte stode outher party se losse bloode party rome towne made capitaines diuers officer affrike wt people sent specially two consulers notable armes famous tho yeres marcus mālius borne romain lie called lucius censorine sent tribune ful notable tofore made mencion werres worthy able meane rome proude scipion cite chefest champion entent affricans tanoye specially cartage distroye nye cartage ther citie stronge mightely builded stode vpon see walles thicke rounde square longe chefe diffence called countre saue kepe aduersite forty cubytes crestes marciall lyke fynde height wall fronte raysed werre stone square hye dungeon called birsa fro wounder ferre men myght beholde courtreis enuyron s reade saluacion affricans purpuse dyd ordayne captaines hastrubalies twayne sayd dungion mightyly battailed againe al saute stand endure worthy scipion al y• hath fayled approche bu • cure engyns mighty stronge sure force knight marcial great quantite brake downe wal lucius called sensorine departed marcus manlius counsayle scipion doctrine assent armes vertuous toke waye myne auctour telleth thus wyth hastrubal sothly myght lay day fight consulers assayled citye called ci • ie beate downe wall slewe fourtye cronycle ye maye se affricans vengeaunce full mortall constable called hastruball slayne day doute trusted next aboute whyle manly corage worthy tribune publius scipion force entred cartage sixe dayes made mencion knightes constrayned toun dispaired deedly cheres towne yelded prisoneres mekely requiryng vnto scipion receyue thys mortall rage men woman dwellyng toun cite sin yong olde age myght abyde lyue seruage vnder romains better refute yere yere pay tribute affrike hastruball whych among thē afore crowned kyng left estate power royal yelded hym prisonere humbly knelyng wyfe pitiously weping whan sawe lorde taken ran fyre brent selfe wo sixe twenty thousande fynde led woman captyuyte thirty thousand men came behinde take prisoner great aduersite seuentene dayes brent citye theyr walles none hard stone poudre brent anone done breuely conclude prowesse publyus scipion sold seruage great multitude olde lordes led fettred pryson thys cartage fynall distruccion cōplaints bocas abideth whyle grece turneth agayne hys style ☞ xiii chap ❧ howe kynge perseus romaynes outrayed take lacedemoyne remembrynge kynge called perseus full proude werryrour claymyng tytle vpon hym vsurpyng succede trewe enherytour gret alisaūdre myghty conquerour fully affirmyng agayne certayne day wyll crowned maugre sayth nay name put memory cast persō renewe prowesse kinge alisaundre encrease glory folowe trace knighthode noble fyrst hasty wilfulnes conquest might sprede ferre gan purpose wt romaine haue werre better auysed whan perceyued marcial apparayle romayns whereof agrised wext aferde noblesse assayle aye found victorious battaile afore ben recheles sent ambassatours wt treat pee perceyued presumpcion howe proude surquedous sent consul great power doune name whome sulpicius whych deedly hated sayde perseus rancour agayne wext solayne ambassade hauyng disdayne partie fortify saide consul sulpicius sent another experte chiualry consul also paulus emylius amonge romains notable famous folowyng selfe nyght mone eclypsed fully hir myght clere token made mencion kynge perseus shoulde haue sharpe shoure lordship region shoulde oppressed voide al socour macedon shuld haue fauour agayne romains togider whā met rounde speares swordes sherpe whet▪ day battaile encrease glorye party rome toune knyght caused victory yonge freshe lusty called caton brought enemy confusion macedonoys great might outraied perseus put flyght emplius noble consulere sent capitaine called octauius pursue costes ferre nere proude kyng sayde perseus take rescus sōnes numbre twaine philip alisaundre story certaine myne auctour telleth kinges many thurty numbre first gramaus haue reigned within macedony last perseus numbre yeres bochas wryteth thus nyne hundred remembre space reigning xxiiii yere translated region al yles vnto obeysaunce rome without excepcion great lord pu • saunce abode long vnder gouernaunce perseus discōlate chere durynge lyfe abode prisoner xiiii chapiter ¶ howe people achaia chefe citye corinthe romains distroied thus lordeshyp weared spent macedoyne made menciō two countreyes therto adiacēt one achaia litle region spartonoyse goynge enuiron myghty people great substaunce one confederate one alyaunce cōioyned made al one maner faithful conuencion whan romaine knew thē fone hauinge frendshyp suspeccion cast make disiunction bytwene lādes bread length thig dysceuered weked hys strēgth ordayned cytyes townes yonder wheron romayns gan make decre lordshyppes shuld set sonder whych made people euery great citie whā knewe subtylite ryse one cruel cheres wold haue slaine ye romayn messāgers fynally thys occasyon romayns agayne gan wexe furious toke hardynes deuysion consul called meuius manlye knyghte armes full famous achaya rome sent distroy great auysement achaya theyr negligence frowarde wylful rechelesnes verye pride list make diffence thought self wythout auisenesse power able stronger southnes romains verely dede thus stroyed afore tooke hede stode hope sturdines battayle haue greate pyllage romayns haue great ryches pompe wylful false dotage toke theyr wiues womē yoūg age set vpon hye mountayne māhode myght feld seine whan romains met battayle dispurueyed ordynaunce slayn lyke beastes power gan faile froward pride recheles gouernaunce achaya brought mischaunce woman chyldren sorowe almooste mad lyue seruage rome lad corinthe tyme chefe cytye distroyed romayns brought ruyne whych among cityes bocas ye may se aboue dyd honour shyne al science floured doctrine craftes artificer wyse reken al world ther chefe marchaū dise thus vnwarly noblesse sittynge fortune hygh stage distroied treasour rychesse brought noughte slanghter pyllage walles broke cruel rage brēnyng bochas sayth leuin raught great part vpwarde heuen playne erth walles broke doun people slayne mercilesse yonge olde made great diuysion led seruage thē solde ymages coper syluer golde sodaynely violence togyther molte hote feruence whych metall thus fal golde syluer coper medled one coper corinthe men dyd call al world custome euerychon▪ fame whych metal ferre gone vessel forged corinthoyse called name corinth thus brent nought prince called philyp phylermene bochas hath cōplaynte brought whose face chere well sene wofull constraynt mortall tene whylome bochas doth specify lorde citye called vallaquy marcus actilius toke hym prisonere brought rome lyst hym respite next bochas heuy chere appered knyght called democrite etholys myne auctour doth wryte chefe lorde countre translated vnto rome citye thys duke cast chayned prison escaped one story fynde take agayne throwe derke dungeon soro went hys mynde slewe selfe mischefe agayne kynde lo howe prince proude recheles haue shameful ende liue pee xv chapiter ❧ nowe greate antiochus vsynge ryot vycious lyuynge marcus actilius outrayed dyed sodaynly touchynge storye order folowynge seleuchus great antiochus mother leodices kyng token sygnes merueylous also seleuchus thygh wryten toforne prynt anker y• day whā borne al chyldren succession dyscent borne linage print anker made mencion fourth booke al surplusage token ther tolde plaine lāgage sayde seleuchus came discent sayde antiochus whose herte set hye couetise folow lustes dilectacions specially cast gan deuise wynne grece diuers region people caught occasion fauour conquere countre rebel agayne rome cite multitude great apparaile gate grece castels eke touns longing rome conquered battayle toke vpon hym presumpcions falsly folowe inclynacions hys birthe dyd abyde citie called talcide cause slouth lefte chyualry forsoke mar toke hym cupyde restyng wynter spent lechery watche ryot chase venus gyde sensualitie made reason stande asyde meanes shorte conclusion conueyed dystruction whan y• winter frostes colde passed al stormes kene ryote spent wasted tolde veer came wyth newe grene freshe flora flour quene custome gynneth motles dresse whych season auctours expresse kinges prince marcial apparayle time whan phebus ram doth shyne dispose go battayle exercyse marciall disciplyne downe rome expert y• doctryne dyscended marcus actylius agayne thys vicious proude antiochus noble marke proued armes wele tyme good knight al host armed bryght stele agayne antiochus came felde right vpon morowe whan phebus shone bryght set wardes captaines y• chees vpon hil called thermophyles antiochus vpon syde glotony ryot dyd oppresse dronken bachus wyth hym dyd abyde wt morpheus wyfe slōber chefe goddesse caused thorugh slouthe ydelnesse prouidence court gone causyng y• day slaughter many one whā consul marcus y• worthy knyghte aduersaries proudly gan assaile vnpuruayed toke thē flyght disarayed might auayle thus antiochus fled battayle againe romaynes myght endure therfore hym fyl discomfiture thus rebuked fled ephesie ferre grece dwell chees sent romains great ambassadrye saide marcus treat pee ambassed doutles whan attained marcus presēce refused audience antiochus greatly ashamed cast againe rome hate enmyte rayse power hath newe attamed gather shyppes make great arme gynne werre agayne see hauynge hope vnder cowardedrede better water thā lande spede made hys shyppes stuffed wyth vytayle hys captaynes hath lande forsake whan y• romayns newe gan hi assaile hys shippes brent al hys stuffe take mine auctor cōpēdiously doth make thus see romains werraying outraied storye wytnessyng yet efte agayne hys confusyon vpon lande gan make hym stronge met wyth cornely called scipion wayne carte made y• wer strōg shod wyth yron sharpe sithes set amonge trauers wise great ordinaunce y• brought mischaunce oliphaūtes castels backe daye slaine many worthy knyght vpon host cruel wracke constrayned toke hym flyghte forsoke coūtre fled mennes syght romayns coude delaye eche yere constrayned tribute pay fraude tribute couetyse fained sore pouerte gathered robbours false pursute oppressed marchauntes spoyled coūtre robbed temple hateful cruelte fro jupiter called dodanon toke al relikes story telleth con dyd sacrileg • entred close without reuerence obseruaunce whych temple agayne rose put remembraunce goddes fil great vengean̄ce vpon tyraunt quakyng drede sodenly fyl ground dede ¶ lenuoye tragedy antiochus lyst ordre froward story se first vertue contrarious rebell euer rome cite justly accused vicious thinges thre pride slouth glotony disordinate superfluyte nyght excesse ryot lechery romains victorious twyse land one see hardy malicious euery battayle custome flee ther vice reigne may grace al surfettes lust dyd apply noysed disclaūdred coūtre nyght excesse ryot lechery amonge liege wode dispytous cowarde knowe y• felde pore toppresse wolfe furious disceite foxe subtilte man froward hie low degre deliting falshed flatery ende • sodain deth parde outrage pride lechery noble prince prudence full famous al greatest roial maieste remembre playnly ye vertuous ye shall perseuer longe prosperite contrary causeth aduersite story afore doth specifye antiochus cast dignite great pride riot lecherye ☞ xvi chap jeronimus kig ciracuse slayn scipio affrican yt laboured cō mon wele romains exiled dyed deth thys antiochus ther came price bocas cōplaining called jeronimus cyracuse whylom lorde kyng whych liege nothing trespasing slayne wyth thre susters dere hatred myne auctour wryteth ciracusanes condicion chaūges newe aye vnstable wilful malice voyde al reason kinges vengeable loued haue perdurable euery yere custome trewe gouerne haue prince newe chaūges vncouth striues wyth variaunce condycions frute founde liues story succession wyl passe duer speke scipions first write worthy man called tyme scipio affrican famous knight al nacions conquest shortly conclude brought full many region wysdome multitude obey romayns ingratitude whych fonde rede wrought tel wyll procede remembred worthynes flouring yonge age rome made lady maystresse many lande auauntage specially affrike cartage hys prowesse made mencion brought romayas vnder subiection againeward vnkynde accusacions fonde falsenesse sayd agayne hym put mynde recorde many false wytnesse haue imbezeled rychesse cartage affrike countre whych appertayned rome cyte againeward noble affrican proudly gaue answere accusours neuer wythhelde fro tyme yt began toward selfe parte theyr tresours saue manere conquerours conserue hys worshyp name profit townes fame meane playnly tary neuer accroched treasour nere ferre towarde hym selfe necessary worshyp mayntayne theyr wer yet tyme lode sterre encrease boūdes fully delite al hole set cōmon profyte toke none hede surplusage treasours great rychesse name reserued affrike cartage hys knyghthod hye noblesse malicious expert vnkyndnesse cause breuely compyle hys body fro perpetually exyle cast neuer wythin rome toun daye amonge seyne vnkyndenesse gaue hym occacion absent person hye dysdayne exyle hym selfe neuer come agayne abyde smal vyllage called lynterne whan fal age men mynde hym haue maner indignacion epitaphie set vpon hys graue saide thus rome toun people vnkynde vnkynde agayne reason funeral ash bone dede thy walles thou shalt neuer possede thyne vnkynde frowarde teritory bone shall rest abyde thyne vnkyndnesse put memory remembraunce shal red full wyde letter graue euery syde report onely small scripture whych set vpon sepuiture lo cause brefe dyscripcion set graue memoriall bone rome toun buried lowe vnder thys wall exile holde feast funerall vnkyndnesse droue cyte wrought much cōmonte ¶ xvii chapter ¶ howe scipio asian lorde asye laboured euer cōmon wele murdred ende thys affrican called time worthy scipion came next brother scipio asyan asie dominacion gayne made accusacion al senate vntruly shold certayne tresours towarde hym selfe wt hold whych asie wonne hys conquest many strong battayle accusacion falsly begonne olde enuy causlesse thys fayle whose worthynesse full muche dyd auayle comon profyt two conquerours great ritchesse encreasyng tresours tone affrik ye haue hard tell hys wysdome chinalry asia whych dyd excell hye prowesse bokes specifye flalsly hyndred hatred enuy compassyng one antiochus hym distroy desirous withstāding twayne scipions tyme manifolde battayls brought vnto rome many region obey citie wt marcial apparayls euer great auails brought tresours encreace wt toun yet haue wrought distruccion tone exyle made mencion dyed ala whan olde seconde murdred prison boeth storyes remembred tolde yeue example prince manyfolde laboureth comonte leseth oft thāke scipions ye may se ☞ xviii chapter ¶ duke philopomenes take put prison dranke poison dyed processe two scipions twene two people wylfull recheles began grece newe discencions twene acheoys etholois doutles great duke philopomenes prince y• tyme full great puissaunce messenois holy gouernaunce sayde prince philopomenes leadyng host vpon ful fayre playne rode armed put selfe prees myd people gouernour wardaine folke rule call agayne vpon stede gan fette due ordre wardes set prynce port marcial pursute gan make amonge enemy sodaine fall voyde al rescue vnwarely take al frendes lyke man forsake amonge enemy brought vnto prison made ende drinkynge poyson philopomenes fatal caas gouernance people disolate except captaine called ligorias whych werres wonder fortunate acheoys toke state gouerne people lede hym bochas rede xix chapiter ❧ thyrde scipion nasica y• euer wrought much comonte wine auctoure maketh dygressyon reherseth memorial thyrde worthy scipion called nasica whych especial disposycion verye naturall holde amonge romaynes reporte laugage passinge wisdome corage olde discrecion yonge yeres myracle myne auctour doth expresse whan senatours sente messageres frigia great auysenesse berosynthia famous goddesse whā brought y• dyd gide house temple would abyde saue palays scipion put name remembraunce whych also hie renoun gallogrois brought vttraunce people grece ferre gouernaunce scipion gan werrey maugre malice y• romains obey wherby name put memory ful gret thāke hath rome deserued bycause onely greate victory triūphe reserued last full falsly serued romains olde manere tragedy anone ye shal augmented treasours conquered asia many region caused fone victours appeased graccus false occasion compassed malyce newe discencions atwene people also senate ofhye wysdome hath stynt al debate trustynge y• romains scipiō begiled lost fauoure offended nought vnwarely banished exyled clene forgoten put thought comon profite al hath wrought guerdon lost thus prynces se al done comonte lyke blase whyle lyght whych sheweth clere neuer seyne lyke sonne moment bryght vnwarly shrouded wt shower rayne ryght windy fauour blowynge vaine may resēbled mutabilite comonte people foloweth owne opinion conceytes wonderful wil holdeth brydel discrecions hasty demyng bestiall dull like blynd bayarde brayde pul quite y• guerdon marciall bounte done comonte day price stādeth people grace lyke would name deify aboue sterres jupiter place mar phebus hys name stellify morow ther commeth soden skye shewyng full faynte surete comonte affirme trewly cal thre scipions remembraunce first affrike asie two note • cronicles knightly gouernaūce restlesse labour romaīs tauaūce reken agaynwarde prince three full vngoodly quit comonte ¶ lenuoye tragedy thre scipions worthy knighthode eke notable made many famous region subiecte rome storye fable wher romayns double disceiuable shewed agaynward prince thre thanke lost guerdon couenable hym doth comonte reken vp affrike cityes touns great cartage castels defensable reken asie great possession wyth reuenues innumerable reken tryūphes prise incōparable whych considred ye may myrrour se howe guerdon false flaskysable comonte whilom romayns chāpions senatours set honoure stable auoyde discorde al discencions atwene cōmons state honorable custome aye chaūgeable fortune may surete sheweth whele guerdōs mutable yt done comonte noble prince payse reason worldly thynge erth transmutable faynt vnsure dominacions charter ther none make thē perdurable sorowe departing body corūpable thyng resemblyng y• neuer recorde scipiōs guerdon semblable doue comonte trust neuer opinion ye power eche day remeuable made blynde discrecions considre example resonable eye fortune lyke hasarde retournable wyth sodayne chaunge false felicitie vnto guerdon dayly comparable done comonte xx chapiter ❧ howe duke hanyball many victorious dedes murdred selfe wyth poison next jhon bocas rede affrik cartage therwithal ther came duke yt mooste hatrede agayne romayns especiall famous prince called hanyball whose prowesse well knowe sayd romains brought ful low amonge worthy duke olde cronicles maketh mencion hanybal fate befal hys byrth dysposicion hys naturall constellacion set heuen perpetually enemy rome cyte storye hym doth deuise father duke whylom cartage called amylchar dyd one sacrifyse goddes nyne yere age sworne auowed hert crrage durynge life wythout excepcion euer enemy vnto rome toun thys martes childe thys lusty yong knight cartage stronge myghty wal whych succeded father ryght deth worthy hastruball fyrst made werre ful mortall gayne sagūtinois specifyed cause wyth romayns y• alyed dreme thus sentence shuld conquere battaile maugre al tho stande diffence two myghty coūtreis fyrst spaine itaile discēdig gret apparaile passing famous ryuer iberus rode alwaie victorious affrike many chefetayns rode gaule found resistence pyrene hye mountayns shewe rigour magnyficence ouer alpes sturdy violence wtstandynge passage ful wycke slydinge frostes • owes thicke great party hys people lost constraint fell passage horse oliphantes many besaunt cost foūde great daūgere thē cariage assaut brigantes whan found auauntage bochas put remēbrance felte great losse al hys ordinaunce alpes passed trauayle great wo thys hanyball al chiualry aproched riuer po came towne called cursye standeth vpon cyte pauye consul called scipton gaue hym battayle euyn afore toun consull gneus scipion whych prowes manly hanybal discomfited made mencion tofore pauye ryght foule fal fyrst victory especial beyonde mountayns whan pursued tassayle romayns sempronius another consulere felowe sayde scipion sent • ke fro rome wt full proude chere gayne hanyball cōmyng doun tofore tresbie large myghty towne outrayed fatal auenture neuer fal myght recure two consulers woful fyne sempronius gneus scipion ouer mountayne called appenyne went hanibal great renoun great domage great confusion people passed mountaines distroyed wt colde snowe hydeous rayns lost knightes hys tresour goodes myght tho made defence gret stedes drowned floodes water mighty vyolence fonde time better resistence saue escaped fro sodayne wracke oliphaūte rydyng backe importable greuous payne onely borne vp marcial corage yet lost one eyen twayne kept knighthode one chere one vysage itayle helde alway passage slewe consull called flaminius thus thre battayls victorious thys whyle saythe myne auctoure quintus fabius subtyl disceyuable whiche rome famous dictatour apperceyued token ful notable romayne captaine tho dayes able shewed experience gayne hanyball make resistence yet conceyte subtillye gan serche fynde waye dyd busy paine day day gan fully theron werche outher fraude cōpassed trayne lye wayte secretely ordayne embusshmentes auauntage hanyball stop passage al traynes serued nought hanybal worthy affrican conquest proudly hath wrought lyke prince knightly man thilke tyme werres gan agayne romayns see lande feble power withstād quītus fabius kept alway close lyinge wayte fal hanihal assent eke purpose one varo manly wyse wythal twayne especiall within poyle large great countre fought wyth hanybal canna cytie story maketh rehersayle romayne party worthy werriours forty thousand slayne battaile emilius paulus thurty senatours twenty numbre yt ben pretours thre hundred captaynes estate slayne haniball mortal debate slaughter emilius noble consul romains dispayred hanybal day victorious lodgyng agayne repayred fone outrayed mortally appayred knewe refute agayne manly knyght mischefe toke flyght day yf hanyball folowed proudly towne counsayle one marthaball manly knyght prince hye renowne shoulde haue full possession day rome lyke hys entent suppose fortune lyst nat assent thys processe playnlye rede hanyball wexte proude ryght pompous four victory dempt hym selfe dede aboue glorious corage inly surquedous ala alytle slouth pryde lacke pursute conquest set asyde yet hys conquest knightes y• laye dede consulers olde yonge age senatours processe lyst rede slayne felde mortall rage duke hanyball sent vnto cartage clene golde recorde writynges felde thre bushell full rynges four victory remembred processe lyst se many worthy dismembred bothe affrike rome cite abate gan great prosperite hanybal froward auenture set one backe fortune harde recure flour hys felicite noblesse drewe declination capne went myghty stronge cite soiourne made mencion tyme wynter colde season lust bodily pleasaunce vitayle founde great haboundaunce whiche made knightes slowe y• werre wine woman plenty vitayle full oft sythe cause men erre make feble enemyes tassayle gorge agroteied enbossed entrayle disposeth men rather rest slepe enemyes take kepe whan wynter frostes colde ouergone thylke region hanyball gan purpose holde laye siege vnto rome towne great raynes fyll fro heauen downe great tempest vpon euery syde constraynt myght nat abyde fortifye sayde hanyball agayne enemy ado sent letter vnto hastruball right great haste come hym fortune whele hath tourned hastruball wer lothe fayne salmator venquished slayne whiche mischefe discomfiture hanybal gan dull hys corage complayned sore hys misauenture knewe refute agayne thys mortall rage herde eke say affrike cartage newe hys confusion strongly werryed worthy scipion siphax also numedy kyng agayne romayns gan werre make maugre might fell workyng force scipion ytake wherthrough corage greatly gan aslake cartage chefe region besieged also scipion thus hanyball constrayned nede home repayre rescue cartage also bokes rede tyme fall farre age mischefe great disauauntage agayne scipion full lytle might auayle discomfited batayle cartage constrayned necessite submit vnto rome toun aduersite gneus gernilius fro rome sent doun onely purpose conclusion procure especiall final distruction death hanyball marciall labour olde felicite wext frowarde vnmete holow ymages put hys treasours toke passage lande crete fortune contrarye vnswere made officer kepe hys rychesse temple diane goddesse som trust percell eke drede fynde succour went kyng bithinye helpe hym hys nede called prusias hys commyng sleyghty romayns knowledgyng bithinye downe theyr letter sent hanybal escaped shoulde repent letter redde kyng daye made people besiege dongeon duke haniball trust alone lay destitute knew treason tescape hys enemyes drāke wylfully poysō chase rather escape none handes fall hys fone tofore dethe sayde oryson y• goddes deuoutly downe knelyng woulde false treason take vengeaunce prusias kyng whiche cause hys false workyng destruction dethe finall famous worthy hanyball ¶ lenuoye tragedy frowarde wryte rede forsayde manly hanyball penne quoke herte felt blede beholde wofull pytous fall hym defensable wall cartage myghty strong toun slewe selfe drinkyng poyson thought manhede sle selfe vengeaunce mortal enemy constraynt hym lede chaynes bounde thrall great dispite leuer byde theyr pryson murder selfe drynkyng poyson semeth thys horrible dede resembled fury infernall cruel pluto trowe toke mede voyde reason became bestiall whose terrible feast funerall goddesse proserpina came wt mane doun tyme whan dranke poyson noble prynces consider take hede leauyng surplus hys dedes marcyall knyghtly remembre haue herte hatrede enpoysonyng especiall abhominable god man withall prynce famous renoun shoulde murder selfe drinking poyson xxi chapter ☞ howe prusias kyng bithinye betrayed hanybal woulde haue disherited sonne heyre went beggyng straunge landes folowyng order came bochas bithinye great myghty kyng whiche tyme called prusias greatly sclaundred noysed one thyng false double workyng agayne noblesse estate royall betrayshed hanyball diffaute derked bryghtnesse hys fame knyghtly renoun eclipsed hys passed olde prowesse reporte many region ala euer condition doublenesse falsenesse faynyng shoulde founde namely kyng prusias procede agayne hanyball wrought thys treason sonne called nychomede borne heyre iust succession hys father false collusion purposed hym yonge age put hym hys heritage matter ther grewe vp great stryfe prusias agayne thys nychomede cause hys seconde wyfe yonge sonne bokes thus rede whome purposed preferre dede whyche caste shorte conclusion nychomede destruction tacomplyshe frowarde falsematere full great delyberation kyng prusyas gan shew heuy chere gayne nychomede sekyng occasion depriue hym possession hys dayes subtell false workyng betheny shal nat reygne kyng people seynge thys great iniquite wrought king gayne good conscience lande hye lowe degre nychomede one sentence gaue theyr good wyll theyr beneuolence euery lorde euery great baron stode whole wt region thus iust tytle crowned kyng prusias shame heuynesse straunge countreys lyued beggyng desolate cryed almesse loe ende treason falsnesse left mischefe myne auctour sayth y• pouerte forsoke hys owne name se two thynges take ryght good hede prusias vnware sodain mischaunce disherytyng done nychomede folowyng great vengeaūce story putteth remembraunce treason done odyble mortall agayne foresayde famous hanyball xxii chapter ❧ howe perses macedone kynge enpoisoned brother emilyus outrayed died pryson bespreynt teares pitouslye wepyng bochas sate hys studye alone next came perses macedone kyng mortally gan sygh grone furiously make hys mone whylom great renoun constrayned dye pryson sayd perses nature frowarde yuyll disposed eke hys condicion though byrth bastarde compassed false collusion hys father haue possession myne auctour remembreth writyng macedone crowned kyng father philip story telleth thus sonne whiche yonge age wyse redy called demetrius borne begot trewly mariage perses cast furious outrage hym destroy murdre poyson kyngdome haue possession falsely compassed hys auauntage entent demetrius depriue macedone whiche heritage thervpon letter gan contriue preue traytour alyue wherof kyng philip greatly anoyed perses distroyed demetrius thought domage ment harme hys opinion yet father suspicious corage perses gaue hym false information made slayne drinkyng poyson vpon daye thyng abhominable sittyng meate father table king philip knew trouth dethe great compassion late great routh whiche caused hys owne destruction sorowe dyed presumption perses falsly vsurpyng macedone crowned kyng diuers countreys made alyaunce grece trace gate frendes nere ferre pride wylfull gouernaunce cast romayns holde werre vngrace youth made erre tyll consul sent fro rome toun brought thys perses vnto distruction called emilius thys consulere sent perses haue great batayle seynge doughter heuy chere went hys enemy assayle made vnto vncouth apposayle wepe ye thyng doth agreue departyng takynge meleue father quod ye take good hede whelpe dyd great pleasaunce called perses right dede chefe cause greuaūce father gan chaunge countenaunce token myne encreace glory perses shall haue victory macedone perses mette quit hym lyke manly knyght cōquered lande none might withlet manly put perses flyght trace toke way ryght whiche conquest short processe make two sonnes perses ther take emilius thys victory asketh triumphe hys guerdon remembred hys story perses foloweth chayre throughe rome toun condempned dye pryson whiche dethe dyd well deserue poyson made hys brother sterue thus fortune erly eke late downe whele hye stage proude prynces surquedy abate whan lust seeth moste auauntage frowardly gan tourne vysage sodaynly estate consume aboue office wrongly lyst presume amonges whiche kyng israell agayne precept lawe moyses called ozias byble well tell presumption wylfull recheles sacrifice put hym selfe prees lyke byshop temple arayed passed greatly affrayed loste speche smyt meselty duryng lyfe lo great vengeaūce hys crowne hys regaly impotent vse gouernaunce peryll pride disobeysaunce lyst nat mekely law obey mischefe dyd leper dey xxiii chapter ¶ howe amonyus prynce antioche delytyng pyllage robbry vicious lyuynge fled woman clothyng taken slayne next order complaynyng hys distresse came amonius notable werriour john bochas shewe hys heuynesse antioche prynce gouernour whiche countre whyle possessour custome thys hys trauayle robbe ryche spoyle porayle spared nouther olde yonge age toke fro marchaūtes treasour richesse delytes lecherous outrage lust watche dronkēnesse wyll courte reason maystresse causyng people region ryse agayne hym rebellion contrary good discipline people arose agayne hym day feare habite feminine lyke wretche fled cowardly away take mischefe made delay falsly confessyng hering many man agayne nature woman trouth knowe sclaunder ryfe assent people antiochene rose attones lost hys lyfe wer wode agayne tene thus fortune chaūge alway sene fro better worse well transmue state wyll vertue sue xxiiii chapter ❧ andriscus lowe byrth borne hauyng tytle became kyng macedone taken died pryson bvt one thynge fortune blame chaungeable corage set boy vnknowen byrthe fame false errour vpon royall stage one andriscus surquedous outrage without tytle subtyll compassyng macedone toke hym kyng colour none claime make stable except visage kyng philyp fetures moste sēblable whereby people furious rage caught opinion wylfull false dotage agayne reason bochas dothe discriue king philyp risen fro deth liue whylom father perses tolde andriscus broughte vp wretchednesse presence bothe yonge olde bold clayme tytle rightwisnesse shewing grounde personel likenesse mocking people fauour royal dignite receyued honour thus fostred wretche misery eke pouerte fro poore bedde horne dyd vp stretche holde scepter kyngly dignite supporte commonte gan wexe pompous elate broughte vp noughte whan stode estate nothing cruell nothyng vengeable hasty execution deynous vntreatable whan begger hath domination curre frowarde strong lyon semblably none great cruelte whan wretche set dignite andriscus royall chere execute hatefull cruelte gathered people countreys ferre nere macedone olde enmyte began maligne gayne rome cite withset frowarde false entent one inuencius pretor downe sent negligent dispite toke hede outrayed andriscus shent people dyd lede romayns hope better spede haue sent metellus full manly knyght macedone mete anone ryght thys worthy man lyst nat longe tary set proudly hope shoulde auayle made macedone rome tributary toke andriscus manly batayle brought rome wt mighty apparayle made lye fettred pryson outragious false presumption thus frowarde vsurpacion haute hys prosperite knewe nat hym selfe false abusion blent myst blynde felicite lyst nat remembre hys first ponerte chastise fortune brought hym low lyst nat hym selfe know xxv chapter ¶ howe alysander ballas kyng surry extorcion pryde vnkindnesse dyed mischefe thus thys ladye play pagent maner deynous mockerye entermesse forth serued entent folke truste onely foly purpose whylom surry kyng lyke write bochas called alisader whose surname ballas whiche ballas tell processe first risyng hys fall antiochus story beareth wytnesse called eupator whiche especiall claymed tytle thestate royall father named antiochus epyphanes story telleth thus whose dethe kyngdome surry shoulde longe succession eupator eke hys party demetrius hostage rome toun claymed tytle region surry epiphanes brought hym story le demetrius fro rome come doun surry clayme hys heritage receyued crowne toke possession gan wexe proude presumptuous corage thus eupator yonge age excluded surry succede demetrius ferther thus rede outragyous aboue measure ryght vengeable full cruelte hatefull also euery creature heuy borne worthy kynges thre fyrst egypt worthy tholome actilius asy tho reygnyng aryrarches capadoce kyng assent agayne hym haue conspyred founde waye demetrius depriue hys vndoyng sore haue desyred theyr entent execute blyue gan fable purpose contryue ye shall together went whiche surry one dyd assent toke galaunt borne lowe lynage called ballas theyr acquayntaunce affyrmed one corage howe sonne iust heyre substaūce epiphanes nexte heyre aliaunce succede token affyrmyng next surry crowned kyng alysander purpose hym call thought person able set hym vp hys royall stall maugre demetrius cruell vengeable fortune fauourable made theyr purpose finally auayle whome demetrius gret batayle alysander named ballas demetrius put memory fyrst ouercome fyll caas demetrius vyctory encrease hys royall glory fortune sodayue auenture ballas felde hym dyd recure thus promocion kynges thre crowned kyng al surry false extorcion hateful cruelte thys alysander dyd hys wittes apply robbyng pyllage eke tyranny dispysed shortly conclude sayde kynge ingratitude forget hys estate pouerte knewe nat hym selfe false ambicion wedded doughter worthy tholome called cleopatra made mencion labour conclusion onely bochas rede kyngdomes aboute hym possede coueteth sometyme dothe lese one agayne selde hath soueraynte ballas frowardly gan chese holde werre kyng tholome foresayde worthy kynges thre assent haue suche wayes sought theyr workyng came nought fyrst tholome fro hym toke hys wyfe cleopatra toke mariage one demetry causyng full great stryfe tyme yonge age ballas full great outrage power gathered nye ferre gayne demetry gan holde werre togyther met proudlye batayle ballas constrayned cowardly fle sawe hys power dyd fayle arabye myghty stronge countre • abydus prynce great poste toke hym force quakyng hys drede kyng tholome sent anone hede men may two thinges consider caas pryde punyshed vnkyndnesse presumpcion man ballas without tytle clayme ryghtwysnesse made kyng surry set gret worthinesse ende ye get hys heed smyt sent tholome lenuoye thys tragedye dothe naturally complayne vpon thys vyce called vnkyndnesse punyshe tourment none ne payne rygour condigne flagell duresse emprisoning none earthly distresse may suffise brifely conclude againe vice ingratitude creature vice complaine lawe nature decree rightwisnesse monster kinde dothe y• light distaine euery vertne derketh brightnesse alisander beare hereof witnesse whiche furthers tetches rude shewed againe warde great ingratitude cerberus thinfernall treble chayne tantalus hungre thrustinesse ixion ticius bothe twayne reken turment remēbre sharpnesse litell chastise redresse hatefull vice delude frendes olde false ingratitude noble prince demayne haue gouernaunce worldly rychesse gayne folke vnkynde loke ye dudayne suffre nat haue none entresse aproche hye noblesse vice hatefull conclude vyce ingratitude xxvi chapter ❧ bochas wryteth rebellyons sedicions rome betwene tribune common folowyng myne auctour storyes merueylous must write y• strōg rebellion gayus first tiberius great hatefull secious meued rome twene tribune cōmons stryues gan conspyre attayne falsly empyre yere syxe hundred computacion gayus graccus made tribune age city first foundacion turned full great domage common profit mortall rage tumulte noyse common toun caused great part destruction departyng champayne heritage atwene worthy pore cite egall portion graccus wt faire langage greatly meued commonte whiche
