occasion story men maye se another graccus called seconde slayne rome low laide grounde deth graccus rede chosen tribune called munycius whiche fordyd lawes dede olde graccus called gayus named tyberius helpe flaccus tribune estate capitoyle began great debate supported commonte voyce people y• word man know graccus party hye vpon tre trumpet stode proudly gan blowe slayne fro tre doun throw slawter y• boke maketh rehersaile flaccus wext feble party gan fayle drede fled teritory janus temple ran vp tour whan tyberius put memory sawe cite fauour dispayred knewe better succour sworde set brest presence myncrue fully purposed afore sterue stode one drew hand backe fro purpose made declyne thus graccus party goth dai dai wrake flaccus toke temple lucyne son frendes almost lyne thei kept thē strōg maugre defēce slayne sturdy violence graccus frendes fought party selfe constrayned drede gan pray boy hys company take sword smyte hys hede set speare bloude made rede sent mother complayning tene castel called missene named cornelya mother dede whylom doughter great scipion ch • oren slayne rede graccus goodes acheted toun therof made diuision iudgement thorughout cite nede among commonte graccus syde fiue hūdred slaine twaine vpon hyll called auentyne oppinius consull dyd payne conspiring y• groūd serche mine flaccus party bryng ruyne slew two thousand hasty iudgement amonge many innocent xxvii chapter ☞ wyfe hastruball brent selfe chyldren john bochas lyst especiall remembre howe cartage newe agayne distroyed hastruball came mischefe y• trouth well sayne reherce new vayne sythe tofore made clere mencion bothe brennyng destruccion saue telleth hastrubals wyfe onely eschewe lyue seruage chase child lese lyfe wylfully furious corage sonnes tender yonge age amonge flame cole reed consumed ash deed dydo first bylte cite made tour stronge wall betrayshed also ene afore remembred fire funerall longe wyfe hastruball chase rather dye childrē twaine amonge romayns liue paine xxviii chapter ☞ machabeus jonathas take kynge surry order suyng vnto john bochas appeared heuy man syght machabeus y• worthy jonathas whiche occupied wisdome myght office prynce priesthod knyght title juda werres toke thempryse clayme leuy priest dyd sacrifise lawe jewes manly defende lande promyssion jonathas ful knyghtly dyd entende agayne enemy enuyron tyll surry false kyng tryphon traynes cōpassed promise falsely holde toke jonathas whō right tolde machabeorum reherced knighthode worthynesse treason especiall wrought tryphon great falsenesse subtell sleyghtes hys doublenesse reherce ye get byble story ye maye se xxix chapter ❧ howe demetrius seconde lost last head bvt wyll returne demetrius called demetrius seconde discent came fro antiochus manhode well founde dyd pride kyng ballas confounde called alysander great rage put father fro herytage demetrius famous notable vpon parthoys many great victory tyll kyng arsacides double deceyuable selfe delytyng greatly vaynglory hys sleyghty fraudes deceptory vnder shadow faynyng false chere toke demetrius vnwarely prisonere great hindring sclaūder name arsacides maner mockery made demetrius dispite shame poorly arayed hate great enuy led jury made hym great auisement wed hys doughter agayne hys owne entent demetrius kepte prees fewe hym syght vnto tyme arsacydes deed passed great might cast escape away flyght secretly accomplishe entent gate hym coūsayle assent gallymandrus lorde countre hys assent dede flight kepe secre made demetrius chaunge wede preuy wayes forth dyd lede nought flight vayne strong pursute taken agayne constraynt presented kyng gan wexe wery life kept straytly folke waytyng maugre presented hys wife abide full heuy pensyfe whē childrē atwene thē twaine go large losed chayne thus space fre lycence go come auauntage whyle wife helde resydence dempt hys chyldren suffisaunt hostage euer vnstable hys corage gallymandrus foresayde knyght thre time take brought agayn flyght dyuers many folde kyng f • aha • e token vnstable sent thre dice forged square golde play raket chylde chaungeable hys disposition varyable restrayne hys condicion est take fettred pryson whan fortune geuen hym pull many diuers straunge aduer site punish phrahates wexeth dul demetrius pryson made free full restored agayne countre wext proude agayne new fall hated liege cleopatra hys mother quene egypt wyfe tholome lorde stryfe lyst sene turned great aduer sue strength party thus wrought made sonne take hande fyght agayne husbande tholome called euergetes gayne demetrius defended hys countre made zebenna put hym selfe prees sonne marchaunt borne lowe degre make clayme false subtylte surry haue possession hym allegyng tytle adoption sonne antiochus claymyng therby kyngdome surry onely texclude sayde demetrius tholomeus sustayne party zebenna hys ch • ualry gathered egypt countreys enuyron agayne demetrius proudly come doun fortune wyth double face caused countre ryse rebellion demetrius stode clene grace whereby people region whole agayne hym opinion tholomes wonderfull workyng zebenna receyued kyng thus zebenna false intrusion surry made lorde kyng tytle none collusion texclude demetrius subtle compassyng yet fynde hys party defendyng howe demetrius zebenna gan assayle theyr quarel darreyned wt great batayle great people slayne vpon outher syde demetrius put hys region ouercome hys great pryde great mischefe hys confusion hauyng succour consolacion fewe chose hys meyne fled water tyre cite lyke woulde haue lyued pee faynt maner perfection within temple myghty hercules vnder shadowe religion sodainly hys commyng doun tyre hys arriuayle heed smit dyd pride auayle ❧ xxx chapter ¶ howe zebenna kyng surry entrusion entryng mischeuous endyng touchyng zebenna whome spake toforne poorely brought vp lowe lynage kynred begger borne came tofore bochas trist hys visage soore wepyng muet langage gan complayne hys wofull auenture vnware sodayne impossible recure hys condicions somwhat dull rude fyrst pouerte proude presumptious appeched great ingratitude shewed hys lyfe kyng autiochus hys first furtherer story telleth thus whyche antiochus greatly anoyed cast meane whyche distroyed cosyn yt called grispus antiochus lyne whiche title demetrius claymed heyre many vncouth signe reygne surry proudly gan maligne agayne zebenna whose party supporte stode antiochus chefe reporte sayd grispus yonge tender age furtheryng supportacion antiochus maryage owne doughter great possession zebenna shorte conclusion compelled great myght antioche take hys flyght fyll great pouerte fayled money paye wage soudyous whyche countre abyde vpon maner age strange folke sundrye langages theues inurdres mansteers pyllours first jupiter assaylyng treasours disclaunder perpetuall memory diffame arose many folde jouis temple baner victory toke away mass • fe golde great ymage stode olde golde also mo treasours pillage payed soudiours sacrilege hauyng conscience escape away entred see eolus great violence winde tempest dyd flee dyd vnto hym full great aduersite meyny forsoke hym entent take grispus sent king surry whō whē brought gaue hym iudgement thys sentence sacrilege wrought spoy •• g temple great violence doyng goddes maner reuerence grispus cōmaūdeth hath iuge slayne better refuge byrthe boy clambe vp royall stage brought vp nought set dignite knew nat hym selfe wext cruell corage arose fro pouert great prosperite fortune mutabilite blind lady made power stretche began ende lyke wretche reken estate worldly regaly nōbre meyny golde treasour richesse stately castels paleys eche party cōquest fortune cumbinge hie noblesse cruel sworde conueyed wyifuinesse power extort couetyse oppressyng causeth destruccion many earthly kyng contrary lyst hym selfe knowe grace inclined mekenesse though pouerte brought vp lowe vertue enclined worthynesse scepter peace sword rightwisnes indifferently dome demeanyng suche one able cleped kyng chefe cause grounde occasion prince ofte stande ieopardy worldly chaunges suche diuision reygnyng amonge yt serpent enuy • symulacion faynyng flatery south serched lyst loke many tragedy expert thys boke xxxi chapter ¶ howe bitynctus kyng auergnoyes romains taken died prison bitynctus next auergnoyes kyng came tofore bochas ginnig cōplaint distresse thordre rehersyng howe made feble faint againe romains mischeuously attaint nat withstanding maintayne quarel cast pride agayne rebell first put remembraunce auergnoyes nacion hanging gaule longeth vnto fraunce bityncte stode possession hauing dispite opinion romains wise obey proudly cast againe werrey labour stande franchise large subiection gau pride lordship dispise gadred people presumption mete fabius sent doun mighty consul knightly toke hāde theyr party bitynctus withstande whose cōmyng bytictus toke dysdayne cause folke whyche fabius dyd lede fewe whan hath seyne sayd scoru people taketh hede may suffise houndes fede whā slayne fewe nōbre multitude yt shall encombre hundred thousād hys vaoward passe shoulde auuergne ryuere fowerscore thousande beside lad consul fabius met good chere whan passed rodanus y• da • gere fought al day tyll drewe night romayns wan fone put flyght ryuere lyke saieth boke drowned brought mischaūce fyfty thousande water toke fortune frowarde variaunce attaynt tencrease greuaunce biti •• tus take romayns dampned prison dye chayns ☞ xxxii chap tyrant euergetes wedded quene cleopatra slewe eldest sonne exyled hys wyfe wedded doughter whose deth pitously rede sene epiphanes great tholome came doughter cleopatra quene gan complayne greate aduersitie sorowe furious diffaced beaute chekes whyte blode teares meynt rent wt hādes pitously bespreint philometor wedded aforne whylom sonne tholome kynge lorde true wedlocke borne two sonnes olde wrytyng whose deth anone vp suynge euergetes prince yonge age agayne ioyned mariage title egipt lorde syre kyng lande cruel dyspytous whose story sheweth kigdom empire may selfe make man vertuous lyke tygre tiraunt furious eldest sonne day mariage borne heire slewe mortal rage longe extorte cruelte albe child atwene thē twaine egypt made fle malyce gan disdaine trowe matter plaine toke doughter whan yt gon agayne nature wedded anon called cleopatra also euergetes vēgeable againe mother fro egipt go citie fauourable people exyled wode vntretable dispyte gaue notable toun hateful malyce straunge nacion whan know cruel dedes gan conceyue howe culpable sawe againe hym y• many folde hatredes conspiracion state honorable large vengeable game cleopatra gyn vncouth stryfe went exyle wyth hys newe wyfe gadred people olde wyfe assayle chyldren shewe vengeaunce day assigned helde battaile driuen vttraunce myne auctour plainly put remēbraūce suyng thus rede howe malice wrought cruel dede reherce nouther good ne fayre terible abhominable dismembred sonne hys hayre peces smal tiraūt vengeable whan mother sate royal table body heed solempnite let serued frowarde cruelte wherof al egipt indignacion auenge cruel great outrage toke plate basnet haberion cote armure wrought gret costage fro temple rent ymage token tiraunt attaint eche thing diffaced yt depaint whose hateful story replete wretchednes full vengeaunce fro warde mischeues therfore deme bochas lyst expresse life fulfylled al repreues cleopatra wrote fynal greues chaptre fatal way toke lest y• matter shoulde difface boke ¶ xxxiii chapter ¶ howe jugurtha entrusion kynge numedy slew y• rightful heires hym self drowned thys woful deadly auenture cleopatra whose storye full olde came jugurtha manly man lure jhon bochas hath tale told conquestes dedes manyfolde subtyl wyt myne auctour sayeth gaue lytel force breake fayth ordre story conuay jugurtha hys kinted massmissa kyng numedy soth say vncle also tede sayd kyng sonne dede called mysipsa eldest wrytinge day reigne kynge massinissa ordayned afterwarde tofore deth hole entencion cause jugurtha borne bastarde depriue al succession testament conclusion sonne mysipsa afterwarde made kynge jugurtha frendly louynge mysipsa two sonnes fynde tone called adherbales seconde story maketh mencion tyme named hyempsaies wyth jugurtha put selfe prees abyde dwell especial lyke cosyn corte royal cherished full wel bycause ye wyse right lykely disposicion chosin afterwarde synguler prise go spayne helpe scipion gaine numētaynes famous mighty toun jugurtha knyghtly hath begon nobis town anon remembre knyghthod entent worthynesse hye renoun mysipsa letter downe sent forsaid worthy scipion gaue great cōmendacion jugurtha callyng werre▪ manly prowesse yonge lode sterre king mysipsa receyued notably called hun sonne adopcion king dead sone jugurtha traitourly slewe hiempsales heire succession realine haue possession custome euer y• tytle stode slaughter murdre get good lyst goddes reuerence nature wylful recheles hauynge nouther remors conscience touchyng slaughter hiempsales falsly practised owne encrees murdre romains haue set doun consulere correccion calphurnius called sent onely punishe horible dede treasour hys eyen blent execucion toke none hede romayns ouercome mede gaue jugurtha collusion murore coloured false pardon toke maner hardinesse tyranny dyd exercyse gathered people hareful cursydnesse selfe gan curledly deuyse execute le • fe gyse false murdre meane nowe none slee adherbales seconde brother alone false intrusion numedy might lorde kyng thus cruelte murdre false treason noyse borne lāgage wrytyng graffes flasly abrode spredynge brought forth hyndring name frute disclaundre reporte diffame mortall treason couered vnder flour saue selfe subtylte specially great treasours appease senat would haue theragayne al cōmonte made agayne coniuracion salse murdre correction foure • men armes downe sent pretour called actilius pretour set al entent gather treasour couetous couetyse contrarious vnto knighthode auctours expresse stepmother vnto worthynes siege layde aboute myghty tour wherin jugurtha put hys rychesse siege layde loue treasoure worshyp worthynesse wherby name noblesse ther discomfyted brought vnto mischaunce mede made hys alyaunce jugurtha encrease shame caused affrike false cheuysaunce togyther disclaundred diffame withdrawe fro obeysaunce romains selfe tauaūce theyr purpose corrupted wyth treasour many tribune many senatour newe againe al comonte fro rome sent gayus marius murder horible cruelte wrought jugurtha tiraunt furious refourme sayd gayus consulere purpose sent doun manly knyght famous renoun full notably werres began wrought euery thyng hie prouidence fortune whyche helpeth hardy man gaue great fauour influence alderfirst dyd diligence auoyde al vicious delicate people folkes lecherous day set taken batayle jugurtha false subtilte profered much good might auaile haue corrupt would haue sayde marius euer one degre stode aye stable vpright wall toke none hede profer jugurtha party dispaired greatly astonyed within hym selfe musynge lyke man hyndred appayred gan purpose anone newe thynge mauritaine went kyng get helpe whych called boccus succour agayne gaius twene made new alyaūce whyche last lytle space kyng boccus gan fal repentaunce cast woulde resorte grace romayns nomore trespace perfourme entencion made gayus mediacion one scylla called questour gayus host gouernaunce king boccus mediatour ther newely accordaunce twene gayus purueyaūce thys boccus jugurtha anone hent maugre myght • gayus sent al kyngdom without resistence gaine romains came vnder obeysaunce marius forgaue offence receyued vnder assuraunce shall dome vengeaunce punyshe y• trespaces dyd aforne space cōpted fro tyme borne jugurtha taken almost angre mad brought rome fettered prison terpeya hye hyl lad jugement yeue false treason bound stone throwe doun fro place full hye stode without mercy tibre flode ¶ lenuoye may wel called tragedy discripcion takynge auctorite tragedy poetes specify ginneth ioye endeth aduersyte hye estate cast lowe degre example taken story sayth aright iugurtha fyrst good knyght ginnyng famous chiualry gate numētaigne spaine great citye repairing home party meane whan came home countre chaunged knyghthode cruelte couetise blinded syght iugurtha first good knighte wyt power holy dyd apply hateful murdre fraude subtylte extorte title selfe magnify slew rightful heires reft thē lybertie false intrusion clambe vp se gaue force wrong ryght thyng contrary euery worthy knight noble prince lift vp hertes iye within selfe remembre se murdre hateful tyrrany oppression done commōte gynnyng good cursed ende murdre axeth vengeaunce day night thynge contrary euery worthy kyght ❧ endeth fyfte booke foloweth sixte ¶ bochas sittinge studie alone wryteth greate processe howe fortune lyke monstruous image hauynge c handes apeared vnto hym spake bochas vnto makynge bytwene many great argument reason fortune chaunces ¶ fyrst chapter hys studye alone bochas stode hys pen hande sodayne auenture remēbre thought dyd hym good howe man may selfe assure worldly thynges fully recure grace fortune make stable dayly chaunges variable braydeth euer y• chaūtipleure songe wepyng wo gladnesse nowe myrth nowe paine endure nowe lyght heuy nowe swetnesse nowe trouble nowe fre nowe distresse shewyng v maner resemblaunce worldly welth hath non assuraūce whyle bochas pēsyfe stode hys lybrary wyth chere oppressed pale hys vysage somdeale abashed alone solitary hym appered monstruous ymage parted twayne colour corage ryght syde ful sōmer floures tother oppressed wt winter stormy shoures bochas astoined full feareful abrayde whan behelde wonderful fygure fortune thus hym selfe sayd may meane creature monstre transfourmed agayne nature whose brenning eyen spercle light sterres frosty wynter nyght chere ful good hede toke face semyng cruel terrible disdayne manasing loke heare vntrussed harde sharpe horyble frowarde shape lothsome odible hundred handes eche parte sondry wyse gyftes departe handes lyft vp men alofte hye estate worldly dignite another hande griped full vnsofte cast another great aduersite gaue one rychesse pouerte gaue also reporte good name noysed sclaundre dyffame habyte many folde colour watchet blewe fayned stedfastnesse golde allayed lyke son watry showres meynt wt grene chaunge doublenesse pretence reed drede meynt wyth hardines white clennesse lyke sone faile faint blake mourning russet trauayle colour meynt wolles one whyle eclypsed bryght dul asse whan men haste gone swalowe geryshe flyghte twene slowe swifte croked nowe vpright nowe creple lowe corbed doun nowe dwery nowe chāpion nowe cowarde durst come prees nowe somwhyle hardy lyon nowe lyke ector nowe dredful thersites nowe cresus nowe agamēnon sardanapallus condicion nowe mānishe nowe feminyne nowe coude rayne nowe falsly shyne nowe mermayde angelyke face taile behinde serpentyne nowe de bonaire frowarde grace nowe lambe tretable benigne nowe lyke wolfe nature maligne nowe sirenes synge folke slepe tyl caribdis drowne thē depe thus bochas considringe figure al feature ordre gan beholde bredth lēgthe shape stature hundred handes armes tolde wherof astoined herte gan wexe colde amonge al membres euerychone hym sempte fete vpon gone whyle considred al thys thynge twene traunce sodainly towarde loking conceiued countenaunce yre plesaunce outher fauour outher disdaine maner woulde somwhat sayne loking coye disdaine bochas quod knowe thyne entent howe thou trauailest busiest vaine thy study euer diligent nowe west nowe orient seche story north meridien worthy prince yt toforne haue ben dwelled vnder pole artike fauour vp raysed sterres vnder pole • tartyke contrary fro v ferre encreced set vp werres lyke lyst triūphes tauaunce frownig brought thē mischāce se busy remembring scripture story prince euery maner age fauour foloweth auenture humble style set playne langage made curious none auauntage rethorikes mus striue plaine four dedes discriue processe thou doest great dyligence deserue yeue thē thanke blame settest vp one roiall excellence within house called house fame golden trumpet wt blastes good name enhaunceth ful hie party wher jupiter sytteth amōg heuēly sky another trūpet sownes full vengeable bloweth vp feastes funerall nothinge bright colour sable ferre fro fauour deadly mortal plonge prince estate royall whan wroth make thē lowte lowe malice trumpet blowe thou hast written set togyther grose lyke desertes worldly mennes dedes nothing conceled vnder couert close spared crownes purple wedes goldē septers yaue thē medes crowned one wt laurer hye hys head set peruinke made gybet thus diuersly giftes depart one accepte another refused lyke hasardours dyce ieoparte one well furthered another accused play double trust euer abused though one daye fauour hath wonne morow againe eclipse sonne cause cōmyng plainly declare good auice vnto thy presence shewe maners spare condicions breuely sentence preued olde newe experience plainly shewe lyst rowne day flater morowe frowne houre shewe merciable sodainly dispitous wel wylled nowe hastely vengeable nowe sobre chere nowe hasty furious play vncouth maners maruaylous brayd y• wynde nowe glad murne lyke wedercock face eche day turne wherin bochas tel yet agayne thou doest folly thy wyttes ply thy labour thou spyllest vayne gayne maners fully reply thy writyng fynde remedy interrupt thy last dayes statute customable wayes al labour phylosophers olde trauayle poetes maners depraue hath ben yore say lyke woulde ouer fredom souerainte haue lawes liberte saue vpon whele shall defende whan list shal discende shoulde men put blame folowe nature double play newe buddes dothe ver whan primrose appere fresh gay day shewe morowe gon away somer flour hath foyson tyl iune wt sythes mowe thē doun nowe see calme blaundyshyng nowe wyndes comfortable styll nowe boreas sturdy blowynge yonge shepe blosomes greueth yl also shoulde haue wyl shewe selfe smothe trouble syth kynde longeth double man ferre fall wretchednesse standeth trust ryse agayne none depe plonged distresse dispaire wāhope ouer layne hope left certaine yeue comforte seruynge entent releued whan lyst assent erth clad motlayes whyte rede whan estas entreth vyolettes sote greues grene euery mede vawm fleteth doth herts bote angust passed againe rote course nature y• vertue doth resorte reuolucion kynde reporte debarre double sith doublenesse longeth right▪ nowe lyke sōmer nowe winter trouble blinde loke derke y• cloudy nyght nowe glad herte mery lyghte foles againe myght muse atwite though power vse selde neuer byde one poynt men must lowpes take fynde whan stande furthest ioynt set folkes backwarde farr behynde worldly men eyen blynd sore complayne vpon doublenesse call frowarde false goddesse thus wrytig marueilous lāgage disclaundred mutabilite wherof ryght catche great auauntage syth doublenesse sclaunder whiche percel liberte called tytle ryghtwysnesse chaunges newe lady princesse thus whan fortune sayd wyl parcell declared gouernaunce made stint soberly stode styll jhon bochas sate herde al dalyaunce feareful chere pale countenaunce order enprinted eche thynge yt sayde ful demure thus dyd abrayde toke vpon vertue corage vpon poynte abyde stable certes quod lyke thy vysage worldly thiges double chaungeable yet parte remembraunce notable shal perfourme southly conne litel boke haue begonne lest labour dye appall boke tytle saue among myne lytel workes letter large aboue vpō graue bookes name shall stone graue howe john bochas especial worldly prince written haue fall whyche emprise cause discriue thys first grounde wyl deny eschewe slouth vyces lyue specially vyce glottony norice vnto lechery chefe cause vndertoke compylacion lytle boke yet thy talkyng vnderstande eche thing nature chaungeable thy sentence see lande yet coude reken thynges stable vertuous lyfe abydyng vnmutable set hole godwarde wyl thought maugre thy power ne chaūgeth nought thou mayst eke call vnto remembraunce thinges made stable grace whiche deuyne hast thou herde y• perseueraūce holy martirs whych lyst decline fro chrystes fayth tyl dyd fyne thy whele none interesse make vary fro stablenesse man enarmed vertue againe thy myght make resistence set trust grace christ iesu hath al hole hertely aduertence ou ryght wisnesse force prudence theyr suster called attemperaunce hath sauecondute againe thy variaunce set store thy double whele supportacion ladyes thre trust stād plate mayle stele vertues faythe hope charite called vertues theologice watch wyth fowre afore specified thy whele haue vtterly defied wynges might flye heauen shoulde se thou hast nothyng adone jupiter planetes seuen phebus mar mercury mone worldly foles erly late sone blent dyrked lewdnesse false opinion call goddesse giftes grace giftes nature almesse dede done humilite loue cōpassion ferre thy cure semelinesse strength boūtye beaute vertuously vsed degre gaine non thy power may stretch vertuous lytel thee doth retch thy condicions set another prefe foles vse aduersite excusacion somtyme sayeth thefe whan hanged destyne • witeth fortune iniquite power domination rule man wyl againe reason whych quod jhon bochas party desolate determin heauenly hid fecrees tho deuines estate remit vncouth priuitees wt poetes lowe degree esche climbe hye loft lest presumpcion shuld fal soft hyd corage misteries diuine prouidence without enuy would plaine langage vttre writinge huble reuer • ce predestynacion nouther prescience appertaine fortune vnto part wyl excuse procede lyke vndertoke tolde matere fal prince wryte boke yet afore thou wouldest desire hole herte entere haue copie prince name al fro thy whele thou hast made fal thy secre bosome ful story sūdry prince life haue lad triumphes victory olde poetes philosopher sad meter prose compiled haue rad song laudes fautes eke reserued remembraunce haue deserued haue put memory theron set study laboure coude encrease glory though lāgage smal fauour cause caliope socour thou hast duringe al rebuked rude style men would accoūpt great dulnesse language conueied prudence declared sobre auysenesse vnder support fauoured defence tullius chefe prince eloquence profite shortly conclude style spoke termes rude yet ofte tyme hath felte seyne vnder huskes growyng land erable hath founde tried good greine vnder rude leaues shakynge vnstable pulled fayre frute holesome delytable semblably rethorike hath failed blūte termes good coūsaile hath auayled phylosophers golden age poetes founde freshe ditees king amphion wt faire langages wt harpig made folke low degree laborer tenhabyte firste cytees musyke phylosophy gan firste common noble policy chefe musike melody accorde well philosophy sprang prudence whych two meanes gan vnitye acorde politike vertue haue asistence wisemen reigne subiectes reuerence grounde story men may se bylte walles thebe citie accorde musyke causeth melody discorde diuersite peace prudent policy eche kingdome euery great countre strife first induced thy duplicite yu maist clerkes thee discryues called lady contekes striues fyrst founde hateful deuysions thy contriued false mutabilitees slaughter debate frowarde dyscencions region prouinces citees desolacions townes countrees men firste experience thy chaungeable gery violence thus opinion thy whele double fayre nature possible ouerthwertly thou broughtest mē troble madest eche froward odible thy traines vncouth terrible lyke corser maketh coltes yt wylde spurre whyp tame mylde thus tempest thine aduersitees make men tame corages discordes twene kyngdoms citees sharpenes thy cruel rage onely speche meane faire langages folke thy fraude fro grace ferre exyled faire speche vnyte reconsiled people grece rome cartage nexte itayle many region indused swetnesse faire langage haue togither conuersacion buylde castels many royal toun caused tell briefe fourme eloquence rude people enfourine▪ afore tyme beastial tyl reason lawes cōstrained vnder discrecion statute natural fro wilful lustes prudēce restrained assent made one togider enchayned golden chaines peace vnite thus gan buylding euery great cite whan thou medlest haue entresse one bring discorde interrupt thy doublenesse citees region one accorde lyke thys boke beare wel recorde fro tyme thou first began thy mutabilite hath stroyed many man thou causedst men obstynate corages incorrigible wilful froward causeles debate eche contrarious odible refourme almost impossible tyl faire speche voidinge diuision peace reconciled twene many region none furious outrage matter fer way meane gracious langage faire speche may man conuay al reason mekely obey example whyche reherce shal wele purpose historial hardy knight cruell achylles whan hateful ire assailed corage meane wt treat pee styl tempest dolefull rage saue onely dyd ire aswage attemperaunce obey reason whan harpe heard swete soun instrument hys great swetnesse put al rancour hys remembraunce wrested againe al gladnesse auoiding al rācoure greuaunce semblably fayre speche daliaunce set men rest realmes yonder good langage ferre asonder wordes bochas wext debonaire towarde fortune cast loke withdrewe rancour speke faire touching labour yt vpon toke beseching forther boke name little knowe good report might blowe name might ferther sprede stode yet shrouded derknesse fauour name forth lede boke forther businesse good reporte yeue bryghtnesse laureate stremes shad forth people al foryetfulnesse neuer appall hyl whych yt jhon bochas made vnto fortune ful humble style whan fortune conteiued al caas soberly stoode gan stynt glad chere gan smyle myne auctour freshe visage sentence spake langage sothly quod se busines mortall men howe curious yt howe study greate auysenesse secretes priue knowe conceites hyd within counsails ye men al payne albe lightly ye may therto attayne matter wyt doth neuer faynt ymaginyng lykenesse mynde lyke conceytes ye forge painte somtyme woman wt winges set behinde portrayen eyen yt ben blynde cause al brefely expresse owne couetous blyndnesse appetite straunge dyuers euer full chaunge doublenesse frowarde also malicious peruers hastye clymbing worship rich alway voyde trouth stablenesse presūptuous serche al degree falsly attayne worldly dignitees bochas bochas perceiue euery thyng knowe full wele great difference hyd thy selfe wordes thynkyng atwene disconuenience hast thou writen many great sentence thy boke sclaundre wyth name hole entent maners defame▪ thou callest stepmother vnkynde somtyme false enchauntresse mermaide taile behind scorne somwhyle namyng goddesse somtyme witch somtyme sorceresse fynder murdre disceites al thus malice mortal men call al done dyspite accusacion many sondry wyse ye oft appeche mutabilite namely whā requestes dispyse accomplyshe gredy couetise whan ye fayle ye lay wyte aduersitees falsly atwite thou purpose teslaundre hast writen vngoodly cōtrarious fable howe wrestled wyth glad pouerte whose party thou fauourable settest backe gayne yu vengeable nowe newe requirest fauour helpe forther thy labour ascaunce maners chaungeable condicions femynine ther ye wynde vnstable thy discripcion thy doctrine euery chaunge redy enclyne woman ben yong tēdre age nature diuers corage party thyne entent thy boke processe may procede fauour accomplishment wel wylled helpe thy nede like thy desire better thou shalt spede whan towarde benigne face spede thy ioruey support grace thy name also thy surname poetes many olde auctour may regestred house fame supportacion sodaine fauour assistence also socour thy worke texplete laurer wyn saturninus wyl thou begin fyrst chapiter ¶ reherseth fortune condicions vnto bochas shewyng many one enhaunceth time anone sodainly ouerthroweth amonge romayns said saturnyne outragious condiciōs caused rome whā gan malygne great debate great sedicions hys frowarde conspiracions sharpe enemy agayne prudēt iuge called metellus deuoide al refuge fro capitole set mighty hande founde socour metellus toun tyme thou shalt vnderstande howe helpe supportacion one smal reputacion called glaucus pouert brought lowe made consulere story well knowe seruaunt first almost set nought afterwarde made fortunate left neuer tyll hym brought prerogatife chose senate pretour office estate also wrought conspiration bryng metellus destruction whose assent also another called marius beyng yere texplete treason sworne brother also tyme consulere fortune made full good chere lyke desyres gaue liberte banyshe metellus cite thre romains first saturnine glaucus called seconde marius layde hoke lyne haue tolde metellus confounde purpose also founde fauourable bryng mischefe story sheweth open prefe banyshed hym rome toun saturninus hys subtell workyng clambe vp fast presumpcion called rome lorde kyng gaue hym fauour maner false smiling tyll last playnly declare distruction brought y• snare senatours knowyng malyce saturne made great gadryng sundry folke castyng auyce theyr fauour might called kyng vpclymbyng shewed hym duryng longe space disceyue full benigne face tyll marius mighty consulere withstande presumption rose stronge hande knyghtly chere beset hys palays enuyron brake hys gate amyd toun saturninus voyde fauour capitoyle fled succour forbarred marius vitayle capitoyle besieged rounde aboute entryng stronge batayle outher party slayne great route thus fauour gan stande doute thus saturninus brought gret distresse good acheted lost rychesse experience full openly men leareth suche hyest thervpon ascende lyke turne whele requireth whan lest wene doun shall discēde haue power selfe defende agayne might ouerthrow laughe make amow drusus also borne great lynage discended full hye noblesse vnto vertue contrary corage frowarde founde gentlenesse yet chose story doth expresse questour asye offyce hye degre byrthe gouerne countre oft tyme vertue gentlenesse come nat heires succession exāple drusus story bereth witnesse bothe corage disposicion euer frowarde condicion let men deme must nedes nat byrthe dedes vertues hym set asyde slowe armed hated chiualry couetous deynous full pryde dedes frowarde full trechery hie estate dyd hym magnify yet al giftes hym ne might stretche tofore thee cōmeth like wretche dare shame nat shewe visage farre disclaundred wretchednesse couetyse vicious outrage falsely caused hys doublenesse maguldusa prynce great noblesse betrayshed mede kyng called boccus drusus false workyng maner turmēt greuous payne cōpetent couenable condigne outwarde flatter fayne hert couertly mal ••• e▪ drusus dyd shewed many signe maguldusa loue frendlyhede vnderneth false treason hydde dede maguldusa lyke manly knyght gayne king boccus hath hiselfe soccoured whan dome iudged agayne ryght olyphaunt deuoured scaped frely laboured acquite hym selfe hie renoun slew false drusus myd rome toun bochas also men put lacke cause destruction contrarious mutabilyte notable famous scipion tyme sensoryn caton gate triumphe many great victory put name perpetually memory merites chose consulere chefe byshop gouerne cite senate patron entere famous name dignite saued romayns aduersite tyme whan werre dredefull dispytous gan atwene pompey cesar julius thus whan sayde famous scipion fauor acōpted notable fro whele sodenly throwe doun neuer word dede culpable romains malicious vnstable theyr hangman first chayned pryson racked gayned raunson thus auayled ofte saue hym selfe founde succour syde dead body henge hye alofte spectacle longe abyde thus geryshly gyftes denyde stoūdmeale nowe frende nowe aduersary rewarde good guerdon ful contrary experte full well scipion gan loye ended wretchednesse bochas remembre make hereof mencion fanaticus gentlenesse made ascende notable hye prowesse yet bokes saye touchyng kynrede manly person chorle borne dede disporte glad vysage set hym vp 〈◊〉 hye vpon whele gaue hym lordshyp low seruage fauour ly kedine full wele wherfore bochas story euery dele note well especiall sleyght came estate royall sleyghty fainyng dyuers folke tolde spake wt scirra goddesse euery houre playnly whan wolde presumption discriued lykenesse sayde also goodnesse graunted hys stare magnyfy duryng life spirite prophesy furthermore people blynde fantasied crafte vncouth within shale story maketh mynde nut haue fyre hys mouthe blew sparkling north southe affyrmed wherwith folke blent spirite hym heuen sent wrought many great vertue gadred people tyll dede two thousande churles hys retinue whiche afterwarde purpose spede syxty thousande encreaced rede suffred serued hym tyde tyll courte grutched hys pryde though byrthe vileyne rose vp nought sodeyne auenture gery fauour made hym seyne royal porte dyd hys busy cure rayse hys baner ware cote armure gracious supportation brought great people subiection last lust gan appall towarde beynge fauourable fro whele anone made fal romains sent great constable called porpenna prince full notable whiche fyll venquisshed anone slewe outrayed churles euerychone selfe hanged vpon hye gybet meyny cast pryson thus pryde gaue great tripet fro whele cast low doun moste hyest domynacion toke hede dyd laugh mourne man alway soiourne bochas quod fortune take good hede also howe bothe disauayle ensample se howe athenyo whylom shepherde itayle brigaunt marchauntes assayle laye wayte besyde great mountayne fugitiues made captayne slewe first lorde ryche senatour violence brake many stronge prison tyme gaue hym great fauour gather robbours enuyron churles region assembled iniquite holde werre rome cite besieged castels brake doun mighty tour slewe robbed eche countre spoyled palayses worthy senatours tytle none saue tytle volunte toke vpon hym pride cruelte clad purple lyke kyng bare scepter amonge men ridyng vpon head ordayned none golden heare tressed lyke emperour • oyfe enbrouded ryche stone lyst laughe false robbour supportacion gery fauour last nat longe short whyle custome dyd hym begyle suffred hym made hym fayned chere haue doen mo full ofte tyll downe fro rome sent consulere toke proudly henge alofte churles slayne nat softe cheynes bounde shorte conclusion dempt lawe die prison whiche story bochas thou mayst lere great party condicion hast story thou shalt howe yere fro foundacion sixty c meane rome toun gatheryng great company together sworne false conspyracy withdraw fro obeysance tribune called clodoue knighthode gouernaunce sent downe rome cyte myghty hande rule great countre called champayne playnlye say people lyst hym nat obay thre score four numbre named chefe conspyratours whiche y• cast thē captayne encōbre wt multitude theues robbours whiche chase amonge thē supportours thre mighty captaynes one called spartharcus chefest echone gadred churles made selfe stronge hye hyll toke dwellyng place hauing regarde right wronge spoyle countre beastes enchace cherished benigne face season gaue liberte false rauyne robbe countre thing cruel comparison vengeable wyll nat ryght whan churle hath domination▪ lacke discretion blyndeth syght comuners defaute lyght haue power coūtreis gouerne fare lyke beast nothyng discerne gladiator folkes dyd call swordes wer stele made fyne fight gayne wilde beastes lyon beares bore wylde swyne mountayne dyd lyne called venuse cruelte slewe robbed eche countre spartharchus chefe captayne brought vp nought borne low degre claudius mighty stronge romayne sent power fro rome cite defende saue countre hyll besieged lay rebuked beate driuen away many kept mountayne hurte day story telleth thus amōges slaine great captayne felow vnto spartharchus fynde hight inomaus whose deth take great vēgeaūce countre felt therof greuaunce mountayne one assent without mercy remission vengeable haue robbed brent countre enuyron tyll two consulers came fro rome doun first called lentulus put flight y• sayd spartharchus wherof romayns greatly dismayed senatours indignacion bothe ashamed selfe affrayed sent one crassus great lorde toun nombre legion whan yt spartharcus fyrste set slewe men sixe whan met afterwarde besyde great ryuer called salayre great batayle spartharcus stode great daunger chere countenaunce gan fayle thurty thousande clad plate mayle slayne yt day gayned raunson capitayns assigned prison without made mencion sixty thousande felde lay dede sixe thousande sent prison felde bloude stayned made rede fourscore quakyng drede thylke day romayne gyse take mercy receyued fraunchyse spartharcus mischefe put flight whan turned visage loste chere lost also might whan appalled fyne passage churle lynage encrees lyked nothyng wele therfore vnwarly cast fro whele maners make greatter prefe another famous greate robbour spayne disclaundred thefe dred iustice rigour trusting shulde fynde socour called vrinatus spayne anon forsoke rome right way toke gadred meyny condyrion euery secte make selfe stronge theues robbours euery region many churle medied amonge name tencreace right wronge euer gate cyte village soudyours parted pyllage thus helpe came greate richesse brought pride presumpcion nat prouyded doublenesse gan maligne agayne rome toun prudence last scipion sonne lepidus makyng therof boste slayne trusted moste whiche ensample notable remēbraūce shewed heretofore john bochas vnto thou mayst know party puysaunce sodayne chaunges mutabylite auoyde ambuguite declare summe myne entent great marius thee present blacke wede habyte also heed vnkempt locke hore gray loke downe cast token sorow wo chekes salte teares lay whiche bare recorde deadly affray wherfore bochas thy penne dresse discryue mortall heuynesse robe stayned romayne blode sworde aye redy whet vengeaunce lyke tyraunt furyous wode slaughter murdre set plesaunce yet nat forthy gaue gouernaunce ouer people rose whele vp fast vnwarely downe dyd cast twene scilla y• woful deadly stryues large herafter bochas thou shalt wryte many romaynes lost thē liues wyll also ordre thou endyte shall rebuke atwyte fro nought made honour shine warde made thē mischef fine forget nat also deadly pytous fate notable lyfe meane great famous mithridate whose name yet full couthe ryfe gaue great prerogatyfe fourty wynter dede well sene agayne romayns werre sustene whiche herafter gyue charge mithridate story set alonge whan thou haste leyser space large remember conquest dedes stronge howe medled amonge al noblesse felicite yeue parte great aduersite next ordre owne choys fortune vntrusty vpon eche party john bochas bothe conuayed fro parthoys stronge herodes reignyng parthy lo john quod take hede story kinred yf well sought wer scithiēs chased brought nought yet al mutabylite whyle stode dispayred restored vnto dignite vnto whan repayred herodes hindred apayred chaunges hatefull pride whan lest wende vn warely set asyde suyng within lytle whyle geryshe lady condicion gan yll laughing falsely smyle lokyng bochas brought doun mighty prince rome toun dayes notable price fame expressed nat name bochas head gan downe declyne seyng prynce face disfigured suspection gan ymagyne whan mynde fully hath recured certayne token sygnes well assured pompey surquedous estate cesar longe debate disconsolate vnhappye caas face soyled water see tyme whan fotynus cruel achyllas drowned hys body furyous enmyte face disfigured solempnyte smoke blake deadly mortall called clerkes feast funerall codrus caused corp brent consumed ash deed cesar head borne sent vpon pole hys story lyst rede bochas toke good hede fortune maner mockery scorne hym gan thus specify vp heauen deuyse gan enhaunce encrease hys glory fauour gaue hym many pryse conquest kynges wt many great victory put noblesse memory support chiualry cesar julius holde champarty fauour dyd applye towarde victory assure fame arose tyll thessalye gan withdraw party succoure sufferyng enemy make discomfiture vpon pompey hyndred syght lesbos mischefe toke hys flyght seruauntes yonge tholome reygning egypt pompey drede take slayne founde helpe gaue vp lost hede yet chaunges man taketh hede vnsurely cast dredefull loke saue thou art busy set thy boke bochas astonied parcell presence bothe chere face countenaunce whyle hauyng aduertence thought sawe maner resemblaunce person stode great greuaunce tyll last fortune cast syght towarde bochas tolde hyght quod playnly termine famous man prynce eloquence gaue latynes y• scole doctrine rethorike well science whiche wyll thou doe thy diligence write thys tullius case gyn marius wordes sayde fortune made ende bete • ynges toke flyght nat se way dyd wende saue bochas telleth like angell bryght departyng shewed great lyght assone gan disapere toke penne wrote ye shal ii chapter ¶ howe gayus marius lowe byrth borne came hie estate whiche blent couetise many great batayls dyed myschefe bochas gynneth tell man called hys tyme gayus marius borne aprina castell tuscan sonne carpenter storye telleth thus pursued armes manly vertuous rome countre man holde stronge discyplyne great subtylite also bokes specify prudence manhode habylite bothe armes chyualry moste famous holde towarde party wtin myne auctour saythe certayne chose tribune great capitayne fro gynnyng tendre age history put remembraunce pricked sore corage gredy fret longe contynuaunce neuer staunche none habundaunce worlde fortune wt richesse suffyled nat appease gredynesse entring temple founde diuynour counsayled diuynayle entre rome holde soiour good auice knightly apparayle made promyse shoulde nat fayle attayne fauour commonte great office state cyte fauour common brought hi hie estate receyued vnto dignyte consulere albe senate disdayne felicite bycause borne lowe degre graunted toun conquere realmes commissyon gate prouince hie renoun numedy dyd assayle toke kyng region called jugurtha proudly batayle whiche emprise marcial apparayle gate ye triumphe y• town ryding bycause onely taking king person notable many famous sodayne victory namely conquest preued profitable cōmons put memory thencreace renome glory opinyon hole cyte hande lay prosperite agayne people y• called cymbroys thē conquere frō rome sent doun also agaynst boystous tigurnoys gadred together many nacion brought subiection like romains afore desyred thei againe town cōspired toke vpon false presumption passe mountaines itayle first discomfited made mencion thre romayne duke felly batayle fourscore thousand clad plate mayle slayne romayns y• story well knowe vnder alpes mischefe ouerthrowe marius marciall auenture germany great batayle tewtobochus gyaunt stature put first flyght al apparayle marius dyd hym sore assayle chace proudly borne grounde maugre might take chaynes boūde marius hoste hym drewe towarde ye people cimbroys fight two hundred people fynde thē slewe eight thousand take thre put flight kyng bolerus full famous knight slayne felde great pryde agayne marius lyke dyd ryde day cibroyes al ye people slaine woman lyst nat reserue yet profered wolde haue ben ful faine chastite deuoutly obserue temple vesta serue request lyst nat fought echone slayne yfere except whan sawe none remedy purpose set eueriche slee murder thought also bet hange selfe vpon hye gybet abyde marius outrage perpetually lyue seruage thus marius thre nacions hys conquest accōplyshed y• victory prisoner sundry region entred rome encreace glory speciall laudes notable memory first triumphe guerdon singulere tymes syxe chosen consulere thus fortune fauourable set vp worldly dignity season chaungeable amonge gyftes great prosperitees gaue parte great aduersytees specially tyme accompted twene scilla whan werre gan lucius scilla abyding champayne marius rome tho present whan deuysion gan atwene thē twayne eche contrary entent melancolous impacient whiche story wel conceyued gouerne sonest receyued sodaynly right wronge toward rome takinge passage agayne marius make selfe stronge gan slee burne great outrage wylfull hasty furyous corage sodaine comming vnware violence agayne found resystence two mighty batayls dyd lede entryng cite gan y• wal myne wyth one bataile fast gan spede passe gate called aquylyne gate named colyne whose entring recorde boke scilla strength capitoyle toke whan marius knowlegyng scilla great power might without arest lenger abydyng maryshe gayus anonright people toke sodainly flyght fet strength coude hym nat defende scilla prison dyd sende thus prowesse whyle slept marius lying pryson scilla tyme capitoyle kept wherby rome stode subiection hatred haste sent sturdy chorle marius drede whyle lay bounde smyte heade chorle wel compacte braune bone set purpose marius oppresse strength ordayned none prison chorle gan fast dresse marius fettred distresse fully purpose without delay behead prison lay losing hym first lying couche marius rose vp lyke man chorle fearfull • inite touche marius full proudly tho began entre place beside woman founde asse auenture vpon whose backe see gan recure towarde affrike fonde passage enprisoning though wext faynt yet abode styl corage hye worthynesse prudence meynt person nat queynt agayne malyce make countertayle proude scilla malyce efte tassayle itayle rode countre toke voyage rome tou n wyth four batayls entred cyte sixe hundred knightes computacion slaine felde made mencion men may se lyste loke aferre domage diuysion dothe werre first manhode marius diuysion story lyst rede great consull called octauius loste head lyfe dede vpon pole dyd blede cruelly presented entent iudges sytting iugement whose death fayne sory loue bounde werre merula slayne priest temple lyke founde jupiter many mortal wounde romayne slayne y• called crassus fyre consumed proude catullus enemyes marius dydencombre agayne conspyracion assented ful great nombre auise haue put doun take dominacion abode turment shoures strong cōdempne al cōspyratours sixe time aforne rehersed condicion though dispytous chosen oft consulere tyll fortune gan wexe enuyous agayne sayd cruell marius made senate wt al chyualry grutche agayne hatefull tyranny time story maketh mynde damasippus pretor toun frendly marius helpyng fynde vnder shadowe deception vnto cite treason causyng four romayns come fere tofore marius certayne day tapere name put memory sceuola carto domicius fourth sayth story called rome wyse antistius together assembled tofore marius rancour agayne iudgement lawe made thē slayn cite drawe body tybre cast cruelte sayde marius cruell werre last twene scilla tyl duke cōpaneus came party hardy dispitous helpe scilla baners first displayed wherof rome sodaynly affrayed gate called collatyne marius scilla great batayle four score thousand numbre termyne marius side slayne fayle scilla victorious marcial apparayle entring towne agayne othe parde thre thousand citezius slew cite folke disarmed naked towne nouther spared olde yonge age cruell murdrers walkynge vp downe scilla sent mortall rage tyll catullus prynce fall age sayde vnto scilla difference twene rebellion atwene innocence murder slee without exception bothe hie low holdyng manere againe knighthode myne opinion procede conquest title lost triumphe requere hie prowesse whan nat obserue difference slee reserue hatefull cruelte scilla contriued letter diffamable wherby fiue hundred cite falsly banished citezins notable agayns vntreatable goodes atche • ed rage auaryce false pyllage another romayne named marius brother marius whō tofore tolde drede scilla fled toke hous vnto gotes set vp folde founde rent dayes olde cordes draw rescue might saue cruell vengeaunce catullus graue scilla made cruell iudgement sharpe sworde forged forto byte time eyen rent bothe one handes smyte head smit ran̄som might hi quyte set pole woulde none dispight sent vnto hys brother marius whome spake nowe right great duke mighty huge afore take flight feare scilla mortal deluge citie finde refuge called preneste ther standing gret drede namely behelde brother hede forasmuch succour fonde dispayred hys purpose slee selfe owne honde thilke place kept close drewe hys sworde vp anone rose cōstrained seruaūt sodain affray smit head selfe day men say howe death fyne mischefe ende aduersite dothe wretch tary fortune maketh another prefe marius howe course gan vary euidence hateful contrary shew malyce vngoodlyheed agayne duke ala whan deed froward lady malyce vēgeable whan lyst furiously raue shew selfe cruell vnstable none estate lyst regarde haue caused marius take graue cruell scilla story founde vgly carayne smyt peeces rounde shew hys cruelte marius shoulde haue burying place cast carayne cankred enmyte tybre none grace lo thus fortune folke purchace whiche example touchyng marius worldly chaunges bochas writeth thus maketh chapter discription first thing gentlenesse set prefe probacion nothyng attayneth vnto hie noblenesse clere shinyng vertuous clennesse may nat shew hie low parage groweth pure corage worldly power oppression tyranny erthly treasure golde stone rychesse meanes vnto gentry vertue rule hye prowesse vyces haue entresse hie byrthe meane low kynrede deme man gentle onely dede royall place stone metall wrought galaryes stately cloysters rounde gentilnesse noblesse nat sought selers vautes rounde onely wher vertue doth habounde curyous clothes great possession maketh nat man gengle condycions phylosophers conclude entent worthy famous olde auctours man may que testament gentilnesse vnto successours wycked wede come holsome flour concluding thus good men shrewes call eche man gentle good thewes duke marius spake toforne nature story beareth wytnesse discent poore nedy borne disposycyon coragyous noblesse persō wyt strength hardynesse vnder dyd herte myne worme auaryce worshyp decline vayleth plenty y• neuer may suffyse flode stauncheth thurst appetyte euer doth aryse alway eate euer eate hath lust cankred hungre fretyng rust riuer tantalus rage gredy etykes fret may nat asswage marius ye haue herd ende woful fall vnhappy caas fate howe dyd wende nowe wyl folow myne auctor bochas howe vnto thre cleopatra loke downe cast wofull face chere atones dyd appere fyrst processe writing thre husbandes bochas doth expresse wedded youth alisaundre kyng called zebenna prince great noblesse great fayrenesse wedded vnto demetrius last kyng antyochus three husbandes woful auenture sonnes great vnkyndnesse bochas afore hath done busy cure curyously maner expresse reherce agayne ydelnesse syth processe tofore founde first eke secounde wedded kyng tholome lyke afore eke made mencion bothe ioye aduersyte first slayne drinkyng poyson seconde confusion euergetes wo fayne chylde serued y• slayne thyrde wedded kyng crispus slayne temple full great outrage drede shame gan wexe furious saue selfe knewe none auauntage saue enbraced jupiter ymage story tofore founde dead suffred many wounde ❧ iii chapter ❧ howe king mithridate bode vii yere wyldernes great turmentes bothe sea lande blode broughte vttraunce slewe himselfe sworde wyll passe ouer cleopatra three forth procede hasty fate sone execute parcas cruelte vpon duke called mithridate first reherce great vnkyndlye hate tutours rede destroy assent kynrede purpose dyd hys death prouide many vncouth straunge occasion tender youth first made ride vpon horse wylder lyon purpose onely distruction al yonge age horse ruled rage nat doctrine euen nature disposed connyngly ryde ouer maystry recure maugre horse wyt gyde way toke forwarde asyde daunted y• euer rode bridled backe bode owne kyn next alyes laboured bryng hym mischefe venomous drynke set hym espyes good leyser doth couerte thefe fell poyson make prefe entent well couthe murder hys tender youthe whan yt apperceyued treason saue selfe made great ordinaunce anone gan haue suspection theyr vnkindly hatefull purueyaunce remedy made cheuisaunce prouided malyce decline many notable proued medicine malyce prudently eschue remembred whyle yonge age certayne frendes y• dyd hym sue disposed custome hys corage hunt chase beastes sauage vnder colour dyd wyle ferre fro countre tabsent whyle one corage one heart one chere suffred manly toke none heuynesse desertes space seuen yere amonge hye hylles bode wyldernesse set asia story beareth witnesse founde lodgyng trasyng countrees saue cauernes great holowe tree boke remembreth diet beastes wylde enchased wt great might fled ydienesse eschewed quiete lytle slepe su •• ised nyght exercise body made • yght nouther whan hym lyst pursue harte hynde y• myght hande eschue nouther drad tygers lyon swifte tho dyd hym assayle lyke strength olde champion wylde beast great smale entayle tescape hande might countreuayle ware early outher late great swiftnesse mithridate amonge armes exercyse amonge tournay ren horsebacke dilicate fare dyd also dispyse gredy excesse lacke nighter tyme slepe full oft brake stoundmeale houres marke daunyng rose vp larke space accomplished fully seuen yere repayred home hys countre shewed hym selfe manhode chere full like knight story lyst se wherof enemy astonied caught hys cōming hert maner drede supposyng afore dede whose absence wyfe leodyces conceyued childe made mencion diffame shoulde nat come prees murder sought occasion fully purpose slee hym poyson defautes lorde nat fayne knowing trouth made slayne toke many knightly dede first conquere paflago • ye helpe worthy nychomede tyme called kyng bithinye togyther assured one alye losse lucre fortune theyr gyde therto sworne neuer deuyde mithridate legate downe sent fro romains lowly requiryng woulde lyke entent paflago • ye restore kyng wonne cite assaylyng lyst nat aduertise prayere party requestes dred nat thretes manaces gate proudly lande galathye conquest wan many place capadoce toke hys partye slew kyng hatred enuye ariarectes full manly man wyse conquest began agayn thassuraūce twene nichomede sodaynly gan fall debate thought wolde warrey hym dede pompous elate capadoce toke hym thestate reygne kyng agayns entent nouther counsayle assent yet nychomede gan debate longe afore owne encrees suster wedded ye mithridate whan brother lyued rest pee also called leodices hauyng two sonues borne succede discease sayde nychomede processe sayde child twayne capadoce helpe mithridate claymed tytle iustly attayne vnto crowne father died late gan felly debate tyll mithridate falsly gan contriue two neuewes vngoodly depriue capadoce toke hys hande owne sonne hath crowned kyng capadociens assent al lande gan disobey purpose workyng whan romains considred thys thyng artaberzanes hast sent doun gayne mithridate kepe region sonne whō fro thē haue refused kyngdome gan enchace sēpte fraunchyse abused see foraine occupie place mithridate gan newly manace toke sustayne partye tygranes kyng armenye artabarzanes fro rome sent capadoce helpe counsayle mithridate knowyng entente howe came downe proudly hym tassayle tygranes set first batayle capadoce al region brought day theyr subiection thus mithridate hauyng entent short time countreys conqueryng mightiest prince orient tho dayes one greatest kyng remembred writyng delyted astronomye sortilege sorcerye dyd hys busy cure lerne vncouth conclusyons secretes sought nature knewe langages diuers region two twenty sundry nacious helde woman many one loued hipsycrata aboue euerychone romains manly mithridate bokes olde recorde hym sayne vpon day cruell hate asya bad eche romayne shoulde men mercilesse slayne twenty thousande slewe eke day romain marchātes durst mā say nay drewe diuers nacions encreace party puissaunce kymbrois gallois region bostornois toke aliaunce straūge people made acquaintaūce euer rode nye ferre rome holde werre grece also gate manye yle cyclades subiection conquered within whyle athene gate famous toun romains knewe entencion sent scilla furious hete mithridate grece mete archelaus constable leading host kyng mithridate gan agayne scilla trustynge able maugre romains debate met furious hate beside orthonia grece great towne archelaus y• party brought downe gan scilla victorious gayne mithridate great violence gate al ephesie kyngdome ful famous rode asye founde resistence knighthode manly prouidence capadoce bithinye eke also romain handes gate bothe two mithridate perceyued hath thinge cōquest scilla toke encrees anone cast without longe tariynge tyme haue pee hie wisdome nat retcheles dissimule tyll founde time space double fortune finde better grace abode tyme kept hym selfe close tyll founde layser lyke hys opinion auenture arose within rome great discencion twene two consules toun appease hys auctorite scilla came vp agayne cite mithridate absence dyd espy purpose founde oportunite gadred people chiualry siege layde vnto cyzite cite asye moste auctorite tyll lucullus myghty consulere breke siege approche gan full nere mithridate fyue captayns tofore towne made discomfiture hie dispyte romayns lucullus damage recure enclose enemy dyd hys busy cure mynours gaue anone charge siege make diche full large within knowledgyng certayn token theyr gouernaunce whervpon made tariyng cast way delyueraunce mithridate seyng ordinaunce hie prudence escape away besyde siege lyst lenger abyde lucullus myghty consuler pursued slew hys meyne multitude asopus ryuer made blode lyke reed se wt winde tempest fordriuen also saw succour lande shyp went wt strong mighty hand founde fortune cruell aduersary lande se worthy mithridate neptunus made see contrary agayns puyssaunce abate shall men call influence fate sodaynly prynce hye renowne fro hye noblesse plounged downe mischefe kept aye one visage mithridate lothe plye bowe stronge hys corage efte agayne goth hys chiualry towarde adrastus hyll armeny pompey beset hym enuyron sent fro rome distruction mithridate makyng lodgyng place vnder hyll drew nyght troubly heuen wt thūdring gan manace firy leuyn dyrked hath hys syght cloudy moue eclipsed lyght astonied hym vnware violence stode confuse prouydence tempest vnware derkenesse almost made wery hys wofull lyfe yet fynde kyndnesse hipsicrata whiche hys wyfe nouther werre mortall stryfe left neuer disguysed vysage folowed arayed page yet hys mortall heuynesse whan cloudy fortune gan manace corage naturall quickenesse appaled nat remeued place hie prowesse dyd hys heart enbrace nat dispayred sodayne fall condicion marciall token wherof standyng mischefe chaunged nouther chere countenaunce euidence full great prefe manly force heartely assuraunce defiyng fortune varyaunce whan founde hys distruction dispayre greatest occasion hym baylife fynde called castor whiche condicion lorde false eke vnkynde conspired agayne false treason token wherof vp rome toun hys lordes child yonge tender age • yke thefe sent hostage one sonnes murdred treason mithridate toke ful sore herte another sonne made mencion false father whā aduerte vnkyndnesse made sore smerte vyces shortly conclude • orst al hatefull ingratitude childe make mynde called pharnax whych agayne nature father traytour vnkynde purpose agayne hym recure al hast dyd busy cure accomplyshe purpose party drewe hole father chyualry sleight mede whā made strong besieged father rounde aboute vnto nature semeth dyd wrong put father great dout kyndnesse ferre shyt wythout whan sonne wyth hate set fyre agayne father falsly dyd conspyre wyth multitude father constrayned maugre hys myght toure flee hys sonne vnkynde hath disdained yet al straunge aduersite corage magnanimite person stode hole lyst vary though fortune hym contrary yet myne auctour bocas beareth recorde mithrydate would haue requyred sonne accord set asyde al olde contrariouste vnkynde indurate parde euer frowarde malycious corage disposed tendre age kyng mithrydate ala ouercome vnkyndenesse neuer afore maner caas stode dismayed hye prowesse kept aye one face passion represse vertue force marcial doctrine none aduersite suffred hym declyne ende werres mortall stryues debate discencions hys concubine daughter hys wiues meane onely certayne pocions slewe al drinkynge poysons woulde cause dyscriue death shoulde byde lyue hys owne death mortall fell rygour compassed afore thus gan deuyse made french knyght y• soudiour sharpe sworde ful cruel wyse ren wherby fraūchyse conserued purpose fulfyl woulde dye owne wyll lo ende kyng mithridate let prince deth take hede howe rechelesly passed fate assent made herte blede bochas lyst hys boke rede playnly rehersynge wordes fewe worldely prince doth cōceyte shewe ¶ lenuoye myghty prynces lyfte vp corrages towarde heauen doo youre hertes dresse memory turne vp vysages wher ioy euer peace concorde gladnesse true armonye celestiall swetnes counterpayse remembraunce worldly chaunges fortune variaunce aduertise mortal fell outrage blody werres impossible repres whyle false enuy wyth furious rage sondry realmes hath great entres slaughter murdre deuision falsenes conscience haue brought vttraūce soden chaunge worldly variaūce reken vp prince sate hye stage fyne royall noblesse tirauntes reken vp blody wage sodaine slaughter guerdoned wodenes mithridate beare hereof wytnes blode vnkynde brought vnto vttraūce soden chaūge worldly variaunce prynces remembre vpon golden age whan saturne ruled y• worlde rightwisnes next jupiter people auaūtage silueren worlde conserued clennes mar hath nowe turned felnes made steelen wt sworde dagger launce soden chaūge worldly variaūce mithridate regestre vyages conspired poysons taffray prowesse land see tempestious passage cōstraynt bode vii yere wildernesse wandrynge payse vnsykernes hys ende myschefe knewe auoydaunce gayn worldly chaūge fortūes variaūce neglygēce haue brought rerages towarde god reken streyghtnesse let reason medle lay hostage compassyon mercy partynge almesse towarde heuen support feblenesse whan merites shal paisa balaunce worldly chaūges fortune variaunce deth spareth nother hye lowe lynages haue mynde heron rechelesnes transitory pylgrimages set brigāts vnwarely toppresse prudence great auysenesse wyth prouydence preserue puyssaunce gayn worldly chaūge fortune variaunce ☞ iiii chapter ❧ howe eucratydes kynge sythie slayne demetrius carayne cast houndes next ordre bochas dyd apere woful prince put hym selfe prees reignyng sithia story doth v lere name eucratides disturbe quiet pee agayne plainly fynde came demetryus y• myghty kyng inde power vyolence eucratides importable besieged first lacke defence take mischefe fone mercyable demetrius hym vengeable whan slayne wtin owne boūdes made carayne cast y• houndes wythstandinge worthy kynge borne hye blode auenture demetrius sonne aboue al erthly thynge hated hym recorde scripture rancoure denyed hys sepulture matter hateful contrary story wyll lenger tary v chapter ¶ howe herodes kyng parthoys werred wyth romains whych sonne heyre slayne made hys bastarde sonne kynge yt anon slewe father arthabanus whilō parthois kynge purpose style transporte full olde prince liuing sonnes twayne bokes reporte age dyd comforte mithridate eldest brother herodes called mithridate reason hys age hys father dead dyd succede banished tiranny outrage afterwarde mischefe nede babylon toke flyght drede people anone partyng indignacion made hys brother kynge thus came herodes estate royal pursued hys brother babilon layde siege rounde aboute wall yelded vp toun thus hys brother brought cōfusion afore castell wythout lenger date made smyte head mithridate parthois toke possession thus yong herodes voiūte pride gan werre agayne rome toun wtstande lyst longe abyde cōsull crassus cam theyr syde cōmaūded short processe make toward parthois hys voiage take crassus lyst entre reme left parthois story dothe deuyse toke waye towarde jerusalem take solempne empryse temple onely couetise toke agayne tytle ryghtwysnes vp al treasour great ryches gate diuers region great multitude hold vp party led wyth hym eleuen legyons towarde parthois fast gan hye hys letter proudly gan defy sayd herodes wyth great apparayle myd countre profred battayle next morowe whā crassus toke y• felde brought blacke cote armure whan knightes auisedly beheld dempt token discomfiture contrary romayns cure whan capitaine shal fighte hed cote armur outher white red another token frowarde beholde fyrst egle beate banere also soone men dyd vnfold contrariously tourned loke chere back crassus folke sawe yt stode nere pronostyke romayns ful certaine howe fortune daye againe flud passinge eufrates wt vnware tempestes hys standerdes echone ryuer cast amonge prees reken vpryght stode one wherof astoyned wold gone pronostykes made afrayed lyke men hert dispaired dismaied token crassus recheles pronostykes also dyd dyspyse toke vpon passe eufrates entre parthoys onely couetise herodes sendeth thys wyse hys commynge pyllage knyghthode manhode corage al power parthoys tho came downe many prefecte men great courage agayne crassus rome towne tolde abode pyllage turned great domage sonne crassus slayne fray father take al vpon daye head smyt defence disconfyted wyth many legion heade crassus brought presence herodes within royal toun whych hath comaunded golde broughte doune molte lay dead powre thereof full hys head thinge done mockery signe onely storye doth deuyse golde treasour vpon party staunche myght thrust couetyse suche gredines eche man dispyse auaryce custome eche place hye prowes doth prise difface herodes dyd serche wardes al felde vpon crassus syde toke penons baners standardes tempels large longe wyde let hange vp surquedy pride signe onely eke memory romains hath get victory whiche lyst onely content wenyng fortune shoulde abyde stable surry hath hys sonne sēt called pachorus made constable region partable al treasours mouables y• founde whereuer rode throughout al lond pachorus hys chyualry encrease gan tendre age wherof herodes father enuy fearful shoulde tourne domage lest would tytle heritage maugre hys agayne commynge take vpon parthoys king pachorus called home agayne surrye conclusion al wrought vayne bycause one cassius fro rome come slewe al people region whych appertayued pachorus find doun without capitaine left behynde withstande romayne cassius herodes hath sonne sent agayne whych anone story telleth thus amyd felde vnhappely slayne trust fortune thynge vayne whiche custome day fauourable morowe geryshly chaungeable pachorus dethe whan noise arose distressynge chyualry herodes abydyng parthois tyding brought farde would die hertely sorow fyl frensy heyre none left royall lynes saue thurty bastardes borne concubine thus herodes cast great sickenes hys sonnes deth hym importable hys worldly ioy gon gladnes fortune cōtrary neuer stable age fylon hys lyfe durable one thyng dyd hym drede cause none heire succede whyche woulde suffre lyue pee tyll last caught fantasy chase bastarde called pharactes bycause famous chyualry gaue crowne regaly anone breuely conclude slewe herodes ingratitude vi chapiter ☞ howe fimbria consull rome slewe selfe bochas processe boke foure myghty prince notable estate towarde thei cast chere loke lyke vnto folke infortunate fortune ben debate maner sempt wele mischiefe fall fro whele first fymbria romayne consulere sent romayns great cite called nichomede came messangere helpe flaccus slayne great aduersite entred countre whose dethe party auaunce flaccus meyny toke gouernaunce presumption without auctorite fymbria dyligent labour full ferre aboue state degree toke vpon 〈◊〉 fortune false fauour called capitaine emprour al countre bokes specify whose presumpcion scilla enuy pursued many greate citye castel made take hys flyght fymbria great necessite constrained maugre hys myght dyspayred sake euery maner wyght slee hym selfe storye telleth thus wythin temple esculapius vii chapter ¶ albinius slayne stone another consull stoode case semblable tyme called albinius whose hareful pride abhominable al folkes lothsome odious whiche lyke rebel wode furious agayne romayns ofter one whan lest wende slayne wt stone viii chapter adriane borne lowe degre falsly vsurped kyng rome whyche wt chorles brent next cam adrian rose hie estate fyrst rome borne lowe degre chosen sent whole senate gouerne affrike countre hys owne pompous auctorite toke vpon subtel false workynge maugre romayns ther crowned king support shortly conclude great numbre cōmonte chorles gadred confuse multitude title none grounde volunte gentleman beyng countre assent one opinion assembled distruction vtices large great cyte hym churles beset rounde aboute woode fagot large quantite cōpas wise closed without gadred vylayns great rout layd fyre flame rede echone consumed ash deade ix chapter howe sinthonius kinge trace yt much coueted al forwet died pouerte next adrian came sinthonius tofore bocas wt teres spreint face story reherseth vnto v hys tyme kynge trace fal sodainly fortune grace cast downe lowe estate royal came bochas complayne fal whose purpose woulde haue seuen realmes haue cōquered wt hād subget rome cytie seuen grekes lande al coueteth ye shal vnderstande al forgothe ful wel affyrme dare vnset houre wherof eche man beware long conquest brought prefe whele fortune cast hym doun pretor sēcius brought mischiefe dyed pouerte made mencion bochas maketh digression compendiously within lytell space discriue region trace x chapter ¶ bochas partye maketh dyscripcion kyngdome trace passeth ouer lyghtlye vnto accōplyshment boke trace whylom countre greate fame contayneth ful large space tyras toke fyrst y• name son japhet called trace whyche many daye dwelled place towarde septemtrion plenteous good besyde dynoe large famous flode southward trace renneth flode egee macedone standeth occydent kyngdome called propontide stant trace towarde oryent great plente blod shed spente whan sencius hye prowesse kyng adrian manly dyd oppresse ebrus trace chefe citie myne auctour maketh mencion cast long tary breuite make trace discripcion procede translacion myne auctor wryteth lōg proces great pompeye worthynes xi chapiter ¶ howe many great conquestes duke pompeye great warre began bytwene hym julyus whiche thre hūdred thousād slaine last head pōpeye smytten thys pompeius name couth wise worthy famous prowesse toke vpō hym tendre youth father fortunate duresse called pōpeye story beareth wytnesse distressed sodaine deth commynge sayeth y• story thūdre lyghtning host dystroyed violence vnware tempest lyke saith boke fourty thousand slayne pestilence feare remenaunt felde forsoke til yonge pōpeye corage toke beginning proudely procede ful lyke knyght father host lede rome tyme theyr dyscencions among selfe nye brought ruyne frowarde false diuysions twene marius silla brefely termine tyl new sonne gan shyne worthynes shad light manly pompeye famous knyght sayde pompeye thys knyghtly man begynnyng hys chyualrye proude captayne slough whan began whych marius helde vp party called brutus lombardy pōpey thrugh knightly gouernaūce al hys host brought mischaunce hys begynning pompey eke also set romaynes rest quiete one called gneus carbo slew knyghtly whan mete whych cicyle proudly helde sete countres enuyron pompey made thē subiect rome toun al pompeyus see wyth many shyp stuffed vytaile towarde affrike made great armee hast arriuaile domicius great battayle brought coūtre throughe hye renoun rome vnder subiection pursued great myghty kynge called jertha marius honorable also hys royall abydynge numidy countre full notable againe pompey hys power able castel met fyght slewe kynge jertha lyke māly knyght thus brefe tyme holdyng passage cōmon profyte made mencion hys wisedome knightly hye corage brought al affrike subiection stode afore rebellion romayns sturdines sayd pompey dyd haste redresse greatest enemy agayne rome toun thylke dayes one sertorius fortune whych nowe vp doun pompeye one victorious soone hym happed thus among meyny fallynge debate slayne hys hye estate deth thys sertorius came porpenna pompeye assayle mette anone pompeius ful lyke knyght slewe battaile victory greatly dyd auayle romains gouernaunce brought spayne obeysaunce auctorite gyue senate noble pompeye vayle cite vpon sea would suffer pyrate euer came fro hym dyd flee wyth shyppes scoured see bare hym māly hys hande maugre thē brought thē land al pyrates false robbours gadred region called sylla whych lyke rauinours made agayne rome conspiracion robbed spoyled saylyng vp doun romayne marchātes people ech countre none hardy passe see pompey made see obey pyrate none durst theron abyde senate sent warrey towarde thorient knightes syde soeuer dyd abyde mine auctour writeth influence heauē conquest swifte fyre leuin encrease eternal glorye perpetually get hym name hys laude renome put memorye buylded cite asia great fame called nichopoly bochas sayeth twene two flodes one araxases called eufrates buylded cite onely entent romayne knyghtes yt fall age warres spent shoulde custome haue herbergage thys custome vsage cite alway fayle beddyng clothes spendyng vytayle pompeye rode armeny rebell rome tigranes king fought wt chyualry disconfyted hym none abidynge tigranes hym selfe submyttynge vnto pompeye wyth euery circumstaunce euer abyde vnder hys obeysaunce al haste pompey gan hym hye ryde asia lyke manly knyght gate kyngdome called albanye whych toke name loke aryght whytnes euery maner wyght borne recorde writynge white snowe hath heer shynyng ben houndes marueilous nature tassaile bulles lyon wylde beast may agayne endure pompeye many region rode thrugh armeny hys champion growen herbes y• may neuer faynt euer colour man lyst wyth thē paynt conquered realmes aboute euery coost hiberie gate region arsaces kynge wyth al hys host disconfited made mencion power surry came doun fenice kyngdome great fame whyche fenix whylome toke name brought al countrees subieccion sidonye myghty strong cyte iturie toke possessyon chrugh araby came downe jude whyche jewes sometime coūtre libanus passed mountaine ceders growe authours sayne sent tofore entring realme one gabinius myghty stronge constable reignyng tyme jerusalem aristobolus prince ful notable temple strong pregnable layde siege bred length space thre monthes gate strength three jewes vnder ye wall founde dead assaut whych made resistence wal beaten downe grounde pompey sturdy violence entred without reuerence sanctum sanctorum men place call made hyrcanus hyest preist great byshoppe aristobolus sent rome myghty cheynes boūde towarde septētrion fynde wrytten thus gate vii kingdōs citees walled roūde rebel rome dyd confounde wyth myghty swerde gate countre fro caucasus downe reed see conquest sempt verily goddes done theyr cure fortune wyth eke busy mighty pompey prince assure euer hym list conquest recure spayne gate whan rebel thre c cytees lx stronge castels harde remembre conquestes echone al prowess thys knyghtly man towarde partie septentrion thousande castels fynde wan sixe hundred mo fro tyme began eight thirty citees dout mighty walles closed rounde aboute peyse dedes conquestes marciall thrise consul chose encrees rede ye shall fynde howe egall alysandre hercules euer put hym selfe prees al came hande concludyng ye maye se commen profite rome cyte marcial dedes put remembraunce one chose diligence enacte conquestes substaunce knighthode singuler excellence trifanes famous eloquence assigned vnto labour toke guerdon common treasour pompey rome chefe gouernour cesar absente gaule far countre time pompey stode great fauour fortune rome citye somwhat made blynde hys prosperite purposyng clymbing stable would haue none y• hym sēblable vnto purpose sayd ful yore agone howe loue nouther hye lordshyppe prefe hath bene made many mo one nouther thē would haue felowshyppe eche would hys partie kepe two case brother vnto brother fayleth poynt eche wyll put pompey resortynge nowe agayne toke al gouernaile y• romains ye haue herde sayne estate common porayle parte al myght auaile makinge lawes statute decre al vp engrosed hys aucthoritie folke enuy towarde cesar long absence let make lawe conspiracy statute concluding sentence without excepcion fauoure reuerenc • man wil senate absence chose none estate admitted procuratoure haue aucthorite dignite office court tribune senatoure promoted theyr aduice wer neuer manly wise lawe ordained folke enuious hyndring onely cesar julius whan julius knewe false
