working fro gaule sent vp cite al senate requiring wrytyng graunt auctorite triumphe notable dignite haue also offyce estate called rome second consulate hym allegyng many great vyctorye diuers countrees done cite many conquestes notable memorye wrought knyghthode equite requiringe guerdoned contrary vnto entent denied al one assent chefe grounde rote occasion brought fyrst controuersye ciuil discordes frowarde deuision whan euery man drought hys partie olde hatered kyndel newe enuy causing prince julius pomey theyr confucion eche warrey triumphe denied cesar fraude pōpey made therof fayle whose disceite julius ware made redy wyth many strong battaile passed ouer aipes itayle fully purpose playnely might romains pōpey fight thus gan warres atwene prince twayne pōpey chose partie toun duke captayne souerayne agayne cesar made mencion thus ala desolacion sued cite many strange signe vncouth tokēs whan gan maligne ginnyng woful warres heuyn sene dredful sightes sparclyng brōdes comet vncouth starres flame fyre wt many fearfull lyghtes lyke lampes brēning al longe nightes castynge speres dartes aire wherby romayns fylin great dispayre partye septentrion towarde rome came full great lyghtninge noone sene starres lyke blode son shon mone eclypsed terrible shewyng mount ethna fearfully brennyng hys cauernes cast vp flame rede toward itaile whych set thē great drede caribdes danger see wawes terrible boyled vp lyke blode rockes cicile herd hou •• ng hoūdes wode vesta goddesse rome stode myd tēple al wyth teares spreynt whā heuēly fyres afore queint afore goddesse auter principle fire perpetuall brennyng day nyght tyl warres ciuyle hateful terrible gan amōg romayns cōtagious fight vengeaūce anon queit y• lyght tofore vesta fyre partynge twayne diuision token ful certayne erthe quaues sodayne terrible ouertourned castels vp doune wyth flodes rage hydous horrible neptunus dyd great distruction drowned vyllagest many mansion reuersed temple golde al vessel threwe doun baners stāderdes pensels gayne sygnes founde none arest vnware mischefe coude mā declyne lyon wolues came doun fro forest wyth many beastes sauagyne wylde beastes serpentes rauyne came cite agayne kynde spake men bochas fynde dyuers foules nature haue custome flye nyght afore warres dyd hem selfe assure midday whan phebus bryght cite take flyght woman chylde story lyst fayn brought forth heades twaine tofore warres called ciuyle senatours beyng rome town came woman called sibile vnto made thys question declare short conclusion among question al cite fortune shoulde fall gaue answere full obscure wherupon made sore muse toke sixe letter set playne scripture wyse myght refuse false rightes dyd vse lyke thre letter twyse set numbre vnderstādeth shall y• toun encōbre thre r r r fyrst set rowe thre f f f order fast long tyme coude knowe exposicion thereof openly tyl diuinours gan serche subtelly fynde lyke entent sixe letter sibylement worde regnum fyrst letter r capitall rome citye loketh ryght thirde ferre worde ruet gynneth wyth r parde whiche wordes whan ioyned sentence concludeth meanyng cite ruinous fallynge touchyng thre f f f aduertise worde ferro f goth toforne chefe letter fame deuyse f also processe wel forthe borne flāma whyche ye towne lorne reason make coniūction causyng rome finall distruction fyre swerd hunger caused warres desyre clymbyng frowarde ambicion sheweyng cometes vncouth sterres pronostikes descrecion worst al wilful deuision among selfe vnware vyolence letter syxe accomplished sentence swerde cesar werres pompey twene twayne lastyng great whyle made many romayne italien dey battayls called ciuyle prophecy remembred sibile writyng ful wel reherce olde poete called lucan martes temple heith stode bellona goddes dispitous preestes cried offred vp blode lamentacion lyke folke furious cause token fel contrarious whych shewed sentuary god romains cōtrarye among deade bone lay graues voyces herd lyke woodman rage crye gostes cauernes caues herde feldes pathes passage laborer fled home vyllages serpentes adder scaled syluer bryghte ouer rome sene flying al nyght another token pitous astonied many proude romayne dead body dyd feldes appere whiche battayle afore slayne fro tombes risyng layne whiche warres wofull dispitous slayne sylla proude marius eke tolde diuinours howe pompeyus lyke haue fall howe thestate romayne emperours theyr triumphes imperiall julius fyrst nowe begyn shall thestate shal forth procede election linial kinrede withstande power cesar towarde rome toke hys waye ryght pōpey sent wise manly ryghte ware whan herde tel myght julius toke hym flyght eke senatours wyth hym dyd flee towarde epyre grece stronge cite pompey holde famous chiualry cesar yong hardy tassayle vpon plaines grece thessaly pompey great battaile gayne julius swerde romaine might auaile cōstrained force y• felde forsake toward egipt haue way take pōpey thorugh cipre came tholome great water paphus dyd ariue stronde dyd se stately place vp went bliue name plainly discriue cacobasyle countre dyd cal whych name fortune thus fal name tokeneth frowarde ariuaile sownyng great vnhappy auenture trust pompey dyd fayle fyl dispeyre myght recure forsoke yle dyd hys busye cure take shyppe see sayling towarde egipt tholome king trust fledde tholome hope shoulde fynde hym socour fayre chere shewed vnder duplicite fayled poynt gaue faint fauour albe pompey frendly labour crowned hym kyng egipt fynde whome agayne false vnkynde mete pompey let stuffe barge maner pretence frendlyhede gaue meyny charge murdre pōpey behight thē gret mede tweyne y• bare haterede vessel sharpe swerdes whet ware head smet one called achylas felowe named fotyne toke vp head prince ala famous knighthode borne gentell line among romains authours determine holde hys tyme men hym ryght al worlde one best knyght thus erthly prince wt pōpus fame ouer world yeueth gret soun slauter murdre toke firste name false rauyn extorcion clambe vp fyrst dominacion brēnyng countreis conquest vyolence set chaires worldly excellence batayle called ciuile holde atwene pompey cesar julius thre hundred slayne within whyle thre thousande take story telleth thus without prince able glorious kynges pretours reckned al atones tribune consul centuriones phebus y• soil might bemes spred groūde shewe clere lyght men slayne laye thicke brede earth man syght wolues beares rauinous foules flight came great plente fede eche day besyde ryuer nile lay gobbet fleshe whych foules dyd arace fro dead body borne vp ayre fyl fro clawes vpon julius face amydde felde repaire made visage blody fayre albe encrees glorye thylke day romayns vyctory head pōpey brought wt stately rig •• vp julyus hye presence compassyon murdre aduertisyng innate imperyal excellence brast wepe aduertence thought pyte price great myght shuld slayn y• good knight corse abode without sepulture tyll one codrus compassyon batayle disconfyture besought hym great affection hyde trunke lowe sādes doun sought tymbre fonde small exequies fyres funerall nowe sith thys prince came suche mischefe murdred slayne tholome kyng power fortune hath made prefe trust worldly thynge deth wanted buryeng proude pōpey famus hande fyshe deuoured lay quicsande shall men set power noblesse slyding goodes worldly glory restrayne may syckernes fortune worlde transitory though mar day gyue man victorye parcase morowe vnwarely shal dey take recorde cesar pompey sith al stant vnder daunger fortune ye worldly men loke vp dresse thilke place ioy doth aye cōtune blynde lady hath none entresse set pride asyde take mekenesse sue vertue truely labour gaine al pompe make pōpey myrrour ¶ lenuoy thys tragedy duke pompey declareth grosse chefe occasion cesar gan fyrst warrey eche againe vayne ambicion haue lordshyppe dominacion ouer ye romains fauer fraude mighte possession take force wrong ryght trouthes partie pride loth obey extort power doth great distruction wyse policye al waye prudent counsaile age discrecion lost liberte free eleccion stronge helde euery wyght possession take force wronge right deuision made many man dey brought cyte desolacion two prince fortune lyst pley till whele cast thē doun subtel disceit fraude collusion ambicious climbinge blent syght possession take force wronge right noble prince remembre saye peyse story wythin youre reason false surmoūting auarice beareth key recorde cesar pompey rome toun whose wylfull warres hateful discencion geueth clere warning euery wyght claime worth without title ryght xii chapter ¶ howe victorious julius cesar brente vessel tholome slough achilas woulde haue murdred hym great victory murdred selfe bodkin brutus cassius woful complaynte lamentable pompeyes deth pitous warres remēbred wt tresōs importable compassed fraudes faced fayre chere conspired murdre rehersed manere kinge tholome fraudulent courage dethe conspired pompey fall age processe tolde holde vayne thereof wryte newe tragedy thing one sayde reherce agayne ydel partie howe cesar went thessaly came alisandre lodge place remēber supporte youre grace lodged paleys royall busy diligent labour region temple royal spoile goddes haue al treasour mocked founde fauour achilas whych slewe pompey cast cesar proudly warrey purpose fall vpon cesar nature hys condicion falsely murdre men ware sleight fynde occasion distroy julius treason accomplyshe hys purpose party twenty thousande hys company achilas false cruel disceyuable cast disceyue cesar myght▪ egipciens leader constable romayns purposeth fyghte whan cesar therof fyghte discended▪ fast see brent al nauy kynge tholome vessel driuen vp wyth flode great domage sayd tholome julius brent euyn stode great parte besyde cite brent great pite famous lybrary egipt kyng full xl thousande volume lying thing bochas reherseth sentence howe tholome greatly commendable busy royall prouidence made selfe librarye notable al clerkes study able seuen science story bereth mynde lyke desire myght bokes fynde fyre farus countre egipciens great battaile wher cesar great necessite day constrained whan ye felde fayle toke barge egypt saile great prees folowed backe almost vessel lyke go wracke cesar armed letter hande put person daye venture two hundred paas manly swam lande cōnyngly lande doth recure notwithstandyng heuy great armure yet tofore cesar toke see felde take tholome achilas murdrer pompey al felowes assent slayne daye went non away many egipcien tyme brent cesar mercy tholome hath sent alysandre sent hym home newe charging romaynes trew whan deliuered prison egipciens alysandre cite euery coast gadred great foyson againe julius came downe meyne yet hys hasty cruelte resistence cesar gan make xx day slayne take sixtie galeys farre fro lande twelue men comynge tholome echone yelded brought hande julius hys prisoner tholomeus busied hym flee water maugre al hys myght drowned hasty flyght knowen rich haburion golde stele entremayled cesar sent vnto royall toun dyffence strongly enbattailed buccles golde richely enamayled token anone haue seyne despeired cesar sent ageyne thē cesar made fayth homage reaim egipt brought subiection tyl grace merciful corage cleopatra gaue region longyng succession tytel ryght tyme none onely tholome brother kyng lagus whylom testament father cleopatra tholome tofore deth great auisement clerely euacted last volunte hys kingdome departed halfe tholome bequeth halfe quene cleopatra brother holde prison kepe wrongly heritage whereof cesar compassion purposed reforme domage whyle helde hostage equite lawe reason al egipt gaue possession came juba libye lorde kynge sower stryues discencion proude hye porte cruell workinge whiche especial indignacion vnto worthy last scipion cause chose lyke bokes sey succede next consul pompey thys juba bare hym great hatrede sought quarel againe hym thyng cause cladde purple wede allegyng howe onely y• clothynge maner estate shoulde vse kynge ment hym selfe syttyng royall trone wold kyng colour weare alone myne authour maketh digression puttynge ensample almayne countre sayth none nacion touchyng array dysguyse waste cloth superfluyte rehersyng full playne langage many wise wast doth great damage causeth pride ambicion agayne vertue humilite lechery gyueth occasion contrary vnto chastite wast array sette folke pouerte causeth also costage spent vayne poore haue ful great disdayne superfluite vsed array ryote foloweth proude port ydelnes wast tyme driue forth day late drinkyng watch surfet dronkenes engendreth feuers many greate excesse thus euery surfet englued one mysrule bryngeth another god suffreth wele difference touchynge aray men ben degre hye estate stande excellence must preferred reason men maye se cloth golde stone pyrre prīces fresh clothinges specially purple kynges thus set hye discrecion aray accordyng prynces hie noble estate lower downe lyke degree twene pouert rich order kept scarsyte exces meane prouided atwene hie lowe lyke selfe eche man may knowe kyng juba insolent madde surquedy caught opinion none purple clad causyng debate twene hym scipion yet partie bothe rome toun agayne cesar drewe towarde pompey myschefe bothe dyd dey whan juba felte selfe powere agayne cesar holde champarty sorow lost countenaunce chere disdaine melancoly called one peitrin knight aly made thē assent y• bothe faine felly fight tyll one slayne againe nature straunge fight eche slee knewe cause king juba hardy knight slewe felowe abode proudly rather chase die wylfully hie dispyte proude corage vnder cesar liue seruage made call man whome loued wele gaue vnto golde great guerdon take swerde forged fyne stele make therof lengar delacion short conclusion take vpon haue feare drede without tarying smite heade thus king juba rather chase dey lenger liue subiection vnder cesar loued well pompey next bochas made mencyon came aristobolus wt face loke cast doun rome afore haue tolde sent pompey kept holde delyuered prison helpe cesar full hasty wyse standing hope region restored vnto fraunchyse hyrcanus ye haue herde gyse preferred great hindring pompey jewes crowned king whiche aristobolus hopeth recure cast meanes reigne againe wrought thereon dyd busy cure whose hasty laboure spent ī vaine fyll handes proude capteine whilom lōginge pōpey poison vnwarely made dey xiii chapter ¶ last scipiō consulere rome lyst nat liue seruage julius rofe hym selfe hearte next came last worthy scipion whiche pompey made consulere whome juba discension wearing purple tolde well ere afterwarde fyl great feare whan cesar within libye lande outrayed thē strong mighty hande wherby scipion gan fall dispeyre lost chere man disconsolate thre romains gan make repeyre dansippus plectorie torquate goyng shyppe time infortunate towarde spayne tēpest gan thē driue affrike vnwarely dyd ariue scipion seing wofull case sodayne howe brought vnwarly mischefe▪ scicius mighty stronge captaine pyrate sea thefe whiche name full great reprefe pyrate longyng cesare fyll scipion ware beyng purpose toke prisonere within shyppe tofore ariuaile ala dul gan chere countenaunce appall eke fayle fynd comfort man coude coūsaile pulled swerd whan might nat stert rofe selfe euyn hert thende last scipion leauer mischefe dey vnder cesar lye fettred prison lordshippe wyse obey bochas next came pompey sonne heyre great pompeyus contrary also cesar julius bretherne susterne mo one many another aliaunce assent cast euerichone father deth hauing remembraūce vpon celar take therof vengeaunce eke vpon tholome collusyon slough father full false trayson eldest brother called eke pompey spaine ful great apparayle cast newe cesar warrey people proudly assayle fynde great batayle pompey eldest son thre julius men constrained flee fonde socour receit saue life standing great drede knowyng refute fled caue tescape away knew better rede slaine cesar brought hyshede sent forth scorne anon hispalee spayne full great cyte thus processe al holy kinrede pompeius short conclusion cesar men dede without mercy brought distruction thus gan en • reas fame renoun julius conquestes sea eke land whose mortal swerd might man wt stand first libie spaine eke itayle thexperience royal puissaunce germany many strong bataile power preued ofte time fraunce brought kingdom ye obeisaunce romains peised al thing sein touching guerdō labor vein toward rome making repeyre appeaced ciuil discencions throne imperial climbing eyre conquest xiii region triumphe required guerdon recure force hath applied albe senate request hath denied name magnifye shewe glory hie noblesse capitole fast gan hie emperour dome dresse day began ioy gladnesse eue nothing according wt morowe thentring gladde thende care sorowe calphurnia whiche wy • e dreme night beforne tokyns shewed funerall strife howe lorde like lorne conspiracy compassed sworne day without auisement capitole satte iugement dremed ala laye slept lorde girt wt many woūde lay lappe body kept womanhede like bounde wo ala true dreme founde next morowe lenger made delay periody hys fatall day poore man called tongilius whiche secretly traison espy let write letter toke julius case declaring conspiracy rede cesar lyst nat apply wo ala ambicious negligence caused murdre vnware violence cesar sitting amydde consystorie estate imperiall many conquestes victorie fortune awayting giue hym fall bodkyns persinge nall murdred wt many mortal woūd lo false trust worldly pōpe found ¶ lenuoye throughe booke rede eche tragedy afore rehersed put remembraunce none wofull fantasy fall cesar substaunce hyest imperiall puissaunce whan wende haue glorious murdred rome brutus cassius marcial prince ridig lōbardy eche countre yelded brought obeisaūce passyng alpes rode germany subiection brought realme frāce gate brute albion long continuaūce two lustre passed manly julius murdred rome brutus cassius among senat conspiracy assent one accordaunce whose triumphe proudely gan deny maugre kept thobseruaunce chare golde stedes plesaunce conueied rome prince pōpus murdre folowig brutus cassius reken conquestes reken chiualry counterpeis worldly variaunce fortune chaunges purparty way togyder cast balaunce set cesar mischeuable chaunce periody sodayne enuious murdred rome brutus cassius bokes cronicles specifye influence heuinly purueiaunce mar jupiter fauour apply gladaspectes noblesse enhaunce mar gaue man jupiter gouernaunce among prince holde one famous murdred rome brutus cassius beholde alysandre great monarchy world vnder obeysaunce prowesse hector medled gentry achilles melancolike vengeaunce reken echone quauering assuraunce among remembring fyne julius murdred rome brutus cassius prince consydre marciall policy nouther trust faithe affiaunce stande chaunge wt twicling eye vp towarde heuin set attendaunce worlde vnsure worldly plesaunce lordship abydeth nat recorde julius murdred rome brutus cassius ❧ xiiii chapter ❧ howe octauian succeded next howe murdrers julius died myschefe dethe manly man noble prince famous emperoure worthy neuewe called octanian reigne rome next successour deuoyre diligent labour punysh tho nature ought rightfull dome y• murdre wrought chefe conspiratour brutus cassius murdre made thordinaunce another brute surnamed decius one also conspyryng vengeaunce wrought cesar slaine france mē may se coastes y• men wende murdre alway requyreth yll ende within space almost thre yere distroied conspiratours sodaine dethe stode daungere banished exyled traitours cronicled aucthours space thre yere tekened one one dyed myschefe murdrers echone murdre prince pitious thing god right take therof vēgeaunce namely emperour famous ech thig world gouernaunce reken cōquestes digne remembraunce peysed one bochas beareth wytnesse hie estate littell sykernesse ☞ xv chapter ¶howe tullius two tymes exyled last slayne pompilius myne auctoure writeth longe processe julius death complaining whyle write tully hast gan dresse compendiously life compile complaining fyrst saith barayne style insufficient write men may sene notable rethoriciene lampe lanterne romayne oratours among called prince eloquence pernaso gathered vp flour rethoricien excellence whose merytes truely recompence mus nyne thought toke hede crowne oflaurer set vpon head bochas astonied gan selfe conclude boke abashed dull corage thought termes reason rude lacked conning langage wherby auauntage though labored wryting liue tullius merites discriue wherof supprised caught fantasy within selfe remembring anonright though fall somtime cloudye skye chased wynde afore son bright yet effect leseth nat light bochas dempte dul writing eclypsed nat tullius shining rude langage man may well reporte laude triūphs cōquestes maruelus thing remembring gretly gā confort herte bochas selfe said thus two colour sene contrarious white blacke may none eche kinde weth phebus presens starres lese light clere midday appereth nat lucine fame tulli whilom shone bright prince fayre speche father y• doctrine whose bright bemes vnto houre shine sothly quod bochas whō whā endite hande fele quaking write giue folke occasion rethorike haue experience haue inspection colour crafte eloquence texite diligence vnto writing whan may attende compassion rudenesse amende vnto selfe hauing langage bochas write gan pen dresse vnder supporte afforced corage remembee thexcellent noblesse oratour swetnesse ditees abrode haue shyned hath worlde moste clerely enlumined tullius singuler famous man fyrste remembre natiuite borne arpinas cite tuscan blode royal discended lyst se grekyshe bokes olde antiquite made rethorike vulgar song translated latin tong tendre youth countre forsoke fro tuscan passage gan dresse towarde rome right way toke entring citie renomed noblesse hydde person wed brightnesse diuers vertues time abode like son hys fame sprede abrode vertues made citezaine good reporte shone clere like borne romaine fauour name entere among chose consulere agayne cite time consulate whan cateline debate prudence tullius manhode rekened bothe fere catelina cruel yrous frowarde porte frowarde chere busy euer finde manere howe might token signe agayne citie couertly maligne sixe hūdred yere fourscore tolde nine rekened rome fro foundacion cruel tyrant proude cateline made coniuracion againe franchise fredame toun first discured bokes tell party boundes tuscan purpose holy cateline imagined false couetyse bryng rome vnto ruine therupon many sondry wise found meanes way gan deuise entent diligent labour cite gette great fauour finally coniuracion discured one quincius afore false vnto toun told case vnto tullius whose prudence working marueilus helpe antony felawe coniuracion broken wtdrawe wytte tulli coniuratours espied brought vnto mischaunce name red tofore senatours falshead tolde gouernaunce manly ordained purueiaunce al people made mencion catelina departed toun antony said cateline besyde pistoy great bataile slaine felde myght nat decline abode whan felde gan fayle power one littel may aueile namely whan falshed malice pride againe trouth dare bront abyde another called lentulus felowes named fabine third eke called cetegus assented sworne cateline strangled prison mischefe fyne cause tullius execucion tulliane called prisone thus coude punishe traitor toun outray enemy manhod prudence called cite gouernour patron sent aboue defence champion digne reuerence chose goddes cite gye two prerogatiues knighthode clergy lyke sonne enlumyne hie prowes knightly excellence world bemes dyd shyne rethorike eloquence whiche great experience circūstaunces nothyng lacke transcended plocius gracke oratours put memorye tullius hie renoun echone honour glorie giue made mencion surmounted al conclusion golden trumpe house fame world blew abrode name knewe secretes philosophy came athens scole doctrine profited greatly clergy science heuenly diuyne called aucthors determyne amonge romayns due right eloquence lanterne light remembred among oratours howe tullius pleted cause twayne romaine courte afore senatours cause defending langage souerain two accused againe playn defautes sauyng fro mischefe court escapyng fro dangere reprefe cause twayne pleted latin excellent flouring fayre langage reason concluded fine wysedome caught thauauntage mater surplusage might aueile vnto partie said coud man denie among grekes athens cite great reputacion famous holde auctorite compared opinion philosopher called platō whose cradell bee dyd abrayde hony sote lyppes layde apronostike like bokes tell plato famous excellence rethorike sour well langage myrrour eloquence yet grekes recorden sentence howe tullius party vnto plato rethorike egall langage said tullius reconciled sote orison lordshyp grace julius prince kinges diuers region suspecte stode accusacions bicause julius disobey wer enclined romains pompey coude appease prudent langage folkes stode discencion crafte speciall auauntage fauour synguler pronunciacion demenyng great prudence reasō pronounsing matter substaūce thanke receiueth chere countenāce gladde mater longeth gladde chere men treat wysdom wt wordes sadnesse pleintes requyre matere greuous morall chere heuines lyke cause outher proces gyueth occasion hinder spede doctrine tullius men may rede name tulli couth many place eloquence euery lande ryfe langage made stand grace preferred al life maried right fayre wyfe child many seruauntes yong olde finde helde good houshoulde de officiis wrote bokes thre de amicitia fynde wrote one age another notable se morall vertue treated euerychone vyncent wrote full yore agone myrrour called hystoriall nombre bokes remēbred wrote also dreme scipion rethorike compiled bokes twayne twayne wrote diuinacion titell land write paine large boke glorie vaine dere publica saith selue oracions wrote bokes twelue dities called morall remembred notably dede said myrrour historiall yet said tullius rede myd worshyps stode alway drede fortune conclusion enuy banished rome toun beyng exile famous tullius campania atiue cite receiued one plaucius man time great authorite abode countre sleping night boke maketh mencion wonder vision thought thus laie sleping desert great wildernesse finding pathe fro romyng howe mette cladde great richesse gaius marius prince great noblesse askyng tulli sadde countenaunce chefe cause greuaunce whan tullius cause tolde disease mortal wo marius hande set holde • ergiaunt assigned right tho hast bad go conuey bu sy cure hast possyble sepulture haue tidinges plesaunce repeyre rome towne alleyed olde greuaunce thende auision next morow made mencion hold tullius great aueile tofore jupiter rome great counsayle within temple buylded marius senatours accorded certaine reconsile prudent tullius exile call home againe receiued lord soueraine eloquence assent senate fully restored vnto fyrst estate thinge whan y• rome toun grettest strife twene cesar pōpey tullius drue caton pompeius cesar warrey julius partie disobey rome tullius dyde hie fledde pompey thessalie cesar free mocion whan stode hiest glorie hym reconsyled againe rome town vpon pompey accomplished victorie julius slaine consistorie sixty senatours assent tullius againe exile sent cite called fariman tullius exile dyd endure antonius enemy bycause percase auenture compiled inuectife scripture agayne antony rehersing caas defautes cleopatra thus enuy mortall haterede deth compassed antonius afterward execute dede procuring one pompilius gate cōmission storie telleth thus false malice forthe anone went gayre compayne cite vertue commission taking antony licence liberte chefe rethorician euer toun among romains worshyp cite slaine ala hate enmyte pompilius rote falshead profering selfe smite head tullius afore defence fro galowes dethe eke let deserued great offence haue ben banged vpon hie gybet saueth thefe whan rope knet necke olde clerkes write false turne ye bribour wil hi quite lo vice ingratitude experience brought fully prefe hert treason doth enclude cast good wyl man reprefe guerdon saue thefe • whan escaped loke ye shall fynde nature euer vnkinde pompilius traitour odible shewe selfe false cruell vēgeable toward tully thing horrible whan dead br • bour culpable smit right hād heare abominable hande lerning toke write vertues many famous boke hande head noble tullius euery man right ought complaine take brought pompilius vpon stake set vp twayne abide shyne rayne wynde weder tyll defyed token al fauour denied ❧ xvi chapter chapiter againe ianglers dyffamers rethorike bochas complaining hys studye alone death tulli wofull fall grudging hert made pitous mone folke rebuking especiall nature boystous rurall hardy ben conning haue craft rethorike hindre depraue clerkes olde greatly magnifie noble science expert wyse called parte philosophy said also prudent auise thre partes tresours gret prise compiled bokes olde prouided philosophie deuided first called morall directeth man good thewes second called natural telleth kinde goodman shrewes thirde racionall well shewes men shal voide thing vnderfong partie rethorike doth belong tullius authours determine person rehersing substaunce traunslated fro greke latine craft rethorike abundance eloquence stuffed plesaunce oratours remembred toforne none like yet borne bochas also saithe writinges preueth wele reason sentence oratour longeth four thinges first natural wyt practike science vertuous life chefe grounde eloquence porte • maner tretable meanes mine auctor hold hi able writing scripture bochas wele parceiueth must nedes ben howe y• right long fiue armures euery notable rethoricien sette order list sene whiche calleth rehersing sentence fiue baners longing eloquence fyrst called inuencion whiche man dothe hert finde secrete grounde founded reason circc̄staunces yt nought left behinde fro poynt poynte imprinted minde touching y• matter ye substaunce great whiche cast notably tentreat another armure order seconde right called disposicion matter whan grounde founde euery thing iust deuision voide al foreine digression disposed touching time space fro superfluite kepe due place third armure named sentence elocucion wordes many fewe matter conueyed iust conuenience diposed order cōuenably shewe like caruer fyrst doth tymbre hewe sqware compasse cast fetures vysage caruing tole maketh vp fayre ymage pronunciacion fourth armure necessary euery oratour case whan craft vnto nature joyned diligent labour elocucion fauour declaring euery circumstaunce folowing mater chere countenaunce heuy mater requireth heuy chere gladde matter longeth well gladnesse man pronounsing must folow matere olde oratours beare herof wytnesse furious complaint vttred distresse ye maner poetes discriue tragedy whan senec liue fifte armure called remembraunce quicke memorie prouidence se auisely groce vp substaunce holy mater nought forgoten lest forgetfulnesse derke nat liberte clere report eche thing haue mynde pronounsing nothing left behind afore prouided forgetfulnesse hindrer inuencion proceding foreyne rechelesnesse trouble nat order disposicion taccomplishe vp reason pronounsing clere remembraunce well fauoured chere countenaūce said thinges inly necessary euery prudent notable oratour nat hasty ouerlong tary conuey processe measure chere according stant fauor pronounsing lacketh chere face tullius schole standeth far grace erthely bestes muet nature saue onely man hath auauntage prerogatiue aboue eche creature vtter conceite onely langage soule grace represseth outrage namely whan reason hath soueraynte bridel passion sensualite kinde vnto man hath giuen eloquence thing conuenable en especial whan conueied prudence talke matter natural secretes hyd aboue celestiall doth entreat sonne mone starres thin •• uent power sent pee warres god hath graunted knowleging onely man wysedom reason langage giue shewyng outwarde make declaracion heuenly course sondrie mocion diuers chaunges plainly diffine reuolucion sphere nyne men langage shewe entente naturall meuing mutacions accorde discorde four elamentes kyndly variaunce four complexion generacion corrupcions erthely thinges contrary eche corrupcion one engendring another power precellence giue man reasonable langage eloquence man taught vertue stable soule eternall body corrumpable taught tong aline defautes howe shall shryue bochas eke telleth touching rethorike two maners one nature lerned youth doth one speke lyke hereth lerneth scripture craft rethorike giue creature saue man great diligence study cometh craft eloquence crafte langage prudent speche causeth prechours spyrituall doctrine vertuously people teche howe shall liue moral discipline langage techeth men plant wine enformeth folke worshyp holy churche artificer truely wurche yet y• plainly teche pr • che haue langage opinion god hath nat regard vnto speche heart affection best gan guerdon inwarde intencion euery man nat visage like meuing inward corage langage great diuersite whan men shew theffect mening beit ioye aduersite chere taccorde therwith vttring nowe debonayre som rebuking rehersing like chere alway tapply rudenesse curtesy discrecion sette difference pronounsinge perce vndermine drawe iudge vnto sentence purpose make encline se wheder melancolike benigne matere vttred vnclosed consider afore howe disposed peised thing rethoricien thiges apperteine right craft speche must conceiue sene mater substaunce matter y• light dispose selfe tentreate euery wight like purpose fine matiere time rethorike dothe require ensample myne auctor dothe recorde men set warre hert farre sonder rethoricien make taccorde must seche wayes meanes yonder olde rancour tappeise ye boystous thunder wise example prouerbes pertinent tenduce party one assent man also stant heuinesse dispeired disconsolate rethoricien must busynesse grounde considred felt estate cause serched stant dissolate reforme diligent labour true office euery oratour rethoriciens whilom olde sugred langage vertuous daliaūce good ensample prouerbes y• tolde wordes pesible enbelished plesaunce appesed tyrantes great vēgeaunce sette aside furious sentence vertue onely prudent eloquence contrary plainly conclude men se day clere experience folke vnauised hasty foles rude braynlesse people wylfull negligence bycause barraine eloquence vttryng speche naked men bare lacke rethorike matter declare clere exāple purple taketh hede lōgeth kinges storie ye may finde clothes golde riche veluet wede fret ruby stone inde saphirs emeraudes peerles kynde thinges appropred right plesaunt obiectes mannes sight langage rethoriciens gladde obiecte mannes audience song melodious musiciens whiche doth great cōfort euery presence example amphion wt song eloquence buylded walles thebe cite rethorike great subtilite langage gret plesaunce finding therby inly great profite countre came obeysaunce speke great delite people enuyron appetite person peace bataile may se rethorike doth aueile ☞ xvii chapiter ¶ howe sextus warreied againe triumuir death great antonie cleopatra folowing thorder bochas boke wyth penne hande caste vp eie tofore came pale chere loke mighty prince sonne vnto pompeye called sextus whiche bokes saye delyted hym wyth greate nauee lyke pyrate robbe see father contrary suche caas euery pyrate custome dyd hate vpon sea whose vsage theim proudelye debate pursued early eke late sextus great reprie • e sea robbour thefe sclaundre gan sprede farre reported many farre countre triumuir sextus gan war office dignite romains cōmytted vnto thre notable estate chiualry thempire hole gouerne gye fyrst named lepidus seconde called octauian third nombre antonius thre sextus proud man surquedy newe warre began afore julius rebellion banished euer rome toun triumuir politike gouernaunce well auised afore reason treating peace notable purueiaunce proude sextus vnder condicions write enacte conuencious anone list tary promise froward contrary conuycte outragious falsnesse sea robbery bochas writeth long processe hauing disdaine name magnify vertue list nothing apply different cause state atwene knighthode life pyrate fugitiue theues robbours men exiled rome toun banished people false conspyratours conuicte murdre trayson toke vnder protection one moena churle certaine fourty shyppes made capitain said churle vnwarely tho began folow nature condicion alied selfe octauian againe lorde full false traison nauy shyppes came doun spared nat mete pride menecratus yt sextus side al soone bataile began party togider shoulde gone vesselles octauian sodaine tēpest drowned echone beside castell buylt lime stone called nauleton yet gret reprefe sextus fled brought mischefe went grece make strong agein holde batayle antonius take cōming strength capitcin longing antonie called phurnius whilom nephue cesar julius duke sextus might farther wende slaine made ende triumuir thempyre tolde capitaine called lepidus whiche office like holde right busy boke reherseth thus reconsile proude antonius grace great octauian eche thing forgiue wherof war began conclude shortly list se fortune whyle gracious thempyre whole gouerned three lordshyp affrike lepidus wext proude contrarius assigned vnder commission fully nombre twenty legion wherof herthe caught pride causing processe distruction surquedy gide fro estate till fall doun namely whan false presumpcion toke vpon malice warrey said octauian gan disobey whan octauian malice dyd se gan waxe sodainly contrary threw downe dignite cast exile list lengar tary lo fortune gan sodainly vary make gouernaunce affryke come mischaunce another prince cesar lucius exiled rome cite vncle said antonius wylfulnesse hasty cruelte time men may rede se contriued cause founde vp malice texile prince notable holde wyse bycause helde cesar pompey y• helde partie good afore wer ware suspection enuy coude nat flatter lie vertues great routhe bycause stable trouthe trouble dredefull odious rehersed order ye may rede noble knight paulus lucius exiled malice hatered folowing vpon great horrible dede pitous death hatefull caas great antonie cleopatra tragedy ylke twaine nowe shalbe set asyde cause chaucer chefe poete britaine seing hertes coude nat deuide boke legende cupide remembring one endure buryed one sepulture thing one said labour chaucer presumpcion make againe whose making notable enteer right compendious notable certayne reherce labour vayne▪ bochas remembring cleopatra caused antonie howe distroied auarice importable supprised great fayrnesse folowing lustes foule abhominable desyring haue empresse ala frowarde wylfulnesse please vnhappely began warrey great octauian frowarde ambicion set hert fyre climbe vp imperiall sea haue possession hole empyre toke vpon wolde haue reigne alone rome cite cleopatra foster pride tytell octauian set asyde multytude many legion haue tolde againe octauian accroched diuers region great multytude many manly man first sea warre began maugre might confusion vnwarely put flight dispeyred fled home countre knowing helpe meane recure thencreas aduersite whan sawe woful auenture gaine octauian might nat endure sharpe swerde danger diuert selfe rofe vnwarely hert whose dethe quene cleopatra toke sorow importable bicause recure caas thought wo would partable whose fatall ende piteous lamentable slough eke selfe loue raue buried one graue ❧ thus endeth sixt boke foloweth seuenth ¶ antony son heire greate antonie cesarius julia agrippa cassius galbus ¶ fyrst chapter storie ended last sixte boke bochas wery thought best gret traueile oppressed loke fil slombre leanīg chest fully purpose haue take rest euin rest haue take came great prees made tawake first felowship came son heyre antonie wt blode spreint wede called antonie fall great dispeyre cause octauian bare haterede whose swerde fled quaking drede olde temple socour haue trusting fro death place h • saue temple cesar deified whō romains set vp ymage whan sawe espied ran julius hie vpon stage gan enbrace piteous rage rent away sodaine violence vnwarely slaine gained defence next order came cesarius fill wondre pitous caas whilom beget cesar julius vpon yong fayre cleopatra slaine youth thus writeth bochas octauian dyd selfe assigne gaine romains nat maligne folowing order julia began hir greuous complaint bochas specify whilom doughter great octauian weping gan houle crie father punish lechery exiled countre lacke socour died pouerte son agrippa yong tendre age borne hie blode bochas doth expresse came next order pale visage spent time slombre idelnesse froward vertue wretchednesse octauian great touthe suffred die mischef slouth agrippa came forth anone right cassius parme famous great countre itaile holde māly knight marke antony wele cherished secre bode court withall parde greatly alowed fyrst chiualry notable famous policy withall existence right great name stode great fauour knighthode hie prudence accused vnto emperour octauian coniuratour haue frowarde false entent julius death fully assent whiche bidding octauian take yong age mine auctor well remembre brought tofore julius hie vpon stage offred vp vnto ymage cruell death▪ storie telleth thus false murdre cesar julius death saide cassius another came rome cite rede called galbus pretour hauing dignite suspection slaine eke eyen fyrst head rent julius death exile sent toward exile brigantes slaine within litel labour nouther gladde ne faine bochas began dyrecte stile great herodes breuely compile greuous fal holy manere set order next ye shall ii chapter ❧ tyraūt herodes slough wyfe chyldren died myschefe remembrynge fyrste jurye kyng antipater father lyst se arabia mightely reignyng ouer prouynce called idume herodes gardeyne galile ordayned fyrste hye prudence notable knyghtly excellence famous manhode famous lyne famous also procreacion rede also wyues nyne amonge made mencion hys pleasaunce opinion maister story reherseth one mariannes fayrest echone worthy sonnes twayne alysander aristobolus suster dyd disdaine called saloma storie telleth thus vnto wext suspicious bycause accused enuy saloma touchyng auoutry agayne rancour sodaynly gan herte greuously disdayne rigorous hert slewe furiously storie doth v ascertayne deth felte great paine euer whan came remembraunce porte chere womāly plesaunce lo prince hasty euery tale rancour assent counsaylles procede wilfully execucion frowarde false entent herodes sore dyd repent thought fyl noy hertely sorowe malencoly rest none nouther day ne nyght troubled fury wext frantyke wt dremes vexed many vncouth syght chere colour man lyke euery moneth one lunatike great whyle wofull lyfe sorowe onely slayne wyfe storye wel reherce capitoyle mydde rome cite antonye octauian crowned made kyng jude senate made theron decree registred kynred shulde lande lineally procede rome made confirmacion herodes bokes specifye beyng afore translacion made juda jurye septer crowne regaly hym vsurped ye haue herde toforne vpon tyme whan christ borne herodes procuracion antonye dyd also occupy augustus plener remission great estate called tretrarchy two kyngdoms al regaly traconitides jtury eke also romains made lorde bothe two mayster story reherseth hym thus commendacion especiall aschalon buylded stately hous right great cost palayes ful royal none riche reken whych myne authoure doth wryte called herode aschalonite herodes cruell nature chere porte passyng ambicious aye venged dyd busy cure al hym contrarious hys wyues brother aristobolus jerusalem chefe byshoppe rede falsely slough malyce hatered vniustly reigned borne realme hert fret cankred wyth enuy another byshoppe jerusalem called hircanus myne authour lyst lye herodes malencoly slewe hym vnwarely rācour vengeable setting dyner owne table man corrage cxuel desirous magnified make name also perpetual four statelye city hath edified name specified cesaria sebastin citees souerayne antipadra cipre twayne also false condition trusted none kynrede sonnes twaine suspectiō purpose sley hatred whan deade hopyng succede causelesse father vnkynde made thē slayne story thus fynde al workyng founde double great tirant hold throgh realme neuer thinge greatly dyd trouble whan thre kinges came jerusalem jesu seche borne bethelem boldly affirmynge cause commynge worshyp blessed yonge kyng thynge whan dyd aduertise prophecy remembringe writinges within hym selfe meane gan deuise first distroy famous holy kynges namely whan knewe offrynges imaginyng gan suppose blyue child borne shuld depriue newly discended fro dauid doun line cast almost herodes rage cursed hert gan frowardly maligne lyke tirant venomous outrage slewe al child within two yere age bethelem ful large space spared none fauour grace one chyldren beyng nurcery story putteth remembraunce auenture coude espy knightes slough trowe vengeaūce eche tirant gladly endeth mischaūce much wext ayen christ wode sake shedde innocētes blode nōbre childre slayne dede bethelem tho party hundred forty four rede two yere age sought espies herodes prophecy christes byrth mencion make echone slayne sake fro day forth made mencion fyl many vncouth malady flesh gan tourne corrupcion frette wyth wormes vpon eche party whiche assailed great tourmentry legges swole corbed blacke gan shyne vengeaūce worketh adue al medicine sickenes stenche horible awayte man myght abyde vnto selfe carrayne wext odible sore troubled eche syde lech hym bath prouide al nought mischefe stode greuous constraynt sodēly wext wode token wery lyfe importable mortal paine pare apple asked sharpe knyfe malady dyd hym constraine fully purpose cut herte twayne knife raught leysar whan founde one stode besyde bacwarde drue hond payne vnneth winde might drawe gaue al frendes commaundement decree furious lawe al worthy party adiacēt whiche y• faine glad entente dethe voyde pitee day shoulde slayne cursed wretche odious caytife rede none stode farther grace sorowe mischefe ended hath lyfe eche man glad whan shoulde pace storye doth boke difface wofull clause whan wryte therefore cast tendite ¶ lenuoy herodes vnware cursed fall lyfe vngracyous hym hys kinrede euer vengeable estate roial hys wyfe childre slough olde hatered innocentes made bethelem blede reignyng juda borne foreyne lygne fyrst tyrant ye may byble rede whych ayen christ gan frowardly maligne hys swerde rigour cruel mortal aye redy whet vengeaunce dede hasty fumous fury infernall wylfull malice innocētes blode shede dyd execucion also womanhede slewe alies whiche cursed signe fyrste cause stode drede whiche againe christe gan frowardly maligne woulde none hym egall daye alyue israell succede byrthe christ dred especiall cause fro jesse line gan floure sede forrayne came fraude mede without titell estate vndigne fyrst also lyst take hede whiche agayne christe gan frowardely maligne noble prince gouerne ouer large world length brede whan sitte hyest royall stall people oppresse ouerlede vpon herodes remembre rede mischefe tyrant dyd fyne shewe y• none shal hys purpose spede whyche ayen christ doth cursedly maligne iii chapiter ¶ antipas exiled octauian archelaus sonne herodes seconde compendiouslye thus ye haue herde fal herodes remembred bochas testament set especiall succede herode antipas hast exiled hym thys ca octauian vien rede archelaus ordained succede sonne herodes called seconde effect toke possession hierusalem reigned rede mine aucthor short conclusion maketh boke small mencion hym hys brother set sodainly asyde write lenger lyst abyde saue writeth forsaide antipas vien mighty great cite exyle soone slayne archelaus succeding jude herodias lyst storyse agrippa tiberye accused certayne crime coude excused certaine time cōmaunded prison themperour coude neuer get grace banished fer hys region spaine certayne space worshyp breuely deface fortune caused final reprefe died pouerte mischefe fatal ende rehersed twayne distresse dyd fyne myne auctour gan pen ordaine write case many wofull lyne vpon striefe wene messalyne twayne standynge syde tofore jhon bochas howe dyd chyde tofore bochas came thre playne messalyne wyfe vnto claudius againe twayne calligula tiberius whose time slaine christ jesus touching y• debate amōg thre suyng processe folowyng ye shal se iiii chapter ¶ strife bytwene calligula tiberius messalyne thys empresse named messalyne haue tolde wyfe vnto claudius successour bokes determyne calligula called gayus fynde tiberius calligula wode tene stode afore bochas messaline atwene metynge al thre furious loke chere gayus calligula called name gan first reherce anone ye shall without reuerence maner shame exordye diffame bochas present felly gan abrayde messalyne euen thus sayde thou sclaundred woman noysed lechery thrugh world folke thy name atwite reported thine aduoutry doest y• thy mournyng habite▪ trowe thou commest purpose visite place vnhappy woman fiue touchinge disclaundre euer alyue first called emilia lepyda named seconde liuia plaucia fyfthe elya diffamed echone dede founde token wherof lechery confounde emilia auoutry take lawe lorde forsake whylom knowe drusus strangled murdred poyson lyke claudia doughter claudius lorde booke maketh mēcion throwen confusion defautes founde auoutry sclaundred euer remedy thou coudest whylom make thy lorde slepe certaine drinkes cast rage made bedde kepe get layser thy flouring age misuse false lust thyne outrage nightertyme toke vpon thee wede bordell dyddest amysse mede thyne appetite vnstaūcheable shame write expresse thyne hateful lyfe abhominable tibery beare hereof wytnesse worde anone gan dresse whan herde al fel langage gaue answere wyth sad visage certes quod coude neuer kepe saue selfe woful creature haue great cause complayne cry wepe sclaūdrous lyfe may recure suppose nature one dayes olde astronomer father tolde byrthe takyng ascendent tolde longe afore misgouernaunce sonne mone towarde orient signe beareth balaūce sayde also assuraunce signe discripcion fote virgyn armes scorpion amid heuen venus exaltate wt mar cōioyned boke maketh mēcion jupiter also infortunate sayd disposicion within fyshe helde tho mancion thus lordshyp plainely venus disposed lecherous excuse sayde messalyne gan alledge constellacion prudent clerkes plainly determine heuenly course disposicion obeysaunt subiecte reason euery man well gouerned constrayned force amys byndeth man necessitie vicious lustes frowardly sue vertuous man stante liberte false inclinacions prudence remewe euery man grace may eschewe al thynge vertue founde contrary synne voluntarye yet sayde messalyne excuse woulde pee heuyn quod poetes determyne borne vp whylom myghty hercules yet coude neuer nature haue relees al knighthod chiualry ouercome vyce lechery thou calligula thou tiberius euer ye say take thereof none hede thou calligula called eke gaius thy selfe diffouled lechery dede rebuke y• shouldest stande drede thy rebuke party quyte defouled none shoulde atwyte fame trūpe thy sclaūdre blowe worlde reported shamefully thy thre susters fleshely thou dydest knowe wexe rede shame thy party vice hateful lecherye durynge thy life putme blame whiche art thy selfe defouled sitteth maner wyse thefe theft syt iudgement lecherous man lechour chastise hath al lyfe spent waste riote forfeted miswent iudge redresse leprous lech cure men sickenes woulde haue suffred take pacience affricke chaste scipion rebuked great offence would haue suffred worde iust reson famous prudent olde caton agayne case made abrayde would haue suffred euer hehad saide lucrece correction layd vertuous doctrine forfetes myd rome toun would haue bowed backe chine haue obeyed vnto discipline shame creple stād y• hath mighte rebuke go vpright agaynst also may reply many false conspiracion touchyng mater nygromancy many contriued false poyson foūde two bokes bochas maketh menciō one called pugio supersticious seconde named gladius able worlde tenuenyme encloy againe thre state dwelling rome toun name write thou cast distroy remembre great abuston chest also fulfilled poyson thy dethe cast thee see rede hundred fish deade mater tedious abyde namely prince princess borne hie estate sitteth gentle bloud chide furious rancour stande debate mater ben infortunate wyl passe ouer write saue ende cōpendiously endite tiberye haue somwhat sayne knowe reported many creature chāpaine folke dysdayne thy hateful lecherous ordure thilke vice whych agayne nature whiche taccōplish voyde al hap grace thine abydyng suspicious place false lustes duringe thy lyfe lyst forbeare thy latter age thou vsidst many rich restoratife vnthrift encreace thy corrage ribaudy thou fyll suche dotage howe mayst thou rebuke shame case art blotted diffame dyd amysse youth horrible thinges gaius hath tolde thine outrage reporte yet couthe thou dydest vse yonge olde tafforce vice manifolde thou caligula ribaudy dyd greatest surfet frowarde glotony also tiberye thou beyng emperour cruel causelesse malicious diddest murdre rome famous orator called tyme prudent asinius thrugh thempire romains tolde thus light lanterne founde assayes rethorike called dayes thou eke cause werthy nonomus kyng parthois thy cruelte exyled thou couetous haue possession treasour parde died mischefe pouerte shamefast wyght accuse case thy selfe excuse agripyne thou dyddest great outrage romayne story well reherce whan socour great ymage ran saued octauian myd temple place called whiche halpe y• lyst thyder wende put force hunger made ende thyne owne brother called germanicus tyme good knyght thy brother also called eke drusus poysoned slayne agaynst ryght false cōspiring thine imperial might texcuse murdre thy selfe leest clad blacke funerall feest haue connyng spech langage reherce make mencion specially ye great outrage sacrilege thou dyddest rome toun violence whan thou drewe doun ymage janus hast tibre thou madest cast thou caligula among thy vice surquedye false presumpcion wouldest men god shoulde call twen pollux castor haue thy manciō fro place thou art nowe throwe doun whych helde thy selfe amōg goddes seuen egall jupiter syt heauen answere beyng presence four mar janus minerue mercurie god eloquence hath rent downe thou dydest deserue fro jupiter mischefe sterue thou herafter wher y• laugh froune shalt haue fauour wt rown defautes many afore reherced hindring thy name howe thou ordaynest fyrst sle thy brother wt mē armes thi gret shame tholome thou didest also sonne heire kyng jubatoun many senator thou slew rome toun shittest vp myd rome cite garner neuer afore seine wherby enfamyned commonte pite plat playne necessite constrayned certayne shame reherce put scripture ete membres thyng againe nature jupiter juno goddesse gaue suche counsayle suppose vnto venus flater thy hyghnes furious mar frowarde cruelte slee senatours greatest cite thy self wherof towne faine thy seruauntes murdred werte slayne tabate thyne outrage thy pryde thou hast vsed thy lyfe lyfte vp thyne head loke thy left syde thou finder vp murdre strife slew▪ thou cesonia thy wyfe thy doughter called drusil cursed entent thy malyce fulfyl haue meruayle howe twayne thou calligula thou tiberius ashamed thyng sayne agayne vysage dispitous atwite lecherous small mote ye abrayde eye beame ye se haue soules take herbergage contrayre striue trowe caron hath made passage vp stronde hell aryue ye abyde thus descryue dredful stix called infernall flode custome rēneth wt furious wawes wode radamantus one iudges twayne kyng mynos hath youe iudgemente perpetually ye shall byde payne eacus hath ordained turmente flegeton floode violent ye shall drowned ende make euer abyde amonge ye stremes blake may cal emperours refuse ye shamefast shew visage astonyed dredful confuse haue vncurtoys langages thus messalyne daunted corrages feminine crabbed eloquence durst lenger abyde presence v chapter ¶ vicious tiraunt nero slewe peter paule last selfe thys hateful story many woful lyne calligula tiberius touchynge strife atwene messalyne shamful rebuke frowarde odious rehersed chere furious ye haue herde ended chiding nero tyrant cōmeth next vpon ringe one cursed comparison euer hye lowe degre disnaturall condicion great outrage cursed cruelte euer reigned rome cite father called bokes determyne domicius mother agripine agripina subtilte blinde fortune fauourable set vp tirauntes froward volunte demerites though able estate imperial notable thinge dredefull vnderstande cruel tirauntes wt blody sword hāde▪ whan nero age twelue yere ordeyned especial lerned gramere seuin artes called liberall vnto mayster al vertues morall called morall senec dyd payne al vice hys youthe restraine kept euer thys senec rede maugre fatall disposicion constraint maner drede al outrage inclinacion conceyued wel hys dysposicion vicious nature restrayne dyd busy cure one twenty wynter age croniculers written thus howe tyme toke mariage octauia doughter claudius al whyle beyng vertuous whyle senec vnder discipline mother lawe called messaline saide senec made desire pursue connyng diligent labour entring fyrst empyre meane whan crowned emperour al senate great fauour report clerkes wryte prose meter coude ryght wel endite jhon bochas made mynde dyd excell greatly poetry made tho dayes also fynde boke notable straunge poesy lyke myne auctour doth specify title thereof called lusce agayne pretour claudius polle excelled musike armony crowned laurer ye best harpour tyme edify rome palays wyth manye ryche tour whych buylding cost great treasour circuite beyng thre thousande paas transitory palays called thys cause put memory sayde palays afterwarde brent therefore called transitory nero entent let buylde house great auysement recompence olde called ryche house golde thys worlde none lyche euer men dyd ryde gone table yuorye fret wyth perry ryche pyllers cristal garnished many stone saphyrs rubyes topasion crisolytes emeraudes grene wyth plate golde siled shone ful shene bodily lust dilectacion sayde nero set al hys desyres▪ gardayns condyttes recreacion dyd ordayne endure many yeres nettes golde fyshed hys ryuers garnementes golde inde stone neuer woulde haue one hys begynning story doth deuyse lorde emperour cyte senatours gaue full great fraūchyse graunted cōmons many great liberte imperial dignite frowarde wyl left good policy al atones gaue ribaudry grece egypt wyth diuers iogelours amonge villayns selfe dysportinge left presence olde senatours amōg ribaudes woulde harpe sing made comodies dishonestly sowning bordel dyd selfe auaunce common woman openly daūce thus processe al vertue contrary great excesse fyll glotony lyst lenger tary euery vice doth apply surfet riot brought lechery ground al chefe porteresse exyle vertue frowarde ydlenes cite called hostience besyde tibre freshe riuers dyd ordaine excessife expence tentes riot coke tauerners al nyght reuel aboute fiers lady came afore well named false riot afterwarde defamed nero false abusion reported hys story lyst se violence religion auowed chastite professed virginite temple vesta goddesse froward lust dyd oppres amonge whych rubria one maugre wyll durst denye temple buylded lime stone sacred vesta myne auctour lyst lye rent vse lecherye withstandyng religious made abyde borde • hous wryting men shall neuer rede matter foule outragious reherced horible dede nero vsed whylom sporus called ompharus male chyldren bokes tel transfourme likenes womā bokes hym determine lyke ribaude horrible detestable misused mother agripine lyke tiraunt cruel vengeable remember abhominable made wombe corue vpon daye se place nyne monethes lay disnatural hateful cruelte god vertue hauyng regarde vyce prodigalite accused knyghthod cowarde al vertue contrary frowarde who wodenes good hede whan toke ashamed set hym thys booke hated al vertuous special enuy hys brethern wyfe tirant dyspitous falsly slewe hys malencoly mayster senec auctours specifye aye whan saw hauīg maner drede hote bathe deth made blede polifagus wodeman sauage fed fleshe man nero toke men olde yonge age fynde vitayle stretes cāe cursed ende cursed whan gan whan dyd offre innocentes blode deuoured ran wode christes fayeth fyrst gan werreye emperours hys frowarde entent peter paule rome made deye vpon day legende dothe assent halfe cite rome fynde brent senatours welnye euerychone nero slewe spared almost neuer one made hys mule shod wyth siluer shone surquedye whan shoulde ryde cite brent romayns sone pursued vpon euery syde subarbe abyde twene salaria numentana right ther stant path whyder toke hys flyght depe mary nero toke flyght whan saw myght asterte pursued romayne knyght fynde socour myght dyuerte roue selfe anone vnto herte wyth sharpe dagger cursed ende lo false tiraunt called nero stede lenuoye nero write lenuoye dedes make mencion rede processe man haue ioye al concludeth murdre treason aduoutry excesse poyson riot glotony lechery vengeaunce slaughter selfe ended mischaūce myght wolde race name boke man rede vicious lyfe chefe myrrour diffame set hym asyde let wyght take hede remembre many cruell dede saue onely thys thinke substaunce howe euery tiraunt endeth mischaunce cast wrytenowe say sayde reprefe vyces wrought yore duryng empyre concluding chefe tyrannye shall ende wyth myschefe recorde nero misgouernaūce ye haue herde ended wyth mischaunce vi chapter howe eleazarus jewe borne extorcion robbrye brought prison ended aater nero came eleazarus jewe byrth price robbry extorcioner cruel dispitous outrage party redresse hateful tiranny mighty pretour sent fro rome doun called felix region force felix take bounde maugre myght vnto rome sent strongly fettred wyth massy chaynes roūd suffred prison many great turment last iudgement abyde thefe euermore ended mischefe vii chapter heade galba smytten filled ful golde offred sepulture nero tofore bocas next came galba whych spayne dyd many knyghtly dede deth rehersed neroun hope stode galba rede thempyre iustly succede parcell knightehode hath hym well borne great mariage beforne finde bochas rehersed sentence disclaundred hateful vice thre cruell contrary clemence straite keping gayne liberalite vengeable herte gayne mercy pitie thynge sitting vnto chyualry custome yeue slouth slogardy occupye thempyre began among romains toke possession claiming title one licy • ian sonne adopcion anone presumpcion one called occho full manly knyght smyt head wronge ryght sayd galba mine auctour writeth thus empire vn warely pulled doun enemy called patrobolus head galba toke possession filled golde made oblacion sepulture nero therewithal goddes goddess infernall viii chapter howe occho vitellius glottony lechery ribaudry crueltie ended mischefe thys offryng full doo ye haue herde bochas make hys complainte order came pyso afore surnamed iustly lycinian sonne adoptyfe tel began sayde galba claimyng succede slaine anone occho rede thempire parted three occho toke rome vnto partye vitellius reigne countre ouer boundes germanye vaspasian reigned surrey fyrst occho surnamed siluius came complaine cruel dispitous al thempire siluius slaughter rauyne extorcion murdre dethe dedes outragious mighty hande toke possession began great deuision whiche occasion great sorowe woo atwene vitellius sayde occho reherced germanye sondry place battayls three whych occho wyth hys partye venquished felde made hys fone flee fortune mutabilite fourth tyme playnly caas maugre hys myght discomfited ther tofore bedry myghty stronge cite germanye discomfiture frowarde cruelte sayde occho seyng auenture wo supprised might endure constraint unportable payne toke sworde roue herte twayne vitellius hauing victory power made mencion surquedy false vayne glory came hoste rome toun bochas maketh discripcion rehersing shortly byrth eke lyne blode saturnyne say saturnus king crete chaced jupiter region ianus itayle take sete vpon mount called ianiculum nowe rome bilte large toun ianus receuyng liberalite whan saturne fled cite tofore y• cōming saturne fayle rude boystous beastial reason al people abyding itayle land none sowe turned vp doun marchaundise vsed toun tyll saturne taught maner liuyng tilth labour ianus kyng afore whose commyng tofore tolde craft none vsed creature building house newe olde liued beastes liuelode recure lyke learned nature coude tho day make cloth ne shape frosty wether greuous colde tescape busy costfull apparayle sundry meates confection diuers drinkes manifolde vitayle curious refection marketts none city tounes man wyth bought solde tyll saturne came thē maner tolde whan taught manere set ordre gouernaunce symple people bokes v lere lyke god attendaunce wt certaine rightes obseruaunce worshipped call saturne myghty goddes al saturne made petegre set ordre conueied lyne discending downe maner list se one latinus forth lauine doughter poetes determie thus discēt fro saturne faunus borne blode came vitellius fyrst knyght borne linage bycause manly ryght famous armes prowesse great corrage called vitellius publius came vitellus lucius father mine auctour doth expresse haue gonne processe diuers story remembre plainly tell hys youthe stode liberte sayde called vitell vicious y• might yeue ribaudy al dishoneste chaūged name called spintour name great diffame finde hasardour workes passyng riotous surfetes great emperour whilom called claudius dedes maners outragious great waste prodigalite great dispce fell pouerte amonge riotes surfetes moe one whiche countreis finde nede solde stone mother bare whylom eare olde time vsed list lere woman tyme hye degre bare eares stone perre sellyng rych stone whych receyued great treasour subtyll workyng sleightes mo one gate trendes made emperour therewithall dyd eke labour receyue another dignite chefe byshop rome cite short tyme thys vitellius thempyre toke al state sworde receiued cesar julius vsed garnement purpurate dempt selfe fortunate wt stāding boldely time atleest aliensoys holden feest aliensoys solempnite amonge romaynes kept dayes olde frēch myne auctour recordeth thus parde tyme custome man shoulde statute bounde holde maner occupacion touched vnto religion duryng feast haue hys askyng custome vsed cite vitellius emperour kyng asked time another dignite chefe byshop haue auctorite estate wyth power hole playne man hardy reply theragayne al vertue vytel dyd vary set nought al wysdome science thought vnto necessary cōning knighthode māhode prouidēce gaue hym onely slouth negligence glotony folowyng desyres watche alnyght wyth drinke • eresoupers beyng byshop panym lawe lyke romayne ryghtes doynge seruise tofore goddes wold selfe wtdrawe cast asyde senser sacrifice call boy ful vngodly wyse kechyn boye tofore hye auter hym cōmaūded bryng hym hys dyner beyng arayed pontificail maner voyde deuocion lyke ribaude lyke wode minstral euer dronkle ceason gorge vpon gorge excessyue gloton ydropike dranke oft agayne lust dranke athrust thys byshop sacred sathan emperour crowned wyth mischaūce lyke porte beast man vsed al power slaughter vengeaūce shed blode set hys pleasaunce takynge hede nouther wrong ne right thus wexte hatefull euery wyght hys soudiours forsoke hym nye echone al party hym sent al countreis septemtrion al surry towarde orient one accorde one assent echone forsoke hym wyth bode mā became seruauntes vaspasian vitellius sawe wolde none feble dronknenes outrage sawe power gan fayle hys brother whan sent signed voyage agayne vaspasian holde hys passage al nought backward went hys party stode dyspayred euery remedy thus vitellius vnhappy werres lyke fordronke vnhappy gloton whose bost afore raught vp sterres al hys pryde mischefe come doun fayne accord thys conuencion litel treasour whych men shoulde hym assygne vaspasian thempyre resygne thys promise held nought sayd worde neuer stable certaine flaterers chaūged hys thoughte certayne comōs euer chaūgeable gaue coūsaile sayd hym selfe able gouerne thestate imperial none able reken al fyrst almayne sent soudiours presumpcion newe werre gan thought y• amōge werriours able fight agayne vaspasian auenture befell werres vaspasians brother yslayne woulde none froward man called vitellius vngracious euer founde hys entent smyt head sayde fabius brother vaspasiā rome sent capitoyle brent suynge within lytel space among romayns lost hap grace hys riot shoulde entrete except riot nothynge hym rede coke pastelere folke mete serue lustes appetite fede forsoke went wyth hym dede toward champayne ryght lyne vp hyll called auentyne standing hope vayne vaspasian fauour recure euyn rome retourned agayne palays entred selfe assure hauyng none creature gate shyt whych shame take last forsoke hys owne name halfe naked halfe clad al alone lyke founde citie afore people lad handes behynde hys backe bounde mighty chaines rope rounde lyke woodeman loke visage people hauing langage thou olde lecherous foule gloton cowarde al vertue contraire cruel vengeable thy condicion euery good man cruell aduersayre cursed benygne debonayre rote al surfetes hauyng aye delyte sue folowe thy lecherous appetite rebuke castyng ordure donge clay blotted vysage presence many creature cordes drawe great outrage vnto place called langage chefe rackes galowes toun custome done execucion men remēbre slayne haste wt sharpe swordes dismēbred y• grounde carayne tybre caste large hoke yron sharpe rounde reuerence stinking hounde remembring myne auctour saith also vitellius galba occho affyrmyng thus partie named among emperours time state occupie first galba record auctours died mischefe voide socours eyght monethes reigned lorde syre cast empyre thyrde moneth made mencion occho died proude ambicious fynde dominacion last eight monethes vitellius proude lecherous cruel vengeable borne cursed lyue wretchydnesse echone fyne ix chapter ☞ bochas glottonye complayneth saying followeth bochas seing great offence foresaid froward company toke penne entere diligence studie gan selfe apply dampne vice hatefull glotony sinne recorde adame mischeues sorowes came outrage disobeysaunce said father paradise twene vertu ther rose gret distaūce clerely conceiued wyse aboue creature reason bare prise tyll foly wrongly gan assent gouerned false serpent innate vertues anone forsake assenting haste retourne heuin whan infernall snake stede vertue man soiourne whiche haue great matter mourne sithe disfourmed certaine vicious liuing vertue made barayne thus came dominacion vice al helde great battaile retinue sent infernall dongeon v woful wretch erthe assaile stretching power proudly gan preuayle world possession toke demerites whan vertue v forsoke saide vertues comprised nombre foure rekened prudēce attemperaunce vicious life tadawed v fro y• slombre rightwisnesse haue holde balaunce fortitude aliaunce whan forsoke mankinde gouerne vertue clipsed lanterne thus derknesse vice bolde multitude almost innumerable among rekened newe olde foure perillous repreuable slouth lechery abhomynable false aurice gredy desyre glotony chefe kyndler fyre nature sothe littel content mine auctour abideth whyle remembre somwhat diligent write whan saturne reigned yle called crete prophetesse sibyle time great auctorite world deuided prudently thre x chapiter chapiter discriuinge golden worlde saye whan attemperaunce holy gouernaunce world whā saturne first kinge reigninge crete royall estate noe abraham vertuous liuing caused erthly folke fortunate world tho day called aureate sobrenesse attempraunce worlde holy gouernaunce y• time wronge violence enuie exiled euery creature dissolucion dronken insolence rybaudy al suche foule ordure frowarde surfetes contrary nature banyshed bycause attemperaunce world holy gouernaunce youth bridled vnder discipline vertuous study floured myddle age drede helde yarde norture doctrine riot restrained surquedous outrage hatefull detraction repressed langage kouth charite bycause attemperaunce world holy gouernaunce fortitude stode tho might defended wydowes cherished chastyte knighthod prowesse gaue clere light gyrte sworde trouthe equire helde vp church spiritual dignite punished heritikes bicause attemperaunce worlde holy gouernaunce rightwisnesse chastised robbours egall balaunce execucion fraude false mede put backwarde fro iurours trewe promise holde made delacion swering shamed durst entre toun lesingmongers bycause attemperaunce worlde holy gouernaunce golden worlde coude loue god drede seuyn dedes mercy vse riche redy almesdede asked harbour men nat refuse man malice would tho accuse diffame neighbour bicause attēperaunce world holy gouernaunce true marchaūt mesure bought sold disceite none artifycer makīg balkes y• plough truly hold abacke stode ydelnesse fer fro laborer discrecion marciall dyner souper content measure bycause attēperaūce worlde holy gouernaunce waste clothing yt time excesse men might ye lorde frō subiectes know difference made twene pouerte rychesse twene princesse state lowe horned beastes boste tho blowe countrefte faining bicause attēperaūce worlde holy gouernaunce golden worlde long endure none alay metal sene tyll saturne cesed recorde scripture jupiter reigned put father clene chaunged obrison siluer shene vp downe bycause attemperaunce set aside lost gouernaunce martes mineral metal stronge inflexible nat malliable sturdinesse people wronge rigorous sword furious vengeable merciful golde phebus nat plicable haue compassion bicause attemperaunce set asyde lost gouernaunce leed philosopher called gold leprus tyn jupiter crasshing dull soun false fugitife mercurius mone mutable condicion golden worlde tourned vp doun eche estate sithe attemperaunce set aside lost gouernaunce sibyles exposicion take metall moralite golden world gouerned reson world yron furious cruelte mone mutable full duplicite lyke worlde bicause attemperaunce set asyde hath gouernaunce venus louers empresse quene vicious lustes lady maystres mettal coper wyll ternyshe grene chaungeable colour contrary sadnesse notable figure worldly brotylnesse like gery venus bycause attemperaunce set aside lost gouernaunce myne auctour bochas gan pitously cōplain disordynate cormetous glotony vittellius felowes twayne thre diffouled horrible lechery diffamed sclaundre rybaudry contraryous enemyes echone atēperaūce banished al thre might haue gouernance glotonye ryotous excesse watche reuell drinking y• night come vncouth feuers many great accesse mēbres podagre maketh mē go nat right goutes mormalles horrible sight many infirmitees bycause attemperaunce nat coūsel toward gouernaunce courte banished prudence fortitude none enteresse gayne vicious liuing make resystence cried woiues hid vertuous sobernes trouth durst nat medle backe stod rightwisnesse put houshold attēpraunce emprours gouernaūce sonne prophete called zacharye patriarke holy man saynt ihon victorious champion gredy glotonye lyued deserte daynties none eat mel siluestre lay colde stone locusta gadred coke temperaunce houshold al gouernaunce camel heares wouyn clothyng recorde gospell trouth tell honysocles moderate fedyng monge wilde beastes whan dwell staūche thurst dranke water y• wel blessed baptist rote attempraunce set chefe myrrour good gouernaunce diete catour scarsite costful fode vertuous abstynence rote deserte delicate plente riche pymentes ypocras dispence hinge nat costretes botels spēce nat excessiue bycause attemperaunce housholde holy gouernaunce baptist ihon moderate foode chefe triūphe abstinence hath begon patriarke rekened goode content littel al suffisaunce hath dyogenes littell ton helde apayed bycause attemperaunce housholde al gouernaunce tonne receite housholde boste celere cuppes siluer golde costful vintage came riuere wel timed mesure mouth butlere tastour attemperaunce houshold al ye gouernaūce conquest soueraine degre alysaunders al hie renoune conquered sensualite made subiecte seruaunte reason daunted prudence eche forayne passion clerke kitchin called attemperaunce whiche dyete al gouernaunce superfluite slouthe slepe diogenes stode euer amonge drede worldly fauour toke maner kepe straw litter simple russet wede turned ton againe winde dede twene hote colde attemperaunce somer winter hole gouernaūce ¶ lenuoy noble prince prudence take hede litell chaptre breuely comprehende golden worlde turned lede pray god grace downe sende hie mercy may sone amende princesse called attēperaunce may houshold haue gouernaūce chefely loue parcel eke drede estate whan ye shynende encrees gracious spede preceptes diligently attende olde emperours rede legende whyle ruled attemperaunce longe prosperite stode gouernaunce worthy kingdom rome called hede whose royal boūdes farthest extende marcyall actes bothe length brede rem publicam prowesse diffende forayne enemy hardy offende hye noblesse whyle attemperaunce thre susters gouernaunce xi chapter ❧ kinrede iacob distroyd christe borne died ierusalem distroyed xi hundred slain sworde hungre fyre pestilence story ended vitellius two feres galba ocho caraine horrible hidious drowned tybre possed fro story accomplished came great nombre bochas rede echone discended iacobes kynrede token complaint heuynesse like folke dismayed clad mournīg wede constraynt wretchydnesse bespreynt wt teares quaking drede knowing recure streight nede resembling folke token full mortall toward feast funerall vgly cheres pytous beholde gan aproche presence ihon bochas tell sorowes olde woundes bleding marcial violēce oppressed hūger thurst sodē pestilēce forayne sworde liues manasyng vpon deathe beastes abyding enclosed narowe folde dispayred socour recure passe boundes dred nat bolde within enfamyned barayne pasture wofull storie remembred scripture howe iacob generacion vengeably brought distruction patriarke called whilome israell renomed amonge nacions famous byble well tell lyne rekened region goddes behest toke possession maugre egypciens pharaos pride whan moises god made gide drie fete passed reed see conueyed moyses also aaron lawe written ye bible list se vpon syna table harde stone deserte gone aungels meate called • na rede forty wynter dyd fede moyses led josue lande promission twelue lynages iacob parde let make distribucion eche lyne gaue porcion promyse made afore abraham isaac iacob whan thyder came patriarkes prophetes ye sad maugre enemy mortall fone mighty duke iudges lad gate region gone tyll last pride echone lyke nacions wolde haue kyng saul chose god graunted asking thus patryarkes theyr alyes abraham genelogie tolde prophetes prophesies conueyed dauid whiche regalye helde iewes hole monarchye whose kynrede processe thus stode christ iesu borne roial blode sent frō father prophetes determine toke fleshe blode saluacion holy goost borne pure virgyne amonge iewes great tribulacion vnder herodes suffred passion gospell truely doth discriue third day rose death liue blessed lorde lorde vertue ende decembre borne betheleem aungell named iesu shewed thre kinges sterre beem iesus ierusalem conspyracion iewes enuy pylate dempt dye caluary thus vnto iesu iewes vnkynde whiche distroyed nye echone christ prophesied gospel maketh mynde cite sholud nat lye stone vpon another mortal fone thē besiege told certaine make ierusalem ye soile al plaine weping eyen christ told thē beforne ruine distruction synne cause lorue nat knewe confusion time notable vysitacion whan christ came borne erthelowe saluaciō lyst nat know thyrty yeres fully cronyculers write somwhat passion amonge iewes playnly endyte within selfe fyll diuision murdrers se vp within toun great nombre many homicide cite man durst well abyde presidentes reigning iude seing horrible foule rebellion murderer mortall cruelte longe endured region appese romains sent doun vaspacian many manly knight whiche galylee toke way right chastyse tho murderer robbours brent coūtrey rode vp doun continued soudyours tyll vnto time countreys enuyron ierusalem entred toun oblacions many sondry wyse pask • required sacrifyse tofore tho dayes ierusalem great worshyp nacions called princesse euery reem whose fame stretchyd al regyons treasour great possession double walled buylding notable dreding enemy impregnable among romayns many manly man willing echone one affection knighthode vaspasian echone labour distruction
