ierusalem great diuision amonge selfe gon cite certaine captain yt nombre thre simon iohn eleazarus horrible tyrauntes oppressing porayle gouernaunce frowarde outragious falsly deuided eche dyd assayle amonge selfe many gret batayle werre without werre within thus vengeaunce mischefe dyd begyn vaspasian nat beyng rechelees party lyke prudent knight notable meanes exited pee nought blent owne sight chese best coude nat se right noble werryour vaspasian chosen emperour alexsaundrie rome went againe receiued themperiall dignite son titus made chefe capitaine procuratour gouerne iude beset enuyron ierusalem cyte men armes sieged none might entre none issue stopped cōdutes water clere enfamined lacking vitayle certain woman thus saith croniculere rosted childe whan vitaile fayle store none apparayle theron layser selfe dyd fede woman horryble dede mighty walles gons cast downe two stronge towres take cite resistence gan fayle towne stode hungre perplexyte tytus knighthode magnanimite throughout toure called antonian entred like knightly man people streates lay hunger dead bye sel lyfelode town succour drinke breed paine death borne nouther vp ne doun vomyte one refection vnto another scarcite redeth iosephus trouth may se brent temple made salomon endured thus writ ye crōyculere royal buylt ryche stone fully thousande two hundred yere romains entred maugre portere speare pollax sworde sharpe whet lyke wode lion slewe met riche gate couered plate gold brent molten without excepciou siluet ymages y• forged • gold vyolent fyre made renne • oun noble tytus compassiou marciall duke spated nothing certain lest presumpcion wolde rebel leuen hūdred thousande staine sworde hungre fyre pestilence stynke carayns y• str ••• layne caused deathe sodayne vyolence titus gaue among sentence meane dyd aliue dwell penny men shoulde thurty sell iudas solde christ thurty penny titus againe thought equyce marchaundyse make recompence thurty iewes founde cyte penny nomore parde solde theyr great outrage euer amonge sarazyns liue seruage temple priest full olde two stately lantarnes y• bright shene table basyns violes bright golde presented thus dyd mene treasure wele sene temple shewed titus token whilom glorious shewe eke busy cure silke sinamone frankencens withall sacrifise purpurate vesture vrimthumun ryche pectorall whiche ordained especiall solempne place place sanctum sanctorum men dyd call cite prince called ihon titus came shewed presence pale hunger came also symon brought duke yt named terence clad purple brought violence receiued titus whan noble town castels towres walles smyt downe castell called mazadan eleazarus take flight belieged scilla castell wan eleazar like furious knight within castel selfe nyght styred euery man father childe brother sharpe swordes erche man sle thus cite stately bilding whilom worlde chefe toun melch •• der reigned preest kyng dayes olde made mencion restored dauid builded newe salomon princesse proninces wher another ahiect refuse al vnto iewes christ iesu ga • e respite full thurty yere toke veingeaunce token lord hath ioye great delite whan sinner dispose penaūce contricion vertely repentaunce blessed lorde king merciable lengest abideth lyst vengeable gracious benygne bade shoulde conuert sone shewed vnto many vncouth signe twelue day eclipsed y• mosis people atones knew nat done indurate froward entent like folke abashed wyst nat ment afore siege titus gan werre ouer cite wherof wext aferde appered comete sterre sterre shape like sharpe swerde touching comet neuer herde another firy bright clere endured space al th • yere festiual day halowed apryl priestes busy make oblacion great light temple fyll al people standing enuyron thought bright inspection passing sonne seme ment man coude deme preestes dyd busy cure offre calfe anone toke hede calfe thing agayne nature brought forth lambe ye time rede vgly token put gret drede contrary pronosticacion shewed vnto subuersion token frowarde contrarye time shewed euer amonge brasen dores inwarde sentwarye yron barres shit wer strong brode entayle rounde wondre longe might nat meue wt xxx mennes might opened selfe twyse night sene also chares eyre men armes bright swordes clere plate maile armure faire bright phebus appere▪ storie also doth v lere sheltrons apparayle profer made cyte tassayle iewes dyd sygnifye pronostyke theyr distruction preestes temple dyd hie vpon night oblacion amid temple herde dredfull foun noyse y• dredeful ende ryse vp echone let v hence wende ful four yere tofore siege gan one ananias yonge tendre age byrthe sonne rude man disposicion dul corage lyke fall rage ran cite maner frensye spared nat open mouthe crye vnto noyse made none obstacle obstinat euer entent day feest holde tabernacle voice quod orient voice fro southe fro northe occident voice fro y• four wyndes y• blow wyde voice ierusalē crieth euery syde voice againe tēple agayn y• people also voice againe husbādes voice againe wiues wo ierusalem treble wo hungre thurst lesing • iues sworde fyre many sodayn striues wretched lamentacion ananie cried toun beaten affray ful ofte whipped scourged endlonge vpright al felte ful vnsofte • eating made faint feble might stynt nat crie day night pronostike shewing cite howe ryght sone shoulde distroyed rehersayle also carnotence cite sinne stode tho romains marciall vyolence nat come done wo erthe haue opened vndo deuoured people voyde al refuge drowned ye toun sodayne deluge breuely passe vengeāce terryble done vpon iewes transgression demerites ye punishing horryble ierusalem fynall subuersion temple tabernacle toun iosephus lyst se al dede de bello iudaico y• surplus may rede ☞ thus endeth seuenth boke foloweth prologue eyght ¶ prologue eyght booke bochas maketh exclamacion agayn iewes great vnkyndnesse brought bi romains cite adoun lyke story dyd tofore expresse disparcled liue wretchednesse god hand punished theyr outrage euer liue tribute seruage folowyng myne auctor cast touch rehersyng manere howe iohn bochas lying couche spake himselfe sayd ye shall arte thou dul loke chere lyke man thy face beareth wytnesse disposeth lyue ydlenesse certes quod iohn take right good kepe muche trauayle outrage hath longe slombre caste slepe lymmes feble croked faynt age caste drede dulnesse corage presume vpon take eyght boke end make thou wenyst perauenture thine opinyon labour get name reherce sodain falling doun newe processe attame prince sitting hie house fame diuers bokes thou dost fynd perpetually put thy name minde thy dayes short put great drede suche labour take passage feble flower spede thy sight darked thou arte fal age among remembring thinke langage whan men buryed low earth doun saue good liuing farewell guerdon worldlye goodes shall passe right sone tresour connyng al shal mynde frendship chasigeth doth y• cloudy mone strayte nede fewe frendes men finde good name whan left behind passeth ryches well deserued al golde cofer locked conserued thy labour fame shall derke beware bochas herof take good hede slouth snake bad leue warke smal reward y• shalt haue thy mede ensample thou mayste rede langage therof routhe atwene iohn bochas ladye slouthe bochas astonied gan heed decline vpon pillowe hanging traunce stode gret doute coude determyne lyke man hangynge balauuce partye shulde hys pen auaunce procede vndertoke leue labour eyght boke atwene twayne abyding thus doute gan flete halfe within half ouer stile coude discerne moste mete▪ tyll fraunces petrark▪ laureate poete crowned wyth laurer grace gide came set downe beddes side bochas hys slombre abrayde gan adawen somwhat hys chere sawe petrarke lowly sayd welcome mayster crowned wyth laurere whiche haue itayle lyke sonne clere poetry plainly discriue soueraynly enlumined liue haue desyred well couthe rightfull herte humble attendaunce worship fro tendre youth shall euer voyde varyaunce duryng lyfe trewly substaunce ye haue ben lanterne lyght dyrection aye support myne occupation wrytyng bokes compyle chefe ensample great auauntage refourme rudenes stile aureat colour fresshe langage nowe dulled impotence age deccepitus marked many signe labour vp writing resigne cast forthe procede stande bay fordriuen werynes quod fra petrark lese thus thy mede yeue cause report expresse thy last age thou hast found maistres bridled soth routhe holdeth thyrein called slouth euident token frowarde slogardye vpon thy bed thy limmes dresse ryse vp shame well espy folke grone fele sycknesse chamberlayne called ydlenes layth thy pyllow • ue morrowe voyd let go forow vertue froward contrary ydlenesse present life hath draw away fro thy lybrarye wyll suffer contemplatyf • condycion holde stryfe euery vertuous occupacion men shuld voyde wysdom resō mater shuld long tary thyslombre leaue vp thine eine dresse boke made life solytarye remembre theron sykernes teacheth way vertuous busynes list rede euery lyne contemplacion moral diuyne sayd erst yet lyft vp thy loke forsake thy bed ryse vp anone shame woldest y• rest nowe vpon thy seuenth boke leaue eight soth thou art blame procede forth get thy self name one thyng thy self comforte thou deseruest men shal reporte make comparison twene derknes lyght twene ydlenes occupacion twene fayre dayes cloudy nighte twene coward prowesse hye renoun twene vertuous speche false detraction conclude vice represse contrary slouthe vertuous busynesse vertuous busines bochas take hede reneweth thynges olde antiquite maketh men lyue dead remember noble many great citye ne writer al gone parde wherfore bochas syth y• art nere lande suffre thy shyp stomble sande meane thus shyp thy trauayle hath passed se bokes seuen cast ankre tyll thou haue good ••• ayle let tempest thundre • eum wyndes cloudye heuen fals • āglers demers bliue depraue thy laboure let thy ship ariue haste thy way let grace crosse thy sayl fall lande wilful neglygence let good wyll chefe thy counsayle gye thy rother set entyre diligence vitayle • ayle wine thy dispence yet last thynke forth y• socour royal prince shal quite thy labour thinke writing auctors theyr payne yeue prince theyr commendation remu • romulus called foūders twain rome towne two scipions kinghthode prudence two catons iulius pompey hanybal eke also ensample whome loke thou prophetes wrote prophesies noblesse olde moyses poetes laure poesy force sāpson y• strength hercules two grekes pyrrus achylles wryting bokes say vnto day yet endureth name ceaseth wryte notable ensamples predecessours enuye men wyll atwite gardayns let peryshe holsome floures sondry wyse might great socours labour spare thy trauayle vertuous labor agayn slouth doth auaile▪ thing remembred antiquite whan set fayre ymage prince hye lowe degre person prynte visage gladdeth frende quicketh corage semblably example men may fynde thing forgotten writing come minde▪ make name perdurable merites put memory vice eschewe vertue stable labour may slouth haue victorye clayme see heuenly consistory dispyte ydlenes forthering vertue fyne labour yeue christ iesu whan petrark reherced lesson rebuking vicious ydelnes bochas supprised moued reason rose couche gan pen dresse well ouercame impotent feblenes croked age bochas vndertoke accomplyshe vp eight boke following dulled rudenesse thre score yeres set date luste youthe passed freshnes colour rethorike helpe translate faded away borne lydgate wher bacchus lycour doth full scarsly flete drye foule dewe • e though passed age hath fordulled tremblynge ioyntes let hande wryte fro take subtylte curious makyng englyshe endyte yet labour truelyme acquite shal procede due two bokes bochas sue finis ¶ firste chapter ¶ howe proude tiraunte domician emperoure rome manye emperoures noble outrage wretchednes mischeuouslye ended bbrother titus sonne vaspacian came next iordre writeth mine autour proude ambicious called domician rome crowned emperour extorcioner false pillour proudly cōmaunded estate vp stalled worlde shulde god called thrugh hye presūpcion eke tolde nether tymber koruin stone set vp image syluer golde token god alone pathmos exyled eke saynt iohn agayne cristen seconde next neron began first persecucion tyraunt reignyng estate citye passinge odyous best worthy • ewe senate vnto vertuous mortall enemy moste malicious slaughter senatours toune asked triumph made mencyon made amonge iewes ful great outrage greatest suspicion slee al tho lynage dauids kinred kinge salomon least put dominacion amonge iewes hys meanynge slewe tho borne kyng amyd palays god wolde right punysh tyraunt quite hys mede domician slayne vpon nyght caraine vnburyed irede comodus doth succede whiche yeue fleshly appetite leaue vertue folowe delyte theatre playes custome vse custome vsage life vice falslye abuse lecherous lustes spent al hys yonge age romaynes ful great domage senate moste vertuous falslye slayne comodus time stroke thunder dente firye lightning y• came fro heuen common lybrary cyte brente wyth royall bokes craftes seuen bokes poetes mo neuyn comodus breuely termyne slayn strangled hys concubyne helinus pertynax came nexte ringe ordained emperour toun olde vnweldy • lame ginning boke maketh mencion title succession intrusour one called iulyan state vsurping reigne began noble lynage affrican borne tripoli mighty great citye one seuerus knightly man gadred romayns wondre great meyne bothe made stronge iulian met pont miluin citie itayle iulyan slaine batayl seuerus entred empyre toke vpon dominacion vpon cristen malice set fyre began againe persecucion tyrannye false ambicion one egipt called poscennius againe seuerus gan worke thus gadred meyny seuerus assaile purpose fully theron hys payne first haue great batayle next thempyre crowne attayne ye shal heare fel twayne poscennius fill discomfiture seuerus thempyre dothe recure purpose might auaile one albinus manly knyght gaule full great batayle full great bloudshed mortall fyght albinus slaine force myght seuerus entred bretayne caught sicknes died paine seuerus next came antonine frowarde disposicion auctours determine busines occupacion set holy fleshly dilectacion false lust corage assayle amonge parthois flayne batayle macrinus tofore bochas came whylom prefecte rome cyte pretoyr inuasion came imperiall famous dignitye occupyed yere sate hys imperyal se tyl fortune lyst hym disgrade amonge knightes flayne archelade next came aurelius surnamed antonyne great rybaude passyng lecherous yet byshop auctoures determine temple heliogabalus time one sabellius false heretike gan name secte called sabellianes said aurelius againe nature false presumpcion bokes told wolde purge wombe nature vessel made golde dispyte whan old slaine knightes longe carayne thrown gonge proude foresayde antonine thempyre iust election senatours bokes determyne came aurelius hye renoune surnamed alisaunder made menciō fought perciens like manly knight king xerxes put vnto flyght aurelius proud knyghtly man whan sate iudge consistory sate one called vlpian great ciuilian notable memory whome encreace glory reported thus great auctorite digestes made bokes thre full piteously emperoure lost lyfe casuelly made mencion among knightes sodayne strife slaine discencion whose ende short conclusion tofore bochas boke wel tel came maximinus gordyan maximinus cronicle expres chose knightes soudiours victorious marcyall hye prowesse done almayne amonge emperours set vp rome maugre senatours strong enmy mine autoure sayth power vnto cristen fayth enemy life list sene cristen clerkes auctorite specially olde origene moste furious cruelte aquyleya mighty stronge countre prefecte called pupien slaine whose dethe cristen men full fayne next senate chosen gordyan first agaynste parthois cast hi werrey ianus temple whan werre began made gate opened wyth keye whiche token old e bokes seye tho gate opened folkes nye ferre wt fone y• romayns wold werre parthois first said gordian holde werre fast gan spede vpon alway felde wan sped perce mede alwaye victorious batayle rede vpon eufrates slayne fynde false treason y• cronicle maketh mynde next ordre came philip name sonne eke philip came also myn auctour bochas reherceth y• father sonne baptised bothe two right sad wyse first cristen echone emperor rekened ther tofore none poncius martyr rede meya famous great cyte baptysed afterwarde dede slayne batayle lyst fle tofore dethe bothe assent parde treasour hole imperiall christes church fynde gaue bishop sixtus toke possession vertuously assigned laurence therof make distribucion poore folke indigence whiche dede cruell violence tyraūt decius agayn thē toke stryfe caused holy laurēce brēning lose life decius cursed cruell caused y• slaughter philip twayn subtell false fell sleight falshed dyd hys busy paine empyre force attayne seuenth tyraunt persecucion agayn christen folk toke first occasion myne auctour writeth time deciue holy hermyte example perfytenesse dayes old called antonyus liued deserte ferre wildernes hermyte dispysing al ryches lyued frute rote men tell perfection dranke water well vpon decius cursednes christen gaue hard sentence thrugh rome itayle myne auctor bereth witnesse euery cyte grete pestilēce sodaine deadly violence hertes men dependinge traunce saue liues coude cheuisaunce mater write nomorc emperour wyll resorte agayne speke gallus volucian busy laboure vaine time short bokes saine martyn writeth olde cronyculere thempyre reigned two yere bothe slayne procuring purchace one emelyan romayne knight whiche slye workinge occupye thempyre tho began tyrannye lordshyp wan whose lordship hap lacke grace lenger last two monthes space lytell chapter tofore sene reherced hath tolde wordes playne emperours almost full fourtene good none twayne whiche reherce haue paine procede began must wryte one valeryan sonne called galiene christen bare great enmyte slew al tho legend men mai sene serued christ trouth equytie whose persecusion hateful crueite abated well reherce one sapor kyng perce force armes sapor mighty king gan asia host came doun tygre eufrates knightly rydyng towarde partyes septemtryo • ▪ caucasus ferre fro babylon surrye proudlye dyd assayle capadoce wan eke batayle mete came vale rian mesopotayme many legion werre strōg knightly man hardy sapor champion felde hath wonne legion afore reherced perce lad valerian boūde chaynes roūd sad sapor maugre hys vysage▪ valeriā straytly brought wrake lyke prisoner bounde seruage obeysaunce founde lacke knele foure profre backe vnto sapor whan hym list ride therby mounte al great pryde offyce valerian seruitude duryng many yere wherfore called many man assendyng stocke sadyll nere whiche frenche called mountuere office bowe doun corse whan y• king sapor shulde light horse guerdon fauour fortune olde maner prince kynges double custome vsed commune sodayne chaunge worldly thynges triumphes vprisinges foloweth well tell take recorde valeryan thys lady fortune blynde fell goddes valerian shewed herselfe vnstable taught lesson doublenes kyng sapor fauourable yet cruell vengeable wyth fete deuoyde fauoure foyle backe emperour olde hathe songe cried loude recorde cyrus many mo kinges perce custome haue proude punyshed chastised eke also prince mercy shulde take hede therto victory estate notable prisoner merciable myne autor bochas mater tel rebuke tyrauntes dayes old turneth side speketh valerian thy ruby saphires set golde theryche peerles rynges manifolde y• wont weare vpon thy hōds wretch art boūd forayn bondes thou wonte furyous crueltie clad purple within rome toune christ contrary thyne imperyall se gaue dome martyr suffre passion nowe lyest thou bound fettred preson kyng sapor constrayned enclyne whan lyst ryde bothe necke chine thus art thou fall thine imperial stage thinke fortune haue memory hath cast thraldom seruage eclypsed thine olde glory thou sate whilom consistorye emperour mighty iudge lyest bound chayns knowest refuge fall ferre thy mynde knightly dede worthy • ublyus rome captayne ordayned finde fyght agayne aristomachus kyng asye fortune fell thus whan romayns dyd felde forsake publius amonge fone take noble prince standing dredeful cace lyfe worshyp dependyng atwen twayn hande holding sturdy mace smyt one eyen twayne led payne felte great smerte toke dagger roue publyus herte loued worship thā lyfe chase rather dye liue seruage conceite imaginatife considred sythe age saue honoure auaūtage slayne worshyp conserue lyke beast prison sterue fortune chaptre rad valerius maketh mencion whose conceyte man vertue sad shulde longe languy prison rather chose lyke opinion manly force knightly excellence dethe endure longe abstynence whylom dyd princesse agripine whan prison lay fettred bound fre choyce felt great pyne hungre thurst story found lay pale grofe vpon grounde maugre tibery let gost wende bodye fatall ende thou stode ferre suche fantasy speke thou valerian thy cruell herte false malencolye made whylom dye many christen man martyr syth christes faythe began mankynde dyed vpon rode tacquyte hym lyste shed hys blode agayne lawe thou impacient importune persecucion thou dydest fauour suffre thine entent▪ egipciens dyd oblacion sacryfices ryte vp doun vnto ydols frowarde wylfulnesse egipt called chefe goddesse fauourable thou thy desire suffre iewes sabote obserue caldeis worshyp fyre folke crete saturne serue cristen men thou madest falsly sterue whose lawe thou dyd retche thou died presō mischefe like wretch ii chapter ¶ howe gallyen sonne valerian slayne next ordre bochas tho cāe doun sonne valerian one called gallien great horrible effusion christen bloud men might sene shed valerian god wold shulde bene shewed openly romains vengaunce manye countre sodaine dis obeysaunce almayne alpes dyd pace vnto rauenne cite itaile gothes also proude chere face agayne grekes many great batayle hūgry armed plate mayle wyth denmarke furious cruell agayne romayns wexte assent rebell whose domage meane whyle amonge romayns befall thus wofull werres whiche called bene ciuile gan cyte cruell dispiteous first whan met slayne gemyus first toke bokes rede hye corage purple wede one posthumus mighty strong romayne kept gaule vnder subiection auayle vnwarly slaine among knightes al hye renoun sodayne vncouthe discencion next victoryne hauing gouernaunce al gaule first slayne fraunce gallien spake toforne sonne heyre valerian domination purpose hath lorne republica whan began lyke contrarious frowarde man wext lecherous obstinate liuinge mischefe slayne▪ hys endynge iii chapiter ¶ howe quintilius murdred woman next gallien came one quintilius man remembred great attēperaūce brother byrth great glaudius wise discrete al hys gouernaunce may fortune eschue chaunce wryte ende shortlye clause woman murdred say cause iiii chapiter aurielan denmarke borne denmarke born next came aurelian worthy knight enemy assaile gothes great warre began gate victory many stronge batayle whose noble conquest greatly dyd auayle comon profyt al worke parde encreace rome cyte recured septemtrion west warde many great victory amonge fynde one asked triumphe put memorye thing eclipsed glorye y• light knightho • withdraw enemy christ hys lawe bochas lyst wryte boke go forthe began one remēbring called tacyte whych successour aurelian suceeded folorian twayne remembraūce fynde notable put mynde v chapter howe probus discomfited romayns flayne probus raygned full seuen yere four monthes hye renoun gain went saturninus wt knightli chere brought proudly subiection withstandyng rome toun toke vpon hym wylfull tyranny holy thempyre rule gye besyde cyte called agrypyne sayd probus gayne many romayne batayle lyst declyne met portulus mighty stronge captayne wyth one bonosus slaine meyny force might slaynm y• felde remnaūt put slyghte batayle discomfyture probus lodgedi smyrmie gret cyte vnwarely sodayne auenture slayne tour called ferre small season last prosperite siche fortune let man trust worldly thynges chaungyng lust vi chapter ¶ howe carus two sonnes mischeued tofore bochas carus next came doun two sonnes numeria carine find borne narbon whan clerely dyd shyne knighthode plainly termine empyre gate cyties twayne chole thessiphontin parthia wt gret payne besyde tygre famous swyfte ryuere pight tentes cast abide sodayne lightning face came nere smyt pouder great pryde numerian stode hys syde marke sent fro heuyn lost bothe eyen firy leuyn sonne carinus good knight dalmacia gouernaunce gouerned righte cast downe lost puissaunce vicious lyfe cometh alway mischaunce sepcius chose dalmacia gye amonge knightes murdred enuy vii chapter ¶ hardy quene zenobia fought aurelian take mine auctor lēger lyst soiourne ēperours y• falles write al haste doth stile tourne zenobya hir story endyte chaucer dyd well acquite tragedyes pyteous fal entreat wyll passe ouer rehersyng great bokes caunterbury tale souerayne poete brute albyon thrugh pilgrimes tolde hilles vale zenobya made mencion noblesse hye renoun tragedye compendyouslye tolde al marcial prowesse pyteous fall mine auctour first affyrmeth howe discended tell herlynage borne stocke worthye tholome kyng egypt full notable age zenobya experte langage wyse counsayle great prudence passed fame eloquence amonge armed plate mayle palmyrences wedded kyng called odenatus prudent batayle also recorde writyng hardy stronge lordship defendinge maugre al tho cheualry agaynst wrongly toke party odenatus sonnes twayne heremanus called one tymolaus beautye souerayne whose byrthe father gan anone occupy prouynces euerychone perce mede proces made thē •• ene zenobya hardy wyse quene whyle odenatus wext glorious conquest thrughout perce mede slayne one mionius whiche kyng cosyn rede bycause horrible dede murdre king odenate dyed mischefe passed fate processe zenobya quene toke two sōnes proudly dyd thē lede tofore chare men might sene borne prince succede made like kinges clad purple wede defende mightye creature hardy lyon toke armure al lordes knight sent maugre romains proudly gan herspede party oriente occupye hoste lede themperour stode nothyng drede called aurelian met batayle meyny proudly assayle outher syde yt day great bloud shed stroke fortune withstāt creature quene zenobia taken forthe led fought first longe might endure rich stone fret hir armure wt themperour entrig rome toun triumphe required guerdon dempt couenable sittinge emperour proud aurelian aske triumph great thing take zenobia werre began gayne romayns marcial woman suppose woman borne neuer quene hardy sene aforne hardy princesse al hir crueltye whose renome thrugh world know stockes golde brought y• citi hye estate pouerte plunged lowe wynde contrary fortune hath blow ala hath pitoufly made fal prowesse passed wemen al triumphe yeuen aurelian conquest vpon quene called zenobya came dyoclisian borne dalmacia story lyst sene countre first dyd flene garlyke lekes saythe cronycler • ▪ bycause gardinere mencion none linage byrthe forsoke region left craft deluyng cortlage gaue armes election chose emperor regne rome toun first gaule sent great power maximian made vicar vicar many great batayle vpon suche people rebellion gan frowardly contrary assaile obey lordship within region tyll carausius commission hardy knight vndre maxymyan chastise toke lyke man processe story doth deuise lordshyp dyd great domage common profit couetyse countre robbed full greate outrage selfe toke pyllage presumpcion ware colour ryche purple like emperoure carasius bretayns twayne proudly vsurped gouernour lyke rebell agayne rome dyd payne busyed marciall laboure many straunge forayne soudyoure hauynge title commyssion contynued longe hys rebellyon wherof astonied dioclisian seyng mischefe dredful perillous ordayned haste maximian surnamed called herculius made hym emperour called agustus whiche fore gouernaunce gaule whiche called fraunce also ouer dioclisian made thys whyle gouernours twayne constancius one maximian surnamed galerius cōstancius certayn whyle wedde dyd payne doughter maximian called herculius named odora myn auctor writeth thus theodora constancius sixe child trewe mariage broder cōstātyne y• cronicle telleth thus whiche afterwarde came age manhode marciall corage chose made lord gouernour worlde crowned emperoure carausius ful seuen yere lyke tolde rebelled bretayne agaynst romayns great extorcionere knighte allectus hym disdayne murdred payne force extort tyranny fully thre yeres place occupye tyll asclepio sent rome doun slewe allectus maugre myght▪ brought bretayne subiection romayns lyke ryght like manly knight italiens gan romayns disobey constancius gan proudly werrey first wyth stronge batayle meyay slayne put flighte trustyng fortune gan thē efte assayle sixty thousand slayne fight felde thrugh fortune might coude dissymule whyle afterwarde falsly begyle wyll passe ouer brefely set syde forayne incidentes resorte agayne dioclisian alisaūdre proudly pytched tentes captaine slewe gaue commaund emēts knightes auauntage cite robbynge pyllage agayne christen great persecucion vsed tyranny orient bydding maximian came doun towarde party occident bothe tyrauntes wrought assent vnder whose sworde many martyr deyes slayn octodorū legion thebeies verolamye famous olde cyte saynt albou slaine legend doth tell rome furious crueltye pope slayne called marcel statute dome fell church brent townes cyties lost fraunchise al liberty frowarde enemy christes lawe made many martyr dye sake wext feble olde gan withdraw occupacion rest take attorney maxymyan dothe make last age reherced thus stode great drede constantius drede sate nye hearte thervpon toke suche fantasy imagining might start fraud shuld dye almoste fere fyll frensye drede boke maketh mencion slewe selfe drinkyng poison tolde erst occident maximian called herculius reygned emperour euer hys entent pursue martyr aye laborus whose byrth bochas foūd auctoures saye coude neuer rede borne kynrede findeth maximian vsurpynge esspeciall dioclisian set dignite called imperiall famous armes prudent marcial daunted al tho againe striue slewe gencyans called nomber fiue rode affrike lyke conquerour broughte subiections sturdy nacions fortune time fauoure gate sarmatoise region city many riche town conquest new hath y• world name shone like y• son cheryshed armes hys youth greate emprises rome cytie yet dioclisian well couthe counsayled resigne dignitie lothe forsake hys see syth lord gouerned al renounce state imperiall assent dioclisian selfe left gouernaunce euen thys maxymyan discharged self royal puissaunce afterwarde fyll repentaunce busy dyuers bokes sayne state emperour recure agayne acheue dyd diligence distourbed galerius sonne called maxence put possession myn auctour writeth thus thing gan wexe enuyous gan ordeyne meanes hys thought trouble auailed nought whan purpose myght take none auayle againe maxence bochas doth discryue daughter fausta knew coūsail discured purpose fled bliue gaule durst lenger striue constantius marcile cite slayne sodenlye lost al dignite viii chapter howe galerius oppressed martyr christes fayth myscheuously ended next tofore bochas came galerius man disposed ryot outrage euel teached frowarde vicious story speketh hys lynage yet set ful hye vpon stage worldly dignyte rose vp hye estate yet ginning fortunate sent dioclisian made emperour hys auctorite agayne narseus proud knightly man reignyng perce lord coūtre whiche helde werre rome cyte galerius toke emprise wyth myghtye hande hys pryde chastyse galerius entred derce lande kinge narseus met auenture strong batayle fought hand hande fortune might endure galerius fyll discomfyture clad purple made mencyon dioclisian receyued hys guerdon meting anone ware dioclisian made abide confusyon sytting chare walke fote chares syde wyth many rebuke abated pryde galerius great shame gan seke meane agayne get hys name came assemble hys old soudiours made ordinaūce diligent workig chase best proued warryours great hoste perce came ryding ofte fought king perciens maugre al theyr myght galerius dai put flight felde gate greate rich robbed tentes wan pillage resort receiued sothnes great noble voyage thus fortune chaunge vysage dioclisian stode disdaine wyth newe tryumphe resorted agayne cloudy quene stādeth neuer certain whose double whele quauereth euer dout whyse fauour man hath certayne though one haue grace another put let euerye man cometh take tourne neuer assure faylynge armes auenture thus galerius hys batayle perciens gan wexe gloryous gouerned affrike lordshyp itayle throughout orient victorious tyll age gan wexe tedious last dayes maligned men saith false hatred agayne christen fayth healpe false mater remembred confusion empyre set two vicats gaue power euery region lawe christ oppres put downe punyshe matter put deathe whyle ful manye one fleeth sayd truell galerius thempyre al gouernaunce cursed hart corage dispiteous vsurped imperyal puissaunce gaue auctorite vengaunce vnto twaine seuerus maxence al cristen mortal vyolence certayne space bothe one accorde state emperour chose maxēce tyl seuerus fell dyscorde vengable pestylence within city noble preeminence called rauenue seuerus ther flayne whiche galerius nothynge faine whyche haste thys galerius support stand hys defence chase denmarke knight lucinius emperour knightly excellēce withstand fight agayn maxence maxence romayne knightes chosen emperour set vp stall election galerius wext wode fil maner froward frensy entraile brent corrupt bloude froward vengable malady euery membre gan rotte putrifye tyll eyre aboute enuiron al felt venim poison like lazar corbed backe chine cristen vengeable auailed maner medicyne christes faythful stable spake vnto wt langage ful notable wordes fewe concludinge substaunce gret jupiter hath take y• vēgaunce euermore shorte conclusion bolde spyrite gan abrayde nat jupiter worshipped thys towne capitoyle set sothly sayd jupiter borne mayde▪ list suffer thou dost endure anye medecynes shulde therecure lyke atyraunt vengaunce furious mischefe dieth bokes tell perpetually cruell cerberus vpon whele ixion dwell demerites wyth tantalus hell receiue finall guerdon coude martyr haue compassion hys ioy shed bloud sent letter diuers region like slye wolf rauynous wode slee martirs diuers passyons lyke desert receiued guerdon horrible death first confounde fury infernall lyeth hell bounde ix chapiter ¶ howe maxence emperour enemy christes faithe mischeuously ended galerisu cruell vyolence gayne christen blode bochas hath tolde piteous emperour maxence came tofore bochas age ful olde famous armes sturdy freshe bolde albe entred notlike heritoure coke vpon reigne gouernoure christes fayth also enemy sone lost gouernaunce infortune slayne sodainly god tyraūtes vnwarely taketh vengasice whose burying made remēbraūce nat receiued ground caste tibre like rotten hound x chapiter howe lucinius enemy christes faythe slayne next tofore bochas came lucynius knighte denmarke borne good lyne whiche ennemy boke saith thus▪ hardy knighte called maximine chose captaine wt mperour cōstantyne faith christ bare gret enmyte slayne anone trace cyte whose death lucinius glad gan agayne christen persecucion procedyng sodainly wext mad commaunded false presumpcyon whan began execucion nochristen nowhere beside condicion shulde house abide lucinius falsly erre againe faith christen men assasle gaine constantine newe gan warre purpose sothe fail twise discomfited batayle constantine one hungrye next grece besyde eualye thus cōstantyne hye renoune gate nye gcece euerye great countre alde lucinius flode rebellion gayne constantine land sea sawe wolde none otherbe might escape place put holy selfe constantyns grace constantine hie rebellion gaue iudgement hast dead leaste citie made diuision lucinius wherof stode drede bochas toke hede came wt chere ful piteous▪ brethern twayne constantine crispus xi chapter constantyne crispus howe damalcus slayne cōstantine spake toforne sonnes cōstantine crispus twayne one mother borne cāe tofore bochas boke reherceth thus came eke lucinius sonne lucinius rome toun afore slayne hys rebellyon constantine werres gouerne made vicar self thre echone rightwise coude wel discerne mighte auaile moste citye encrese profit commonte name tolde cōstantine crispus tofore remembred lucinius thre vicar vnder emperour gouerned rome knightes famous alisaundre rose vp great errour false preest called arryus beleue thing contrarious fayth wyrche decre put chyrche assent bithinye full notable nicea famous great citye errour proued ful dampnable thre c bishop present parde eightene cronicle list se one sentence • like preued arrius false heretike time bokes doth specifye howe constantine hasty crueltye sayd vicar nigh alye fayned cause slee thre cause rehersed told equitye saue gan procede make cosyn dalmacius succede fauour fortunate towarde dalmacius gracious sentence among whose knightes fell sodeyn debate constantine presence dalmacius withoute reuerence sharp swordes speke wordes fewe▪ vnto death wounded phewe xii chapter ¶ brethern constaunce constancius magnentius decius murdred selfe came constaunce constancius yong brother thus writeth min autour constantine time arrius eche ful great labour payne reygne emperoure tyl last breuely say eueryche gan werrey said constaunce entred perce land nyne time fought agayne sapore king ye shal vnderstand romaynes foughten afore finally constaunce hath bore holde felde might endure vppon fyll discomfiture fortune gan chaunge anonryght whan left vertuous spain slain like knighte castel strong called maxencius none left constancius romaine knight destitute euerichone chase emperoure one vetramone vetramone ferre ronne age barraine wit coud letture knighthode great corage able study scripture like anemperour endure cōstācius spake late vetramone cast hi debate vetramone hath left estate list werrey againe constancius forsoke felde loued debate spaine min auctour writeth thus wrote late magnencius gayne cōstācius wt sword spere shielde presumed proudly holde field great domage hindring toun many romayns thilke day dede besyde cite called leon tyl last coward drede magnencius captain head agayne constantius hath felde forsake lo howe fortune chaunges make magnencius sorow shame bode lenger gate sharp knyfe sole b • selfe wherein blame roue thrugh herte lost life brother decius partable strife necke cast mighty corde hynge self bokes record constancius thase gallus vncles brother gouerne fraunce false tyraunt cruell outragious sone slayne misgouernaunce another vicar disobeysaunce called syluanus iudgment slayne fraūce many man fayn xiii chapter howe bad constantine good chere sitteth aboue nine speres lord lord lord lengest yeres wyll thou haue wel minde mount sarapty y• shalt thy leche fynde god grace list visite shed bloud thou dost spare hath v sent thy labour quite tidinges brought helth thy welfare pope siluester shal declare haue told ryghtwel assured thy sicknes thou shalt recured mount sarapty al hast thousēd suffre siluestre come thy presence sought found breuely make end receiued due reuerence deuoyre entyre diligence like life siluester hathe deuysed grace made hole whan baptysed flesh synewes made sodenly white thrise washynge pystyne holy baptym welle delyte holy gost enlumine enfourming teching doctryne siluestre like myne auctour saithe artycles longe vnto faythe font made porphyrie stone cost constantine round partye goodly prince gostly policy set newe statute great vertue obserued name christ jesu first lawe reherse ordre set ful great reuerence christ jesu sothfast god • lord lordes lord excellence hath daye beniuolence cured lepre ye haue herde deuised blessed siluestre whan baptysed gracious lord souerain lord jesu bence forthe shorte conclusion wyl lord vertue faythfull herte hole affection worshipped euery region man hardy byddyng disdayne least suffre death el greuous paine folowing day called secound constantine hath ordayned decre euer towne founde el aboute countre euer hye lowe degre blasphemed name jesu dome shuld haue dethe plain issue thyrd day euery mannes sight decre confyrmed made stronge euery christen vnright oppression collaterall wronge shuld notbe taryed ouer longe conuicte gilty shal lawe ordained halfe good lese fourthe day amonge romayns al priueledge pronounced toun yeue pope sytting peter stall souerayne head euery region haue rule iurisdiccion preestes alone al thyng temporal lordes like hath kynge church graunted great fraunchyse fyfth day specially lyberte felon maner wise finde socoure thider fle within bound danger go fre assured haue therof full refuge execucion temporall iudge man presume within cytye sixt day gaue sentence man hardy hye lowe degre buylde church haue licence bishop beyng presence say estate pope afore approbate holy bloud spared sayntes cruel erroure pursue moste furious wode blessed jesu moste gratious good peysed consydred myn immortal offēce worthy come thy presence entre holy place vpon ground vnable dwell open mine eyen lyft vp face thy mercy thou repell man sinful come vnto well thy well grace mercy pite washen mine iniquity example openly hath shewed state imperiall mekeneslaid aside purpyl nygromancy double apostata mine autour sayth first ordre faithe ordinaunce constancius sayd julyan rote ypocrisye gouernaunce froward vicious sent gaule great cheualrye vicar chosen countre gye gate trouthe existence iutrusion fayned apparence conuersacion spared sacrifice eyremonyes false oblacion emperour rose wyse state receiued firste gan deuise agayne grekes countre ferre make strong wt haue
