whan men dyed anone made translacion spyrite another man maner likenes byble tell double spyrite grace prophecy helisius graunted hely hereon concluding like opinion pyctagoras affyrmed sentence ful possession sprite existence shuld haue wisdom science disposicion blyue spirite aliue gouernaunce also nature resemble maners liuing thus fraude pluto cure make julyan trust euery thynge byrthe spyrite kyng called alysandre whych shuld wyn world conquest lyst begyn thus gan fo • e fail fantasy trust pluto goddes infernal shuld enhaunce cheualry possede reioice al sworde seipter crowne state imperial passe alysandre honour glory excel triumphal victorie trusted sathan bi whō disceiued christes faith became mortall enemy euer hathe perceyued crosse crucifixe brake vengably false langage caused traitourly christ jesu called galilee dispyte somtime nazaree agayne faithe tyrant wext wode againe christ great hatred slew many martyr fasly shed blud ydolater regenate dede held mortall war thē perce mede comyng perce first gan debate gayne sapor spake late parthois also entred thrugh reem fonde maner resistence came jerusalem jewes anone gaue licence buylde temple great diligence dispyte purpose shame christes church bilt new name caught great corage theatre made brode toun wylde beastes cruell sauage sayntes bloud make oblacion deuoure men religion al christen purpose distroy lust set al worldly ioye heraude host conuey purpose bring trayne strāge desert found froward way heate importable dyd constrayne brent thrugh harneyse felt great pain drye sandes ayre infect hete made many man hast lyfe lete froward tyrant knowing remedy cursed heart gan christ jesu blaspheme malycious hatred enuy wode furious seme gan curse lord al ye world shal deme christ jesu longe pacience list vengaunce malice recōpence cruell neuer none vengable cerberus hel mortal enemy good men euerychone whose blasphemy rebuke fell byrehersayle shulde tel▪ afrayd venomous violence shuld enfect ayre wyth pestylence cast dartes bytter gall blasphemy infernal langage whyle among prince knight vnknowe angelyke vysage freshly armed punyshe outrage sharp spere thrugh euery vayne thys tyrant roue hart twayne bathed bloud tyrant fyll lowe god man frowarde odious thoughe y• time knight know yet men sayne marcurius praier basilius tirant slewe cronicles doth v lere myracle christes mother dere mercurius bokes determyne cesaria mighty stronge citie within countre called palestine buryed afore rose vp iournee graue strange thinge se horse brought hi arayed armure whiche hyng tofore beside sepulture armure sene nyght morowe graue founde tyl midday phebus shone fulbryghte whan mercurius gaue fatal wound blasphemy euer confound preue whiche thinge accomplyshed thys myracle armure againe eue blasphemy soden wrake • hiche tyrant receyued mede last worde fynde spake thou galylee hast ouercome dede toke bloude blede deuyllyshe man dying dispayre dispyte jesu cast ayre body slayne skyn take tawed▪ precept bidding souple tendre coude make saporbadde perce king men therof might haue knowlegyng early morowe eue late nayle vpon palays gate cyte called kayre cronycles make rehersayle apostata wolde ofte day repayre woman entrayle spyrites closed make diuinayle whose wombe barain grace wicked spirites dwellyng place sayd woman creature afore cursed julyan lyfe purpose recure sacrifice offred sathan cursednes began ende al bokes tell whose soul pluto buryed depe hel tyrant bochas gan wexe wroth odious fell outrage reherce partie lothe blasphemy hys fell langage nouther furye infernal rage may compared poison fret within false venyme horrible synne contrary good thewes tofore god moste abhominable hatefull saue cursed shrewes vyces imcomparable moste contagious delectable mouth enfect infernal hound euery day sle christ new woūds obstynate purpose none disposicion furyous wode afraide swere goddes bone horrible body flesh bloud lord dismēbring gracius good fete hādes armes face heed reno new wolde haue deed blessed lord immortall though dedly would slee ageyn erthly celestial froward wise ben ouerseyne discrecion fayleth reason vayne suche blasphemy shorte conclusyon procedeth pride false ambycion semeth haue foul fayled kyndnes reuerence loue vpon crosse nayled pay raunsome man offence suffred death humble pacyence false rebukyng spyttyng hys vysage bring mankynde vnto heritage false surquedy doth heartes reyse blasphemer julian whose great empyre might counterpeise lord god man original ground pride sathan prince vnder infortunate apostata reignyng estate thende tyrant horrible cruell felon hatefull euery wyght sodayne myracle al hoste visible dyd appere heuenly knyght freshly armed angelyke sighte sharpe speere sitting stede made tyrant hert bloude blede false goddes might auaile frowarde rynge done maumetry al proude imperyall apparayle inuocacions hateful sorcerye apostata dyd faythe denye amonge knightes slayn death sodain soule hell sathan great payne xv chapter ¶ howe themperoure valence slewe heremites shed christen blud▪ distroyed church brent bochas hast doth hys style dresse next mperour ye called valēce rehersyng first perfyte holynesse heremytes dilygence lyue penaunce abstynence forsoke worlde christes sake desert haue way take▪ world lyst lengar tarye dyuers double trust certayne ferre egypte liue solitary depe desertes folke sayne soyle drye vitayle ful barayne frutelesse tree vp seared rote christes loue thoght ye life • e sayd valence malice frowardly heremites y• liued gret penaunce causelesse full great enuy troubled thē great greuaūce lyke tyraunte set al vengaunce distroyd church people ladde went christen bloud shadde mean robbyng rauyne mauritayne great countre prince called faryne cesaria famous great cyte extorcion cruelte toke vpon proudly reignynge maugre romayns crowned kinge theodose fyrst manly man sent malice withstand bidding valencian time mpyre hand bothe atones ye shal vnderstande theodose sent assayle sayd farine slewe batayle whiche faryne full cruel hate countre presumptuously reignynge smote heed sate gate cesaria endyng intrusiō afore crowned king mauritayne oppressing drede ye haue herde lost heade mater bochas doth soiourne attendaunce long diligence purpose dothe agayn retourne mperour called valence told great offence holy church froward cursednes slewal hermites bode wildernes god wolde suffre shuld long endure graunteth tyraunt longlyfe mischefe sodaine auenture dye murdre dagger swerde knife gotheyes whilom gan stryfe outrage great oppressyon agayne romains fyll rebellion prince called maximus distressed great tyranny vpon contrarious gadred cheualry wext strong vpon partie manhode fel auenture valence made disconsiture spared robbynge pillage slough brent many stately place cyties townes many small village famous within lād trace furiously thei met face like coward turned visage saue life lay hyd cartage thus finally emperour valence ye haue heard fayled entent gothes folowed cruel violence wylde beastes al one assent house ash haue brent lo fyne ye prince take hede tyrantes saintes bloud shed xvi chapter ¶ kynge amacisius howe gracian theodosy distroied temple fals god graciā put flight valence god contraryous al workes froward liuēg tofore bochas came amacisius gothes whilom lord kyng great age piteously complaining inflate dole lyst make delayes slew self short greuous dayes came downe brother valence mighty emperour called gracian whiche afore experyence first vncle valentinyan empyre bokes tell afterward theodosy gouernaunce rome cyte theodosy gracien assent distroyed temple partie false goddes also haue downe rente great ydols maumetrye full deuoutly gan church edifye whyle fortune dyd ordayne one maximus vicar bretayne hardy knight albe vary promise made sacrament bretayne list lengar tary▪ gaule hert hole entent gayne gracian sodenly went fyll set bothe auyse batayle far fro parise gracien put flight prowes proud captayne called merobandus hardy knight power hath ouerlayne gracian constrained certaine whan power myght auayle gayne maximus flye itayle maximus pride gan desire hert false ambycion reigne alone hole empyre handes haue possession wyse fortune threw doune nombre fiue chapter bochas doth discriue tyrant maximus slain gracian noble emperour theodosius venge death warre hast gan also valentinian wrongly banished thrugh cruelte gracian farre countre maximus holde vp partie andragacian ful notable knight made prince chiualrye toke vpon force might kepe y• mountain maner wight theodose armed plate mayle man shuld ouer alpes itayle theodose made great armye grace god marcial corage layde siege aygle great cyte wan towne maugre visage toke tyrant great outrage berafte fyrst royall garnement slewe rightfull iudgement whan adragracian knewe maximus lord slayne wise anone sorowe storie telleth thus drowned self bochas doth deuise thus fortune make men aryse▪ estate emperours attaine vnware stroke gyue fal agayne maximus spake tofore dethe made ordinaunce sonne called victore shuld gouern gaule fraunce whome arbogastes gouernaunce great constable valentinian slewe victore reigne whan begā xvii chapter ¶ goodlye processe howe theodosye wyth prayer smal nombre gate victory vvhan valentinian great apparayl arbogastes toke possessyon lombardy al itayle brought al land subiection power came gaul doun receyued great solempnyte vienne famous old cyte arbogastes spake late chefe constable ye haue heard deuyse lord full cruel hate dethe conspired false couetise therby supposyng shuld aryse vnto thestate chose emperour whan deed lyke false traytour vp towre heng traytourly sclandring hindring name reported outward said cursedly arbogastes hide shame souerayne lord put blame stiffely affirming thing false howe hym selfe hyng vp halse thus lyke murdrer false traytour condicions hateful odious labored sore made emperour alone eugenius might exclude theodosius first let shuld partye passe thrugh itayle thrugh lombardy sette spyes bring trayne time vnderstode like iust prince busye paine thought nothing gode hylles lombardy abode arbogastes furious outrage cast trouble stoppe passage eugenius beyng assent theodosy mortally assayle whan knew mening fradulēt albe scarce vitaile euerye cost set batayle knightes forsake manere left thinge toke prayer lefte smal meyne true faithful affection first al fil kne jesu gan make orison lorde quod thine eares enclyne doun thy mercyful gracious goodnesse deliuer mortal distresse consider se howe thy knight whiche ofte sith thrugh fragilite fleshly lustes blynded sight thousand time haue trespased gracious jesu mercy pite request beningly take hede socour great nede trust holy plainly conclude thou shalt forther fortune viage fewe folke agayne great multitude make haue gracious passage prouerbe new olde langage thou maist canst thy power shew gayne multitude victory fewe thou saued whilom israell agayne pharaos mighty puissaunce lyon deliuered daniell saued susanna mortal greuaūce saue day fro sorow mischaūce mischefe graunt issue escape daunger grace y• jesu blessed name interpretacion saye mighty sauiour drede dubitacion jesus al worldly labour trust victorious protectour blessed jesu pauise defence make tescape mine enemyes vyolence let myn enemy great bost doblow though power dredful terrible may experience knowe nothinge impossible thou two thre indiuisible though haue men saueme day jesu fro dethe amen day gan clere son gan shine bryghte whan theodosy deuoutly lay knelynge grace ad awne gan syght fro cloudy wawes long pitous weping chefe hope heuenly kyng jesu captayne whose holy name day escaped fro mischefe shame holy crosse bette armure borne chefe standerd tofore bataile god made stronge field endure hardy lyon enemy assayle jesus champion plate eke mail jesu alone set memory whome day victory knight prince chiualry arbogaste eugenius gouerned al hole partie arcibio called manly vertuous whiche goodly came theodosius reuerence glad cheare saued day fro mischefe dangere whan theodosius enemy gan set lyke knyght tournynge visage bothe battailes togither met theodosy explete passage fyll myracle auauntage sodayn tempest wynde hayle tain troubled tho sieged mountayne vulcanus chefe smyth heuen gayne arbogaste gan redy make bend gūns wt thūder leuyn eolus wyndes gan awake cauernes hidous brown blacke assent sturdy violence theodosius stand defence againe eugenius arbogast brother people departed yōder winde mist y• non saw vnware vengaunce tēpest thūder speres brast shield roue sōdre eugenius take lost hed arbogast slough selfe drede thus gan lord eternal might chastice tyrantes malice represse saued theodosy hys owne chosen knyght trusteth parfite stablenes gothe fre fro daunger escapeth fro duresse bokes record howe theodosius time called catholicus cace reherce thessalonyca famous great cyte bishop saint ambrose millan certayne jewes equite sytte dome hauyng auctorite notwithstanding commission slayn common entryng toun therof emperour nothynge faine commaunded hasty wilfulnes whan knew iudges slayn knightes shuld thider dresse entred cyte cruell sturdinesse swerde pollax dagger sharpe whet indifferently sle al met whose biddinge cite encombre day slaine many innocent fyue thousand deed remembring nombre murdred host without iudgement cite sent whan ambrose herd cruell dede like iust prelate thus gan procede ye haue herde vengaunce gan theodosy chastice cyte emperour came myllan wolde haue entred sole mpnite cathedrall church royalte byshoppe ambrose porche met purpose manly set quod bi shop counsayl wythdraw churche thou haue none entre thou hast offended god eke law hardy bolde charge sette thy fote entre degree thou art cruel homicide maugre thy might thou shalt abide vnto thy palaes home agayne retourne eyght monthes loke thou sein passe thy bond mekely soiorn trust wel rightwel certayne murdrers god hath disdain blode falsly shed haue remembraūce calleth day night vēgasice great offence innocentes bloude shed agayn right iust auctorie giue sentence eight monthes accompted day nyght▪ entre church y• shalt com sight reason shal hold iust balaunce tyl thou haue fully accōplished thy penaūce haue said take therof good hede time thou gettest withdraw thy hād innocentes blode shede rancour hasty cruelte beholde great humilitie emperour consydre wele wolde haue peersed hert stele heed enclyned word spake fyll wepinge wt subbyng vnstaunehable purple wede bedewed rayne returning home chere lamētable continued purpose stable al token faithfull repentaunce lowly wyse accomplished hys penaunce gaue ensample prince euery chone case semblable worke wylfulnes execusion procede anon mentain errour froward cursednes defēd trespas meintein wodnes farre ioint shalbe declared theodosy compared earth mekely obey goddes knight lowly penaunce wrongly warrei holde ther froward maintenance touching mater set remēbrāce mendeserue let euery wight take hede seeth al quiteth mede theodosius list nothyng abredge short yard correction forsoke platte rigour toke edge mekely suffre castygacion bowe chine rebellion meke confession knowing trespace saynt ambrose restored agayne grace vertuous prince may ensample take theodosy lord shal queme nat froward amendes make ceptre swerde diademe subiect ambrose list deme obeied al thing great offence holy churche make recompence knew god souerayn lorde holy church greatly bound▪ grutched neuer wyll thought word holy christ empyre found vertu reigneth vertu ay rebound prince obeyed al vertue hath mede aboue christ jesu xviii chapter ¶ howe knightes gentilmen chase alerike king common chase radagasus whyche ended myschefe remembred antiquite byble no floud howe discent sonnes thre linege plainly theyr bloud kinreddes dylated ben abrode myne authour made mynde japhet seuen nacions finde people fyrste gaule galathe magoth gothes folke itayle tyre cithia many great countre standing asia rehersayle europe stant trace fayle gothes cithiens purpose ordaine▪ among selfe gouernours twayne knyghtes gentelmen chase alericus prince haue souerayntie common chase radagasus gothes fyrst greate suerte king alerike entring cyte rome finde socour time honorius emperoure graunt whome al hole countre gaue alerike gaule spayn fraūce abide thereto holde see gothes spaynolfes vnder obeisaunce takyng hym al gouernaunce tyl stillicon occident mete rome sent time honorius beyng emperoure stillicon gan alerike enchace many sturdy proud soudioure fight chose haue place aleryke stode grace fortune might stillicon put vnto flyght radagasus alerike assent haue concluded full accorded thrugh itaile make went toward rome entre cyte maugre romains haue souerainte tofore entring gan town manace name rome chaunge difface towne euermore shame purpose ye haue heard deuise fyrst al chaunge townes name dempt selfe able emprise tune thought otherwyse like maners domage whan men sheweth fresh vysage condicions alway one stondmele custome vary fyrst froward stilicon radagasus efte agayne contrary one poynt list neuer tarye radagasus fauoure fayle stillicon vanquished batayle pride might make spede fortune lyst ordaine fayne strayt nede fl ye socour hye mountayne vitaile naked baraine weere hunger felt great greefe nigh al people dyed mischefe socour destitute baraine sawe remedy toke flyght romayns ouerlaine take mischefe maugre might chaynes bound dampned anone ryght deed people tolde many one slayne take sold none prouder su • q̄dus thylke dayes plainly discryue said king radagasus toke romains stryue • ower short ouerturned bliue fortune malice lust •• e tirant hunger thrust among proud prince reioised selfe maner vainglory men countres cal king gothes short memorye rehersed written history gyue ensample dede men maye finde name tyrantes sone minde xix chapter ¶ howe ruffyn chamberlayne theodosy vsurped emperour therfore honorious dampned heade smyt hie climing vp hath oft vnware fal specially whan sodaine fro low degre estate imperyall whan false ambicion ladder doth ordain vsurpacion presumptuously attayne abou • skyes heade perce fro whens come shame reherce meane thus al hasty climbing list self know haue forget groūd ginning froward fame worldly wind blow▪ reise name aboue sagitaris bowe recorde ruffin proudly gan desire false intrusion occupi • pite rufin whilom chamberlayn theodosy holde manly knight yet one thing • oule ouersaine couetise blynded syght spēd labour title right emperour honorius sent gouerne orieate processe ruffin made vike • e called vikarimperial toke vpon holye entere authorite chefe principall selfe alone gouerne able thus deme weare diedeme selfe much make porte therto ambicious constantinople vnwarely take first bound chaynes serued thus true iudgment honorius hed smot righthand dede ende irede xx chapter ¶ howe stillyon like condicon ended mischefe whose dethe bochas came one like condicion afore remembred called stillion purposed haue possession empyre hole thus thought mene y• way fader sought compendiously tell twayne fro diuers countrees towarde septētrion gather people theyr busy payne many dyuers straunge nacion againe honorius came togyder doun met fortune made fayle bothe atones slaine batayle ginning cursed cursed fyne whose death rede twayne one constance father constantyne constantine toke certayne reigne gaule dyd ordayne countre gouernour continue lorde emperoure sonne constaunce caught deuocion conscience forthwith anonright shaue monke made profession father force might let take hī gaue hī thorder knight bothe assent gan make selfe strong toppres countre people wrong said constaunce mine auctor saith confederate hatefull cruelte one hēricius assuraūce made faith brethern sworne authorite make nombre vp thre constantyne sworne also al one saide thre sworne ioyned thus conquered spayne many great cyte whyle said henricius traytour false full duplicite felowe slought againe othe pardye thus constaūce false collusiō henricius murdred trayson henricius lyued nat whyle owne knightes slaine also fraude fraude disceit quyt gyle foloweth euer gladly cometh therto men receiue guerdon let men alway haue remembraunce murdre custome wyll ende wt mischaūce among suche thus endinge mischefe came attalus one eraclyan prowes great reprefe remembred storie tell agayne romanes whan rebell gan honorius afore made officer empyre called chefe vykars first attalus tyranny whan gaule made gouernour went spaine great company dyd payne fraudulent labour false sleight made emperour take bounde exiled falsnesse hande smyt ended wretchednesse eraclian ende almost lyke yet promoted great prosperite made gouernour lorde affrike consulere rose dignite rode libi many gret coūtre thre thousande shippes gan sayle seuin hundred ariue itayle many shyppes neuer afore seine like accompted wryting nauy passed nauy certayne mighty zerxses perce king alisandre yet cōming toward itaile whan aryue sea fortune gan againe stryue arriuaile sodaine drede cause honorius sent downe capitain constancius called gouernoure bede romains mete ye plain whiche eraclian tourned fynde gan take passage towarde cite called cartage thus fortune lyst power shewe came fully noble towne sharpe swerdes hewe among knight false collusion fil discencion intrucion fyrst gan quarell romains whan gan rebell ❧ xxi chapter ¶ goodly processe rome distroied lyke cause many realmes many mischeues rehersed drawe longe shortly tolde howe fortune hath whele reuersed tragedy remembred manyfolde tofore bochas prince yonge olde eight boke rehersed processe echone almost ended wretchednesse namely dyd moste desyre wrong titel selfe magnify haue lordshyp gouerne thempyre state imperial proudly occupy whiche estate plainly specifye farre phebus doth spere shyne among lordship brought ruyne fro mine authour lyst nat discorde tel y• ground rome came nought example cast recorde chefe cause wel soght storie came vnto thought john bochas whiche ye shal full notably rehersed ensample storie rehersing ceriously folowing myne authour odoacer whylom famous king kyng name great gouernour condicions rauinous robbour countre mercy pite banished euer trouth equite region mercy nat vsed trouthe oppressed tyranny right wysenesse power refused false extorcion subporteth robbrye sensualyte may haue maistry reason token prefe many lande haue brought mischef realme may stāde surete ferme stable existence continue long prosperyte trone knightly excellence supported iustice prudence shall egal iudge stand twene riche poore sceptre hand clere ensample matter grounde father naturall like mother kindly bounde foster child especiall right king estate royall office diligently entende true liege cheryshe defende good ensāple subiectes tenlumine tēporal realmes saith scripture resemble kingdome diuine lawe god lawe eke nature re publica long time may endure voide discorde false duplicite one body longe prosperite nouther reigne dominacion haue selfe none assuraunce estate kinges gan permission goddes grace purueyaunce vertuous life moral gouernaunce long continue bothe peace warre like desertes punish whā erre myrrour lyght transcēde vertuous excellence examplers equite right discrecion natural prouidence tempre rigour wt mercy clemence▪ shal fal afore cast al thinges appertaineth prince kinges thinges passed haue remembraunce conserue wisely thinges presence thinges come afore make ordinaunce folowe trace vertuous continence againe vice make resistence vertue magnanimite whiche appropred imperial maieste brother force author say echone conserueth royal dignite suche meane stable stone nat ouerglad prosperite ouer sad none aduersite life death hygh corage remue god man yelde thē due gayne fleshly lustes arme thē sobrenesse voyde surfettes froward glotony gredy appetite measure represse house auoide ribaudy rowners flattrers lie ware dome nat perciall poore almesse vertuous liberal array shewe like king prince maner apparence men prayse hys vertuous lyuing clothing far frō presence let thinke aduertence trust theron verely certayne gouerneth men wyl reporte sayne let also great aueile haue presence notable prince counsayle suche fore haue experience twene good euill know difference sixe thinges hatefull newe olde banish hast frō houshold fyrst loue liue ydelnesse suche loue nouther god ne drede couetous people poore folke oppresse also mede simulacion cladde double wede auauntages one hode shewe two visage let also voyde gate ryotous people y• loue watche al night also vse drinke late lie bedde till diner dight suche lyst nat god haue syght recheles folke list nat masse • uoyde court let thē lightly passe defautes rehersed toforne nat onely rome many great countre haue distroied many kingdom lorne olde cronicles ye may rede se false ambicion froward duplicite hath many realme many lād encloied ben cause haue distroied jerusalem whilom transmygrate true prophetes dispite balthasar eke infortunate babilone folowed al delyte dary perce small respyte sodainly slaine murdred treason alysādre whan drāke poison discorde troy grounded couetyse whan false traison solde palladion rome cartage wyse distroied shorte conclusion among selfe deuisyon reken realmes later date deuisions fraūce y• late al defautes rehersed breuely sought rote weied balaunce chefe occasion tell hath ben ī prince y• haue gouernaunce specially put remembraunce example telleth cometh mynde odoacer storie fynde borne pruce hardy corage beginning selfe magnify though mencion made • mage hauing titell thefte robbery cōquest gan nought blode aūcetry gadred people sondry region entred itayle many nacions soudiours fyrst gan assayle multitude entryng anon right kingdom hūgry countreis itayle met passage romayne knight called horestes stele armed bright felde take put ieoparty horestes fledde socour pauy straitly besieged towne founde time none cheuesaunce next morow rising son bounde cheynes tencrees greuaunce sent cite called plesaunce againe odoacer fel let slayne iudgement full cruell whose death sodayne violence odoacer passed itaile entred rome found resistence zeno emperour durst nat assayle none giue batayle force rauinous working itaile crowned king rome vnder subiection fortune lyst nat fayle zeno therof indygnacion gan worke againe hope shoulde auayle therupon lordshyppe itaile gaue purpose power committing theodorike gothes kyng y• theodorike hope haue vyctorie againe odoacer gan make resistence name put memorie toke vpon knightly excellence romains stand diffence met proudly chiualry beside riuer called soury batails togider whan met beside leglere standeth lōbardy rounde speres sharpe swerdes whet odoacer al tyranny put flight disconfyted party fortune best chaunge vary vnset hour contrary power romains haue defied brent vine toures enuy ron bycause thentre denied rauenne discended maugre take toun theodorike lette eche man take hede odoacer commaunded dede myne authour bochas entencion time came remembraunce towarde romains maketh digression recording great variaunce vnware chaunges gery coūtenaūce fortune false transmutacion wordes rehersing toun remembre rome call ayen minde day passed thy felicite thy marcial cōquestes thy triūphs left behinde thy great victory auctorite thy famous lawes song eche countre ye world report shyne atones tourned ruyne est west thy lordshyp attayne aboue power excellent royall nowe rome almaine estate translated imperiall name thy senatours name especiall golden letter darked diffaced remembraunce almost raced cyte city whilom glorious freshly floured chiualry whiche alpies mountain famous subiecte lombardy til discorde diuision enuy amōg selfe hath clipsed y• brightnesse false serpēt brought doublenesse kinges prince tributary prosperite fulsome flode among yourselfe till ye began vary world throughout subiecte stode tyll ye gan shew two face one hode folowed fortune hath prouided ye came nought whan ye gan deuided vnpurueyed prudent senatours thy marchandise tourned pouerte knighthod naked barayne soudiours disconsolate stant cōmonte towres walles broke cite whilom paradise delyte nowe worlde hath dispite cause conclude al thy wretchednesse false ambicion pride lechery diuision malicious doublenesse rancour hatred couetise enuy set aside good policie brefe rehersed short conclusion haue chefe grounde thy distruction xxii chapter ☞ howe kinges trabstila busarus brought vnto subiection made tributares theodorike mischeues told rōe toun came trabstila king gepidois twaine made mēciō busarus king bulgarois philitheus reigning ragois thre brefely saine came atones bochas complayne realmes standing toward septētriō remembre fyrst twayne brought atones subiection theodorike dyd busy payne conquere proudly ordayne neuer hardy rebell agayne romains take quarell theodorike made tributary wretchedly bound seruage neuer hardy vary paine death al age seruitude lo surplusage al wretch wretched foūd thraldom constrained bounde tresour tresours well sought vertuous fredome large lyberte worldly goodes may nat bought royal ruby gold stone pyrre transcendeth hath soueraynte aboue richesse erthe found man large frely stande vnbound xxiii chapiter philitheus lost kingdome marcian leo next two ordre ye may se john bochas gan shew pre sēce third king called philithe fortune sodaine violence lost kingdome cruel sentence odoacer tyraunt mercylesse lost life came presse sodaine chaūges rede whan begā saw whele oft turne vp downe fortune came one marcian whome made none mencion saue coniuracion murdred innocent amōg knightes slew asset tofore bochas shewe presence came one called leon caught titell violence made clayme iust succession father toke possession leon myne auctor saith beyng emperour bare name yong leon truth ryght tyranny made mencion cruell zeno y• good knyght put possession constrayned liue religion order dyd wende fynde nat made ende xxiiii chapiter ¶ howe simacke boes sonne lawe banished iudged die mischeues simak gan hym drawe toward bochas ful pitous face boes came y• son lawe among romains gretly stodi grace matere brefely pace said boes onely trouthe exiled ala great routhe cōmon profite vnto toun matter grounded right protectour stedfast champion againe two tirātes whiche force might porail oppressed many wight exaction pyllage gun newe vpon cōmens full false eke vntrew theodorike gothes lorde king toke vpon false intrusyon reigne rome people oppressing prouostes two made mencyon citie great oppression confederate brother vnto brother coniugast triguill compendiously matter declare saue common stode defence life death lyst nat spare withstand tyrantes sentence king theodorike cruell violence banished hatefull tyranny father abyde pauy afterward theodorike cruell haterede like false tyrant malice enuy gaue iudgement two dede touching boes bokes specify wrote diuers bokes philosophy trinyte matter diuine martyred christe called seuerine xxv chapter ¶ king arthur cōquestes commodity england distroied cosin mordrede neuer prīce might self assure fortune fauour restrayne like desyre grace recure abide stable stand certaine among reken arthur bretaynē time hold euery wight wysest prince best knyght bochas gan style dresse chaptre remembre bliue great conquest highe noblesse singler dedes wrought liue first ginneth breuely discryue site britaine countre whiche enclosed large see set farre westward ye shal vnderstand hauing spayne set opposite small angle called englande fran̄ce hi discryuing thus sight many riuere plesaunt delite bothe bathe welles founde diuers mynes metalles full habounde aboute whiche ronneth occian right plentuous maner vitaile name brutus fyrst began london hath shyppes sea sayle bachus wynchester gretly doth auaile worcestre frutes haboundeth ful herford beastes cotswolde wul bathe hot bathe holsome medicine yorke mighty timbre great auauntage corn wall mynes wherin myne salisbury beastes full sauage whete mylke hony plente euery age kent canterbury hath great cōmodite sondrie fyshes taken see bochas reherseth eke bretayne founde gete full precious stone blacke colour vertuous certayne sickenesses many mo one poudre whiche wyll difcure anone dronke though secre maydenhede broken chastite ther ben peerles founde muskil shelles best haue whitenesse boke brutus also telles king arthure speke worthynesse passed kinges marciall prowesse touchyng line royall kynrede lyst se brutus may rede father called vter pendragon manly knight famous corage right notable actes euerychon arthur yonge tendre age full assent baronage succession crowned anonright called europe moste famous knight curteys large manly dispence myrrour called lyberalite hardy stronge great prouidence knightly magnanimite droue saxon countre conquered prowesse mighty hand orcadoys denmarke holande irland gaule norway scotlād fran̄ce martes son werres mete wrought counsaile ordinaunce prudent marlyn called prophete fynde let make sete among britōs famous notable worlde called y• roūde table worthy knightes proued hand chosen arthur order begō famous noble euery land shone reporte doth midday sonne fame palays renome vp ronne statute set vertuous ordinaunce vnder profession marciall gouernaunce first statute regestre founde fro na • decline right full assuraunce othe custome bounde aye armed plate forged bright except space reste night seke auentures time spende rightful quarell sustene defende sebler partye right theyr power manly supporte required wight folke disconsolate beare vp comforte time men may reporte maner wyse vtolence tiraūtes make knightly resistece widowes maiden suffre domage false oppression hateful cruelte restore child true heritage wrongly exiled folke countre holy church liberte redy euer make selfe stronge rather die suffer haue wronge cōmon profyte chosen champyons pro republica defending countre shewe aye selfe hardy lyon honoure encrece chastise dishoneste releue al suffre aduersite religious folke haue reuerence pylgrimes receiue y• faile dispence called armes seuen dedes mercy buryed soudiours fayle sepulture folke prison deliuere graciously suche poore raunsome recure wounded people languyshe endure pro republica māly spent blood statute bounde suche folkes good put selfe neuer auenture matter iust trewe afore prouided stode sure ground wel know olde newe matter whan knewe procede knightly nat fayne ryght required theyr quarel darrayn clerke cronicle theyr dedes purciuauntes made reporte exployte good spedes rad songe folke gaue great comforte famous knightes making resorte hygh feastes eueriche toke sete lyke estate mete one voyde called see perilous sanke royall doth playnly determyne none entre vertuous god prouided pure vyrgine borne discente accomplyshe fyne alone chefe souerayne auentures wale bretayne amonge al kynges renomed famous bryght sonne set amyd sterres stode arthur notable glorious lyke freshe phebus cast lyghte aferres peace like argus marcial werres ector hardy lyke vlixes tretable called amōge christen king honorable roial courte dyd ordayne eche coūtre fer spred light euer came thider complaine wronge oppressed required right defence shulde fynde knyght hym assigned finally entende marciall dome quarell defende fell straunge knyght sought auentures thyder came fro ferre armes request made right chalenge sene peace werre accept courte came nerre lyke came wyth many alone deliuered forsake neuer nōe schole marcial doctrine yonge knyghtes lerne al gyse tendre age lerne ful disciplyne horse fote notable exercyse thing take youth doth helpe many wise ydelnes grene yeres gonne al vertues clypseth clere sonne wydowes maiden oppressed folke also extorte wronges wrought tiranny countre nacion came therto receyued lyst man denye complayntes founde sone remedy made delay forth anone ryght defende assigned knyght eke order bounde troth assuraunce othe sworne emprises let slothe playnely tell howe haue borne auenture thinges done beforne right fyll spare manere tel eche thinge vnto theyr regystrere thynge openly done thinge secre auenture bytwene twayne quarel take volunte trewly reporte platly fayne sworne statute dyd ordayne conceled worshyp shame regestred reporte selfe conclude statute hath v leared euery quarel grounded honeste courte knyght requyred diffence trouth equyte falshed excluded duplicite shall aye redy sustayne party lyfe hys body put ieoparty thus bretayne shone y• clere light chiualrye hie prowesse world shad beames bright wel worshyp condite al noblesse imperial courte wronges represse head sprīg honor largise chefe cesterne myrrour māhod noblesse lanterne yet sene neuer bryght sonne sommers day mydday spere freshly shyne skyes donne might percase curtaine beames clere oft falleth whā fortune maketh best falsly smyleth double wede folke sene expert drede thus whan name worthy kyng ferthest sprade reporte memory euery realme noblesse shinynge emprises concluding victory double goddesse enuied glory cast meanes som maner traine clipse light knighthode britaine thus whyle arthure stode honorable estate flouringe age among knightes rounde table hyest prince fortune stage romains sent truage gan make claime frowarde outragious takyng title cesar julius time mighty kyng arthur conquered gaule also fraunce outrayed frolle lyke conquerour brought paris vnder obeysaunce toke grace hys ordinaunce gate al anioue angory gascoine poitowe nauerne berry burgoyne cesed dyd busy payne lyke knight helde forth hys passage gate lande poyters tourayne cite yolde hym homage rebell founde none auanutage soiourned fraunce sayth y• cronicler helde possession space nyne yere helde feast full solempne paryse countreis whyth gate fraunce lyke prince full prudent rightwyse fredome full royall suffisaunce cōquest countreis substaunce prince baron prouided lyke desertes hath deuided seneschal called kay anioue mayne gaue party butler made delay called bedwere gaue normandye baron nye cosyn alye manly knight named berell gaue duchy burgoyne euery del thus departed lordeshyppes lande thought expedient reserued hys owne hande againe britayne retourned entent sent letter helde greate parliament made feast anon countre called gloumorgon great cite called carlion remembred olde wrytinges came many prince many freshe baron nombre fynde x kynges redy obey arthur al thynges present also wele sene erles rekened full thurtene al knightes rounde table feast pentecost feest principall many estate famous honorable prince baron borne blode royal present especiall othe promyse bounde y• brotherhede table rounde fell whyle kyng arthur appertayned sate hys estate came xii sent downe great laboure olde men chosen senate sad porte demure temperate richely clad loke vysage gray heared sempt right great age first connyngly thought due cause cōmyng playnly entent fyrst assent kyng dyd salue next tolde sent letter mekely present concludyng thus speke brefe langage howe romains aske hym truage customed olde syth gone many day whan cesar conquered first britayne kynge requiring make thē delay arthur abode lyst nothinge sayne courte gan dysdayne proude briton cruel hasty blode wolde haue slayne thē euyn stode nay quod arthur al officer within courte shal haue domage entred bene come messangers men also greatly fal age let make chere wyth glad visage toke coūsaile wer wise answere sayde curteyse wyse letter red plainly vnderstande tenure hole remembred place touching y• charge ye haue take hāde yeue answere reherced short space worde writyng ye greatly manace ye purpose wyth many strong battayle passe moūtains felly assayle nedeth conquest alledge agayne briton none olde truage coming y• way shal abredge wyth goddes grace short passage make delay baronage passe see without long tariyng mete romaine downe cōmyng answer youe messāgers departing bare wt great rich bade also vnto officer agayne rome anone gan thē dresse plainly reporting plentuous largesse worthy arthure considred thynges christendome passed al kinges arthur courte sour well marciall prowes lucius tolde howe al dyd excel chyualry wyth wthold chosen knyghtes yonge olde europe considre arighte noblesse torch lyghte cast paye truage sayde romaynes helde londe defende wyl make passage claymes breake two bonde knyghtly preue honde ye haue tytle ye cite agayne briton whych euer haue stand fre y• al kingdom subiect rome toun kynges prince aboue hie mountaines lucius discended downe mete briton vpon large playnes arthur comming greatly disdain bycause plainely dyscriue multitude people fyue southhamptō arthur toke see knightes rounde table behinde left gouerne countre cosin mordrede vntrusty vnstable prefe false disceyuable arthur trust toke al lande crowne except whych kept hande fro southhampton arthur gan sayle worthy lordes britaine harflue fonde good ariuaile prince passage dyd ordaine thrugh normādy fraūce eke burgoine vp cyte called augustence wher first fonde lucius presence large felde multitude men armes assembled plaine vpon day shortly conclude togider assemble afore neuer seine lucius party certaine eastwarde worlde chiualtye brought y• moūtains germany wardes set ech great battaile capitaine gouerne gye arthur wt briton romains auaile fond many sarazins vpō party briton gaulfride doth plainly specify arthur prowes doth discriue flewe day sarazins kynges fyue great slaughter effusion bloude day outher syde eche againe y• furious wode lyke felde fortune lyst prouide shoulde longe theron abyde write deth slaughter manere touching felde tedious conclude leaue surplusage battayle dead manye knight cōsul lucius slaine rage proude romains force put flighte gentilnes arthur anone ryght let body lucius caried againe rome lenger taried worthy prince lord dead manly knightes abidynge wyth arthur like king solempnly toke hede buried diligēt labour whyle lyke false traitour cosyn mordrede dyd busy paine take kyngdom britayne story plainly maketh minde mordrede falsly auauntage entreted left behynde vnder colour fraudulent langage gaue thē gret fredōe homage false conspiracion brought al britaine rebellion faire behestes many frendly signe drewe people hym sondry wyse shewed outwarde goodly benygne gaue lybertees many great fraunchyse make britōs soueraine lord dispise purueiaunce gan make blyue kepe porte shoulde ariue whan king arthur knowledgyng false treason al purueyaūce mordrede made lyke manly king left burgoyne al lande fraunce cast mordrede vengeaunce toke see wyth great apparayle cast sandwiche make ariuaile mordred redy wt knightes gret nōbre made strōg felde mete plaine purpose fully arthur encombre arriuayle slayne gawayne cosyn arthur noble knight certaine eke aguisel slayne stronde kyng scottes came londe maugre mordrede arthur dyd arryue grounde recured lyke manly knighte feare anone blyue sayde mordred toke hym flyghte towarde london toke hys way ryghte gate shyt kept cite againe mordred myght haue none entre al haste cornwayle fled sworde arthur durst abyde lest shoulde lay life wed yet selfe thus gan prouide multitude gathered syde put life dethe day auenture dye felde recure fortune may certayne vpon whose whele al brotilnesse founded mordred tharday felde slayne noble arthur deth wounded felde briton confo • ded great slaughter good knightes lorne vpon day men haue sene beforne battaile arthur whyle staunche woūdes hurtes recure borne lytter came yle called aualon auenture sayd gaulfride recordeth scripture kyng arthur flour chiualrye fet wt knightes liueth yet fairy thus britayne translated sonne vp ryche sterry bryghte dongeon astronomer wel reherce konne called arthur constellacion wher sit crowned heuenly mancion amyd palaies stone cristalline tolde among christen worthy nyne errour abideth yet among brytons founded vpon prophesye olde marlyn lyke opinion kyng crowned fairye sceptre sworde regalye shal resort lorde soueraine fairy reigne britayne repaire againe rounde table prophesy merlyn set date among prince kyng incomparable sete agayne carlion translate parchas susterne spon hys fate epitaphe recordeth certayne lieth king arthur yt shal raigne agayne vnto bocas wyl agayne retourne afore rehersed parcel hys prowesse theron abyde lyst soiourne remembre great vnkyndnesse conspiracion treason falsnes done king arthur cosyn mordred make lenuoy al men may rede ¶ lenuoye tragedy arthur folowing byddeth prynces beware false treason erth none perillous thynge trust fayeth decepcion hyd vnder curtayne false collusion mē shuld holde coūcel good beware afore euer vnkinde blode world diuers fortune aye chaungeable euery countre euery region straite nede fewe frendes abyde stable long absence causeth discencion prince false diuision nygh alye shewe two face one hode let men beware euer vnkynde blode hardy prince reignig famous marciall renoun thā whilom enemy outrainge arthur chefe sonne brutus albion al disposicion fate fortune furious wode caused distruccion vnkynde blode cōtrarious nature shewinge fayre pretence double entencion great aliaunces frowardly workyng hid vnder floures serpent cast poison bryght siluer scaled domageth dragon eche worme sōe party tarageth brode perilous vnkinde blod noble prince arthur remembringe deme day phebus going doun al golde clere shininge afore prouided inwarde reason false vndermining supplantacion remembring aye arthur stode conspiracion vnkynde blode ☞ exclamacion bochas agayne kynredes vnkynde agayne kynredes vnkynde alyaunces bochas maketh exclamacion vpon mordrede whyche wyth hys ordinaunces caused arthur finall distruccion fame eclypsinge brutus albyon wyth standyng plainly discriue trusted aboue al men alyue meruayle vncouth deuyse occasion corrage man shoulde maner wyse founde vnkinde vnto linage hateful god age blode agayne blode borne one kynred conspire malice hatrede matter vayne tary story knowe arthur mordrede blode alied workyng contrary made many briton knyght blede vsurpyng conspiracion falshede sayd mordrede infortunate caused al britayne stande desolate fyrst desolate absence kynge called tyme kynges notable desolacion knyghtes abydynge whilome britaine famous honorable brethern echone rounde table mordred y• false sworn knight stode longe eclipsed dyrked lyghte light noblesse y• shone britaine false mordred dirked bemes monarchye departed twayne stode first one marcial strems afterward brightnes hys beames drough decline false diuision hath distroied ful many region al processe vpon duplicite plainely concludeth blode vnkynd adue welfare prosperite peace concorde left behynde tree may thriue departed fro rinde plaine example arthur mordrede conceyue list story rede xxvi chapter ¶ gisiuill kynge venandre three kinges howe distroied straunge vncouthe thynges tofore jhon bochas made mencion came foure myghtye kynges complayne desolacion fyrst gisiuill kyng region called venandre werres ful contraire vnto prince called belisaire saide noble belisaire full renomed tyme chiualry kyng gothes also aduersayre atones hatred enuy assented fully holde champerty gayne belisaire throughe hie renoun toke thē cast thē prison thē bochas founde order writyng came amarales wyth many blody wound tyme mawres kynge without cause title thynge vpon jane sanguin gan werray agayne right affrik one y• best knight sayde jane armed plate mayle met amarales affrike sande helde mighty strong bataile lyke knight slewe hym wyth hand droue al people proudly fr • lande 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 boke none mynde remembred • fynde synduall bretaine lorde kyng tofore bochas put selfe prees gan shewe mischefe pitiously wepyng whan helde werre wylfull recheles agayne prince called narsates romayne knight feirse hardy stronge defence whā men wold hun wrōg narsates case auenture though dede manly knyght fayled membres sothe engendrure aduersaries echon put flight toke king forthwith anone ryght cronicle playnly doth recorde hye galowes hinge corde narsates victory kyng totila full great disdaine great host pōpous glory came vpon met hym playne multitude though ouerlayne turnyng totila many man behelde narsates slayne felde order next bochas doth write gepidoys howe king trusmonde required woulde endite gret aduersites dyd haboūd doughter called rosamounde vnhappy chaunce make discryue fortune contrary al lyue albuinus king lombardy many laude helde subiection conquered beme prage hungery land gepedois manye region fought king made mencion slewe battaile said trusmonde wedded doughter rosamonde myne auctour gretly comendeth beaute wryteth also young age whose story first whan dyd se howe vngracious also mariage gan pale dead visage greatly astoined confuse shame write story hindring name wyll forbeare lightly passe surplusage lightlye ouerpasse tel manere felony dyd hertes brace shoulde blot boke eke deface cast truely fayle touching story make rehersaile xxvii chapter ☞ howe albuinus murdred hys wife howe moste vycious murdred also kinge albuinus ye shall vnderstande many conquest victorye whyche hadde bothe see lande put triumphes memory let crye feast encrese glory whiche feest solempne principall sate estate royall parcell pride parcel gladnesse quene present sayd rosamonde take supprised wyth dronkenes stronge wynes whych yt day habo • sent goblet golde founde vnto quene licour full pleasaunt bad father shoulde drinke taunt dempt maner mokery first name worshyp confounde byd drinke ataunt party father sayd trusmounde slaine afore wyth many blody wounde albuinus vnhappy chaunce whych rebuke cast vengeaunce bare rancour ful long entent whiche day day gan renewe encrease certayne squier made assent accomply woulde neuer cease another squier gan preace called perdius accorded one false murdre execute anone daye set whyle lay slepe fyll vpon wt sharpe swordes grounde lorde slayne ala toke kepe died fortune hath founde speares head tronchon bounde selfe defending mortall strife slaine treason wife murdre escape fro daunger rosamonde fled awaye night went melchis squier toke shyp sayled sterre light rauenne toke waye ryghte led refute socour albuinus al hole treasour wedded melchise man worlde stode grace loue appalled set prise coude content one place ioye euer newe thing purchace assaye many neuer pleased one tyll experience preued echone prouost rauenne chefe gouernour excellence great beaute aboue al woman loued peramour whan entred fyrst cite fraude duplicite cast murdre frowarde auyce newe husband called melchis hote sommer lusty freshe may melchis hete werines selfe bathe went certayne day caught great thurst fayntnes rosamonde infernall falsnes toke goblet licour great fo • son gaue drinke wine medled poisō dranke vp halfe therwithal gan brest belly swell aryse intoxicate wext deadely pale wan whan dyd treason aduertise made drinke wise maugre wyll might restrayne guerdon murder died bothe twayne chapter litle fruite fynde saue onely thys put remembraunce folke shoulde call agayne mynde murdre afore god requyreth aye vēgeaunce funeral story wayed balaunce wrought melchis compassed founde false treason cursed rosamounde slewe first lorde albuinus sayde two squiers dyd execucion slepe whan dyd abrayde let counterpayse guerdon ech murdred drinking poison melchis drank first next drāk rosamoūde gan thē dyd rebounde counterpaysed one murder albuinus slayne rosamounde hys wyfe assent melchis eche poison parted gan fatall strife murder murder lost life vseth falsnes ful wel affirme dare shal falsnes quit ware departed part againe toke men deserue suche shall mede frowarde storye ende eight boke rosamonde melchis wrought dede short conclusion byddeth men take hede shall agayne receiue measour measure vnto neighbour ☞ thus endeth eyght boke herafter foloweth nynthe ¶ hovve emperoure mauricius hys wyfe hys child slayne calcidony ¶ fyrst chapter france petrark bochas vndertoke eschewyng slouthful ydelnes began taccōplysh vp boke assuraūce made hym busines thinge remēbred gan pen dresse nynth boke god wold gyue grace performe lyfe space beginnyng sothly labour study dyd hym appeare mauricius myghty emperour complayned rehersynge manere howe phoca cruell loke chere distroied wyfe childrē kinrede slaughter couth lyst storie rede sayd maurice write bochas jhon phoca brought distruccion wyfe child slaine echone calcidony made mencion whose deth toke possession sayd phoca put memory gaue pantheon saynt gregorye whyche temple olde foundacion ful ydols vp set hye stage throughe worlde euery nacion theyr goddes set vp great ymages euery kingdom direct visage poetes fuigens hys liue bokes olde plainely doth dyscriue euery ymage hande bell apparteyneth euery nacion craft token shoulde tel whan kingdome fil rebellion gan maligne agayne rome toun redresse wt strong myghty hande sent prince chastice al lande saide temple builded lime stone pope boniface bookes specify wher first called pantheon set vp cross vpon eche partye halowed martirs mary yere yere gynnyng nouembre feast hold martiloge doth remembre asia emperour maurice slain cite called calcidony al housholde many good romaine phoca perciēs memorye phoca vaynglory slaine heraclius thā emperour four twenty wynter gouernour ii chapter ¶ machomet false prophet beyng dronke deuoured amonge swine deth phoca tolde whā heraclius raine first began came mahomet time yhold false prophet magician bokes olde well reherce borne arabia low kynred life worshipped ydols dede whan grewe great age disceyuable many sondrie wy camel vsed fyrst cariage false double subtle diuises went egipt fette marchandīses jewes christen sondrie time sent learned olde newe testament bokes olde recorde partie thys mahomet cursed false man egipte fast gan hym hye towarde countre called corosan lady hight cordian subtill false daliaunce crafte fyll acquaintaunce wrought enchauntementes false meanes nygromancy enclyning towarde entente coude flatter wel lye sayd openly messy jewes abiding vpon cōmyng greattest prophet souerayne kyng thus people brought great errour techyng false doctryne wext among great gouernour saide lady also dyd enclyne prophet whych diuine sent aboue dyd vnderstande whyche toke husbande lynage gan hismaell syckenesse full ofte sithe fyll doun excuse saied gabriell sent fro heauenly mancion holy gost instruction angell shewed selfe shene stande vpright myght sustene shoulder oft tymes seyne whan folke shewed presence milke white doues piked greine eares affirmyng sentence came grace gostly influence visite shewe specifye prophet called messy newe lawes also dyd ordaine shewed signes false apparence lyke moises selfe dyd feyne prophet excellence thervpon shewe euidence smal porte wyth mylke hony borne great bull hanged eche horne made people gyue credulite doctrine froward teachyng mylke hony figured plente merite gostly workyng thus beginnyng take sarasis gan draw whych false errour bounde thē law clerke called sergius wrote lawes miracle thre first doues howe came hī thus tofore rehersed howe mylke hony token plente bull afore craft made tame false disceytes gete hym name arabiens sarasins rede turkes made prince gouernour hysmae • ytes folke perce mede gadered people gan wexe warriour agayne eraclius myghty emperour vsurped ride contrees▪ gate alisandry wyth many mo citees tho party desirous kynge purpose whan set asyde people falsly dyssimulynge tolde sent prophetes prouyde tho coūtrees gyde lecherous corage made venus set vp ymage made sarazins worship friday semblably hys story dothe expresse jewes halowed saturday workes concluding falsnes whan dranke wyne fyl dronkēnes taught people like false prophet drinke water good wyne lete sayd heretyke sergius counsaile frowarde contrary fone fayeth nestorius holy churche greatly gan vary whose errours bochas list tary write machomete gromancian false prophete list se lawes euerychon yeue sarazins boke cā bere wytnes set alkeron echone ordre grounded falsnesse lyke glotton dyed dronkennesse excesse drinkynge moch wyne fyll podell deuoured among swyne thys ende false machomete craftes nigromancy funerall fine saide prophete dronklewe kynde called selfe messie sarazins gretly magnifye jhon bochas let quene fraunce errour put remembraunce iii chapter ☞ howe brounchylde quene fraunce slewe kin brought land diuision hanged hewen peces small • came arayed nothynge lyke quene heer vntressed bochas toke good hede al booke afore sene wofull creature dede weping eyen torne al wede rebuking bochas cause left behynde wretchednes put mynde vnto myne auctour sodaynly abrayde like woman wo chekmate first al thus saide sometyme quene great estate crowned fraunce nowe disolate stand forsoth broūshilde name reherse haue maner shame thou busy write wofull caas within thy boke arcinoe dyddest seruice quene cleopatra rosamonde thou wrote also parde amonge al thou hast forgoten whereby semeth thou doest disdayne list parcell write paine whan bochas herd chere wext sad knowyng nothyng dyd endure iwysse quod afore haue rad cronicle scripture frowarde wofull auenture quod pray take good hede fyll wil reherce dede bochas brounchilde gan debate anon sothly quod condicion woman almost euerychone ye haue thys maner wythout excepcion naturall inclinacion youre declaring thys obseruaunce kepe nothynge say contrary worshepe nature hath taught wrōge excuse vnder curtaine al thig hyde litel graine chaffe ye abuse defautes ye lyst abide gaule touched al ye set asyde shewe rose freshe wedes ye let passe fairest chere ye trespasse ye shall tel owne tale howe ye fil fro fortune whele ye wyl vnclose litel male shewe vyces smal percele brotle glasse sheweth brighter stele though vertue ye shew faire pretēce fole yeueth credence quod brounchilde ryght well espye thou haste woman false opinion howe flatter wele lye ben diuers disposicion thou myghtest haue made excepcion hie estate gentle bene namely great quene hye estate kynd hath power chaunge nature nouther cold hete let v passe leaue matter theron abyde plete complaint say greate way seruyce shall quyte ye declare take penne write take hede quod good auice fro trouthe beware thou ne varye whilom fraunce reigned kyng clowise sonne named clothary clothar heire yt named lotarye lotary named seconde sonnes four story founde cronicle take hede put remembraunce whan father mighty kig dead atwene foure parted fraunce eche selfe haue gouernaunce one assent brother vnto brother wearing crownes ech quit thē time called brounchylde lyst varye olde writinge father named leuechylde spayne soueraine lorde kynge sayd father ful great hyndring bothe realmes fame ranne ferre twene spaine fraūce gan mortal werre brethern four fraūce crowned king agayne father made strong defence marcial pride fortunat chaungynges whan met mortall violence sodayne slaughter fyll pestilence outher partye felde like great flode tirrible effusion blode realmes y• werres importable causyng deth passyng great domage sought meanes wext assent tretable blode shedyng appease wofull rage one accorde yeue mariage sigebert reignyng tho fraunce twene realmes make aliaunce nay quod bochas deme twene must begyn strife aduised take good hede therto first assuraunce mariage lyfe chilperik ye wedded wyfe cronicles sene euerye expresse matter wil beare wt wytnes though bokes reherce sayne lyke ye haue made mencion rehersaile stande certaine assent outher region spaine fraunce conuencion ordained tendre age sigebert yeue mariage imeneus present whan toke chambre towarde nyght thesiphone susterne assent infernall goddess bare torch lyght torch shewed derke brighte thereby people present one al dempt mariage befal custome vsed antiquite temple goddes goddesse mariage folke hye degree torch borne men toke witnes dercke shewed bryghtnes difference sene eche estate towarde infortunate mariage short processe make torch brent yet bright shewed combrous smoke blake consolacion lost al lyght thus derknes wasted fyrst nyght verse songe goddes goddess togither sorow heuynesses tokēs night mariage pronostikes great aduersyte yet nature auauntage womanhead excellent beaute like quene stone perre arayed clad purple wede crowne golde vpon head solempnely crowned quene fraunce se folke fast gan repayre welfare suffysaunce clombe fortune full hie vpon stayre sonne called clotayre sygebert recorde writing thyrde name fraūce crowned kīg wolde god day borne put sepulture saluacion blode shede toforne caused death many creature diuers bokes reporte scripture ground ginning made mencion within lande great diuision brethern spake late began first occasion nat quod bochas ye fayled date chefe cause diuision sothly quod myne opinion among selfe dare well specify chefe ginnyng fateruall enuy kepe close matter ye faile folowing trace condicion ye halte foule rehersaile owne ymaginacion ye sewe sede dissencion amonge kynges ye take hede fraunce many man deade brounchilde gan chaunge chere bochas sayde face full cruel long agon thou knewest manere liuing small parcell semeth nowe thou knowest euery del ye may wythout lenger strife syt iudge knoweth wel life whan bretherne stode discorde eche agayne mortall violence vnder colour treate accorde many maner fayned diligence chilperik beyng presence whylom brother sigebert king slaine among thē false conspiring whose death auenged sygebert selfe auaunce among preace slaine parde nat qd bochas false gouernaūce misliuing fyl vnhappy chaunce sygebert murdred sothnesse onely occasion doublenesse folowing trace newe fangylnesse gaine sygebert ye wrought full falsly whan ye loued frowarde doublenesse landrike erle champayne bry outrage greyt foly king slayne ye dyd assent forest hunting whan went called forest compyne ala quod brake complaining bochas bochas thou doest sore vndermyne surfetes done liuing thou knowest death sigebert y• kīg whiche y• wrought ala mine assent howe knowest thou nat preset debate werre rebuke reherced vayne rehersaile greatly thou doest ecre caste right wele certayne defence reply agayne nat thou doest mene fregundis • lusty yonge quene fregundis thou shalt vnderstande right womanly fayre visage chilperik whylom hrsbande beauty toke mariage traines great outrage story list rede mischefe slaine thou shalt finde dede though ye langage make strong defence matter cause muse haue againe lost pacience subtelly wolde selfe excuse coutrariously traynes ye abuse clo • ayre haue red parde engendred sigebert remembre full wele haue rad chilperyk though ye therat disdain recorde auctours prudent sad trouth gendred twayne dying list nat fayne left sonnes two story ye may rede theobarte theoderyke succede bochas qd though thou turne vp • said story reherced dede folowing malice thyne opinion maugre thy wil forthe wyll procede began take therto good hede fyrst theoderik thou shalt vnderstande cosin germaine husbande king burgoine time another hatred indignacion slewe theobart whiche brother wyfe child short conclusion mighty famous region antras • e reigned lorde kyng euer thou saiest trouth leasinge nay nay qd bochas otherwyse may nat suffre howe ye go amonge langage newe ye deuise brought prefe concludeth vpon wronge shold lenger mater draw alōg self cause wher ye loth faine theodorik ye theoberte slaine grounde herof gan percell enuye froward breunyng couetise ye onely occupie rule lande owne gyse shall plainly deuise mischeues reherced god bote ye selfe ground chefe crop rote quod brounchylde conceiue wel se ye partie haue lost reuerence selfe enarmed shewe cruelte touching violence two slaughter reherced sentence first theodrik brother slew ī dede called theobarte pitous thing rede selfe strangled poyson wife child hewe peces smale ye quod bochas make mencion parte trewe nat al tale suppose ye wexe pale shame thing ye nat excuse whan theoderik beginneth accuse put crime false treason ye slewe wife child also selfe also ye murdred poison would wete ye coude say hereto ala qd neuer woman hie lowe estate thing considred infortunate fortune set lyttell price frowarde furious violence turnyng whele visage malice causeth man yeueth credence dispite voide reuerence fortune mutabilite sole abiecte fall pouerte bochas john shorte conclusion thou mayest againe thy style auaunce haue deserued haue punicion al prince baron fraūce crie aske auengeaunce refuge none recure thing tho wt clotarie selfe crowned king defautes foule abhominable tofore iudges parliament foriudged founde also culpable euery crime conuicte iudgement myne accusours beyng present one standing great route marked wt finger folke y• stode aboute shame mine eyen close thē gaured cast sight folke may token wele suppose mine eares nat stopped halfe ryght taken force lad forth might hangman drawe ouer hill vale dismembred hewe peces smale blode pament al bespraynt thāked fortune mine auēture soule parted body faynt red euer creature muche turment endure prayde bochas haue al thing mynde write life leaue nothing behynde ¶ lenuoy tragedy broūchild y• quene loke story list yeue attendaunce froward red cōtagious sene contrary good gouernaunce borne spaine crowned quene fraūce double tonge vpfynder treason caused al lande stande deuision tho traines coude man flene sourse headspring sorow mischaūce shed hony first stange myrremedled wt sugred false plesaunce said encluded variaunce maystresse murdre discencion caused lande stande deuision prince gaule might nat sustene great outrage great greuaunce surfetes done yeres grene brought y• kingdome almost vttraunce assent cried vengeaunce fame arose howe region falsnesse stode deuision knyfe murdre grounde kene malice longe continuaunce corage fret infernall tene spared nouther kyn alyaunce paysed forfetes wayed balaunce bochas writeth occasion made al fraunce stand deuision ¶ bochas marueyling malice cruelte brounchylde writeth thus bochas astonied gā inwardly maruayle fyll maner ambyguyte brounchyldes marueylous rehersayle howe woman reason ful malice cruelte slee kyn set distaunce deuision realme fraunce bochas dempt nat credible woman shuld vengeable malice venymous terryble slaughter murdre culpable story susperte helde fable onely excepte dyd exite great instaunce story write crie sought eche partye sayd prince coude wyshe teach releue dropsye made faint feble wyth great paulsye thus sickenes hath hys dayes spent vengeaūce slayne wt infernall turment eraclyus wofull ende assayle togither met stele armed bright gisulphus slaine people put flyght cathamus wt stronge mighty hande toke possession conquered lande whose death rimulde duchesse greatly astonied pale visage castell forgoile gan dresse knightes stronge fel corage cathamus made passage layde siege cast ieoparte lyfe body rather departe castell armed stode like prince sate knightly stede vpon walles rimuldis abode freshly besene purple wede siege gan take hede loke vnwarely cast asyde sawe king afore castel ryde like prince manly knight gan loke wonder narowe god loue perced sight vnto hearte marked arowe siege toke litell sorowe made soyle plyaunt thought castell set almost right nought accomplishe hole entencion false lust maner thing agreed composicion yelde castell haste vnto kyng come without tarying lyke duchesse selfe present king sate armed tent people within prisoner take four sonnes toke flight loue caused hath forsake blode kyn wronge right rimulde space al nyght cathamus delite euer dispyte kyng whan refused twelue nombre y• dwelled house frowardly beauty hath abused nature lecherous reherce contagious howe wext abhomynable aquainted gromes y• stable vayne tary witnesse cronicles also make mencion empyre made deuision first one parted twayne wherof mine auctor maner doth cōplaine ❧ ix chapter ¶ howe anastase compelled leaue empyre preest liue pouerte reherceth opinion therupon doth grounde deuise cause rote deuision toke originall false couetise ceriously telleth gise y• church whā rich brought pride perfeccion anone set asyde pore staffe potent doctryne whan chaunged list natabyde wylfull pouerte gan anone decline stately palfrays hie horse ryde shortes heer also layde asyde turned cope purple sanguine gownes scarlet furred hermine slendre fare wyne water clere abstinence breade made whete chaunged tho dayes many fat dinere confect drinke ypocras swete sobernes boundes lete scarsnesse fode left olde estate newe excesse gan wexe delicate gostly liuing churche appalled caused grekes withdraw sentence pope peter place stalled list none obedience false auarice caused offence grekes selfe deuide fro romains great pride thus couetise false ambicion first great harme spirituall brought discorde diuision amonge prince estate royall clibeth highest perilous fall recorde take foresaid anastace theodosie put place theodosie dyd busy paine grimaldus chaunges remēbred writinges like haue tolde partye came bochas four mighty kinges reigning echone olde lombardie maner gyse barbarye arayed passage hear frogrowen body visage berdes raught nauil doun garnementes colour manyfolde brod baudrikes enbraced enuyron large buckle pendauntes fyne golde theyr brech enbroudred y• gyse olde fret perle legge stocked kne playnynge bochas aduersite shone raced freshly tone richely transuersed gold wyre theron set many stronge stone gayne phebus light shone bright clere lombarde kinges gan taproch nere fyrst al king lupus vnto bochas gan complaine thus bochas quod party reherce short conclusion one grymaldus prince lombardy hath enclosed region cruelly enchayned prison sergeaunt sende smyt myne head made ende xi chapter ¶howe heade alexius smit comperton end reherced lupus declare mortall heuynesse next ordre came alexius lōbard king famous richesse toke surquedous prowesse compasse distruction prince called comperton ware also crowne lombardye atwyxt werre great distaūce people lordes pauie mighty hande marciall gouernaunce said alexius brought vnto mischaunce comperton escaped drede mortal vengeaunce let smite heade xii chapiter ❧how ariperton drowned ryches whose death pitously playning tofore bochas came ariperton lombardy whilom lord king whiche like fole high presumpcion causelesse toke occasion volunte say againe duke bagaroys werrey prince twayne taken haue felde ariperton party gan apayre aduersary anone behelde cowarde herte gan fall dispayre pauie feare gan repayre toke treasour purpose anonright uery drede take flight toke vessell entred see sodaine tempest assailed derknesse barge perished great aduersite drowned wt al great rychesse lo fyne worldly wretchydnesse namely get great treasours gyn werre agayn neighbour xiii chapter ¶howe dediere pope adrian charles fraunce put flight died mischefe nexte bochas heuye loke chere king lombardy shewed presēce called time noble dediere notable armes great excellence father done offence pope full great duresse king cast domages redresse agistolphe father name whiche pope great aduersite whiche sonne encreace fame royall fredom magnanimite benygne lyberalite gaue pope humble reuerence stately cite called fagence therwith gaue treasour great good list fredome nat spare mighty castell whiche tybrestod within boundes lordshyp ferrare whiche cyte playnly declare antiquite myne auctour telleth stant vpon ryuer poo dediere reigning lombardy gan wexe famous beginning great name vpon eche party erthe nothing abyding stant chaunge fortune workyng founde vnstable double vysage king chaunged corage large euery side lyberal founde many sondrye wyfe goodlyhede chaunged pryde largesse couetyse doublenesse gan anone deuyse clayme agayne ye shall vnderstand saide gyftes pope hande whiche dediere made aliaunce cronicle maketh mencion king pepin reignyng tho fraunce whose death haue possession full lordshyp region gan newe fall distaunce wt pope king fraūce presumpcion werres began againe promise double variaunce pope tho day holy adrian stynt troble gret mischaūce required helpe king fraunce great charles bochas rede came pope helpe nede charles time chefe protectoure holy churche pauis defence whiche hole hert dyligent labour dediere manly violence met tuskie knightly excellence batayle preue might charles victor yelded vp cyte kyng dediere sent fraunce mighty chaynes fettred prison like wretche sorow great penaunce died mischefe gayned raunson afore great possession whose day olde writing among lōbardes neuer crowned king xiiii chapter ¶ pope johan woman childe put downe prince reherced toforne drowned teares came creature like byshop rounded yshorne priest abrode tonsure apparayle outwarde vesture
