without title byrthe lynage succede fraude false labour among romains reigne emperour vngracious sitting estate mischefe spent dayes euerychoue lyce wormes made infortunate skyn fleshe fret vnto bone craft medicine socour ther none depe fret entrayle died▪ distresse leche might auayle ¶ bochas counsayleth prince remembre arnolde myne auctour bochas stynte sharped penne entenciō gan anger transporte style write tyrauntes transgression wode fell scorpion counsailing whan bolde remembre proude arnolde ne nat pride assayled wolues tigres lion rauynous beares wilde bore trauayled nouther mighty champion haue conquered many region wormes engendred kynde said arnolde murdred fynde suche disioynt said arnolde stode louse wormes fret againe nature nie borne charles blode impotent paine endure whiche sothe vncouth auenture prince might nat socoured smale wormes deuoured greate ensample lyst considre see prince abate pride let consydre theyr fragylite se emperour abide thassaute wormes ley▪ boste asyde arnolde wysely aduertyse god hath power pompe chastise▪ death arnolde pen encombre great abhomynacion bochas came twelft nombre called pope jhon made mencion entring fraude false election goddes lawe frowarde contrary nar like pastour lyke marcenarye called aforne octauian nothing resembling peter gouernaunce fro time rome began sit pope gaue attendaunce folow lust fleshly plesaunce hauking hunting stode felicite amonge woman conuersaunt vnto surfete ryot glotony gaue wholy toke kepe greatly disclaundred lechery kept court without shame drede nombre woman cronicle rede two cardinal purpose entende vicious life correckre amend entent cardinal two churche esclan̄dred cast redresse made letter sent orcho duke saxon dresse toward rome hie noblesse holy churche haue compassion make mischefe iust reformacion pope jhon whan hath perceiued cardinal maner writing howe duke y• letter hath receiued vengeaunce made taryeng bode lenger iudgement yeuing cut nose felly one hand y• called john emperour letter sende pope hole affection defautes amende found correction deposed put doun cardynals cursidnesse list nomore write wretchidnes defautes gret ontrage john put downe ye haue herde deuise mine auctour caught great corage seing mischefe many londry wyse holy churche dyd aryse among prelate cast selfe blyue defautes openly discryne pride presumpcion gan studie matter gan rembre anone reason vpon verse written yt sautere touche nat prophetes ne nigh thē nat nere againe thē beware dede thought wyse ye maligne nought cause ye shall vnderstande touching matter plainly rede mine auctour gan withdraw hande left purpose forth gan procede whose presence toke hede came prince duke charles lorayne besought write greuous payne ❧ xv chapter ☞ charles lorayne confounded hunger duke lorayne ye shall conceiue werre y• king fraūce called hugh capet apperceyue archebyshop king plesaunce hatred made ordinaunce agayne duke wayte vpon set toke bedde whan slept said byshop gan falsly vndermyne worthy duke full false treason fynde called anceline bishop time leon fraude false collusion toke prince yt duke loraine king brought traine whome deliuered prison orliaunce chaynes bounde ende made mencion pyt horryble profounde mischefe hunger confounde suppose duke loraine consumed constraint paine xvi chapiter ¶ howe king salamon whylom king hungery put flight bochas came doun prince four eche party grefes tolde fyrst salamon whylom reigned hungry bothe fole cowarde bokes specify voyde reason noysed ygnoraunce point coude purueiaunce fortune also disdayne nouther manly coragious worthy knightes twain herta one laodislaus famous armes notable vertuous bothe one salomon came doun made flye region vnhappy frowarde cowardise founde defence flight shelde list wyse gaine enemy make resistence fayled herte come presence saue lande drede selfe sore bochas writ boke xvii chapter ¶ howe petro kyng hungery slayne kynge put remembraūce called petro reygning hungry defautes agayne kynge fraunce called charles malice foly indignacion turmentry eyen put ther better socour slaine dome emperour xviii chapter ❧ howe diogenes emperour taken eyen put bochas came twain ryng duke sweue formest rede againe themperour fyrst malicyously working henry emperour reigning tho dede malice fatal mede banyshed dwel amonge beastes sauage slaine forest great outrage whan constantine departed thys lyfe whiche grece lorde gouernour mariage wife knight diogenes made emperour fortune great fauour constantinople holding hande souerayne prince al grekes lande yet ther grutched theragain great indignacion king perce belset tarquiniaine fro force toke many region mesopotamie possession toke strong hand chiualry maugre diogenes almost surrye belset tarquiniā made selfe stronge manly force diogenes assayle diogenes thought wrong gan ordaine great stuffe apparayle day assigned met batayle diogenes froward auenture knightes brought discomfyture take brought great disdayne tho resistence kinge belset called tarqumiaine whan came presence yeue sentence lie downe plat king belset take fote throte set done hie dispite diogenes brought forthe chayne without reuerence fauour respyte great feastes assigned payne alder last put eyen twayne whele fortune tourneth ball sodayne clymbing asketh sodayne fall xix chapiter ¶ robert duke normandy foughte turkes named crowne jerusalem died mischefe aworthye prynce spoken manye reem noble robert duke normandy chose crowne jerusaleem cause deny fortune vnto enuy robert next ordre came playne fall vnto bochas christes fayth mighty champion duke robert armed plate maile manly godfray godfray de bollion againe turkes fought great batayle christes faythe auaile sustene lawe entent kinges occident turkes sarazins gret nōbre gaine christes law gadred puissaunce fayth christ falsly encombre made hasty ordinaunce kinges england normandy fraūce first socour busy paine godfray de bollion yt duke loraine sarazins made discomfyture maugre turkes great might battaile christ made recure felde day supporte right robert found good knight noblesse recorde writyng jerusalem named king assented nat election bycause new vnderstande elder brother short conclusion called willyam dead englande wolde wyse take y• crowne hande jerusalem like manly knight came englande clayme right yet came knowledging yonger brother called henry vpon take crowned kyng tolde lordes prince fynally next heyre entred rightfully enheritour succede reem brother king jherusalem god wot cause stode wyse said robert duke normandye purposed marciall emprise brother take regalye toke prince chyualrye thought wold like manly knighte arryue england reioyse righte one felde assembled day brother twayne ech wt strong party darraine make delay eche holde champarty whan lordes mischefe espy busied nat recheles atwene bretherne refourme pee said bretherne fully condiscended vpon poynt shorte conclusien accorde iustly comprehended henry holde haue possession life al region robert haue party summe golde normandy thre thousande poūde put remembraunce eche yere robert sent fro region payment make full assuraunce layde hostage made mencion yet new fyll discencion atwene bretherne hatred enuy certaine castell y• stode normandy castell longed heritage vnto kinges iurisdiction duke toke auauntage maugre king held possession turned confusion whan king thing espye stronge hand came normandy duke layde siege made ordinaunce recure right gate castell toke brother emprisoned force might left alone mennes sight fourtene yere cronicle writeth died mischefe wo whyle bochas busy labour boke tacomplyshe great diligence appered great emperour called henry shewed presence gan complaine vpon great offence done mischefe distresse sonnes great vnkyndnesse sonne called eke henry greatly accused ingratytude cause wrought disnaturally toke father force multitude entreated boysteously rude afterward gayned raunson great mischefe dyed pryson xx chapiter joceline prince rage pryde slouth lechery dyed pouerte next ordre trist ded visage▪ vnto bochas shew heuines came jocelyne lord prince rage cite famous ryches prince mine auctor bereth witnesse greatly yeue slouth slogardy lust set lechery left lordshyp gouernaunce lacke wisdome discrecion fleshly lust set plesaunce countreis enuyron nat reputacion certayne prince mine auctor doth discryue lordshyp cast depriue amonge whiche prince alapy called sanguyne story lyst se joceline hauing great enuy layde siege rage cite beyng absent ferre countre thus slouthe wylful neglygence rage take mighty violence joceline commaunded prison fortune coutrarious lost lordshyp dominacion lo fyne folkes vicious slowe delicat proude lecherous dyed pouerte mischefe nede vicious prince lo fynall mede xxi chapiter ¶ howe emperour andronicus slewe blode royal cheryshed vicious people hanged heire trewe successour election also lynage came andronicus lorde emperour constantinople crowned king age next bochas trist pale vysage beseching busy cure remembre woful auenture amonge grekes story scripture andronicus gouerned nat aright againe lawe eke agayne nature founde suster fleshly night bothe assent toke flight agayne cosyn fell lorde countre called emanuell time stode man exiled discēcions many vncouth strife prince reconsiled standing hope amende lyfe tyme fugitife made lorde stode whyle reignyng pontus asie great ile whyle emanuell deade fall great age story telleth thus hauyng child list take hede whyle dwelled tathers hous among grekes called alexius tutour assigned called alexius also assigned tutour se vpon al gouernaunce ful power lorde emperoure al empire vnder obeisaunce prince lordes gaue attendaunce present absent eche thing done cōmaundement meane thus al hand constantinople cite great substaunce extorcions whych dyd lande subiectes misgouernaūce among lordes fyll remembraunce al assent hert gan desire call andronicus agayne empyre assent restored crowned emperour constantinople entring cite busied fraudulent labour bloude borne imperiall see slayne vengeable cruelte iudgement andronicus except prince called jsacius thus effecte trouth well sene vengeable last olde age right yeres grene felly gouerned ful false outrage last al malicious corage toke coūsel grece thus named al disclaundred diffamed homicide houshoulde tirantes y• wrought agayne ryghtwysenes cherished al hardy bolde widowes wiues maiden oppresse ribaudry called gentilnes spared nouther lecherous woman shorne chast folke religious also maner conscience subiectes falselye rauine toke list vniuste violence al vyces hys youth dyd enclyne royall lyne slaine echone except jsacius tolde erst andronicus fynd haste sent purpose come presence murdre entent diuers token many euydence fully knewe fine sentence lyke prince lyst come nere smyt heade messanger manly prouidence myd cite shewed lyke knyght prayde lordes yeue audience prince iudges ryght might declare syght great iniuries domages outragions wrought themperour called andronicus citezins knowe gise emperour called andronicus emperour ye lyst aduertyse tiraunt cruel furious false murderer vengeable dispitous hath newe froward false corage slayne empyre holy lynage aliue left none blode saue alone royall lyne andronicus lyke tiraunt wode hath slaine echone breuely termyne sworde vēgeaunce myghte decline nowe purposeth mortall tirānye slee also alye requiringe consistory citezins present remembre call memory howe famous imperiall cite hath aye ben redy equite busy also noblesse wronge tirauntes manly oppresse philosopher poetes eke deuyse sawes prudent notable blode tirauntes noble sacrifice god aboue whan vengeable sith ye ryghtfull iust stable workes voyde variaūce weye thys matter iustly balaunce people echone al one assent outrage thys andronicus put downe ryghtfull iudgement whose place set vp jsacius sayd tiraunt frowarde vicious gan maligne hym selfe dresse defence make fortresse holpe make resistence stode voyde al fauoure seiged violence maugre hys myhgt rent tower spoiled cruelly founde better socour stode naked quakyng payne fyrst rent one eyen twayne ouermore rewarde wythout help socour respite rode asse face set backwarde ass tayle holdyng dispite beholde people delyte pore ryche thrugh cite hym rebuke graunted liberte al carte set vengeably lad y• toun dome hanged hye gybet people hym hys confusion made clamour terrible soun wolde neuer fro galowes wende tyll mischefe death made ende ¶ lenuoye tragedy agaynste andronicus bochas maketh exclamacion agayne al prince vicious whyle haue power dominacion tirannye vsinge extorcion concludynge thus theyr false liuing right requireth haue yuell ending indifferently tyrant lecherous wyues maiden made none excepcion folowyng lust froward disclaundrous spared woman religion made wyues breake profession violence peyse wel al thing ryght requyreth haue yuell endyng murdre contagious innocent blode make effusion vengeable also agayne al vertuous kynrede sought occasion slee fro whych came doun considered false working right requireth haue yuell endynge bochas manaceth prince outragious whyche proude hateful abusion god man wyll contrarious hauyng herte false opinion al tho bene subiection may deuour power stretchyng shal faile haue yuell endyng noble prince ye bene desirous perseuer deminacion al vertue victorious cherishe trouth put falshede doun merciable measured reason andronicus surfetes eschewyng ye grace may haue good endyng xxii chapter ¶ jsacius made blynde take mischefe rehersed whan jsacius empire possession auenge deth andronicus constantinople royal toun brother came doun basin brenning bright glede made blind hym rede except jsacius take mischefe wrought distruction liyng awayte doth preuy toke emperour put prison vengeably dyd execusion remembred basyn bright brennyng red hote lost sight sonne called alexius tendre age cast succede tutour false contrarious murdred mischefe rede tutour purposing dede empire false collusion fraude mede haue possession chapiter fynde reherced order writynge mine auctour y• processe maketh mind came haste sangot egipt kyng came pitously wepyng mightye prince soundans twayne reigning dama falles cōplayne alopye salech one reigning dama true ryght cathabadyn beyng eke soudan tho day holde good knight right notable euery mannes sight soudan babilon aferre called saladyn oppressed werre socour sent prince twayne come hast wyth chiualry supporte busy payne enforce myght sustene hys partye whose request lyst deny abode lenger made selfe stronge stande hym ryght wrong thys matter substaunce conclude prince came salech cathabadyn guerdon founde ingratitude forsayde soudan saladin founde vnkinde plainly thys fyne estate knowe disgraded thē broughte thē ful lowe none mede labour kyndnes fyll bochas rede forthwith leaueth processe vnto robert doth style dresse called farentyne reigninge taurence lost lordshyp sodayne violence say reigned whyle thys sayd robert lost gouernaunce next bochas came guylliam cecile kyng coūtre lorde great pu • saunce lost kingdom thrugh fortune variance eyen twayne rent hys heade died mischefe drede guilliam reignyng cecile discent borne • ye alye▪ robert guisterde bokes compile whylom duke normandye greatly deliting chyualry brother ful notable renoun brought naples subiection brother name rogere sonne enheritour called tancret sayth croniclere toke vpon reigne successour thus cecile tancret gouernour agayne title sought fer aliaunce gan mortall werre mayde called constaunce doughter kyng rogere whych set spirituall pleasaunce religious hole hert entere recorde croniclere constaunce hath world forsake religion hath body take constaunce selfe yere borne made mencion clerke great astronomere tolde byrth calculacion shoulde cause desolacion kingdome processe age occasion onely mariage tancret great enmy vngoodly exhortacion moued emperour y• called henry take constaunce religion pope dispensacion wedded thēperour might tytle put tancret hys ryght wyth great nombre italiens emperour entred region fauour ceciliens tancret long time stode possession fortune transmutacion tyme conclude sentence saide tancret dyed pestilence hys sonne guilliā y• yonge dede ceciliens cast faile kepe hys land ryght possede met emperour wyth stately apparayle made redy wyth haue battayle emperour great auantage cast otherwyse fraude corage fayningly duryng dyscorde emperour cast another whyle fase colour fall accorde yong guilliam vngoodly begile vndre treaty taken cecile falsly depriued hys region sent itaile throwe prison wey treaty story lyst see concluded vnder false treason guilliam take susters thre eyeu put conclusion perpetually dampned prison dyed pouerte lost enheritaunce lo fyne worldly variaunce write jhon bochas began guilliam put frō hys reem hym appered guyot lucinian afore kynge jerusalem whose knightly fame shone lyke son beem noblesse whisō dyd attayne godfrāy present duke lorayne soudan named saladine enchaced dignite al worldly pompe draweth declyne constraint aduersite yeres passed prosperite wente cipres fugitife fil rede lyfe make hys cōplaynt hym came one stand great perplexite erle brye • ne called jhon whych afterwarde kynge cyte called jerusalem also parde faire doughter yonge tender age joyned frederike mariage beyng tyme lorde emperour desirous aboue al thyng jerusalem gouernour eecyle crowned kyng whiche alderlast subtyle workynge constrained downe fro partye capitaine serue • lombardye xxiii chapter ¶ henry eldest sonne frederike seconde myscheued hys father next bochas croked halte sycke one called henrye cāe plaine eldest sonne vnto frederike whiche siknesse felt great payne megre pale contracte euery vayne whose langour chefe occasion lay longe tyme prison al hys dysease great aduersite ycaused shorte conclusion father frowarde cruelte bochas maketh mencion thys henry generacion sonne vnto frederike lyke founde meane frederike called seconde henry discent lyne cecyle fyrst crowned kinge jerusalem whose renome dyd shine many lande beginnyng fortune also workyng henry passyng notable al workes inly fauourable person auantage people right acceptable well cōmended flourynge age face loke ryght amyable porte demure stable called ginninge suche fauoure hath wonne prince al lyght sonne ofte falleth glad morning whan phebus sheweth beames brighte day somtyme therupon folowyng derke skye clipsed hys lighte semblably fortune myght said prince false variaunce fonde whele full noious greuaunce may fury fortune appese troubly waues make plaine wher mē trust fynde disease double corages stande certaine shining day ofte meint raine thus frederike great vnstablenes hath brought son mischefe dystresse frederike set vp great fauour pope diligent busines vnto state lyft vp emperour fatal frowarde vnkindnes couetyse fyl excesse toke vpon patrimony gye christes church parte occupy fyl pope indignacion counsayle treaty myght none auayle malice presumpcion cast wyth pope haue great battaile sayd henry hys father gan counsayle agayne churche violence submit wyth humble obedience strife enduringe atwene estate frederik made sonne accused hym crymelese magestatis woulde suffer excused lyke man maliciously refused father cursed false treason cōmaunded dye prison bokes say taken brought father dome haue sentence lyke man passed sorow thought whych hys lyfe none aduertence furiously wyth great vyolence lad ala horsbake hys horse fyl downe hys necke brake bokes reherse hym sayne hys father toke agayne hym occasion whan longe cheynes layne great mischefe dyed prison saye fyl doun bridge bochas reherseth • drowned depe ryuere ☞ commendacion bochas suche kynde kynred nexte ordre myne auctour dyd hys cure make speciall commendacion disposed nature kyndly inclinacion blode requireth generacion acquite thē selfe thought wyll dede without fayning vnto theyr kinred specially none vnkindnesse founde none aduersite consider naturall gentylnes appropred mercy pyte auoyde false duplicite frederik whyche vnkyndly let slee hys sonne called henry pyte appropred kynrede father mother disposicion cherysh theyr chyldren eke fede tyl seuen yere passe lawe maketh mencion bounde naturall reason tyme passed tendernes ten • lyne vnto fortune vertuous dyscipline afterwarde theyr adolescence vertuously tech chastise norish doctrine science fostre vertue vice dyspyse curteyse prudent sad eke wyse whan gyn wyth vertue age gladly great outrage longeth euery gentle lygne blode royall kyndly influence father mother shewe selfe benigne humble hertes reuerence aye remembre aduertence syxe prince wrought contrarye whyche fortune aduersarye eueriche founde vnkinde cursed blode may kindnesse one tarage sauoureth tree rynde frute also beareth tre wytnes semblably father cursednes wyth mortall sworde nature reprouable againe childe ofte sene vengeable among whych brutus rekened one next order folowed manlius slewe chyldren recorde euerychone philip manlius also cassius cruell herode fel malicious frederik also vengeably slewe sonne called henry frederik aye frowarde contrary towarde son gracious benygne holy churche vngoodly gan vary theragayne frowardly maligne lyke man obstinate vndigne dyed accursed thrugh misgouernaunce wythout confession repentaunce xxiiii chapter ☞ howe manfroye kyng poyle slayne nexte bochas poyle came kynge began hys fall complaynte specify called manfroy hys false workyng put downe slayne cause tiranuy lo auayleth septr regaly tyraunt violence list god warde haue none aduertence xxv chapiter ¶ howe ences kyng sardiny dyed prison wyth loke downe cast deadly pale chere sardinya ences nexte came doun kyng lande tell manere howe werrayed agayne myghty toun called bonon • confusion vēquished wyth chaynes roūde dyed prison long lay bounde folowīg myne auctour called bocas jhon sardinia maketh mynde serpent wolfe lande none hauyng well whych kynde theues eyen water maketh blynd true folke doth deuine water thereof helth medicine groweth also herbe bokes sey diuers nature tasteth therof laughyng shal dey medicine may helpe succour touche therof stante eke auenture enter mouth syde shal alyue laughter abyde xxvi chapter ❧ howe frederyke slayne iudgemente hys brother another frowarde frederike sonne alphonce king castyle corage wode eke fran • yke owne brother falsly begyle began werre lastynge whyle whose purpose brother dysceiue crowne castile receyue frederike came greate battaile agayne brother entent purpose yet dyd fayle god fortune assent take felde iudgement brother great trespace slayne openly better grace xxvii chapter ☞ howe manimettus argones dyed mischefe manymettus perce lorde kyng came next preace distressed gret payne vpon fortune pitiously playnyng aduersite dyd constrayne one whych disdaine called argones voide title ligne gayne manimettus proudlye gan malinge whych argones presumpcion take mischete sodayne violence dome giuen dye prison power make resistence fortune difference chaunges atwene frende fo caused dye mischefe two ❧ xxviii chapter ☞ howe charles kynge jerusalem cecile auarice auoutry died mischefe forsayde rehersed sentence bochas remembreth hys style came noble charles vnto presence kyng jerusalem also cecile whose cōming myn auctour great astoyned se knyghtly face chere come place hys porte behelde hym wele considred fyrst loke hys vysage sempt trad vpon fortune whele noble marciall corage power gotten auauntage shewyng selfe eche partye might dyd vtterly defye first commende royall hye lynage vertuous famous alyaunce writing praysing langage name specially auaunce sayth borne blode fraūce encreace soueraynlye prise writeth brother vnto saynt le wyse gaue fraunce commendacion phebus passeth eche sterre right kingdom comparison passeth euery lande nie ferre policy peace werre transcendeth peace prouydence werre knightly excellence wordes nat take myne auctour entytled remembraunce one laurence whiche translatour processe commende fraunce prayse lande plesaunce sayth influence royall lande made charles worthy hande whose noblesse pope vrban ioy encrease vertuous liuing time duke anioy chosen cecile kyng pope vrban required writyng toward rome dresse king manfroy tyranny oppresse agayne pope holy churche right said manfroy dyd great extorcion noble charles goddes owne knight came stronge hande vp rome toun whiche comming gaue possession gyot manfort haue garde passage gouerne vowarde rome great ordinaunce passed ouer boundes itayle māly knight charles borne fraunce lad many stronge batayle pope enemy manly assayle whyle stande diffence said charles founde resistence entring rome protectour full well receyued first entryng chose preferred chefe senatour pope glad comming cecile crowned king jerusalem made mencion graunted full possession whiche ginning bare well entring y• land knightly apparayle cassine gate fyrst stronge castell beneuent great batayle kīg manfroy whose partye assayle reherce shortly auenture charles made discomfyture bataile king māfroy slaine noble charles toke possession wherof romains full glad fayne yet cecile rebellion brought vnto subiection conradine recorde al wrighting sonne conrade claymed king gan make strong proudly toke place alygate famous olde cite noble charles knightly chere face fyll vpon made flye set rest countre auoyde trouble make al thing certaine gaue iugement conradyne slayne amonge kynges notable glorious charles put made mencion lyke prince stronge victorious full peasyble hole possession cecile regyon agayns disobeysaunce yelded hole herte gouernaunce tytle also alyaunce fortune greatly magnifye put remembraunce noble princesse called mary doughter stephane reigning hungry joyned knit mariage charles son thencrece lynage charles auctorite selfe list ordayne made king great cyte called jerusalē townes moste soueraine whiche title bare crownes twayne brother lewes olde bokes say time egipt gan werray gate countreys aboute enuyron whiche sarazyns dyd falsly occupye brought agayne subiection jerusalem iande magnifye cartage affrike regalye countreys beyng afore cōtrayre kyng charles became tributayre whyle sate highest glory lyke phebus shyning mydday spere many conquest many great victory whan noblesse shone bright clere tyme frownyng chere fortune gan charles tourne face berafte fauour grace lady fortune doth selde one cōtune geryshe condicion sorceresse traytour cōmune cast false meane distruction one sonnes slayne poyson dyd eclypse myne auctor doth expresse full great partye olde gladnesse disclaundred vyce appertayneth vnto tyranny meane vice frowarde auaryce contrary vnto chiualry diffamed also false auoutrye whiche susteyned mayntenaūce within lande knight fraunce knight abydyng hous cecile troubled dede great offence disclaundrous thrugh region began sprede thylke woman plainly rede wyfe one whiche suffred offēce venged dyd dyligence john prosith plainly name whiche cast fully auenged kyng charles beare blame slewe al frenchman bode y• coūtre without grace mercy pite full execucion required kyng aragon lost cecile hole region obeysaunce many countre jerusalem possession fyll processe great aduersite last constrained wyth greuous pouerte god mekely wyth ful heuy chere soone dead hys prayer supprised wt sorowe corage lost force fyl malady languished forth tyll gan fa • l age agayne fortune founde remedy occasion false auoutry fyl mischefe sorow drede charles died rede ¶ lenuoye lyke phebus freshe morninge aurora day doth clarifye falleth oft bryght shining derked cloudy skye alykenes shewed tragedye expert charles story doth well preue youth age rekened truely fayre day men praise eue noble fame fresh gynning saint lowes nygh alye ryght wyse manly vertuous liuyng called knighthod flour chiualry tyll maintenaunce auoutry came hys courte hurte hys name greue life deth put ieoparty fayre day men prayse eue lyke desertes mē haue theyr guerdoning vertuous lyfe doth prince magnify contrary great hyndring folke experte trouth may denye serche rewarde cursed lechery vsed houshold may preue matter charles haue eye fayre day prayse towarde eue noble prince al vyces eschewing hyghe corage let reason gye withdraw hand fro riotous watchyng flye fleshly lustes vicious companye oppresse man tiranny socour nedy pore folke releue let men report prudent policye last age whan draweth eue ❧ xxix chapter ¶ hugoline erle pise slaine prison charles story red woful fyne ye haue herde maner y• gyse jhon bochas appered hugolyne called whylome erle pyse tyll gan againe aryse vengeable cruell vnkynde slewe prison finde saue child haterede enuy murdred eke depe prison next cōplaynt kinge armeny came tofore bochas called athō christen prince full famous renoun fayth lyst nat erre gayne tarta • ines longtime held werre manly king knighthod full famous shewed story lyst rede brother fell dispytous called sabath desyrous succede sted brother kingdome possede false treason reued right kept holde put syght sabath lost happe grace brother made mencion stronge hande put place chased region take force fetred prison died man lyst visite lo howe god treason murdre quite xxx chapter ¶ howe pope boniface eight take lynage de columpnes eate handes dyed prison among wofull prince thre shewed thē vgly chere pope boniface great aduersite eight name gan approch nere thousande c c c accompted y• yere fro christes byrth computacion whan made lamentacion pope caught occasion vnder peter kept gouernaunce interdicte region time king philip reigning tho fraūce dyrecte bulles downe constaunce nycholas made bouiface archdeacon place holy churche prelate nygh ethone byshoppes fraunce felly haue declared preuing poyntes many mo one great sinne plainly nat spared church hurt nat repayred put crymes gret misgouernaunce denoūcing enemy al y• land fraunce put many great outrage wrongly howe done offence cardinall borne lynage de columpnes kinrede reuerence cause kept absence court drew borne occasion y• pope life hath lorn de columpnes y• lynage hath wrought toke boniface olde cruelte wt gret force power haue brought vnto castell stode cite called sa •• ri angeli gaue auctorite cardynall cōmyssion power full execucion mater hangyng balaunce wene partyes right wronge bothe romayns prelate eke fraūce pope aye kept within y• castel stronge auenture abyding nat longe fyll flixe afterwarde nede hunger ete handes rede houre dyeng made mencion aboute ye castell merueylous lightning pope lay fettred prison none suche afore sene lyuing whyle bochas busi writyng write fall bonyface order templers came tofore face xxxi chapiter ☞ howe ordre templers foūded iaques order brent croniclers trouth recorde calling minde first foūdaciō old auctours therwith accorde templers y• religion gan time whan godfray de bullion noble knightly man jerusalem order first began certaine knightes payne whan cite first ywonne noble godfray duke whilom loraine crowned kyng order begon olde bokes wel reherce konne takyng grounde pouerte mekenes founde ordre dyd busynes begynnyng gan deuocion groūde ytake wylfull pouerte made first habitacion temple ferre cite token clennes sworne chastite temple lyke theyr desyres toke name called templers pope honorie gaue auctorite holy church beyng time hede whyte habite bare yt time chastite eugenius gaue crosse rede defende pylgrimes drede gayne sarazins high renoun chefe point profession whyle liued wylful pouerte crossed knight mātel clad white spred many ferre countre perfection set delyte folke deuocion caught appetite encrease gaue great almesse whych gan wexe great richesse processe wythin fewe yeres nombre great religion fame sayde templers gan sprede wide many region sodayne rising profession tour castels gaue delices appalled vertue yt brought many vice long reken amonge fynde one manly knight folke iaques dyd call great auctorite among euerychone cronicles remembre yore agone whych iaques realme fraūce borne blode great enheritaunce iaques holde manly knyghte gynnyng freshe lusty corrage brother elder title right occupied al hole heritage iaques yonger age whych might condicion nothyng clayme possession elder brother occupied whyle thys jaques lowe degree wonder desirous hym egal alway put backe frowarde pouerte surmounte woulde founde meane lyke hys desiers chosen mayster templers promoted fre election chose hym ryght whereby great dominacion ryches treasour great power myght hys person eke manly knyghte tyme put remembraunce philip le bele crowned kyng fraunce whych iaques great indignacion al templers al chiualry cast wayes distruction gate auctorite lust fortifye downe fro pope bokes specifye clement theer concludyng may templers distroye daye certayne crime horible al one set prison frendes touchyng thys matere counsailed aske mercy pardon plaine confession requiring hym knelyng rowe trespase ben aknowe iaques take thre kept holde prison sent remnaunt iniquite ordained open iudgement mighty stake tied brent kyng maner lyke grace would confesse trespace al nought indurate accorde one corrage aske mercy obstinate fire redy al wyth one langage whan flame approched theyr vysage full plainely spake cried pitiously actes gylty purpose lyst declyne wyth one voice echone one soun fully affyrmed tyl dyd fyne order religion grounded vpon perfection theyr deth verely dede compassed malice hatred sayd jaques spake forne brought place called leon tofore two legate life lorne openlye made hys confession worthy short conclusion dead rightfull iudgement hys ende ash brent xxxii chapter ❧ bochas cōmendeth theodorus wyth two philosopher theyr pacience notably yeuing prise phylosophers thre bochas cōmēdeth wt great diligēce howe ech co • tre soueraynly vertuous excellēce olde commended pacience may set crowned hir stall emperesse among vertues al among ceciliens fyrst theodorus pacience great reuerence amonge grekes story telleth thus anaxerses magnificence force vertue grounded pacience vertuous wyse sufferaunce gate souerayne prise among romains put remembraunce sceuola philosopher knyght marciall stronge constaunce whan helde amyd flame lyght hande finger among cole bryght tyl ioyntes falling yonder wrest departed sonder fyrst theodorus borne famous yle pacience great paine enduringe chefe philosopher called cecile chaynes boūde vpon ground lying body layde gaddes reed brennyng suffring paine list refuse kynge jerome tiraunte siracuse common profit suffred payne long tyme afore liyng prison whych assent mo one twayne chefe conspiracion bring tiraunt distruccion paine might endure coniuracion would discure rather chase mischefe dey name openly declare slewe tiraunt sothly sey thought ryght man spa • e common profit helth welfare slee tiraunt demyng best al region set rest title list suffre deth turment toke paciently theodorus tyl yelded vp breth grutched noise loude cry amyd wose hert roted faythfully common profit bochas wryteth among ceciliens get hym name grekes also cōmende aboue sterres anaxerses greatly magnifye cause stint mortall werres lyst spare acquite hys partye rebukyng manly tirannye nico • reon tiraunt full mortall reignyng cipre estate royall spared nouther deth ne drede rebuke vertuous langage tiraunt bad cut heade hys tonge haste wt strong corage sayde shoulde haue none auauntage membre whych wyth al myghte tolde trough people sight manace set litell tale bytte tonge stronge corage chewed al peces smale manly herte thought domage spyt visage tiraunt gate vyctory put name euermore memory sceuola equal twayne common profit iust comparison put preace dyd busye payne slee porcenna enemy rome toun accomplysh entention toke stronge darte passingly trenchaunte al mighte cast tiraunte marke cause dyd faile slee enemye entent whych tuskan many stronge battayle gayns romains wyth knightes went sceuola owne hand brent cause failed hys arte slee proceuna casting darte declare force manhode put selfe auenged haue tolde cole rede hande brent loue cite onely aquite magnanimite feruent loue cite auayle slee tiraunt cause dyd fayle thus put marcial suffraunce noble philosopher thre perpetuall mynde remembraunce howe quit eche lyke degre pure partye vnto commonte cause al ioy inward delite auaile cōmon profit fyrst theodorus put selfe prees ceciliens dye prison grekes noble anaxerses tonge torne felte great passion sceuola romayns toun suffred hande shorte auisement verye trouth cole brent martirdom manere corage haue great constaunce stable herte body chese cōmon profite face countenaunce vnto deth without variaunce gate triumphe souerayne excellence laurer crowned pacience lyke phebus passeth litel sterre hyest vpraised hys mydday spere vertue trouble peace werre called pacience freshely doth appere among vertues shewe hys beames clere pacience knyt wyth humilite abyde maye none errour • rauntes hertes vertue doth appease modifyeth cruell fel wodenesse rage lion lyst lyue ease folke prostrat malice doth represse al ioy gan first wyth mekenes juda hardy stronge lion maidēs mekenes fro heauen brought doun battaile mighty stronge sheltrons aduice sufferaunce winneth victory pacience venquisheth champion lownesse vertue many olde hystory mekenes perpetuall memory al conclude groūded reason maiden mekenes wrought redēpcion ¶ bochas commendeth humilite vertue vertues noble pacience wyth laurer crowned vertuous constaūce laude honour prayse reuerēce yeue thee price pleasaūce renomed olde remembraunce myghty marciall armure gayne vyces lengest may endure grounde gynnyng stande defence agayne sathans infernall puissaunce laureat quene thou art presence outrage haue gouernaunce condite head spring plētuous habūdaūce cristall well celestial figure gayne al vice lengest may endure chefe founderes soueraine excellence gostly building spiritual substaunce empresse magnificence heuenly spirites next aliaunce life euerlasting thy triūphes tauaunce ioy eternal thy noblesse lo assure aureat throne perpetually endure three jerarchies liuing preīence whō humilite hath souerayne acquaintaūce osanna wt deuout diligence songe aungels long continuaūce tofore throne keping obseruaunce syng sanctus sāctus recorde scripture wyth voice memorial perpetually tendure brēning loue cherubin feruence perfit charite diligent obeysaunce seraphin wyth humble obedience order nyne heuenly concordaunce dominacion vertuous attendaunce afore trinite synge freshly measure wyth voice memoriall perpetually tendure suffraunce panims hath apparence done vainglory hangyng balaunce christes martyr existence lyst againe tyraūtes make repugnaūce rather die shew god displeasaunce shewed myrrour likenesse picture take full possession wt christ euer tendure suffraunce vertue hath y• preemynence set god affyaunce recorde stephyn vincent laurence blessed edmonde longe perseueraunce suffred fayth victorious greuaūce kyng made martyr palme recure heuenly courte perpetually endure set maner difference bochas boke tolde euery circumstaunce howe fayth full great violence dyuers sayntes haue suffred gret penaunce stable chere visage coūtenaunce neuer vary none auenture like christes chāpions perpetually tēdure whose foundacion notable prouidence grounded christ soules auaunce graue hertes theyr conscience voiding trouble worldly perturbaūce chaunges fortune wt double chaunce loued god dred aboue eche creature hope perpetually endure xxxiii chapter ¶ howe philip le bele king fraunce slaine wilde bore thre sonnes wedding whan bochas written paciēce commended vertue suffraunce philip le bele came presence fift name crowned king fraunce gan complaine vnhappy chaunce fortune custome vary cruell aduersary wounded greuous sore gan complaynt bochas determyne slaine wilde bore forest called compyne tolde howe sclaundred al hys line one flaūders wt many worthy knight vēquished flēminges felly put flight proceding ferther gan touche lynage howe time sonnes three lewes philip charles yonge age fourth robert also doughter called isabell right excellent beaute sayde robert storie well kouthe whiche died tender youthe story li • haue good regarde circumstaunce wysely discerne doughter isabell wedded edward carneruan boke doth v lerne yonge philip wedded nauerne kinges doughter stately mariage called jane whyle tendre age philip crowned king nauerne father assent fyue sonnes liuing fiue sentyment thre nombre right pertyn ent matter list loke processe boke eldest sonne called lewise whome father gaue possession nauerne bycause wyse gouerne noble region philip brother high renoun afterwarde iust enheritaunce rightful title crowned king fraunce thyrde brother title right made erle march named charles eche people syght famous holde passing great prise right manly right wyse philip charles toke tendre age erles doughters burgoin mariage storye reherseth certayne noblesse fortune enuy maner malice disdayne brought processe vpon party two wyues frowarde auoutry causing death wyues thre whan floured felicite three prince glorious tofore bochas shew theyr entent mighty duke notable famous came complaine charles tarent time florence went make peace royall estate twene guer • te gemellius standing debate said charles borne blod fraūce manly knight story doth deuise whose vnhappy fatall froward chaunce werres twene florence pyse horsbacke sittinge knightly wyse hurt wt arowful lowe grounde wherby caught last fatal wounde man armes beyng soudyour pisanes wronge right false disdaine busy labour treade charles people syght whan laye gruffe wherfore made knight theyr captain maner pryde gouerned sybelines syde study wyth full heuy chere john bochas bode styll sete appered gan approche nere daunt florence laureate poete dities rethoriques swete demure loke fulfilled pacience vysage notable reuerence whan bochas saw vpō fete stod mete toke pase full right great reuerence auailed cappe hod said humble chere sight clerest sonne sothfast lyght cite called florence laude honour reuerence thou hast enlumined itaile lombardy laureate ditees thy flouring dayes grounde ginning prudent policy monge florentine suffred great affrayes golde pure proued al assayes trouth madest mekely thy selfe stronge commō profite suffre paine wronge noble poete touching matter florentine vnkynde wyll remember write good chere thy pytous exile put mynde fray quod daunt stante one behinde duke athens turne thy style vncouth story breuely compyle thou lyst plesaunce discryue knightly excellence wyll thou put life remembraunce oppressed mighty violence famous cite called florence story plainly thou shalt se whiche frendes foe cite able excused trouth clerely apperceyued worthy refused whome cite ful falsly disceiued cyrcumstaunce notably conceiued reken order euery syde shoulde chaced whiche shoulde abyde xxxiiii chapter ¶ duke gaulter florence tirannye lechery couetyse ended myschefe whan bochas knewe thentencion saide daunt caste anone ryght obey mayster reason toke penne cast sight alite aside sawe maner wight saue duke gaulter longe day daunt vnwarely vanished away said gaulter bruely perocede lyke put remembraunce touching line royall kynrede discended blode fraunce longe processe knightly purueyaunce father fyrst diligent labour athene lorde gouernour stode clere possession grekes full great enuy cast assent put doun de priue famous duchy entent layser espy toke mischefe quaking drede hie dispyte haste smyt heade vpon whose death auenged said gaulter mighty apparayle cast wolde asiege cite purpose longe faile wt many stronge batayle two mighty price cōe pise laide siege luke full knightly wyse florentine luke fauourable delyuer siege toun multytude almost innumerable made ordinaunce knightly came doun tourned distruction fell mortall auenture florentine fyl discomfiture noyse fame great batayle gan sprede ferre reporte langage lombardy itayle monge soudiours lusty corage among fayning pylgrimage said gaulter vnware violence came fro naples downe florence florentine helde fyrst parliament saluacion garde cyte great prudence great auisement suche highest degre one assent gaue soueraynte gouerne hopyng theyr increace statute made werre peace greatest state ruler toun called magnate tho day sothnes gaulter gaue dominacion entent common oppres marchauntes spoile theyr ryches streyne men craft froward violence theyr lybertees vsed florence people alway awayte lying restored vnto theyr lyberte gan grutche sore among themselfe plaining great extorcion done cyte greatest also auctorite leuer suffre gaulter reigne action modify restraine said gaulter full subtil wyse false maner symulacion enemye herte vnto fraunchyse wrought short conclusion done onely theyr distruction pretence fayned frendlyhede promise contrary aye dede clambe vp proces full hie estate fayned speche subtil flattery herte wext pompous elate working outwarde man coude espy lyte littel drough party conclude shortly sey florence lustes dyd obey gan subtelly please commonte accomplysh falsly desyers made promise encreace liberte suche frowarde maners made othe distroy officer wolde fre volunte graunt vnto larger lyberte gretter power dominacion encreace might euery syde gan manace grettest toun day daye encreace pride felly gan felly dyd abyde therupon kept close entrayle florentine greatly gan meruayle one reymere great auctorite great reuerence mighty sergeant great officere whose bidding obeyed florence gaulter accorded sentence soudiours stuffed eche hostry sustene gaulter party traytourly fortifye entent gaulter fell ambycious haue state onely tyrannye chefe lorde froward surquedous reigne florence case peryllous whan two tyrauntes bothe one assent multytude accomplishe entent thinge considred theyr gouernours magnate called cyte whan found among socours remedy great aduersite fyll accord necessite gaue assent without variaunce gaulter haue al y• gouernaūce condiscended issue gaulter best wyse vpon body sworne christ jhesu restore vnto fraunchyse vsed olde couetyse promise lyfe ne deth decline conuencion lyst termine herupon blowe trompet assemble state toun parlyament holden gaulter first set holy pronounce conuencion euery percell entytled reason like accorde declaring anonright stode vp vocate people sight men armes stele armed bright vnto palayes chefe principall said gaulter conueyed anonright set seate moste stately royal people voice memorial gan crye loude concluding sentence gaulter euer chefe lorde florence perseuer lyfe toke palayes full possession durst none agayne make strife graunted domina ••• castels aboute enuyron tuscan areth castell florentine lordshippes mount appenyne ye haue herde gaulter thus began owne furious diuinayle sayd borne lorde tuskan great party also itayle tolde lad conuayed quaile said euermore right wronge sentence birdes songe birde brought first florence way afore toke flight sote synging dyd reuerence hye ayre corage glad light wolde neuer parte sight gaue token set herte afyre florence shulde lorde syre birde bare diuyses full rychely enbrauded pyrre toke vpon many great emprises chefe lorde florence cite sate iugement gouerned countre drewe flaterers folke y• coude lye baudes ribaudes might thē spy cyte toke meruaylous truages croched richesse toun lechery vsed great outrage maydens wyues made none excepcion voyde mercy grace remissyon founde quarell vengeable reherce abhomynable hated mercylesse slee brake fraunchyses olde lybertees people plained desyred sore dethe cried vengeaunce citees tyranny done countrees cause great discencion citee almost subuercion thus among thē selfe deuided theyr greuous sodaine oppression lacke foresight y• nat prouided se mischeues fal toun sothe diuysion wytnes recorde scripture may kingdom cite longe endure gan complaine one bothe greate comonte accord amonge selfe fal refourme hurte cyte fynally condiscended maner fell coniuracion procede distruction vpon day armed stele bright magnate first common town assent rose vp anone right gan make hidous sowne let slee tyraunt let v pull downe layde siege mighty violence aforne palays lay florence suche enclyned gaulter amyd palais story doth v lerne eschue siege full heuy chere ordained selfe flye away full yerne towne smal posterne whan florentine dyd labour vndermyne round tour thing whan gaulter toke hede message sent vnto toun nat trouth fayningly drede made promyse false collusion make full restitucion fredoms lyst deuyse sent guyllamine dassyse cite proued vtter foe aforne done great domage guyllamyne sent also sonne yre stint al rage worse father wyll corage bothe one hanged anon right tofore palays gaulters sight another also called henry afore yeere instruction vnto gaulter eke enemy stire agayne noble toun gynner grounde diuysion tofore gaulter iudgemēt shew sharp swordes hewe execucion done vpon thr • tuskan borne rancour apease florentine staunche cruelte againe gaulter life great ease glad escape disease fled away full secrete wyse towne restored fraūchyse thus lost insolence power dominacion bothe tuskan also florence mine auctour maketh mencion fro lombardy discended doun drew king iohn reigning tho fraūce byrth full nigh alyaunce fynde partye king ihon gaulter like knight whan king chiualry take selfe lordes put flighte englande lad anone righte said gaulter hauing regarde worshyp fled like cowarde met flyght diuerse soudyours lombardy abiding king iohn time brygantes pyllours toke gaulter led forthe anone force corage herte agone auenture certaine florentine smit head fatall fyne xxxv chapter ¶ philipot cathenoise borne lowe birth came vnto great estate sonne doughter brent bespraynt teares wofull noyse tofore bochas quaking sorow drede next order came philipot cathenoyse poore degree borne lowe kynrede rose great estate dede gan sorow complaint ful mortal seriously tell woful fall touching byrth derke linage poore bed borne outher syde bochas lothe spende great langage history longe theron abyde purposed nothing hide substaunce tell great superfluite remenaunt leat whiche reherced youth whan toward robert cecyle kyng ierusalem storye nat couth yet boke list compyle reherce full soueraine stile lyke courte tolde one bulgare called slauaine olde sayd bulgare marynere also calabrien called constantine full many yere trauailed sondry thinges sene diuers countreis bene monge thinges sene dayes olde storie bulgare tolde duke calabre robert name father charles mighty kyng cōmaūdement y• storye saith gayne frederike make stronge ryding force proudly vsurping toke vpon lorde yle called kingdome cicyle depranne sothe called towne duke robert pauyllions pight rode armed hie renowne gaine frederike lande fight withstande plainly might fyll morowe prime duke wife childing bode tyme violaunt men lady call time famous great duchesse destitute woman al whan childe borne distresse yeue souke story doth expresse saue mischefe philipot fet nere cathenoyse duke chefe laundere fysher husbande childe lyuing theyr trauaile fro sea vnto courte lande day day caried vitaile case cause might auayle philipot brought greate straytnesse norice vnto duchesse cherished desyres eche thing redy whan euer sent duchesse amonge chambrers naples fynde went tyll atropose frowarde entent made childe say lyues threde breke tway king charles whō spake toforne mine au • tour remembreth boke one raymond champayne borne whiche wt king called mayster coke day iourney toke towarde sea pyrate finde solde child borneī inde lyke ethiopiens colour whō coke raymonde hath deuysed notable diligent labour made christen baptised gaue name also practysed promote vpon toke doctrine mayster coke sone toke order knight ethiopien wext good officere gate suche grace kinges sight nere processe made wardyopere though blacke visage cathenoyse ioyned maryage wexte malyperte presumpcion made knight y• king gan requere fredom great affection condiscended graunt prayere declare plainly manere time violaunt duchesse afore remembred dyed sicknesse whose death bokes dothe certifye howe duke robert naples cite wedded lady called sausye philipot fyll degre diligence great humilite please dyd deuer counsayle none nere euer redy commaundement wrought atyres plesaunt delite holsom water redolent make skyn washing sote white made confection serue appetyte husbande story lyst se philipot chyldren three connyng porte prudent chosen fauour maystresse fayre iane yonge innocent doughter great duchesse calabre furthermore expresse husbande ethyopyen withall charles houshold made seneschall lorde quod bochas spake hie disdain meneth fortune make chere fauour rayse vp forayne vpon whele bright fethers clere custome aye manere fayrest appere chere countenaūce whan wyll bryng mā vnto mischaūce boy last day ethiopien borne horrible sight afore time kechyn lay amonge pottes baudy cote anight nowe newe hath take ordre knight king charles seneschall sodayne climbing asketh sodain fal philipot wyfe fro pouerte enhaunced rissen great richesse two sonnes stately maryed fauour worthynesse order knight highnesse father died whose feast funerall solempnysed holde full royall thus fortune chaunge mone bright face derked skye eldest sonne dyed sone seconde left vp clergie made knightlgan selfe apply stode father plainly rede office fauour succede thus processe fro philipot anonright deathe husbande sonnes twaine fortune party eclypsed hath light welfare gan disdayne yet euen like whan doth rayne phebus sheweth clerenesse fro trouble rose noble meane thus rehersyng vertue person men coude espye onely tytle issue whan charles doughter partye king wedded hungrye called andree man great corage sayed wyfe right tendre age iane nat without vice rehersed somwhat myne auctour whome phylipot whylom norice ye haue herde full great labour said iane robert made gouernour sonne phylipot great rewarde made cecyle lande stewarde fauour done philipot cathenoyse caused lande great indignacion whose doughters weddīg caused gret noyse maryed charles gret erle marchon whiche gaue folke greate occasion deme amysse aboute eche countre y• lande gouerned tho thre quene iane phylipot cathenoyes said robert stewarde cecyle son philipot common vois quene robert subtil wyle assent vsed longe hateful synne aduoutry rose cecyle went vp hungry quene iane began maner thing cathenoyse assented therto execucion fully working brought conclucion robert al time rose great stryfe also disclaunderous froward discorde atwene quene lorde harde procede vpon suspection sclaunder swift lightly taketh flight men shoulde eschue occasion fame noyse euery maner wight prouidence remembred sight whan report lande ronne harde stint whan begonne withstand principle occasion decline lest vnwarely ther folow great domage late commeth salue medicine festred sore whan vncurable▪ case resemblable eschew sclaūder list nat spare maye nat fayle fal snare thus time slaunder kept close albeit abyde another mischiefe ful pitously arose afterward spred abrode ful wyde aduoutry murder gyde set priefe mine auctour doth recorde king andre strangled corde chambre raysed great heyght coniected false conspiracion entreated brought downe sleyght strangled made mencion whose death punish commission hugh erle anelyne patent large iudge toke vpon charge murder rose vp great noyse euidence full abhominable philipot called cathenoyse sonne doughter culpable dome yeue iudges ful notable conclude shortly iudgement chaines boūd stake wer brent ¶ lenuoy▪ thys tragedy afore rehersed telleth domage presumption experience rehersyng manere whan beggers rise dominacion none dredeful execucion cruelte yf wel sought one came vp nought recorde philipot hūble chere sodayne fauour supportacion fore simple smal landere value reputacion fortune gery trāsmutacion shed malyce testate whan brought list consider came vp nought disdayne daungere frowarde communicacion vengeable venim doth appere sleyghty false supplantacion conspired vnware collusion vndermining done couertly wrought folke come vp nought fortune chaunges meuinges circulere stormy transmutacion one set vp ful hie sphere enhaunceth vice vertues put record philipot whose venemous treasō compassed aforne secret thought dede sheweth yt came vp nought noble prince bright eyen clere aduertise discretion flaterer come court nere fraude false disception alway remembring afore reason tragedy treason wrought false flatter came vp nought xxxvi chapter howe kyng sauses slayne cosin brother vnto king aragon time came trauayle bochas dempt holding best noble poete florente itayle make penne rest closed boke shut chest might sparre key came thre prince mekely gan prey amonges remembred boke theyr greuaunces briefly declare wherwith bochas gan cast vp loke cōpassion behelde theyr pitous fare thought would slouthe spare theyr requestes goodly condiscende boke make ende gan first reherse writyng complaynt ful pitously made touching fall great king called sauses soiour place named astrociade writ lytle beside alytle ile called emaside bothe iles together knit one wher sauses dominacion liuing peace enemy none longe quyet possession whose kyngdom hole made mencion vulgar myne auctour write malliogres plainly bare name also another smaller yle called maylorge twayn said king lord great kepyng estate notable souerayne hauyng cosyn gan disdayne brother made mencion vnto king tyme aragon yles remembred wryghtinges whan people went batayle vsage founde vp first stinges cast stone enemy assayle shot none apparayle tyme arblast nouther bowe perauenture tho lytell knowe countreis called one lande saw helde possession till cosyn strong mighty hande great power sodaynly came doun brought people arragon fyll kyng saw feble diffence gate kingdome knightly violence balaunce nat euyn peys atwene cosyns lyst take hede hys conquest arragoneys cruelte hath smytten hede kyng saw quakinge drede though stode nygh alye day shewed curtesy xxxvii chapter ☞howe lewes king jerusalem cecile put downe thys story tolde wordes fewe kyng saw slayne tyranny came prince gan face shewe called lewes lorde trynacry yle party called cythane story telleth thus name king siculus trinacry countre merueylous toke first name famous hylles thre chefe called pe • orus next pathmus third lyllybe ferre ethua sayd hilles beside sea full perilous ylle two danger caribdis scille sayd lewes kyng jerusalem cecile boke maketh mencion chased put realme another lewes put ended pouerte short conclusion last lewes pite dyd hym grace tyl died haue dwellyng place xxxviii chapter king john fraunce poyters taken prisoner prince edwarde brought englande next last euerychone cursyng fortune variaunce makyng hys complaynt bochas came king john tolde tale take fraunce prīce edward great puissaūce strong mighty hand fro poyters brought england afore distroyed castels townes ouerthrowen manly battayle prince slayne theyr baners penouns brode stander might auayle trace sought spoiled plate maile maugre might kīg john prisoner england abode full many yere set afterwarde full great raunson worthy slayne frenche party time brute albyon floured suche noblesse chyualry high prudence prudent policy mar mercury aboue eche nacion gouerned tyme brutus albion mar knighthode theyr patron batraile mynerua gaue influence meynt brightnesse plate mayle stour clergye hie prudence prince edward marciall violence day liue one best knight brought home kinge john maugre hys might though bochas gaue fauour lāgage heart enclined partye vnto small auauntage worde winde brought enuye hinder famous chiualrye english mē ful narow gan thinke left speare shelde fought pen ynke though sayd bochas floured poetry parcial writyng gaue mortal woūde caught quarell melancoly shame afterward rebounde conclusion lyke founde agayne king john quarel gan take cause would english men take helde small reputacion report men may hys writyng see fantasy hys opinon stode case none authorite kīg take knightes flee wher bochas helpe thē nede saue pen made man blede right wisnesse euery croniculer writyng make exception indifferently conuey matter perciall none affection gyf thanke mortal guerdon hys style order egally obserued euery party haue deserued laude king john abode quit hym like manly knight lordes slayne away rode meyny toke flight iourney take king edwardes right feelde wonne haue memory trouthes hold hath gladly victory king john write brought land prisoner vpon realme complayned sore rehearsayle olde croniclers died england within fewe yeres led home agayne theyr writynges lieth denys kinges ❧ lenuoye bochas boke last tragedye compendiouslye put remembraunce prince edwarde wt chiualrye fought poiters wt king john fraūce mighty marciall puysaūce groūded quarell vpon father right toke prisoner ful like manly knight collusion kyng john dyd occupye set order royall aliaunce scepter crowne regalye descēded edward ī substaūce cōueyed ye braūches lineall concordaunce title grounded vpon right prince edward fought like manly knight clayme quarel fortify token y• god quarel would auaunce discomfiture made party vpon kyng john violent vtraunce heauenly signe influent purueyaunce sent aboue shew edwardes right ye prīce fought like māly knight noble prince heartes applye justly way matter balaunce thing paysed ye • denye ye consider euery circumstaunce right judge may variaunce fielde • rreyued deme hath right whiche ye prīce fought like māly knight thing assent put ieopardy committed god ordinaunce may contrauersy atwene party quarel distaunce shal reioyse case stode fraunce sith poyters declaring hath right prīce edward fought like manly knight ¶ bochas maketh rehearsayl fortune hath made highe estate vnwarely discende let folke wisdom cōsider wit gather vp sum count theyr reason estate fortune hath quit pope prelate gyn first rome town cardinal souerayne renown sat hiest coude defende agayn fortune proivsion turne made diseend order call remembraunce state imperial famous emperours appollo theyr puyssaunce theyr fame vp blow jupiter tour forget olde conquerours aboue mercury cast ascende tyl fortune frowarde shours sodaynly made discende kinges prince diuers region asye europe affrike cartage ethiope marciall champion monster inde hydous visage athlas hercules ī furious rage whose might man coude hīdefēde folowed hyest stage fortune vnwarely made discende priestes prelate well fed fat person patriarkes great soueraynte reken vp religiōs wt al brode crownes byshops abbottes confyrmed see beholde fortune mutabylite seculere chanons wt many great prebende whan sate hyghest felycite howe sodaynly made discende yt written written doctryne one courbeth lowe another gothe vpright vicious vertue shyne phebus clipsed sōtyme shyneth bright somtyme cloudy somtyme sterlight folke appayre dothe amende shew fortune power might one goth vpward another doth discende man holy encreaseth vertue another rechelesse frowarde wilfulnesse one perfit stable christ jesu another braydeth vpon frowardnesse one encreaseth treasour richesse list thriue labour must attende maugre world fortune doublenesse doth one arise another doth discende one busy setteth ail labour early aryse good multiply another spendeth great wastou • tre barayn tre doth fructifye one say sothe another well lye one gather another dispende vnto fortune matter dothe applye maketh one arise another discēde matter combined one boke maketh mencion voyde wede vertue take corne reason teacheth discrecion make short conclusion brefe summe b 〈…〉 comprehende fortune whele reuol •• ion doth one clymbe vp another discend ☞the wordes translatour w 〈…〉 letter leues lytell boke trēbling pray prince haue pyte v ••• e picture enlumynyng w ••• h hast cicero curious dyte 〈◊〉 gardayne floures beaute 〈…〉 graunt grace thy rudenesse nat offende 〈…〉 hygh noblesse magnanymyte cōprehēde sende might grace prosperite euer vertue encreace ascende kisse y• steppe thē furtherīg laureat poetes whiche soueraynte eloquence supporte thy makyng pray tho shall processe se thyne excuse lyst amysse amende set thy grounde vpon humylite vnto grace thou mayst ascende shorte clause thy content rehersyng one vp clymbeth great prosperite another experte knowlegyng great rychesse brought pouerte ala boke shall say thy tragedyes thrugh y• worlde sende go forthe pray excuse thy selfe loueth vertue highest shal ascende blacke thy wede cōplaynt mournīg called fall prince felycite lyke chaunteplure singing nowe weping wo myrth next ioy aduersyte entremedled suerte lyke boke doth prayse cōprehende nowe whele set lowe degre encreace vertue must ascende ende bochas
